Stopped by this morning and had a great breakfast, the portions are large, and the staff way helpful and friendly. The country fried steak skillet is excellent! The parking lot is large but shared and can get crowded. Everything was very clean and turn around was quick.

The number 1 reason we come here is for Amanda. She's such a doll & always goes above and beyond!! All the girls here are great but Amanda has our heart! Foods always great and coffee is always fresh! Egg and I is a most come!!!!

Great service and yummy food!  Glad to get off the strip and enjoy a wonderful breakfast!  Had a waffle which was delicious.  The mimosas are huge and worth the money.  Will be back next time I'm in Vegas!
Fantastic breakfast, great service (thank you, Lisa). I had the strawberry cream French toast.

I was searching for a solid brunch spot while in Vegas and came across Egg and I.  It was about a 30 min wait for a table on a Sunday around 11am.  I ordered the Country Benny and banana nut bread French toast to share.  Both were delish!  If you're a fan of biscuits and sausage gravy then the Country Benny is the way to go.  The French toast was great with the apple syrup they give on the side.  Service was fast and friendly.

The breakfast potatoes were so good, I bought the seasoning they sell at the font counter register.

The food here is generally good, and if you do a Yelp Check In, you can get a FREE muffin (I had banana nut).

This place served the best corned beef hash I've ever had! Shredded corned beef, mixed with potatoes and maybe some onions and peppers. I'm not exactly sure but yum it was delicious. Definitely coming back for this dish next time I'm in Vegas. 
Their blueberry pancakes were packed with plump blueberries. Saved the banana nut muffin for the drive home immediately after breakfast.. Very tasty, once you start you cant stop. The place was packed on the Sunday we visited but the wait was not bad at all. Glad we came here instead of a buffet on the Blvd.

Came back here because I had a dream that I was in heaven munchin' on their banana nut muffin....ZZZzzZZzZZZ.. 

Came by for breakfast to try one of my favorite breakfast dishes, chicken fried steak. I had "Brad's corned beef hash" the first time, kinda salty..

And Of course, it wasn't hard to choose, "toast or banana nut muffin".. Is this a trick question? haha, banana nut muffin, please! Muffin was Awesome just not as warm and moist as the first time. There were many more customers dining this day and maybe they were a little busy and in a rush making them? 

Chicken Fried Steak: Nice portion with a good amount of gravy, I went with egg whites only and their seasoned potatoes. The steak had the right crunchy skin, meat was perfect and their sausage gravy was mild and heart warming. In my opinion, much better dish than their corned beef hash.

Upped the rating to 4 Stars because they deserve it.
As always great service.  Our server Amanda is great and always has a smile on her face. Love coming back
Carole Ann did a great job!! Love me the eggs Benedict.. She served me with a smile and attention. What a perfect way to start my Monday!

First the banana muffin I was questioning why this is a automatic side with each dish lol but it's amazing and warm when it comes out  highly recommend!! It's like a small cake!!! 
Anyways, I had the chili (the hot one not the cincy sweet one) on egg white skillet without cheese, so yummy and amazing. My husband had the island favorite which he really liked. He describes the spam as something he would eat everyday if he could, I'm not a spam eater so I trust him if you like spam get it :)
Coffee is good here also, and they're not cheap on their sauces, or creamers. Plenty to go around here.
Good price. Good portion, good location. There can be a wait though it's worth it.
Had the chile relleno omelette and it was amazing. Also had the banana pancakes which were good but probably would have been better if I didn't choose the healthier buckwheat option.

Our server forgot to bring utensils til we got our food. I know it could happen and isn't a big deal, but she disappeared for a while. So we have to find other server to get utensils.

She appeared again, and she gave us check at the moment we just had some bites. I looked around to see people with other servers whether they had a check, just in case "it's the restaurant's style." But only people who seemed already finished got the check. I felt she wanted us to leave asap. After giving us the check, she had never came our table again.

It sucked. Better train the girl again.

Super friendly service.
Huge portions.
Decent prices.
Delicious banana nut muffin (comes with most breakfasts).
My husband got a skillet- he really liked it, though barely made a dent because it was so big.
I got a crepe omelet. It was ok... Too much avocado (don't say that too often!). The salsa on the side was yummy.
Potatoes were good... Just lots of them!
Overall good experience.

Our service from Alyssa was awesome! Our food was delicious.  The California club was amazing and cajun fries hit the spot. Alyssa also started us off with the banana nut muffins that really hit the spot. Great service and excellent food. Highly recommend!

Went here for lunch today and OMG was it good!  Ordered the traditional Benny and it completely filled me up.  Eggs and hollandaise were nicely done and those potatoes are delicious, if maybe a bit too seasoned for my taste.  Fast, friendly service during a busy lunch hour.  Staff is clearly loving their jobs which is nice.  I'll be back for sure.

What a breakfast experience! My first time in this restaurant and I could immediately feel that it must get VERY busy in the weekends! It was Tuesday morning and the place was crowded up to the last available seat. We ordered the Sunrise Mountain and the Eggs Benedict and they did not disappoint at all! 

Oh, did I mention they offer free banana nut muffins if you check in through Yelp? Do not underestimate the muffin: they are the most delicious, truly homemade muffins I have ever had in my life. I am not having muffins anywhere else anymore but the ones from this place. Darn, I need to go back to Vegas JUST to have breakfast again in "The Egg & I"... :)

In a city full of great breakfast places, the Egg & I is definitely one of them. Seriously, though, it's very good. And relatively cheap. Very unpretentious. And the banana nut muffins are amazing. Our server, Amanda, was the best! Very friendly and attentive and never once rushed us even though we took our sweet time. 

If you can make it off the strip, this place is definitely worth it.

Very good spot for breakfast food in Las Vegas!

I ordered the Brad's Scramble:
Brad's scramble is diced tomatoes, fresh spinach, sliced mushrooms, and cheddar and jack cheese.

I skip the cheese... I know, I'm weird, but I like the eggs mixed with veggies.  It's not overwhelming.  Also, the banana nut muffin is delicious!  Choose this over toast, 100% of the time.

Most plates come with their diablo potatoes, which I really like as well, they taste like seasoned french fries.  Yum!
The food was good. A bit pricey but you in Vegas . The computer system was down for a bit .

This morning I brought my mother and daughter in for breakfast. We had Oscar as our server. Oscar had a great attitude from the second he came over to our table. He was very attentive and friendly the whole time we were there. Food was awesome as always, just wanted to make sure Oscar was recognized for his great service.
$ Service was excellent. Veggie Benny was large with fresh vegetables and excellent Hollandaise sauce.
I was reading the yelp reviews and maybe just hyped up myself that this was going to be mouthgasmic. The food was good and from what I can tell so far is that it's better than IHOP or Denny's.

Our waitress Troyce was very attentive, and friendly. Thank you for your positive attitude during this busy Easter Sunday morning.  1st time at this restaurant, good was good. They were very busy but we were seated relatively quick. Will be back try more of the menu.
Went here thinking there was gonna be avocado toast. LIES!!! there was just toast. and avacado. what the crap.

This is the place you want to go if you really want an awesome breakfast! And I mean AWESOME! I came here with some friends on a busy Friday morning, the place was packed. Luckily, there was outside seating in their patio where we can be seated. The menu itself was very extensive from the benny's, omelets, crepes, pancakes, waffles, etc. I honestly felt getting my monies' worth from the Works Omelette that it filled me up. If you haven't been here while you're in Vegas, you're definitely missing out! It's a place known for it's breakfast and just open during breakfast and lunch hours.
Literally the best breakfast ever!! Raul brought us a to die for muffins for being first time customers.. He also had excellent customer service.. AGAIN BEST BREAKFAST EVER.

Amazing! Great food at great prices. I definitely recommend coming here if you're hungry and tired of the ridiculous food prices found on the strip. I discovered this gem on my last Vegas trip and I definitely made sure to come again & write a yelp review. Kelcey was our waitress and she was awesome! Definitely recommend if you're wanting a lot of food for $10-$14 bucks
Just finished breakfast Amanda are service was fantastic!   We sat outside enjoyed the nice weather and savored out banana nut muffin!!

The BEST breakfast I had in vegas so far and I will come here every AM I'm in town.. I had the skillet works! It was amazing and you get PLENTY of great quality ingredients inside! First time there? You get a tasty banana muffin.. Tabitha was awesome and explained the items on the menu I had questions about. I'm so happy to have found this place! I wish there was one in Los Angeles but only in Las Vegas areas for now...They close at 3pm so get there early and get your grab on! I came here on a Tuesday morning and it wasn't as busy as people say here.. Fantastic!
Really disappointing. Had great reviews on Yelp so I drove here. I had a skillet which was cold and the potatoes were horrible. It gets one extra star because the serving staff were were very good

I normally like this place, but I was just a little disappointed with my last visit. I came here with Don, but I really wasn't very hungry, so I just ordered a cream cheese danish. Don ordered some sort of potato soup and a tuna salad sandwich. His meal was pretty good, especially the very hearty soup. However, my danish was very floppy and seemed kind of soggy. I could completely fold it taco style because it had no "crisp" to it at all (http:\/\/s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com\/bphoto\/dk70gFzNfCOjgd3aN7N0_w\/l.jpg). I'd normally give this place 4 stars, but I have to dock off a star because of the danish. I would think a danish would be pretty simple. Everywhere I go, they're all the same, but Egg & I managed to make a pretty bad one.

I'm always shocked at how busy this place is.  Omelettes after all are pretty easy to make.    Having said that the service here is good and the food is solid.

What is unique to this place in Las Vegas, is the Cincinnati style chili. A chili with no beans and I believe has cinnamon.  The chili is normally had over spaghetti with mounds of cheese and for those of you that have no one to maks out with,  get it with onions and beans.  Yummy!  During this trip I decided to go low carb and get the chili over an omelette and of course bacon.

Most of the dishes here come with theIr seasoned country fries.  They are delicious.   Since I'm a fry connoisseur,  I can really appreciate these delicious cubed and fried pieces of carbs.

My country Benny was cooked to perfection.  As always amazing staff we had Karen as our waitress and she was on top of her game and was always one step ahead. Loved this location and for a Sunday morning we only waited 20 mins.

I come to Vegas every once in awhile but next time I'm here I will be surely coming back to this place. Server was sweet as pie, forgot my eggs but thankfully he did because my word the French toast plate was HUGE!!! I wouldn't of been able to eat them he insisted on giving me a free muffin he really didn't have to but the next morning hung over in my room a muffin was just what I needed. If you're in the area want Amazing food and service for a low price go here. Also the patio is dog friendly
Excellent service by far! BRADY was very attentive and helpful wish more people in the food and beverage industry was like him. Hope he wins the trip to Disneyland

Excellent breakfast! I had the spinach Benny which was really good.  We also ordered the French toast sandwich.  Oscar was an attentive sever.  It had a really extensive menu of egg dishes. Usually you find a menu loaded with pancake plates, but this was at least 3 pages of eggs!

I decided to stop here since we landed at 7:30 AM and wanted breakfast.  All the reviews raved about this place.  The food was good, but the waitress was not very attentive.  The muffins were alright.  The portions were good.  I felt that the potatoes stole all the seasoning and everything else was a bit bland.  Maybe next time I will try something else.

Wow. Best breakfast in Vegas, hands down. Everything is a winner here, but I am a particular fan of the skillets and the Sunrise Mountain breakfast sandwich. Cincinnati transplants - if you're looking for delicious Cincy Chili, Egg & I is for you. Going to the Egg & I is the highlight of any weekend.

I would like to give a shout out to the amazing server Amanda. Last time I was at Egg & I, I ordered the delicious Cincinnati Chili skillet. My fiancÃ© mentioned that I grew up in Cincinnati, and Amanda made sure I got extra chili. Yum!

If your looking for nice healthy breakfast come here! Service is great! I eat on the healthy side , they have good options for that! I order egg white omelette with feta cheese, very yummy and fresh! Fresh fruit instead of potatoes. 
Got out free muffin with check in! Amazing! I ask our server Oscar if they had iced coffee, they didn't but he offered me coffee with lots of ice, it was perfect! Thanks Oscar! 

Best place for breakfast in Vegas!! Wait is a bit long so we sat outside, near water mist. Not bad!
I just had the steak and eggs,  it was cooked perfectly. My server Earl was awesome,  very polite and friendly.

I've only been here for breakfast\/brunch and lunch, but it was an "egg"cellent experience every time.  Big portions, really friendly service, casual homey atmosphere.  They did a great job accommodating our large group (we called ahead to warn them we were on the way). It's a nice spot  to get away from The Strip and have some comfort food.  http:\/\/www.eggandi.com\/

When I'm in town I have to eat here!! The food is amazing. I love their banana muffins that you receive when you order. It's so worth the wait when there's a long line. Great price for the proportions. Make sure you get Oscar as your waiter , he is awesome!
The ice coffee was good too. Loved the muffin. Server was very sweet. Hope you get to go to Disney Breeannda. I hope I spelled your name right :)

Oh, that was some great corned beef hash! I am use to eating corned beef out of a can where the meat is more like ground beef compared to this place where the meat is shredded, and oh man that was awesome. So as you can read, I ordered the corned beef hash which does come with 2 eggs made whatever way you'd like, some pretty good, crispy, special seasoned cut potatoes, and a choice of a banana nut muffin or toast of choice. The waitress was nice enough to pass out free muffins for everyone, the muffin sounded good and everyone at other tables had them, but in actuallity it was only ok. I probably should have went for the toast, but looking at my friend's toast, I will say that they put a lot of butter on it, so if you don't want that shit, make sure to tell them, because I don't think they'll tell you. Oh also forgot to mention that the order also comes with two random slices of fruit.

I actually felt a tad overwhelmed, not by the meat, but the potatoes, while great, it was just so much starch to digest, but non the less, it was still satisfactory and the flavorings in each bite were awesome. 

Service was awesome but paying at the end seemed to drag because we had to wait in line to pay at the register....but regardless, I would definitely go here for breakfast if I ever wake up in time during my Vegas trips.

The one thing I love about this place is the fact that it's off the strip, and it serves up the classic homey style feel, rather than the over-glamorized you would expect in Vegas. Yeah you come this city hoping to escape into another reality, but it's nice to come down from the clouds once in a while.

The one thing I have to admire is there amazing variety of amazing egg selections. I Decided on going with their Chile Relleno Omelette, which was on the money, but their Banana Nut Muffin is THE thing to get. 

Listen, if you feel like wondering off the strip for some good home eatin', why not here??

Best breakfast in Vegas !!!

This is a fun place to eat. That is, it is a fun place to eat if you can get a table as they are oftentimes very-very crowded -- especially in the morning.  On those hot summer Vegas days I see people waiting outside but I don't know... That is just not for me. When you want to go is before the weekend AM crowds have hit or on the off-hours. Then, walking in and getting a table is very easy. 

Okay, now that the warnings have bee spelled out, let's get down to the restaurant. Inside, it is very Americana. Plus, the food is very Americana. Basically, what you see is what you get. 

Ordering is easy. As the name of the restaurant suggests, it is eggs and things that go along with eggs. Simply as that. Make your choice and you are all good. 

The staff is always nice and helpful is you have any questions. And, most of the times the other guest are nice though I have been here a few times when the restaurant was deluged with a rowdy or rude crew, however. But hey, this is Vega, what can you expect? 

Eggs & I is attached to a large shared parking lot. I have never found parking to be a problem. 

It is located on West Sahara, so finding it is easy. 

Overall, very good restaurant. Fun and tasty place to eat.

Recommended!
Breakfast here was great. Eggs over easy cooked just right and the biscuits and gravy were tasety. Chance, our waitress was funny and attentive.

Monday morning breakfast of steak and eggs.
Options included egg preparation, toast type, meat temperature, and potatoes.
I ordered over easy, sourdough, medium rare and potatoes diablo.  Of course I had to have coffee as well.
Coffee and water arrived first.  The coffee was in a hot pot with at least a quart of delicious coffee.  Water was reverse osmosis and highly drinkable.
My steak was cooked to order, but cold.  The waitress rescued me and soon a nice hot steak and eggs order was in front of me.
I enjoyed it for the duration of everything on the plate except I could not finish the potatoes!
Assorted jellies included a rarity: mixed fruit.  Nice!
Good Breakfast stop!

Truly enjoyed breakfast here. Perry our waiter was also nice and patient. We sat outside where they have sprinklers that kept everything cool. 

Food: I ordered the stuffed French toast $10.50. This thing is fully loaded. It's French toast stuffed with scrambled eggs with cheese and I chose, turkey sausage. However you can choose any of these, ham, bacon or sausage. It also comes with a side of potatoes squares. They have large portions and vast selection of items on the menu. Almost everything has some kind of egg. 

Drinks: started off with some hot tea, then had a corona :-) 

Definitely try their signature Habla Diablo verde sauce with your food. Not too spicy, trust me. 

There's parking right out front and this place is off the strip. 

Their prices are very decent. Also make sure to check in to get your free muffin.
Our server was Alexa ! It was our first time here what can I say DELICIOUS the potatoes  were perfect definitely coming back again on my next trip to Las Vegas

This is my 2nd time here as I work out here twice a month. The food is incredible. Customer service is excellent too as the waitresses treat you like family. My waitress today, Chance (wicked cool name) got on her knees to fix my wobbily table with a screw driver. That To me is going over and above just shoving sugar packets under the problem.

Chicken enchilada onlet was the !!!
Liza our server was excellent!! Good luck hope u win a trip to Disney!!

Manuela was AMAZING! This was our first time here and with so many options, we didn't even know where to start. She was patient and offered so many suggestions and she was right on with all of them!!! The restaurant is equally as amazing- food was so good - I definitely recommend taking the trip off the strip and trying this place- you won't be disappointed

It was busy on a sat morn but the food and service was great!  There was a variety of options!  I like that the pancakes can come with fresh fruits.  A group of 5 ate here and we were satisfied with the food and service.
Awesome breakfast! And great service especially for a place this busy with plenty of staff for a timely breakfast.
Food was terrific! We went twice. Double check that they have your order correct. They had our mixed up both times.  Staff is friendly and welcoming.
After such a long wait, we finally went back.  I love this place.  This time I went with my 2 and 1 year old and the server was very patient with us, even after the mess that was left.

It was worth the over 30 minute wait....great breakfast.
It was nice to get away from the strip :)

Every visit to Vegas we have to have breakfast here.  Great food, super nice people and a nice change from the hectic Strip.  Our waitress today, Tabatha, was awesome.  As a mom herself, she understood the needs of our two young children and really helped us out.

This week on diners, drive-ins, and dives.... my group and I took a chance on this place when we searched for brunch places on Yelp and I'm SO glad we did. The service was quick and respectful and the food was a savory spectacle. 

We were a group of six arriving at peak brunch hour and we were seated in less than 5 minutes. Our dining experience began when we checked in on Yelp to get a free batch of their acclaimed banana nut muffins. Our server served them to us warm and they were perfect to peak our appetites for what was to be a massive, hearty breakfast. I ordered my own creation of the The Works skillet with country gravy on top while the rest of my group tried different variations of the Eggs Benny. The country gravy was the best I've ever had and the fresh ingredients in the rest of the skillet balanced the whole meal out. I was impressed with my friend's Eggs Bennies as well. You really can't beat their brunch especially at their modest prices. 

This place is definitely gonna be a staple of my future Vegas trips
Great server! Paula is wonderful!  The hot banana nut muffins are bomb! The carrot cake French toast was so good! And you can't beat the price... we will be back!
Love their banana nut muffin! Love their hot sauces! Be sure to buy some before going home. All of their dishes are great.
Great food! Alexa was great, so patient with those of us new to the Egg and I. The portions are very huge so bring an appetite. I recommend the bacon and avocado omelet.

Pretty good, but not enough for more visits.  No matter how creative you are, eggs are still eggs.  We ordered all dishes recommended by the waitress.  Beautiful, delicious-looking but in the end... the impression doesn't last.  We party of 5 (who eat out quite a lot) all agree that we won't come back.   Excellent service.

Reina was our server and we had a great experience being that it was my first time at Egg & I.  We came on a Saturday and yes it was crowded but we got seated in about 20 minutes. The potatoes and orange juice was a highlight for me. I definitely would come back here again when I come to Vegas.

I am a cartoonist, and when I was in town talking to the editor of the Las Vegas Review-Journal - which apparently has some sort of partnership with this restaurant, since you get a free copy of the newspaper with breakfast, and their logo is on the coffee mugs - I heard about this place but never had a chance to drop them. This time around, I finally made it and found out what I was missing.

Simply put, this is worth the trip away from the strip in order to get huge servings of incredibly fresh fruit, and delicious eggs and bacon and pancakes and French toast and anything else that your carb-loving heart desires for low prices.

Atmosphere is close to non-existent, but whatever - your stomach will thank you while your arteries scream in agony.

Really cool location, great food and service by Breeannda!

Make sure to bring some waiting time during breakfast rush hour!

An amazing gem. We discovered this during our trip to Vegas. My BF is a picky eater and he enjoyed the skillet with season fries, banana muffin, and even straight down to their coffee. It is truly a service with a smile as we had a wonderful server, Karla. It's so good BF wanted to go back again before we left and he usually doesn't request unless it's good. Fo those of you who like bloody marys, it's a must. Even I liked the taste not being a big fan of it. The best part of our vegas dining experience.
Best breakfast in Vegas! Lindsey was phenomenal! Made awesome recommendations. Service was great. Please open one in loma Linda California!!!

I was glad that I only ordered a half serving of Ultimate Skillet - because the serving was GENEROUS!!!!! Ultimate Skillet was definitely a classic and very satisfying - A flavorful combination of sausage, ham, bacon, mushroom, onions, tomatoes, spinach and bell pepper, topped with a perfectly poached egg. Ohhh.... and that's not the end of it! All order came with a banana nut muffin that was moist and soft.......

Yummmmmmmmmm...... definitely worth the wait!

Absolutely amazing food! The service was also outstanding, I went in for breakfast with my girlfriend. The waiter that helped us was very attentive and sweet not considering that she was very much pregnant. Hard working woman, 5 stars to her and everyone else. Definitely returning to eat there again.
Food is exceptionally delicious, friendly service and a warm welcoming. I'd recommend to anyone and everyone!

With over 2,000 reviews and nearly 5 star rating, I'm not sure there's much more I could say that hasn't already been stated by others but I tell you what, this place is truly worthy of the raves and ratings. 

Located about two miles passed Palace Station casino off Sahara Ave, The Egg & I is a wonderful breakfast\/brunch place that is continuously packed. The service is quick, efficient and friendly. Our server Perry was right there ready to take our orders and food arrived shortly afterwards. 

We had the prime rib benny, grandma's biscuits and gravy, corned beef hash and Island Favorite. Everything was delicious but I found the benny to be a bit salty for my preference....the banana nut muffin was sooo good and moist. I highly recommend this place and will be back here the next time I come to Vegas.
BIG fan over here. The country benny? Aces. Eggscellent food and super friendly service from Erin.

Everything yum for breakfast. Had Combo pancakes and eggs just the way I like'em. Cooked well with mushrooms and spinach, Chance is an awesome waitress -quite service. Will definitely return my next visit.

We came here specifically because of the Yelp reviews and boy they were spot on !!!  This place is an excellent local spot for breakfast and everything on the menu is incredible.  I had the eggs florentine and it was awesome, we also enjoyed the Chili Rellenos omelet !!!  10\/10

This is definitely a good example of a brunch place where what you order can have a significant impact on whether you love or hate the food. I ordered the California crepe, which was not made well and tasted fairly bland, despite how promising the combination of ingredients sounded. My friend, however, ordered the chicken fried steak, which was great. This brunch place has a HUGE menu so just make sure you order something that you will definitely like, and you're in the clear. Additionally, the free banana muffin is delicious.

Great breakfast place. It's not on the strip but if you can, make the trip out. I had the Loco Moco and it was great. The banana nut muffin came with the meal and it was the best banana nut muffin I've ever had. It actually may be the best any muffin I've ever had. The staff was friendly with prompt\/quick service with reasonable prices. The potatoes that come with most breakfast entrees were really good as well.

The food was honestly just okay and bit over hyped in my opinion, especially for the wait. The prices were great though so I really can't complain. Its a short distance away from the strip, so if you want something that feels more normal and less vegas like this is your spot!

Heard this on place was good so dropped in to give it a try. The food was delicious as advertised and I would definitely recommend this restaurant to friends and family! But the best part of this place was the service! Even though the place was packed and there were plenty of people waiting in line, the turnover time is amazing, waited probably 15-20 minutes before getting our table with about 6 parties ahead of us. You're then greeted by the staff members who just make you feel good and welcomed, they're all smiles and super friendly! Our server in particular, Karla, was super helpful and welcoming. She made sure we had everything we needed and that we were enjoying our meal despite being busy tending to other tables as well. I would definitely come again, great people, great atmosphere, great food!
the service is great, the skillet course was wonderful. we didn't enjoy the blubbery pancakes..

Great brunch place! Place was packed when we got there but waited only a bout 15min. Their coffee comes with your personal jug! I also loved the various 'healthy options they had' which included substituting for egg whites \/ fruit \/ etc. Bunch of different types of omelettes on the menu too. Eggcellent, 5stars.
Nice good great service!!!! Love their half portion menu, great for girl who wanna keep their shape up!!! Also their banana muffins is the BEST!!! Love it;)

I had the Chile rellenos burrito and my boyfriend had the eggs benedict. Both were delicious! The service was great! My boyfriend made the comment hope he wished his meal came with one of the banana nut near muffins, so our waitress brought one out for him too, since it was our first time visiting the restaurant. Great food. Great service. Great experience.

This is the place to go for a diner\/breakfast\/lunch in Las Vegas.  It is off the strip but totally worth the manageable drive.

I went after a long Vegas night around 11am for a breakfast\/brunch.  We were seated immediately but the place was still relatively full.  I went with a ham and cheese omelette and the person I was with had the pancakes.  We each had a banana nut muffin as well.  All was cooked to perfection and portions were huge.  My omelette came with home fries and all was delicious and perfect for the post Vegas night.  I tried the pancakes and they were great as well.  The banana nut muffin is a must try.

Prices were very reasonable for the quality and the size.  if you have a car or don't mind cabbing it out to this locale, I highly recommend the trip.  Much better than any diner-type option on the strip.

Just ok breakfast.  All too often, I believe people mistake quantity for quality.....They just serve a truckload of potatoes and make them seem exotic by putting a little paprika on them.  Everything is ok, but average.

WOW!!!!  This is a bit off the strip, but worth the ride. Food was amazing. There are so many choices on the menu!  Make sure you bring your appetite!  Portion sizes are HUGE!  Prices are very reasonable!  Definitely go here if you have a chance!

Had sundance omelette for $11.25 and includes alot of potatoes. It was delicious but pricey though. Potatoes were seasoned nicely not too salty and same for the omelette. Would be better if they have organic as well.

There are many locations from the same parent restaurant across Las Vegas and I am sure they are equally good. 

Egg & I does what any breakfast diner should do the best! They have great food at good prices with large portion sizes. All of their food is fresh and made without any apologies to clogging arteries or expanding waist lines. This is a perfect place to go for brunch in Las Vegas to get over some of the dieting and dehydration that had happened the night before or coming up that night. Also a great stop before heading towards one of the great national parks. 

You will not regret coming here as long as you are looking for what they have on the menu!!
Great home style food served by a friendly staff. The banana nut muffin is awesome! Debra was a fantastic and friendly face. Great place for vegetarians! Will be back!

great place for Brunch... best and moist banana nut muffins...
My kids love their waffle with fresh fruits....
Really good food and a really great waitress. Our server was fast and prompt. She made sure we had everything we needed before we even had to ask. Thanks Alyssa for the awesome service!

A decent,  not great, breakfast experience in a market  hurting for a good breakfast restaurant. Few truly healthy options here. Too busy for really good service. Prices are very good. Beware the at their sausage patties are rather flavorless,  pre-fab frozen breakfast sandwich patties.

I had the vegi-benny breakfast with their breakfast potatos, ie deep fried potato nuggets. The Benny was very good. Their cinnamon roll was very good. Not 5 stats for having to wait way too long for coffee and for few healthy options. A last note about all the televisions they have mounted on the walls. We enjoyed watching COPS while dining. Really guys? 

The fact that this place has long waits on weekends goes to show that Las Vegas needs better because even this greasy spoon with a homecooked image gets slammed.
I Love the Egg and I!!! Everything I have tried is delicious but I love the fender benders part of menu also Karla is pretty awesome!!!
Just wanted to say I love this place the food was great love the potatoes.  Amanda was awesome she was our waitress before and still was pretty awesome.

Stopped in here for breakfast on the way out of town.  Wife had banana pancakes with pecans, and I had some prime rib\/eggs benedict plate.  She liked her meal, and mine was good other than the prime rib being a bit too seasoned.  The portions were big, but the prices were a little higher than I expected.  It was pretty crowded, but we had good service.  Unfortunately, there are a lot of breakfast joints in Vegas, so I probably won't be back.  But worth a try - maybe it just wasn't my style.

I would give a hundred stars if I could. Alexa was beyond amazing, I'm shocked she's not serving at the nicest most high end restaurant in Vegas. She has a smile that lights up an entire room and a personality to match it. We were being somewhat complicated with our order and everything came out perfect and tasted great. Will absolutely be back!!

This place had a lot of variety in their menu. One of the best omelette S I've ever had. They have the most amazing banana nut bread. It was my favorite part of the meal, and best part it was free with a Yelp check in!!

We seem to have arrived at exactly the right time, about 9:15, and immediately got a table.  Afterwards every time I looked up the on-deck bench was full.  Our order was taken promptly but there was a bit of a delay before it came.  I had the Works Skillet and my wife had a California Crepe.  We thought both of them were delicious, and there was plenty to eat.  So much that about half of our order came home in a box.  It was open seating and a bit noisy so don't expect much privacy, although that wasn't a big issue with us.  The staff was courteous, and prompt with the extras we asked for.  The cashier was, to use and old phrase, "bubbly" while checking out a line of people, a trait that we found refreshing for such a busy place.  We were very satisfied and agree that they lived up to the positive reviews that we used to chose them.

There's one thing I like in a restaurant, and that is..... I get exactly what I ordered and the way I ordered it.

The pancake's were still warm up to the last bite, how rare is that.   The staff was friendly and it's off the Vegas strip.......

If you're looking for a good, no frills breakfast spot.  This would be it.....
Love! The service, the food, the spot is perfection!!! Highly recommend!!! Parking is not a problem and everything on the menu is divine!!

This is a great place to meet friends or bring the family for breakfast! Great value for the amount and quality of food you get. It's always consistent and the service is good. The food comes out fast so not an issue coming with the kids, they don't have time to get fidgety. And the patio seating is nice of you have 4 year olds that need to stretch their legs on occasion.

I had the Loco Moco. It was absolutely fantastic. I also recommend their muffins!

I make a point to stop here at least once every time I stop in Vegas. The food is amazing and the price is right. Highly recommended.

I gave a 5 because my server " REINA " was on POINT... First time as a family of 5 and the customer service was excellent... Our breakfast was nice and hot and we enjoyed our time here!! Thank you for being super friendly! Atmosphere was great from the time we walked in!!! We will be coming here again!! #vegaswecamehungry #anditwaslegit #thanks
Very good place for breakfast.  Had the taco skillet and it was decent.  The pancakes and banana muffin looked amazing.  Our waitress Samantha was great.

Went here on a quick bite and decided to go in. The food tastes so good here. I was surprised by the banana nut muffins, it was soft and just a really good desert. What I ordered was the hash browns and pancakes. The hash browns are actually cut into little cubes and seasoned I was surprised at the shape but they were still really tasty will come here again.

I tried the mashed potato omelette and California crepe . Both was awesome and given in quite big portion. Worth for those eggs lover. Just that after you ordered , may need wait for about 10 mins for the dish to be served. The server is attentive after I accidentally flipped the mood chart . Come early to queue as they don't allow reservation.

Such a great find! When we arrived, we knew it was a popular spot because there were people waiting outside to be seated. They got us in quickly and we were seated in under 15 minutes. The staff are all super friendly! Our server Raul took great care of us. The food did not disappoint either. I had a delicious breakfast burrito with carnitas and tomatillo salsa. We will be back for sure!
AmaZing best american brunch\/ breakfast ever! Prices are reasonable. thank you Karla she helped us to find out the best ones in the menu! Easy to park! 4 miles to stribe dont be lazy is worthed
What a great meal and Karen was a great waitress, very attentive and smiling. I am a person of few words. I write reviews both good and bad.

MY FAVORITE BREAKFAST SPOT ON THE PLANET!!!

Okay, maybe a little extreme, but you get my drift. I LOVE eating here. The staff is ALWAYS helpful, the food is always great, and the Chile Relleno Omelet is the bomb.com. PLUS --- the coffee is strong - its the perfect place to take visitors to a local Vegas spot, or just for your regular hangover cure - this place will do the trick JUST FINE, trust me, I know from experience lol

Sooo hungover, and new in town, I could only think of this place.

It's cute inside, the waitress was nice, but not very attentive.

The plain waffle was flavorless, the bacon uncrisp and small, the potatoes were extra and toast did not come with the meal.

Once the headache subsided, I thought of two places that served a better breakast for half the price.
A must stop in Vegas! Love the banana nut muffin. All food is great here!

WOW What can i say about this place other than it was amazing! I ordered the chill omelette which was amazing and it comes with potatoes. Also the banana nut muffin comes with this and this muffin was probably this best muffin i have ever had. The service was great even with the place being busy. Just a heads up your gonna have to wait especially on weekiends, it was definitely worth the wait and i will be back here every time I am in Vegas.

EGG-CEPTIONAL OMELETTE:

The Three Pigs (diced ham, bacon and sausage, topped with cheddar and jack cheese) $10.25
ï½ Love this! You will love it as much as I do if you like cheese. A lot of fillings and omelette is served with crispy cubed potatoes. 9\/10

Mashed Potato (bacon omelette with garlic mashed potato, topped with melted cheese, onions and sour cream) $11.25
~ Mashed potato is very filling. Huge portion of omelette and mashed potato stuffed in it.
~ 6\/10

EGG-CREPES:

Works Crepe (diced bacon, ham, smoked turkey, sliced tomatoes, onions, cheddar and jack cheese, served with poppy seed dressing) $10.85
~ Not too bad. This egg crepe has a lot of different fillings that compliments each other really well. Taste really yummy. 7\/10

California Crepe (diced bacon, mushrooms, tomatoes, guacamole and Swiss cheese) $11.25
~ Really really yummy! I love this dish the most! The guacamole makes it refreshing. 
~ 8\/10

SKILLET BREAKFAST:

Santa Cruz Skillet (seasoned chicken breast, green chillies, onions, homemade Santa cruz sauce) $10.99
~ Don't like this at all! Too meaty, too saucy and too heavy for a breakfast. 3\/10

1st visit:
Server Brady's service is really good. Our table is always on "Smiley Face" as he will constantly walk over and ask if we're doing ok. Good service! 

2nd visit:
Server Amanda is very attentive to our needs. Ensuring we had all we need. Great service!

Tips:
~ Check-in and get 1 FREE Banana Nut Muffin
~ Love the Happy and Unhappy Face on the table. If you need attention, flip to Unhappy face, if you're happy, flip it back to Happy face.
~ Write a review on yelp\/tripadvisor and mention your server's name and they're one step closer to win a trip for 2 to Disney California to meet Mickey Mouse.

Places like this is when I appreciate my iphone and the yelp app the most.

Was in Vegas and wanted some breakfast that doesn't come with the word "Buffet" attached to it. Looked up on Yelp and found this little gem.

It's around a 10minute drive from the Strip, without traffic of course.

I ordered the Crazy Chicken omelet with the muffin. They leave the whole carafe of coffee on your table, saving yourself from waving down a waiter(ess) every time you want a refill.

The omelet itself was very tasty, the muffin, while not as heavenly as some others claim, was indeed very moist and tasty and worth a try. The potato that came was what made my day. The fried squared shaped potato was crispy on the outside, but still mushy on the inside! Such a delight!

If I find myself in Vegas some other day, I'll definitely come back again!

Try to be here before 9am on the weekend, the waiting list was long by the time we arrived at 10am on the Saturday we visited.

The food was great and the best part is the server tabbatha. ....she must be new, never seen her before..let me tell you, if ur having a bad day and people being shity go see tabbatha she put a smile on my face she was great she treat u like ur family and always making sure we were ok with everything we were served.....she really knows service and making people comfortable at the restaurant after a long freaken night at work....thank tabbatha u rock...hope to come back with my whole family...

I ordered the corned beef hash with the banana nut muffin. I've been hearing about how great their banana nut muffin and it truly does live up to the hype. It was light and fluffy and the banana flavor was subtle. 

The corned beef hash comes with ranch potatoes (think Tommys style fries with that red seasoning only diced up), eggs, and a side of watermelon and pineapple. The hash was served under scrambled eggs in a skillet. The ranch potatoes were crisp and flavorful. I just wish the hash was a bit crispier. Since the hash was made with a mixture of potatoes, the texture remained soft and did not create any contrast with the scrambled eggs. It had good flavor though. 

Lastly, the customer service is top notch. All the waitresses were happy to help and near the end of brunch, the owner\/manager came over just to chit chat, which I appreciated.

We came to this place based on all the good reviews...and I'm glad we did! I ordered the stuffed French toast and substituted the seasoned potatoes for cooked spinach. It was a very filling meal! I think by ordering the spinach I was able to clear my plate. I also had a tea, which came with a plate of lemons and honey containers. 

Our server Raul was amazing! He had us laughing and was on top of our orders! We had him split our table into 5 checks, and he did it with a smile. He made our first time visit here that much better! He also have us all free muffins as it was our first visit.

Plenty of parking and there is a large outside patio. The inside is decently large, cozy and homie feeling. Very nice :)

I recommend coming here if you want a filling and good meal. The menu is huge, there are so many options. You're bound to find something you'll enjoy.

Great service 

Oscar was a great waiter his service was quick and made our first time in the The Egg and I AWESOME. 

My table had a variety of orders 
Steak and eggs 
Chrorizo breakfast sandwich 
The classic breakfast 
The works omelette 

And everything was great. I strongly suggest this place to any and everyone.

Been coming here for the past couple of summers, at least twice a week.  Considering that I'm only awake these 'early' hours (the place is only open from 6am to 3pm) a few times a week, that's a fairly high ratio, now that I think about it.

Menu items of note:
Crazy Chicken - simply a well balanced omelette

Eggs Benedict Florentine - not a fan of eggs benedict in general, but I am when I come here

Banana Nut Muffin - this thing might be enough of a reason to come here just by itself

Haole (sp?) loco - on the back page, under the Hawaiian section, it's one of the more fattening things on the menu, but very tasty.

Not a fan of their homefries, so I substitute them out with fruit instead

Service:
The servers are usually quite friendly, helpful, and attentive.

Reasons why I come here:
This is one of the cheaper and healthier breakfast options in Vegas, yet there is no sacrifice in quality for the food.  Much better than the overrated Hash House a Go Go.  Oh, and if you are coming here for the first time, do yourself a favor and get the darn Banana Nut Muffin.

Ordered the diablo potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon, and chocolate chip pancakes. The portions are nice sized and everything was fantastic. There was no wait and the server was efficient and pleasant. My boyfriend's food was excellent as well. Great breakfast spot!
We had an absolutely amazing breakfast at Egg & I! The portions were generous and delicious, quite a good value. Our server, Karla, was full of energy and helped us have a great start to our day!

I gave Egg and I a 4 star because it was delicious but not extraordinary. As first timers we were given complimentary banana nut muffin. It was delicious but too oily for me. We went on a Sunday morning and waited about 20 minutes to be seated for a table for two. Our server was very polite and actually everyone there seem happy to work there. You can tell everyone was working hard and had a a routine that works. As for the food, I was satisfied and left full. I ordered the stuffed French toast with bacon and potatoes. The potatoes were tiny and well done with extra seasonings (average). My BF got the biscuits and gravy with potatoes as well. The gravy had the right amount of sodium not too salty and not to bland.

Came here for a late breakfast with a line out the door on a Saturday morning.. we opted to sit outside to skip the wait. Our server was Tammy, if you can sit in her area, DO SO! She was super attentive and on point with everything. All her recommendations were really good, even though everyone got delicious meals. The muffins were delicious, the chicken enchilada omelette, country fried steak, and the French toast sandwich ... can't go wrong!! Everything is delicious. Honestly everything could have been crap and I would still be I pressed. Tammy outdid herself and made sure we were always taken care of even though our table was in the forgotten area of the outside. She checked on us and always came by with creamer for our coffee, butter, napkins... truly the best service we've had in our 3 day weekend stay in Las Vegas even compared to the 5 star steakhouse service.

Awesome breakfast spot. Everything I saw coming out of the kitchen looked really good. I had the country fried steak breakfast with eggs and banana nut muffin. The CFS is excellent and rivals some of the places I go to.

Our waitress, Reina, is very friendly and took care of us. She even apologized to my friend about the football game loss last night. This shows she likes to interact with the customers. She also was attentive and came by to ask how things were or if we needed anything. The service in general is excellent as we always had a rotating staff to help with clearing the table. 

I'll definitely be coming back to try other dishes.

We were heading to Jamm's for breakfast and my wife said, I think we've been there before, so she suggested we try something else.  This place was on the way.  Turns out, we've eaten here before as well.  It's really good, portions are plenty from a guy who likes big portions.  I had the chicken fried steak breakfast and my wife had the stuffed French toast with sausage.  Telling the truth, I was really looking for something that came with pancakes because I like a big breakfast, this place really didn't have many options.  It didn't need it.  You get a mountain of little diced up potatoes that are nuggets of seasoned fried heaven, large main potions that pancakes would put you in food coma.  Coffee is really the only thing that I would say could be better.  Good, but not spectacular.

Stopped in here on the drive to the Vegas strip with my boyfriend.  We were starving and needed some breakfast.  Not too much to say, since I've only been there once and am not from around there, but it definitely wasn't a mistake. Good eggs!
Great food, wonderful customer service and the staff is so friendly plus they pay attention to everyone like a true team.  Even if they have a long line it still moves pretty fast.
Stellar muffins,great service, excellent "country benny", lots of fresh coffee. Wait time is worth it.

5 stars for the amazing service from our server LINNEA! She defiantly deserves to win the trip to Disney!

1) Linnea went above and beyond when it came to serving. When we order she would ask additional questions like, would you like flavored creamers? And give additional recommendations towards the food choices.

2) Linnea would always check on us and see if we were doing good, always having a cheerful welcoming smile on her face and the way she talked made us feel very welcomed.

3) When there was a slight mistake, because my friend ordered steak and instead of eggs they wanted an omelet, which never happened before and Linnea brought out my stuff French toast and apologize for the confusion and mishap, that the steak was cooked inside the omelet and apologize for the confusion and wait... Which we didn't even wait long. About 3 minutes the steak and omelet was brought out immediately. Still apologizing... It didn't matter too much to us and for the fact that they were sincerely sorry. Wow what exceptional service. 

4) I was going to stop at 3, but since Linnea went above, she not only brought us our check but a "sorry" gift of banana bread wrapped and gifted nicely. I was shocked to see such service!!! 

THIS IS WHAT YOU CALL AMAZING SERVICE, someone who went above and does more than just servicing you! Thank you Linnea!!! We enjoyed our visit and defiantly will be coming back! I hope you will be in Disney by than!!! :D
Love the breakfast. We got the stuffed toast and the bacon avocado omelette. Portions are pretty big. Well worth the price. The potatoes on the side were really good!

Quite possibly the saltiest eggs that have ever entered my mouth :(

The menu selection is overwhelmingly large with many different options but I opted for good ol traditional eggs benny. I'm not sure if they sprinkle their eggs each with individual cartons of salt...wouldn't be surprised cause everything was so salty. The hollandaise sauce also had an overbearing flavor and the ham was so. damn. SALTY. Everyone at my table was commenting on how salty the egg dishes were.

I really wanted to like this place because the servers were all so kind and attentive but my egg dish pretty much ruined it for me. The potatoes on the side however were prepared perfectly. Crispy and perfectly seasoned. 

Nevertheless, I did enjoy the free banana nut muffin that came free with yelp check-in. Probably one of the best muffins I've ever had. Warm, toasty on the outside & moist on the inside. Mmmmm.

Had a small portion of friend's stuffed french toast which was pretty good. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing, but since this restaurant specializes in "egg works" I was not expecting to be let down by a classic eggs benny dish. I would give 5 stars for service and 3 for food.

Pros:
Chicken Enchilada Omelette is the bomb!
Home Fries are awesome, great seasoning.
Wife loved the French toast!

Cons:
None!

Wish you were so much closer to me! Better yet no I don't I would totally gain 20 pds by you lol! Love this home fashioned yet unique breakfast joint! I will make a stop here everytime for at least one breakfast if in the area.  Here is what I ordered:

MEXICAN OMELETTE
Chorizo* sausage, green chilies, diced onion, and melted cheeses.
Covered with salsa and sour cream. About 10 bucks and two biscuits on the side.

I don't know what they put in their seasonings but Y-U-M-M-Y!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I usually never finish a plate that has such huge portions but I gobbled this one all the way! And yup they have MILITARY Discount!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Their menu is full of things I am just dying to try in the future! We got here about 11:30 and only waited about 5 minutes before seating. Breakfast is served until 3:00 for all the late nighters! MMM..MMM.....Good!

Excellent breakfast place off the strip.  Busy but minimum waits.  Food came out remarkably fast considering how busy they were.  Veggie eggs Benedict was great!  Maryanne didn't let my coffee get cold and seems to be a mind reader :)

We used to come years ago more often, but since we've moved to the NW I just seem to never be around this area when it is open so we made a trip to come eat here. 

So I saw they had loco moco on their menu which is something I wasn't expecting. I decided to order it anyways though I wasnt sure about ordering a item at a non Hawaiian spot. It was actually really good, even better than most of the fast food style Hawaiian places as everything tasted much fresher and the gravy had good flavor. 

The fiance got a apple walnut chicken sandwich which he seemed to enjoy. I took a bite and it's solid as far as cold chicken salad sandwiches go. 

The thing I like is they are always friendly here. I really liked our server as she was just chipper. 

It's always busy here so I avoid the peak times to not have to wait, but if you go later in the afternoon like we did, there's no one there. 1 hour wait for breakfast time or no wait for breakfast at lunch....I'll pick the no wait! 

It's been a long hiatus, but my next visit won't be so far off again.

Hard to "pile on" with the good reviews, but we're really happy we stopped here. It was on Mother's Day, and I expected a line out the door, but we were seated within 15 minutes, and had very attentive service.  The boys had huge plates while the Mrs and I split one (which was plenty). Beverages ($2.50\/each) tend to tip the bill over the top, so be cautious of that, but the food and service are terrific.

Food was fantastic. The portiins are VERY filling. Amanda was our server and she was so sweet and helpful. We were a large party including 2 crabby seniors and a fussy baby and she made sure that everyone was well taken care of.

Egggxellent... Liza was our waitress...it was our first time there and she gave us great suggestions on the most popular dishes...we tried the loco Moco, steak and eggs and the eggs Benedict.  Food was homemade,fresh and lots of flavor.  If you are Hawaiian, you'll love the local food and the aloha shoyu and sticky white rice...so on.

Awesome breakfast. Look forward to coming when I am in town. I always get the key largo crepe. Would love one of these in San Jose. Came on a Sunday once and it was packed so plan to wait. Week days are better.

My boyfriend and I went to this place really randomly when we went to Vegas for New Year's in December 2005. We found this place by looking in local ads. I know we each got omlettes and shared the french toast, and it was all very good. This will be the first place we go to if we ever go back to Vegas. The service was good and even though it was packed, we still received our food without the long wait you usually get in the bay area.

Breakfast was delicious they have 4 egg omelets and a standard is 3 eggs. Portions are plentiful definitely need to walk it off on the strip. Only disappointing item was Daily Egg Burger. Was too dry for me and the eggs yolk was already fully cooked. Other then that, you will walk out with a to-go container.

In Vegas for a softball tournament & looked up a breakfast spot. Found this place on Yelp & decided to check it out. Had a great experience! The hostess was friendly, the waitress was great & the atmosphere of the place was awesome. Got our food quick, for how crowded it was! The food was perfect. Full of flavor and fresh. It was pretty crowded for a Friday morning but we got seated pretty quick and out of there within an hour.

Good food, good prices and a wonderful atmosphere. Glad Google showed me this place. Was just what I wanted after dinner at my hotel last night.  My server, Lilian was prompt, friendly and quick to make sure I had everything I needed.
Great service, fresh, generous portions and so cheap! Great locals spot if you want to get off the strip. So glad I found this little gem while visiting Vegas.

I went here last year and wasn't super impressed. I don't remember exactly what I got, but I think it was an omelette. Decent, but I didn't see what all the fuss was about and especially for a place that isn't cheap. Well, I'm glad I tried it again, because now I see more of what people have been talking about. I went with a party of 8 and the service was excellent. Someone recommended the stuffed French toast and although it didn't really sound like my kind of thing I ordered it. Well, I'm glad I did because that thing is awesome! Perfectly cooked eggs with the right amount of cheese and sausage. The French toast was done just right as well. So, I suppose it really depends on what you have here and what your tastes are. For example, I tried those muffins everyone at our table was raving about and I didn't like them. Go figure!

No wonder why this place is #1 on Yelp. Service was awesome; Carole Ann the server provided an excellent service. Checked - in on Yelp and got a free banana muffin and it was delicious. I would recommend people to order their banana muffin. Ordered prime rib benedict and it was delicious; meat was tender, good combination of veggies in the mix with the sauce and crossant. Oh, and the potatoes that came with it was nicely season and tasted fresh unlike some breakfast places, potatoes are soggy and no flavor. I would definitely go back whenever I'm in vegas. I left a happy customer.

Yums! This place is delicious!! 

Since we had a car this time in Vegas, we decided to get some brunch off the strip. We had a party of 3 and waited about 10-15 minutes before we got seated. My friend ordered the stuffed french toast, which was HUGE! The bf ordered the eggs benedict, which was not bad and good portions. I ended up ordering the egg-crepe, which was simiar to an omelette. Pretty good and not too heavy. 

What we loved the most was their banana nut muffin and ranch potatoes. O man, my mouth is watering just thinking about how light and tasty their banana nut muffin was. I could eat like 5 of those in 1 sitting. hahaha. =X We were all raving about how  the ranch potatoes were so flavorful. Plus, each dish had a big portion of it. I definitely wasn't complaining. 

Our waitress was very attentive, but not over-bearing. She told us if we needed something, we could just flip the little egg over to get her attention (reminded me of Bubba Gump's).

I will definitely want to come back and try other things on the menu, since I go to Vegas about 3 times a year.

Egg & I is always a favorite and is most always the first breakfast spot we hit during our ventures to LV.

I can't seem to get myself to order anything but the Egg Crepes, I guess it's just because it's that good, not to mention, I can't order anything like it from anywhere else!  I forget which one I usually order, I think it's called the "Collision" or something?  It has mushrooms and bacon in it.

The Ranch Potatoes are like like Potato Chips, you can't help but pop one after the other, after the other, in your mouth.

But, it's not like I can finish it anyways, because of that damn freakin most delicious Banana Nut Muffin I have in the beginning.  Oh my gosh, slap a little butter on it, hell, slap a lot of butter on that warm muffin and it's freakin heaven.  I'll need to ask the next time I'm around if I can actually order some muffins to go.

Egg & I is definitely worth it and I'll keep coming back every time I'm in town.

Overrated. Corned beef hash had very little hash and too much beef. Usually, the opposite would be the issue. The problem is that the corned beef was EXTREMELY salty. Fried potatoes that come with many entrees are mediocre. Biscuits and Gravy are good. Mashed potato omelette is exactly what it sounds like. Ironically, I was expecting something different or creative. It was okay. Pancakes were really good. Service was great! Establishment is not that bad, but a little ronchy due to all the green...just weird.

Had it on a past sunday on the way out of vegas. Waited about 30 minutes for a group of 4 around 11:30 am. Definitely worth the wait. 

Got hooked up on banana nut muffins with the check in. Deliciously moist and flavorful. 

So when deciding to order my buddy and i couldnt decide between the chile relleno omlete and the a south west type of omlete.. so we decided to order both and split it. Ya i know l, totally adorable.

Must say the chile relleno is soooooo good. Definitely filling and hit all the right marks. Not many places can make a good chile relleno entre, alertos is the only place in oc, imo, but eggs and i got it right.

The south west type was also a good omlete. Definitely tasted the different components but it was not as awe strucking as the chile relleno omlete.

Other things ordered at the table was a "1\/2" order of maple bacon french toast had a special type of syrup as well. This plate was a good addition to the overall meal. 

The gf ordered a carrot cake french toast. She said it was ok in comparison to the chile relleno omlete *cough cough*. But i need to be hoenst besides loving chile rellenos.. i love carrot cake! It was moist, similar texture as the banan nut muffin and with bits of carrots enough for texture. Definitely a fan. 

Besides great service with the food, out waitress was just as diligent with our questions in regards to this establishment's history.

Will be back next vegas trip and ill recommend it to everyone i talk to.
Good breakfast place. The eggs benny were awesome as was the banana nut muffin. Server Carole Ann was very sweet and friendly!

Bacon Maple Cream French Toast! Yum.  Also tried the Mexican omelette.  Omelette was ok, the hash browns were delicious.  Coffee....not great, decent.  Omelette came with the banana muffin, which was very good.  There are not to many good breakfast places near the Vegas strip, but I would return for the Bacon Maple Cream French Toast!!!!!

Awesome breakfast place!   Went here twice-  steak & eggs first trip, Italian skillet on second.   Perfect banana nut muffins, coffee off the scale good.    Great service.   A bit of a wait sometimes but soooooo worth it!

We had the Chile Relleno Omelette and the Chicken Fried Steak. Both were amazing. We live in CA and I've never had a better Chile Relleno. The house made banana nut muffin was soft and delicious. Our hostess Chance was sweet and awesome.
Great breakfast spot away from the strip and fantastic prices! Best vegas breakfast imo
Very good food , this is my favorite breakfast restaurant of all time right here I really love the omelets and the hash browns but do you guys have grits I don't think you do
Great place to have breakfast. Few minutes from the strip but they take care of you well. Corn beef hash great but mushy. All food was amazing. Serves breakfast until 3pm. Busy but well worth it!
Liza was a really great server. She was very attentive and everything was brought promptly. The food was really good. I will be leaving a decent tip and can not wait to come back again.
Everything is great but for some reason I just don't care for their coffee. HUGE servings that I usually had to save for lunch.
Food luke warm coffee way over price and luke warm and bitter to taste. French toast soggy could not finish it, Way over price for what you get.
Amazing place, really busy on Sunday's but there really quick on getting people in.  Our server Breeannda, was super attentive.  Great food and great service!!!  Will defiantly be back.
My wife and I love getting "Kay's Special" whenever we go there.  We love this place!
Tons of food. Mega portions. Great service. Easy going environment. Family friendly. Nearby. Go early. Stay as long as you want. Good coffee.

The only breakfast place I crave when I'm back home. It's a must to have breakfast here when I come out to LV. I love the mashed potato omelette! Haven't tried much else because I love it so much! Everything looks bomb though! Quality food at a fair price.

This is the place to break the fast while your in Vegas. The casinos don't have jack on this place. Only a 10 minute drive from the strip. Good place for locals and tourist alike. The staff was excellent and the food was some of the best morning grub I had in a while. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone. The omelets are great and healthy serving. Don't skip out on this spot while in town.

One of the best place to eat breakfast or brunch in Vegas. Foods are great price and taste really good. They have a lot of servers so they don't drag you down. Paula was our server and she gave us great service!!

My new fave breakfast\/brunch spot in vegas. Not on the strip but still not too far. Kind of a locals spot. They have really good omelettes and pancakes. Everything I tried was tasty. The servers are also quite courteous. Will go back whenever I'm in Vegas.
Outstanding Chili relleno omelette!!  The potatoes were perfect!!  Thanks, Jennifer, for being so efficient!!

Great place to go after fun night! 
Servers were respectful and fun.
Got eggs Benedict and had a second breath.

Really great place for breakfast\/brunch. 

The banana nut muffin is the moistest I have ever had in my life.

I've also tried the corned beef hash here, the loco moco, the chicken fried steak, and all were delicious.

The coffee comes with unlimited refills and is pretty strong. You will get the tremors after a couple cups.
Don't let the strip mall location and dodgy\/sketch exterior fool you, this place is good stuff!

Delicious. Loved the staff and the decorations. Four egg omelette! We did not even eat lunch. The chile rellino omelette tastes exactly like an enchilada. The mash potato omelette is very filling and my sister who loved mashed potatoes absolutely love it! I ordered the feta, mushroom, and tomato omelette which was good as well! Warm banana nut muffin delicious and you can get a free one! The side signature potatoes are delicious I loved the seasoning and not greasy! Would recommend this restaurant to anyone and the 15 minute drive from the strip is well worth it! Best food for your money value.

This location is very speedy, so if you have a big day planned & need to eat fast, it's a great place to stop!

 The tables are spacious, with plenty of room in between (not over-crowded) as many tend to be. 
 
 I had the spinach Benny, which was very good, the hollandaise was a bit salty for me, but my husband said it was just right. 

 His California crepe was very good, loaded with delicious guac too! 

Another wonderful location, grab a bite to eat here, you can't go wrong.

Good breakfast food off the strip of Vegas. Price is reasonable (Around $10 per plate) and they give you a lot. Enough for you to take back home unless you are coping with a hangover and need all the carbs you can get. 

The Banana Nut Muffin is really as good as everyone says it is; especially with the spread. You can tell they bake it fresh as there is no complex presentation to it. It is just simply muffin off the pan. I ordered the egg-ceptional omelette and it was decent. Definitely worth the money but, not mind blowing. I would try their other items if I go again. My friend got the stuffed french toast and that looked very good. However, the ranch potato side were delicious and exactly what I needed after a long weekend in Vegas. 

Their high selling point is their super nice staff. They give you the perfect amount of chit chat and leave you alone time.

Use their egg signs. Yellow Egg means you need attention; Black Egg means leave me alone.

We were out of town and stopped by. Breakfast was good! I got the biscuits and gravy and my boyfriend got the spinach Benny the potatoes on the side were delicious and the coffee was good. Customer service was outstanding as well our waitress was on top of everything.

The Spinach Eggs Benny and the cream cheese stuffed toast were so delicious.  Definitely a great place.  Not only the best breakfast place in Las Vegas, but the best I have been to in a while anywhere.  Hopefully you get a sweet lady named Karla.  She is a fantastic server.

Awesome breakfast. Our server was Karla and she was very nice. 

I had the stuffed French toast and it was delicious. The seasoning on the potatoes was really good.

This is indeed an awesome place for breakfast\/brunch\/lunch.  The food that they serve is excellent, and the portion is generous too.  I personally enjoy the Stuff French Toast and Omelet.  The banana cake came for free when you check in using Yelp, they are very moist.  However, some say the OJ is good, but we tried it.  I'd say... it's not my cup of tea, although they are also fresh squeeze.  We suspect they have put sugar or ice to mix them together since we drink freeze squeeze juice at home very often.
Just a regular breakfast spot. Nothing special or out of this world. The service was excellent though. That's y I gave it 3 stars

We were on our way out of Las Vegas and it was lunch time when we actually arrived.  We were really hungry though and were craving breakfast.  

Atmosphere is down-home.  Food is very good and there is alot to choose from.  Service was a little slow, but our waitress wasn't being lazy.  She was just very busy with lots of customers.  All in all it was a unique breakfast house and we'll return!

Who knew that making over easy eggs was an artform?  This place has mastered the art of making eggs.  I was visiting Vegas with family and actually craving pancakes, but I couldn't eat at a place called "The Egg & I" and not have eggs.  So I ordered a simple breakfast the Eggs Plus (over easy eggs, grits, toast, and bacon).  I had never seen such a perfectly cooked over easy egg, and it definitely tasted that way.  The white of the egg was so airy!  My mom was willing to share a bite of her eggs benedit, and they were soooo good!  I felt I had to commemorate the visit, so I bought my mom an "Egg & I" coffee mug.  :)  Oh, and the staff was very friendly.
Really good service by Sayra and excellent food  we had the abundance special omelette and choc chip pancakes.. Everything was so good and the service perfect.

Liza was an amazing server and made the group feel at home. The food came out in good time considering the whole place was packed from front to back. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. Great experience overall. The works omlet was amazing and i highly recommend it.

Good food and nice service. I had a delicious pesto eggs Benedict. My father said the potatoes were too salty, but I liked them fine. The OJ isn't fresh squeezed, and I've definitely had far better hot chocolates. So if you are on a budget, rest assured that you're not missing anything if you stick with water.

Yummy with a dog friendly patio, friendly service and great value! Hubby didn't like the omelette he selected (the Mexican omelette) but the carb free option for sides saved the meal. We always measure how good a place is based on our return to the establishment - we will be back!!!

My friends and I wanted to have brunch some place that wasn't a buffet so we found Egg & I off Yelp and decided to come try it.  I have never been more in love with Yelp.  

Their banana nut muffin is SO good and I never eat muffins because I don't like them.  It is so moist and you can taste the freshness.  Everything here is good.  If you like spicy food, add some Cholula sauce on it to complete your meal :D  Their hash browns are delicious.  The spices used to make it come together so well.  Anything you get here will be a party in your mouth.

Although it's off the Strip, it's definitely worth a try.

The veggie skillet and ciabatta breakfast sandwich were delicious! Great coffee and great atmosphere! Our server Chance was so nice and personable. Definitely recommend this as a spot to get an amazing breakfast!

The best cure to a hangover and it's Vegas so chances to visit Egg & I are high! It was so tasty that I actually came here two breakfasts in a row. This restaurant will definitely show you the sunny-side of your day. ;)

The servers are really nice, and accommodating to custom orders. The menu is a cute, reminiscent of a newspaper so it give you an old-timey diner feel of reading a paper in the morning. The little black and yellow egg sign was cute too, just flipping it let the server know that you needed their attention, so many eggs everywhere it was a bit on the cheesy  side. The extensive menu did not help my indecisiveness, everything is equally good and largely portioned. I loved the country style potatoes, the seasoning is perfect so I recommend getting that if you can as a side.

Don't forget to bookmark this place or the yolks on you!

Large plates! The corned beef hash was really something. Coffee was a bit pricey but the staff were friendly and the food came out faster than i expected. Should definitely eat here at least once if youre staying in the area.

This place was packed when I went.. The food was great, I enjoyed the el Diablo potatoes, it had a nice crisp and was well seasoned. I ordered steak Benedict. Very flavorful and had some spice to it. Service was great as well..

2äººã§å®é£ã¯åºæ¥ã¾ããã§ãããå¤§æºè¶³ã§ãã

The Egg & I! If I could eat at one place for breakfast every day of my life, it would be this place. Granted, I've only been here once, but I can't stop thinking about the delicious food I ate and how I wish we had this place in LA. 

I ordered the Chili Relleno omelet and the Country Benny. They had the option of ordering smaller portions of the skillets and omelet dishes which I really enjoyed because the portions were fairly large and I unfortunately can never finish my food, no matter how hard I try.

The Chili Relleno was so extremely flavorful, the omelet practically melted in my mouth. And the Country Benny, the gravy, the sausage, the biscuit... Mmmm! My eyes rolled back with every bite. I wanted to order the banana pancakes but I think I was getting ahead of myself. 

Our waitress, Carla, was amazing. She was very helpful and attentive, and definitely made my experience more enjoyable.

I will go to Vegas again just to eat here. Can't wait to come back!

This has always been my favorite breakfast place. Their works potatoes are the best. Ordered the mashed potato omelette with no bacon and my order came out perfectly and was delicious! Our server tabatha was very fast and friendly! Definitely recommend (:

Just average. Ordered the biscuits and gravy two eggs over medium with bacon and potatoes. The gravy had no sausage in it as far as I could tell, the eggs were under cooked, sent them back just to get the same under cooked eggs, the only really good thing was the potatoes.
Only got two cups of coffee, the server took the coffee pot away when the eggs were sent back. I guess that was my punishment for sending the eggs back.
Most likely will not return.

This is a great brunch place. I enjoy the farm decorations and outdoor seating is beautiful on a sunny day off. A lot of selection when it comes to food with eggs of course, a little less creativity with things like pancakes, waffles,etc. Still a very solid place to eat, food is not oozing with grease like most other places. Service is pretty quick.

The host was not good at all today this morning. My family had been waiting for a while and when she called us. She said my mom's name, since she was the one who signed in, and then "party of four" when I even heard my mom said party of six. The host seemed out of it & disinterested. She did not take down the correct number for my party. Her job is so simple & she could not perform. Bad service! Didn't get to taste the food so this review is for the service.
Got in fairly quick. Order placed and meal delivered in a very speedy fashion. Omelette bigger than my head? Plus. Found this place accidently...pleasantly surprised. Will probably go back.
Reina have us perfect service! Prompt courteous. Great selection and quality of food. Endless coffee. Muffin was soft and flavorful. Nice to sit outside and people watch.

Everything positive you hear is true.  Come hungry and ask the hostess to call you a cab before your bill comes so you don't have to wait outside awhile.  Only negative is that its a little off the beaten path.
The food was excellent and service was great. Brady was a fantastic server and started our day off right!

This place is amazing. Their muffins are the best. I have been here two times and have not left disappointed. Our server was attentive and the food beyond amazing.
