The first time I got a scramble and it was great. The second time I got the chile relleno omelette. It was amazing a little heavy on the cheese but the flavors were still able to come through. Really good would recommend as their prices are great and their portions amazing.

The service here is absolutely horrible. I can't comment on the food as we didn't stay long enough for that. We were offered a seat in the very back near the bathrooms even though the restaurant was half full. We were offered to have a seat in another section. We were not offered menus when we were sat down. We waited 15 minutes during which time no one came by to gives us menus or to otherwise acknowledge we were even there. Other people were seated after us and were greeted by a server and given menus. It was like we were purposely being ignored. This is my first time here and my last. Avoid this place like the plague. If I could give this place negative stars I would. Go to the IHOP a couple miles away for a real breakfast.

An amazing find off the Las Vegas Strip! Even though they were (understandably) swamped, we were seated quickly, our waitress showed up to take our order promptly, and the food came out before we'd even noticed. Our portions were huge, and they had no problem accommodating my request for avocado with a substantial serving (I would post pictures, but we were too busy devouring our meals). We'll definitely be back!

This place is a great place to get breakfast in Vegas.   Always packed.  Usually a wait no matter what day or time you go.

Locals as well as visitors and tourists keep this place packed.

They do everything great here.  From chicken and waffles to omelettes, benedicts, and pancakes.

Last time I was here I even saw a guy commenting to his waitress how great their taco salad was.

I love a place that is always good everytime I go, consistent with service and food quality.  I think they even sell their own hot sauces now.  

This is a spot I try to hit every time I'm in Vegas.
Excellent food!!!  Great price!!  HUGE portions!!  Thanks Carole Ann for the great service!!!

Breakfast was excellent, I had the avocado omelet. Server Lisa was great checking on how the food was. I think the managers name is Marc, have to give him credit too. Banana bread very moist. good luck getting to SoCal Disneyland

Fabulous Bloody Mary's, and trust me, we are picky with our Mary's! We left a place to come here specifically for the BM. Happy they didn't disappoint! The muffin is delicious, and I'm sure the breakfast will be too.

Delicious food. I had the bacon and avocado omelette. Hella good! Came with potatoes and toast. Bomb. The rest of my party enjoyed their food and we walked away full. Good price for quality of food. Good service too.

Went here because of the great reviews, and was not disappointed. Long line out front, but surprisingly only waited 15 min for a table. Food was excellent. Lindsey our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Will definitely be back on my next trip!

The Banana Nut Muffin deserves 5 stars on its own.  Its soft, it melts in your mouth and it goes so well with my morning coffee.  Besides the muffin, egg & I is a wonderful breakfast spot because their extensive menu has something for everyone including someone like me who frowns at eggs.  I had their breakfast sundae which is basically some yogurt with granola and fruit and it was just fine.  The wait can be long but it goes fast and the staff is trained to get you in and out of their place in record time.

This place is awesome. I stop by every time I come to Vegas. It's worth the 20 min.  The server was great "Alexis" & manager was took her time to make sure everything was perfect.  I tip my hat to the cooks.  I brought friends here for first time. I'm sure they are coming back.
This place is a a a amazing I had there omelet and muffin omgeee the muffin were the best thing going. Bomb.com loved it I will Def recommend.

This was the second time eating here when I'm in town.   I'm usually in Vegas for work once a year and this spot is on my way to the convention center.  Service is always nice and friendly without being overbearing.  I ordered the Blackened Prime Rib eggs Benedict with the home fries.  The eggs were poached perfectly and the Prime Rib was flavorful.  I love Hollandaise sauce, and while this is not the best out there, it was pretty decent.  The home fries were a little bland, but I do like the touch of adding some red bell peppers and spinach along with the prime rib.  It adds a nice bit of sweetness to the dish.  I'm sure I will be back again next year.

Seemed like a long line when we got there but it moved fast.. Seated, server was helpful and informative and very friendly. She suggested the Santa Cruz Skillet(added grilled jalapenos) and it was perfect. The kids got pancakes and an omelette, both great and the wife had a veggie scramble, which she loved. Will  return next trip to Vegas for sure.
Was a great meal frenz felt the potato were over seasoned but overall it was some great eatz

If someone were to ask me where do you want to go to breakfast, I would always pick this place. The famous Habla Diablo potatoes are amazing. I always ask for food server Genesis. She is very polite, super attentive and has a great personality. They have an egg face on you table and if you need anything just flip it to a frown face and any one of the staff will come help you. I haven't had to use it because Genesis is always checking on us. I highly recommend this as a breakfast hot spot.

Wonderful breakfast - what a gem of a place! Our server Staci was friendly, the banana nut muffin was to die for, and one of the best omlettes I have ever had!  My new breakfast place whenever I visit Vegas!

My husband and I are visiting Vegas for our honeymoon and wanted search out the best breakfast in town -- we found it! Our server, Carol Anne, was almost as sweet as the waffles! If we ever visit Vegas again,  we'll be back to Egg and I.
Classic always hits the spot! I love their home fries and the seasoning is what keeps me coming back for more.

This restaurant is a great place to grab breakfast. The food is excellent.

But the banana-nut muffins are really the ones to talk about. They're delicious! To me, the thing that makes this restaurant so good are the banana-nut muffins. The food is great, big portions, great potatoes on the side, it's a nice place: but the banana-nut muffins are what makes this restaurant one of my top favorites. Honestly, I'd love to go back there again, just for the muffins.

All in all, this place is amazing! The food was great and there wasn't even a wait. Next time I come back to Vegas, I'm sure I will come back.

Oh, and did I mention that the banana-nut muffins are phenomenal?

The Egg and I may look like just another run-down, strip mall diner from the outside, but when you step inside, you're greeted with a breakfast oasis in a sea of Vegas locals. This place has just about anything you could think of for hot breakfast, (except oatmeal) and some items you would never dream of.

The newspaper-style menu is a breakfast gazette of headlines - like carrot cake French toast, pork carnitas burritos, and just about every type of omelet and pancake you could ever imagine.

Liza was our fabulous hostess on our dining journey. This woman is the epitome of a multi-tasker, buzzing around and paying attention to every little detail, from the quality of our food to the assurance our glasses remained full... and even the fact that I was rubbing my arms and she instantly picked up that I was cold and turned the air conditioner up a few degrees, without me asking. 
This woman is amazing at customer service! 

All of our food came out together (for seven people) and it was all piping hot! We were never left unattended and were quite entertained at how Liza perfectly orchestrated her tables (including our own).

Some of the dishes at our table included:
* Stuffed French toast - like a deconstructed monte cristo with bacon; delicious!
* Vegetarian crepe - filled with veggie goodness.; so fresh and so clean-clean.
* The Classic - hot scrambled eggs, toast and ham - American style.
* Pork carnitas burrito - mexitastic pork in a verde sauce wrapped in a soft flour tortilla; to die for.
* Egg whites and short stack of buckwheat pancakes - both cooked with no oil...  I was trying to watch my caloric intake, and The Egg and I was happy to accommodate me.

It's a bit of a drive from the strip, but so worth it! Bring your clan and ask for Liza!

I love this spot. It is one of my top 10. I can eat break fast all day. I love there potatoes. I usually get a skillet with meat and potatoes. Perfect hang over food, for me any way. Only thing I don't like is this place is always packed. Many locals know about this place. I haven't ate inside yet, I always order over the phone, and pick it up. It stays busy for a reason.
Good Brunch place... Crepes Omelettes pan cakes are really good, moist and traditional American. Family owned place.
Our server Karen was fantastic. Very helpful with our order and service was quick. The prime rib eggs Benny was delicious !

I order a half order of the bacon onion skillet, It was very good, and the right amount of food for me, orange juice was fresh, although they forgot my order of toast. Overall a good breakfast experience.
Everything was so tasty and the portions are huge. Say yes to the banana nut muffin. Sunrise mountain was the best meal at the table. Worth the wait!
She flipped my egg back to happy when I put it on sad but that's okay. The classic is pretty good but I wouldn't get the meat since 2$ for bacon isn't really worth it.

Omg this place this delicious! Had the bacon and avocado omelet and it was Huge, they definitely don't skimp on the avocado either.  Service was fast and meal was amazing, waitress Chance was attentive and brought everything quickly. I will be eating here every time I'm in Vegas from now on!

Good food off the strip!! "Normal" prices.... not Vegas strip prices. Definitely worth the Uber drive there!! Friendly waiter. Quality of food was great. HUGE selection. Would definitely go back. The actual facility needed a little sprucing up tho.

Food was great. There was a 30 min wait, which was expected. Our server Patrick was exceptional, making the experience even better. Our table ordered the blackened prime rib eggs benedict, steak and eggs, and cinnamon french toast. Everything exceeded our expectations, and we even got free banana nut muffins. Before we left he offered coffee and tea to go. I would definitely come back when I'm back in Vegas.

we ventured out from the strip during our weekend in vegas since I LOVE breakfast.  I read the reviews about the corned beef and hash.  I tried that on the "first" day.
: - )
My friend and I went back to the others in our group and I had someone else join me the next day.  I added the blackened prime rib this time and it was great too.  there were a number of items on the menu i really wanted to try.  I can't wait until my next trip to Vegas.  Enjoy!

Visiting from nc for a few days and of course my husband wanted biscuits and gravy. Our food was so good! He got the country Benny and I the corned beef hash. Amazing! The food and service was great!our server ulises was super friendly and the restaurant has a great system to let the servers know when you need something so they are asking you every 5 mins if you need anything. We will definitely be back here!

What an off-strip gem!

Hubby and I stopped in here after a couple of days on the strip and it was just what the doctor ordered. 

Him: Corned beef hash with two eggs over medium and Hablo Diabla "works" potatoes. So freaking delish.

Me: Breakfast burrito sub turkey sausage for bacon (because I'm watching my waist line... *crickets*). Heaven. 

Although everything we had was delicious, what really made a mark was the homemade salsa they served and the Hablo Diabla seasoning they use. So delicious and one of a kind. One of a kind is hard to find these days with so many restaurants out there in competition but these guys really do have something special.

Service was prompt and cheery. 

As we drove away to head back to SD, we promised that the Egg-and-I will be a ritual breakfast spot when we're in town.

We came here because of the reviews and we were absolutely impressed. The reviews speak for itself and there wasn't an empty seat in the place. Don't let the old style mom and pop restaurant scare you away. Amazing home cooked food and top notch wait staff and the prices were right on budget with what you'd want to pay. You have to try it!

The breakfast was very good. Mist dishes were delicious.  Don't order the buckwheat pancakes. They were very dry and blend. My yogurt with fruit and granola was yummy. So were all the homemade muffins. The skillets were very good if you don't watch your cholesterol or count the calories. I would definitely come back

The Egg & I has the freshest eggs you can get at a breakfast restaurant! My scrambled egg whites were fluffy, light, and delicious! Their homemade banana muffins were yummy and their fruit was fresh! The restaurant itself is quaint and adorable. And you can't beat the price (especially if you've spent the weekend shelling out tons of money for food on The Strip!) This place is definitely worth going out of your way for if you're visiting Vegas!

Busy most time in the morning.saturday wait for 20 mins at 9.30.
Now they ask your number and text you when it is your turn.
Breakfast is the KING
4.5 . Got seated immediately for a party of 3 at 12:30 on a Sunday. Awesome service, unlimited coffee, attentive waitress, yummy eggs, warm toast. Exactly what you need for breakfast! I'm a fan!!

I've heard A LOT about Egg & I and in a quest to try different breakfast spots in Vegas my husband and I landed here on a Saturday morning. The place was packed, obviously very popular.

The menu is extensive, quite a few breakfast items to choose from. Obviously eggs are the feature here with a large omelette selection. The place is homey, and they have murals of farm lands all over the walls. 

I decided to get the Mexican Omelette - Chorizo, chiles and onions and cheese, topped with sour cream. Came with a heaping side of potatoes and choice of bread - I got wheat.

Overall I was kind of underwhelmed by the dish. Usually I love chorizo, but for some reason this omelette just did not meld like it should. 

Service was SLOW. Yes, it was busy on a Saturday, but there came a point when my husband looked up and said, "Where's the food?". Never a good sign when you actually start questioning whether or not they put the order in.

They did have a very yummy banana nut muffin, which I highly suggest getting if you come here. AND (as of this writing) if you check in on Yelp, you get one for free!

This is definitely a go-to breakfast spot if you live in the area. But, if you live elsewhere in the valley I am sure you can find a place that is just as good, if not better. I still like Black Bear Diner over Egg & I for breakfast.
Delicious breakfast place just  off the strip. Service was super friendly, food was really good and prices we're reasonable. Definitely check them out if you have the chance!
Food was really good!! Service was really good! Heather was our server!! She was GREAT! This is the Breakfast spot!!

Visited this place because of the great Yelp reviews. I must say that it was definitely worth going to too. Is the wait wasn't too long about 15 minutes they also texted us when our table is ready which was convenient because we were able to check out some of the other shops in the shopping center while we waited.
 I ordered the chicken enchilada omelet and it was beyond delicious very flavorful and the tortilla chips on the top was the icing on the cake! Their hash browns are seasoned so well and you can tell everything was made to order. 
The only reason I did not give it 5 Stars was because it took a long time for us to get water and when we did they only brought one instead of 3 & we also did not have silverware. 
But our waitress was nice the service was good and I have already recommended this place to some of my friends and family.

Wow, what a great place for breakfast! This little mom & pop restaurant that is out of the way from the busy strip and expensive breakfast prices! 
We found this place from one of those Vegas pamphlets they hand out with a 2 for 1 coupon in it. 

And by the looks of all the other reviews, I would say that everyone knows about this place too. It was packed when we showed up. 

I got the corn beef hash with two eggs over easy and their banana nut muffin. The corn beef was fresh and their banana nut muffin was really good! Now I see shy they were famous for them. The ranch potatoes were a little too salty for my taste. They need to tone it down on the salt and then they would be really good but really didn't eat them 
because I felt my blood pressure go through the roof! lol.. 
My BF had the Chicken omelet and he gave me a bite and it was really de-lish especially if you are an avocado freak because there was a ton of avocado stuffed in the omelet. 

The service was really good even for sitting out on the patio. I would definitely go back for breakfast when I come back into town!

The food here is excellent.  Out of town and found this gem using reviews from yelp.  Our waiter on the second day named raul ended up bringing out a different plate from what I had ordered.  It took a few extra minutes for my original ordered plate to come out, but it was so fresh tasting I really enjoyed it.  He felt bad about the whole situation that he gave us a complimentary fresh baked banana bread.  That extra effort to ensure great customer service made my morning.

Karla, was our server and she is top notch!!!  As busy as the place is (Mothers Day) she is frequently checking on us to be sure we are happy. Everything is delicious and we'll all definitely be returning!!!!

The best breakfast place I have ever eaten at.  I love the rancho potatos, biscuits and gravy, and the gigantic blueberry pancakes.  Its amazing how fast the service is.  Even when there is a long line your seated in no more then like 20 minutes.  There is also a 35% military discount!!!

Wow, do they know how to make their eggs right and potatoes right! How did I know about this place sooner? I'm officially making this place my mandatory go-to place for breakfast on the morning I leave Vegas.

Just right out of the strip, Egg & I is a cute, homey place for a hearty breakfast. The menu is in a newspaper form, so you'll feel like you're reading the morning paper while having a cup of coffee! 

EGGS:
We ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine and an Egg Crepe. Both were amazing! The eggs benedict at Egg & I is one of my top favorite!! The Egg Crepe is similar to an omelet but the eggs are cooked crepe style. Both of our dishes came with seasoned potatoes, which were AWESOME!! They were so good that I bought a bottle of their seasoning. They have bottles of the potato seasoning and blackening dust for meats for $6 each.

I some times go here for breakfast. The food is delicious and the service is great, anytime something goes wrong the waitresses try their best to fix it. Just at a flip of the egg that is sitting on the table.  i love their Muffins with coffe....

My husband I had heard of this place and we just had to try it. Very cute interior we went on a Tues afternoon so definitely missed the weekend breakfast rush. Let me tell you this place did not disappoint, food was amazing. I had the wonderful Kay's omelet that had tomato, spinach and feta it was so good. When we are in town again definitely gonna go back!!
My friends and I were in Vegas and looking for a great breakfast spot. I ended up finding this place and must say, AMAZING!! Great service and yummy yummy food... Well worth it.

Amanda was amazing and greatet us with a huge smile. She gave us vegetarian tips and we actually had our best breakfast of our entire vacation! 

Highly recommend. The potatoes was amazing! 5 stars for sure!

Hands down the best meal we ate since leaving Texas. My wife had the Waffle Works with eggs over medium, bacon, and strawberry sauce and whipped cream on her waffle, and I had the Mexican Omelette.  Her waffle was to die for, the sauce was warm, and the whipped cream is homemade and delicious. The eggs were perfect as well.  My omelette was the omelette I've been looking for in my 51 years on this earth! It was absolutely amazing and huge as well! The potatoes are awesome, the coffee is great, and, oh yeah, our waitress Kat, gave us two free banana nut muffins! They were so good, we bought a banana nut loaf to go.  As great as the food was, it didn't hold a candle to Kat! She is very friendly, extremely helpful, and the most efficient waitress I've ever met!  If you ever make it too Vegas, forget the overpriced tourist traps and casino krap and come straight here. If I could give it a hundred stars I would!
Believe the hype. Omelet, pancake, biscuit and gravy, beef dip sandwich all on point. Excellent food all around. Awesome service!

I love all day breakfasts! In fact, I have a hard time going anywhere that has Eggs Benedict and not ordering it. So I tried the Spinach Benny with Canadian bacon (ham) and a side of Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. My husband had The Classic with 2 basted eggs, seasoned potatoes and toast....,they both were good but not egg-ceptional as advertised
They have these eggs that you turn over on the tables if you need service (see photo) which is a cool idea but our server was swamped and really was so far away with other tables that she couldn't take care of us well.
We went to the oldest location and although it was busy, it really could use an update and maybe even a day to shut down and be cleaned from top to bottom.
TIP FOR YELPERS! Check-in online for a free banana nut muffin. They are HUGE and delish!

I ordered the classic. I love the potatoes. The banana nut muffin is delicious. I have it a three star because the wait is way too long. I came in with a party of 5 and we were quoted 20 min and we waiting an hr. I recommend a seating system so that they will be able to know how long the tables have been sat. So they can give an effective wait time.

This place is so tasty and delicious. I got the bacon and advocacy omelette with the seasoned potatoes, a small stack of chocolate chip pancakes and a banana nut muffin. 
The omelette was soft and had a dallop of sour cream which made it taste amazing. The pancakes were good as well, not too overbearing with the chocolate!
Our server Liza, was super nice, and very attentive to us and recommend a choice of combos for us. 
My group and I went twice because of how good it was. Everyone was very pleasant and I'll be back next time I'm in Vegas!
Perfect place to enjoy breakfast! Fair prices and large portions. Try the sundace with turkey bacon, delicious! Friendly and good service by Sayra. I will definitely come back again
Love the egg white omelette from here! Everything is delicious and everyone is extremely nice!  Highly recommended!

Tired of the Strip and hotel fare, we checked Yelp for a breakfast place nearby.  We found great reviews for Egg and I so thought we would give it a try.  We loved it.  It was easy to find and the staff was very welcoming and friendly.  Very professional and efficient. The restaurant was very clean and well cared for.  The food choices were all very tempting and our server, Karla, was very helpful, even recommending an egg breakfast for my husband that included everything he wanted for a better price than what he was going to order.  I had the Southwestern Cobb salad and it was delicious....very fresh and the chicken was hot off the grill! The banana muffin that came with my salad was yummy.  Lots of variety on the menu....but since I am not an egg lover I was glad there were plenty of choices that didn't focus on eggs.  We would highly recommend this place and will definitely come again on our next visit to Vegas.  Karla is the kind of server you love to have...she's friendly, efficient, knows the menu, is really helpful and gives you the perfect amount of attention while dining. Great start to our day all around!
Food was great. Service was not so good. Got my food well after everyone else at my table. I would def go back tho for the breakfast

I wanted to try something new for breakfast. I had no idea where to go or what to eat. I came to Yelp like I normally do. Mostly everyone had something positive to say about this place, so my friend and I packed up and headed 15 minutes away to get some good breakfast.

When we arrived, we could tell that it was going to be a long wait and a headache. I sent my friend in, ahead of me, so that I could park. As soon as she walked in, she called me. She said that the place was a mess and she was going to have to come out and wait the 15 minutes it was going to take to be seated. Nevertheless, the hostess pointed out some empty benches, around the corner. So, I walked in to wait.

Upon entering, I was discouraged because a lot of people were standing around waiting. I just knew it was going to take 30+ minutes. Surprisingly, it only took 15 minutes before we were called and seated.

The place is really small and packed to capacity, so I was thankful that we got to sit around the corner where there were only about 4-5 tables. We had plenty space.

The server came around fast to take our drink order. She was quick to bring our drinks back too. She asked us if we were ready to order and we said, "No, we're looking at Yelp pictures and we need some more time." I did ask about the stuff French Toast dish that someone shared on Yelp. She smiled and pointed it out and said that it's a popular dish. Then she left and took orders for people that was around us.

As soon as she walked away, we decided what we wanted, but it took her about 6 minutes to make eye contact again. When she did stop back by, she asked if we were still looking at pictures or if we were ready to order. We went ahead and ordered. It totally slipped my mind to check in and get a free muffin for myself. The waitress said, "You were on Yelp, did you check in to get the free muffin?" I was happy she reminded me to do that.

She came back a couple minutes later and brought 2 muffins. I don't even like banana nut muffins but I took it anyways because it was free. I took a bite of it and fell in love. It was so warm and yummy lol. My friend got emotional lol. She said it reminded her of childhood, when her mother used to make them. They were just delicious.

About 12-15 minutes later, our food started to roll out. I order the Stuffed French Toast with eggs, cheese and sausage on it. It also came with seasoned potatoes. It looked incredible. My friend ordered the 2 pork chops that came with 2 eggs, the muffin, that she had already ate, and the seasoned potatoes. Her's looked delicious too.

I LOVE potatoes so I ate those first. I put ketchup all over them and had a ball. My friend didn't like hers, because they were kind of crunchy, so she gave them to me. I put ketchup on them and finished them off too lol.

Next, I started in on my French Toast sandwiches. I didn't like the sandwiches. The sausages, eggs and cheese didn't have much flavor. I thought I made a big mistake. Being that I'm so smart, I thought to scrape the sausages and eggs off the French toast and season the filling myself. I did, and it was 90% better. I ate the filling separately, and ever so often, I would dip the French Toast in the warm syrup that came with my food.

My friend said that the pork chops were Just okay. They were really thin, for sure. I don't know why, but we were expecting some big juicy chops vs the breakfast chops. I wanted to taste the chops for myself, so she took a bite of mine and I took a bite of hers. They tasted as if onions were the main and secondary seasoning. She was right. They were just okay. She did enjoy my mixture of filling and seasoning though.

The good thing is, we got really full and still had a bunch of food left. I'm sure it has something to do with a humongous portion of potatoes we got and the muffin we were served in the beginning.

The service was like a 3\/5 because there was a little piece of hair in my water when the server dropped it off. I asked for another one and she just stared at my full cup for like 10 seconds. I guess she couldn't understand my reason behind needing another one. I didn't even mention it because it wasn't a big deal and I didn't want anyone to make a big deal over water.

But also, I took some points off service, because it took my sever a long time to refill my water, once I had actually finished it. It took her maybe 4 or 5 minutes to check on us, after we finished eating too. We just wanted a box to pack up leftovers. When she did stop back by, we asked for the box, she quickly picked one up, dropped it off and walked away. She came back around maybe 3 or 4 minutes later and told us to pay upfront. We were just sitting there, waiting for her to come back by so that we could pay and leave. I'm glad she did stop back by because we probably would have been sitting there for a while.

Although I'm in love with the potatoes and muffins, I probably won't go back because the rest of the food was just average.
Awesome food. The banana nut muffins are great. Have not had a bad meal here yet. Highly recommended.

Wow what a amazing place. Food great big portion and prices are fabulous . Clean \/fast. The wait time wasn't that bad , would have waited a hour if it needed to be , it was that good  !!!
Get the muffin the best !!everyone is so happy , I would think they are all family , not a sad face around , not one server complained about anyone , we sat right by the kitchen , but they could have a complain spot in the back , lol, that we don't know about ..
Our sever Amanda was so helpful , are glass of drinks filled  constantly, food brought out with a smile , very pleasant when taking our orders , Amanda joke with us , and she was busy , took the time to be helpful , thank you !! coming in from AZ , we should have hit this place from the first day , to bad we are leaving .next time here first ,to start our day off right .
Head over fast, wish had more stars because that's what they should get 10  of 10
Good service. Small pancakes were ginormous!  Little egg signs on the table to notify the server.

Will probably come back whenever I'm in Vegas! When my best friend and I went, the line wasn't too bad for a Sunday morning. Waited for 15 min. 

It was totally worth it. We shared the Hawaiian French toast works (which is like the waffle works but with French toast, secret menu). The portions here are huge so I'm happy we shared. It was yummy and I really like the compote that it came with. 

Don't forget to check in for the free banana nut muffin! We were so stuffed that we took those bad boys to go!

I ate breakfast at the Egg & I on Sahara in Las Vegas, NV on 11\/23\/2014.  I was my 1st time there.  There were seven of us.  Everyone had something different.  I had their western omelette.  This place is connected with Egg Works and has the same menu.  Plus, I took photos.

Best breakfast potatoes I have ever consumed in my life. The salty diablo seasoning (not spicy) is amazing and the potatoes are always perfectly cooked. While this may seem to be a rather strange thing to rate, a lot of breakfast places overlook the breakfast potatoes, even though half your plate comprises of these carbs.

The other breakfast foods are solid. I got the eggs Benedict and they drowned it in hollandaise sauce. I hate it when places drizzle that delicious egg butter concoction and am so glad to have found a place that isn't afraid of it. My husband always gets the typical egg sausage breakfast and he is always happy because in all honesty, he really comes out for those potatoes.

I've also had a few of the spicy omelettes and they have all been amazing. I watched my brother in law devour a four egg omelette. He ate through the pain because even though it's rather large, it was so delicious that leaving any behind would have been a crime. 

Check in for a free banana muffin that's warm and goes to wonderfully with a cup of coffee.

Also, it's always busy here, even though it's a bit off the strip and the middle of the week. It doesn't matter, it's worth the trek

After weeks of passing it up saying "we really need to go there soon", we FINALLY took the plunge and stopped in for breakfast. I have no idea why we waited so long... It was one of the most enjoyable breakfasts I have had in a LONG time. 

I sort of built my own eggs Benedict and was pleasantly surprised by the hollandaise sauce that came with it! The hash brown patties were perfectly crisp (side order) and the coffee was quality. 

Great "default" breakfast\/brunch place! Very casual demeanor and the staff is SO pleasant. Our server was Amanda; she was great! Will definitely be going back soon for breakfast, and will more than likely stop in for lunch!

This place is great. Big portions worth the price. We loved the banana muffin (I think there's a Yelp check-in for it). We shared half a chicken salad with a side of chili and the country fried steak. The bbq chicken salad was great and I'd recommend if you are trying to eat light(er). The chili was ok-- I think I've had better. Finally, the fried steak was the star. It's everything you'd expect and it's cooked right. We'd definitely get this one again!

We live in California and have been here 4-5 times over the course of several years. The reason for my 5 star review is that I'm at a loss to come up with a single negative. Every server has been 100% on top of it. We (myself, wife and two kids) have raved about every entree. The prices are low for strip-area Las Vegas dining. The ambiance is more mid-west USA than Las Vegas but I have no issue with that.

I'm not one to freely give out 5 star reviews but the Egg and I has earned one.

I always eat here when I am in Vegas. The food is always fresh and they have a huge menu. If you can't find something on the menu you like, you really have something wrong with you.  I've never had a bad breakfast however I have had a few service snafus but they were easily corrected.  Not far from the strip and well worth the effort.

Had a wonderful breakfast here! Karla was an excellent server- very friendly and hospitable. We checked in on Yelp and got free banana muffins. The muffins were so delicious! I had the mashed potato omelette and it was very good! You can also substitute fruit for any of the other sides if you want a lighter option. I would highly recommend coming here! The line was out the door at 11:30 on a Friday but for two of us it only took 15 min to get seated out on the patio.

Best breakfast\/brunch spot in Vegas hands down! I wanted to buy a chain for VA. Everything taste fresh and homemade. Food was amazing, none greasy, nice portions, and great friendly atmosphere! I will visit every time I come the Vegas!!!

Never in my life have I polished clean an entire breakfast of steak, eggs, 4 pieces of toast, and hash browns!  The food here is absolutely delicious.  The service is extremely friendly.  Our coffee was lukewarm and they immediately brought out a fresh pot and continued to apologize when I didn't think it was a big deal.  No charge for substituting hash brown patties for potatoes.  Perfectly cooked sunny side up eggs.  delicious, buttery toast.  I have no complaints about this place!  It's just awesome!

We are visiting Las Vegas from Boston and this was an amazing brunch meal for our first day here. We decided to check this place out after reading the glowing reviews on Yelp, and we were not disappointed.

We arrived around 10:15am on a Sunday and the place was packed! There was a line outside the door of people waiting. However, the wait was quite fast and our party of 6 was seated in about 20 min. The service was excellent - our waitress Alexa was super friendly and took our complicated drink and food orders with ease. Any one with a Yelp account can also check in to receive a free banana nut muffin, which was huge, warm, and full of banana flavor. It was one of the best banana nut muffins I have tasted. In addition, coffee comes with unlimited refills! 

Our table ordered:
Bacon and sliced avocado omelette ($11.25): excellent. The omelette was huge and stuffed with ample chunks of whole avocado, bacon bits, and topped with a generous amount of melted Jack cheese and a dollop of sour cream. There was also a side of buttered toast and a choice of home fries, cottage cheese, or fruit (I think this is offered with any egg dish). Delicious, and a large portion size for one person. 
Heart stopper skillet special ($10.25): this was my favorite dish that our table ordered. It was one of the specials and consisted of a layer of works potatoes topped with bacon, ham, and sausage and smothered in homemade country style gravy and two sunny-side up eggs. The gravy and the runny egg yolks mixed with the potatoes and meat created a delicious creamy explosion of flavor and umami. 
Southwestern Cobb salad ($10.50): a huge salad with a ton of toppings. I was impressed that there was very little lettuce, and instead a lot of delicious toppings such as taco seasoned chicken, black bean and corn relish, tomatoes, black olives, bacon, cheddar cheese, tortilla strips, and a whole sliced avocado (amazing!) with chipotle ranch dressing. 
Sundance special omelette ($11.25): veggie omelette with spinach, mushrooms, artichoke hearts and Swiss cheese topped with tomatoes and feta cheese. You can also add chicken for an extra $2.50. The feta cheese melded perfectly with the creamy egg flavor and the various vegetables. 

Overall, I highly recommend this place for brunch. Service was super friendly and efficient, and the food is great value for the portion size and the price!

This is definitely the best place for breakfast.  Lots of locals here so you know it's good.   Very good prices,  and great food,  but the best service of anyplace in Vegas.   Tried the bloody Mary, excellent! !!

Breeanda, is a wonderful and the most ever best waitress I ever seen and met in a long time here in Las Vegas. This was my first time in the egg and I and well I have to say, the service was so amazing that Disneyland should have an egg and I too! My and I ordered the Hoele Loco. Let me tell you something it was Delicious and Tropical and FULL OF AWESOMENESS! !!!! Felt like Hawaii came to my mouth and give it a big kiss!!!! The dish is $9.25 and hey you get eggs and a hamburger patty on top of rice and toast and a pineapple.... what kind of deal is that. .... great huh? Just a reminder the portion are HUGE!!!! So, come over with a BIG APPETITE to the EGG AND I! !!!! Take it from me,  you will not be disappointed!

This is a cute little place with nice people here.  We didn't order much and we got it to go.  They are only open until 3pm for breakfast and lunch.  We came around 1pm during the week and it seemed like there was a long wait to be seated.
Corner breakfast shop with a family atmosphere and very welcoming staff. Our server was always attentive and made the experience exceptional! Will come back again:)
Good American breakfast. Order the banana nut muffin. Big portions

This place is a must stop every time I go to Vegas.  I go to Vegas at least once a year, more if I can and anyone who goes with me know that we will go here.  It is still pretty busy in the late morning even if it is off the strip, but if you go early (cause you're still on E. Coast time), or later, it isn't so bad.  
At home we have a place with this name, but it is NOT the same place.  This place is epic good.  My favorites are the Chicken Enchilada Omelet, the Strawberry Stuffed French toast, the banana nut French toast, and the banana nut muffin here is out of this world.  
After a 2008 trip to Hawaii I became obsessed with Hawaiian breakfast and they have both your traditional breakfast of eggs, rice and spam or Portuguese sausage, but they also have loco moco!  If you've never had loco moco it is crazy good.  Rice, steak, and eggs with gravy dumped on top.  Yummy!
Awesome service, Chance rocked it! Get the skillet if you're hungry.  Keep up the good work guys!

We have been enjoying breakfast here for many years.   It's always delicious, and the staff are always friendly and accommodating.  We always bring out out-of-town guests here, and they love the food.

Soooo good! One of the best breakfast places I've had. We were sat right away under the misters on the patio which was nice. Our server was awesome- attentive and friendly. The food was amazing- banana nut muffin, chile rellano omelette and the skillet country fried steak (they layer gravy on top of the steak, eggs and cheese on top of the gravy in one skillet). This might have been the highlight of my Vegas trip!

First time here the food was fantastic. Busy but the wait wasn't long, it's run very efficiently. Karla was our waitress and was fantastic! We will definitely be coming back on our next trip to Vegas!

I was not impressed with this place at all. Coffee wasn't great, but drinkable (similar to hotel lobby coffee). My pancake was not very fluffy, too dense. I ordered it with fresh strawberries which were cooked into it, but I would have preferred them raw on top. My boyfriend's skillet (the one with sausage and ham) was ok and was probably the best thing I tried there. His mother's bacon and cheese omelette was not very good and she ate less than half. The bacon they use for omlettes is the same stuff Taco Bell does... shredded little bits that tastes like some kind of pork, just not bacon. Her friend's bacon strips were extremely overcooked, dark brown and crunchy vs. crispy. The homefries were terrible. Just potatoes with A LOT of some kind of cajun seasoning all over. I thought homefries were supposed to be seasoned with salt, pepper, onions and green peppers... The one good thing about this place was the wait time. 10 minutes for a party of four on a Sunday morning.

A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!! And we haven't even gotten to our food!!!! The banana nut muffin is EVERYTHING!!!! We also just got our food. Paula said everything on the menu is good and we just ordered 5 different plates and none disappoint!!!! Best way to start off our Vegas weekend!!!!! Paula is super awesome and so are all the staff!!! Ordering a loaf of banana bread for my toddler YUMMY YUMMY!!!! Thank you Egg & I

The best breakfast spot in Vegas,  super affordable food and really good food. You get way more than what you pay for and our server Raul was amazing very attentive and helpful, this place is lucky to have a server as good as Raul.

Great little find away from the Strip! We had a large group and they sat us on the patio. Our waiter was very attentive and helpful in us deciding what to order from the vast menu. Everyone was happy with their choices.
Biscuits and Gravy were on point! Tabatha was an awesome waitress with a great laugh and smile. Eat here you won't regret it!

Love egg and i\/egg works! Came today with my sister for lunch and ordered the spinach Benny and she ordered the breakfast burrito. Didn't realize our orders didn't include my favorite banana nut muffin! I have been craving it since the last time I ate here =P. Asked our server, Alyssa, and she said those meals don't include it but she was going to throw some in for us on her. Wow! That is what I call going above and beyond in terms of service! Will continue coming here forever!

I was immediately sat down by the host. This restaurant normally is very busy and wait times can be up to 30 minutes but it is well worth the wait! My dining experience was nothing short of amazing by Perry. He was very patient and willing to help me choose the best plate on the menu that suited me. I chose to go with The Classic. First, Perry brought me out this FRESHLY BAKED, OUT OF THE OVEN Banana Nut Muffin. By far, the best muffin you could taste at such a great establishment. Also the entree plate was huge when Perry brought it out to me. I ate every bite and Perry smiled at me asking if I enjoyed my meal.

If you have read this far, hopefully you are waiting for your food. You won't be disappointed!
Great place, free banana nut muffin with breakfast for first timers! I got the western and wife got the stuffed French toast! Yum! Staff was very down to earth and welcoming!
This place was awesome for breakfast.  I'd go back to this restaurant.  Service was eggscellent!!!  Food awesome.

The place was full. The waiting line was out of the door but even as we we're told the waiting was going to be 20-25min long we didn't wait that much. At first we were greeted by Carlos who brought our coffee which was hot and delicious. Then our waitress, Paula went over the menu with us and recommended some dishes. We ended up with Sundance omelette that was delicious. My sister had the corned beef hash that was freshly made and tasty. The banana nut muffin was also good so you should totally get it. I got toast but it was just standard store bought sliced bread so definitely go with the muffin. Overall was a great breakfast. We will come back next time we are in Las Vegas.

Lisa was fantastic! Everything about this place is fantastic. 

Service

Attentive quick. Within fave minutes drink was served and with in ten food is served. Just right amount of check ups and right after we finished the bill and Togo box is served. 

Good

Ordered the works omelette and beef hash, with muffins and potatoes as sides. The banana muffins are simply amazing. I'm not a big fan of baked goods but the muffins are something else. 

The potatoes tastes like squared fries and delightfully crispy. The actual omelette and the beef hash are tasty with just the right amount of seasoning. 

Did I mention bottomless coffee? Omg this place have everything! This will be my new favorite spot when I come to Vegas

I've been to this location before but I have to praise this past experience. 

Oscar, our server, was phenomenal! He was so friendly and attentive. It wasn't just us either. We noticed he gave consistently excellent service to everyone! He was a real star. 

The food is always top notch! The Sundance Omelette with blackened chicken and egg white was incredible! I ordered a side of fruit instead of potatoes or bread and the fruit was so fresh. Definitely a great breakfast before the gym!

This restaurant has great food. I had the New York steak and eggs with their special potatoes. It was great and I also enjoyed the banana nut muffin. Will definitely stop in again next time I'm  in Vegas. Our server Ashley did a great job.

My husband and I didn't realize how far this place was from the Strip. A little too expensive of a fare for breakfast! HOWEVER, this place is super yummy. We did have a wait for about 40 minutes upon arrival as well. A local favorite. Combine tourists like us with locals, you got a busy place! Look in the 24\/7 guide for a buy 1, get 1 entree free coupon. The banana nut muffin is served warm and is a must eat. We both got omelets - love the unique variety! The homestyle potatoes are super tasty and you get a generous portion. Fresh squeezed orange juice - a plus! The little black\/yellow egg flipper as a service indicator is fun and helpful. Within seconds of flipping it to the black egg (meaning we needed service) the MANAGER was over at our table asking what we needed and joking with us. Everyone here is friendly, upbeat and happy you stopped in. Good place, good people. Go.

I would say this place was pretty good! We waited about 10 minutes for any service once seated at our table. The place was packed and it was 1 p.m. on a Monday!  The average breakfast is about 10 bucks and 3 more for coffee. I would say sharing is a must!!! The omelets were super cheesy but tasty. The Cajun potatoes are awkwardly addicting. At first bite they taste over seasoned with cajun powder but by the end of it you will wish you had more. The banana nut muffin comes with your entree or free check in on foursquare. It's definitely not the best muffin int he world like others claim, but it is tasty. However, eat it hot or it might taste dry. And eat it with the butter then its perfection. Overall with sharing, free extra muffin, and two iced coffees and tip it was 23 dollars. Don't know if I will be back as there is too many other places to try.

Great service. Big portions. My friend had the stuffed French toast and I had the mash potato omelette. They're home fries are so good. Seasoned well. And muffin was so moist. Can't go wrong. I went on a Thursday around noon so no wait time.

The service here is amazing. Everyone is SO nice! The food was delicious and very fairly priced. I couldn't be more happy with my experience! The banana nut muffins are delicious-- and this is coming from a person who likes neither bananas nor nuts. I definitely will come back again.
Great French toast. Overall awesome experience the food was exceptional and the service is on point. Uli was our server and he made sure we were pleased.  btw nice booty Uli.

Favorite breakfast place ever!!!  Served by the AWESOME waiter BRADY wearing Viking's jersey, always following up with his customers, way to go. Checking in on yelp got an extra all time favorite banana nut muffin, yummy... Chicken  fried steak skillet & the works omelette to complete  the meal. Generous servings!!!

A new Must when visiting Las Vegas!! 
The food was absolutely delicious!! And the portions were extremely generous. The staff was very friendly and very attentive. Our server Earl made sure we were well taken care of as well as Carole Ann. Definitely coming back!

Eggs & I is a popular brunch spot for locals in Las Vegas.  We had to drop by the airport and chose Eggs & I as our go-to food spot afterwards.

The menu consists of a variety of eggs benedict dishes, omelettes, hash, and other breakfast items.

Service is homey and the vibe is definitely casual here.  The menu comes out printed on newspaper stock so perhaps their items change frequently.

We started out with their signature banana nut muffin which accompanies many of their dishes.  Light, soft, fluffy, and not too sweet, the banana nut bread was a hit and a great starter.

Our entrees included a mish-mash of their popular dishes:

Prime Rib Benny (or Benedict) - the highlight dish entree was an Eggs Benedict version made up of prime rib.  It replaces the traditional muffin with a croissant and is definitely a large portion so was plenty to share.

Florentine Benedict - a version made with spinach and ham.  Pretty good.

Chicken Fried steak - I only had a few bites, but I liked it.  It's a calorie killer though.

Kay's Omelette - another signatuer omelette, it had plentiful cheese, ham, and egg.  Kinda plain and not sure why this is so popular.  You could make similar omelettes at home.

Brad's Chili - wasn't sure which chili to order and was recommended this one.  It came out lukewarm, had a bland flavor and was generally forgetabble. 

Eggs & I is a decent brunch spot, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go here.  They take credit cards, including American Express.

Such a great place! We ate the haole loco which was sticky rice, ground beef patty that was juicy and big with an over easy egg with gravy! We also had a delicious Banana French toast! Our server Carole Ann was sweet and funny!!
Amazing and great food!!!!!! Stuffed French Toast a MUST!!!!!!!!! Wow came here from Hawaii this morning and an amazing way to start my Vegas trip!!!!!
Have no idea what people are talking about or hit it on an extremely awesome day. Disappointing. Ordered the huevos rancheros which was basically chili slopped on a tortilla.

Went here for brunch on a Saturday and this place was packed! We waited for 25 minutes for a party of 2 which wasn't really that bad of a wait but we were really hungry by the time we got a table. I got the works skillet with a banana muffin (I swear, best banana muffin I've ever had!), my bf got the mashed potato omelette with 4 pieces of toast on the side, and we also got an additional order of waffles with whipped cream! 

The works skillet comes with works potatoes, bacon, sausage and ham, then topped with eggs (any style) and gooey cheese! So good and very very filling. The mashed potato omelette also comes with the works potatoes on the side. Seriously, the omelette is huge (4 eggs!)! It's filled with bacon and garlic mashed potatoes then topped with cheese and sour cream. The waffles are just okay, plain but tasty. We definitely enjoyed our meal!

Service was fast and excellent considering they were so busy that day. Our waiter is a pleasant guy and he's very efficient. 

Our order came up to 35 bucks. Pretty reasonable since portions are huge, coffee is bottomless, and food is really good! Definitely coming back next time I'm in Vegas!

Never in my life have I ever eaten a banana nut muffin that made me want to kill a unicorn so that it may get a leg up in the race of All Things Magical.

Godspeed, oh glorious muffin!
Great food! Excellent service! Linnea was so helpful with the menu and made sure our whole dining experience went well.

Yay Egg! Glad I asked Mary W. for breakfast recommendations before the trip. When I got here there was already a line but the wait wasn't too bad, perhaps about 15-20 minutes. They have a cute menu that looks like a newspaper and a huge menu to choose from.
We ordered a corn beef hash and eggs benedict. Do me a favor and order yourself a corn beef hash if you go there, it's pretty darn delicious. The eggs benedict was alright, way too much hollandaise sauce, I wish they'd go easy on that. I do love the breakfast potatoes. Our waitress didn't take care of us too well but the other staff were nice and helpful. Serving was so big we didn't eat lunch that day.

Went to the egg and I for breakfast this morning wow is all I can say I have the stuffed French toast with strawberries and cream Yum also I got the muffin for checking in on yelp that was the best dog on muffin I ever had in my life very light and delicious also got the bacon and eggs along with the very good my server Amanda all I can say is awesome she was the best server ever...whenever you're in Vegas you need to stop at the egg and I just saying.

My omelet was so good! Make sure to try the hash brown potatoes the seasoning is bomb! Me and my husband found our new favorite breakfast place in Vegas. Our server Patrick was awesome! Thanks for the great service!

his place has redeemed itself. 

I was lucky to be seated right away since I was there all alone. My waitress Amanda was there immediately to see if I had any questions and to take my drink order. She has a warm smile and made me feel very welcome. I ordered the Texas toast French toast with eggs and bacon. It was delicious. I also ordered a side of toast for which she asked if I wanted it buttered which usually they don't so that was great. The eggs were perfectly over medium and they were actually seasoned. Amanda was very attentive and was sure that I was not in need of anything. I also had the banana nut muffin it was one of the best I've had in a restaurant, I am a bit partial to my own.

I will say the service through out was exceptional from the moment I walked in until I left even thought the register had trouble reading the card I had. 

The food would definitely be worth the wait, and the service I experienced was above expectations for how busy the are. Give it a try if you haven't been

My hubby and I are huge breakfast people!
Has the eggs benny and juevos ranchero with carnitas at the suggestion of our server Manuela.
She gave us fantastic service and was amazing!
Would definitely come back next time we're in town.

Went to this place today after seeing that this place had over 1000 reviews in yelp...was not disappointed. The ambience of this restaurant is very good..staff is friendly... The freshly made banana nut muffin was awesome!!!!. The waitress at my table was Chance and had provided excellent service...i did not find any reason to give this business less than 5 stars.

From the outside (& inside) it looks like a typical diner type restaurant BUT dine here you'll soon notice the difference. 

First, the staff is great, always warm & welcoming. Second, they have a system in place so you never have to wait longer than a couple seconds for anything (whether it's more water, ketchup, your order).

The food is really good!! I've never tried anything I didn't like here and they're consistently good! Their coffee is my absolute favorite coffee, it's rich and full of flavor. 

My favorite items:

- Their skillets are really good, esp. The bacon & onion one.

- Avocado bacon & cheese omlette

- Banana bread french toast

- Pancakes

It's a great place for a fuss free brunch, sweatpants and hangover included.

Best Hawaiian burger steak in vegas! Loco moco is what you need to order in here! and the freaking spam! I don't not know but when they cook the spam it's so good!  They have the free banana muffin yo! so good!! very good service and very fast!  5 star!!!

This is by far my favorite place to have breakfast and now lunch in Vegas. Their banana nut bread\/ muffin is amazing!! The best! Very moist and nutty.

This was my first time ordering off the lunch menu and I got the Cinci Chili Burger.  It was delicious!  Great tasty chili with the Ranch Potatoes on the side.  Comes in an open bun with a large pickle, lettuce, and tomatoes.   I was very satifised with it.  

Usually the service is pretty good and friendly except when they're super busy.  Then it gets a little quick and snappy.  But overall, I definitely look forward to coming here whenever I go to Vegas.  And if you like the muffin, definitely buy a loaf to go and put it in the fridge.  It lasts for a while in there and its always moist and soft.
Amazing! The food was great and the service was awesome! Banana nut muffins!!!! It seems they get really busy Friday-Sunday so make sure you give yourself enough time. I will for sure be going back!

I had a Sunday morning breakfast at the egg and I yesterday.  The place was super busy, and the hostess wrote my name down as milassa (it's Melissa) and when I told her it Was spelled Melissa,  she said "we'll figure it out" thankfully,  our server,  Kelcey was awesome!!!   She made sure to do her quality check, even though she had several other tables to take care of,  and when I had an avacado issue,  she took care of it and the manager stopped by the table to make sure everything was okay.  The only thing that I was displeased about was that this one location does not serve bloody Mary's (the other 5 do) or any alcohol in general.  I was seriously looking forward to a bloody with my eggs benny.

This place was great for breakfast\/brunch. Similar to a place like Black Bear Diner except excellent customer service and little bit better food. But the feel of the restaurant was very similar. Our server was very attentive. We ordered the Sundance Omlette and the Traditional Benny and added avocado. 

I thought everything was fine, the only reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is because there is nothing special about it. Just another breakfast place. However, I do love that it is family-owned and has multiple locations around the city. I don't regret stopping by. Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day!

Me and my girl were in Vegas and as usual Yelp really came through. This place has really good breakfast at a very reasonable price. The potatoes were some of the best I've ever tasted. The seasoning they put on them is the bomb! We also tried the spinach mushroom omelet and the chicken tortilla soup. The only complaint was that the soup was way too salty but the omelet was worth the drive out.

This place is a breakfast gem.  Located a few minutes away from the strip.   They serve all American breakfast and a few Hawaiian breakfast in their menu.   We had their huevos rancheros (no meat), plain pancakes, corner beef hash with a side of rice.  They were all delish.  The cool thing about this place is that you get a moist banana nut muffin with Yelp
Check in. 

I will definitely go back for more breakfast goodness the next time I visit Vegas.
This is one of my favorite breakfast spots ever! Seating is fast, service is excellent and plenty of options for people of all culinary persuasions! Raul was a great and attentive server!
Horrible experience. Bacon...cold and old.  Pancakes dense and hard.  Potatoes deep fried and extremely salty. Please go somewhere else. Their food is NOT good.

If in Vegas you have to come here for breakfast! Had the French toast and enchilada omelet! Service, family environment, and food where amazing! Liza was great and all the  staff here were super welcoming! Can't say enough great things! Definitely bringing the family here again. And a generous military discount.

Massive portions, pretty good and unique menu options.  Not too far off the strip but far enough that you don't need to worry about parking or massive crowds.  There was a 15 minute wait on a Monday morning.  Good place to go after a night out in vegas.  Make sure you check in to get a free banana muffin - so good!! served warm.

Grrreat food!!!!
A trip to Vegas is not complete with out The Egg and I. 
Get there early they close by 3pm on most days

Great service.  Huge portions.  Please ask for Amanda.  She is a great server; attended to my table with her professional service.  I will definitely ask for her everything.  U will not be disappointed.

I had the country Benny and it was awesome. Hubby had the piggy skillet and he said "lets add this place to our list of good breakfast." We will be back. We didn't realize they closed at 3p and got in about 2:50. They were nice and didn't rush us even through we were obviously keeping them open. I'm so glad we found this place.
The place is okay. The potatoes are way over-seasoned...ruined them. Guess I should be glad, saved me calories.
It's ok but expensive for what it is.  Food is good. Service is great.  Had better breakfast off the strip.
This place is awesome. The food and service are great. Whatever you do,  pick the banana nut muffin.  It's incredible!!!

The food was great and the service was excellent! Definitely coming back when we are in Vegas. 

We got the Santa Fe Skillet & the Stuffed Strawberry and cream cheese French toast 

The banana muffin is soooooooo gooood!! Amazing!

I hate to do it, but i need to knock this down just one star. Every time I'm here, while the service is great and friendly, the place is just packed and I find the breakfast to be lackluster, compared to Egg Works.

The seating is pretty crammed, even when you get there early. We're often bumped by servers and patrons as they're making their way to tables.

I also don't love how they *only* have those season-salty potatoes and not fresh hashbrowns. They have them, but only those frozen hashbrown patties. Meh. I like homestyle potatoes, but these really seem like they're dumped out of an Ore-Ida bag.

The last time we went, I asked for my poached eggs well in my eggs benedict and they came back *very* runny both times. I can handle a little runny, but these were like, runny to the point of being almost chilly inside the yolk.  It's a texture thing and it skeeves me. I know I'm not the only one. 

They were really great when I sent it back the first time, but the second time, I felt like a total pain in the ass and was embarrassed having to ask them to redo it, even though it wasn't my fault. They were gracious and took it off our bill and the 2nd time they made it, the eggs were cooked well enough. (Yes, we tipped on the full cost of the bill.) 

I also am not wild about how they completely drown their eggs benedict in hollandaise to the point you can't even see the bottom and the english muffin gets really soggy. 

My boyfriend's blueberry pancakes weren't that awesome either.  Kind of spongey and flavorless.

For the hype this location gets, it wouldn't be my first choice. But I know it's popular and beloved, so if someone else wanted to go, I'd go, but otherwise, I'd recommend one of their other locations.

If you are ever in Vegas, you gotta try this restaurant out! They are only open for breakfast & lunch. Excellent value, fast & friendly service with
a big smile! I wanted to try everthing but couldn't this trip. Even if you can"t eat eggs there are alot of options. Can't wait to go back! 
Thank you Rachel Ray for the recommendation!

Went here with some friends last weekend after we Yelped the best spots for breakfast.

None of us were disappointed!  The portions are enormous, the drinks delicious, and the service wonderful.  

All of us loved our food.  Highly recommended for a change of pace if you're in Vegas and really sick of doing buffets, chain restaurants, etc.
Not sure what else to say that hasn't been said in the 1187 reviews! Great spot for breakfast off the strip!

This is always a must on trips to Vegas.  Food is amazing, portions are huge and prices are reasonable. Our server, Raul, on this visit was great, and very attentive.  Why waste your time on the strip?

Nice breakfast!! Veggie Omelet was soft and great with cheese, Stuffed French toast with egg, cheese and ham--great idea and turns out a good match!! Steak and eggs---so tender and well cooked!! Good place with family and friends, nice choice for a fulfilling brunch. Would like to go back again.

We decided to try something other than IHOP - and, we're really glad we did! Food was fantastic - and, the service made it a perfect breakfast! AMANDA was very pleasant, attentive & we loved her suggestions.....We'll definitely be back!

Breakfast was great! We went to Egg and I around 11am. Had a bit of a wait. They said 15 mins but was more like 5 mins. happy Moment. Patrick was our waiter. The guy new the menu like the back of his hand and i liked his response about the corn beef hash. So i ordered it. It did not disappoint. This is a Vegas Gem and needs to be recognized. Awesome food, awesome staff. Great choice.

I  Love a good breakfast!!! My BF had read a few great reviews about the Egg and I recently and suggested we try it after sitting in out DR. office appt. for 2 hours; needless to say it made us hungry.  The day was warm and not too windy so we opted to sit outside on the patio.  Nothing impressive but it did just fine.  The newspaper style menu was fun and different.  Right away I saw about 6 items I would like to try.  As did my hungry man.  I finally decided on the breakfast burrito.  And he picked This little piggy omelet.  Our food came very quickly and looked great!! The burrito was huge and looked great.  There was 4 scrambled eggs, cheese, peppers, onions and huge side of   their breakfast potatoes.  There was also a side of salsa that was tasty and not too spicy.  My BF food looked yummy as well, I knew this when he ate it all with few words.  
The only thing that could have been better was a more attentive server.  We had to look around for a water and soda refill.  I hate that.  She was however very sweet and seemed a little new.  I will defiantly be going back to try some of the other dishes that made my mouth water.  Overall, the Egg and I is a sure fire great breakfast experience.

An amazing place with great coffee and great breakfast. I had the grilled chicken omelet and it was good. Although I liked the Mexican chorizo omelet better- it was spicy, flavorful and so good! The banana nut muffin is delicious!

Went to the Egg and I today with my family! I am delighted that they have wifi here! It is very convenient. :) I think the dishes are a bit pricey and so I ordered the side dishes in the back of the menu such as the bagel with sour cream, ranch potatoes, and two eggs! The atmosphere in the place is lively and comfy. The servers seem friendly and the music in the background is decent. After finishing my food, I thought the bagel was okay, I could find better at Winco! :P The ranch potatoes did indeed taste like ranch, but I am not a fan of it! Also the eggs were fine! I just love eggs. Overall the taste of the food was just okay. Nothing spectacular about the place.
Today we had the pleasure of being waited on by Liza... She was amazing. Her personality and customer service was 5 stars. The food here is always great! She made the experience that much better!

Went to this place in Vegas when my boyfriend was playing in a basketball tournament. We were crunched for time and we decided to go there. It was really busy but we put our name on the list and we were seated really quickly to our surprise. We sat down and right away I ordered some banana nut bread with our drinks and it came right away! I recommend everyone try the banana nut bread, it is SO good! Anyways we ordered our food and the service was pretty decent. Had to wait a bit for our food but that's just cause it was busy. The food was good, nothing crazy special, and the price was about average or what is expected to pay in a place like Vegas. Overall I suggest going here if given the chance!

Recently ate breakfast here on a Sunday morning in mid Oct '13.

Wait : 20 mins for 2 patrons at 10:30am. : 3 stars
Dining room : simplistic but acceptable appointments (furniture, wall decor) : 3 stars
Menu choices:  plenty of options, and menu was easy to read : 4 stars

Food : my party ordered :
breakfast burrito - 5 stars, 
pancakes - 5 stars, 
scrambled eggs - 4 stars, 
bacon - 3 stars, 
'work' potatoes - 4 stars, 
fruit plate - 4 stars

Value : reasonable prices for quality of food, good prices for quantity of food

Summary :
I enjoyed my visit and would visit again.

This place is awesome . Food was incredible and our waitress, Chance was just as awesome. 
She was very personable and quick to serve and made sure we had everything. 
Highly recommend this place for the service and the food.

Second time here, and I have to say it's average. The previous visit, we went and it wasnt crowded.   This time we went on a Saturday, around 10ish and the wait wasnt too long maybe 10-15 minutes.

Previously, the service was very attentive, but this time service was was very mediocre at best.  I ordered the Taco Rancheros again.  I feel like this time around something was missing,  it tasted kinda blah, or in comparison something that I would find at Dennys.  Tho, the ranch potatoes still were quite tasty!  

Next time if we come back, I'm going to try something different. Sigh.
Yummy! Muffins, and Karla is the best she really deserves a trip to see Micky Mouse! The portions are large and the price is low, service is great! Perfect combination.

Excellent breakfast spot! Vast menu--almost too many choices--with plenty of vegetarian options. Large portions, and everyone's dish came with a healthy serving of fresh fruit. I had the veggie benedict. Good choice with the grilled tomatoes and fresh avocado, although my eggs were a bit overdone. The home fries are amazing though! Crispy and great seasoning. The bottomless coffee wasn't that great, but good enough for a bottomless pot to wake you up in the morning.

Service was incredible! Fast, attentive, friendly. I wish I could remember our waitress's name to give her a 5-star review. The service is definitely what would keep me coming back. The food is good, but the pricing was a bit high (I think bennie + coffee came to $14 + tip) to make it a regular go-to breakfast.

This is my favorite breakfast place to go to when I'm in Vegas. I usually save this for my last stop before going home. Always making Vegas a yummy food destination. 

If you're a breakfast person this is the place for you. They have every kind of breakfast you can think of and they do it right. 

Also, a must is there banana nut muffin that you can also buy to take home as gift! Always really really yummy! This place never disappoint.

Seen this place so many times while driving and thought nothing of it.  Today was my first time inside for breakfast at 1:30pm.  So glad I finally stopped in!

All the reviews talk about their bannana nut muffin, but more on that later, first - the eggs...   I ordered the biscuits and gravy which comes with a side of 2 eggs (I chose scrambled) and a side of potatoes (the server allowed me to sub half of the potatoes for fresh fruit.

Everything on my large plate was done perfectly.  The eggs were warm, tasty, and not under or over done.  The biscuits were deliciously moist and puffy (best I've had in as long as i can remember) with a very nice sausage gravy.  The potatoes were original and had a nice texture but the seasoning was a bit much for my taste.  And the fresh fruit was very sweet and well, fresh!  I really don't have a single complaint about the food.  I'd go here regularly for breakfast if it were closer to my house.

For first time goers you get a banana nut muffin on the house.  I don't care if you aren't a big fan of banana nut muffins, I'm really not.  But just eat it!  You won't regret it.  I don't know what they put in this pastry (sprinkled crack maybe?) but it was amazing.

As far as  the employees go, they all seemed happy, smiling, and they were genuinely nice.  There was no wait for me although I heard i just missed a rush.  everyone from the hostess to the servers to the cook did everything just right in my opinion.

Prices are fair for breakfast.  My large plate with an iced tea came to eleven bucks and change.  More than what I'm used to paying for breakfast, but worthy for the quality of the feast, and I'd happily hand it over again.
Love this place. Usually have the chicken fried steak breakfast. They gave us banana nut muffins--awesome (warm\/sticky). Worth the 15-20 minute wait, which is common for weekends\/holidays.

The banana nut muffin is to die for! A must have when you're here. We had the Country Benny and The Classic and both were great - the potatoes especially surprised me! Portions are generous though; so us three girls shared the two portions with more than enough to go around.
Four stars because there isn't enough seating, and the seating they do have is kind of awkward. However, as for the food, yum, yum, yum, yum, yum; did I say, YUM?
I never been here before, so it was my first time. It exceeded my expectations! Theyre all reallly sweet; the waitresses.
Absolutely egg-celent breakfast stop in Vegas! Staff was amazing and very helpful, must go! All the food is amazing and it comes with huge portions! You definitely won't go hungry.

This place is nothing special! Breakfast is the easiest meal to cook, and when I pay for it I want it to be flippin awesome. This was just ok - like Dennys. 

The place was packed, but it only took a minute to be seated. The service was all around good - no complaints.

I ordered one of the skillets - maybe the three meats - which was okay. It was fresh, good portion, and tasted ok. Just nothing to write home about. The best thing, other than the diet coke, was the banana bread. 

It's not bad, just not good. Make your own breakfast, and you'll be just as happy.
If you are really hungry for a big breakfast, this place is the spot!  Incredible portions and the banana my muffins....OMG....the banana nut muffins...!

First...amazing banana muffins.  Simply delicious.  The food is great with a large number of options.  Staci, our server, was an amazing server.  I watched her explain items to us, as well as others.  She was very attentive and personable.   The only issues I would have are these.  1) I wanted a pancake and they only have large portions and no option for a single normal pancake to add to the side of a large omlet.  2) the potatoes were very salty...tasty...but too salty.  I don't mind a bit odd salt or spuce...but these were over the top with salt.

Great place for a nice breakfast.

Give Staci the trip to Disneyland!

Nothing like Egg and I to complete a wonderful vegas trip with my friends. I ordered the Western omelet, which was just the sustenance I needed for the drive back. Not only that but I was lucky to have such a great server this time too. Amanda is one of the best servers I've ever seen in a long time. She's friendly, efficient, and extremely courteous :). SHE'S EGGCELENT. IF YOU EVER GET HER BE EGGCITED!

Egg & I had really great food. We got the EGGS-PLUS which included 2 eggs cooked to order, ranch potatoes, toast or banana nut muffin (get the banana nut muffin... makes a great appetizer!!!), and choice of bacon, sausage or ham (get the sausage links). Service was good. Food came out quickly. A few miles\/minutes off the strip. Definitely worth trying out. Will definitely go back here when we go back to Vegas and would recommend!

This is the best breakfast place I have eaten at in the US. Simply amazing choice and unbelievably fresh and sumptuous food. I had the Mexican omelet and toast . . . they were authentic with just the right amount of spice. Even the orange juice was fantastic.

We were looking for a new breakfast spot and found this one from yelp. We saw all the good review so we decided to try it. We were NOT impressed at all. Maybe they were just having a bad day? I got the basic pancakes with bacon breakfast. How can you go wrong right?? Well let me tell you, the bacon was hard and chewy and the pancakes were like chewing on their old recycled newspaper menus. It was like eating 100 crackers that you were unable to swallow. My BF got the eggs benedict that came with potatoes. The potatoes were like hollow skins with no meat inside and were salted beyond belief. I think we left swollen from all the water retention.. At least we can say that we tried it but we will definately be sticking to The Omlette House or Hash House A Go Go for breakfast when we visit Vegas.

This place is one POPULAR and PACKED breakfast spot on weekends that's for sure.

Although they were super busy and packed the one weekend day we showed up, we were seated immediately near the back where the patio seating is. 

I ordered one of their scrambles I believe and I got the banana bread on the side as well. Banana bread was seriously super moist and very buttery. I loved it!

Service was very friendly and efficient. 

Pricing is obviously very affordable being that it's off The Strip. Once again, we love eating where the locals eat. Best bang for your buck fo sho! Thanks Vegas Yelpers for helping us find this decent breakfast joint.

This is one of my favorite breakfast places in town! Even though they are always crowded they get you in and out fast with a smileI never feel rushed and I can always get what I want. They care about how your day is going and I always leave feeling better about how my day is going to go. I have had breakfast and lunch and both were awesome! The Carlsbad club is to die for along with their muffins!
Our waitress Alexa was very nice and efficient and made our experience a really good one!

Favorite breakfast\/brunch place when in Vegas. But, you need a mode of transportation because it's not on the strip.

TIP: If you check in through Yelp, you get free of the delicious, moist Banana Nut Muffin. (Do it! It's worth it.)

Be prepared to wait in line before seated, ALWAYS busy. So don't come here starving because you'll end up hAngry. 

FOOD: I love everything I ordered from this place. Oh, if you eat like a bird, share The food with someone because they serve big portions. (My son and BF always finish their plates though.)
