Let's talk about Victoria. She's dynamite. You'll want her to be your bestie just as we all did.  She is so personable and friendly and funny and I could go on and on. She was so attentive, our glasses were never empty...even the Bloodies! She gave us her recommendations and we were NOT disappointed. 

Between us, we had omelettes, stuffed french toast, waffle w\/banana, coconut and toffee and a mexican skillet. As I said before, we were not disappointed. 

If this place came to California, we would definitely make the trek wherever it lands. I HIGHLY recommend Egg and I...and their BANANA NUT MUFFIN!

Thank you Victoria for being our bestie even if it was only for 30 minutes!   We will be back!!!
Graf place great food but we had a waitress named Amanda and she was outstanding made our body there fantastic

This restaurant had the best service on our trip. They made sure we were okay throughout the morning. Their menu was awesome with so many choices. I had the Huevos Rancheros with chorizo and it was great. I also loved their potatoes. They actually give a lot of food.

We sat outside on the patio and the weather was great and the experience was even better for our breakfast.

I would go here again or try their other locations hoping it's very similar!

I love the egg and eye it's a fantastic place to just drop in anytime for a little bit of breakfast section they have a plenty of stuff to eat variety of choices and daily specials. They also have a selection of hot sauce is on the checkout at home when you can't make it in to the restaurant.
What a nice place, great staff my waitress Lindsey was very nice.  Always a treat to get a perfectly cooked sunny side egg, and the hash wasn't too bad either.

I read all the great reviews on Yelp for this place and recommended it to the group I was with.   Long story short we went twice in 4 days, its that good.  I want to know where they get their sausages, outstanding flavor....service great...we waited less than 10 minutes the first time and walked in the second.  I will definitely be going to this place again...The only thing I could recommend would be that they fix the latch in the restroom.  Also they really need to put a Rooster for the Men's room and a bunch of chickens for the Ladies Hen house...;)

Eggcellent food, had the chicken enchilada omelette, delicious!  Ask for Darla to be your server, she provides Excellent customer service, keeps you updated , is very warm and friendly, makes you feel very much at home amid the busyness of the place. I would definitely patronize this establishment again when in Vegas.

Everything was delicious and I LOVE that they offer 1\/2 portions! Everyone was so nice, especially our server Breannada.  She kept checking on us to make sure everything was ok, or if we needed anything.  She was warm, and had a great smile.  We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas! Oh! Banana muffin was awesome!! We had to take a loaf to go :)

Paula was our waitress and the service here was beyond excellent.

Food was just regular american breakfast, but it's nice to know what the local's favorite is like.

Plenty of parking, decent prices, A LOT of food for you to start your day.

The shocking number of reviews is because the customers are incentivized to post a review on Yelp \/ Tripadvisor to help their waiter \/ waitress go to Disneyland.  Apparently, whoever gets their name mentioned most gets to go to Disneyland, but it seems like an unfair popularity contest.  What if I was a waiter and I had tons of Facebook friends to help me out.  Easy free Disneyland trip.  Management, it's a smart business move, but this is a bit unfair.
Paid a recent visit after probably ten years since my last meal here. Just as good as I remember. Skillet breakfasts always satisfy. Good coffee. Friendly and prompt service.

After looking at reviews on here for another good breakfast spot, I choose The Egg and I. I was not disappointed, everything on the menu looked and sounded good!

I ended up getting a FRANCISCO'S SCRAMBLE and it was flavorful!

I will be back!

I had the egg white omelette, my son had blueberry and chocolate chip pancakes, my daughter had chocolate chip pancakes, and my wife had the hash, not the kind you smoke, but often times I wish she'd try it, ... food was great, service was perfect, but the wait was long (which is why I gave it 4 stars).  However, that single condition to reduce it by one star is really unfair if you think about it...? 'Cause the reason it was long to get a table was the fact so many others were waiting before us, 'cause the food and value is pretty damn good.  Truly I should give it five stars. But life isn't fair, so they get four.  Notwithstanding I was standing for about 30 minutes before getting a table.  Why was I standing? I'm a glutton for punishment. Therefore I ate with a gluttonous appetite once they sat my tired ass down.

This places is fantastic!!  Erin was our server for b'fast last Saturday and she was great!  Good prices, great food and very friendly.  We went twice over a 2 week tour of NV and CA. Would highly recommend going here to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip!

Wednesday morning, breakfast time in Las Vegas - what to do? I Yelped it and decided to try The Egg and I based on the reviews. Great decision! This is an old fashioned, cozy breakfast place with fantastic food and great service. I tried the Eggs Florentine or, in my case, "the usual" - and the hollandaise was just about perfect. 
Highly Recommended!
Great brunch spot and you can bring your dog!  Full bar, the bloody Mary's were amazing!   The skillet & stuffed French toast are our favs!

This is a great breakfast place with so many delicious choices. But the best thing about this place is the incredible customer service you get from Amanda. She is the most cheerful, friendly and super nice waitress we have had the pleasure to meet.

Our server Karla was great! Friendly and very attentive! I started off with the Banana Nut Muffin and coffee. Oh yum! You MUST try this at least once although I'm sure it won't just be once! I also ordered the Stuffed French Toast and eliminated the meat. Before I can ask what are my other options Karla recommended veggies! Stuffed French toast with scrambled eggs, spinach and mushrooms. It also came with deliciously seasoned potatoes. I can't wait to go back to Vegas, so I can come back to this place for breakfast! 

I'm saying good-bye to brunch at the buffets and saying hello to Egg & I! I found my Vegas breakfast spot!

This place was just OK.  If I am going to give a breakfast place more than three stars,  I should be wowed.  Everyone looking for a solid Breakfast should still go here, but if you are looking to be knocked off your feet: this is not the place.

What a great atmosphere!  Even though we were in Las Vegas, this could have been a small-town diner anywhere in the US. 

We had a great breakfast with banana-nut muffins, of course!  We were going to share a chile relleno omelet, and asked for an extra muffin, when the waitress told us that we could order half orders of just about anything on the menu - the cost was half of the menu price + 50 cents.  We did that instead, order half an omelette and half an order of grilled banana bread french toast. So I said - well, we won't need the other muffin, but the waitress said - no charge! - I'll bring you an extra anyway.

The food was excellent. The breakfast potatoes need some work - they were just hard fried "bits" of potatoes - but everything else was great.  A carafe of coffee was left on our table so that we didn't have to keep asking for refills, and cream\/flavored creamers are on the table to make a perfect cup of coffee.

It was delightful - a trip back in time!  Don't miss it if you have a car in LV!
My best friend and I visited this brunch spot and we fell in love. The banana nut muffins are the best! The food has a lot of calories, but it doesn't matter because it is THAT GOOD.

Wow!  Decided to eat away from the tourist spot.  I found a coupon in one of the LV booklets you get at the hotel, it was buy one get one free breakfast. This place is definitely worth going to.  It's about 10mins from the strip.

Food:  Corned Beef Hash and eggs, Eggs Benedict Florentine,  Banana muffins.

Corned Beef Hash:  husband really enjoyed the "real" corned beef in the hash!

Eggs Benedict Florentine:  Yummy!  The sauce was delicious, I think I would stick with the original eggs Benedict.  The spinach was served fresh and not sautÃ©ed which I was expecting.

Banana Muffins:  this is what they are known for!  Must get them!! They were so good, we ordered 6 to take back to the hotel!

The service was AWESOME too :)

Came for breakfast on a Saturday morning just because its our last day in vegas and we wanted something different from the complimentary breakfast we have from our hotel.
Was surprised to see that the place is packed and hopping at such an early hour.We waited for awhile for the server to arrive to get our orders. ORder came after 15mins. The corned beef was good. Portions are generous.
would recommend.

Popular place about a 30 minute wait for a table for 7. Staff is really nice and the menu is detailed I got Benny country with poached eggs and seasoned potatoes. The gravy is out on top of the sausage eggs and biscuits and it was delicious I was not fond of the seasoned potatoes a little too salty seasoned for me great will looking forward to coming back to try new things.

AMAZING breakfast!!! I got the chile relleno omelette and I almost regret it because I know I'm going to crave it and I won't be able to travel back to this awesome restaurant for a long time! I also ordered a side of banana pancakes that were DELISH. They were super fluffy and overall had perfect texture. The service was also 5\/5! My server was nice, helpful, and attentive. If you've come across this place on Yelp, just GO NOW. IT WAS WORTH EVERY PENNY!

I went in feeling nervous about trying a French toast sandwich. The bread was French toast and the inside was ham, egg, and cheese scrambled. It was deelish! The food was great and the waitress was sweet as pie. 

We sat outside and enjoyed the patio that allowed a soft water mist fight against the Vegas heat. 

I would have given them a rating of five but the patio tables needed to be cleaned because there were cobwebs on them. I Don't PLAY with spiders!

We love love sitting out side and eating the wonderful food at egg and I it is a dog friendly.  Ask for Stacie she is a sweetheart out on the outside patio!    We love the green chicken enchiladas omelette :)

By far the best food I have tasted in my entire life. Every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to eat here if not everyday of my stay then every other day. I can't leave without paying a visit. Staff is amazing and service is quick. I recommend it to anyone and everyone.

We were originally getting a breakfast buffet at the Wynn and decided it was too pricey. Did a quick yelp search and Egg & I appeared.

To make the review short: the skillets were huge and nicely made. Prime rib benedict was on point. But the star? The warm muffin. Could just eat that for breakfast and nothing else.

Service is great too. Our server, Thay, took our group pictures voluntarily and filled our glasses and coffee mugs frequently. Awesome food and service makes for a great experience. 

Casino buffets move aside. Come here for breakfast but leave a spot open for me.

5\/5 would come again.

Didn't really want to patronize the usual breakfast buffets in the hotels, so my husband and I set out to find a local breakfast spot that we'd really enjoy.  Boy did we find it!!!!!!The banana nut muffin was probably the best I've ever had!!!!!  Everything on the menu looked good so we really had a difficult time placing an order.  However,  I ended up with the enchilada omlette which was devine and my husband had a chili omlette and he loved his as well.  We were stuffed by the time we were done and promised ourselves we would return once again before we ended our vacation.
Great choice for breakfast when visiting LV since it is clearly a favorite of the locals. The food and service are very good and the portions substantial.

Good breakfast place but not unlike most places you get eggs and coffee.  Food was good and came out very quickly, I didn't particularly care for the side of potato hash that come with the meal. The staff is attentive but not overbearing seeing as how they are so busy and they have a little egg dude on the table that frowns when you flip him over so you can get service ASAP. A solid 3 stars.

Me and my boyfriend have been here twice so far our first time being last week and while the portions are good overall I'm left with the feeling that he could have been better. Like if they just take it one notch up it could be great. All of there food is mush there is no texture I got the California crepe and idk how they call that a crepe it was way too think but the filling inside was good. While my boyfriend got one of the burritos but he could only eat half because the inside was throwing him off. On the other hand the service is great and I like how they have a lot of different kinds of creamers. It's the little things that count. This time around I got the strawberry cream cheese French toast and my boyfriend got a scramble the one with jalapeÃ±os and chorizo I like his more than my own because they used the pre-made strawberry flavored cream cheese so it just tasted like fake strawberries but the strawberry compote that was also on it was delicious. His omelette was very tasted but the chorizo bits were so small I couldn't even taste it. Overall it's a good experience and a nice little cozy breakfast place that's close to home
Karla helped us with an amazing brunch!  Food was tasty and plentiful.  Service was terrific.  Will definitely return next time we are in Vegas.

Came here from LA for the weekend, wanted a good breakfast,  I saw the high reviews, it has over 2k 4.5 stars, but honestly if your from LA and know about Norms Restaurant, it's basically the same thing. 

The seasoning they put on their potatoes, it's really salty, out of the 6 of us sitting in the table, we all though they we're salty. 

I got The Works Omelette,  it was decent, it had flavor, but not something over the top. 

Orange juice was good,  hot chocolate was okay.

The one thing, that was really good was the Banana Nut Muffin. Other than that..this place was alright.

The service was good, our waitress Mariah, was really nice and friendly. 

Overall,  my rating is based on the service and somewhat on the quality of food.

LOVE this place.  Went for brunch on a Saturday around 11am, only had to wait a couple of minutes while a table was cleaned.  Everyone who works there was terribly nice, and we loved the little egg sign that tells the staff if you need something.
You must order the stuffed French toast!!  I'm not normally a French toast eater, but this is not normal French toast!  SO yummy, like the best sweet and hearty sandwich I've ever had - I could only get through half of it.  My friend had the eggs plus, which looked yummy, and a banana nut muffin that everyone raves about - it was awesome.  Their ranch potatoes are also amazing, like eating tiny square-shaped french fries.
Everything is so well-priced.  We paid $26 including tip for both of us, and considering I had an orange juice, I'd say that's pretty great.
Breakfast was wonderful! The service was great. It was about a 15min wait to be seated but it was well worth it. Huge portions; definitely should have shared. Pancakes were just fabulous.

I got the Works Veggie Benny and it was filling and delicious! It was a hearty meal as it included spinach, tomatoes, and avocados with a side of some potatoes seasoned with the famous Hablo Diablo! The customer service is on point with the "Let Us Know If You Need Service" egg flipper on the table. Reminds me of how Brazilian restaurants have those red and green things to let them know when to come to your table or not.

P.S. Make sure to check-in and get a FREE banana muffin! It's so moist and is a great way to end a meal here.

I absolutely LOVE this place!! I always come here whenever I'm in Vegas. The service is excellent and super fast, it literally took 5-10 mins for our food to come! My favorite is the works veggie benny. The potatoes are so delicious! Definitely recommend coming here, if you haven't been here, you're missing out!!

There is definitely a reason why there is always a wait for this place...it is totally worth it!!!

I got one of the Egg & I specials - Chicken Fried Steak  which consist of 2 eggs, ranch potatoes, and a banana nut muffin which you can totally share with 2 people except for the muffin. Please dont share that. Get your own, damn it. Its too good to be shared!

Wait a minute! Did I say RANCH POTATOES???!!! OH HELL YEAH!!! Its the best tasting season potatoes ever! They are not like french fries nor tots but they are cubed shaped fries. I almost died when I put one in my mouth. This is why I scored this place a 5. 

The potatoes and banana nut muffin totally suckered me in for life! I dont even like banana nut flavored anything or muffins and this muffin was the bomb!!!

My chicken fried steak was huge and just perfect. Its not oily at all, just plump and juicy. 

5 star in my book. I think the service was good...I think the wait wasnt too bad... shit, I dont remember, I zoned out after my first bite of those delicious potato fries!

My first visit here. I would definitely come back and eat here. They have friendly staff. Really good food. I had the prime rib Benedict Eggs - delicious. My wife had the biscuits and gravy - she loved them. My daughter ate the Cordon Bleu skillet and enjoyed it. To anyone traveling with their dogs. They have a pet friendly patio.
The Works skillet was simply amazing! Yummy homemade salsa and the homemade muffin finished everything off nicely. Biscuits and gravy was too too

Breakfast makes me happy. This place made me happy. I had the Crepe Omelette and it was pretty substantial and good. The rave about the Banana Muffin is legit and i was very impressed. It gets very busy but it's worth the wait. Great service too!
Eggs Benedict was delicious! Loved the banana nut muffin... Must get if you eat here!

We ended up here only because there was a power outage on the entire block occupied by Hash House A Go-Go.  Boo.

Huge omelets and other specialty egg dishes.  The boyfriend's scramble which was supposed to be topped with a couple eggs looks like it had 4-5 eggs.  He was pretty happy with that.

My chicken fried steak was good, but I couldn't touch the potatoes which were covered in way too much of their salty seasoning...they looked like someone dumped a bottle of Lawry's on them as a joke.

Speaking of jokes, the lady at the register thought it was HILARIOUS when my boyfriend said the food was "eggs-quisite".  DUMB!!

Amazing food, superior service.  Get off the strip and give this place a try.  A great experience!!

I was in town for a conference and my husband was able to join me for a couple days.  We always try to get away from the tourist traps and try to eat at local establishments.  This one was definitely a win!  

The food was plentiful - way too much to eat, but too good not to try.  The eggs were hot, cooked perfectly and served promptly.  The service staff was all very down to earth, stayed on top of every request, and smiled the whole time.  

Everything we ate was wonderful and all the plates around us looked great too.  Can't order wrong here.
Food was really good and it comes out quick.  Our server was on top of it and very nice (Lindsey).  The "works" skillet was delicious.

My husband & I visited this place once while we were visiting Las Vegas & after eating there we wished we had known about that place sooner so we could've had breakfast there every morning while there. The second we walked in we were greeted by the hostess & given a table right away (it was really early so it wasn't that crowded yet) and a couple of mins later our server Amanda greeted us & took our drink order. The menu had a HUGE selection of items and after minutes deciding my husband ordered the ciabatta breakfast sandwich & I ordered the French toast breakfast sandwich     (both sandwich came with a side of potatoes) and we were pleased with our selections. Not only were the portions big but they were delicious! Their potatoes are super good too, my husband isn't a potato guy he prefers hashbrowns BUT he really liked those potatoes. A good restaurant with good food is nothing if they don't have good service & our server Amanda was great! She was very attentive, she made us feel like locals which we loved because when traveling we don't like to be treated like tourists. Over all, I give this place 5 stars because of their delicious food & great costumer service! When visiting Las Vegas, this is must try spot!!!

The service is great! Our waitress was super sweet and helpful; she answered all our question. The orange juice was delicious and definitely freshly squeezed. The food was delicious! If you are in the area, this cute little breakfast place is a definite must. The children's meal was super cute: a chocolate chip Mickey Mouse shaped pancake! And the wait time was not that long, definitely worth it. I got the chili skillet and it was so delicious. The portions are good sized and I left happy and full. The key manager Abby served us and she was so sweet and nice. Loved her!

So my boyfriend is a taxi driver and he gets all kinds of coupons, deals and freebies. He got a coupon for Egg & I.  I was so excited to try it because we're never awake for normal breakfast time. They stop seating people at 3pm, which is when we usually get there. 

The food is great. The chili relleno omelet was amazing. I'm not a fan of the ranch potatoes. I think they are a good filler though. Same about the Banana Nut Muffin. But the meal I dream about is Benedict's Garden. It's a 'vegetarian' version of eggs benedict. English muffin topped with guacamole and tomato, poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. it's the greatest thing!

Service is great. Everyone is friendly. Waitresses are attentive but If you need anything, just flip the egg on the condiment caddy.
The fiesta skillet and strawberry cream french toast are amazing! Check in on foursquare to get a tasty and free banana nut muffin.

I guess you wouldn't come here if you were looking for something healthy. Everything here is pretty heavy. I'm usually quick with my selection because I know what I want, but it was the opposite this time and now I know it's because I was hungover. I opt for a chilli omelette because I wanted more protein and it was decent for under $10, came out exactly how I expected a chili omelette to be. I'm not a fan of potatoes but the house potatoes were nice and crispy! We had a big group of 10+ and they quickly sat us outside in the patio! It was a relaxing breakfast : )

Went here on a Saturday morning.
They take reservations on the phone but will only hold the table for you for 10 mins - so I suggest calling as you are on your way.

We had a big group (8 BABES) 

Once we got there it was only a 15 min wait even if there was a ton of people waiting.
Not sure if it was because we called in advanced.

This place is quite large on the inside with ample seating.
A family environment.

They have this thing on the table similar to what I saw at Bubba Gumps where you can turn the sign to make it so that if a waiter sees it, they will help you. See pics!

If you check in VIA Yelp - you get a free Banana Walnut Muffin - but I got one anyways with my meal.
I ordered the Sundance Special which was a veggie omelet with spinach, mushroom & artichoke hearts topped with tomatoes and feta cheese (which would lead to my later food poisoning - not through the fault of the restaurant but mine)
It was super yummy but it was a huge serving so I had to take it home.
FYI; leaving feta cheese in a car for 5 hours is never a good idea.

You pay up front. FYI.

I would recommend it as there are a ton of good choices for food and they all look good.
There are a ton of choices for vegetarians as well. Always a PLUS!

This morning my childhood best friend and I needed a spot to brunch and have a reunion after 2 years without seeing each other. And what better place than Egg and I? The environment and the staff are all very courteous and attentive. One of their employees had a brief conversation with us and he told us about his life and how he has been working for Egg and I for over 18 years. Peculiarly I felt like I never left home while eating breakfast. Spending quality time with BFF and having brunch were the best of both worlds. I cannot wait to come back. This place has the best stuffed French toast in Las Vegas. I will never forget their fast service and the way they made us feel when we were there. 
Egg and I is top notch.

First time here in the multiple times I've been to Vegas, I wonder what took me so longggggg?  the food was amazing, especially the Yelp muffin and French toast. Our server Liza was such a loving lady always checking in every 3-5mins making sure we didn't need anything extra, because of her I'll be coming back every time I visit Vegas from here on. Thank you for your great service Liza! Hope you get those Disneyland tickets, you deserve them!!!
This place was just ok... over priced for what you get. If you want a really good breakfast spot try coffee pub!!

The food is nice and hot with large more than you can eat portions. 

"The works" omelette is very filling as it is very well packed.

Don't think twice about coming here! Just do it! You won't be disappointed.

Jose was our server, did an excellent job!

Wow. I have never had banana nut muffins quite like the ones served in The Egg and I. It was freshly made and still hot from the oven. The next time I come I need to make sure to get a box to go!

As for the breakfast plates, my boyfriend got the omelet and I got the usual potatoes ham and eggs. We also decided to get the "short stack" banana pancakes. Let me just tell you that when we asked just how big the short stacked pancakes were, the server made this hand gesture that indicated it was small so we went with that. Guys, the short stack was, STACKED. It was huge! It's bigger than the regular pancakes in Ihop and Denny's! Plus it had REAL bananas in them. Holy smokes! 

We were IN LOVE with the potatoes! It had the best seasoning - a somewhat Cajun flavor? The ham was a large chunk and my boyfriend loved his omelet. This place is perfect! Would definitely come back for more!

10\/10 would bang (the door) again
The Mexican Omelette was good. Plenty of butter on the whole wheat toast. The place was packed on Friday morning but service was quick and professional.

We found the place on Yelp. Thank goodness we did. It was great. The portions were big and the staff was friendly. I ordered the Hawaiian French toast with strawberries and maple syrup. I also order a side of the honey bacon, eggs over hard and their signature potatoes. My husband order the prime rib benny. He inhaled it in 10 mins. 

It does get quite busy so go early and prepare to wait. We went on Saturday morning around 10 am and it was a 20 min wait. So worth it though.

This is a great place for breakfast. Huge portions, great banana nut muffins, fast service. They leave a huge pot of coffee on the table. Even the glasses of water are big. We were leaving to go back home and our super-efficient waitress, Jessica, even made us waters to go.

We went here on a Friday morning and we had attentive service. I've also went to egg works, but I actually liked the food better here even though they're all owned by the same people.

I got the stuffed French toast. It's French toast stuffed with eggs, cheese, and your choice of ham, sausage, or bacon. They also have turkey bacon. It also comes with a side of potatoes. I got the homemade orange juice again. It was really delicious but I couldn't eat it all. Afterwards, my waiter said they can do half portions! :) 

My other members got burritos and stuffed French toast. They were gobbled up and said they were good.

We also got to claim the free muffin - it was moist and delicious!

Banana muffins are out of this world ! We ordered eggs Benedict with breakfast potatoes and they were the best perfectly cooked potatoes nothing compares to crispy outside and super soft mushy potatoes inside ! 5starts to chef!! We will be back again

An early arrival to Vegas gives us an opportunity to go off the strip and enjoy a couple of breakfast eateries. The Egg and I has a cute name and an old cowboy ranch feel to it. The menus are newspapers and the servers are friendly!

Food (4 Stars): I ordered the corned beef hash with over medium eggs and the banana nut muffin. I'm usually not a banana nut fan, but this muffin changed my mind. It was full of spice and flavor, you can definitely taste the banana. The corned beef hash was pretty good with the shredded style corned beef. The seasoned potatos were DELICIOUS and I wish I could've had more.

We ordered the Cinncinati 4 Way plate with onions. It is pretty much spaghetti pasta with chili and onions on top. Our group was intrgued by the ingredients so we ordered it. It was amazing!!! Who knew that chili and spaghetti pasta can go together so well?? Topped with cheese and onions, this is my dish!

We couldn't finish all of our food due to the large portions, so definitely come with an appetite. The food is still good after being reheated.

Service (4 Stars): Our cute server was friendly and humorous. She frequently checked up on us and refilled our cups, she even got us another table because ours was cramped.

Bottom line: Hungover? Hungry? Feeling like stuffinf your face? Egg ans I will satisfy it all.

In search of that last good meal before heading back to California, I decided to give The Egg and I a try due to recommendation of a family member.  Yes there were people waiting outside to eat due to this place being so popular for breakfast.  The wait was 15 minutes which wasn't that bad.  I tried the waffle works, which consisted of a huge Belgian waffle with 2 pieces of bacon and 2 eggs.  I did request whipped cream on the waffle, which made it taste even better.  The waffle was huge.  I enjoyed every bite.  The portions were very generous for the price.  Worth every penny.  The server Lindsey was wonderful and made sure I had the meal of a lifetime.  

     The Egg and I taught me a lesson that the best places to eat are not always on the Strip or Downtown Las Vegas.  There are good places to eat all over Las Vegas and you have to dig deep into your soul for the best food possible.  The Egg and I has a small town feel to it which provides an intimate dining experience.  This is one of the few places in Las Vegas you can eat at everyday and not get tired of it but wouldn't do so simply due to the fact that you don't want to spoil yourself.  This will become my new go-to spot in need of a good breakfast while visiting.  As far as the food quality and atmosphere goes. the Egg and I destroys Denny's and IHOP by all leaps and bounds imaginable.

My family and I decided to try this place on the morning we were headed home from Vegas. We got it off of the Triple D website and have had great experiences in the past so it seemed like a great choice. While it was not a terrible experience, it was certainly a disappointing one and here is why:

My mother and I both have a food allergy to Monosodium Glutamate more commonly known as MSG. It is a flavor enhancer\/ preservative often found in foods like Doritos, Cheetos, and all of those other junk foods you shouldn't be eating (but let's face it, sometimes we just need some junk food). For me, a little is OK, but my mother can't eat it at all. 

When we sat down at the table, we asked if they used MSG more out of habit than anything else; why would a breakfast spot need a preservative? Our waitress, who was very nice, informed us that it was in most of the food, but not the eggs. My mother, who had originally decided on the highly rated Chicken Fried Steak, had to change her order. Both of chose the Sunrise Mountain and decided to order fruit rather than take our chances with the Habla Diablo potatoes that came with 90% of the breakfast options.

When the food came out it looked delicious, but one bite changed our opinion. While it was plentiful, it was bland. Even the blanket of cheese over the top could not help it.

My father, who does not share my MSG allergy, ordered a skillet. Mom and I both took a bite of the Habla Diablo potatoes from his plate and they were delicious. Crunchy and flavorful, I would have loved to be able to eat them, but they were covered in stomach pain inducing MSG. And the only option besides the potatoes was fruit (which was very nice, but did nothing for the dish itself).

I gave this place two stars because the service was good and the banana nut muffins delicious. Now if only they could learn how to cook with flavor rather than chemicals...

In spite of its obvious chain affiliation, the food is better than average.

First, there is the Chicken Fried Steak Skillet.  Just so you know, the CFS has a crispy crust, cut into bite sized pieces and placed on top of their mini crispy potato cubes.  Topped with a good tasting, creamy gravy, this dish is really good.  I had to restrain myself from ripping it away from my son.

The Hanks Scramble contains fresh spinach, mushroom, tomato, and cheese.  I don't know where they went wrong, but I have had much better tasting vegetable scrambles.  It was a disappointment mainly because it tasted way to bland. Dumping their house salsa on it redeemed it considerably.

Then there were the pancakes and bacon. Decent pancakes, but nothing that stands out.  The bacon was salty but not smoky tasting and rather flaccid.  I like crisp.  Good, not great.

The Waffle and Bacon combo was similar, neither the waffle nor the bacon were crispy.

I really liked the serve yourself carafe of coffee left at our table. Got it hot.  Got it exactly when we needed it.

The service was excellent. Maybe part of that was because they did not need to run around filling coffee cups instead of taking care of more important matters like getting food out of the kitchen fast. Smart.

This was ok, but we shall continue to search for the ultimate Mom and Pop places in Vegas.
Nice brunch spot with solid skillets. Coffee is meh, but the food is really good, incl the banana nut muffins.

Cute menu in newspaper style. Reminds of people in the old days perhaps that they wake up in the morning with breakfast and newspaper in hand. 

I ordered Blacked Prime Rib Benedict, my bf ordered stuff french toast and we got banana muffins for free. Both of our dishes came with home potatoes, just mine was too salty, his was fine.

I have had better egg Benedict at Bill's cafe in our bay area, the prime rib was salty for me, but the stuffed french toast was very unique and tasty. Also the banana muffins are really good.

Overall a nice place to eat breakfast off the strip with very reasonable prices and friendly service (Thank you, Paula!)

When in Vegas this is a must, either when we just drive in, if early enough or right before we are heading home.  Check in for your free banana muffin you will not be disappointed.  Reasonably priced, good service and amazing food.  Everything I have tried (chile relleno omelet, enchilada omelet, pancakes, steak and eggs) have all been delicious.

if i'm gonna talk about finding great breakfast spots in SF, i have to give all something to compare. a real LV gem with one of the largest and most diverse breakfast and lunch menus i've ever witnessed. the  "homey" feel is exponentialized by the great service (a rarity in SF). and for those midwestern transplants searching for a little bit of home, check out the Cincy chili (served every way you can imagine, with the real deal stuff shipped straight from Ohio). god, i'm salivating like a damned Pavlovian puppy!

Came here on a bad day. There were confusion in their kitchen and other customers were upset. We waited over 30 mins for skillet and waffle. Should not be there with high expectations. Food was normal. Bloody Mary tasted like ketchup. Staff were great but won't be back again..

This place is horrible. There was five in our party and four of us got waffles and the other one got biscuits and gravy. This gravy was so salty that she couldn't eat it. The potatoes are way too overly season salted also. It tasted like they dumped that whole container of salt in the gravy but when we complained about it to them they didn't apologize or anything, three different wait staff just simply said, "Oh we get that a lot. " One even said that everyone that gets it complains but no one here is going to actually tell the owner\/cook that it tastes horrible and that no one likes it except the owner.  Service was slow, we had to ask several times for some items. Not sure why this place gets so many stars.

This is my go to spot every time I am in Vegas! I even bought myself a coffee cup! 

Bacon avocado omelet with sour cream, little chunks of bacon in the egg and slices of fresh avocados inside the omelet with cheese and topped with a nice helping of sour cream.  
Banana nut muffin x 2 please, I take one to go. 
Every bite has a crunch of nut, they serve it warm, which is the best way to eat it! 
My unlimited amount of coffee refills! 

The breakfast here is awesome and the portions are huge. I usually end up taking half of everything home, yes back to LA!

Eggs Benedict were yummy, I really enjoyed the food, the ambiance, and the service! 

The only reason I don't give the Eggs and I the last star is bearcats my kiddos disapprove the pancakes! 

I asked they if they wanted to go back and they immediately responded NO mommy the pancakes there were not delicious. I can't testify for it since I did not try them... but that would explain why my toddler kept on spitting them out. 

Regardless I would recommend this place for the adult menu!

I hadn't eaten at Egg and I for a few years. My friend and I needed a restaurant the other day and we were close to Egg and I. The place was very busy - a good sign. We were seated right away and the server, Tamara, was great. The food also turned out to be great. All in all, a great experience. I'm sure I will eat there a few times a month. Highly recommended.

Must go to breakfast restaurant when in Vegas! 

This place is off the strip and it gets pretty busy but the wait isn't long at all, for three people is about a 10-15 wait but worth it!!

I had the beef hash with two over easy eggs and it was so flavorful and you can taste the quality.

Family owned restaurant where they care about their menu choices and how the customers experience. 

Would surely come back again! Thanks!
Food was crazy good and service was exceptional. Our server Amanda was extremely helpful. Her smile seriously made everyone's day.
This place is delicious. Large portions and friendly staff.  We make it a point to come here every time we come to Vegas.  Karla is the best.
Really good!  HUGE portions so beware and split if you don't have a huge appetite.  Great biscuits and gravy!  Excellent coffee!!  Service was equally good!

Definitely one of my fave breakfast place in town. I used to get the steak and eggs before I turned Pesco-veggie, and it was gooood. My bf and I grabbed breakfast here a couple days ago and I just had two over easy eggs, wheat toast, and blueberry muffin. Muffin is always moist here and it's served warm so butter is a must. My bf got the steak n eggs with ranch potatoes and said he still loves it. Ranch potatoes are always flavorful here. I also suggest the tuna melt here--delicious. Service is good, we're so used to coming here so we don't mind the inconsistencies they have with their service. Although it would've been great if they wouldnt have alot of turnovers with their staff. It was great coming in here and the staff knew our names. But ever since the turnover we don't know anyone anymore except the host lady. Once again, food makes up for it so we shall be back regardless.

Had the Chile Rellano Omelette and my friend had the Chicken Enchilada Omelette and they were both outstanding! Great service!  Lots of seating and the wait went fast.  Definitely recommend this place!

Wow what a great meal.We came here twice because the first experience was so good.Omelette's were great and Prime Rib Benny was outstanding.Service was equally superb as well. Reina our waitress was great both days !!!

Darn, a Yelp disappointment for me.  Karen, my server, was nice.  The food was just okay, though.  My waffle came out barely warm, I requested extra crispy bacon but they still had chewy fat on 'em, scrambled eggs were ok.  3 stars versus 2 because the coffee was good.

yummmmm eggs
yummmmm banana bread delicousness
yummmmm brunch
yummmmm everything
Our server Linnea was awesome and so patient, she answered all our questions. The corn beef hash is also amazing.
If you love breakfast, you will love this place! Closes early of course. Their dishes are great! Diner style. No pretense.

Another breakfast review.... well I just had too as we found another local joint in Las Vegas which just hits the top notch mark. I found this place while yelping and I'm sure glad we did...  Great customer service, great food and wonderful staff..  a big high five and HUGE thank you to our server Lindsey (hope I spelled your name correctly) as she was amazing first of all as well as everyone else in the place. Treated us like their best friends... the food came out hot and fresh and tasted wonderful. Not to mention those amazing muffins they treated us too for free for being first timers!!  Now THAT is customer service!! Talk about making an instant impression and creating an instant loyal customer... thank you to all of the staff at EGG & I for treating us so well to our visit to Vegas... we will definitely come back to see you again!

I had such a wonderful experience and Oscar was probably the best server I have ever had. He gave suggestions right away, which made the ordering process a lot less stress-inducing for me, which I highly appreciate, as I have a lot of anxiety over ordering food from a menu that I'm not familiar with. He also took interest in us as customers, and asked about where we're from and made lovely conversation. I am so thrilled about my experience and will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.

Every time we come to Vegas we make a point of going to Egg Works. This time we tried the Egg & I we were not disappointed. It is the best breakfast in Vegas! I had the Skillet with Bacon. Jim had the works Skillet. Our waitress Tabatha made sure the eggs were done perfectly she was very friendly and made sure we had everything we needed. The muffins are fantastic we get ours to go since you get so much food. If you want a marvelous breakfast at a good price with great service this is the place to go!!!

Reina, Reina, Reina I hope that gets her three steps closer to Mickey Mouse !!
Food was eggselent. Place was busy which means the food is worth the wait.
This place is fantastic, can't believe I never stopped in before. Biscuits and gravy off the hook good. Great service from Amanda!

So this is the first time my family and I have ever been to this restaurant and unsolicited, our server Paula offered to bring us all a banana nut muffin complimentary.

so. damn. good.

Service was great. Food was great. Most notably of all things the potatoes and french fries. Seasoned so well, and every piece, which is usually an easy oversight for potatoes. Definitely recommend for a quick and delicious breakfast\/brunch\/lunch spot
Long wait for absolutely grease laden food.  If this is your thing you will love it.

5 stars does not even come close to how amazing this food is!  I highly recommend ordering their pork carnitas rancheros with a side of work potatoes!  It is consistently busy,  but service is very fast and efficient!  Also, for your sweet tooth cravings try one of their homemade banana nut muffin!  It's just heavenly!

I had the steak breakfast and it was delicious. Potatoes were amazing alone but on another level good with the Habla Diablo Verde salsa. even ordered the banana nut muffin which was equally awesome. I definitely recommend this place when your in Vegas.

The Biscuits & Gravy, so good!! 
The staff is very friendly & know the menu like the back of their hand.
Tabitha was Great, this place is my old faithful breakfast spot. Everyone is super friendly and the food is always on point

Food was excellent, and large portions.  Menu items can be customized to dietary requirements.  Our server Bree was friendly and efficient, providing excellent service.  We will be back again for sure.
Far and away the best breakfast place in Vegas OMG huge portions and great prices, service was amazing and you always leave full!

It was just about the most pleasant experience I have ever had at any restaraunt. The service was quick,our server was delightful, and the food was very satisfying! I would most definitely say this is my new favorite restaurant
Staff is super nice and the food is excellent. I have 2 favorite places and this is definitely one of them. Don't pass up on this place no matter which location.
Amazing service, friendly atmosphere, and a great place to visit for tourist.

Let me start off by saying that this place has good food. 

Came for breakfast and had the banana muffin and stuffed french toast. I now have a go to spot for breakfast and will definitely be back soon
Great service, and the food was AMAZING! I had the Santa Fe skillet and it was delicious!

Good food, great selection, excellent prices and phenomenal customer service. 

Our server Bree was charming, helpful and attentive. 

Girlfriend got breakfast, I had lunch.   Huge portions. 

The Only reason I can't give five stars is they didn't serve real 100% maple syrup. Nobody gets five stars for breakfast with "table syrup"

But we will definitely be back.  My syrup snob GF will just have to bring her own.

Awesome breakfast. Just a few minutes away from the strip which is a nice break. Waitresses (Karla was mine) are unbelievable and super friendly and attentive (a relief from the soul-less feel of vegas) and food is bomb (and huge portions). If you don't feel like being a food coma and your appetite is not HUGE, you could easily split a dish between 2 ppl . Highly recommend !

Total breakfast fan here and this is one of the few in Las Vegas that truly does breakfast right.  Prices are pretty good and there are always coupons to be had.  Love the Pumpkin banana pancakes and Carrot Cake french toast in the fall!

Good breakfast place for groups of 4. With fairly short waiting times and quick table turnover. 

Service: 5 stars -this place cares about their service on the side of the table they have a happy and sad face that you can switch. If you are unhappy you can switch it to the sad face but if you look around tables are pretty satisfied. 

Food: 4 stars- food is decent but nothing special. Wide selection of almost any breakfast dish you can think of. Most dishes come with your choice of eggs and potatoes. They have seasoned potatoes and hashbrowns.

This is a great spot to catch a quick bite with friends. Easy to break up checks since you bring it to the front cashier.

Everything is good here.
Go here everytime im at vegas because it's cheap and delicious.

I've had the avocado sour cream omelette and the country fried steak skillet.
Both are amazing


service is good as well

Having breakfast at one of my favorite breakfast places in Las Vegas. Had the banana nut French toast which was fantastic. Service by Amanda was exceptional. She was very pleasant, attentive, and helpful in helping with making choices on food selection.
Our server Oscar was awesome! Outstanding service & food! Our breakfast was delicious & portions generous.

Fabulous place to have breakfast. We are eggterians and wanted break from food at the strip. This place was so refreshing. Very welcoming staff, great selection (menu has so many items), good quantity and fresh food.  Kids loved the place!

It definitely made our day!

Never fails... I walk in and am greeted with smiles. I ask for my fav server CHANCE! She is truly an asset! She giggles because I know its a huge menu but the skillets are to die for and she knows what i want every time. What a great memory! Thanks girl!1
Just flew into Vegas and went there for breakfast. Had an omelet, ham, toast & juice. A friend had eggs & blueberry pancakes. Simply put, I would rate this restaurant A+.

It was our first time and we were impressed from the time we walked in, ordered our food and left the premises. We were greeted and seated right away. Sasha our waitress was fabulous. She recommended the ultimate skillet which was delicious. Steak and eggs was great too. You have to try the banana muffin, it is to die for. You can purchase a loaf to go. Fresh squeezed O.J. & their coffee was tasteful and yummy too. This is by far the best breakfast place to go to in Las Vegas. We will definitely go back next time. Great food and great customer service!!! Thx Sasha and The Egg and I staff. :)

I would definitely come back here the next time I am in Vegas! The breakfast was great and our server Amanda was just as great! Nothing better then good food and service.  I am not a big muffin person but the banana nut muffin is a must try!
Perfect last stop before flying out of Vegas. Got a half order of The Works Omelette. The banana walnut muffin was delicious. And they give you the whole pot of coffee.
I got the Texan French toast... It was pretty damn good! Coffee could have been a little stronger but not bad. Our server Alyssa did an outstanding job.

Confirmed: the banana nut bread was AMAZING!  Buttered it up and inhaled it in about 2 seconds flat..........ok a bit of an exaggeration, lets call it 20 seconds.  Had one of their scrambles and it was pretty darn good too.  Would have given 5 stars, but the one thing missing from this place...........is character.  Like alot of other really good breakfast places, it is located in a strip mall.  Food is still great, location not so much.

Delicious! Great variety of breakfast dishes. From different benedicts to a variety of scrambles and omelets. Also non egg dishes like french toast and burgers and sandwiches. Have the country potatoes, they're seasoned and cut into perfect bite sizes. Well worth the 20 minute wait
Didn't care for the blackened prime rib benny.  The meat was diced & the red peppers made it sour :(

Searching for a breakfast joint, we took these reviews to heart and checked out Egg & I.  We were ANYthing but disappointed.  The coffee\/toast\/butter aroma wafting throughout the restaurant was inviting in itself.  Our terrific server, Lindsey, volunteered I could have a 1\/2 order of anything, as I was not up to 4 eggs.  I chose the chili rellenos omelette - PERFECT - and a 1\/2 order was more than I could handle!  My husband had the bandit scramble - DELICIOUS.  Loved that a carafe of coffee was left on my table, so I could serve myself when I wanted more.  Loved that the cost was less than a hotel buffet -- and I didn't have to serve myself!  It is now our FAVE.
This will be your little secret breakfast restaurant. It's amazing. Try the steak and eggs. If you get a waffle get it with whipped cream and fruit

More like 2.5 stars.  This place is ok.  Nothing special.  A bit pricey.  

Went here with my cousin and a bunch of friends on one of many Vegas trips.  My cousin was super excited because she had seen it on Rachel Ray.  I've never watched Rachel Ray, but if this is the kind of place she recommends, then I cannot trust her opinion.

This was another one of those "it's more about saying you've been there, rather than the food" type of places.  A lot of things on the menu sounded great.  
 got the Chicken Enchilada Omelet.  It was ok.
I forgot what my girlfriend ordered, but it sounded fantastic on the menu.  It was ok.
My friend ordered pork chops and eggs.  Looked great.  He said it was ok.
My cousin and her hubby ordered whatever it was that Rachel Ray had ordered.  She was spouting off about how great it was, but honestly, it didn't even look that good.  Her enthusiasm seemed forced.
The other members of our party weren't very pleased with their breakfasts either.

This place is only open until 2 pm.  So you better get there early.  Don't worry about me holding up your table though, because I won't be back.  I'll be at Blueberry Hill, on Flamingo Rd., enjoying a very good breakfast for about half the price.

Just for reference, I don't write 5 star reviews unless they're very well deserved.  But this place consistently rates high with us.  This was out third visit.  We recently visited Egg & I for breakfast with a group of six.  We arrived about 10:30 in the morning.  There was a considerable waiting line.  However, the hostess was very sweet and efficient. The estimated 20 minutes wait was actually more like 10 minutes.  Our waitress (sadly I didn't get her name) was incredible, attentive without being overbearing, quick and efficient.  Once our orders were taken, the food arrived fairly quickly, no mistakes or wrong items.  We pretty much all ordered something different.  I had the house made (not canned) corn beef hash and eggs.  Excellent.  Can't remember what everybody had but all raved about their food.
Avoid the strip with it's lines and cheesy buffets and overpriced breakfasts and check this place out.  Just a short drive from the strip.  Mostly locals and a few visitors.  A gem!

Better than the first time.  We scored a free entree coupon so we made the trek over to this location from the strip.  There was a bit of a wait but nothing too bad... The banana muffin is legit, served warm with butter.  This time around I ordered the huevos rancheros and they were good, very filling, cheesy and tasty.  This is a great place for breakfast.  Looks like they have also won a best cheeseburger award too.  Don't let the line of people outside scare you they turnover the tables quick.

I've been here 3 times though out all the years I have lived in Vegas and it has always been consistent in serving good food. There is always a wait too. Had the Blacken Prime Rib Benny,  it had a great flavor but instead of using a English Muffin, they used a grilled croissant, which I felt made it at little soggy during my last bites of it. Good drip coffee too. 

When you check in they give you a banana muffin.

The waitress was really nice, and even suggested some dives to check out while visiting, and brought each 4 of us one of their banana nut muffins on the house. Not only was it a sweet gesture, the things MELT IN YOUR MOUTH. If this is how they hook you, so be it, they are AMAZING. 

Everyone was more than pleased with their order; I had the philly cheese steak, great meat to veggies ratio, very tasty, and their fries are killer. They put a little something special on them, my guess was season salt. 

For how expensive Vegas can be, this place offers a refreshing break!

We loved there breakfast.
Alot of things to choose from and grt service.
from breakfast burritos and skilletS you cant go wrong with anything.

BOOM awsum place

EVERY time we're in Las Vegas we visit the Egg & I before going home. My friends and I wanted to have a home style meal during our last morning on the strip. Don't get discouraged by the lack of glam and glitz, this restaurant is definitely worth visiting. We were all immediately greeted upon entrance by vibrant and welcoming staff. Our waitress was personable, friendly, and didn't miss a beat, she always made sure we were all well taken care of. The food was out to us in no time and their home made muffins are to die for. Everything is cheaper compared to the strip and the portions are ginormous.

Searching Yelp for breakfast restaurants, I found Egg & I. With four star reviews and excellent quick tips, I had to try it. Arriving around 10:30am, the place is packed (which is always a good sign), yet there was only a 10min wait. Very friendly staff and waiters\/waitresses. I got the Kay's Omelet (w\/added Chicken). I was offered the choice of toast or banana nut muffin. I went with traditional toast. The omelet is simply the best I've ever had. It had the perfect combination of spinach, artichoke hearts, tomatoes and topped with feta cheese. Brilliant

Now, to the matter of the toast. Fortunately, one of my companions ordered the banana nut muffin. Even more fortunate, she offered to share. Not an over powering banana taste, more of a whole grain taste, yet just nutty enough, with a hint of chocolate bitterness. 

While I loved my experience, I can't give five stars, as some in my party were not as happy with their dishes as I was with mine. I do look forward to trying more from the menu very soon.

Terrific local place, varied menu, competent staff, GREAT FOOD, huge portions.  I figured out the LAS is not the cheap place for anything anymore.  Other half had the waffle - which was one of those big, thick, crusty ones- about 1 inch high.  Most places sell the wimpy 3\/8th inch high waffle.  Killer home fries with some kind of chili\/onion powder that came w\/ my two eggs.  I felt our waitress was a little pushy, but she was just doin' her job.  All I wanted was the two eggs that came with potatoes.  She kept asking if I wanted sausage, or bacon.   Choice of English muffin or the 'to die for' banana nut muffin.  Too bad there's no place like this on the strip.  If there was, lines would be 10miles long. Keep in mind, ya need a car to get to this place.  I don't know about public transportation in this area.

If you're looking for a cheaper breakfast option off the Strip, I'd definitely recommend coming here! Call ahead of time, to see how long the wait is. They usually seat people fast, but because it is SO good, you should definitely expect to wait. 

I'm so glad I took a group of 10 of my girlfriends here at the end of our Vegas trip. The portions were humungous and I had to challenge myself to finish my plate. Yes, the banana nut muffins do live up to its hype!! So delicious and so fresh. Most plates actually come with the banana nut muffin as an option, but they'll give you another one if you check in!

Their menu is EXTENSIVE. So if you are an indecisive person like I am, it'd probably help kill your wait time if you take a look at that menu to decide what you want! They offer breakfast sandwiches, french toast, egg bennys, OMELETTES, specialties, and more. I went for the chile relleno omelette and I'm SO glad I did! It wasn't too saucy and the sauce they offer is super good. Their POTATOES. SO GOOD. Thank god they let me get half potatoes half fruit, because the full portion of potatoes is HUGE! 

My girlfriends and I all ordered different items on everyone enjoyed their meal :) I would say you probably can't go wrong with anything on the menu! Definitely coming again to end a Vegas trip. 

Service is great. The interior decor is super cute. Very family friendly!

I spent $15 including tip for a HUGE breakfast so, yes, I'd say this is a very good breakfast deal located off the strip!

This is a great breakfast option off the strip. Took my family here for breakfast recently and had enjoyable experience. 

It's about a 10 minute drive from main casinos, located in strip mall. Popular dining spot for locals and gets packed on weekends. Luckily, we arrived early before the breakfast rush and were seated immediately. Good thing too, 20 minutes after a bus load of people arrived and place was full.

Country style atmosphere and dÃ©cor provide the perfect backdrop for their food. Both indoor and outdoor patio seating is available. Old-fashioned breakfasts are the specialty here, including huge omelet platters, pancakes, eggs benedict and a large selection of house specialties. Prices are reasonable and large portions. I highly recommend trying their famous banana nut muffin. OMG, so good! Super moist and the flavor profile is off the charts. I got mine free with my Yelp check-in. You can also substitute the toast that comes with your breakfast entrÃ©es for a muffin. 

We ordered "The Works" scramble, Fresh Veggie omelet and the Hawaiian breakfast spam and eggs. Everything was fantastic! Served in large skillet, the scramble was yummy. It's loaded with sausage, ham, bacon, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers and mushrooms, served with hash browns and topped with the fluffiest scramble eggs. Enough for 2, I literally devoured everything and no regrets. I loved the taste and texture of the hash browns, lightly crisp and tender. I usually prefer shredded kind, but this was equally nice. Of course, who doesn't love spam and eggs for breakfast? Simple Hawaiian-Pinoy breakfast done well here, served with steam rice. Just the way us locals love them.

Most of the time we usually dine along the strip because it's convenient. Egg and I was definitely worth the drive and waking up early for. Service was excellent too. Our server did a phenomenal job, friendly and refilled our coffee regularly. Still thinking about those banana nut muffin. Looking forward to coming back.

I went here for breakfast on a recommendation and I will be back every time I'm in Vegas, period. Portion size and price mean very little if the food is not worth talking about. This was breakfast heaven. The wait staff was outstanding (ask for Sam if she's there), the service was prompt, the portions were plentiful, the price was appropriate for the size of the portions and the food was absolutely phenomenal. Get the banana nut muffin whether it's included or not. It was so good, it tasted like a dessert. To add butter or anything else to it would be a crime, it was perfect the way it was. My wife had waffles with strawberries and whipped cream. Typically, she does not eat large portion meals without sliding some of it across the table to me. She polished off the whole thing. I had some kind of special that came with four scrambled eggs mixed with bacon, spinach, mushrooms and loads of cheese and some kind of side of potatoes that was eye-rolling awesome. I've been on this planet for over half a century and I honestly don't remember the last time I had a breakfast that tasted this good from start to finish. According to Sam, everything on the menu can be modified or customized to taste and size. This place is almost a reason to go to Vegas if for no other reason. I highly recommend it.
Amanda was awesome! Love this place! The food is delicious and her service was awesome!

When they have a 30 minute wait at 9am on a Thursday, they must be doing something right.  I got one of the skillets with chorizo.  I honestly don't remember which one because I was in a food coma when I left.  I will for sure get comatose there again soon I hope.

My wife and I had discovered Egg and I 18 months ago when we decided to have breakfast after a late night out away from the Vegas strip. After reading all the good reviews on Yelp..we decided to try this place..and we love it so much that we have breakfast here everytime we come to Vegas from San Francisco - Bay Area. 

We have tried several breakfast places on the Vegas strip and it does not even come close to the service, price, and quality of food at Egg and I.  

The Banana Nut Muffin is a MUST try!!!

My wife and I visted Vegas for a week long vacation and about half way through we were craving a good down home breakfast. Once we found and ate at The Egg and I, our craving was no more. We loved it so much we went back a couple of days later. The food was great and the service was just as good. If and when we return to Vegas, The Egg and I will be our place for breakfast.

I am not a big fan of Rachael Ray, but she doesn't get on my nerves nearly as much as she did when she was all unfiltered perkiness. Now that she has been homogenized and Oprah-sized and puts on make-up like Jack Nicholson as the Joker, I am somewhat sympathetic to her insatiable need to be the people's home cook, the pint-sized Paula Deen. Maybe that's why I was rather turned off by one of her Tasty Travels recommendations, the Egg & I on the corner of a strip mall out on Sahara Drive in Vegas. 

Even though it doesn't have the A-frame roof, it's really an IHOP with a country kitchen vibe that seems to draw the who's who of the Convoy-and-trailer-park set. Rachael was giving her thumbs up to this place for all the egg dishes they offer. That I won't argue as the menu went on with variations of omelettes and skillet breakfasts that span the globe and stretch the pocketbook. Jamie W. was being very good and ordered the Original Breakfast Burrito (see photo). However, it was quite a log that came out with a flour tortilla stuffed with four eggs, diced bacon, bell peppers onions, potatoes, cheddar and jack cheese. It came on top of a plate of cubed ranch potatoes and some salsa. 

It honestly tasted like any breakfast burrito, just more of it to justify the entree-level price. I went all self-indulgent and ordered the Blackened Prime Rib Benny, an Eggs Benedict variation which had little cubes of prime rib (whether it was blackened or even prime rib was quite arguable), sauteed spinach, roasted red bell peppers all chopped over what looked like a slice of Texas toast. Two poached eggs lay on top, and I asked for the hollandaise sauce on the side (see photo). Thank goodness since it was the congealed variety that clogs arteries faster than Drano cleans them out. It was on the meh side with nothing hofbrau-ish about the meat at all.

The dish came with the same cubed, packaged-looking potatoes Jamie got, and neither of us had any desire to finish them out. When you order coffee here, you actually get a little pot so they can charge $2.25 for it. Jamie had a glass of milk but it was $2 for just six ounces. Hell, I would have lactated myself for that price. Service was efficient, and even though they have a little egg sign you can flip over to get a waitress' attention, there was no need for it since they seemed interested in turning over tables lightning fast. I'm afraid I will need to second-guess Rachael Ray's judgments on what amounts to good eats on her travels, or else I may be doomed to high-calorie intakes of mediocrity. 

FOOD - 2.5 stars....just thought the dishes were just too generic despite the abundance...it didn't seem human hands touched those ranch potatoes 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...country kitchen quaint if that's your idea of charming 
SERVICE - 2.5 stars...efficient if rather impersonal, no need to flip that egg sign over on a busy morning 
TOTAL - 2 stars....right on the border between 2 and 3 stars, but I need to go with my bulbous, post-benny gut on this one

When your in Vegas and want to venture off the strip of a great breakfast. Just down W. Sahara you will find this gem. 

The food is great the banana nut muffins are awesome. It has a very down home atmosphere and very friendly service. Excellent place for parents with kids and wont break the bank.

Wow! This place was really good! It's located off the strip which is nice - you don't get all the traffic and craziness. We were greeted right away and the place was full, we went on Wednesday morning . We were seated right away and the waitress was very nice and attentive . I had the eggs Benedict with spinach and my husband had the eggs and chorizo . We loved it ! Definitely recommending!! Great service - Great Food and good prices .

Thanks Patrick for taking such good care of us. This is going to be one of my top five breakfast spots in my book. Definitely worth and highly recommend the drive away from the strip for breakfast. There are tons of other great lunch dishes too. Service was great. Dog friendly patio. Food is crazy delicious BTW.
Great chile relleno omelette and the sliced avocado and cheese omelette were very good.
I love this place. We come every time we visit Vegas. The muffins are yummy, the coffee free flowing and the staff is nice. Alexa was great.

I'm so happy I stopped in for brunch today.  I came in with a group of 7.  We were seated quickly  & our waitress, Bree, was awesome!  It was obvious that she loves her job.  Her friendly attitude had a big impact on our experience.  We felt very taken care of the whole time & the food was delicious all around.

This was my first time and I absolutely loved the food and the service. The food was delicious and the servers were very nice. The portion size definitely matches the price. The banana nut muffin and the potatoes were the highlight for me, it was so bomb. Although the wait was long (20 minutes), it was definitely worth the wait!
Great family spot, everyone loved it. Great food and even better service! Will always come back for breakfast when visiting Las Vegas!

Came to vegas for a week and decided to eat off the strip and found this place through yelp.  I was excited to see they served spam, egg and rice.  Came on Monday, June 9th for breakfast and from the time we walked in to the time we walked out we had exceptional customer service by Gia the manager and our waitress, Carole Ann.   They were both very personable.

We we're seated promptly in the back next to the kitchen by Gia.  Carole Ann came by to acknowledge us but would be right back because she had to sing happy birthday at a table.  No biggie as we were on vacation and wasn't in a rush to go anywhere.  

Gia came by and apologized but no need to apologize for the delay.  She came out with two banana muffins for us while we waited and took our drink orders and came out with it.  Those muffins were delicious.  Carole Ann came back and took our order.  I ordered the spam and egg over rice.  That came with a muffin or toast and since we already got the muffin I thought that was it.  But she offered me toast or another muffin to take home, but I declined.   My other half ordered a chorizo skillet.  

The food and service was great and I would have def gone back but my intentions while I was in Vegas was to visit a different restaurant everyday.  

They don't take American Express, not sure if it's just at this location. 

Thank you Carole Ann for great customer service, keep it up and I hope you get to meet Mickey Mouse!!!

Oh cute place and so cozy for breakfast! Waited about 45 minutes as this place was packed!! Good sign right? Right and worth the wait! Had the ham and cheese omelette which was a very generous size and could be easily shared as it comes with a muffin or toast, and potatoes. Yum! My son had the chocolate chip pancakes. Need I say more? Sorry, don't remember what hubby had but I know it was good. Can't go wrong at this place. Prices reasonable considering the portion sizes are HUGE!

great food family environment. They serve big portion , kinna unhappy with their coffee,  coffee should be real hot coffee not cold. Customer service is AAA , lucky we hvae Patrick our waiter.he's very attentive and  took care of our needs like a special guest.The sauce is also good. taste like real home made salsa.

EGGsellent:
-Newspaper style menu that's fun to read and packed with choices.
-Cute egg stuff every where and fun little eggsquisite sayings.
-Huge Portions
-easy parking, no valet necessary as it's off the strip.
-They give you a big coffee carafe so you can refill your coffee as often as you'd like.

Not so EGGsellent:
-Ordered a skillet and it didn't really have the "bacon and onion" in it ... it was all potatos and eggs.
-The potatoes are not good.  They are the little cube kind, and they are just meh tasting.  Considering the potatoes take up the bulk of the portion ... this is the main factor that kept me from a 4 star review.
-Eggstremely slow service when paying.  There was literally a line out the door to give payment.
-off the strip
-Kinda pricey.  Total was $24 for 2 people.

Overall, it wasn't bad.  It didn't live up to the hype. But not eggsactly "rachel ray" worthy ... seriously rachel?  What the hell? (it was featured on her show once)

I HATE breakfast food... And I like this place :) I have found that after a night out, everyone always wants breakfast foods. This is a great place to take your breakfast-loving friends and still get what you want!

Must try:
Muffins- They are to die for! Try the banana nut, AWESOME!
Cincinnati Chili- It certainly isn't Skyline, but at least they are trying :) 
Fruit Plate- Fresh and someone else did all the work cutting it up for me. 

Skip:
Salads - I have tried two different salads here. Although there is enough to feed a family of 4, bigger portions don't make a better salad. I found the chicken really boring and dry. I will be trying something different next time. 

The service: It has always been the same. I get greeted by a friendly person, served by an even friendlier person and bid goodbye by an even friendlier friendly person. I think they have conquered good service. I love their happy eggs on the table :)

The breakfast was great.  Even though it was a sunday and extremely busy we had very little wait time.  Our waitress was fast and stopped by the table often enough we didn't have to try to chase her down.

My wife and I were in Vegas on vacation, and went back to the Egg & I.  We had been there about a half year ago (the last time we were in Vegas).  Both times the food and service were good.  Both time the place was very busy.  Both times we were there closer to lunch time, so I imagine Breakfast time must be even more busy.  The food is very good, and the prices are reasonable (no Las Vegas deal, but normal for a off the strip family place).

Next time we are in Las Vegas, we will be at the Egg & I.

I was here a few months back for EDC weekend and I will DEFINITELY be coming back.

We barely waited at all to be seated given that it was a weekend with a lot of traffic, again due to EDC, even though we were a larger group. It was so great! I had the skillet and my husband had one of their burritos and we were full for the rest of the day!

However, the highlight of our meal was the banana nut muffin! Oh my goodness was it the best muffin I've ever had! I love this place and will be back for sure.

First time here and what have we been waiting for!?! We were seated quickly and our server Alexa was great. Very helpful with the menu and she even made a point to get the kids' food out first. (Big plus for parents with kids that get bored quickly) the food was great. The classic Eggs Benny was amazing (best Canadian bacon I have had in as long as I can remember). We'll be back... Soon!

Probably 4.5 stars, not the best breakfast spot I have ever had In this world but but hands down the best spot in vegas so it gets 5.  This place is also the same as Egg Works and I have eaten at both spots and they are both excelent. 

There menu is awesome with all the regular stuff plus with crepes, omelets, scrabbles, skillets, bennys, and hawaiian breakfasts.  They also have a cincy chili section that I like, I have never had cincy chili for real but I know what it's all about (over spaghetti) and this chili is real good.  You can also get toast or a banana nut muffin with your meal.   

They do everything well and I have never been disappointed with anything but my favorites are the cincy chili omelet, enchilada omelet, and anything with their excellent country gravy all over it.  They have a chicken fries steak skillet that is potatoes topped with chopped up fried steak, topped with gravy, topped with eggs however u want, it is AWESOME.  They also won some awards for their cincy chili burger but I have never had it.   

My good friend and fellow yelper used to think cracked egg was the best place in town and refused to eat here for some stupid reason.  Well we ate here and he was mad at himself for missing out on this place for all these years, don't make the same mistake.

Great brunch, and clearly a locals place. Very friendly service--our waiter gave us free banana muffins because we were first-timers. I got the fiesta skillet with eggs over-easy--terrific, but next time I'd ask for much less cheese. Definitely worth the trip if you're sick of casino food.
Great food and service! I got the classic. Warning: orange juice is $3.25 and you only get one small glass of it.

Egg & I is easily one of the best local brunches in Vegas. The restaurant won't blow you away, but the food might. There's almost always a wait mixed with locals and tourists. Their breakfast potatoes are the best. Don't forget to check in for a free banana nut muffin.

The woman at the front counter welcomed us with a smile & a good morning. We were seated immediately. The service was REALLY fast & perfect. They even have a little black egg you leave out when you don't need anything & you flip it to yellow so the waiters know when you need anything! I think that's a great concept & they should start something like that at all the restaraunts, ever. But anyhoo. I had 'the works.' 2 eggs, their country potatoes(they have a specific name, but it's escaping me right now), your choice of meat and toast. I opted for scrambled with cheese(my go-to), ham steak & cinnamon raisin toast. Everything was perfect! Wonderful after a long night of Vegas drinking. The prices are so affordable too. I will definitely be back, this place is great.

Bacon and avocado!!
This place is fantastic.

WARNING: It is usually busy. While the staff does a great job of managing their tables and seating, expect to wait. It is just that popular.

I would easily say that we received the most amazing service from the most incredible server in the world.  I only wished  i lived in Vegas to get the chance to have brunch here at least once\/week.  the banana nut muffin was very fresh. The Chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes were perfectly fluffy and pumpkin was fresh, and teh chocolate chips were just right (not too much, not to few).  The Fried chicken skillet was also AMAZING!. Cooked just right, with a thick and creamy gravy, with perfectly cooked potatoes, and an egg, just how i asked for it. even the OJ carafe tasted fresh, and it probably wasn't though, but it had me fooled.
Again the prices, service and quality of food were amazing. (only thing is that this particular Egg&I restaurant was a bit far from our Hotel on the strip, but definitely worth the cab ride). Even the General Manager came by our table  a few times to ask how everything was. (my receipt says the  server is Mandy but i believe her real name was thiereny (shes getting married soon)).
And they have an amazing GIVEAWAY trip to Disney
This place is s must for your Morning start.. Today we came on a Monday and it was pleasant not to have to wait a long line..although we would do it any time because it's worth it...

Officially my favorite place for breakfast now.  Those crepe omelettes are some serious stuff!!!  It was funny..we had such a difficult time picking what to eat on the menu cuz everything looked so damn good..it was borderline stressful.  But what's the big deal??  We're going back next week!
Great food, great service.   Found this place while visiting Vegas.  Great American and Mexican breakfast specials.  Great options, great service, great price - get off the strip.
