Fabulous place far from the strip's chaos. The works skillet I got was fabulous and the French toast stuffed with bacon and eggs was one of the most delicious breakfast items I have ever had.
We will definitely be back next time we're in Vegas

This place went beyond my expectations! Food was great and the portion was large. Keep that in mind because I ordered too much haha. The service was wonderful as well, I definitely recommend! I got the sunrise mountain and it was so yummy--however there was so much cheese stacked on top that it was overpowering but if you like cheese this would be a great dish. Would come again!

Thanks to my server, Rachel and the rest of the folks working hard here to everyone's experience remembering. Definitely the next time I come back here, I need to come with a real appetite as depending on what you order, it can fill you up pretty good and quick.

The Egg and I used to be my favorite breakfast place in town. It is now crowded and thefood taste so manufactured.

What keeps me coming back is breakfast with the girls, the banana nut bread (OMG, it's SOOOOO good), and the ranch potatoes.

During the weekends, the wait is up to 30 minutes. The staff is super friendly, they are great at keeping your coffee cup full. Also, what's cool is that when you have an issue or need something they have an egg on the table, you can flip it to reveal a sad, yellow egg. Someone is usually at your table within 30 seconds. It's like they have sonar for these yellow eggs.

The Egg & I serves breakfast and lunch and they close at like 3 PM.
Placed was packed and after having breakfast we know why! Eggs Benedict amazing. Even the coffee was good!

Wow!
Great portions for a great price.
Service was great, very attentive by not annoying.
This location wasn't too far from the strip where our hotel was.
We wanted a descent price, tasty breakfast and thanks to fellow Yelper's I was able to track down this great place.
Our group of four were seated fast and by no time we were all enjoying our breakfast's. 
For our first visit I had the Egg's Benedict Florentine- Fresh spinach atop canadian bacon, two poached eggs & a grilled english muffin, smothered with hollandaise and served with fresh fruit garnish and ranch potatoes. We all left full and happy.
For our second visit I tried CHRISTY'S CINNAMON RAISIN FRENCH TOAST- Cinnamon Raisin bread dipped in a custard batter. Grilled Golden and lightly sprinkled with powdered sugar. Served with Sassy
Apples.
This is a great spot, it seemed like it had "The Regulars", so that's nice to see they have loyal and satisfied customers.

My family and I decided to go into Egg and I after it was greatly recommended by a good friend. Everything was great! There was a descent line at the door when we entered but we were still sat within 5 minutes. Our server was Gloria and she was such a delight and extremely helpful. The food was some of the best breakfast food you can try for the price. On our way out we got to meet Sarah the manager and she was more than kind and professional as she thanked us for coming in and asked how everything was. We will definitely be back!

I had a couple hours on Sunday morning and decided I'd give Egg and I a chance.  I had heard it was pretty good.  My server, Breeannda was extremely attentive.  She made sure my water glass was full the entire visit.  (About 6 glasses worth)  I ordered the biscuits and gravy and asked to have extra sausage cut up and added to it.   The food was really good.   I recommend stopping by for breakfast if you are in the area.  I will be back.

First time here and will be making this a regular breakfast spot when in Vegas. Patrick was probably one of the best servers we've had in a very long time. He greeted us with a friendly smile, recommended their signature banana muffins (which were Ah-Maz-Ing), and always checked up on us.  

Their food is great too and the portions are enough to share so make sure you come hungry. Now keep in mind they can also do 1\/2 orders on omelettes. So instead of four eggs you get 2 which was more than enough. Our family loved everything we ordered. 

This place gets packed so expect a wait. They have indoor and outdoor seating available.

I made a call-ahead for 7 people for around 10:30am on a Sunday....good thing I did because there were about 15-20 people waiting out front to be seated. We arrived about 15 minutes early so we reviewed the menus as we waited. We were given an 8-person table in the back corner of the restaurant.

After being seated I notified our waitress (larger woman with Hispanic accent) that two members of our party were not going to make it so we broke the tables up so more people could sit. Our waitress was helpful in executing the table move without any impact to our comfort. Throughout the meal, our waitress provided us the best service possible, despite the busy conditions of the restaurant. 

The wait for food was nothing extreme and actually pretty quick considering all the people eating there. The food itself was fantastic. Most people at the table did not even finish their plates. My friend ordered the omelette with mashed potatoes....sounds strange but I tried it and it was amazing. 

In the end, everyone from my group was satisfied with their meal and especially with the service. Egg & I seems like one of the go-to places for breakfast in Vegas. I recommend it for anyone...just come early or call-ahead if you have a large group of people.

Stopped by for brunch, before getting on the road to Moab, Utah. 

Service: 5\/5
------------------
The service was good. There was only one bad service experience. One of the hosts that was taking our phone number and name to seat us when ready was very rude. She looked very unhappy, and spoke rudely with very few words: "Phone number....Name....Number of people." We gave her the information and she just turned away. Some what rude. After being seated, our server was very polite and kind, an opposite from the host. It being our first visit we asked for recommendations, and he gave us a number of recommendations, from the stuffed french toast to the chili relleno omelette. Because it was our first time, he brought us free banana nut muffins on the house, as a welcome to The Egg and I! First time a restaurant has done that. 

Food: 5\/5
-------------------
We ordered the stuffed french toast, traditional eggs benedict, and chili relleno omelette. 

Stuffed French Toast: 4\/5
Scrambled eggs, cheese, and sausage sandwiched between 2 pieces of french toast. Was good but not amazing. I found it to be dry, but I'd honestly get it again. 

Eggs Benedict: 5\/5
The eggs were perfect, and english muffin perfect texture. However, a bit heavy with the hollandaise sauce. Overall, probably my favorite entree. 

Chili Relleno Omelette: 4\/5
Cooked perfectly, with lots of flavor. Unique dish with the chilis inside the omelette. Didn't get to try much of it

Habla Diablo Potatoes: 5\/5
Probably some of the best potatoes I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I'd almost compare the texture to McDonalds french fries. They're seasoned with spices and we're very very good!

Banana Nut Muffins: 5\/5
Best banana nut muffins I've ever had! Not too sweet and very moist. One of my favorite items we got.

Overall: 5\/5
---------------
Great value, food, and customer service. Each person costs around $10-15. However, almost everyone I saw left with to-go boxes because they gave so much food!

The Egg & I has got to be the best breakfast dining experience I've had in Vegas. The place is busy because the food is excellent for a really good price and the service is very good.

Food:
1) Banana Nut Muffin was the best I've ever tried so far. You could tell they used a lot of butter because it was so soft and flavorful!
2) Benedict - The eggs were poached perfectly and the hollandaise sauce was amazing. Perfect execution of this dish.
3) Ranch potatoes were FANTASTIC. They were seasoned perfectly and not overly salty. They didn't have that heavy, thick potato texture. It was lightly crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

Service: The hostesses knew how to handle the influx of people waiting and the servers were friendly, helpful, and very efficient. We even got water refills without even having to ask.

Came here with friends for brunch. The restaurant  has a very cute newspaper style menu, a kids menu that children can draw on, and a dog friendly patio.

Their egg brunch options are PLENTY! I ordered a stuffed french toast and it was heaven! The portion was huge and served with warm syrup. Yummy stuffed eggs, ham and cheese. I substituted potatoes with cooked spinach yay^^ My friends all loved their habla Diablo potatoes too.

We also checked in with Yelp and got a free banana nut muffin. The sweetness was just right and it was served hot!

Perfect brunch choice in Vegas!

The reviews for this location are misleading.  This place is dirty. The center railing doesn't get wiped we sat next to dust and insects.  Expect a long wait and minimal customer service. The hostess was probably the most pleasant worker there. I didn't even touch my cup of water, the cup wasn't clean. Won't be back to this location.

First, I loved named " The Egg & I". Waiting 10mins to get a table but good to do it! 
Big portions and good meals!
Service lady "Karla" was a great and easy to asked her any menus. Thanks 
 
We ordered Traditional Egg Bunny and plain waffle with ham. 
You'll get a free Banana walnut muffin from Yelp and another free muffin on table for everyone 
It was a good! 

I'm so full and happy !!!

Ohhh this place is soo good! I've tried the eggs Benedict, ultimate skillet, pancakes and the muffin. Yes, it was a lot of food. Yes, I felt like a heifer after. But it was so worth it. 
I also brought my puppy dog bitch and she sat quietly outside with us. I like this place and can't wait to go back.

great breakfast! portions are a bit more than the average breakfast spot. the hashbrowns are the highlight in their food selection! perfectly cooked and seasoned just right! above everything else the service was superb. very homey feeling as soon as you walk in the door. not sure if it's family owned but sure feels that way. waitress was very attentive and made sure to check on us but also did not over do it and bug us. overall great spot. will definitely return on our next trip to vegas!

I love this place. The food is outstanding. Our server was so sweet and kept checking on us.  I made sure before my daughter left Vegas I would bring her here to have a great meal. Ask for Linnea area and you will be impress with her as well. We'll done!!!!!!

Egg-cellent Food, Egg-ceptional Service! Definitely worth the 20 minute wait on a Sunday morning.  My wife was not feeling well and just picked at her food.  The manager came by to make sure everything was alright, we explained that Ellen was not feeling well, but the food was great.  Without even asking she took $4.00 off the bill.  Now that's Customer Care.  If your in Las Vegas and want a great breakfast, with caring servers, at reasonable price, go to the EGG & I.

They were amazing. It was a 25 minute wait, which they handled smoothly. The menu is inventive, unique,  and enticing, and printed like a newspaper. The waitress was helpful and wonderful, and the manager was reallt great with mt allergies. Even though it was crazy busy, our food came out fast and perfectly made. For coffee and tea, you got your own pot at the table for refills, and the mix drinks were just awesome.

Thank you for a great time, I will definitely be back!!

We arrived in Las Vegas very early and couldn't check into our hotel until 3 pm. I asked my husband to find a local breakfast joint and he immediately found Egg & I. I didn't think it was going to be good but boy was i wrong!

It's located off the strip and driving past it i honestly would not have given it a second look. We saw the reviews and they were good. 

The place had a nice crowd. We were greeted and seated immediately.

Our waitress Tamara (who was helpful and awesome) suggested the Bandito Scramble. It had pepper jack, cheddar, sour cream, chorizo, jalapeÃ±os and of course eggs. It came with a spicy sauce on the side and breakfast potatoes. Oh my goodness, it was wonderful. Oh and it also came with an AMAZING banana nut muffin...pure perfection!

Another thing I liked on the menu that I didn't try was they had Cincinnati chili. I'm from Cincinnati and everybody knows chili is our thing. I'll be back before I leave to try it and get another banana nut muffin.

My husband did great finding this place!

We love the Egg and I every time we eat there. They have an extensive menu and large portions. Today I had something that wasn't even on the menu. My nephew said the stuffed French toast was the best he has had. We had a great server named Carole Ann. She was as accommodating as the servers we have had at the Cracker Barrel, and they have the very best servers.
Ulises was a great server, and the food.... AMAZING! Prime Rib Benny is a must have ;)

This place is delicious. Thank you Patric for being such an awesome waiter.  You were willing to take back my food when you found out the order was wrong. However the food was good I didn't mind. 
Great food. Great service. Than you. Will be back for sure

We searched to a good breakfast place here in LV. So glad we went, the Eggs Benny was delicious and their potatoes were amazing! Our waitress, Chance was wonderful! She was courteous and efficient. We will definitely come back for another yummy meal to start our day in Vegas!
Food was super good, had a very good waitress, very polite, and generous. First time going, definitely get the banana muffin

Liza, our server was great, 5 star service.
Our food was very good.
Portions were large, wife and I shared chicken fried steak and eggs, couldn't finish.
My big appetite teenage son had the three Pig omelet and was stuffed.
Reasonable prices short drove from strip.

This spot has become a regular part of my Vegas experience! 

Their banana nut muffins are INSANE and their egg skillet meals are huge enough to keep you full for the rest of the day, easily. Boyfriend once finished a full chicken fried steak skillet and I feared for his cardiovascular health for a hot minute. As an added bonus, the coffee is delicious and I absolutely recommend the bacon avocado omelette and banana nut French toast. 

Service is excellent and we always feel cared for when we visit. Our server today, Bree, was awesome and attentive!

Ambiance is charming. This place isn't great for huge groups, but it is totally perfect for the family. Expect a line in the morning -- but the wait is worth it!

Wow. Best place to grab a quick breakfast. They have hospitality down to a science, have awesome breakfast muffins, and are willing to accommodate any diet. I was even able to snag an egg white omelette with a grapefruit side for no extra cost!

Great breakfast stop! Had the spinach Benedict really good and you can't beat a fresh warm banana nut muffin. I also tried some of the corn beef hash! Let's just say the next time I come back I'm getting that!
Great breakfast, reasonable price, great service and we were able to watch the football games.

Infinite menu . Besides they'll make anything you want if they have the ingredients in the kitchen . I usually get a waffle with strawberries and whipped cream, sausages and scrambled eggs with cheese and bacon oh and the house potatoes you can't forget about those  . They have something for every taste guaranteed

Breakfast off the Vegas strip.

No matter how much money I donate to the casinos in Vegas, it's all good when I stop by for breakfast before my drive back home.

There's a few things I look for in a great breakfast restaurant.  Coffee quality, food selection, and excellent service.  Well, they have it all!

I always get a half order of the ULTIMATE SKILLET.  Sausage, ham, bacon, mushroom, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and bell pepper - symphony of tastes!  Paired with a nicely buttered & toasted English muffin on the side and it's just bliss.

Their hot coffee served in their signature yellow mugs really hits the spot in the morning.  

There might be a bit of a wait, but the service is great, the food is great, and the coffee is great.  Totally worth it.

We wanted to get off the LV strip and eat at a local place for breakfast so after reading the reviews I chose the Egg & I.
I was not disappointed as the food was fresh and the menu selection for breakfast was excellent. I ordered the veggie omelette and it was served with a huge portion of home fires. As others have commented the home fries are highly seasoned with seasoning salt so I enjoyed them. The veggie omelette had a generous amount of chopped veggies inside and they melt jack and cheddar cheese over the top. The meal is served with toast or their famous banana nut muffin and the muffin is light and packed with flavor. I was very hungry today but I left very full and satisfied. The prices are very reasonable and my breakfast inlcuding a drink came to a toal of $10.00. I will definitely be back on my next trip to LV.

This is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast in LV. The food here is very simple but the taste is amazing. The one thing you must, must have is the banana nut muffin. It's the best! It's warm and amazing with coffee. 

I usually like to eat the Hawaiian food here. My favorite is the island favorite. It's just eggs, portuguese sausage (linguiÃ§a), and sticky rice.

Tried this place for the first time this weekend. We had high hopes, but alas, salt did us in.
Hub's scramble (prime rib) had some tough meat. My chicken fried steak was ok.  Here's the catch.  It was ALL salted so heavily that we couldn't finish anything.  The potatoes were coated with an orange, seasoned salt, the gravy could have easily floated a ship. My two scrambled eggs, which HAD to actually be four because they covered half the huge place, were browned and chewy. I ate the steak after scraping off the gravy.
I've never eaten in a restaurant where the food was uniformly Over Salted. Since I have high blood pressure, this was extra-problematic for me.
Not a good place. Potatoes taste like barbecue potato chips, way to salty. Benedict was watery. Straberry French toast was good but that's it Not sure why the place is highly reviewed.

4 of us got there at 10 am Saturday, 15 min wait but well worth it. You could tell by the atmosphere that it was going to be Good and it was. Our first time there and we all had something different. Oscar our server was great, will definitely go back again.
Our server Lannea made a few great suggestions that hit the spot! Fast service and the best omelet I ever had. Next time in Vegas we'll be coming back.

this little place been one of my favorite place to have breakfast on special occasions,what I like about this place,is the staff,they are very friendly,the place is very gozy,I love the orange juice they serve,and the coffee of course,plus,I love their omelettes.they make it how ever you like.so glad I don't have to go to a casino to get a breakfast .for me and my family.

My dad were in town and for our last day here we stopped at Egg and I, and we were not dissapointed. The service was amazing, our waiter Oscar was polite and friendly and made sure we were taken care of through our entire visit. The restaurant was clean and the food was absolutely amazing. It was probably the best meal we've had since being in Vegas. I wish we would have gone sooner!
The portions are big but they taste really good Karla  was an excellent server. Ask for her when you're seated . I recommend the Works skillet.
This place had a good breakfast reasonably priced.  Thermos of coffee on the table, good service, nothing fancy just a good breakfast.

Always great breakfast. Prime rib benny is my favorite.  Blueberry pancake are the bomb! 
Free banana muffin for checking in on yelp 
Staff is always very attentive and fast service. 
Good job guys!
bomb.com .. And Alyssa was such a good server ... We'll be coming here more often not bad first my first time trying it

The food was great here, but the service was HORRIFIC. The server forgot to place my order all together, but his manager made up for it by coming over to bring something to eat in the meanwhile. We appreciated that much for sure.

The thing that got me was the fact that the server never apologized or even acknowledged the mishap. And even after that he wasn't around to refill drinks. It was very strange. 

I am still giving it a great review because the food was amazing, especially the banana bread.

This place use to be one of the best places for breakfast, but while in Vegas decided to take my husband and he wasn't really impressed by the food and neither was i. In the past the food was hot and good, instead we got warm potatoes that had way to much seasoning salt on them cold sausage and banana nut muffin that tasted like cardboard. So my question is what has happen to this place.......SMH

Came down here from Los Angeles for the weekend and we decided to stop here for breakfast. It was probably the best part out of all my trip. The food was great and our waitress was the sweetest friendliest lady we came across. I would definitely come back to Vegas just for this place!

All I can say is thank you Yelpers!  Hubby and I go to Vegas at least once a year and always try new places to eat each time. We always rent a car and love to explore. The service was great, and the food was delicious!  I had the biscuits and sausage with gravy (can't remember the name of the dish) and my hubby had one of the skillet breakfasts. Yummo!  It was a lot of food and neither of us finished our meals, although I wanted to!!  If you are looking to venture out from the strip I highly recommend. Also, the price is right!
Great service! The waitress was nice and gave us free, warm banana nut muffins. The food was also delicious! I had the special, the Las Vegas omelet. I would definitely go back!
We always make it here when in vegas. In fact, it's a big part of why we come. The banana nut muffins are to die for and our server Stacie was very attentive!

Whether you hear about the Egg&I through word of mouth, or through online posts, you cannot trust a review until you experience the venue yourself.  

Well, if you choose one place to experience, the Egg&I should be it.  This restaurant, provides great service and food.  The servers are knowledgable of their menu.  The food is deliciously prepared and served.  The busier times you will have provide your name to the host stand, the wait has been only fifteen minutes.  And if  your server asks your bread choice, ask for the Banana bread.
Not too shabby. Only complaint I have is the wait, it's rather insane. The food is excellent, I recommend the Veggie Benny for any vegetarians. Their potatoes rule!!!

Very impressive Egg menu. I'm from the south where breakfast is an all day food item and this place would do well in the south. Worth the drive off the strip for breakfast. Excellent service thanks to Liza.

1500+ people couldn't be wrong, so I checked this place out for breakfast. My experience was in line with the rest of the reviewers. Great food and service with a smile. Food comes out quickly, and their menu is interesting enough to come back several times. My new go-to breakfast place in Vegas since my previous favorite is now gone.

This place is an "egg cellent" place to have breakfast.  It is a little bit crowded, but I believe it is because it IS such an excellent restaurant.  The waiters and waitresses are friendly and let you substitute fruit for sausage or ham; which is healthy and a very nice option.  I highly recommend this fabulous breakfast spot!

Ranch Potatoes - HOLLA!  

Need I say more?  Don't ask, just go, order it and eat it.  You'll understand.

Breakfast at this quaint eatery was delish!  I ordered the stuffed french toast with a side of bacon.  Egg bread dipped in a custard batter. Grilled golden and lightly sprinkled with powdered sugar stuffed with strawberry cream cheese.  My plate came with 2 helpings of syrup for reason i can't even fathom.  The goo of whipped cream and strawberry stuff was oozing everywhere and definitely sweet enough to ravage alone.

The wait staff was friendly, helpful and patient (we were a group of 4 adults and 5 kids who couldn't make up our minds with all the yummy food to chose from).

I don't know about you but I'm going back the next time I'm in town and eating the rest of the menu!

I was introduced to this joint during my recent trip to Vegas. A friend who resided in Sin City decided to take me and my girlfriends here after a long night & morning of partying\/clubbing\/gambling. I told him I want a place with bomb breakfast & local flavor. Egg & I delivered just that! 

I had a slight hangover and the hustle & bustle of the busy atmosphere did not aid in it going away. However, I was cured after I had some OJ, Egg Crepe & superr delicious potatoes! I do not know what type of seasoning is doused over those cut up potatoes they servve but it sure did hit the spot! I even joked with our waitress asking if they sell the seasoning (which unfortunately, they don't). The portions are pretty huge so if you don't eat a whole lot like myself, think of sharing with a friend.  I couldn't let my food go to waste so I got a to-go box which definitely came in handy during the road trip back to Long Beach.

I stopped in after all the positive reviews, I must say it was right on par. The food was good, banana nut muffin was great, and the staff was awesome! It's actually the great staff that took the 4 star food rating to a 5 star overall diner rating. Thanks guys!
Great breakfast for a great price. Good quality food and a nice relaxt athmosphere accompanied with excellent service by Amanda our waitress
Huge portions. Great value and brunch food cooked to perfection! I ordered soft scrambled eggs, and they came out perfect! This place knows their eggs. Also home fries was amazing!

So we slept in and missed the breakfast buffets, that left us looking for good local food and bingo! we found Egg & I. Great friendly service, good food, just what we needed, thanks for the hospitality. It was a little chilly but we wanted to be outside on the patio so they pulled over one of the fabulous patio heaters and we were warm and toasty and well feed.

After a long drive from Southern Cali this morning for a quick weekend getaway We decided to stop here because the reviews were good. 

First off, the location is really crappy looking.It almost made me want to find something near the hotel we were staying at. Second,  the food is not that great. It's just big slabs of cheese basically on the omelettes, and there was no flavor. Where's the flavor?! I had a bacon and avocado omelete. It had little bacon bits cooked into the egg, and it was hardly noticeable. The avocado was in a big chunk in the middle. Then it was covered in cheese and had some sour cream on top. Maybe strips of bacon would be better. Then maybe it could be tasted. 
the potatoes are way too salty and taste weird. they definitely seemed like they were frozen. My husband was not impressed with his omelete neither. 

With all the reviews we thought this place would be better. The atmosphere was drab, and the attitudes of the workers was somethin else. Even the manager seemed real fake.

This place is great. Omlettes, pancakes stuffed french toast its all great and they have something for everyones taste.  Our server Karla was awesome!  She described everything we asked about with great detail. I also like that they leave the coffee pot on your table so you never have to ask for a refill.

My new favorite breakfast restaurant in Vegas! Me and my wife are big breakfast people, and this place fit the bill. I got the Mexican in omelette, which was perfectly spicy and packed with chorizo and other add ins. I would recommend if you like chorizo. My wife got the corned beef hash with an over medium egg. We always make jokes about how other "Egg" based restaurants just can't make an over medium egg! Well, looks like we found a place in Vegas that knows how. Just look at that picture! Great job guys!

We had breakfast here by chance (stopped as we drove past) and am glad we did! Huge portions of delicious food, served up by smiling friendly people. The breakfast wrap was HUGE, tasty and oh so filling - I couldnt come close to finishing it, and was barely hungry for a late lunch. My husband loved the little crunchy home fries (think small, seasoned steak fries cut into cute little squares) as well as his omelet.

The Egg & I is on the short list of places to eat breakfast in Vegas.

It was our first time in Vegas and relied on yelp to find out what might be some great places for breakfast. We came across this cute and delicious spot and didn't regret anything! I ordered the banana walnut french toast and my boyfriend had a skillet. Both were extremely good! Potatoes are a must have. I repeat, YOU MUST HAVE THY POTATOES! Also, I asked for my ham to be warmed up b\/c it was cold, but she offered to make me a new one. Minutes go by and turns out they forgot my ham. BUT DON'T FRET! Not only did she get me my ham ASAP, she took it off the bill AND free muffins to go. Yum! Can anyone say, awesome service???

Banana nut muffin is probably the only thing I'd come back for. Service was great as well, but the breakfast was nothing that spectacular or out of the ordinary. I would definitely come again for the muffin though!

My favorite breakfast place . Egg works ,egg and I etc they are all the same amazing breakfast food , beats any breakfast place I've ever been too . Good service even with busy hours opens 5am-3pm . I try and go here at least once everyone I'm in town and always take my friends who all fall in love with it every time .
Always a pleasure to visit when im town. Nice variety of egg breakfast meals to satisfy anyone!
Amanda was great.  The food came out in a flash.  It was very good.  The place was clean and busy, but no wait for 2 people.
Great service.  Interesting menu.  Food was well prepared and tasted good.  Ambience lacking but the food more than made up for it.
First timer and what can I say good quick service,friendly wait staff also thanks to Karla for a great experience definitely coming back

Linnea our sexy server was cute and friendly with a sassy voice.  A jug of coffee with refills provided.  Such a large variety of items for breakfast. Banana nut muffin was warm and yummy. Something new was a mashed potato omelet with jack cheese, green onions, sour cream.  So good.  The potatoes were nothing special.   Overall a good choice for breakfast off the strip.

Before everything else, I would like to give five stars to our server. My mom and I were at the restaurant in the morning of Sept 27th. According to the receipt, the server's name is Card, not sure if that's right...She was pregnant and had some tattoos. Very helpful and attentive, especially considering she was carrying a baby around too!

Back to the food, best traditional brunch place I have been in the States. We tried the banana muffin, spinach\/avocado\/veg omelet, gravy biscuits, pork, and sausage. Excuse me that I don't remember the exact name for the plates. Everything was good, so feel free to order anything that interests you on the menu. But make sure to pay attention to how much you order; the portion is very generous here.

Really enjoy this spot for breakfast. Maybe 10mins Off the strip and places to park 

Food was really good and came out fast, services was very good. Well recommended if you're looking for something off the strip.

This is our favorite brunch spot!  They have the best service and the freshest, hottest, most scrumptious food in town.  We often bring friends and family for a special occasion, or not. :-)  We're never disappointed.  Be warned, they can be very busy, especially on a Sunday. So plan ahead, but even with a reasonable wait, you won't be disappointed!

I finally got to eat @ Egg & I this past Saturday, 03\/30\/13. Monday comes along and I'm back in the office and I read that a car plows into this restaurant. WTF? I hope everyone who was injured in this moronic act a speedy recovery. I also hope they are able to be fully operational again ASAP (if not already). 

Egg & I is located minutes from the strip on Sahara. I believe their other restaurant goes by the name of Egg Works. This restaurant is open everyday but only between the hours of 6am-3pm. We got plastered the night before and somehow were able to wake up and drive our zombie behinds to eat here the next day right before noon. The wait wasn't too bad considering the restaurant isn't too big to begin with. 

Our server Jacky was a sweet heart. She was uber friendly and attentive even when it seemed like the restaurant was chaotic. How many other tables did she have with a bunch of hung over dudes, possibly acting a fool beats the hell out of me. She was holding it down like a seasoned veteran. She started us off with that infamous banana nut muffin. This is not to be missed especially with a cup of joe.

Not going to lie and say that this place serves health conscious types of food. They may have some "lighter" dishes but the menu is dominated by heavy hitters. Everything we ordered was either smothered with country gravy or had some sort of heavy but tasty sauce. We thought of this great game plan to all order our own entrees and add an extra French toast plate to share amongst the five of us. Bad, bad decision. One entrÃ©e is an adequate amount of grub. Anymore, you may want to check your blood pressure.

There are plenty of choices on their menu and as you can imagine, numerous egg inspired dishes. From skillets to classics, you'll find something for everyone. I had the Country Benny, you can look it up yourself. Let's just the menu states, "This one's a heart stopper." Need I say more? That dish was good but I also hated life afterwards. No regrets, it was delish while I was conquering that beast but just be ready for the consequences.

Egg & I is definitely a hit. I can see why locals and tourists flock to this establishment. We ate here and I had to immediately go back to our hotel to pass out and recover in time for night two. Only in Sin City...

Probably the most reviewed business off the strip, what's more inviting than that?

Arrival wait pretty much sucked, did not help that the hostess was on the rude side.

Lo and behold our waitress (Paula) came through to save the day in the service department. She was great from the get go and stayed consistent providing excellent comfortable service that you'd want to get from a breakfast spot after a looooong night out.

Food:

The Check-In Muffin: Meh, nothing great. I'm a big carrot raisin muffin person and this was okay. Complimentary so am I allowed to give it a 2\/5? 

The Big Omelette: If it's not called that then it's some synonym of the word big. How impressive can an omelette be? Order this and you'll find out. The way that the ingredients are actually layered in between the eggs is a unique alternative to the usual blanket style omelette. Ingredients a plus. 4.75\/5

Potatoes: These need a review of their own. Eggs and I let me know I was not crazy for expecting good side breakfast potatoes everywhere else where I've had them. The seasoning extraordinary...cooked to perfection..add a little catsup and you've got the best potatoes I have ever had at breakfast. 5\/5

French Toast: I got hit with an avalanche off the high that I was on. There was something wrong with these. Not so the taste but more of the texture. Even the berries and the whip could not save these. 2\/5

Orange Juice Carafe: It seems bottomless for two, good deal, good taste. Freshly squeezed I think. 4\/5

Not disappointed with my meal here. The hostess and the french toast need to be reworked a little, get her to shadow Paula and steal Blu Jam's recipe, maybe?

Oh yeah, the salsa :\/ taste like taco bell sauce but does not come with a witty packet message

Emily was a great waiter, and I was very happy with the banana moffin free for doing check in, it was as delicious as the one I make, but, I did not like my food, chicken enchiladas has to much flavor, it make you thirsty, the rice was good, the fried beans more less, my husband husbandhad a Bandito Scramble, he liked it but said it was nothing amazing. The coffee was good. The restroom is awful pretty small.

The king of breakfast and brunch in LV. Known for the banana bread, but everything on the menu will make you want to live in Las Vegas only to come back here every weekend. This is a must-go place, no matter if you are in hangover or just chilling with your family. Breakfast here will definitely boost the mood of your party! Recommended!

I LOVE THE POTATOES!!!

I don't live in Vegas but whenever I come here, I make it  point to come to this place. Unfortunately the line is long and it's off the strip, but I honestly do feel it's worth renting a car to come over here. 

This place serves breakfast - and most of it comes with my favorite part (the potatoes) If it wasn't for a recommendation from a friend I probably would have never gone off the strip to make this my now regular pit stop when making it to Vegas!

Beyond that I try to get a bit of everything since I can usually only stomach only so much! I recommend this place!

Came here for the first time on a Friday at noon after reading all the positive Yelp reviews and surprisingly the wait wasn't too bad. The banana nut muffin is to die for and I don't even like muffins like that. I got the veggie skillet and the portions were huge. Also, I'm not sure what they season their potatoes with, but they were amazing. I would come here and get a muffin and potatoes everyday if I could. Parking wasn't a problem because it's located in a big shopping complex with other stores.

After an extensive search for a bomb breakfast I stumbled upon this gem. 
When I tell you the food was delicious...
*moment of silence*
It was damn good. 
I ordered the Corned Beef Hash. Along with the muffin & a side of avocado. 
My BFF made their own omelette which came out looking amazing. 
We chose to take our remaining food to go because we already KNEW this food would bring us back to life after the pool party. 
The service was also really great. Tamara was attentive, sweet & seems genuine which I find rare out here. 

Bomb. 
If you're considering coming...just do it. 
It'll give you life.

I'm a proud Egg and I supporter, I own a bright purple Eggeriffic shirt to rep my new local breakfast jam. I wasn't always that way. I'll explain my Egg & I experience.

I wanted to run away when we pulled into the shopping center, located past that road where the palms hotel is. Its like a used car dealership wasteland on this street. That is how I found this place, while doing some car shopping all morning and finally getting so desperate for food we ventured down the road. Not somewhere you think you find a great breakfast place. Or so I thought.

You walk into what feels like a family style diner greeted by a cute older woman who reminded me of my own grandma. Always a plus.

Get seated and scope out the menu, 
lots of great options for omelets. We loved Canadian bacon or what my boyfriend likes to call bacon from Canada, ordered that. Preferred the waffles over the pancakes. (Learned that from my first trip there.) Order two orders of skillet potatoes (one for me and one for Adam.) They are literally that good. Each bite is a perfectly seasoned little bite of french fry \/ hash brown combination. Fruit platter with your choice of three berries. Lots of orange juice because I'm a sucker for pulp and vitamin c to start out my day. 

After 5 times here I've realized, it's really great for what it is. A alternative for some Denny's or Ihop because I'd rather support a local business owner. This place has breakfast down and I plan on eating here whenever I'm craving those skillet potatoes. Chya Boy!

Wanted to find a local place off the strip for a good breakfast! This place was the spot!! Had the country fried steak and it was one of the best I've had! Our server Karla was efficient and friendly our water and coffees were always full. Highly recommend and will def come back next time we are in Vegas! THANKS KARLA!!!

Hears unbelievable things so had to try it but was disappointed with my ham and cheese omelette. Potatoes were great though. I asked for egg whites and I didn't get egg whites. Place is kindve dirty also. Omelette had WAY too much cheese

Very friendly staff and delicious meals. The only problem is that is high on fat and you have to wait 15-20 mins to start eating. The banana nut muffin is overrated. If you check in with foursquare you can get the muffin for free.

Egg and I offers an awesome array of breakfast choices and the food preparation and quality did not disappoint our party of five.  Arriving about 9 AM on a Wednesday morning, the restaurant was busy, but not unduly crowded.  We were seated promptly and quickly supplied with coffee by the attentive waitress.  Various breakfast dishes were selected and delivered with no undue delay.  Everything was cooked to our complete satisfaction.  Overall a very satisfactory breakfast with no problems whatsoever.
Omg this place is so good.... The staff is great too....my boyfriend and I were in Vegas for a few days and I will say that this was the best meal I had during the whole trip! You got to go here !

Sin City is the playground for to-be-brides, burned-out college students, and exotic dancers galore.  But with the bright lights and a full schedule of gambling, shopping, and drinking you definitely need to start your day right with the most important meal of the day--breakfast. Egg & I is a local favorite and contrary to the restaurant's name they do serve entrees san eggs. *gasp* 

The offering:
*Reuben Sandwich w\/ Fries: The meat was perfectly seasoned between two toasted slices of bread. mmMmmm... Oh and they gave an extremely generous offering of french fries. yum yum! 
*Fender Blender: Some type of egg and crepe contraction which was light fluffy and all around delicious. It came with an asian-inspired sauce which complimented the main course perfectly. Oh and the potatoes were spot-on!   
*Florentine Omlette (Daily Special): Ironically the daily special was not special at all . Instead it was a complete epic fail in my party.  Way too cheesy as the produce was drowning in the gooey sea.   

The food is great, the price is right ($8 average entree), and I'm definitely coming back!
We loved our breakfast.  Bacon avocado omelet and carnitas pork skillet.   Great service by all the staff.   We will be back next time we are in town.

Weekend trip to Vegas and I wanted to avoid the strip and hotel restaurant breakfast scene. Yelp recommended this place so the wife and I gave it a try. 
Pretty busy for a Monday morning. Were seated within 2 minutes, great. Server was friendly and attentive. Wife had the strawberry cream cheese stuffed french toast...yummy. Very good with a nice sized portion. 
I had the corned beef hash. Good stuff, also a nice sized portion. I love corned beef hash and this was homemade. Excellent. Hit the spot. Great food, good service, reasonable prices.
I was not too fond of the location ( I felt it was a bit far) but I wanted to avoid the strip so I guess I shouldn't complain. 
The only CON for me was the lack of info on the server's part. I love pancakes, and always have them for breakfast when I dine out. I asked for pancakes instead of toast and was told they could not do that. Okay, no biggie. Not the first place that does this. However, the pancakes were HUGE and 3 came with the order. I barely even touched them because I was almost full from the hash. I was pretty upset that I dropped $6.25 for an order of pancakes that I had less than 1\/4 of because of the shear size. I feel the server could've let me know they were huge and given me an option. Service is a big part of the experience when dining out. If I wouldn't have dropped $6.25 on uneaten pancakes our server would've gotten a nicer tip.
Tried it for the first time..I had the Veggie Benny and it was delicious. The place was so busy but our server gave us free banana-nut muffins and it was delicious.... highly recommended!!
Great breakfast and great service from Tabatha! The Traditional Benny was awesome (soft yolk) and loved the banana nut muffin. Definitely will be back next time I'm in town.
Never been disappointed in the Egg & I on Sahara in Vegas.  Chance took really good care of us.

HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!! Not only was the food egg-cellent but the staff was amazing!!! When you have a waiter sent straight from Heaven, you just have to bless him with kind words. This soft spoken angel, Brady The Key Manager, was the best we've ever had ANYWHERE!! Everyone was extremely friendly and it was truly a breath of fresh air compared to many other restaurants. If you love eggs and sincerely good people definitely try this place out!!!!

This place is quite old but, they do great food and great service. the crew is so happy and you know you get good food. coffee is always brewed perfect and they have great seasoned fries i always love. their all the omelet are super good and, my wife always try for the breakfast.
Oh what can I say about this place that you haven't already read in other reviews. Great place. Nice ambience. Order anything and it's all good. The hot sauce is amazing and so are the potatoes.

Ate here about 2 weeks ago. The name caught my eye and I read a few reviews and decided to go for it.

The omlettes were just OK.. they say they are 4 egg omlettes, but they were on the small side.. looked like 3 egg omlettes.. the omlettes were frikkin caked in CHEESE.. I like cheese but it was too much! The coffee was ok.. they give you a carafe like IHOP. I like that.. you don't have to bug the waitstaff for refills. The potatoes were good.

I also ordered a short stack of pancakes. The pancakes were frikkin delicious and HUGE! I ate half of them.. 

I'd go back again but it will probably be a little while. I'd get the Pancakes again or try something else like French Toast or a Scramble.

I did leave this place full as if I was leaving a buffet.. ugh!

This is a very homey restaurant, and this is what I imagined a southern hospitality restaurant would look and feel like.  The restaurant is huge! The service is really good, the  food itself is okay, I think is very typical of brunch food, nothing really stood out to me. In addition, I don't like too much egg for breakfast.  The egg benedict that everyone raves about is just okay for because I don't like that they put the crossiant under the bed of egg and cubed rib eye because it made it extremely soggy. Remember to check in for your FREE banana nut muffin

The 3 stars is just based off of the food that I ordered at Egg & I. If I could rate just my sever or the customer service, he\/they would get 5 stars!!!

I was in Vegas for the weekend and got referred to Egg & I by a local. After reading all of their yelp reviews I was excited to try them out! The staff here are really friendly and really quick to try and seat all of their customers. Our waiter was Patrick, and he was so friendly and attentive. I ordered the Eggs Benedict and my boyfriend had one of their scrambles. My boyfriend LOVED his food however, mine was not the best. The sauce was really "oily" which upset my stomach, and the rest of the food was extremely bland.

They do have their own branded hot sauces which are really great. I'm not too sure if I ordered one of items that is not so popular, or I just came in on an off day.

Great food! Big portions! Good value. My wife and kids all had something different and it was generous and good. Lilliana was excellent! Super sweet, prompt and took care of us well. Glad I finally found a Vegas breakfast place that is local and great!

We were here back in June. The food was so good, we went back a second time before we left. The banana bread french toast is amazing, but definitely too much for 1 person (share it!) The wait staff was also really great.

Just off the Strip, this place is a great find. Even though there was a line waiting to get it, we were seated very quickly. The food was excellent!! You couldn't go wrong with anything you ordered. And added plus was the service was super., We had a great waitress Chance that always checked on us but didn't make us feel rushed.

This place is da bomb! No accident it is the best breakfast in Las Vegas. This is the one location that does not have mimosas FYI. Had the Veggie Benny Works and it was beyond delicious. Huge chunks of avocado, grilled tomatoe, spinach and eggs done perfectly. Only improvement would be to have the English muffin more toasted. Coffee looked pretty watery but it tasted good. Service was excellent in spite of them being PACKED. Worth the 20 minute or so wait. A definite must visit next time we're here!

Visited this place the last time in Vegas.  I have to say I'd recommend it. It's in a little strip mall way off the strip, but worth the drive. Everything tasted great and the service was really good.
Always a great breakfast and super service. They give you the whole pot of coffee! Banana muffins so good and great deal! Portions are huge. So split if u can.

Erin was great. Attentive, quick, and friendly. Would love to come by when I am in Vegas again.

I had the Waffle Works, which came with eggs and a choice of meat. I had the turkey bacon. Delivery was prompt and service came with a smile; always a good thing to see in the morning.

Good aside, this place has a large dining room and an outdoor seating area with mist, so you don't cook outside.

My 300th review, and what best celebrates that then with a review for the best darned breakfast\/lunch joint in TOWN! I'm from San Francisco, and I wanted to eat somewhere OFF the strip. (I was staying at Vdara). So I yelped Egg and I, and ventured off the strip with my rental car and my husband. My husband of course was a bit hesitant to venture off the strip, but he was SO happy I found Egg and I. (We ate here every morning of our 3 day stay). It was seriously that good.

We ordered-
breakfast burrito (ordered with egg whites and light cheese) A+
chicken fried steak: A (better to get sauce on side IMO)
chicken omelet (it had a "special" name to it) A+
Denver omelet (ordered with egg whites and light cheese) A+
whole wheat pancakes (HUGE ORDER!) A+
Portions are big, so don't order too much!

Service was great! We had the same server all 3 days. She was surprised to see us back on the 2nd day, but was just laughing when she saw us the 3rd day. A bit funny I know :) She made sure our visit was pleasant, asking if we needing anything. The only thing I needed was help walking out their door, since I ate so much. 

I hope Egg and I continues to serve great food. Sadly we don't live in Vegas, so we can only visit when we need to sunbathe and gamble :) So that's twice a year, hopefully more!

Thanks Egg & I, for a 5 STAR experience.

Looking for a place away from the strip for breakfast this is the place. I've been here s couple times and haven't been disappointed, I'm a huge breakfast kind of guy. I've had the chili omelette it was big portion very flavorful, also the square potatoes are seasoned well. Don't forget to check in you get s FREE banana muffins which is to die for.
 
Update:
Today I tried their country fried steak it was tender and delicious

* Saturday breakfast
* Arrived 10:45am
* Approx 25 guests waiting inside and out
* A table for two took only 10 minutes

I've been wanting to try this place for a while  now, but the crowds and the wait discouraged me from trying. All the good reviews kept this place on my radar, so when a friend wanted to try somewhere new, we came here. 

The wait was not bad at all - especially because as we waited, we had the menu to look over and wow, there are lots to look. Eggs benedict, omlets, pancakes, skillets and more. 

Today, I went with the Crazy Chicken Omlet ("you're crazy for not trying it"). It's a plateful - so much so that we got a box to enjoy it later. 

Outstanding service - They even have happy\/sad face eggs you can display on your table to signal for service

I would probably come here again and again to try the rest of the menu.

SO DAMN SALTY. HOLY COW.

friends wanted to try this for lunch when we were in the area and i had high hopes for this place. wait for a little over 10 people was a long wait as this place is super busy. once we got seated we noticed the place was packed and our service ended up being horrible. i guess they utilize these egg signs on the tables to indicate if we need help or not and look. we were the unhappy eggs of the place. sat down and ran out of menus. we waited for over 10 minutes then got menus. after we all decided what we wanted to order it took another 10 minutes to get someone to help take our order. the guy who took our order kept hitting my friend's chair as he took his order over 20 times. after we ordered our food took an okay amount of time to come out. once it came out no one could eat because they ran out of utensils and he had to ask wishing a 15 minute period three different waiters to get us utensils (how long could this possibly take?) then we ate our food. EVERYTHING WAS SO SALTY.

i had the burger and fries (i know who gets a burger here but its what i wanted and when you have such a large selection it truly suffered). my burger came WITHOUT onions. i was confused had to ask the waiter if they give onions and he was like they should. patty was cooked with no seasoning at all. bland. tomatoes were frozen. nothing special on it like damn i know its a plain burger but its so bad... NEVER GET THE BURGER. fries were the most salty thing I've ever tasted in my life. like wow. I'm a person who licks my plate clean and i didn't finish this plate at all. biggest waste of my money. i tried my other friends dishes and we all agreed all the dishes were salty. not acceptable.

don't recommend unless you want salty ass food for days.
one star is just for the free yummy banana muffin for checking in...
Best customer service ever! Tabatha was our waitress and she was amazing! She anticipated our needs and enhanced our dining experience. The food was great. The service was great!

Love this place. Great diner-style breakfasts along with some Mexican-inspired section. Also lots of veggie-heavy options, which are delish. Really excellent service too. Despite crowds and lines most days, I have never had to wait more than 15 minutes. Highly recommend for a great off-the-strip breakfast!

Looking for a hearty meal while in town, EGG and I does not dissapoint. Enjoyed the Bacon omelette w\/ potatoes and side of biscuits and gravy. Split the meal with my wife. Omelette was good, potatoes seasoned and crispy and buiscuit was flaky and soft gravy perfect. Everything served hot and quick. Also checked in and got a free bannana muffin served warm and fresh loved every bite. Plenty of seating here come early gets busy on the weekend.
Our first time and we will be back every time we come to Vegas. Excellent food great service. Huge menu and all good

Egg & I makes for an amazing breakfast spot -- unbelievably savory morning foods. The menu is very extensive, which is surprising, because they do most of the items on the menu VERY well.

Between the 4 of us that tried Egg & I, we each got different dishes and were all very happy with the food. The portion size is huge as well. If you're not that hungry, share with someone. The omelettes are made with not 1, not 2, not 3, but 4 eggs. FOUR EGGS. It's a beast omelette among eggs.

Three things I will highlight: The eggs benedict, the banana nut muffin, and potatoes.
--Eggs Benedict: Order this and you will not be disappointed. The hollandaise sauce that's drizzled over the eggs is something that most places mess up, but at Egg & I, it's made to perfection -- smooth, creamy and seasoned just right.
--Banana Nut Muffin: They give this to you when you order and omelette, and don't miss out. It's the most airy, soft, moist -- yes, moist -- muffin you'll ever eat. It's like they fold air into the batter before baking. THAT GOOD.
--Potatoes: MY GOD. These are the best side of potatoes I've ever had. I'm convinced they have to be fried, but I'm not sure. The exterior is exquisitely golden crispy with a perfect seasoning blend on the outside. Best potatoes west of the Mississippi; hands down.

Pros: Breakfast food for gods
Cons: Can get busy, limited parking

Amazing find thanks to Yelp. I ordered the works skillet and it was amazing! The banana nut muffin is out of this world. Great place to eat while in Vegas for sure. Worth the drive outside the strip. Karla was the best server!
Excelent food and service i wish know where i can buy the habla diablo sauce

Visiting Las Vegas for the weekend and saw that this place had some pretty great reviews. People weren't kidding, it's FANTASTIC. Our server was Liza and she was SO attentive, kind, and helpful. True definition of a great waitress. Everyone's plate was clean at the end of breakfast. I was very impressed with this place and will definitely seek it out again when I'm back in Vegas.
Awesome service! Delicious food! First time here glad we went. Best banana muffin I've ever had!

WOWWWWWWWIIIIEEEEEEEEE!

that's what I felt when I put the stuffed french toast in my mouth! and this is what I looked like O.O

I came here once before and got a healthy omelette. I wasn't thoroughly impressed with this place, but let's be real, how yummy can anything healthy get? But I decided to give it another chance and decided to try one of their signature dishes. THE stuffed french toast: french toast stuffed with egg, sausage and cheese topped with powdered sugar. It's a heavenly mix of savory and sweet, especially dipped in maple syrup.

Most of their entrees come with their homemade potatoes. They're lightly fried to give a french fry crisp and cajun-flavored that makes it taste like Lay's BBQ chips!!

This place is better than the all time popular Hash House A-go-go!! It's as good as breakfast can get!!

Best breakfast ever!!!!!!
Banana but muffin!!
Eggs Benedict!!!
Blueberry cashew pancakes!!!!
Everything's awesome here!!!!

The Egg and I was good but unless you have a car, not worth the trip off the strip.     Perhaps we were spoiled by our visit to Hash House a Go Go earlier in our visit but the Egg and I was a bit disappointing after all the good reviews that we've read.

The banana nut muffin is worth a try and the omlets and skillets were good but definitely nothing special.    As others have noted, the potatoes in the skillet were very salty and definitely not the highlight of the meal.

I love, love, love the Egg & I. I could live on the Works Ranch Potatoes for the rest of my life.  Today I wanted a salad. I looked at the menu online and decided I was going to order the Twin Salad. When we got to the Egg & I, the salad was not on the menu. I told our waitress, Karla, that I saw the Twin Salad on the internet but not on the menu. She said it was still available and that it is one of her favorites. Thank goodness I asked! The tuna salad never disappoints and the chicken salad was terrific too. Karla made sure there were no sprouts on my salad and was super attentive. I accidentally left my banana muffin on the table and she called me back. If I could give Karla more than 5 stars, I would. I will always ask for her.
Great breakfast! Had the chili omelette and our server Ulisis was very polite and professional! Send him to Disney, part of an in house promotion for them!

Well worth the drive off the strip. Service was good. Lots of menu items available. We had breakfast. We waited approximate 20 minutes on a table at 1:00 PM. It is in a strip center ,  so parking was kinda a problem but again I would recommended this restaurant.

My wife and I were looking for a place to celebrate our anniversary. I found Egg & I by looking on here. 

We had to get the bus as we were staying on the strip but it was well worth the journey! This place is amazing! 

My wife had the breakfast burrito and I had the corned beef hash with poached egg. My wife devoured his and said it was fantastic, mine was so good that I can't find the words. 

I was expecting the sort of corned beef you get in a tin, I was soooooo wrong! This was real pulled beef! My eggs were perfectly poached and I cleared my plate which is rare!

Our server was a real asset to the restaurant, so good at his job. When my wife told him how we had found out about the restaurant he brought us complimentary muffins which were mouthwatering. 

We had a massive jug of coffee that was just perfect! I can't recommend this place highly enough, the food, service and value for money are spot on! 

We will most certainly be back here.

I usually don't give 5 stars, but I just had to! Great food but also awesome service!! Our server Lilly was very welcoming and gave us such great service! After eating some brunches in the LA area, I can say that this place was one of the best brunch places I've had!! If you're in Vegas, you must come here!! Also the banana nut muffin is amazing...

O-M-G!! Get yourself the banana nut muffin here! It was so freakin good, I ordered a banana nut bread to go! Yes, they sell a loaf, if you want to take it home and savor it. The banana nut muffin comes with some of the meals, but if it doesn't order it. It comes to you very warm and moist and it was one of the best things I ever ate! I swear you not. 

Anyways, enough of the muff fin because the food was good and service excellent. I ordered the stuffed french toast which included scramble eggs & ham stuffed between 2 thick toast. Man of man, it was alot of food cuz I think they used 4 eggs and then u top it off with syrup. They also had the alot of ranch potatoes that came with it. YUMMY! 

My friend ordered the chicken fried steak skillet. I tasted some of it and it was delicious. The gravy that came with it was just really tasty. I was hearty and I would order it next time...=) 

The service was great with a egg-sign on the table if you wanted a server to come by if you needed anything. You flip it and any of the server who sees it will come to you. NICE! 

This was a great place for brunch and I will be back for the banana nut muffin alone!  A much better brunch place that Hash a go go.
Great place great workers. Group of 7 and fast service
The banana nut muffin was amazing, worth it alone for that. Big portions and really good breakfast food with many many menu options.
Yummm!! this is a great breakfast place. I always go for the waffles, but you pretty much cant find a bad meal here.
Thank you so much Alexa for your service you did an amazing job on serving us and being concerned on our order we hope to come back and have you as our server again.

Found another bomb breakfast place in Vegas!! this place is on the Zagat list so that's why it gets a lot of ppl there every morning!! we ordered the steak benedict n the corned beef. Let me tell u this... the steak benedict was sooo good lots of steak in it so I was really full after! but the corned beef was even better!! My gf ordered that one wanna swtich with her hahah kinda far from the strip but its worth the drive tho!!

Patio seating is nice, if u dont mind a few flies. Very nice staff so far. I really enjoyed my meal. The home fries are good and so was my veggie and bacon omelette. I will come back next time im in town.

I was looking for breakfast off the strip and picked this place based on yelp reviews, but I cant agree with the consensus at all. I feel this place is way overrated. The food was smothered in cheese, the potatoes were from frozen and  we were handed the check when we werent even half done with our breakfast. We felt rushed and left feeling heavy (food) with indigestion (food and being rushed out). Will not be returning.

I have been a fan of this place for ever.  It is one of the best places to go for breakfast in Las Vegas in my opinion.  The food is made hot and fresh.  They have daily specials and they even make there own banana nut muffins in house.  The works potatoes are amazing a man could survive on these alone. 

My favorite items on the menu are the omelettes, skillets and also the biscuts and gravy.  I have not tasted any thing I have not liked at Egg & I.  This is a must try place in the city.  Enjoy.

Wow just wow I wish they had this place where I live. Every time I come to Vegas I will come here even if I have to uber here I will do it. So worth it for the quality and tasty food. Even my parents loved it that we had to go two days in a row to confirm it was good. 
Come in and was seated right away. Service is nice and friendly. They leave the pitcher of coffee on the table which is nice to. First time here the waiter offered us there famous banana nut muffin. We don't really eat muffins but we finished this in no time it was that good. I haven't had anything like it to be honest. Same goes for my parents they never eat that stuff but boy did they love it. I ordered scrambled eggs with mushrooms tomatoes and spinach. My dad ordered the Mexican omelette and my mom ordered scrambled eggs and potatoes. The potatoes are to die for. The best I've had. Must be the seasoning but damn it was that good. The eggs were good the toast was good so I need to say more. I couldn't finish it good portions. All around we left satisfied, full and not heavy. We were able to stay full for the rest of the day till night time. Overall highly recommended because I don't really rave about breakfast but this place was that good

Get ready for an eggcellent time (sorry, I couldn't help myself). The menu is extensive, especially for first timers. Egg & I has perfected its mastery of anything egg, and we are thankful. The side of potatoes that usually comes with dishes is no less of a star, as is the delicious banana bread muffin. Service is wonderful and everyone who works there hustles with joy. If you're a local, make this your local.

Amazing food and service. Probably the best I've tried. A true all timer.

Earl, hope you get to meet Mickey Mouse soon. Lol
So bomb! Got the apple walnut chicken sandwich with fries. Fries were a little over seasoned but sandwich is so good.

I found this and bookmarked it prior to our trip.

Food was great and if you check in you get a banana nut muffin - my hubs and I split it prior to our meal arriving.

Very delicious.

Staff was extremely friendly.

Food was great - they only do pancakes in 2 so usually my husband substitutes the toast for one pancake.  They don't do that here.  He enjoyed the pancakes and also enjoyed his Chicken fried steak order.

Portions are very large I could have split with him.

I ordered a ham, bacon, sausage skillet it was super yummy and a glass of OJ. 

The OJ arrived late - however being pregnant I wasn't sure if I had really ordered it.  My husband didn't hear me order it so I thought I didn't so that is why I didn't ask the waitress.  

Everything was very enjoyable and I will be back next time I am in Vegas. :)

Great service and the food was all pretty good. Everything came out correct. Three stars because the "prime rib" is a joke. Call it something else or take it off the menu. That is not prime rib. More like little cut up pieces of sirloin.

We came here by default because the Pepper Mill had a 2 hour wait.  The wifey found this on Yelp, and we were so glad we came here.  Great breakfast food at very reasonable prices! I had the prime rib benny and the wife had the veggie benny. Both were delicious!  The wait was not bad and the service was quick.  If you're looking for good breakfast without going broke at the buffets on the Strip, I highly recommend this place. Way better than the Pepper Mill.

Great little local place for breakfast. The banana nut muffins are great! The corn beef hash is also very yummy. Bree was our waitress and she was wonderful, very attentive. Overall a great spot for breakfast.

Very friendly welcome and service by Thanayra, food excellent: Waffle works & sausage verygood, "half" pancake stack (half is a szrong understatement though...) but pancakes a bit on the heavy side, could be more fluffy, Veggie crepes with avocado fulling excellent, chili omelett really very good well spiced, i particularly liked their "works potatpes"...
The best breakfast place in Las Vegas! Was looking for a great affordable place and we found it. We tried the omelets, the classic breakfast...it comes with a yummy muffin. It is also Pet-friendly.

Always a favorite! Every time we come to Vegas we come here on Sunday morning! The wait varies depending on the time you come but it's always well worth it. 

This time we got the Stuffed French Toast and it was amazing!

The banana nut muffins are always warm and fresh and the diablo skillet potatoes are perfect!

Our waitress, Liza, was awesome as well. Very attentive, friendly and fun!

I didn't take pictures because we are so fast! Maybe next time! 

Thank you Egg and I!
Bottom line: top notch service, easy parking, mega delicious food - even on a super busy Sunday morning. Come hungry!
Breakfast and service was great. Large potion sizes and the atmosphere was comfortable. I'll definitely return for another visit.

This is my second visit; the first one was 5 years ago. The food and service are still as good as I remember. The choices here are endless so it's hard not to find something you'd fancy. I had the Country Fried Steak with 2 sunnyside up's, and polished almost everything except a small portion of the potatoes. If I had to point out anything, I would wish for some veggies on the plate. Otherwise it's great! Also, don't miss out on the banana nut muffin! Our server was Carole Ann, and she made sure we were great throughout the whole meal!

I was sort of skeptical about eating here because it just looked another midwestern chain breakfast place.  I had the eggs benedict.  Really good and the eggs were perfect (not overdone).  My fiance happily shared the banana muffin which was really tasty.

What has happened to this place? Was so good when I lived here but has now gone down hill big time. The hostess screwed up and continually skipped people on the list, a waitress with very poor English and talks at a volume like she is in a night club. Food is still good though.

Loved this place for breakfast off the strip!!!  Wish there was one in San Jose!  Check out the back page for the Hawaiian Portuguese and eggs.  IT was awesome!  Mom (old school Hawaiian Japanese) loved it big time with eggs and 2 scoops of rice!  Coffee and banana muffin was excellent.  We bought one to munch on the plane ride home.  Excellent friendly service.  Definitely a can't miss in Vegas!!!
Every time we come to Vegas, we have to stop here! The best breakfast spot by far. Off the beaten path, but definitely worth the drive. Great service too.

Superb, friendly service. Outstanding fresh food. Most breakfast places are ok...this is great. Leave your strip hotel and eat here. Prices are more than fair, portions are large. Biscuits and gravy were so yummy, fluffy ...omelette was drowning in wonderful cheese and veggies.

Believe the hype! Their food is generous in proportions & they offer "healthier" ways to have your meal prepared (like using cooking spray vs oil or substituting egg wholes for egg whites only). 

All the times I've come here, the service here is great and the wait is never too long! When I came, I was worried that we were going to wait for a while because there were many people waiting but we got seated within 20 minutes. 

I ordered a ham, cheese, avocado, spinach, & mushroom omelette with potatoes and a banana nut muffin. I love that they have Cholula as an option for hot sauce haha! 

Tamara, my server, was great! I definitely recommend eating here for breakfast! 

PS. When seated outside, if it is a hot day, they have the mist going outside so sitting outside did not feel uncomfortable or annoying at all. 

Don't forget to check-in to get your free banana nut muffin!

Eggcellent food, had the breakfast tostada and it was fantastic! DH had a skillet with corned beef hash. He liked it very much. Most of all the service was top notch! Raul was great! Friendly, funny and personable. This is a busy place, we are out of towners and this place treats you like family. Must visit while in town. Will return.
Amazing breakfast I had have in a while I appreciate the kindness of the waiters. Fantastic food they have ill definitely be back.

Skillet breakfast of seasoned potatoes, melted cheese, eggs, bacon ham and sausage is yummy delicious, worth sodium cholesterol detox for rest of week :) Banana nut muffin warm, moist and fragrant. Generous plate, be prepared to fill tummy... Friendly helpful server Paula tops a happy brunch!

It was worth driving off the strip to eat at Egg & I. There's no reservations so expect a long wait on the weekends. The portion size is huge and I really enjoyed my hearty Works skillet breakfast. We were all very surprised that they brought out a mini bottle of champagne for the mimosa. That's really generous and the bottle was very cute. Price point is cheap especially compared to places on the Vegas strip.

The husband and I were in town for the weekend looking for a good spot to have breakfast at. Good thing I looked up on yelp first because it was so good!! I had the chile relleno omelette with the works potatoes on the side and it was very good. The husband had the works omelette and it was tasty as well. If your in town try this place out. We will definitely be coming again when we are back in the area visiting. It was packed but all worth the wait!!

This local hot spot takes pride in scratch made food. Ive been eating here for a decade & am happy to say they have added several new locations. Im addicted to Brad's cincy chili. Its beanless, sweet, smokey, & mouth watering delicious. I always have the 4-way, noodles, chili, cheese & onions. 5-way adds beans. I do not like kidney beans & dont like them forced into my chili. This dish is enormous & inexpensive. This dish is made with love, plain & simple. The entire staff is always welcoming. They know how to treat their regulars & irregulars.They have a prime rib benedict, health conscious items. When i eat there i am far from health conscious. i am down right unconscious & barbareick. They never laugh or stare when i have a couple entrees going at once. What can I say, options are hard cause there are so many good ones.

I always loved the Egg & I. My dad used to take me here when I was a child, and I've been coming back ever since. I drive about 30 minutes to get to this particular location.

I had an egg-crepe with mushrooms, bacon, and cheese- breakfast potatoes and banana bread sides. Although I wasn't impressed with the "crepe", it wasn't the fault of the cooks. The eggs came out perfectly cooked and of course I polished off every morsel of fried potato on the plate and considered picking a couple cold ones off the floor that have been there since we stopped in. YES- THAT GOOD! So back to the crepe, it was like trying olives for the first time in a restaurant and deciding you don't like olives. It's not their fault you don't like olives.. I don't like egg-crepes.

The banana nut muffin.. Oh man.. Would it be terrible to walk in there and order a loaf of banana bread and just eat it all for breakfast? Probably for your arteries, yes- but it's damn good for the soul.

Everything here is delicious. EVERYTHING!

came to this place 2 times in a row I'm from California and I wanted good breakfast lunch after having lots of drinks the night before and I couldn't of picked a better place the staff is super friendly and they remember who you are felt very welcomed 
one of my servers was Alexa very nice and I can't remember my other server for Saturday but she has curly short hair super nice. omg the food is amazing I has the mexican omelette with OJ and my husband had the 3 pigs or 3 meats omelette the next day I had the same thing and he had a bacon burger which he loved. I will decently go back .also their works patattos are the boom .

Pretty good place, very busy even on a Wednesday morning, but we were able to get a table within 5 mins.

Veggie skillet was pretty good. You can get half portions which was perfect size for 1 person.

Banana pancake was okay, I'd rather have the banana slices on top instead of smashed into the batter.

You get a Banana nut Muffin with the free check in, but I wasn't a fan of it.

Customer service was a bit slow and forgetful, we had to remind her of a few things more than once.

Writing this review makes me feel like an old man because all I am going to do is complain about how salty my meal was.  I had the chicken fried steak skillet.  The dish consisted of eggs over medium over a layer of sliced chicken fried steak on top of a layer of potatoes all smothered with a coat of gravy. 

I love greasy and unhealthy foods in general but I am starting to think that my taste buds are slowly changing.  The meat was dry and salty.  I had to continually dip the chicken in the gravy to get some moisture and to mask the salt away.  The potatoes were even worse.  They were doused with a heavy coat of seasoning salt.   I considered wiping each piece of potato with my napkin so that they would be edible.

I drank a lot of water that day.

I do want to mention, however, that service was nice and my wife enjoyed her huevos rancheros.

Ohhhhh... Banana nut muffin was quite good.  It was moist but not very fluffy.    My new old man self suspects that something not too healthy was used to get it that moist.  Sometimes not knowing for sure about something like this is better.

We stopped here on our way out of Vegas heading towards Zion NP. The reviews were rather good and I can see why! This place is a nice little quaint area in a strip mall. Doesn't look like much but it's definitely worth entering. 

Definitely get the homemade banana nut muffin-it's moist, not too sweet but sweet enough with the right amount of flavor between banana and nut. They offer this with most of their breakfast items. I ordered the veggie omelet with slices of avocado-delish! Bacon was crispy and done-I don't like wet partially done bacon. Coffee was ok, not great but not bad so it worked. 

Service-ok. No smiles, just business as usual. And we sometimes had trouble getting the waitress to notice we needed more coffee and water. This is why I'm only giving this place four stars.

Various choices of food to order! I used awhile for browsing the menu (want to try everything!) I'd ordered a blacken prime rib Benny and my honey got a egg stuffed French toast. Both are delicious!! And we've checked into Yelp to get each of us a free banana nut muffin which taste good too! Our server Amanda is great! She carries a big nice smile in front of every customers :) not that long waiting time (I arrived at 12:30pm and had around 30 minutes wait which is totally worth after I tried) will definitely visit again next time when I come to Vegas! Btw, hope you can win a trip to Disneyland Amanda! You deserve it ;)

Came in today, 7\/20\/16 and had the absolute best experience.
