The food was excellent, atmosphere was great, and everything was really decently priced but what really put this experience above and beyond was our sweet and personable server Tamra. She was kind, quick, had perfect recommendations and maintained several tables with this level of excellency. I saw her make each of her tables laugh, and made my friend and I feel at ease even though we had kind of obnoxious and high-maintenance orders. I would return if I lived here just to be served by Tamra. I am impressed on all levels!

Great breakfast here the first time we ate at here, but the second time seemed like the staff was either overworked or very inexperienced.  Our table of 10 didn't have a waitress at it for 10-15 minutes, the food was good though, albeit it that too came out extremely slow.  Overall it was a good experience, but we'll see the if we come here a third time or not...
Great breakfast and service!  Amanda was one of the nicest waitresses we've had in a long time.  Stuffed French Toast was great!

Saturday morning in Las Vegas, really needed to score a solid breakfast. The eggs benny florentine was incredible, but the potatoes that came with it made the meal. 

Waitress came by to remove our plates and we just growled at her :). Sh realized we had a couple of potato morsels left and backed away.

A great place to stop if your hungry for breakfast or lunch. We have had the omelets and  they are really good! We have been here numerous times and we have never had any complaints at all. If your visiting Vegas its a great place to go to get off the strip.

This breakfast joint is a must have for anyone visiting Vegas. When I go on trips that involve Vegas, I've started planning the itinerary to let me go to Eggs & I for breakfast. It is a slight trek from the strip, but totally worth it.

For my most recent visit I got the Ensenada Burrito and my wife got the Banana Bread French Toast. The Ensenada Burrito was a recommendation from my server Amanda and I'm so glad I listened to her. The burrito was delicious. Tasty meat and eggs in the burrito and topped with a healthy amount of cheese. Plus, it came with a side of their potatoes (what they call habla diablo seasoned potatoes) which are some of my favorite breakfast potatoes. So good. My wife's french toast was sweet and delicious. The service was top notch. Amanda (our server) was cheerful and seemed genuinely excited to help us figure out what to eat.

Oh, and they have this black\/yellow egg heads on each table to notify the staff if you need help (Black smiley face = you're ok, Yellow frowny face = need assistant). The staff watches this like hawks. Each time we flipped it, a staff member (not just your server) is right there to help. We were in a rush and needed the check... flipped it... 5 seconds later a staff member was there... 30 seconds later our server gave us our check. It was awesome.

Overall, I can't say enough about this place. It is one of the best breakfast places in Vegas (if not THE best). The wait is quick, the service is great, and the food is top notch.

This is a fantastic place to go for breakfast, especially if you want to spend a little time off the strip. The omelettes are amazing and loaded with cheese and toppings. One of the unique things they offer here is a fresh baked banana muffin that you can choose as an option over toast for a side. Take the muffin. It was still hot and tasted delicious. Large portions of very good, homemade breakfast food.

Great breakfast food and excellent service from Rea!

Food came out quickly and was perfect. 

We'll be back next time we're on Vegas.

Great breakfast and lunch.  My wife and I had the Cobb salad.  Very fresh ingredients and very tasty. Our server was Kathleen and she was very courteous and friendly.  This was the location at 2490 E Sunset Road in Las Vegas.
Very good restaurant. Superb service - make sure you don't miss their muffins - one of the best muffins I ever ate in my life!

I love breakfast food, especially pancakes and omelets.  So when a friend recommended trying this place, I was down to give it a try.  I had high expectations and I wasn't disappointed!  I like how they give you a carafe of coffee when you order a cup (like IHOP) so you don't have to constantly wait to get refilled.  Since I usually drink 3-5 cups every morning, this was a plus.

As far as the food, it also met my expectations.  I decided to try the egg-ceptional omelet (has bacon, mushrooms, ham, peppers, onions and sour cream) and not only was it delicious, it was more than enough food to last me through lunch.  I wanted to try the pancakes as well but I couldn't get it as a side so i tried the banana nut muffin that other reviewers had recommended - it was good but not great, but I'm not a big fan of banana nut in the first place so others may enjoy it, i don't know.  

The overall price was reasonable and I prefer quality over quantity and other than a handful of a few breakfast places on the strip the Egg and I is one of the best breakfast places around Vegas.  Highly recommended!

I was in carb heaven at the Egg and I, had the biscuits and gravy and the banana walnut muffin which were both very good. Service was very good and our food was delivered quite fast. Crowded, but the wait went very fast. Look like a new favorite in Vegas for me.

When my brother was in Kindergarten last year, he got some sort of award for some achievement I have since forgotten, which resulted in a coupon for the Egg & I\/Egg Works. I don't think we ever used it, but I had looked it up on Yelp last year, and remembered it had good reviews.

Fast forward to yesterday, 4\/2\/11. While eating a breakfast of homemade blueberry waffles and chillin on the patio, Lawrence T. was telling me all about how much he loved breakfast foods - all kinds. I was trying to figure out where we were would eat before we headed off to The Adventure Dome later during the day (we ended up not going.) I was bummed when he said breakfast foods were where his heart was, because it's my least favorite meal of the day. 

Around 2 PM, after driving around and me not remembering the names or addresses of the places that I wanted to try on the west side (where he lives) I spotted "Egg & I." Despite the fact I'm not into breakfast, I decided to suck it up and offer this place as an option because Lawrence had told me he liked breakfast so much. It helped that I vaguely remembered that it had good reviews here on Yelp. 

Upon walking in, you get hit in the face with the "breakfast" restaurant smell. You know what I'm talking about. We were seated immediately and took it all in. Lawrence was all into the fact they had soccer on their tv and that they had a zillion choices on their menu. Despite the extensive choices, not too long after sitting down, we ordered. I got the tortilla soup and house salad with ranch, and Lawrence got some omelet and fruit... and was mistakenly given a humongous side of the most delicious skinny fries ever (the problem was quickly remedied by a pregnant lady who worked there bringing him the fruit he actually ordered.) 

The tortilla soup, while not the type I'm used to was SO good, I could not stop eating it. The house salad rocked, especially with the sprouts on top, and the ranch dressing was on par with that of The Mad Onion (aka DELICIOUS!) I didn't try any of Lawrence's fruit or omelet, but the few fries I stole off of his plate were the best fries I'd ever tasted. Yeah, they're that good. 

I have to agree with Bonnie G.'s statement that, "You know the food is good when you are so full and you keep eating."  Lawrence kept eating his fries, while saying he should stop because he was tired of fried foods... but they were too tempting, even when blanketed by napkins on top to hide them from view, hehe.  I was so full toward the end of the meal, but my salad was so good, it was hard to finally push the remainder away.  

For our meals + coffee + $5 tip, it came out to $27 and some change. We both confided over our meal that we weren't sure about how good this place would be when we pulled up to the place, but after trying the food, it was super bomb.
Great food. Everything was seasoned so perfectly and I personally would suggest the Chili Rellano Omelette

This is the second time and both times the food and service has been over the top. I recommend the stuffed French toast but of course I'm sure their other food is just as great.. Carole Ann was great and her service was on point.

The most amazing breakfast we have ever had!  I ordered the key Largo crepe and a french toast to share with the table.  It was amazing! The service was incredible.  Our waitress Liza was extremely attentive and a pleasure to have serve us. One of the runners asked if we needed anything and we asked for more tortillas. Then about 5 min later he came out with the tortillas and a loaf of banana bread as an apology for taking too long.  Which we thought was very nice even though it didn't take long at all.  We will definitely be eating here again. Thank you to our server and the staff!

Real good stuff.  Eggs benedict was super tasty, their hollandaise sauce is amazing whatever it is.  Ask for extra bread or english muffin so you can mop up the extra sauce.  

Home potatoes are delish.  Not far from strip, great place for a bunch of guys.  Traveler friendly.  Watch what time you come in, can be busy if you show up too late.
I love food the ppl and my fav waitress karla haha if you want a funny waitress to make ur day nothing but laughs shes the waitress. I come here almost everyday possible.

Real good breakfast place.  Everything is fresh and they have a nice assortment of food.  I have been there a few times and nothing jumps out at me as GREAT but its all very good and the service is pleasant.  You really can't go wrong here.  I have had the meat eater skillet and a few omelets.  Good stuff.
This place is racist. Went there this morning with Asian and Mexican friends. And we got passed up by 4 groups of white people. Then they want to seat us outside.

Waren heute vor Ort, Auswahl riesig sah super aus, leider hatten wir wohl das falsche gegessen. Geschmack war nicht so der Kracher, die Bedienung hat zwar erst aufmerksam gewesen, aber bei nachbestellen der Milch uns total vergessen. Nicht unser Tag nicht unser Geschmack. DAHER NUR EIN Stern

Karla is my girl!!! First off, the food is bomb, the wait is worth it and the customer service is top notch! Everyone is friendly and very attentive to your hangover needs haha but back to the food...omg is too good! I would definitely come back to that Banana Nut Muffin.

Great hearty breakfast if you are not wanting the all-u-can-eat buffet.  The only thing this place is not drunk-walkable in am, it is a drive away - towards the "giant souviener shop" direction away from the strip.

Good service and good food. Every seat was taken in the restaurant. The hostess and waiters are all super nice saying "morning sweetie" and "how are you honey" seem to really enjoy working there.

All the food portions were HUGE! our table tried a little bit of everything: blueberry pancakes, choc chip pancakes, moco loco, breakfast burrito, omlettes.  their potatoes were really good - seasoned and fried!

Wish it was walkable from the strip - that would make it 5 stars!

Thanks to Yelp and the good ol community of yelpers out there i know A LOT of places where 10 bucks can go a LONG way in providing some good eats.

My Buddy recommended The Egg & I after hearing some good things about it from other sources. I've driven by this place multiple times and it's caught my attention a few time while in the same plaza as B&C Camera. 

They have a diverse menu of egg related items. I was about to order one of the combo skillets because another table's home fries looked GOOD but ended up getting a Hawaiian themed plate which featured Portuguese Sasuage or Spam (went for the sausage), rice, two eggs any style (sunny side up), "sticky" rice (turned out to be calrose rice). Also came with a choice of what ever bread or the banana nut muffin everyone raves about. 

I choose the muffin and man oh man it did not disappoint. Blueberry's always been my favorite muffin and to be honest i havent eaten enough muffins in my life time. If i were in a situation where the entire fate of humanity rested upon my recommendation for a muffin it would be The Egg & I's banana nut hands own, sorry humanity you had your chance i'm throwing this one out and if it lands under the bus so be it. 

Overall the island favorite plate was good, obviously the Portuguese sausage made the dish but in all honesty it wasnt worth the price. Even with the banana nut muffin dreams are made of it still wasnt quite worth it. For the same price my buddy got one of the combo skillets and he ended up easily with three times more food then i did.

So far i do like this place. Outdoor seating was available immediately seeing as it was a cold morning but their heaters are very powerful and aside from a few gusts of wind there was very little outdoor discomfort. Looking at other people's plate was very easy on the eyes as their selection of food is diverse yet seeing common dishes amongst different diners makes me want to come back and get what they're getting because they cant all be wrong.

Recommendation from my sister,  even though she's never been.  Went for breakfast in Saturday morning and it was a 15 min wait at 9:30 am.  Within 15 min the wait turned into 30-45 min wait.  So if you're going to check this place out come early.  First time?  No problem, you get a warm banana nut muffin. Regular, check in with yelp and get a free muffin. Lots to choose from. The portions are big enough that you can share with someone else.  Shane was our waiter ABC be was so nice! He recommended the rib eye benedict. So good!  It comes with home potatoes that are seasoned to perfection. The Mexican Crepe (made out of eggs) is pretty good to.  My boyfriend and I shared the rib eye benedict and the biscuits and gravy. Come on an empty stomach, trust me. Prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly and eager to make your experience a pleasant one.  This one is definitely going  in my book as one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas for breakfast!

My husband got the Lag Egg Crepe, and I got the chicken fried steak. 

My chicken fried steak was too salty and the country gravy itself was too salty too. I felt that I got overdosed with the salt after I've finished only one third of the chicken fried steak. I had my egg scrambled, and the egg didn't taste good, seems like they put white pepper in it and I don't like white pepper. So I was done with the egg with only one bite.

My husband said the egg crepe was interesting enough that he liked it, while it was also too heavy for him as it's made with 4 eggs.

The meal was okay, could be better though. We can get better chicken fried steak (with the right saltiness) at the other diner in town, so probably won't order chicken fried steak ever again at Egg & I. 

I think the best item of the meal was the banana nut muffin, which was only a side that came with the entree.

Our server was very nice though.

We don't know if we would come back again........just because we are not attracted to other menu items so much while we know we are not gonna order chicken fried steak here again.

I would say that the hype from yelp brings in a lot of the clientele here. I think we beat the mad rush on a Friday morning by coming on the early side around 8AM. By the time we left nearing 10AM, there was a line out the door. Service was friendly and attentive. I was pretty disappointed with the food though. We ordered a veggie eggs benedict and a southwest (chicken\/chorizo) hash. At first, the order for the eggs benedict came out wrong with canadian bacon and spinach vs. just all veggie. The waitress brought out extra banana nut muffins to apologize, which was a nice gesture especially since the best thing here was the banana nut muffin.  The hollandaise on the benedict was really watery and had a slight sweet taste to it. Overall, the benedict lacked flavor. On the other hand, the hash and the breakfast potatoes were extremely salty. We got the extremes here in terms of flavor (too salty and too bland). Overall, not bad, not great.

this is my favorite place to get breakfast outside of the strip or downtown
fast friendly and attentive wait staff take care of all your needs and the food is always great.

Eggs Eggs an yes Eggs. My husband an I love this place an no matter which location you choose they are all  great. You know when you walk in as busy as they are the food has to be good. An of course it is. This is my go to place for the best traditional eggs Benedict ever. They always cook them just perfect an that's not always easy. There omelets are also very good. An I love the potatoes as the side. Crunchy on the outside an perfect on the inside. Hey also have a Yelp freebie for the banana nut muffin which is very good as well. You can always  use it later if you're not in the mood.   So go by an check them out.

Our server, Genesis, is the bomb. Cheerful and attentive. Great recommendation of the bacon avocado omelette (lots of food). 

Quick and great tasting.  Patio seating is shaded and with misting system.

Had the prime rib Benedict with the seasoned potatoes and their homemade banana nut muffin.  The service was very quick, and we had our amazing vanilla cappuccinos within minutes of ordering. Definitely coming back

Awesome place!!  We were undecided between the Egg & I and another place we saw on Yelp with great reviews.  We'd gotten rid of our rental car the day before so we'd have to take a taxi to either.  At the spur of the moment, we picked the Egg & I.  Yay for us for picking an awesome joint.  We waited only about 10-15 minutes before being seated.  Once seated, we flipped through the newspaper menu.  I'd read so much about the muffins, we ordered a couple to start our meal.  They were banana nut muffins.  We both ate the entire thing.  So good.  And with a great cup of coffee, we could've stopped right there.  But we didn't!  Since breakfast is not my favorite meal, I love it when I find a place that has lunch style breakfast.  There were so many options I had to choose from.  I was stuck between the stuffed pepper and the Tacos Rancheros.  I chose the Tacos Rancheros.  It was a tortilla topped with refried beans, ground hamburger, two eggs (which I got fried) and topped with cheese and sour cream.  I would've liked some salsa with it but it didn't need it.  My partner got the garlic mashed potato omelet.  It was enormous.  She could only eat half of it to which our server, Karla suggested getting the half order next time!  Shoot, we didn't know you could do a half order.  But, my partner said she wouldn't gotten a half anyway because the portions would be all wrong.  We both loved the Old Bay seasoned fried potatoes.  As we waddled out, it was great that the front desk called a cab for us.  Very nice.  Oh, and there's a little egg face on the table that you can flip revealing a sad egg face if you happen to need anything.  That's a brilliant idea!  Karla was awesome and if we lived in the area, it would be our go to place!

Found this great breakfast diner. I had the Country Benny. It's like Biscuits and Gravy on Steroids. Layered biscuits, sausage patties, eggs to your liking smothered in sausage gravy. Served with their great Ranch Potatoes. It's a killer meal. Try it out for yourself. You won't be disappointed.

I ate at Egg & I and had a food server (Victoria) was absolutely amazing! She treated everyone in her section, including my party as if we were her only and most important table. I will definitely come here and ask for her specifically next time.

Our server Tamara gets 5 stars but the potatoes that came on the side of my veggie Benny were salty so 4 stars for that. Tamara was attentive and very sweet. I substituted the English muffin with croissant and it was good! It costs extra but that's fine. Our wait was about 15 min, not too bad on a Sunday morning. The eggs on the dish were poached perfectly and the hollandaise was delicious!

Showed up at 1pm on a Sunday and got seated within 15 minutes with a 4 person party. They sat us outside which we didn't have a problem with. Though usually you get asked if this is okay by the host. Our server seemed to be busy with the number of tables he had but soon took our orders. I orders the Blackened  Prime Rib Benny with potatoes. It was exactly what I hoped for. The prime rib was cubed and well seasoned way better than what I expected (a slab of prime rib that would have been difficult to eat with my eggs benedict). Two of my friends got the crazy chicken omelet and loved it and the other got a simple breakfast with biscuits and gravey. The side of fruit was pretty legit as well. Over all a great brunch!

This is the best hangover breakfast spot in all of Vega$$! 

The following reasons will state "how come:"

BIG MENU
HUGE PORTIONS
DELICIOUSLY GREASY PORK PRODUCTS
FRIENDLY STAFF
EXTREMELY INEXPENSIVE
CLOSE TO FREEWAY

Just go already!

Tucked away in a little strip mall, this little gem packs a powerful punch. I don't think there is a bad thing on the menu, except they have Coke and not Pepsi. Ask to sit in Amanda's section, she took very good care of us.
I normally hate buttermilk pancakes everywhere but the pancakes here are stellar honestly! Everyone should eat here, super affordable and delicious. Send Paula to Disneyland she's awesome

The best thing about Egg & I is the seasoning that they put on their potatoes!  It's fantastic!  Large portions, and otherwise pretty tasty breakfast food.  I love that they give you the whole carafe of coffee!

We tried Egg & I on a recent trip working in Vegas. It's hard to find good breakfasts, and the reviews here made me think we found the holy grail of breakfast spots! The reality: not so good.

I had a benedict. I asked for the eggs medium hard, and they came out essentially hardboiled (I am not holding that against them), but worse, the hollandaise was pretty awful. Sort of an off, slightly grainy texture, no lemon to cut the richness, just unappetizing. Potatoes seemed too regular, like processed frozen potatoes. 

On the upside, I tried one of the banana nut muffins, and it was pretty good. The staff was wonderful--really nice, helpful, on point. 

If only the food had lived up to them.....
My wife and I ate here twice on our recent trip to Las Vegas. The food is very very good! Service was good, and friendly. The prices aren't bad either. I wish we had one where we live.

Great breakfast spots are my favorite and this is one of the best I've ever found, thanks to YELP.  One of the most innovative breakfast menu's I've seen and particularly impressive is the ability to execute so many offerings to perfection.  Service was outstanding, our waitress, Jessica, was fast and efficient.  

The feature here is undoubtedly their banana nut muffins.  They were excellent, rivaling the best homemade I've ever tasted.  What amazed me is how they can produce as many as they have to do to supply this very busy and fairly large restaurant.   They were warm and obviously very fresh and tasted as good as most any homemade.  They have a slight gingerbread taste to them so I suspect molasses is a part of the recipe.   I know how much work they are to make homemade which is why I really admire their dedication to featuring this treat.    The food was really good as well, because they wouldn't earn any points from my son who doesn't eat anything with bananas in it.  I feel my opinion was well founded and based on a total of three banana muffins- mine, my son's, and a free one as a YELP check-in bonus.  I carried two out and enjoyed them later in the day.

I had the three little pigs omelet which was great.  The potatoes were done to perfection- crisp on the outside, evenly done throughout with a nice seasoning on the outside.  My son had a western omelet with tomatoes substituted for the potatoes.  A nice patio is outside with misters to help battle the Vegas temps and low humidity.

It's no question this is a premier spot to enjoy a wonderful breakfast in Las Vegas with just a little drive from the downtown strip.

A good variety of breakfast\/ brunch options. 
All staff were extremely friendly.
Ordered the crepe and pork Benny.
Both were flavorful.
The pork Benny was a little too saucy but other than that, everything was good.

Just finished eating our meal here. Wonderful place with a good location. Always a pleasure to come here. This is my favorite breakfast place by far! Spent $80 on breakfast at the trump and it doesn't compare to this $26 dollar masterpiece! Definitely a place to stop at!

Empty glasses came out (with the orange juice caraffe) COMPLETELY dirty. Food leftovers in them and LOTS of it. Very gross. Makes you wonder what the water glasses really looked like that came out pre-filled and just how sanitary everything is that comes out of the dishwasher!

Vegetarian eggs benedict was quite blah, toaster muffin was soggy from the get-go. The boys weren't crazy about their meals, they were just ok as well. Nothing special here.

I love strong flavors, personally. I season the heck out of my hash at home, but the potatoes really are over kill. I couldn't finish them.

Pretty disappointed. Only notable GOOD things were quick seating outside & decent prices.

It can be a long wait but it is definitely worth it!  I've been here twice on Saturday's and usually wait between 15-30 minutes and that was for 2 people.  Can't remember what I got the first time but I know I enjoyed it because I came back for seconds. The service is great, and they even have these placards on the table to let your server know you need service instead of being that person to flag them down. Very useful. Highly recommended!
Excellent breakfast love the works fruit plate!  Kiddos love it too good selection for them at a reasonable price.

The reviews on this place really set the bar high for me.   I was slightly disappointed.  The food is good diner food, but the reviews set me up for something else.  The service was fine and the best part of my meal was the thermos of coffee placed on the table next to me.  Low maintenance food that probably tastes great after a night out on the town...

First things first, I have to recognize our server, Amanda. She was, by far, the best server I've ever had. I'll be asking for her section next time we come here. My husband and I decided to come here, last minute, after seeing a picture of their Grandma's Biscuits and Gravy on google. While neither of us ordered that specific dish, we did order some delicious meals. My husband ordered the Original Breakfast Burrito which was absolutely amazing. I ordered the Chicken Enchilada Skillet. Oh my goodness... SO GOOD! I already can't wait for our next visit to Egg & I!!!

Awesome breakfast and brunch shop!!! I ate here with my mom before her flight back home and I loved it. Mentioning Yelp! got me a free banana nut muffin... it was fricken amazing.  I highly recommend it.
Best omlette ive ever had, the server patrick was amazing! I think we found our new breakfast spot in vegas

The Egg and I is a good place to get a good meal to start your day.  I had the Country Fried Steak and Eggs with the Habla Diablo Potatoes. Everything was excellent. The meat was cut with a fork tender and the Potatoes were really good with the seasoning that they use on them. They sell the seasoning at the counter if you would like to take some home. The only gripe that I have is that they don't get the butter to the edges on their toast. This is one of my pet peaves that really bothers me.

The Egg and I, and Chicken Fried Steak!

Experience:  I met some friends for early lunch or late breakfast.  It was pretty busy for 11:00 on a Thursday.  

Facility:  fairly good size place with a dinner atmosphere. There were murals on the walls,  and typical tables and chairs with some half booth seating too. 

Service:  not the best service I ever had, but not the worst. Doesn't seem to be one set waitress per table...this can be a good or bad thing. It took a good 10 minutes before someone took my drink order, we had to flag someone a few times, and after the food came, no one did the check back to make sure we didn't need anything else....but when they did help us, they were friendly and quick. 

Food:  a girlfriend and I decided to split two meals, so we could try more.  We ordered the "Chili Relleno Eggs Benedict" special, and we got the "chicken fried steak with over easy eggs and banana nut muffin."  
The muffin came out warm and it was pretty tasty.  Would have been perfect if they served some butter with it. 
The Benedict was good. I love the chili taste that cut the richness of the Benedict. 
The chicken fried steak was good, but not the best I ever had. It was crispy outside and a nice southern white gravy on the side to dip it in. I really did enjoy the hash brown potatoes on the side.  When they first came out, I thought I wouldn't like them because they looked to have too much seasoning on them.  However, they actually had just the right amount, and it had a Lawrys season salt flavor. 

Overall:  I would definitely come back here again. They have so many good things in the menu I want to try.  See yah soon!!

The banana muffin was up there with sex! The most delicious, gooey, beautiful thing I have eaten this trip. The carrot cake French toast was pretty yummy, with a warm sweet apple sauce on top. The noco loco also very  good and surprisingly as I remember eating it in Hawaii. The only thing that could have used some help was the michelada (they use tomato juice instead of Clamato!). The service was excellent, and our server Angel hit the experience out of the ball park with her charm, friendliness, prompt service and suggestions.

Great service & great food! Our waiter was friendly & attentive. We have a child with an egg allergy so most breakfast places are not an option for us. Nice to see they have a full lunch menu to choose from. We ordered 4 meals & their portions were generous. Bookmarked this restaurant & will definitely go back when we're in Vegas.

I ate at this place yesterday before heading back to San Diego and had the best Chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes ever!  Okay, maybe they were the only ones I've ever tried, but still, I thought the pancakes were great, yet maybe a little on the sweet side.  I had no idea that this place was going to be so popular and after eating there I know why.  The staff was pretty friendly as well.  I wouldn't mind coming back to this establishment for breakfast next time I am in Vegas.

Dont be fooled by the exterior! its not your typical VEGAS glitz and glam.. it is a bit off the strip but every bit worth it!!! 

Both my husband and I had Omelets.. WOW.  absolutely delish! Not skimpy on ingredients at all and piping hot! 

My husband is a breakfast potato guru and he was FLOORED and in love.

We may have to plan our next vegas trip just around this place!

- been back time and time again and never disappointed! This place does draw a crowd- a hungover and local crowd so be prepared to wait!
Excellent food and equally great service. It's well worth the 10min journey from the strip and the prices are very reasonable. Would definitely recommend this joint.

Every time I go to Vegas I must go to egg and I. Chance is one of my favorite waitress's.  She fast, funny and always gets our orders right.  And we're always 5 or more. Make sure you ask for Chance when you dine here. But everyone is great.

All I can say is yummy!! Food was delicious and the Hanna nut muffin was to die for. Super banana-ey! Carole Ann, our server, was great! If you're staying on the strip, it's so worth the 10 minute drive!

Overrated? Probably. This place was honestly lukewarm in taste and service.

Considering the overbearing amount of 5 star reviews this place has, I'm not sure why my experience was so disappointing in comparison. 

We ordered the banana nut muffin (free with a check in), the Classic, and the Works skillet. Two tables that were seated after us received their food before we did. We ended up waiting a really long time just for two entrees. But we brushed it off considering there could be many factors at play.

The Classic had three slices of bacon that resembled rubber. They were not crispy at all. I didn't like the seasoning of Hablo Diablo potatoes as I felt the seasoning was overbearingly strong. I felt like there was hardly any meat and a WHOLE lot of potatoes. 

We drank all our water and tried to get our waitress's attention. After five minutes or so, I flipped the egg to yellow (meaning we would like attention). Our waitress glanced at our table and proceeded to walk away. Another waitress promptly flipped it back to black and asked what we needed. When I said we needed a refill she said okay and proceeded to chat with the table next to us. She never bothered to grab our waters. Finally, our waitress asked what it was that we needed earlier and finally got us water. 

Also guess what? Never got the banana nut muffin.

Sorry, but there are way too many delicious breakfast eats like Babystacks Cafe or Black Bear Diner (with their huge portions) for me to ever come back.

Awesome experience here. Chocolate chip pancakes were great, homemade muffin fantastic and amazing service. Waitress offered to grab us to-go drinks and food was out within 10 minutes of ordering (even with the restaurant full). Great dinner feel and exceptional service. Highly recommend.

I am not an egg person so I was happy to find items on the menu that did not have egg.  I have tried the pancakes in the past and was very happy with them.  This time I tried the Cincinnati chili which I didn't like much.  Nothing was wrong with the dish I just didn't like the flavor.  It is more of a meat sauce over spaghetti and not really chili.  The service was great and if your into eggs this is the place to be.

This is the only place in Las Vegas that I will go for breakfast.  The food is great and the service is even better.  The homemade hash, and banana nut muffin are my go to items.  On my last visit, Carole Anne and her trainee Oscar were great, they were both polite, courteous, and professional.. Makes me feel at home :-)

We found this place on yelp and thought it sounded perfect.  We were right!  The menu is huge and we had a really difficult time making a decision.  We finally decided on the Country Benny and the Sunrise Mountain.  We asked about the Works potatoes.  They're diced potatoes that are heavily seasoned and then deep fried.  So in other words, heaven in your mouth.  We both loved our meals and the service was excellent.  Breeannda was friendly and took great care of us.  We are visiting from California, but we'll definitely make breakfast here a part of every Vegas experience!
Bree was so attentive and we loved our Breakfast; delicious seasonal fruit bowl and endless carafe of awesome coffee!
I'm ready for brunch now. :) The banana nut muffin was amazing though. Especially with butter. mmm...

Just finished another excellent meal here. Come to think of it my family and I have never had a bad one here either. If you're in the mood for breakfast, brunch or lunch stop in , my family and I have had just about everything on this menu here and have never been disappointed today my wife and I had a Mexican omelette and a Santa Cruz skillet, just fantastic meals and wonderful energy, especially from our server Perry. Thanks again for another wonderful brunch and we'll see you next time!!

I really like this place.  Casual, cheap and good breakfast.  Most of your breakfast dishes come with a choice of toast or banana muffin.  Get the muffin.  Their are so many choices, it's hard to make a decision.  I've had the Loco Moco, pancakes, omelettes, french toast, country style breakfasts.  Popular place so you will wait for your tables.  Parking is abundant.
This place was awesome. Only issue was the wait but that's what u get when the food is great!

Carole Ann was wonderful! Cheerful and helpful! Food was good. Potatoes were good but I couldn'd eat all of it. A bit salty after a while. Had the Crazy Chicken Omelette. Was good but rich. Banana nut muffin was the best! I'd give the server 5 stars and the food 3 stars (banana muffin saved the rating).

I had the huevos ranchero and was AWESOME! Sauce was fresh and tasted clean not greasy or oily , customer service was equal good, waitress very attentive and polite, even with it being busy they are still fast to respond to my needs while dinning, I will be back very very soon
I am a local and I come here almost everyday to see my favorite people and waitress Karla.  Great place to go everyone won't be disappointed.

First I think most of the bad time was due to our waitress Ashley. She had a bad attitude from the start and was more than slow. I tried to order a mimosa which I was then told that even though it's on the menu they don't have them. Ashley took offense to that as well. It took a while to get our sodas, she never came back for refills. After a bit she came to take our order and didn't get that right either. My sister ordered a burger with a muffin as an appetizer,  the muffin never came. I ordered a pesto veggie sandwich (came out without pesto) but Ashley didn't know that because she never checked on our food once it cane out. My mom asked 3 people for mustard, by the time she got it her burger was cold. Overall less than happy with the experience. Cheers, hope yours is better than ours.
Delicious breakfast here! I love the breakfast crepes they have! And the banana muffins are by far the best I've ever had! Great breakfast place for sure! Skip Blueberry Hill and head here!!!

I came to the egg and I in Las Vegas because I had been previously to the egg and I in Estes Park, Co. They didn't have the same menu items as they do in CO but everything was just as good. I ordered a breakfast skillet with potatoes and chili. The skillet was very good, I loved it. My wife had the breakfast burrito and she also loved it. The potatoes are seasoned with paprika and other ingredients and are very good, but I prefer the CO potatoes. The only thing that I didn't like about this place is that they don't use the egg and I brand hot sauce.

I don't even know where to start that's how amazing this place is! From the Banana Nut Muffin to the Stuffed French Toast to our sever Tamara everything was great! Friendly staff who checked on us over and over to make sure we had everything we needed. Great job Egg & I keep it up! Oh yeah and I forgot to mention this was our 4 Year Anniversary Breakfast too!

I had read about this place, and really just wanted to check it out with my family. We were not disappointed! And, the place was packed...always a good sign. The food we ordered was delicious. The staff was very friendly and the service was quick and helpful., Prices were very reasonable and the portions good sized with delicious homemade flavors!  It was the best tasting skillet breakfast we ever have.
....Just a great experience all around. We definitely want to go back there again.

We stumbled across this local secret while on vacation last year. Its not much of your typical Las Vegas Strip crowd, more of families that actually live around town catching a late breakfast\/brunch.

We had some really awesome pancakes here, and its a nice escape from those crowded hotel places. Just a few minutes from the strip!

Definitely will go back on our next visit this summer!

Everything we ordered was delicious! Stuffed French toast, works veggie Benny. Our server Alexa our server was attentive and kind. Really everyone here is super friendly. Great place for breakfast off the beaten path.

Everything was delicious! Our server, Karla, was amazing! And, despite being slammed, we didn't wait an unreasonable amount of time for our food. Oh, those banana muffins people keep mentioning 

I'm only giving 4 stars because it was a bit dirty and the creamers on the table were all nasty and sticky.  However, Karla was a sweetheart and brought us a fresh dish of creamer.

My wife took me there it was my first time and the food was fabulous! Even more Fabulous was our server. His name is Austin and if you go there to eat I highly recommend you asking for his section. He is polite, kind and very helpful. Quick and on point at his job. He recommended Biscuits and gravy and he was right delicious!!!
Eggsellent banana muffin!!  Carole Ann waited on us and was very sweet. Portion sizes are big, shared the classic with turkey bacon and a side order of eggs between two people.

Great place! 
I had Karla as my server and she was very helpful!! If your looking for a great breakfast place then defiantly come here! They have eggsactly what you are looking for! Their service is eggceptional!
Great food with big portions! Very friendly stuff, Amanda was amazing! Just perfect, we loved it!!!

It's a decent place for breakfast or brunch. I've had lots of different things here and none of them are incredible. The potatoes are pretty boring, honestly. The toast is always good. This last time I got the chili with rice instead of pasta. It was ok. I was expecting a small bowl but it was massive and it was covered in cheese. In my opinion, the food here is a 3 but the service is always really good. This last time, Amanda took care of us and didn't miss a beat. Nice job!!

We can at breakfast anytime any meal period!

The wait was manageable as we arrived in between the early morning rush and weekend late breakfast crowd.  We can tell why it is a local favorite as it the staff offers a warm welcome.

Their famous banana muffin arrived almost immediately after we put in the order.  It was so light, fuffy, yet sticky, we could have easily eaten a full loaf just the two of us.  We didnt realize you can order the full lf until a plate was served near us... 

Their menu (made to look like the morning paper - clever concept!) offered an abundant options that it could be overwhelming.

They dropped our veggie eggs benedict, so they had to fire it again... the spinach was left raw and piled in top of the itty bitty english muffin and slivers of avocados.  We love spinach, but the proportions were off - would have liked a slightly sauteed spinach or place a smaller portion of raw leaves.

Our other orders were a classic over easy eggs with spicy seasoned potatoes with an xtra side of waffles.  Since they had to re-fire the eggs benedict, the egg was luke warm and waffles were not as golden crispy as we liked.

Whoever made our batch of coffee added too much water as it was missing that needed caffeine perk.  Im sensitive to caffeine and even I thought it was too weak.  

We love the vibe of this breakfast spot, so hopefully, it will be a win next time.

This is definitely the place for breakfast or brunch in Las Vegas. Everything about it was spot on, starting with our server Karla. She was friendly and made us feel welcome. Her menu suggestions were teriffic! As everyone has already noted you must start with a banana nut muffin. They are moist and delicious. The coffee was rich and bold. They even leave the pot on the table for you so hot coffee is always at your fingertips. We shared the Carnitas breakfast burrito and the chicken fried steak skillet. Both were delicious! I don't think future trips to Vegas will ever be complete without stopping at The Egg and I.

I love this place although it was my first time here my friends and I usually go to egg works but it is related and closer to strip so we came here. I had classic breakfast with hash browns that look like McDonald's  hashbrowns they are so good . Wait time runs about 30 min but it's worth it as it goes by pretty fast. I love how they serve the mimosas with its own champagne bottle and juice . Overall our server and food was great. Thank you Liliana for making our experience pleasurable.

You gotta try, excuse me, have their banana nut muffin! It is so moist and onolicious! AND they also include some meals for us locals from Hawaii!! How thoughtful and well received by those of us who miss our foods.

I dig the atmosphere of this seemingly mom and pop breakfast joint. The food is good but nothing to write home about. It was packed with a line out the door on the Saturday morning we went.

I was able to try the combo meat skillet, beef hash skillet, and the stuffed french toast. Everything tasted homemade which places it above chain breakfast restaurants, but I think all cities have some sort of a joint that serves similar tasting dishes.

One thing that stood out was their banana nut muffin. Choose it over the toast, when asked what you prefer. This was the only thing that was better than anywhere else I have tried. I'm not a big fan of BNut, but if it tasted like the ones here, I would choose it every time.

Decent breakfast joint, decent prices. I might hit it again to try out different dishes to see if anything that can knock my socks off.

Great breakfast! I always struggle to find a breakfast meal that is healthy and not drowning in cooking oil like most omelette\/egg restaurants. I had the veggie Benedict and it was delicious! Fresh spinach, sliced tomato and a perfectly ripe avocado..Jessica our server was great and I hope she wins the trip to Disney!

Just found this place at random during a stop in Vegas, and now I wish I had one by my home in PA!  The service was excellent, the waitress was so friendly and the food was top-notch delicious. If I was creating a restaurant, this would be the one. I had been unable to decide between a crÃªpe and a waffle when the waitress suggested half a crÃªpe to go with the waffle. Perfect! So delicious and they have a cool concept of a tag on the table that you can flip up when you need service and anyone will come over, managers, busboys whoever. Brilliant concept. I had often thought a call light or something like that should be in most restaurants and they have one. So, five stars for this place only because I can't give them more than five stars. Stop by, you won't be sorry!

Don't let the outside appearance fool you! This place is the bomb! We went and check-in via Yelp and got a free banana nut muffin and it was delicious! It was warm and moist. Not to mention you get one with your meal that you order!! We tried The Works Omelette & The Crazy Chicken Omelette. You get tons of hashbrowns with your meal....it was so much I had to get a to go plate. Service was alright, nothing extravagant but the food is delicious and their menu is huge! I would definitely recommend it.

Absolutely love this place. It's a must stop pit stop whenever I come to Las Vegas. 

The basic breakfast is great. Eggs any way you want them, fluffy pancakes, sausage \/bacon is good. Nice homestyle potatoes. Amazing french toast. I'm sure they have waffles. Try the Country Fried Steak, do the muffin, not the toast and thank me later.

This banana nut muffin has been WAY hyped in other reviews. Yelpers were making it sound like this muffin was the secret to life. Muffin lived up to the hype in terms of taste, but not size. If we are talking about a life-changing muffin, it needs to be a little bigger. I wanted 2 of these.

Shoulda went with the crowd and got the Eggs-cellent Omelette. Kay's Special caught my eye cause it sounded like spinach artichoke dip but made into omelette form. It was really tasty but the 3 Eggs-cellent Omelettes at the table kept overshadowing my dish. But that was my fault and not the fault of Egg & I. 

Potatoes were completely covered in a paprika type spice blend. It made them really dry. A good dousing of ketchup cured the dryness.

Overall your typical uber greasy breakfast that will make you feel ridiculously full all day long. The muffin made the experience above average.
Fantastic breakfast. Better than anything I've had on the Strip and for half the price.
The family and I make it a point to eat breakfast here during our Las Vegas visits. Friendly staff!  Amazingly delicious food!  Banana muffin!  Waffles!  Everything is delicious!

The food portions were rather large, which is a good thing but the quality or taste needs to be turned up a notch. I was really disappointed with the Cashew pancakes. Service was great as well, however I rate due to the taste because service is only relevant to the individual servers. I would rather go to Hash House or Mr. Mamas!
The eggsperience was eggsactly what I had hoped for.  I had an eggsempalry server "Genesis" who I would love to see win the Disney trip!  Eggselent service and a great menu!

I was impressed with both my breakfast, Kay's Special, and my husbands, huevos rancheros. Kay's special is an omlette with artichokes, spinach, parmesan cheese, cream cheese topped with fresh tomatoes and feta cheese. I was looking for something different and not what I would usually order, which is 2 eggs with toast and pancakes. I was pleasantly surprised! It was flavorful, and delicious. The feta cheese on top which I was concerned about was fantastic. I think that might have actually been the best part. I really really enjoyed it. My husband's dish was equally delicious. I was worried there would be too much salsa, but not at all. The side of potatoes were a touch salty. I would have preferred just a little less seasoning however, everything was really really good. They serve a muffin of the day before they serve your order. Todays' was banana nut muffin. It was good. I was happy that the wait was rather quick, especially for a Saturday morning. The menu has many offerings so really, no matter what you like for breakfast, I'm sure you can find it there. Our server was also very nice and quick.

Wow the banana nut muffin is excellent! Moist, soft but has a crutch top. It hit the spot! First bite is like fireworks! Coffee is great with my fav French vanilla creamer. 
Definitely will be coming back here!

Super delicious! Spotted this gem as we were driving around looking for a gas station. My mom had been to their other location, so we stopped in. 

The food and service were incredible! I had the biscuits and gravy with sausage patties. potatoes and scrambled eggs. It came on a huge platter! The biscuits were soft and fluffy with tons of flavorful gravy. My mom had the sausage patties, eggs and potatoes. The potatoes had a bit too much seasoning salt for my taste, by everything else was amazing.

The service really took things up a notch. They have a stand on the table where you flip the egg over if you need service. Different servers stopped in and refilled our drink while we were eating. Our glasses never got less than half-empty.

Definitely try either location. Every plate we saw being served up looked amazing!

That is one de-lic-ious breakfast. I happily took my banana muffin with me to-go and made it my perfect snack a couple hours later. Service is spot-on, food is EGGsellent.  I had the California crepe which was the perfect mix of omelet insides, and crepe outside.

Would have been a perfect but the air was blowing right on us, we turned the fan off, so it worked.
Between the three of us we have two with food issues, and one cranky woman. Liza checked the kitchen for Soy free foods, and read the ingredients to double check. Really great service. Never an empty cup of coffee, food hot, all cooked great.
 The Prime Rib Benny was a tad salty but I expected that from the Prime Rib. It's delicious. The Original Benny was great, too. My daughters Fruit Plate with yogurt was fresh and a much different variety than the usual fare at other places.
  I think we'll add this to empty breakfast place slot that was opened Baby Stacks told us to freeze so the servers would be comfortable later in the day.  :\/
 Parking lot large enough, bathrooms clean, and tables stocked and condiments full.
:D

First of all, when you walk in the restaurant people with colorful t-shirts and bright smiles welcomes you in, They want to make sure everyone is happy and satisfied so they have the smile\/frown sign on the table. The food is amazing with good price and portion. Talking about portion.. It's HUGEEE but the best part is you can do half order. I recommend the country fried steak on skillet with fries and potato omelette. It literally melts in your mouth with all the happiness you can give to your tummy. its a baby friendly environment. But!!!! One thing It is a pretty heavy high calorie meal so be prepared. Must try!!! I will definitely come back whenever I visit Vegas for any reasons! :)
Our server was Tabatha.  She was super friendly and helpful with our order.  The food was great!  We highly recommend this place to Vegas visitors.

Ordered avocado, they didn't put it on my meal. Told the waitress they forgot it and to forget about bringing it. She began to goad me on to get avocado, which was strange after saying no several times. I repeated that it was fine; at that point i didn't care for it. Eventually I submitted but asked for only a little amount of avocado. She brings me avocado and soon after - the check. I look at the check, no avocado charge. I was happy, and ready to pay. A few minutes later, she sneakily replaces the check with a brand new one. I hardly noticed that she had done that and after looking at the check again, a $3 avocado charge made me cringe. Wtf? If it was your mistake and I said I was fine on avocado, why would you goad me on to get it? Then give me a check without it (again forgetting, but this time you forgot to charge me so might as well leave it), and replace it with a ridiculous charge? And do not call your customers "babe", it's just weird especially when you say it behind them. "Thanks babe" - as I was holding the check in my hand. Thanks? No thanks lol.I wish I remembered her name, but she was some older red-haired lady. I was not pleased with this incident.
Also, their "Habla Diablo" potatoes, which comes with every meal, are horrendous. They taste like over seasoned, beyond-salty fast food potatoes. 2 stars for getting seated quick, polite service, and a banana "nut" muffin for a side, despite the fact that it was overly sweet and did not receive the slightest bit of nutty flavor. Be weary of such scenario as I have endured. For these reasons, I would not consider returning.
Service was excellent! Thanks Amanda for the wonderful experience. The food was also delicious. Chicken fry steak it up!

stopped by sunday 8am
crowded but no wait yet
waitress friendly\/attentive
food spectacular
banana muffin was tasty

BANANA NUT MUFFIN you MUST!!
The service was eggsellent ;] Our server was very helpful and fast. 
Food is delicious.
Huge portions.  Great prices.  Service was excellent.  Amanda was an excellent server. Would recommend.

Very popular breakfast place in Las Vegas! So it's gonna be crowded there. I always get excellent service here. I usually come here with some real health nuts who have to have some seriously customized orders and they always get it right. They have one manager that even looked at our bill and showed us how we can order things a certain way and save some money.

Food looks delicious, but we never got to try it.  Sometimes a single individual defines the whole experience.  Got there, place was quite busy but we were seated fast.  So far so good...
Then Oscar shows up, rude and condescending.  After coffees and 15 minutes waiting for the order to be taken we decide to leave.  At thr cashier (have to pay for coffees) manager shows up.  She was very nice.  Oscar blamed it us (classy kid).
Now at another breakfast place, being treated with class and kindness.

What a shame, it looks really good, also, its not like theymiss our business.::
The food here is the best value in Las Vegas . All the items are tasty don't forget the Banana Muffin. Liza is great be sure to ask for her !!!!

My boyfriend and I were visiting Las Vegas for a convention, we wanted breakfast before we headed over to the convention center, so I asked him to find something.  He found Egg & I.  It wasn't far away, the parking was good, we were seated immediately, and after we ordered we had our food in under 10 minutes.  Our waitress was friendly and fast.  I love this place because you can ask anyone to get you something, you aren't just tied to one wait person.  You have an egg posted by the table, you need something you flip it to the unhappy yellow side, you are happy you leave it on it's happy side, when they see the yellow side they come over and see what they can do for you.  We had biscuits and gravy, which were piping hot and tasted good and served different ways.  We also got coffee, and they left the pot at the table for us.  How cool is that, no waiting to refill that cup when it's empty.  Love this place and will def come back when we visit Vegas again.

always a great place to visit for breakfast :-D
I highly recommend ranch potatoes! small, bite-size, seasoned potatoes are sooooo good! 

I also love their banana nut bread. it comes with a lot of the entrees and it's so moist and delicious! 

they have a similar service style like bumba gump (where if u needed assistance, u would turn your sign to "stop forest, stop!"). they have a happy egg face and sad egg face if u need service

I tried the Banana bread french toast because I like banana bread but it didn't do it for me. The bread tasted good all by itself but the french toast didn't make it. Wish I had ordered breakfast burrito my friend had ,now that was good. Took a small bite. I will give four stars because all my friend's food was very good. Yes  I sampled lil bit. service was good and the place was clean. good to go I will be back.

Four words, homemade..........banana..........nut..........muffin.  With so many reviews for this place, what could one gather from this review?

1.  Much much cheaper to eat at than on the strip.
2.  The drive is close by from the Stratosphere.
3.  Portions are VERY generous and filling.
4.  Service is outstanding with many smiles (thank you Amanda).  =)
5.  Hot sauce selection extends from regular tabasco and tapatio (thank goodness!).
6.  Saturday mornings are a little less crowded than Sunday mornings.
7.  Homemade banana nut muffin.
8.  Parking in a shared lot.

BIG TIP:  Be sure not to wait until 10:30am to get up and eat here or else you will be waiting.

So why leave the strip to come here??  To be honest, I wanted something good for also a good price.  You know that dry, empty feeling you get from some run-of-the-mill restaurants?  That breakfast where you are happy that you ate it, however, it just settles in your stomach because it has to, not because it wants to?  Exactly!  Here at Egg & I, you get breakfast that is prepared with meaning and with purpose.  Wonderfully filling and satisfying.
Pretty darn good...a lot of food.  We all liked the Maple Tree better though.
Great food!  Great service!  Liliana was also great!  I'd come back with my wife any day!
Tabatha is a great waitress!! Super helpful and a great help to decide and this huge menu! Thanks for the delicious free banana muffin too.
Liliana Liliana Liliana, she was awesome and not to mention the food. Awesome food, awesome taste but most of all the best service. It is a must
Great stop for breakfast.  The food is good and the mimosas (yes, plural) were awesome. Definitely worth the small wait.  Don't bother going anywhere else.
Portions are HUGE!! If you are in Vegas, make sure you stop here!! I HIGHLY recommend this establishment!!

The banana muffins were delicious. Free when you check in :)

I was super excited to have brunch here during my stay in Vegas. I loved the cafe\/home ambience and it was cute to have an egg concept throughout the menu\/place but the food was not all that great.

I had the eggs Benedict which did not taste fresh or traditional. The sauce was way too heavy for my liking. 

My boyfriend got the meat omelette but it came with more potatoes than meat itself. The potatoes were dry so it was quite disappointing.

Service was great though. We had more than one server check on us and everyone appeared helpful. 

I wanted to like the food here but it didn't work out.

Our server Brady was great and he was very efficient and nice and always made sure that we were doing alright and wanted us to have a great breakfast. I believe he is the most qualified to have a nice vacation for all the hard work he has went through. He works hard and can still keep a smile on his face, making him deserving of a nice vacation.
this place is fun and with very tasty food and they offered Aloha Shouyu with rice, in Vegas.

One of the best breakfast\/brunch places ever. Omelettes here are flavorful and filling, served with country potatoes. Choice of Toast or Banana nut muffin, chose banana nut muffin and boy was it a good choice. This muffin is closest to some of the best homemade-muffins I've ever tasted.

Will go there every time I'm in Vegas.

OH goodness this place rocks!!!!! Ask for Chance, she is an awesome server.  Thanks for the directions. 
The banana nut muffin is the best I have ever had
Bad attitudes fair food too much comparison for poor employees thou I must say the chicken tortilla soup is good

At Egg and I.  My 3rd time here.   The service is great.   Better than the strip restaurants.   Brady has good timing and was attentive.  When I go to Vegas I always go there on Sunday morning before the painful drive back to Cali.

I'll recommend anyone that is willing to venture off the strip to go there.
For the price I paid for the food. It was really inexpensive and the amount of food that I received was great. Great customer service and great environment.
Everything our party of 4 ordered was delicious!! Try the banana nut muffins!! Linnea was an incredible waitress!!
Best breakfast place, best banana nut muffins and habla Diablo muffins. Tabatha gave the best customer service. Definitely coming back next time we're in Vegas.
What a cute little resturant. Great food, great service! Oscar was our waiter great server and free banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp!

It took me a few trips to Egg & I over the years for the place to grow on me. I can finally say I'm officially a fan of this place after discovering their breakfast crepes. Can you say yum

The service is just all right and I always end up with a weirdly small fork compared to the rest of my party, haha. 

All in all, a great little place for breakfast.

Our server was so excited about his job- a rarity in servers. His energy was contagious!  The food was pretty good, and much more affordable than breakfast on the strip. I highly recommend this spot for tourists looking for a quality, affordable breakfast!
The service was exemplary.  Came at a very busy time and was seated immediately.  Ordered and meal delivered quickly.  Food was delicious and fresh

I really enjoyed this place. We went here before heading home from Vegas and it was aproximately a 30 minute wait on a Monday morning at 10am. The banana muffin was delightful and they gave us an extra one when we checked in. I ordered a sausage omelet that turned out pretty good but my friends skillet turned out very salty. They offered to switch it out, but we were almost all finished with our meal so we asked if they could take it off the bill. There was some sort of miscommunication so when we got the bill, the skillet was still on there. In the end, after some time, they were able to take it off the bill and we left. Other than the little miscommunication, service is great and they were very nice.
Good Breakfast spot in Las Vegas!  We enjoyed it over the Thanksgiving Holiday.

I went here solely based on the good reviews and I was not disappointed. Servings are hearty and the food is very fresh. There are not a lot of fatty oils used so even if you pig out you won't feel to weighed down. The muffin that is served before your meal arrives is absolutely amazing. The coffee is pretty plain and is really the only thing that could have been better. With that being said, it was a diner so the coffee was on par for what I expected. The service was really good. I like that there is a sign that you can flip up for when you need service. It's nice not to be bothered every couple of minutes. Look for the waitresses wearing a button on their uniform declaring that the owner was right! (sorry, I forgot his name) As the story goes, when a server leaves egg and I to go work somewhere else he tells them they will be back. When they come back they have to wear the button! Lol
Depends on what you are looking for. This is by no way a fancy place... Like your I hop or Dennys but better food. So if you're on strip looking for a fancy place, this is not where you should go.
The food was delicious and fast despite the very busy morning rush.  Our server Chance was lovely and quick with the refills! A wonderful stop away from the strip.
Our waitress Karla was amazing she was fast, efficient and very attentive. The food was great ,but her personality and service made our visit worth the wait.

Absolutely perfect. Made for a great start to the day. Food was cooked to perfection (even with very specific requests) and our server, Jose was wonderful. Pleasant and attentive with just the right amount of humor. Wonderful! ( Guess we liked it a lot, huh?) Thanks.

I made a reservation for 12. My family got here first and they refused to seat us before the entire 12 people were here. They were extremely rude and I was told that the reservation will be canceled if the group didn't show up in 5 mins. I felt disrespected.

I eat here on a regular basis! Everything thing I've ever had here is so yummy!! The staff are very professional and polite. I love all the different tasty hot sauces are a great accompaniment to scrambled eggs or any one of the many omelettes! I always get a mimosa to go with and they are so yummy! I love the fact that they bring your orange juice separate from your personal sized bottle of champagne leaving you to pour  your own trouble!!!

This place was so good and totally unexpected! They have gluten free options and are aware of how to prevent cross contamination which is ALWAYS so helpful! I had their chili relleno omelette and my fiancÃ© had the stuffed French toast. The only bummer was that they did not serve mimosas and bloody Mary's.
yelp comes through again, banana bread is awesome service is great oh and don't forget the breakfast
Amazing service and our waitress, Manuela, was fabulous! Made our first time from Texas a place we will always visit when we come to Vegas!

Best breakfast in a long time!   Huge menu, wonderful and friendly staff and the food is excellent.  I got great recommendation from the manager as I was paying, which was to order smaller servings so I could try more of their dishes!  Yep, I will be back before I leave Vegas to do exactly that!

Send Genesis to Disneyland!!! She was an awesome server! Very kind, attentive, and quick! 

Also, food here was amazing. I don't think you can go wrong over here. 

We'll be back!

Thanks Yelp for another great recommendation.  Wide variety, good food, good service.  The blueberry pancakes were very good, and the turkey sausage was great.  An excellent breakfast choice if you have a car

I chose this place based on all the great reviews they have. It's has a cozy atmosphere and the food is really good. My caffeine monster was glad they left the carafe of coffee at my table, unfortunately the pour spout looked grody. It needed a good scrub.

Food was a generous portion for the price and it was awesome tasting. The Spanish rice was a little oily.

Coming off the plain we came straight here because they have great reviews and a ton of them to back it up. Their menu is like a newspaper and it was pretty large. There are plenty  of options for everyone from Benedict's to omelettes to burgers. We were a party of 11 and we were lucky enough to get seats right away and right next to each other.

I ordered the Works Skillet. It had peppers, tomatoes, mushrooms, ham, bacon, potatoes and eggs. It was off the charts delicious. I also got the banana nut muffin instead of toast, which came out first. It was a very good and if you check-in you get a free banana nut muffin (I got 2nds). Not only was the food good, it came in a timely manner. I can eat a lot and I thought it was plenty of food. A lot of my friends had to take half of their meal to go! 

The server did an ok job on greeting us and bringing us our drinks. She wasn't the best server in the world but she did a great job with our large party.  She kept our drinks full and we had plenty of napkins without asking. 

Overall, I rate this place a 5. It was great food, great service, and quick food at decent prices. Even though I tried some of my friends food that weren't very good, everything regarding my experience was great. Highl y recommend you try this place!
Huge portions at reasonable prices.  Friendly staff and clean facilities.

Sunrise Mountain platter will cure that nightclub hangover. There are 4 eggs and a crossaint hidden underneath that load of melted cheese and sausage. Bargain of a meal for what you get. Sausage was a little bland but nothing some hot sauce can't fix. Potatoes on the side were awesome. There's some seasoning they put on it that really makes it work. The muffin was pretty good, not the best I've ever had but pretty darn good for a free muffin (if you check in on yelp to unlock deal). Service was friendly and attentive. You have to walk the check up to the register to pay...thought that was a bit weird but whatever...its a minor inconvenience. Overall I'd say worth a visit if you're close by.

Friendly folks, lots of seating, good food and coffee - my only complaint was that the potatoes were very salty.  Other than that, tasty and good - it was great to get away from the Strip on our trip and just be with the locals.  Our server was lovely and it was an overall great breakfast experience.  Would definitely return.

We are on vacation here and just tried out this place. This is amazing !! The avocado omelette was ridiculously good. Our server Karla was the nicest ! I would definitely recommend checking this place out if anyone needs a great breakfast spot :)

Wandered into this place for a late breakfast. Food was pretty descent.....i ordered country fried steak with scrambled eggs with cheese.....my server was Jessica.  She was polite and friendly. Im critiquing the food and food only. The country fried steak itself was delicious....well cooked, crispy and seasoned perfectly....the gravy was rich and creamy. The eggs were extremely overcooked and potatoes were ok......the spice on them were a little too overbearing for my liking. Overall flavors were good......steak was the standout.....eggs not exectued well and the price.....a couple dollars higher then id like it to be. Not a bad experience, but there are too many good places in Vegas

This great breakfast place is across the street from me, so I've eaten there many times. I actually go by there a couple times a month just to pick up their famous banana muffins, which my son devours!

I've ordered their oatmeal, their scrambles, their wonderful blueberry pancakes that they make with multi-grain (or was it whole wheat?). I'm not sure if I ever ordered anything that wasn't good.

Their service has been great so far. They have that nifty system of turning your egg sign on your table if you need service. I'd have to say their wait staff has always been efficient and attentive.

We often frequent Egg Works, Cracked Egg, I'm not sure if it's all owned by the same company. Their menus are slightly different, some serve coffee cakes, some serve muffins. You can't really miss with either one, they are all delicious.

Highly recommend for your family-friendly casual breakfast\/brunch. Beware like many great breakfast places, the weekends get pretty busy, especially Sunday during the church rush. Definitely worth it :)
Yum! Great food, homey atmosphere, pleasant service, good price for large portion... definitely coming back here. The banana muffin was super... and my omlete-crepe love child... who knew!

VERY MISLED by Yelpers here. No accounting for taste....

We had the tuna melt, the Sundance Special, and the flavored coffee (partner's idea). The Sundance Special, a veggie omelet with thought behind it, was actually pretty yummy (artichoke, feta, spinach...great flavors), but the potatoes that come with were pretty yucky. Just cubed potatoes that are overly seasoned and taste previously frozen, not that fresh.

The tuna melt was the WORST I'VE HAD IN MY LIFE. SOOOOO BAD! The "cheese" looked like a non-melting version of Velveeta. I'm not sure it was real. I had to scrape it off; it was disgusting. Also the tuna salad part was the worst tuna salad ever. It was a mushy, wet, flavorless glob of mayonnaise mess. The Parmesan bread it comes on is super-salty. The matchstick fries it comes with don't taste that fresh and are overly spiced.

I picked the sandwich to pieces, and most pieces remained on my plate. I ate my partner's Sundance Special, because Vegas portion sizes allow for that. The server didn't even bother to ask how our food was, just slapped the check down and didn't comment that I had barely touched my plate.

The flavored coffee (hazelnut) is really gross. Bad idea to order it, but it tastes like the bad idea it is--overly sweet with its sweetness covering up that burnt taste that most diner coffee has.

This is the kind of place that automatically brings straws with water and gives you styrofoam for your leftovers.

My 1st time here and it was my server tabatha's 1st day. Tabatha was so friendly, knew the menu and was attentive to our table. This service was a great compliment to our fabulous breakfast! So delicious,  the Chile Relleno omelet was great! Don't get me started on the delicious banana nut muffins, omg! So delicious. For sure we will be back! A 5 star dining experience. .

AMBIANCE: 4 - It was okay inside, kind of a cross between homey restaurant, diner and cafeteria. It was bright inside, lots of families, and it felt nice in there..like when you went out for breakfast in the 90s on a bright Sunday morning.

SERVICE: 4 - I thought that the service was good. The servers are always smiling and genuinely kind. They are constantly concerned about your food and if everything is tasting good. 

FOOD: 3 - My disclaimer: I really only came here to eat eggs. I did not want any meat other than bacon. I strictly came here for really, really plain ol' breakfast food, and not anything else.

I got a really boring item called "The Classic", but I really wanted just eggs and bacon, so that's what I went with. My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly. I mean, they were absolutely perfect. Some cooks leave the yolk barely runny on the inside, but they are experts at eggs here..and I have no complaints. 

The banana nut muffin was soft and moist, but I just didn't like the taste of it. I think I'm just picky, but the banana in the muffin tasted a little ripe. The potatoes were good, but they weren't great. The bacon was a little overcooked and a little too hard for me. 

I totally forgot to check Yelp before ordering, but next time, I'll order a healthy omelet and see how that goes!!

This was a very quaint breakfast place with excellent service. They have this cute little idea where if you need to contact the waitress, you flip a card shaped like an egg on the table to a sad face to request service. I got biscuits and gravy with potatoes, eggs and bacon. The potatoes and bacon were very good, but the biscuits were a bit too salty for my taste. The coffee is also pretty good quality. My parents got similar food; the only problem was that the food is a bit more pricey than our standards, but compared to some restaurants on the strip the price was not bad. Overall, I would come back again when I come back to Vegas for vacation.

Awwww yes I love me some breakfast anytime of day!


Took my sweetie here for breakfast after hearing all of the glowing reviews. I am sure glad we dined here because it was eggceptional! Make sure you come hungry because their portions are large and in charge!

Her-
Denver Omelette 8.49
Diced ham, onions, green peppers and melted cheese. 

*Three-egg omelettes served with ranch potatoes and an English muffin or toast.

Him-
Mexican Omelette 8.59
Chorizo sausage, green chiles and onions, topped with Monterrey Jack and Cheddar cheese, salsa or pork green chili, sour cream and green onions. Served with a flour tortilla.

Their ranch potatoes are so good!

Wow we were very pleased with the service and quality\/quantity of food! 

My coffee cup was never empty, refills galore from a catering staff!

We will be back indeed!

Yummy for sure a must stop for a lip smacking country breakfast!
The Pancho scramble was the best ever! Add the Salsas and it's a home run! Raul was a great server as well! He made some fabulous recommendations

Maybe my expectations were high due to all the great yelp reviews, but I found my experience disappointing. The restaurant was very crowded and noisy which isn't conductive to a pleasant experience. Our waitress delivered our food quickly, but my muffin was mostly cold and the food was rather plain. We also agreed the potatoes were way too salty. Overall I wish I had just stayed on the strip.

THE breakfast place! The portions are always large and rarely have I found a breakfast menu with more variety. It's popular for many reasons so there may be a small wait, but the tables get turned over pretty quickly. The staff is always friendly from the hostess through the bussers. Our server, Stacie, was very nice and quick with the food. I work in the food service industry and usually have a very critical-eye when eating out. This place is outstanding!

I give this restaurant 5 stars not so much the food, which was delicious and greasy btw but the potatoes were a bit salty for my taste, but I would definitely come back because our server Curtis was on it! Very attentive, very personable and very he's good at what he does. Thanks again Curtis!!

I really don't understand the hype with this place and why it is so packed. 
The food is mediocre and the portions are so large that it's unhealthy. The service is also pretty bad. When we arrived the hostess seated us at a  with unraveled silverware and a five dollar bill still sitting on the table. She gave us our menu's and left the money awkwardly sitting there. 

When we finally got to put in our orders our waitress recommended that we take a half portion of our cheese, egg and veggie skillet breakfast dish and I'm so glad she did. The half portion was like a full portion and I could barely finish it, as it had so much thick sticky cheese on top. Also, the seasoning that they put on the potatoes tastes exactly like Dorritos and I felt like I was eating potato chips (not in a good way). 

Also I just wanted to note something that happened while were waiting for our food to come. The waitress hastily sat us at a 5 top (it was just my bf and I). A family of 5 came in about 10 minutes after us and she tried to sit them in the table next to us which could not accommodate anymore than 4 people. She grabbed a chair from our table to try and seat them there, but the family was really unhappy, it was especially awkward as we were sitting at the only table that could fit them.
