She then moved them somewhere to the other side of the room. I saw the family leave a few minutes later out of frustration. 

The food is really just standard fare, nothing to write home about. On top of that it's incredibly unhealthy. I understand that Vegas has very little breakfast joints, but I would rather make my own omelet at home. Your health will be better for it.

Read the reviews on yelp and went to try it.  Glad we did.  I had the french toast combo (with eggs and potatoes) and the lady had some type of omelette that she thoroughly enjoyed and surprised me by finishing it. French toast was very good eggs were done right (I can't believe how many places can't do over medium right). Potatoes had a nice taste.  Service was good and attentive.

Definitely will return and suggest to others.

The food was yummy. The restrooms and restaurant has a pleasant and clean atmosphere. Our server, Liza, was very loving and catered to our every need without an issue. The plain pancakes were delicious, along with the stuffed French toast. I'd recommend it to anyone headed to or past Las Vegas.
Great food...!!! Amazing service... this is the best place for breakfast in Las Vegas.

Our first time here and the food is good. The gave them at 4 star. The only thing that I didn't like so much was the crazy large menu. It's a bit too much. The service was good and the people are really friendly here. It seem like everyone Who worked here asked us how was the food and have we been helped. You don't see that kind of service anymore unless you are eating at a fine dining. We definitely will come back when we visit LV.

Not the best breakfast\/brunch place I've eaten at.  The pancakes were average and a bit too sweet with the strawberry cream cheese (and I have a huge sweet tooth).  And their famed banana nut muffin was maybe too hyped up, so my expectations were not in line with what I actually tasted.  Not to say that it wasn't good. You do get a lot of food for the money though, considering you're in Vegas, so it's a steal. And the service was very friendly, like being in a diner where everyone knows your name. So if you're looking for a fix of good old fashioned, artery-clogging American breakfast, this would be a good option in Vegas if you don't want to break the bank in a casino establishment.
Excellent food! Linnea and the rest of the staff were awesone... Linnea is super friendly and helpful!  Will be back!

You can usually find md here on Sundays. Great food at a decent price. The only thing I would say to the owners and chefs is PLEASE lighten up on that super salty seasoning that you put on the fried potatoes. I definitely suggest this place to anyone who lives near here. I always leave stuffed.
You have to stop by here while your in Vegas it's definitely a must. The food is fire and please check in to try that amazing moist and fluffy banana muffin.

My favorite breakfast place to bring out of town guest.  The biscuit and gravy was way too salty today.  The crepe was good.  Too big to finish for one person.  Service was lacking when the place got busy.  Ask for a to go box and had to flag down another server via the smiley face after waited 15 minutes.

This place was awesome for a city , packed at 10am, but we got in rather quickly.  I got the Green Chile Breakfast Burrito, and it arrived on my table before I finished my coffee. Great burrito, Huge and tasty! The staff was top notch, and friendly! If I am in Vegas again, I would defiantly do eats here again!

Oh don't get me started on the fresh baked muffins they are amazing! And the food comes out faster then you can say "sunny side up!" I was getting bored of the same old breakfast joints like Denny's or iHop, they're just not the same! I took a risk with Egg&i and it's a risk I'll take again and again! They're menu has literally everything! From eggs to burritos, skillets to forgein! You name it! Trust me you won't regret spending your hard earned money here. I've never wanted an establishment to take my money so bad.

We had a feeling this place would be good after seeing a line going out to the parking lot.  The works veggie benny was incredible (generious amount of avocado slices in it) and their banana nut muffin  (free with yelp check in) was the best I've ever had! Despite a packed restaurant, service was great and faster than expected.  This place definitely has their act together as no chaos going on with very competent and friendly servers.

Free muffin with Yelp check in, you had me at hello! Perfect breakfast spot off the strip if you want to avoid all the usual chains. Plentiful portions and eggs galore. Everything we had was delicious. Next time I'm in Vegas, I will return!

Came across this place using Yelp before coming to Vegas. Immediately I knew I wanted to come here right off the bat looking at the pictures. Came here without any reservations but the place was spacious enough that we didn't have to wait. Three of us went and we ordered an omelette plate, pancakes, a skillet plate and a side of toast. Oj was a must! Annnnd we got muffins for free for checking in! The orders were hugeeee and all the plates came with a side of home fries! My chicken fried skillet plate was amazing! Definitely not what I expected. The fried chicken was covered with gravy and then topped with two Sunnyside eggs. I thought the fried chicken would be too crunchy or crispy and wouldn't blend well with the home fries tucked underneath and especially for breakfast but I was worrying for now reason! The chicken was covered with the gravy making them soft and moist yet still a bit crispy! This plate is definitely a must try!!!! The pancakes were great, one order came with two large pancakes that were soft and moist! The omelette was awesome as well. The omelette was filled with tomatoes, mushrooms and spinach! If you're able to drive out from the strip stop by here for some bomb breakfast!

Can't say enough about this place. Just all-around good American, Mexican, and even Hawaiian breakfast food. We had the Sundance special omelette with a side of fruit and the chicken fried steak with the side of potatoes. The omelette was vegetarian and extremely flavorful. We love feta cheese and it comes loaded with it. The chicken fried steak comes with your choice of two eggs, toast, and potatoes. The steak is smothered in a flavorful white gravy. The portions are large so you can always take some food home for later

The service is great also. Our order came fast and easy. Don't forget to check in on Yelp to get your free banana nut muffin. They're very moist and delicious. It hits the spot when you're starving for a hearty breakfast.

The Egg and I has been a staple of Vegas breakfast dining for years and is consistently lauded as one of the best places in town to getcher morning grub on.  It's easy to see why - this is just great, unpretentious food.  While it's fun to dine well in a dinner environment with tiny gourmet portions and fine presentations, for me breakfast is all about big portions and perhaps a little less regard to the appearance of the food.  It just needs to taste good and help wake your sluggish butt up.

The Egg and I offers breakfast staples - eggs, toast, pancakes, waffles, crepes, french toast, omelet, sausage, bacon - in various combinations and specialty skillets and frittatas as well.  Everything is always fresh, cooked to order, and served by a friendly wait staff.  I wish I lived closer, because I'd probably have their eggs benedict every day.
Food was great split a skillet and stuffed French toast with my wife. Carole Anne provided great service. This will be a spot to always come back to when in Vegas.

This place always amazed me! Amazing food and amazing service. Liliana once again delivered an exceptional experience.  I recommend you to try the breakfast tostada, it is delicious!!! Viva the THE EGG & I..
Best local breakfast place in vegas, I love the small time mom and pop atmosphere, the food is five star, their seasoned potato square cut are amazing with the breakfast

We went on a Friday morning during Spring Break around 10:45am. It was just starting to fill up and we only waited about 5 minutes. The food was delicious and Linnea was our server, who was excellent. It's not that far from the strip and totally worth getting away from all of the over priced stuff on the strip.   I ordered the chicken fried steak scramble and added mushrooms and spinach. The rest of my party  had an omelet and blueberry pancakes which were all really good. I highly recommend this place!

This was mine and my husbands first time eating here and we loved it so much we ate here two times during our weekend in Vegas because the food is delicious. Small and cozy restaurant with very friendly staff. Prices are incredible for the amount and quality of food you are served. I ordered the sunrise mountain the first day and the Ensenada breakfast burrito with potatoes the following morning. Hubby ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs one day and pork chops with eggs the next day. He enjoyed both days so much he wanted to come here all weekend. I would highly recommend trying this place for an inexpensive and very tasty breakfast when in Vegas!

My hubby and I love coming here as a part of our Vegas trip. We always do the Yelp check in for a free banana muffin and take it to-go!

The service is always really good and the food is very good too! 

The only dish I've had issues with is the corned beef hash. It comes out way too mushy and too salty! I've ordered it twice and have been disappointed both times. :( hubby is obsessed with the country Benny. That's a biscuit with a sausage patty, poached eggs, and country gravy. He tries to get the same thing at other restaurants, but it's never the same :)

The seasoning on the potatoes is great~ We bought a bottle to have at home although we have yet to use it haha

Anyway, 4 stars for the general deliciousness and service!

At some point during breakfast, my husband started laughing at me.  It was probably the look of utter ecstasy on my face as I made sweet love to the banana nut muffin.

... oh yeah, and the Italian omelette gave me such an upset stomach that the timeshare presenter freaked out and ended the presentation early.  That alone is worth the price of admission.  Five stars!

My favorite place to eat in Vegas. Not once have I ever been disappointed here. From the food right down to the service it is everything you need after a long night. Ask for Tamara, she is hands down the best server I've ever had. This place is a MUST!

The Egg's Benedict Florentine is a great breakfast to start your day with. They have several TV's on during the morning, with the volume turned down and closed captioning turned on so you can still catch the news.
Alexa was great - take her to Orlaaaaaaaandooooooo! The food was absolutely amazing! 10\/10 would come here again. Huge portions and extremely good!!!

This place is crackin' like an egg. Love the chile relleno omelet. So far this is my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas. Friendly staff. Quick & pleasant.

Worth driving off the strip (Not too far). Opposite side of airport.

Always a refreshing relaxing event to dine here. The most valuable part is having the great fortune of being served by Server TABATHA! So positive, spreading joy with her fantastic smile and direction!

By far THE BEST BREAKFAST PLACE so far in my life! Very simple & great service! The waffles w fresh fruit was phenomenal & biscuits & gravy - don't get me started! I don't know why this place isn't 5-stars on Yelp! It's probably because of losers or snobs who just want to make a statement. If I could I would give it 6-stars!!   I've been to breakfast places all over the country and this place is THE BEST!  "Johnathan" was awesome!!! Hope I'll see him in Disneyland! Cheers to the owners of this place, they know breakfast! :)

Wow! All I can say is incredible! Karla our server was amazing and super attentive! I ordered a Michelada with the Chile Relleno omelette and they were both epically awesome! The Michelada was huge and the chile relleno omelette was sheer cheesy goodness! My fiancÃ© ordered the stuffed French toast and looooooved it! Definitely will come back! And the banana nut muffin was so soft and delicious! Must try!
Eggcellent customer service.  Food was delicious! Really big servings! Seasoned potatoes and sausage patties wet my favorite.
This place has the best breakfast in town.  I totally recommend it. Our server Tabatha was great.  Get her to Disneyland !!!!!

This breakfast place is awesome! Their Habla Diablo Seasoned Potatoes were delicious. And, our server Paula was great. She tended to our needs right away and was very nice. We're definitely coming back here when we're in town.

This is the second time here.  Love the service, friendly, very welcoming.  I personally am very picky about service, not in a demanding rude way.  Egg & I has this cute egg faces which can be flipped based on how you are feeling about the immediate service.  Unfortunately some customers in my opinion abuse of this contraption.  The ambience is nice relaxing the music very nice.  I ordered The Veggie omelette with side of fresh fruit, my husband one of the veggie skillets with egg whites layered on potatoes.  I hIghly recommend Egg & I.  You also have the option of asking for 1\/2 portions if you're not feeling very hungry.

Great service.  The staff was very accommodating .  Best banana bread muffin.  Definitely exceeded expectations.  Ordered Belgian waffles.  Could have been cooked a little longer.  Not crispy melts in your mouth kind.  Will not order this again.  Will go back but will try egg dishes next time we are in Las Vegas again

This is a nice little breakfast place off the strip. We ate here on a Saturday morning around 11 a.m. and it was pretty busy. The menu is pretty huge and I had a hard time deciding what to get. I ordered the Fiesta Skillet with chorizo. The eggs were really good, but the chorizo left something to be desired. It probably wasn't the best item on the menu, but this particular morning I was feeling something Mexican inspired. The ranch potatoes were great, like little cubes of goodness.  And yes, the banana nut muffin is as good as everyone says it is.

Come here if you're looking for good breakfast with generous portions at a decent price. I definitely would consider coming back here the next time I'm in Vegas.
The portions were large and filling and our waiter Raul was attentive and fun!  Definitely a nice spot for a local or someone who wanted to get away from the Strip!

This place has a real vibe to it. At first, the goofy murals on the walls seemed a bit overly cheery for me but after perusing the huge menu and talking a bit with our friendly waitress, a delightful pregnant English lass, i really started to get the theme. This place is all about freshness, growth, and fertility. Our waitress mentioned it and i remembered reading a review saying they always seem to have pregnant women working there. I think that's beautiful! Celebrate life, ladies!

Best Breakfast Place In Vegas! They are known for Banana Bread Muffin and it is by far the Best Banana Bread I have had. The service was also top notch. They have a huge selection on their Menu. Overall, it was a great experience. Would definitely stop by when I am in the area.

Eggs and I just like Egg Works doesn't disappoint. The food is great and at a fair price. It is much better than having breakfast at a casino. Their portions are big so keep that in mind in case you want to share. Their staff is very friendly, especially our server Jessica. She was attentive and professional the entire time I was there.

It's all about the banana nut muffin. It's five stars all on its own. One comes with the meal, but you get another for checking in. Sadly, I forgot my phone in the hotel room so I wasn't able to get mine, but my friend got his to go, and we ate it in the room later on. Yummmmm.

He got the chicken fried steak, which was good, and I got some chicken, mushroom, avocado omelet with added spinach. I loved all the avocado in it, but there was something lacking in flavor. Also, there was way too much cheese. I love cheese, so for me to say that, it's a big thing. Also, I wasn't a fan of the salty seasoning on the potatoes. I wish there was less of it, or none of all.

Don't wait for your server to collect your payment. You have to do that at the front counter.

As a lover of breakfast, I can attest that this spot is awesome. Everything about the menu is suitable to all. The prices, portions, and taste can really cause instant love. The location is a nice size, so the wait wasn't too bad. The customer service is excellent and the clean atmosphere is super inviting. The portions are huge so come hungry and leave happy. 

We ordered stuffed french toast and an original breakfast burrito, both entrees included the most tastiest home fries. We really enjoyed our meals and didn't want to leave our plates. They have an amazing seasoning salt and housemade salsa that are pretty addicting. 

Defintely worth a try and a revist whenever we are in town. Yum.
This is definitely something I would totally  recommend,  the seasoning on the food. .delicious! !!

We came here with high hopes because of all the choices, loved the potatoes. The coffee had a burnt taste so we asked for a fresh pot but it still took 3 sugars to make it drinkable. The skillet my wife had with the Portuguese sausage seemed over salted and gave her a stomach ache and sent her to the bathroom several times. Our waitress was forgetfull and not very knowledgeable about the menu.  We probably wont be back for a while as long as the Omelet house is still in business. Sorry Eggs & I

I have several friends in Yelp Vegas and quite often bookmark a place that gets good reviews from them. Being a party of one I got seated quickly but many people were waiting over 30 minutes to be seated on a weekday morning because of all the folks up from Cali on Christmas break. That crowd further presented it's weight when I found out they were out of corned beef at 8:30 AM, ON A WEEKDAY! Not to fear, the diced chicken fried steak skillet thingy was great and more than I could finish. Packed as it was, service was still good.

Awesome menu.  I took photos of the different egg-ers.  They are just too funny.

Good breakfast food.  Friendly service.  Affordable price.  But they close at 3pm!!  I had to purposely woke up earlier in order to make to the place.  Com'on this is Vegas...  It would be nice if they at least stay open till 5pm.

Homey, tasty, and friendly. 

Every dish I've tasted has been great. This is the homey eggs and toast place you're looking for. Large portions and good prices only add the fantastic value.

If your looking for a great Breakfast spot in the LV area, look no further.  This place was great.  I ordered 2 eggs over-easy, with Potatoes and bacon.  My wife got an omlet.  We also ordered a biscuits and gravy.  Everything was AMAZING!!!!!!  It can get kind of crowded in the AM on the weekends but its worth it.

Great service, and the banana nut muffins were amazing.

I would've preferred fewer options and smaller serving sizes, but other than that not a bad brunch stop. It was busy on a Saturday morning!
It would've been good but they forgot my order. So I had to wait. The waitress did apologize and comp our meals but we took it to go and I lost my appetite. I missed my friend finishing her marathon.

Had a wonderful experience for breakfast with Liliana. Very delicious food. The Black prime rib benny was so very tender. The hash browns are so addicting with their Habla Diablo potato seasoning. If you like some kick and added flavor, top it off with their Habla Diablo sauce. Yummy!
Service was average at best. Taste and food quality about the same. I had to wait to be seated though so they are popular.

Randomly chose this place based on a breakfast yelp search. I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet with a banana nut muffin. The muffin was very soft and moist, almost melt in your mouth. Very delicious. The skillet was also exceptional. The country fried steak needed a very light push of a fork for it to break apart. It was very tender and juicy. 

The service was very friendly and welcoming. Our server Oscar was also very attentative and refilled our drinks before we finished drinking. That always scores huge points with me. This will definetly be a Vegas staple whenever im in town.
Service was great and the food was delicious! I ordered the corned beef hash and it tasted good. The banana bread muffin was moist and fresh!

Our server Staci was awesome, and made us feel cared for as guests.  I appreciated that she asked whether we wanted full amount of cheese on the omelette or butter on the toast, as it's nice to be made aware of some healthier changes to the food when dining in Vegas.  I took one star off for the potatoes that were too salty to eat, but otherwise everything else was great.  I had the veggie omelette with added avocado and banana nut muffin.
Fast friendly service! Generous and tasty portions of food. Staff was very attentive- I will definitely go back!

What a great little breakfast spot!  I got the crepes... yummy.  Mom got the veggie bene, also yummy.  I liked that the juice was nice and big.  Not a little shot glass like some other places.  The service was really friendly.  We appreciated the little egg face at the table to attract the attention of the very busy servers.  

While we were in the Venetian, we picked up one of the tiny tourist magazines.  There was a coupon in it for BOGO entrees.  If you are planning to come here, see if you can snag one.  It makes it an even better deal!

The location is off the strip so the wait was not too bad. We got there just before lunch time and waited about half hour (they text you when your number is up). Next came the foods, we ordered quite a few items. The one I remembered were seasoned New York steak and French toast sandwich with eggs and sausage. They are not bad but not super good neither, just your normal above average brunch foods. Price is good for Vegas. Our bill came to about $100 for 7 people.

Overall, I don't mind coming back another time.

I really like this place. There are a few of them in Vegas. I like to venture off the strip and find little local hidden gems. So I typed in a breakfast in my Yelp app and this place came up it was in a little strip mall. It was very homey inside the waitresses we're very friendly and service was great. The home fried potatoes or just write with the right amount of seasoning. I had the corned beef scramble. It was very good. There's plenty of seating and it felt very homey and the waitresses again we're very friendly. Service was just right food was good and the muffins were great

Once again I am hard on Breakfast spots. This place was pretty good they are not trying to reinvent the wheel. Coffee was good, food was good, service was above average. I will go back again but Hash House A Go Go is still my favorite outside a casino.

Good regular coffee and HUGE portions. I would recommend getting a half portion otherwise you will end up taking food home. Country fried steak skillet was great, the hollandaise sauce was just OK. And corned beef hash was OK too. Maybe you can ask for it to be a little extra crispy as sometimes it's a little mushy. Good potatoes and our waiter Oscar was THE BEST.

Had a great experience venturing off-Strip for weekend brunch! This place was super popular on Yelp and won so many local awards, we were forced to check it out. Arrived early afternoon, there was pretty much no wait, even though there were some customers lingering near the entrance inside and the place was still full! Service was extremely down-to-earth, friendly, and attentive!

This place has a huge menu (in the form of a "newspaper"...if that gives you some idea). There were so many choices it was really hard to decide on just one =( The variety is vast, but the bulk of the items were simple, straightforward, typical breakfast dishes with unique modifications\/twists or add-ons. My husband's chile relleno omelet was such a great idea for an omelet...the juicy chile and the cheese tasted amazing wrapped in egg! My benedict's garden (vegetarian version of egg's benedict) was superb as well. Even though one of the items listed in my dish was guacamole, I was SO pleasantly surprised when it arrived NOT as guacamole, but pretty much a whole avocado sliced up!!! You don't get that often, even in California! +10 points for that! The whole combination of poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, and avocado was such a delicious creamy mix, and perfectly-balanced by the crisp freshness of the tomatoes. I basically devoured it in under 5 minutes...and then had to wait for the husband to finish his plate *rolls eyes.* We both agreed that their seasoned potatoes were freaking AMAZING. We don't know what kind of seasoning they use, but it reminded us of Cajun and it was to die for. I wish they sold it by the bottle!
 
Wonderful place, with reasonable prices (total with tax came out to be $27) and a great cup of coffee as well. The awesome staff makes it even better!

At Egg & I, you can stick with classic, such as biscuits and gravy, or be a little adventurous with something like the carrot cake French toast. If that doesn't sound appealing to you, they have a lengthy menu of options (including those that are healthy) that will make it difficult to decide. In my opinion, the menu primarily consists of classics and southwest combinations, however, I also noted Island\/Hawaiian style selections. It's somewhat of an odd array, but you can't go wrong. 

The restaurant is located in an isolate shopping plaza with plenty of parking. Wait times are long; I suggest you plan for an hour of that (during peak times), with limited seating, so you may have to stand outside with the overflow. However, once seated, the service is very fast and friendly. 

During a recent visit, we received a gigantic, banana nut muffin with each Yelp check in.

vegas breakfast?..afternoon flights and up early...last meal for some...egg & i extra large breakfast platters...enormous sizes...literally mountain of potato cubes with heavy seasoning salt sprinkling...a brad's special...eggs, spinach and meats loaded and large...hungry?...egg & i will deliver a tummy expanding plate for $ten...comforting homely interiors...casual diner atmosphere...friendly service...

Holy moly! First of Karla is the best. You'll be lucky to be a table of hers. Not from Vegas but I'll be absolutely coming back anytime I'm here in town. Banana Nut Muffins...enough said. Just what everyone needs in their life.

Comfort food away from the pricey options on the strip.  Everything was delicious except the Mexican omelette we ordered was kind of a mess because it was a bit over cooked.  Other than that, it was a great breakfast and I'll come back to try some of the other items on their huge menu.

Been here twice and have been completely satisfied both times!! Food is delicious and the service is amazing. "Toria", our waitress, was awesome! A must stop for anyone looking for great food, especially breakfast!

Went here twice in the same week and it was delicious! Gets really busy on weekends but the line moves pretty fast.  Service was awesome.  We got free muffins because the waitress thought the food was taking too long.  We ended up taking muffins home with us because they were so good.  Love this place for breakfast!

Hearty breakfast where locals go. It's got a country-side vibe. Relatively cheap and large portions. Service was really quick, in and out in 30 mins. Great place to go if you're in Vegas and on a budget or if you don't wanna wait 1.5 hours for a trendy brunch place.

Recommend: omelettes are okay, get a skillet. Crappy OJ is $3.25!
I love this place !! Delicious food , and our server Tamara was exceptional! She was a sweetheart and We will definitely be coming here again next time we come to Vegas !

The service wasn't bad and the food came out super fast. However, I didn't like how the food was cooked. The banana muffin came out steaming hot as if they put it in a microwave. When I tried to eat it, it was so tough that a knife couldn't even cut through it. I asked for another one and asked that it not be heated in a microwave. They claimed it wasn't. I don't understand how it was steaming hot and so tough and hard around the edges. Then, when I got their potato scramble, the cheese all over the top was hard and not the soft, melted type of cheese. So if you ate your potatoes, you could pick up a whole layer of cheese. Again, it was overcooked. It's too bad because the flavors were there in both the potatoes and the muffin. The biscuits and gravy were good.

The cashier\/hostess Caresia must've been having a bad day. She was not friendly or personable at all. The food wasn't good. I ordered the strawberry cream cheese french toast. There was so much cream cheese, whip cream and artificial strawberry sauce that you couldn't enjoy the French toast at all. It was soggy. No need for syrup at all because it was so sweet. Definitely won't be going back to this place. The only thing good was the hospitality by the waitresses that's why I give it 2 stars.
First time at this location and it was great. Food was amazing good!! Tamara took great care of us. It's our first time and we're thinking on coming back gain tomorrow!!

Yum! I went to Egg & I after my last day in vegas for EDC! I ordered the prime rib benny and it was delicious. They also gave us some of their famous banana muffins for free since it was the majority of the groups first time there, which were to die for! they are soooo good and I am not even a huge muffin fan. Service here was awesome as well.

I like to visit restaurants off the strip and this was a Gem. I started with a banana nut muffin and it was the best, I followed with the 3 pigs omelet and it had plenty of meats and cheese, it came with plenty of the house home fries (which are good) and another muffin. Service was pretty good but it was crowded so we had to flag server down a couple times. Prices way better then the strip, I'd uber to this place if I had flown to Vegas

This is one of the best breakfast joints in town and they are always busy but they seat you fast and service is great the banana nut muffin is one of the best muffins there is it's huge delicious always fresh as far as the food concerned well I have my favorites and I never try anything else so I can tell you their menu is perfect for me the price is great the coffee is hot and I always leave with a smile on my face

Best banana muffins in town! 
Great place for breakfast, brunch, or lunch.  
Gets very busy on weekends, so be prepared to wait to be seated.  Or you may place an your order to go, if you know what you really enjoy.

Our server  was breeaanda? She was super nice and helpful. We were  originally sat outside but someone in our party had a fear of birds so they were able to relocate us inside. Our server was attentive and help and friendly. Chili Omelet  was the best!!
Not bad. This is a great neighborhood joint with lots of locales. Muffins are delicious. Yummy large portions.

Every time I come to Vegas this place is a must. The servers are very sweet (shout out to Jessica, our amazing server, who told us to go for the waffle with strawberries and cream - it was amazing and fluffy and warm and oh man. Miss it already. Sigh) and their little egg notification for need something\/satisfied) is adorable. Go. You won't regret it.

Get the skillet. Their potatoes are SO GOOD. 

Check in for their free banana nut muffin. It's also SO GOOD. 

What are you waiting for? Go!!!
Seriously the best breakfast in Las Vegas! Patrick is the best server he made us feel like family. I wish we had a restaurant Iike this in California.

This is a great greasy spoon joint. Not really for the health nut but if you want big portions and great flavors for a good price this is the place. The muffin was kind of sticky like they pull them out of the freezer to thaw. So we didn't enjoy that but everything else was spot on. 

My husband had the mashed potato omelette and my dad had the biscuits and gravy. I had the veggie omelet, all of the above were great!
Large portions, excellent variety and prices. Karla was an excellent host. Must try this restaurant at least once. Staff is friendly and helpful.
Our server Maggie was awesome as so was the food. This is one of our favorite places to eat.

Reyna was awesome from start to finish she made me feel very welcomed and best of all very friendly.. Service in general was one of the best and speaking about breakfast food best I had in vegas so far. I would recommend eating the stuffed french toast. :)

I can tell this is a local favorite!  You have all the makings of a good diner; big menu, happy ambiance, good service and fair prices with BIG portions!

I highly recommend:
-bacon and avocado omelette
-the works omlette
-chicken enchilada omelette
-banana nut muffins.

If they ask you whether you want fruit, potatoes or fries GO WITH THE POTATOES! They are soo well seasoned, crispy and delicious! :)
Price point: $
Ambiance and service: Clean interior and great service.

If we are in Vegas, this place is a must!!! You will not be disappointed! And if you are, it's because you lack taste in food! Everyone is very friendly and attentive! This place is perfect for the whole family!
Our server Raul was very good. Food was great and parking was easy. We only waited 10 minutes. Pricing? $50 for 4 of us. We left full.

Great breakfast. We had biscuits and gravy, omelette with avocado and bacon and couple of banana muffins. 
Food came out fast, hot and enough to fill us up. 
Service was great as well. 
I hope I didn't jinx myself for the next time i come again to get bad service and food. Haha

Great service, very delicious foods, a big dishes and very friendly staffs.  Our family loves breakfast and when to so many places in different states, and this place is the one of the best place!  Love "Egg & I". I definitely come again!

Went in during a pretty busy Sunday morning yesterday, and can I say how amazed I was at the staff and getting us our table in exactly how log the estimated. Everyone was very kind and helpful. Our server Oscar was awesome. I never had an empty drink I never had to look around and ask for anything because he was always a step ahead. I will definitely be going back to dine again soon!
Maggie was GREAT we come here for our last breakfast before we head home to California everytime we visit Las Vegas.. the banana nut muffins are a thing of beauty

I wanted to have some thing which is healthy and great in taste also so thought to go over to this place which is located at a prime location. We ordered bagel with cream cheese, works egg salad,  banana bread toast and waffles with fruit. It was an awesome treat for my taste buds and was simply amazing for the breakfast option. Everything ranging from the seating option, to preparation of food and freshness of food to the menu was really good and nice.
This place was amazing. We were greeted and sat outside within seconds. Service was excellent and included great recommendations by our server, Patrick. We will be back next time in Vegas.

Amazing food at amazing prices, about $15 per person. Everything is homemade and delish. Service is just as amazing as the food, there's a wee wait to get a table but well worth it. Very clean, food is quite fast. They make fresh banana nut muffins daily that just melt in your mouth and you can even buy a loaf or two on the way out, yummy. I can't say enough great things about this place. I highly recommend that if your in Las Vegas you stop by and try The Egg & I.

This was the ideal breakfast spot off the strip! We ordered the breakfast combo with pancakes, eggs, and sausage and the southwest skillet with chicken, chorizo, eggs and potatoes. They were delicious and the skillet was so filling I could not finish it! Reasonably priced for good breakfast food, and the staff was friendly. Will make this a go to breakfast place anytime we visit Vegas!
Great service, food is pretty good. Defiantly get a craft of OJ if you have 2 cups. Potatoes are really good, Eggs Bennie not terrible.

So many GREAT breakfast lunch choices you don't know what to pick!! Banana bread muffins are AMAZING !!!  Home style cooking in a a home town local venue. Worth visiting and venturing off the Vegas strip path!!
First time here. Such great food. Very great service. Def a must if your in Vegas. Got the black prime rib Benny it was fantastic. Dariesia was a great server. A+++++++
My husband and I went here with a groupon  to check it out.  It was very good.  The service was wonderful.  I would definitely go again when we return to Vegas!
The wait time was not bad at all, Sunday morning only about 15 min. The staff was super friendly. Get the muffin.  My omelet was ok.
Big portion of food and it's delicious.  Great service!

Great breakfast! Stopped in on I our way to Utah. The veggie omelette was delicious and he loved his stuffed French toast. Their home fries though!!! Yum!  Crispy and perfect seasoning. The service was great too. I believe we had Chance as our waitress she was very attentive and quick. Def be back next time we're in town.

3 words. Banana nut muffin. Sweet, soft, fluffy goodness.

I had the pleasure of dining here for brunch. Make sure to come early to beat the long lines because this place can get packed. Their menu has a wide variety of choices that you can choose from. But whatever you order, make sure that you get the banana nut muffin.

1. Sundance Omelette: It's the ultimate healthy veggie omelette. With feta cheese, spinach, tomatoes, and other deliciousness. I really liked the omelette. It comes with potatoes and your choice of toast or muffin. Get the muffin! All plates are pretty hearty, so this choice makes me feel less guilty of eating a lot of food haha (5\/5)

2. Cordon Bleu Skillet: Comes with seasoned chicken breast, diced ham, swiss cheese and delicious potatoes. This one tastes great with easy over eggs. Very flavorful and savory. Overall, a great one to choose from (5\/5)

The service here is friendly. Prices are reasonable as the portion sizes here are HUGE. Credit cards accepted. Plenty of parking.

I have to say, this was a outstanding breakfast, right down to the coffee. I had pork chops and eggs that was so tender. We also had the corned beef hash which was outstanding. Wherever you are at in Vegas, this is worth the drive. It is now a must have when I come into town. I was outstanding

I had the belgian waffle with strawberry and my wife had the omelette.  They both tasted verty good.  the fries were too salty.  It was easy to get in and people were nice and the one thing I like about this place is that everyone from the waitress to the person who refill the drinks to the table cleaner all want to help you if you have a concern.  They don't just say I will call your server for you.

Several people we talked to in Vegas recommended Egg & I, so we had to try it out. My wife and I both really liked the atmosphere. It was busy but they kept things moving. If you need anything, you can flip a cardboard egg on your table from black to yellow, and someone comes within minutes to see what you need. That, plus everyone gets a table-side carafe of coffee, were huge pluses. 

Unfortunately the pluses didn't completely overshadow the fact that our waitress messed up both our orders. My wife's veggie omelet, hold the onions, was stuffed with onions. My Cali omelet, the special for the morning, for some reason and as egg whites. I didn't want to wait for another one, so I just ate it. It didn't have much flavor as a result. Nor did the cinnamon raisin toast my wife ordered. I guess just a disappointing breakfast all together.

I've been back a few times since my last review and my opinion is the same. It's average food with a local spin on Denny's breakfast menu. Someone compared it to the Pork Store in SF and I'd have to say that's a pretty close comparison. They also mentioned Mama's in SF and I'd have to say The Egg and I is not as nice and not as tasty. One things for sure, I'd choose Hash House a Go Go in Vegas any day over this place.

So, after a crazy weekend in Vegas whats the first thing your body needs before you hit the traffic on I -15?  An IV, close... Breakfast.  The Egg & I is not to far off the strip, only about a mile depending on where you stay.  We took the back roads from Caesars and our ETA was about 5 minutes. 

The coolest thing is their "happy egg, sad egg" stand at the edge of the table.  Whenever you need something like a drink refill, or if you have a problem with anything, just flip the egg from the happy black face to the sad yellow face.  We tested this unique method of customer service and within seconds we had our waitress back at the table asking if we needed anything.  Even without flipping the egg the waitress was very attentive.

After you get your drinks the waitress will bring you a fresh baked banana nut muffin.  My buddy thought he was flirting with the waitress, and they totally were, so he made us all thank him graciously for the 2 muffins.  Then after 30 seconds of looking around, you realize everyone gets a muffin.  *Sad egg face Jordan, sorry :^(   But the muffin is warm and delicious.  

We had a party of 4 and we all got something different and it was all great.  I got chicken fried steak covered in gravy atop a mound of ranch potatoes with 3 fried eggs on top, and the best part about it was... they CUT it up for you!  This is when I found out I am lazy because you know you're lazy when you get excited about your food coming pre-cut.  The chicken breast was moist and the outside was perfectly crisp, and with every bite the batter unleashed a flurry of flavor.  Mouth watering.  The hype about their ranch potatoes is true.  They are really good and live up to the expectations other yelpers have set fourth.  I haven't had anything quite like them ever before.  My plate also came with a side of fresh seasonal fruit and a biscuit for gravy dunking. 

The rest of the gang ordered: eggs benedict, the breakfast burrito, and a plain jane 2-egg breakfast with bacon.  All of which was worth the wait on a Sunday morning.

5-Stars for the overall experience.  The waitress was cute and friendly even if she didn't give Jordan a muffin because he was "special," their happy egg \/ sad egg system works well when you need something in a pinch, the superior quality of the food and the prices are great especially after losing a couple G's at the tables in Vegas.

The food was good. I wasn't blown out of the water by any of the food we ordered but I gave it a 5 star because their customer service was one of the best I've experienced. Our server, Amanda, was so warm and welcoming and everyone else who worked there was just bustling with positive energy and good vibes all around. Servings are good for 2. There was just a bit of a wait as the line was out the door when we got there but they were quick to seat people. I would definitely visit again when I come back to Vegas.
Excellent portion which two people can share n reasonable prices but even more important, very courteous service
Dawg.... Amazing. Their omelette's are 5\/5. Stuffed French Toast is amazing as well. You'll love this spot.

Liliana provided excellent service for our breakfast visit. My wife had the classic breakfast and said the bacon was very good. I had a special, the Hobo Scramble, which was exactly what the description said and really hit the spot. Their potatoes are deliciously seasoned. We both also had their tasty sourdough toast. Had already had coffee so can't speak to that but the iced tea was good. It was Memorial Day so there was a pretty good line but it moved quickly, only about a 15 minute wait. Hostesses were great, too!
Terrible service wait for more than 1 hour, when it was suppouse to be a "15 minutes wait" . I asked if for sure was going to be 15 minutes! They said "yes" no more than 15 for sure!!

My favorite breakfast joint in the US of A.

This is the 3rd time we have visited The Egg And I - so worth leaving the Strip to get here - the food and service have always been great - and the people who work here are a pleasure to interact with. The place was jammed with a crowd outside when we came on a Sunday morning - but the wait was only 10 minutes and it was worth it. Food-wise the Fender Bender Egg Crepe was out of this world. (After I wrote the above, my girlfriend said "Oh, I forgot to order fruit instead of home fries" with her breakfast. The waitress of course said "I can bring you fruit" and didn't charge us for it. That's exactly what you would expect from a classy cool place like this. I made sure to Yelp it because we need more restaurants like this. And I repeat: every employee from the hostess to the waitress to the cashier was charming. Yes, yes, yes to the Egg and I. If I had the stomach for running a restaurant, I would do it just like they do.

Yum. Great food. And really personable staff. 
Need creamer? Which kind? All of them? Sure! No problem. 
Worth the drive off the strip.

I came on a Wednesday and it was not as busy as a Sunday would be and the service was extremely slow! Multiple people including myself complained about the food taking to long. I would suggest going to Egg Works on Rainbow same thing just faster service.
The perfect local spot for a cozy friendly meal, bring the whole family. They've got plenty to keep the kids occupied. I loved it here and I'll definitely be back! The breakfast is AMAZING!

Karla is the best!!!! Great service and very very very fast!!! Give her a raise guys and a big tip when you go!!! 



Food was good!!! Definitely coming back!

I know there's a lot of other breakfast places 2 eat at, especially the buffets in Vegas but I can only take so much of all u can places.  That's y we chose here, w the help of yelp of course!  It's kinda "retro" in there.  The waitress we had wuz nice.  She kept coming back & giving me coffee refills.  I ordered chicken fried steak.  It came w 2 eggs, ranch potatoes & the best banana nut muffin.  Omg, it wuz 2 die 4!!! That wuz yummy!!!  The place gets busy so try 2 come early.  Located off the strip.  I love breakfast places like this!!!
Had the veggie benedict and the biscuit and gravy. Perhaps we ordered the wrong this. I was not impressed with the quality of the ingredients or the way they were put together.
Thanks to Tamara! She was an amazing server! She made us feel welcome as we walked in. Way to go gurl!

This place was horrible! Did we come on a bad day or what? 

The 4 of us decided to stop in here for breakfast before making the 10 hour trip back home. We decided to give this place a try as it had really good reviews. 

We got in and got seated pretty fast, there was quite a few people. I ordered a vanilla latte coffee whatever and it was way too sweet. I feel like I might have gotten diabetes from that coffee. 

Aftwr looking at the newspaper menu for a few minutes I decided on the chicken fried steak skillet since I am a big fan of all things chicken friend. The 3 others got the Mexican omelet, I believe that is what it was called. 

The food came out pretty quick, first glance at my chicken fried skillet made me queesy but I was hungry and I thought it can't be that bad. The country gravy was gelatinous. It was weird. Like a slime blob of gravy exploded all over my food. Whatever. Give it a try. 

It didn't taste that bad but it didn't taste good. It was very salty and I just couldn't get over the slime gravy so I stopped eating. Everyone else with their Mexican omelet had tears streaming down their face. Apparently the omelet was too spicy to even enjoy. My partner is Mexican and loves her spicy foods. She is obsessed with all things spicy, tears will be streaking down her face and she will still say it isn't spicy enough, but even she struggled with the omelet. Maybe not that it was too spicy but that it tasted like crap spicy. 

Anyways, about 10 minutes after trying to eat my slime it hit me like a brick, I made a beeline to the bathroom and was in there for about 10 minutes only to return 5 more times. 

As you can imagine the 10 hour car ride home was horrible. Never again.

Stopped in yesterday for breakfast! Everything was amazing! I got the breakfast burrito and I even checked in to get my free banana muffin which was great! The service was fast and out waitress was perfect! I highly recommend to anyone in or around the Vegas area.

Had brunch with my daughter there on Sunday after church. They were full of customers and was very pleased at how fast we were seated. The food is very good, served hot with large portions. The sever Linnea was prompt and friendly. Great   overall experience !!
Traditional eggs Benedict was very good! Our server, Amanda, provided excellent service.

This place caught my eye as I was passing by due to the great number of people who were congregating outside waiting for a table so I decided to try it. It also was a good sign that local firefighters were walking in to eat there. The menu was newspaper style and some of the menu items were original like chicken quesadilla omelet and chile relleno omelet. My boyfriend ordered the carnitas skillet and it was flavorful. The service was quick even though it was a packed house. You definitely get your money's worth. I wish they had this place in the L.A. Area. Word of mouth is that the owner is considering it! I am crossing my fingers!!'

Best breakfast I've had in vegas in a long time. The service was on point. Food came out fast and hot. I had the turkey everything skillet with bell pepper and onions. So happy I decided to stop in I will be back.

Yelp guided us well! When we arrived, it felt like a breakfast place for the locals. They have plenty of choices. They have traditional American breakfast but we wanted to try something different (not pancakes, waffles or French toast). I had the Italian skillet and my husband had the Sundance omelet. It is a lot of food but we ate it all. I had no more room for my muffin so i took it to go. We loved the experience and would come back any day. This definitely a keeper in my book.
Loved the Ciabatta Breakfast Sandwich Brad's Scramble Special!  Service was great and food came in a timely manner.  Jose did great and deserves to meet the Mau5!
Two breakfasts - one was delicious, one not so much. Portions are huge. We enjoyed the omelet and potatoes. Potatoes were hot and delicious. The bacon maple french toast not really.
Great egg, mushroom and cheese scramble.  Banana muffin yummy. Waitress, Janeen very bubbly!

Came here as my second brunch meal in Vegas with my boyfriend. I had the veggie Benedict and my boyfriend had the Mexican burrito. The veggie Benedict was amazing. My boyfriend didn't like the Mexican burrito, he thinks it's typical diner food. But I enjoyed the food very much. The home fries that came on the side were so crunchy and delicious. The banana nut muffin was really good too, it was a good start to our meal. The freshly squeezed orange juice was good. The service was good and the price was definitely worth it.
I think this place has the best breakfast in town. If you go expect a small line except on Sundays. Then its a big line.

I wanted to try breakfast off the strip and read the reviews. So I did and I'm HAPPY to say. It's worth the drive. I walked in and was seated immediately. The wait staff is very attentive to their customers. I had barely sat down and was asked if I wanted coffee or water. I said both, please. 

Kai, the waitress, said "Hello!," asked If I had questions. The breakfast menu has nearly anything you can think of. It's on there! She returned within a couple of minutes and took my order. Ham and eggs, with a choice of hash browns or home fries. I went the home fries, 

While I was waiting someone would come along asking if I wanted coffee, I was impressed. The place was crowded with locals and some of us tourists!

The order arrived in about 10 minutes. I nearly fell out of my chair, the slice of ham nearly covered half the plate, it was lean, cooked to perfection. The home fries were not greasy and the eggs were cooked perfectly. As I prefer over medium, along with the toast.

Kai, came by at least two more times before. I ask for the check. This place had a good feel to it. By the way, it's situated in a strip mall and a person could drive by it. The words Egg and I are in yellow, the parking can get a little tight. However, the parking lot can handle the customers. 

Enjoy your breakfast there !

Back again on a Sunday after trying on Saturday but the line went around the building. Today we have a very sweet server \/ manager Carole Ann and the food tastes even better. People make or break a restaurant and this gal is tops.
I love this place. You have amazing selection of eggs, i recommend eggs-plus. The muffins are terrific!
Been here many times before. Food is always great. Bringing my girlfriend for her first visit. She's already loving the muffin
Came to Egg  and I For first time. The service provided by Chance was great ! She made wonderful reccomendations and the food was out of this world.

You got to try this place. This place is off the strip and not something that most visitors are aware of. It's a gem of a breakfast\/brunch place that is filled with positive energy and awesome food. They have a pretty diverse menu for all kinds of taste buds. The service is very fast hey doesn't take long for the food to be ready. Portion sizes are very generous and the price is more than fair. With The fresh taste of all ingredients combined with endless  fresh coffee in the morning, this place pays really well for the crazy day you're about to spend in Vegas. This place is a must try
I just had breakfast here. Outstanding service! Great food! Nice atmosphere. I will be coming back. Their banana nut bread was amazing.

Found this place on Yelp. What a great place! A big  menu, friendly staff, and great food!! My wife had the classic breakfast. Two eggs, bacon, Habla Diablo potatoes, and choice of toast or a banana nut muffin.  The waitress recommended the Works omelet - stuffed with bacon, ham, sausage, veggies and topped with cheese. Very good!!!  We even got a free muffin for checking in there on Yelp! Check this place out. It's off the strip west on Sahara Ave.

What can I say perfect eggs benedict phenomenal breakfast selection all around it's off the strip totally reasonably priced this place is a jem and every time I come back to Vegas I'll be there! Awesome service, fantastic food , great location. Go early or you might wait, so worth it though.

This place is great for breakfast. Tons of options from eggs to sweets. 

The service was great my first time here. I messed up my order and they fixed it right away and were really nice about it. Amanda was our sever and she was really sweet and accommodating I would definitely recommend this place for post Vegas nights.

For those who are super hungry and craving for eggs, this would be a good place.

This restaurant is packed even on a Monday morning. It sells every breakfast dish that has to do with eggs. We ordered Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy and Stuffed French Toast. Both tasted good and homemade.  Service was excellent (thanks Jessica!), portions are humongous, and price was reasonable.

Will definitely return if in the area again.

I was amazed by this place!! I love visiting local spots, not doing the typical hanging out on the strip.  I found this on yelp and saw the reviews.  I got the half order of eggs bennie and stuffed french toast.  My goodness!!!! What a meal!! I also had the coffee and all I added was two creamers, no sugar needed (I was getting enough from the french toast). The waitress was sweet enough to suggest half orders on the dishes.  My husband had the enchiladas and he loved them as well.  I didn't care for them as much- maybe since I wanted the sweet stuff.  This place is a must for anyone in the Vegas area.  It's obvious that they don't need my review- they are packed, but it's nice to be able to visit a great place like this. You will be amazed by the food and the service was great!! Thank you Egg and I!!!

Great service
Banana nut muffin (really really good)
Chile relleno omelette (a little on the salty side)
Chicken fried steak skillet (good but not as good as Ellis Island chicken fried steak)
Strawberry cream cheese french toast (too sweet, bread was very moist though)

not a fan of their seasoned potatoes

We are tourists (Vegas) and found this place via Yelp. Thank's yelper's ..... keep yelping!

If I was a 300# football player I could have finished my meal. The food was good but a bit to plentiful for our tastes. I liked the happy \/ sad face egg flippable sign to alert the serving staff of service status.

The most impressive attribute I found was the staff seemed so happy, positive and upbeat! 

Judging from the level of activity, this place does a great deal of business and I wish them the best. For some constructive criticism ..... investing in some better quality flatware will elevate the perception of quality and will do much in justifying the relatively high prices.

Came here over the weekend and wasn't impressed! Why would you have to use a picture of an egg to get service? Service should be an automatic thing. Service is slow and my waitress didn't seem like she enjoy her job much. As for the food, it has an unnatural flavor. The omelette tasted as if they don't use real eggs. I wanted to venture out but I think I'm going to stick to my number 1 breakfast spot mr. Mamas, their food and service are more worthy of my money (subpar)!

TASTY!!  We went here twice for brunch during our 3-day vacation.  On the first day I got the ultimate skillet (no cheese) with Portuguese sausage instead of regular sausage (reminded me of Hawaii).  It had bacon, sausage, peppers, ranch potatoes and other deliciousness topped with 2 eggs over easy.   Super great! Also, the server gave me an ice tea to take with me.  The service was pretty good - it was packed but it seems the staff actually pays attention to the system of "frowny egg"\/ "happy egg" because when we put the frowny egg on for more coffee, people came immediately.  
The second day I got the prime rib benedict but with guacamole instead of hollandaise sauce.  That was awesome!  They were actually too generous with the guac and I had to leave some behind on my skillet.  Service was again pretty good, but we got the same waiter who remembered us.  Everyone else at the table was also very pleased with their meals.  Can't wait to return on future Vegas trips.

The best breakfast or lunch in Las Vegas.  Alexa is an outstanding server.  She get orders correct, makes sure got drinks are always filled. Don't leave without trying their banana nut bread.  It is to die for!!!  You won't be disappointed!!!

Had the Eggs Benedict and the Greek Omelet.
Both were excellent.
Service was great. Prices very reasonable.
Excellent place for breakfast. We found it by chance. Huge portions and the ranch potatoes were awesome. Service was perfect and the wait time was 10-15 minutes. I would highly recommend.
I love it lots of food, great service and a pot of coffee!
The beef burrito was perfect for the Vegas hangover. Our server, Earl kindly answered our questions and served us quickly.

LOVE THE EGG & I!! it has been my go-to place for all of my vegas trips!! and this time me and my BF justin whom has never been here... went there on a monday morning...and it wasn't packed @ all...which is a first time for mee!! :) and we were seated immediately....and our server was ALEXA and she was such a doll!! she was very attentive and she even hooked me up with a sausage patty...cuz i usually get my waffle and meat and THEY USED to be able to give mee one piece of bacon and the sausage patty...but she said that they didn't do that anymore...but being the sweetheart that she is...she brought me one!! and my BF got the biscuits and gravy which he said was good but them potatoes tho!! i would absolutely love to just eat a big ol plate of those all day!! but yeah we will be back there...since it is definitely our vegas tradition!! :) soo thanx again alexa!! you were awesome!! :)
Exactly what we wanted, great food and great service. Awesome patio too!! Oscar was really nice and his support staff was very helpful! We will be coming here for breakfast whenever we are in town!

VERY friendly and service oriented staff.  Restaurant was clean.  Racheal was an excellent server - very attentive!  Food, of course, was great.  You can order half portions on many items. We did, and we still had leftovers!

A hidden gem in the sea of places to eat in Vegas. Great breakfast spot and we even drove out to this place two days in a row on our last trip.

Don't miss the banana nut muffins as they are delicious.

Just another ordinary breakfast place.  I didn't think this place was anything special.  The restaurant is located inside a plaza.  We went on a Saturday and we got seated right away, no wait.  But as we left, there was a line and that was around 1:00pm. I love corn beef hash and so I had to try their corn beef hash.  It came with eggs and toast (can choose muffin instead of toast) and if you check in on yelp you get a free banana muffin.  Our waitress forgot ours but we didn't make a big deal about it.  Corn beef hash was shredded style and I thought it was below par.  Not the best corn beef.  The place reminded me of another Dennys. Dennys being better. The restaurant also sells merchandise and sauces at the entrance.

First things first, WOW! The service was amazing our waiter was Raul. He was a very friendly waiter very quick and was checking on us frequently and quickly got a lot of food for four people and it was only $60. I highly recommend it

Place is decent. I wouldn't say it's any better then a Denny's or any chain breakfast joint. I had country fried steak & wife had bacon avocado omelet. Both came with potatoes which were crispy which I liked but not so much flavor. Tasted like a buffet potato. Also order a waffle which I thought tasted great but not much better the a chain restaurant. If your looking for a traditional family breakfast and not try a chain place this is okay. Price is pretty fair. We stayed on the strip and I didn't feel like it was worth the cab ride to get there for something I could of had any other breakfast restaurant. Staff is friendly though & attentive.

If you're visiting, this restaurant may not be walking distance from your hotel, but it is very much worth driving to! Also it is not overpriced like most places in Vegas. Do not surpass the banana nut muffin! Order it, it is delicious.
Above all the service and staff were amazing! The food wasn't shabby either;) our server Sunshine brightened our morning up! And the outside patio is dog friendly!

Wonderful breakfast! Unique offerings! I can't believe I would say this...but the best sour dough toast I've ever had! Excellent fresh fruit too. But you gotta have the eggs! Waitress Alexa did a great job explaining her faves. We will go back tomorrow.

I really like this place for eggs Benedict and I always make sure to come here everytime I'm in Vegas. Unfortunately this last time I went it was an awful experience. I was told the wait would be 20 minutes, but we ended up waiting closer to 50 minutes.To make matters even worse, there was a mix up in calling my party. When I first checked in with the hostess I made sure that my name was correct on the sheet and that it said caitlin, but when my "name" was called they called Lin???? We assumed that wasn't us because that's not even close to my name so we kept waiting. Finally after I noticed that parties that came after me were getting seated and we weren't I was getting really annoyed and it turns out that they had passed us a long time ago and they were 5 PARTIES AFTER US. When we brought it up to the hostess she tried blaming it on us saying that it was somehow our fault?? I was actually shocked like wtf?! They did nothing to try to make the matters better like I just waited 15 more minutes when I should've been seated already? Awful awful awful customer service, I don't care how good the food is or how awesome your business is doing but you've definitely lost a loyal customer

Came for brunch 
Had the skillet works and delicious 
Mimosas were good and served in mini bottle champagne

Fast seating, great service, the portions are huge but you have the option to half size your order. I ordered the half portion of the fresh veggie skillet and I got full with just half of that!  The banana nut muffins are the best I've  ever had and the food was equally amazing. You cannot go wrong with this place and it is pretty inexpensive.

Food is excellent if you can get it.  We had a table of 7, and 6 received their meals within a reasonable amount of time, except me of course!  Not one word was said to me, so we put an unhappy face on Mr Egg, but I still had to flag down our waitress, which took at least 5 minutes.  She seemed pretty annoyed when I asked where my food was. She said "we can only put 4 orders on one ticket, so yours will take longer". Hmm so why did 6 orders came out???  Finally, someone else came out because of the unhappy face on Mr Egg, and asked what she could do. I said everyone is almost done with their breakfast and I don't have mine. She went to check, making sure that we put the happy face back on Mr. Egg.. A few minutes later, our waitress came back and said that they were still baking the biscuits, and promised that she was watching for my order. Hmm, by then 3 people at my table had finished their breakfast. After another 5 minutes everyone was done eating , Finally a different person brought my order, with the explanation "they poached the eggs, so they had to remake it with my cooked eggs".  Ok which one of you clucks the truth?  So I got to eat while 6 people at my table watched me, so needless to say I ate pretty fast and didn't get to enjoy the egg-cellent food.  I'm pretty easy going when it comes to food orders, as normally we all do our best, But by the time I got my food and had to listen to 3 different reasons, I really did expect for them to take my meal (and only my meal) off of the bill. Was that too much to ask? Well I left with egg on my face, no discount...not even an apology. All I got was a "there now you have your breakfast, you are all set".  Really??? No we won't be going back to that location.

We ended up at this place after not being able to get into a few other breakfast joints on a Sunday morning.  I am sure glad we did.  Their food was amazing and the service was fantastic.  Would definitely hit this place up again.  Best part, it wasn't on the strip so the wait times and prices are pretty doable.
Chicken Skillet ( where is my chicken??) hey seasoning is really good
This is one of the restaurants we do breakfast at every other Sunday after church. Always pleasant, food is always fresh and hot, and our coffee. Endless just how we love it!!
Great service! People are very friendly! And food is delicious!!!! The banana bread muffin is soooooo good!
This was the best breakfast i had in las vegas. Service was timely and friendly.  I had the eggs Benedict with spinach the seasoned potatoes were awesome.  Definitely worth a drive from the strip.
Food was great! Manuela was nice and attentive. Definitely coming back when I'm in Vegas again.

Just like always both food and service is good!!!  But this time I decide to pack some banana muffin back to LA and share with my family. Our server Curtis is really patient to take my complicated orders.  Overall, everthing is really good. Will be back again next time when we are in town.

OMG...!!! Everything was amazing. The banana nut bread is homemade and heaven!!  To die for Chili as well.  Lots and lots of options. I love local breakfast places and this ranks up next to my favorite one back home.  I wish they had this in Oregon!!

This place is awesome and our server Liza's the BEST! My wife and I ate here for breakfast on our visit to Vegas. We at the bacon avocado omelette and country fried steak. Banana Nut muffins are homemade and melt in your mouth! Coffee also tasted delicious too, didn't want to stop drinking it! Place was packed but definitely worth waiting for. A must when visiting Vegas.

Visiting Vegas for the first time and found this spot for breakfast! Excellent service and the food was delicious. The banana nut muffin was absolutely gorgeous! Very moist (homemade). It was so good we bought a loaf back home! Will definitely go back
This place has the best breakfasts. Potatoes are simply award winning. Servers are always nice and on point. Atmosphere is relaxed. Props to our last server, Maggie, for being awesome.

We had breakfast there several days ago.  Excellent food and service!  Their banana nut muffins are also wonderful.  Our server Juan was terrific!  Although, he had only been there a week (?) he was very friendly, helpful, and pleasant, all the qualities you would like when trying someplace new!  We visit 3 times a year, and will make the Egg & I, one of our standard stops.  Nice to see a place with no slot machines!
Place was good my eggs were scrambled and I got a,free banana muffin per yelp which was nice had an overall great experience

Such an amazing place for brunch! Call ahead and ask if there is a wait just because when we got there, there was quite a line. Waited for about 15-20 mins, not bad for a Sunday, specially for Mother's Day. 

Ambiance is a homey relaxed vibe. They serve a variety of eggs, pancakes and chilis. They have a lot of options and vegetarians too so check out the menu! 

Price is about comparable to Denny's or IHOP. 

I ordered chile relleno omelet with banana but bread and the hubby got 'the works,' with toast. We enjoyed our food and both finished it in no time. 

Will definitely come back. 

Our server Erin is very upbeat and personable, made our dining experience a little extra special!

What a GREAT choice for breakfast. We came here based on the Yelp reviews and can see why the ratings are high. There are many breakfast restaurants that are good... But the Egg & I takes it to a whole new level. Excellent, attentive, friendly service. Delicious breakfast selection and many creative options, like the delicious Chile Relleno omelette and the Strawberry Creamcheese stuffed French toast. The banana nut muffins are amazing and the potatoes are seasoned to perfection. Super pleased. We'd most definitely come back here.

We had an awesome breakfast! There was a wait but that's what you get when you go to an above average dining experience! Our son was being difficult, and at first did not want to order breakfast. Then when our food arrived he decided he wanted something . The waitress was able to get his food to us so promptly, it definitely provided customer service that we were not expecting! Also just a tip, they have half orders on certain items - unless you're super hungry their food portions are humongous!

we were in vegas this past weekend for a very short trip. of course there are bazillion places to eat on the strip, but i wanted to check out some place off strip, to get away from the craziness of driving in bumper to bumper traffic, waiting for tons of people to cross the streets and then to wait to eat. 

Egg & I is located off strip, east of the 15 off of the sahara exit. its located in a strip mall with plenty of parking. there is indoor and outdoor seating. there were a few people waiting when we arrived but we were quickly seated. the place was full with a few tables empty. we were expecting to wait but it was already about 10AM by the time we went. 

i ordered the strawberry and cream french toast which was thick slices of soft french toast with a strawberry whipped cream cheese and strawberry preserves on top. it was pretty good. i liked that it wasnt too sweet like most french toast\/waffles with fruit toppings at other restaurants.

the bf ordered the fiesta skillet with chorizo. it had green chili, onions and salsa. i thought it was gonna be sausage type of chorizo but it was the ground kind. if you've ever cooked or bought it at the market you know what im talking about. when you cook it, it pretty much just melts. so the skillet was as if it had chili on top. it was pretty heavy and greasy. i could probably do without the chorizo next time.

the bfs bro ordered the country fried steak skillet. this had chopped chunks of country fried steak with their homestyle potatoes and eggs with white gravy on top. it was pretty good. it tasted just like a regular country fried steak plate but all chopped up for you, if you dont mind your food touching (i know some people who dont, like my 5 yr old nephew...).

bfs bro's fiance ordered the stuffed french toast. this was two pieces of their thick sliced fluffy french toast with an omelet in between. the eggs had lots of bits of bacon in it which made it tasty but it was pretty firm. i felt like it was over cooked. maybe it was all the cheese. it tasted good though. it tasted good with either the syrup and\/or ketchup. sweet or savory, whichever you prefer. 

we had also had a side of the banana nut muffin, which was pretty good. it was large on top. it wasnt too sweet which was nice. it came out moist and warm. yum!

the service was good. everyone was pretty friendly and the food came out fast. we had ordered coffee and they gave us a pitcher of coffee. they take credit card but you have to show your ID and pay at the front.

What's with the hype of this place???!
My dad and I came by, early in the morning, on our way to Salt Lake City. The place was dead, but we waited about 6 minutes to be seated. We sat down, received our complimentary banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp and drank some coffee. I kid you not, the coffee tasted like beef broth. It was gross. The banana nut muffin wasn't really anything special, but hey, it was free!
I ordered the veggie works eggs benny which saved Egg & I from a 2 star. It was really good, but I was expecting a lot from the outstanding reviews on Yelp.  My dad said his breakfast was "ehh." 
We paid our bill then headed to SLC. 
I can assure you I won't stop here again on my future routes to Utah.

Food quality is not that great so I always stick with egg options. Cute homey decor. It's in a convenient location for breakfast and lunch. Salads leave a lot to be desired. Wish they just had a few more healthy options.

This is the second time I've eaten at Egg & I and this place is soo good for breakfast. I forgot what I got the first time I've been here. The last time I've been here I got a cold turkey sandwich with french fries. The sandwich was really simple with turkey, guacomole, tomatoe and etc. Just the usually stuff but it was good. Their french fries was a bit different, it is small and crispy...not like McDonald's or Burger King fries.  I love love love their banana nut muffin!! It is so freaking good! Everyone gotta try their banana nut muffin!

I would definitely come back here again.

Tired of all the Vegas buffets, I decided to use my Smartphone and search for a breakfast place outside the strip.  I was directed to "Egg & I".  Loved the name and read some reviews which were positive.  This was my birthday breakfast so I had high expectations.  I am pleased to report that they surpassed them.  Unlimited breakfast options and very attentive staff.  I ordered an omelette and the hubby ordered strawberry waffles with tons of whip and bananas.  YUMMY!!!!!!  A must- go- to place when in Vegas.

Ok, imagine that you've just left South Orange County (Ladera Ranch to be specific) and you've made this great plan to beat the traffic in the Los Angeles area.  Part of the plan has you delaying breakfast until you get to Las Vegas, and the plan is working pretty well so far.  At Barstow you get out your phone and you begin to review the non casino options in Las Vegas when 'Egg and I' leaps out with these great reviews and a fantastic star rating.  Sold!  That's where we're going to go.

When we check-in on yelp we get a free Banana Nut Muffin, and things seem to be fantastic.

Our server is charismatic, checks in often, provides us with a pitcher of water (its something like 100 degrees outside and rising), and was efficient throughout the meal.

Our omelettes arrive in a timely fashion, and so what is their to complain about.  

First, I like cheese, and so having cheese is always a good thing, and for you this may be a big plus, but there was so much cheese it was hard to taste anything else.  I had ordered the chile rellano omelette, and it arrived as advertised, but with just a ton of cheese.  

Second, the potatoes looked to be cubed by a machine, frozen, de-frosted, and then lightly seasoned prior to arrival.  They were very disappointing.  

Third, my expectations were way too high.  My fellow yelpers love this place, and so I was expecting this amazing breakfast that just didn't live up to my expectations.

In a nutshell, I'd probably go back, but with a whole different set of expectations, knowing that I'd ask for sliced tomatoes instead of the potatoes, and I'd probably not choose an omelette.

Be sure and check in, a free muffin is not a bad thing.

Decided to try a breakfast place outside of the strip and found this nice gem. Carole Ann was a great server and provided us great service. The food was fantastic and the portions were awesome for being a half order. We orders the mash potatoe omelette and chicken enchilada omelette and it was delicious. We will be back again soon!

This place is awesom. It's a breakfast place with a southwest twist on the flavor for most dishes. My favorite is the country fried skillet. Price is a bit high but you get a ton of food. 

The service is always good. Never an empty cup. Worth the wait if there is one.

Fast & friendly service.  Good selection for kid meals that include a drink.  I got fruit instead of potatoes and it was worth it.  Fresh slices of orange, pineapple, watermelon, honeydew and cantaloupe.  Very delicious!
My first time visiting. I enjoyed my food. The staff was very friendly. I recommend this place for family and couples. The bathroom was no so clean. But overall the experience was nice.

Since my sister first introduced me to this place last year, every time I come to Vegas I HAVE to stop by and have myself some breakfast before leaving back to L.A.

The Banana Nut Muffin is so delish! They bring it out to you nice and warm! They also sell them in a loaf for $6.99 and I always buy a loaf home. And they wrap it in clear color papers that makes it look very nice and presentable. The Brad's Very Special is good. It comes with a side of potatoes and eggs that are scrambled together with spinach, mushroom, tomatoes, and cheese melt together. 

I definitely recommend this place to anyone that visits Vegas.

Well worth heading away from the strip for an excellent breakfast. About a 30 minute wait for a table on Sunday AM is a sign off somewhere good.
Lots of choice from simple eggs and bacon to full on skillet meals. Our omelette where great, as where the great banana nut muffins. Brilliant service from Genesis.
