Just like most other reviews say , the banana muffin is great- the potatoes are as well- the wife & myself both had the skillets , they were good . Plenty to eat , service was good staff was friendly , food came out quick- a good place off the strip

I've been to some of the other egg works locations in vegas and have enjoyed them all. I got the Santa Cruz skillet and it was very tasty. I've had some better dishes at other locations (carnitas skillet!) but this was pretty darn good. The service was great and very accommodating even though they were busy, and by checking in on Yelp we got free banana nut muffins - a must try! Won't hesitate to go back next time I'm in vegas.

This spot is 15 minutes from the Lad Vegas strip. You can't find breakfast like this on Lad Vegas Ave. The Banana Nut French Toast is simply amazing. Also, you can't go wrong with their homemade potatoes. They are seasoned with what they call " habla Diablo" and are to die for. If you are looking for a great breakfast spot in the Las Vegas area, you must try this place for yourself.

The food here is good just the amount of food And everything came out hot. Service was better than some of the other places we have been to. 
  We would come back here to try the rest of menu

I think it's hard to find a breakfast place that truly stands out, at least a cheap one. This breakfast place, I will remember and even recommend.

I had the banana bread French toast AND it was pretty damn good. Mind you that there were sooooooo many things on the menu I wanted to try.

The other people in my "party" had the:

biscuits and gravy - "this is legit" was the comment from the southern gal
Cinnamon raisin French toast - "mmm, this is good"
Seasoned potatoes - I kept eating it off my friend's plate. 

I actually don't remember what my dad got but he didn't say "junk" so that is a good thing.

Good service. Eh coffee.

OK
You must go there, if only for the CHICKEN FRIED STEAK.
I can't imagine it being any better

Very good service and great food.  I've had wonderful servers every time i had breakfast or lunch here. Chance helped me out and was delightful through it all. Raul is also has a great personality and was sure that everything went through smoothly. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great breakfast or lunch.
Breakfast was amazing. Brought friends from out of town and they said it was the best breakfast they'd had. Koko was great and really fun!
This is our go-to breakfast spot on our drive out from a full weekend of Vegas partying.  That Banana nut bread, oh, that banana nut bread.  I am craving it as I type.

The food was good but not amazing, I'm not sure what all the hype is about. Service was great hence the 4 stars. Husband liked his works omelette. I ordered the stuffed French toast which had a little too much cheese and the kids' banana pancake was pretty dry. I'm not sure I'd come back.

If you want some American style breakfast that gives you real proportions, this is the place to be. I was thinking about going to Ellis Islands for their $6.99 steak and eggs, then I changed my mind thinking about dealing with the strip crowd. The best advantage I always have in Vegas is my own car, and my own GPS. I can have the same options as a local. 

This place is a Zagat rated breakfast joint. The food did not disappoint either. I tried out their waffle plate which came with 2 eggs and a large slice of ham or sausage. The waffle could've been a little warmer, but it tasted wonderful. $2.25 for all you can drink coffee has Starbucks beat. This was the perfect place for my stomach to get all that alcohol soaked up and out of my system for the long drive home. I now have a new off the strip favorite breakfast spot.
This is the feed I've had on my month long trip around the country, fresh products, great service and it's cheap. Would definitely recommend.

AWESOME AND FRIENDLY SERVICE!!!
i think every worker in the place told me "good morning".

Great Stuffed French toast!!!!  Spot On!  

LOTS of food:  i recommend sharing!

banana muffin did not live up to the hype.  

coffee pot left on table makes life easier too. :-)

Great breakfast prior to a Vegas departure back to San Diego!!!

I was introduced to this wonderful place a few years back by a family member and knew I had to come back next time I visit Vegas from LA. So on the way back home today we stopped by for breakfast. The place looked as I remembered and we were promptly greeted and seated by a very friendly hostess. The menus are quite charming as they look like your local newspaper and there are many delicious options. I ended up ordering Grandma's Biscuits & Gravy with scrambled eggs, home fries, sausage patties and a banana nut muffin. The muffin was soft and warm; slather some butter and it was great. I really enjoyed the gravy on the biscuits and the home fries, where are very well seasoned. The rest of my party got a ham and bacon omelette with home fries and a blueberry muffin, along with a chicken salad sandwich on rye bread with cranberries and walnuts. All three of us ended up eating half the plates so we have some food to go with us on the 4 1\/2 hour trip back home. 
Overall, great food, nice service and reasonable prices. Will definitely make a return trip next time I'm in town!
Amanda was our server.  Her smile is congatious and her service is exceptional.   Food is fantastic too.  Great way to start the day!!!

This place is not to be missed if you're looking for breakfast\/brunch\/lunch in Vegas. I had the Country Benedict, was good, gravy could've been thicker, but still good. My wife had the Gumbolaya, great!!! House potatoes had amazing flavor and the banana nut muffins were delicious. Wish there was one of these by me!!
This will be on my must visit list from now on.

This place is by far the best breakfast\/lunch restaurant in Vegas...great quality food and service was amazing! The staffs works as a team to make sure you have everything you need! Highly recommend!!
This place blows broken yolk out of the water.  You have to get the potatoes with your breakfast.  It's off the main drag but totally worth the short trip.....

My husband and I visit Las Vegas pretty regularly and wanted to try a restaurant the locals patronize for a change. It was really busy when we arrived but the wait wasn't too terrible. We were seated inside, and it was really bustling. 
With our Yelp check-in, we each received a free banana nut muffin, which was REALLY tasty. I ordered the Vegetarian Benedict (with bacon) and my husband ordered the Biscuits and Gravy and Blueberry Pancakes. My Benedict was really, really good, but I will say their hollandaise is seriously lacking in lemon juice. It didn't seem like an authentic hollandaise at all, but it tasted good. They know how to poach an egg beautifully, which made up for the sauce. The breakfast potatoes that come with every entree are very flavorful and crispy. My husband really liked his biscuits & gravy (he said the biscuits were very light and fluffy), but the pancakes were a huge bust for both of us. They were way too dense - the texture was pretty awful. I'm assuming that's how all their pancake batter is, so I'd hard pass on pancakes there. 
It was fun to venture off the Strip, but we'll probably stick with breakfast elsewhere in the future. HOWEVER, they offer an extremely generous military discount of 30%, which we appreciated. We didn't even ask for it, but when I opened my wallet, she noticed my military ID and offered it up.

I'll preface this review with the fact that I am NOT a breakfast person. I don't love anything about it. Except when I visit the Egg & I. And let me tell you ... it became a weekly event after a while.

I can't turn down fresh squeezed OJ. This restaurant has delicious OJ. You should try it at least once. I love their menu. They have interesting combinations, like chicken, pesto, and eggs, and delicious twists on common breakfast dishes, like French toast. I love the scrambles the most, and would  often get the veggie scramble sitting atop ranch potatoes. Slather that mound with hot sauce and call it a day. Expect an exhilerating food coma to follow. The portions are big. I also recommend trying their complimentary banana nut muffin at least once. I don't like muffins or bananas, seriously, but I like theirs. Be adventurous, don't order eggs and a side of bacon. Live it up a little...

Super awesome service. Expect to wait on the weekends for breakfast\/brunch, but they have a quick turn-around and great waiters\/waitresses. A nice perk to the crowded atmosphere is an egg on the table that you can flip when you require service. On a very busy day it's very helpful to the staff, and don't be afraid to use it! I've always had friendly, impeccable service here ... no complaints. I've brought every out-of-town guest here for breakfast, and we've always left happy. Stop in and give it a try!
Breakfast this morning was very good both in size and cost. We were immediately seated and our waiter, Ulitis, was very good. We will come again.
One word DELICIOUS!! Lots of breakfast choices, oh yea n lunch. If you're in Vegas you must stop by! mmmmm Can't wait to go back!

Soooo good with EXCELLENT SERVICE!!

I ordered the crazy chicken omelet. It was cooked to perfection.  They did NOT skimp on the cheese, at all.

 It came with seasoned homefries that were the best I'd ever had. Super crispy on the outside, nice and fluffy on the inside. The seasoning on these fries was perfection. 

The banana nut muffin that came with the meal was PHENOMENAL!! Served warm with butter. You could literally taste the spices inside the muffin.  You could tell it was homemade. 

If I lived in Vegas, I'd be a regular.
Really good food, super fast service!

This is still my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas.  It is my first choice and the food is as good as it had always been.  The service is also excellent!  I have to admit that I've never had anything on the lunch menu before because no matter what time I go I always order breakfast - it is that good!

Thought this place was great...favorite thing was definitely the free muffin we got for checking in on Yelp! I also had the corned beef hash which was really good. Service was great and I overall would love to visit this place again!
Good food good service. First time I been there. All I heard was good things. So took the family. It was a good time there. Nothing to special to

Love love this place!!!!!! Super delicious breakfast!!! Came with my girls and I ate the biscuits and gravy and they were the best! I also had the blueberry pancakes and they did not disappoint! Karla was our waitress and she was awesome! She was very attentive and kind! Thanks Karla for making our breakfast that much better!  I recommend this place!

Ive lived in Las Vegas about 3 months now and drive by here often and have always wanted to stop and try it.  Especially, after seeing all the amazing yelp reviews.  Unfortunately i wasn't very impressed.

There were a ton of people (as i expected) and my son and i only had to wait about 5 min., the entrance is horrible.  Seems like such a fire hazard to me....way to many people in and out and standing in the door way.  

The seating was way too cramped for me.  But the waiter was right there and got our drinks right away.

Our food was brought out in great time.  

Iam on a very strict diet, so i ordered whole wheat banana pancakes.  They were HUGE !!! but tasted like something i could have very well made at home.  My son had Mickey Mouse shaped pancakes with a fruit face and bacon mouth.  He loved that part but that was about it.

All in all it was 'ok'.....i may or may not go back....im reading about all the yummy stuff that my diet doesn't aloud perhaps on my next cheat day ill try again.

Exceptional and friendly service. Quick delivery.  

Corned Beef Hash: not what I expected.  I want to call this dish, smashed corned beef. The consistency was of baby food, smashed and smeared into a patty. Kind of reminded me of dog food.  The flavor wasn't the best; small bites of potatoes and peppers.  The egg was cooked perfectly.  Highly not recommend this dish.  

Veggie Benedict: creamy with bursting flavors.  The potatoes were bursting with flavor and crisp to the eat! Veggies were fresh and delightful.
This place is the bomb. Great food great prices. We sat on the patio and it was perfect. We will definitely be back. Karla is a wonderful server. Enjoyed everything about it.

Banana nut muffin & their potato hash is the business!!!

This place only serves breakfast & i believe they close at 3pm. The menu looks like a morning's newspaper, they have tons of yummy items to choose from. The trick to getting your waiter's attention: first you'd have to look at the smiley egg that holds the condiments on your table and when you flip the egg to a frown, you'll be serviced in no time. Unless they are super busy and most of the time they are so just wait patiently. 

The food portion size is big, I would say that thee portion is adult men's size who is damn hungry in the morning because I never finish and always pack it home.

Every time I order unlimited coffee, it always taste old (drink @ your own risk) :\ so I never get coffee unless I absolutely need it. 

Overall, I love this place! Mainly I give them a 5 for the damn food...it's just too damn good.

Our Server Breeannada (Bree) WAS AMAZING!

She was attentive, respectful, and a model of an excellent server. She knew her menu front to back - and it's a big menu!

The food was delicious - this was our first time here - if we lived here in Vegas we would be in here all the time! 

Next time we come out here  we will definitely be back!

Love this place. Large selections to choose. Beginning with banana nut muffins, so moist and soft, perfect sweetness, this is most ordered item here, I guessed. I ordered a California Crepe included diced bacon, sliced mushrooms, diced tomatoes, guacamole and Swiss cheese, I replaced diablo potatoes with fresh fruits. Food was so tasty. AWESOME good. My husband ordered a Cordon Bleu Chicken Skillet which is seasoned chicken breast, diced ham and Swiss cheese served with diablo potatoes. He liked his food except for diablo potatoes. Lol. 
Service is fast and attentive. Would definitely come back.

The staff is very friendly and attentive. There was a nice variety of food and the portions were large. The banana nut muffins are quite delicious and I would recommend them. I ordered the original breakfast burrito and it was pretty good. The salsa that came with it was soooooo good. The potatoes that came with the burrito had good flavor, though they were slightly to salty. Despite the wait, I would recommend this place.

This place is highly overrated. I've eaten at way better breakfast\/brunch places that are also reasonably priced and give you large portions. The major difference is quality! I was not a fan of their potatoes and I normally love potatoes. But there's is clearly frozen potatoes that they just fried and added some powder flavoring. It also was overcooked. I got an egg omelette and they are suppose to be famous for "EGGS". So why was my eggs overcooked as well?! My whole family and I were not impressed whatsoever with the quality of food. The service was ok. Price is reasonable. But the quality of the food and the ingredients weren't that impressive. As mentioned, this place is highly overrated.

First time at this location went here because of all of the good reviews... Was pleased that they offer  a free banana muffin with checking into Yelp. Ordered the half stuffed French toast with turkey bacon and seasoned potatoes and that is really enough for 2 people. Would definitely come back if around this area.

I usually don't write reviews but made the exception all because of our server Patrick! He was amazing! I hope Egg & I knows how lucky they are to have him. Very friendly, attentive & gives the best customer service so thank you Patrick for making our experience so great! :)

What a great find! I ordered the eggs benedict that comes with the works potato and it's amazing! The plate could easily feed two! 

Our waitress was super friendly and knew  what we needed without having us call her!  I'm a little sad i didn't get a chance to use the eggy help flag (there's a flip egg stand on each table that you flip over if you need anything). But at the end of the meal,  I don't care, food was great and the service was exceptional because our waitress, Carole Anne, was awesome!!

After a long night out in vegas lights, the Egg & I is just the right place to go afterwards. While the wait is bit long, its all worth it for the food and service they provide. Shout out to our host Earl, who took care of us perfectly! Those with  spicy pallet, the food is perfect for you. Combination of mexican spices and english twist on the spinach Benedict is finger licking good. Highly recommended #VeggieAbroad

This was a really cute brunch spot. I found it by the recommendations off Yelp. I drove by on the weekend, and boy was it packed, with even 10 or so people waiting out front! 
I ordered the steak and eggs breakfast. The steak was good, and cooked just the temperature I ordered. The eggs tasted fresh. Breakfast also came with a banana nut muffin, which I actually enjoyed! It was moist and warm. 
The potatoes were well spiced and served well with the rest of the breakfast. 
Great service! I would come back.

Based on the general consensus, here on Yelp, I tried the country fried steak.

I've had a many country fried steak in my life...and this is one of the better one's!  We were warned by the server, but it was indeed salty, but not extremely (albeit I prefer more sodium than most).

To me, flavor was great, consistency of the gravy was perfect (not too thick or thin), country fried steak was moist and very crispy, eggs were prepared perfectly and the potatoes were very crispy (potatoes were moist and seasoned well - but also salty in a good way!).  

More over...the nut muffin, as others ranted about, was very fluffy, moist and flavorful!  This dish was spot-on for breakfast.

This place was a big letdown. I guess b\/c I had such a great experience with EGG WORKS their sister place I had put this place on such a high pedestal and they fell off... and no all the kings horses and all the kings men couldnt put this bk together again. 

ENTREE: my bf got the franciscan scramble. sounded really good and he's a professional order-er. Its amazing to watch him work. Everything he orders always comes out spectacular and the best tasting dish at the table. not me.  I had a the tostada last time and I had really wanted the cobb salad but was torn. So this time cobb salad was my only request. 
disguisting. 

COBB: I love cobb salads. This was just plain GROSS. they probably gave me 3-4 lbs of ICEBURG LETTUCE. really? iceburg? gross.  the croutons were the 99 cent croutons with the green specks on it. They gave me 1\/4 of an egg... at a a place with the word EGG in it.. i was very disappointed. You'd think theyere 'd be at least a full egg? maybe 2. no.
on top of my salad was a lil bit of shredded cheese, and some deli sliced sandwich meat turkey and ham (not even cubes) and the box of sprouts sittong on top of my salad. i ordered blue cheese dressing, they brought me ranch. anything that could go wrong did. 2nd worst meal i've had in las vegas since I've lived here. 

Maybe its my fault? my fault for ordering anything that wasnt scrambled so early in the morning. I take some responsibility in that I guess. my bf's omelet was delicious. the potatoes were good.. so was his banana nut muffin.. (while my bran muffin was gross) it was just the perfect yin\/yang of good vs. evil... , er mavs vs the heat, the cowboys vs the 49ers, egg works vs egg & I... and yes good food vs. bad food. 

The only reason I gave them 2stars was b\/c of the bfs food was 4 stars cancelled out by my zero stars.. to equal 2. :) 
Here's hoping you gleam something from my review... please do not order a salad at egg & I.

Well let's start with the service. Tamara was our server and we would like to give her 10 stars.
The biscuits and eggs were also a 10.
They have so many people working everything is do smooth. Packed house but a short wait.
Best breakfast place in Vegas.
We will be back!

Absolutely delicious.  Our server, Genisis, was wonderful & even took good care or our dog while we dined on the outdoor patio.  I highly recommend the omelettes, pancakes, & potatoes.  The banana nut muffin was warm & soft, crispy on the outside, & so good that we ordered a third one!  Much better than the high-priced bland Casino breakfasts.  Worth every penny!

You definitely have to try their version of a banana nut muffin. I've never eaten a banana nut muffin quite like it.  Now I know why they're famous for it.  I also love their newspaper-like menus, very creative.  

It is a comfortable atmosphere and friendly service.  This is a popular restaurant, and we went on a Saturday morning, thus we had to wait for about 15 minutes for a table, which isn't bad at all. It took a while for us to decide on what to order because everything (they had quite a variety of choices on the menu) sounded so appetizing.  After we finally ordered, our food came out quickly, and everyone was pleased w\/ each of our orders.  Everything looked very good and tasted great too.    

It's not located that far away from the Vegas Strip, and it's definitely worth the short drive.  It's also a nice getaway from the chaos and traffic where the casinos are.  I certainly couldn't have gotten a decent and fairly priced breakbreast\/brunch meal somewhere on the Strip. From now on, whenever I visit Vegas, I'll have to goeat at Egg and I.

We came to Vegas to celebrate our friend's bachelorette party weekend, and stopped by here before leaving from our trip back to Cali. We arrived around 11am, and the restaurant was PACKED. However, upon checking in, the lead hostess informed that the wait was surprisingly only 15 minutes... Talk about efficiency!! They got it down here! Amazing customer service!

Of course, Vegas is extremely hot and we were in a rush to eat and leave, so we were flexible with our seating. Outside was fine, and that's where we ended up. The outside patio was hot due to the weather, but they had some machines that automatically blew out cold must which helped a little. OSCAR- (woot woot!) our server, was absolutely AMAZING and provided exceptional customer service, making out group feel very welcome. He was extremely knowledgeable and friendly, and gave us some great suggestions for breakfast and lunch. Our entire party was beyond satisfied with the service, friendliness, and quick arrival of our food. Oscar provided us with the best banana nut muffins, which were served warm with butter. I had the breakfast burger with a fried egg on top, a side of delicious seasoned fries. They also serve stuffed French toast, and you have the option of getting half country potatoes and fruit, instead of full order of one or the other. Food was delicious and we will definitely drop by the next time we visit the Strip. Hands down, this is one of the best breakfast places I have been to!

I love this place! Preferably because they serve turkey products. This is my second time at this location. I ordered the waffle works (w\/ strawberry & cream,eggs and turkey bacon), Habla Diablo season potatoes and cranberry juice. I purchased a Groupon for $13 for $20 worth of food.

The Eggs Benedict is the best I have ever had at any restaurant. I have been searching for the best Benedict for years and this tops the cake. I am so satisfied and so happy I found the perfect place, even if it isn't in California where I live :( Service was incredible as well! Thank you so much for this wonderful experience. Ask for Patrick as a server! Tipped 50%. He is amazing. :)

It was good very basic food not every one was a fan like I was, but they ordered Mexican breakfast at an American breakfast spot. I had the Omelet with sausage and orange juice. All was good but the Banana Muffin was oh so nice.

This place was great!  Not terribly expensive, great selection, good service and we would definitely go back.

As a note, we learned you could get half portions on most of the egg items.

I was a little skeptical when I walked into this place at first but once I saw the menu I realized this as a lovely surprise at Vegas. The place was bustling with people and the food was excellent. The coffee was great. A great b'fast place to go at Vegas.

My husband and I just came across this place last weekend and I must say although we waited 30mins to get seated it was well worth it. After a long weekend in Vegas we wanted to get away from the strip and Long behold....was the Egg and I. The service was good and the breakfast was delicious. They have the best banana nut muffin! We ended up ordering a few for the trip back home!

An awesome local breakfast diner, a couple miles off the strip on Sahara.  Lots of cool touches like the newspaper style menus and the little flipcharts to let the server know you need something.

The breakfast skillets are superb here, served hot on the skillet with a layer of ranch potatoes.  I have tried both the Chili skillet and the Ultimate skillet, both were excellent.  I also recommend the banana nut muffin side.

I would, however, advise against ordering from their Mexican inspired menu.  They should definitely leave the chorizo con huevos to the Mexican joints.

Overall one of my favorite Vegas dining spots, for breakfast or a late night snack (they are open til 3AM).
Found a really good breakfast place! Plus a great service! Our server was Tamara, shes really nice & friendly. We'll be back ^^

This is a very busy restaurant. Expect to wait at least half an hour for brunch. That being said the food was appreciable but it took forever to come because it was so packed. I get the appeal with their specialty items and delicious egg dishes. But there are probably other places just as good. I recommend going at an off time so you don't have to wait.

Now my second favorite breakfast in Las Vegas (Hash House is #1). The place doesn't look like much situated in a rundown strip mall several miles off the strip. I am thrilled we picked this place though, they have earned all their outstanding Yelp reviews. Excellent service and excellent food.

We ate here on our last day in las Vegas. We were looking for a place to eat off the strip and I'm glad we found this restaurant.  The portions are huge, more bang for your buck. I ordered the half portion of the southwest omelette and my husband ordered the chicken fried steak and we both were satisfied.
Really great breakfast. The Mexican omelette and the bacon avocado omelette was the Bom!!! Banana nut muffins were delicious.

We stopped by for a quick breakfast before heading to the airport on Saturday morning. Our last experience here, we had to wait over an hour for the food to come out. It was so bad our waiter had comped our food. So needless to say, we were hesitant coming back here because had to catch our flight. We were pleasantly surprised to come and get seated right away. It was not very crowded and the service was quick!

Breakfast Burrito - This was pretty big and smothered with sauce. I personally do not like my burritos to have sauce on the outside soaking into the tortilla. The ingredients inside were not too bad though. 

Oatmeal - I went super plain Jane because we had eaten really late the night before and I wasn't into something heavy. You can't really mess up oatmeal so this was fine. 

Overall, it was a quick breakfast and the service was good.
Great food absolutely enjoyed the hell out of the garlic mashed potato omelet it was fucking delicious. The staff was kind and courteous I enjoyed myself at this restaurant.....
Love the egg & I! Consistently delish breakfast every time we visit. Try the chicken fried steak & fiesta skillets. Lovely service, especially Stacie :)

The only reason they get a 3 star and not 4 is because because i was expecting them to be as good as there counterpart egg works. Unfortunately not so. It was good, better than Ihop but not that stellar amazing flavor Im used to from these chains. Anyway the service was quick and the waitress was very personable so ya if Im in the neighborhood I will go again

Great local breakfast restaurant.
Fantastic service, selection and prices.

Anything from basic steak and eggs to a selection of benedicts to loco moco.  All filling and oh so good.

Next time you are visiting Vegas, take a little drive and get out of the overpriced resort restaurants.

This place is great. There were so many people waiting when we arrived but they seated everyone really quickly and we didn't end up waiting more than 15 minutes plus they made it really easy by sending a text when our table was ready. Excellent staff, delicious muffins to tide you over while you wait for your food and everything was tasty

Food:
We had the fender bender crepe and the strawberry cream french toast. Both were pretty good. I was not too into the bean sprouts in the crepe. We both thought the french toast was too sweet and started to wear on you haha.

Service:
Our waitress was awesome. We got a seat outside but it was about 95 degrees outside. I asked if she could move us inside and she did without any issues, and it was pretty busy that day. After that she was all smiles and our coffee was consistently full.

This is a great place to try right before you leave for your drive home. Definitely off the beaten path and away from the strip. 

Went on a crowded Sunday morning.  They sat us very fast on the patio.  Our food arrived equally fast. 

I would have given it five stars, but our waitress wasn't the best.  She was bussing our table and actually did the finger wave for me to hand her my plate across the table.  I know, I know, is it really worth taking a star off? But yes! I was a waitress for years and that's just a big no no.

This place is absolutely AMAZING the strawberry stuffed French toast was DELICIOUS I WOULD CALL IT ORGASMIC HAHAH no seriously so good took me a while to decide everything in the menu seems delicious n it's so cheap wish I lived in Nevada so I can come Here all the time and let's talk about the server "EARL" great server super friendly and very attentive :) nice guy

Nice place for breakfast. Great portions but too much saw many people leave behind food. However the portion is mainly made up of potatoes so unless you are interested in carb loading with potatoes the eggs portion is just right.

With this review I will say that everything is relative.  When you consider other options in Vegas for a good breakfast for a reasonable price, this is one of the best.  If you have read my other post you know I love chicken fried steak and of course that was my order here.  The steak was seasoned very good and had a lot of flavor.... really good!  I will be back to get it again in the future.  The gravy was good but not great in my opinion.  I really liked their breakfast potatoes as well as they were season with extra season and were better than I expected.  The eggs are eggs and nothing special there.  Also their banana muffin is really good.  It is a bit greasy and not for anyone on a diet but you talking to someone that eats fried meats for breakfast.

My husband found this spot on TripAdvisor so we checked out out. There were many people waiting outside, so we were a little hesitant about wait time but getting sat took less than 10 minutes.

He ordered The Original Breakfast Burrito. It was very tasty and a good size. About 7" long and 3" diameter. The stuffing was tasty and just the right spice, the sauce on top was delicious. 

I ordered the Works Veggie Benny. The vegetables were great, English muffins toasted well but not so much that they hurt your mouth while you're eating. Eggs were perfectly cooked (I am so crappy at cooking eggs that this always amazes me). My only complaint was that I wasn't super happy with the hollandaise which is 75% of why most people order Eggs Benedict (I think). 

Both came with habla diablo seasoned potatoes which were very tasty. Both of us finished our plates. 

Drinks: Soda and unsweetened iced tea.

Bill: $27
The stuffed French toast was amazing! 2 massive pieces with 4 eggs in each one. Big portion at a good price. Banana Nut muffins to die for. Came after breakfast so there was no wait.

Great bang for your buck. Carole Ann was our waitress and she was epic.. we had the French toast and the sunrise mountain. Both were good. Lots of food so heads up. The vanilla capinchino is quite sweet but yummy !!! Overall great. Would come again.

This restaurant never disappoints .. second time coming here.. our server Tamara was very attentive and the food was delicious .. I had the original breakfast burrito with the diablo potatoes and the chicken enchilada soup, everything was tasty...their banana nut muffins are a must try .. we always come here when we come down to vegas
Dariesia is a great server!! We loved her!! Food is amazing!! My husband and I both had The Classic- sausage and eggs with potatoes and toast. This place is highly recommended and we will be back!!
If you are looking for a good food and big portions this is the place to be. Don't forget to order the banana nut muffin, it's very good. Service is okay.
The food is amazing, & out standing service! The banana muffins are the BEST in town!  Server:Karla

Cute restaurant. I love the daily specials bc they use fresh ingredients. ABSOLUTELY get the banana nut muffin. Coffee is good. Eggs are the best, duh that's what they are famous for. Pancakes aren't that good, but that my opinion.

It was fantastic, our server Bree was awesome and the food was great in quality, price , and it was very huge portion. I had the Brad's Scramble. This store is absolutely to recommend, easy parking, easy to find, great price and quality:)

We were seated immediately. Our waitress was very nice and welcoming! She unfortunately pushed the wrong button when she put in my order so when they brought it out, it wasn't the right skillet but she immediately went to the back and put in a new order. My skillet was brought out within 5 minutes and the problem was solved! But the my correct order was missing my toast. The waitress said she'd go get it and never returned with it. By the time I could even address the issue I was done eating. Regardless a small issue like this won't stop me from coming back. The food was delicious.

No strip fans, so we tried Egg & I out. 
Very friendly people inside, huge portions (which we don't like, sorry !) and a very good taste. The guacamole was - unfortunately - not good at all.
Regular coffee was very good.
We will come back to try out something else.

Cute family diner. I had a great experience at Egg and I. We came here around 12 which was to my benefit because I cannot stomach anything during the morning time. It was so hard to choose something from the menu...everything sounded so good! They have something for everyone. I had the the "Egg-Ceptional Omelette" with a side of country potatoes and my, was it exceptional! The omelet was loaded with sausage, diced ham, onions, tomatoes, sliced mushrooms, bacon, and cheese...and topped with sour cream. yummm! My husband had our usual...eggs benedict...and that was very delicious as well. The portions are huge! My husband eats like a beast...and I, like a man...and we still couldn't finish our food. Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She came back periodically to tend to us with a huge smile on her face. Also, the food came out very fast! My tasty and fulfilling brunch definitely prepared me for a long and crazy day-night on the strip.
The Santa Cruz Skillet is really good, the banana muffin  are aswome,  thank you Tamara

A great breakfast house is consistent no matter what. 
I only went here once, but it was disappointing. The food was on par to IHOP. 
I can't tell you how many people get a omelette wrong. Either the ingredients don't gel right and is tasteless, or the egg is undercooked, etc. 
The omelette I got here was tasteless. The potato o' brien was overcooked in too much oil to the point it was deflated and tasted more like leftovers. 
Not a fan.

I am really big into customer service and everyone here hits that out of the park. I do come here quite frequently and it never fails that I get excellent customer service. 
I always get a coffee with only Carmel Macchiato creamer. (The waitresses never have a problem with my requests, by the way ask for Bre she's the best!) Than I always get the half order of chicken, broccoli, mushroom skillet, its awesome that they offer half orders because there proportions are already huge! They have awesome skillets!!! I also get a side of sourdough bread with apple jelly (once again the staff always gets it to me in a respectful manner)  
I don't have anything negative to say about Egg & I. I want to say thank you to this AMAZING staff. I truly feel like home there!

How I'd never heard of Egg&I until last night, I'll never know. I love off-Strip, local establishments where I can get my grub on, and this is definitely on my list now. 

I intended to get my butt up at 5 am and be at their door at 6 am when they opened, but my brain determined I needed sleep more than food and I ended up putting my name down at noon-thirty, at the height of brunch\/lunch time. I was told the wait was about 15 minutes; I waited a solid 20 (which isn't bad when "15 minutes" usually serves as code for half-an-hour) and was promptly greeted by my wonderful server. I had my food about 10 minutes after I placed my order.

My late uncle was a gourmet chef, and my earliest, fondest memories of Vegas revolve around eating his cooking. Biscuits and gravy were on the usual menu when my family and I made our annual road trip out here, and I have purposely shied away from ever ordering it because nothing could ever come close.

But, for some reason, I ordered it anyway here. Was it as good as my Uncle Ray's? 

Does the free show in front TI have anything to do with pirates anymore?

Exactly. But that said, I would probably order it again. I regret not remembering my server's name, but she's one of the best I've had in a LONG time, and as someone that waited tables and bartended her way through school, my standards of service are ridiculously high. She was awesome, and was warmer, more attentive and professional than any server I've had elsewhere in Vegas, even in those pretentious "five-star" restaurants you'll find in abundance in this city.

Keep in mind they're open from 6 am - 3 pm. I was told by a girl at the host desk that the best time to go was 6-8 and after 1:30.

Overall value?

Price: 3.5
Service: 5
Ambiance: 4

= 4.17. But Yelp! doesn't offer a decimal rating. So a solid four stars from me. Worth visiting at least once if you want a tasty meal in a casual atmosphere without the pretentious attitude.
If you're looking for a good hearty breakfast, come here ! Linnea was our server and she was very attentive. I'm from California and every time I come to LV, I'll definitely come here for breakfast.

Best breakfast I had in Vegas. You'll need a car to get there if you're staying on the strip, but it's worth the drive. The ranch potatoes are fantastic! Great food at a great price and good service, too.
So glad we found this great breakfast spot before leaving Las Vegas. The food was great and the service was excellent. Thanks Amanda

The Banana Nut muffin is so good, I'm glad we don't live on that side of town or I'd be there eating the stuff everyday. 

It's an awesome place for breakfast. Good food, good service. Just get there a little early because it can get pretty crowded.
I love Leaving Las Vegas.. with Stuffed French Toast in the stomach!

me and my 2 sisters and mother came and ate here and one ordered biscuits and gravy and was sooooo good and the other got the classic and it was good and simple and the other got french toast sandwich that had eggs and bacon with cheese  and it was deliciousss.... i got the bacon avocado omelet and omg it was just the bestttttt .... there banana muffin is soo good as well as the blue berry muffin .. our server was karla and had 5 yrs of experience and you could tell ..super sweet and gave us her thoughts of everythiny we ordered .. probably the best breakfast restaurant in vegas we got to eat ... better then hash house a go go ...  country cooking

Summary:  Perhaps the best breakfast restaurant I've ever found.

Long version:  So I'm on vacation with my two adult sons (and one of the boy's GF).  Since we're at a timeshare I'm enjoying making breakfast most of the week.  On a lark I decide we're going out, and I google "best las vegas breakfast".  #1 on the list is "The Egg and I".  So we map it and off we go, without a lot of expectations or knowing what's on the menu.  

So first of all there's a bit of a wait - 15-20 minutes for a table.  Staff is friendly, place is clean, and every table is filled.  We are seated outdoors on the patio and there are heaters set up (the stand-up propane ones) every couple of tables so we're nice and cozy.

Coffee comes and guess what - it's really good.  I'm a bit of a coffee fanatic - I roast my own beans at home and can distinguish varietals between African and South American by taste - and it's surprisingly lively on the palette for a breakfast joint.

Between the four of us, we order a vegan breakfast, two different omelets and biscuits and gravy.  Each entry is under $10, and the portions are absolutely ginormous.  It's a quarter to midnight and I'm still stuffed.  

But most importantly, every thing on the plate is absolutely delicious.  From the specialty omelets to the potatoes to the gravy, everything is simply first rate.  

Apparently the place has won several awards and is Zagat rated.  I have no reason to doubt any of this - if you're in Las Vegas for breakfast, you absolutely MUST search out and try The Egg and I.

I visited Egg and I before heading home on a Vegas trip. Hands down the best food I had the whole trip. Maybe because breakfast is my favorite? I had The Classic with bacon- two eggs over medium, bacon, potatoes, and a banana muffin. Everything was great, but the potatoes stole the show! So super crispy and seasoned marvelously! Seriously, so good. Now I have to figure out how they made the potatoes so crispy! Definitely will visit on any future Vegas trips. The service was also top-notch. My waitress was very friendly and attentive.

Located "off of the strip" in a plaza, The Egg and I is definitely a local's haven. We only discovered it since our hotel (The Artisan) was nearby and we used our Yelp app to find the closet breakfast place that wasn't a buffet (by day 3 of buffet hopping, I needed major portion control).

Even though it was Mother's Day and the line was out the door, this tiny restaurant somehow managed to get everyone seated quickly and keep diners moving through the door. The menu was quite extensive for breakfast with everything from stuffed french toast to eggs benedict to the infamous breakfast burrito. I tried the eggs benedict, which came with ranch potatoes and a huge portion of fruit. The orange juice was the best part though, it tasted like it was just squeezed in the kitchen.

Highly recommended if you are staying "off the strip," in Downtown Vegas or if you are on your way out of town!

Another wonderful breakfast at my favorite LV breakfast spot. Server Alyssa was delightful. Try the chili omelet. My only complaint: they should make a real dairy product available on the table for coffee instead of your having to ask for it. They serve real butter, so why non-dairy creamer? Spock and I consider this "illogical". Still always 5 stars for me and I've been coming here since the 80's.

Egg and I is a great place!! I come here every time in Vegas. The line is pretty long, but it is well worth it. 

I love the omelets, French toast, creeps etc. They have great sauces, which you can take to go :-) 

I especially want to complement Sasha, our server. Great job! She is really fast and got everything out to order. You are the best!  

See you again next year, Egg and I!!

Had a late breakfast here with friends during Wizard World Las Vegas in April 2015, and left a very full and happy man. Everyone at our table, from the carnivorous 12 year-old with his eggs-and-bacon with a side of bacon to my health-conscious friend with her fruit and egg whites to my own delightful blueberry pancakes was very happy and satisfied with our food. I only wish they had one of these in my hometown - I'd breakfast there often.

Big thanks to our server, Carole Ann (I believe I have the name right). She was friendly, served with a big smile, gave us some good Vegas tips, and made sure our coffee\/tea was always full. You can't ask for much more.

I've been to almost all five of the locations of "THE EGG & I" throughout the years. Mainly the one on eastern and sunset growing up. Today's late breakfast was the best service hands down. Earl was our server and I did double check the name since I suck at remembering. Me and a friend came to catch up on things and I recently recruited her to Yelp and had her check in. With the check in we each got the banana nut muffin. Which was a 5 out of 5 Yelp star rating. For breakfast I always stick to the basics so I usually always order "the classic". Which comes with eggs, one choice of meat (bacon, sausage and I must note each come in turkey too), potatoes & toast. My friend got the "Country Benny" which she was very pleased with. Earl checked on our table throughout our whole visit. Also, if you've been to any of the chain restaurants then you know they have this egg shaped smiley face that you can flip to a sad face to grab anyone's attention for service. Needless to say, we didn't have to use it. Oh and Earl kindly offered me each type of creamer they had for my coffee! So for the first time there I didn't have to have plan old half & half. 

To top it off they gave us a military discount for my friends portion of the bill! They actually check ID with your credit cards too here!!! #WINNING

Thanks for the hospitality Earl!

Super service!!  Kat is the best!  She took care of us even though this place was slammed!  Had the steak and eggs.  Definitely try the Banana Muffin, you will not regret it!  They even were giving free Bloody Mary mix when you leave!

First of all, thanks for the reviews on the stuffed French toast guys, best breakfast decision ever. The biscuits and gravy are delicious also. Secondly, my server, Amanda, was seriously so sweet! She checked on me and made sure I had everything I needed. She had a full section and she was so nice to every single guest. I will absolutely come back again, and again. Thanks for the awesome service, and kick ass breakfast guys!

I met a friend for breakfast and let me tell you it was 10a and the place was constantly full, even the patio with it's misters was full until about 11:15a. They seated us very quickly.  The menu has so much to choose from.  My friend ordered the parfait cup with fruits, granola and yogurt.  She said it was quite tasty. I chose the plain French toast w\/turkey sausage, maple syrup and apple compote. They were perfectly done. Our waiter was attentive and the noise level was not at all overwhelming.  I will definitely recommend and will come back again. Oh yes, and the banana nut muffin was every bit as good as others had mentioned. It comes warm and soft to the table. Worth the trip all by itself with a glass of juice.  I would definitely recommend to others and will go back either there or one of the other restaurants owned by same Chef in Summerlin.

Me and my family went early around 730am or so and I have never been here before, the young gentleman who was really young was very swell and respectful and was caring that I had a infant and I thank him for being caring about him. Well mannered, our waiter was knowledgeable and very cool, I didn't catch his name but had a great sleeved tattooed on his right arm. The muffins are out of this world, they were so hot and fresh I was worried I want going to have room for my actual breakfast 
The eggs bennidict were so delicious had a great zest to the sauce. The potatoes would have been great but there was a large amount of pepper and there specialty El Diablo of some sort of spice they created but ask them for easy on the spice. Other that great food good price. Had to take the remainder of my portion a home and I would go back

So disappointed....... Haven't eaten at this location in years, usually visit Flamingo. They took my name for 1 and then not only seated everyone before me, but 8 tables that signed in after me. They did it to another single before me too. They said they were waiting for a small table, but kept seating parties of 2 that signed in after me at the small tables..... They finally seated me at a  table for 4, go figure. And I waited all this time for ????? Horrible!!!

My family's FAV breakfast\/ lunch place.  Love the servers and could eat the fresh banana nut muffins all day long.  Fav dishes so far are the Tuna melt with avocados and the hubby likes all the skillets.  Extensive menu with lots of variety.  We've been here multiple times and have never ordered anything that wasn't really tasty.  Portions are big so don't be surprised if you have left overs.  Ordering some extra banana muffins to take with you will be worth it! If you're wondering if it's worth the drive since its off the Strip, you should still try it.  We're locals that would love to keep this place a secret, but it's too good to not share.

I don't know what draws the crowd here. It could be the portions, the banana nut muffin or the people.

The portions are big enough to share. They're not skimpy on their omelettes and pile on the Works potatoes, easy to split. Banana nut muffin is so moist, leaves you wanting more. The house special burrito, hubby says, is the perfect combo of egg, cheese, bacon, Works potatoes and green bell peppers that just melts in your mouth. Kid's meals were big too!

Most likely it's the workers who create such an inviting atmosphere here. To the corporate manager: Caresia should win the Disneyland trip because she was such a friendly server! She was still smiling as we made our mutiple requests.

Thank you Egg and I, our bellies are full!!
The food was delicious! Must try the banana nut muffin! Will be back the next time I am in Vegas! The omelets are huge, and all of the ingredients were fresh.

The breakfast game in this city is no joke. After looking at the reviews I had to check this place out. The menu is lengthy with so many omelets, classic dishes and so much more.

The service is friendly, like most locals spots in Las Vegas. despite showing up on a Sunday Morning at 10:30 our wait for a party of 5 was only 20 min. The server was with us quickly and the food hit the table shortly after that. they have a ton of televisions around the main dinner so you can catch the get as you grab brunch. 

The pork chops were good, as we're the potatoes and eggs. I would say I've had better, and like I said up top, breakfast in this city is no joke. if not for the limited wait despite the busy morning and the amazing service I'd probably be dropping a star on the Egg & I. 

side note, they sell the hot sauce they have on the table. The hot sauce is great.

The standard to which all "breakfast joints" should be held to. A Las Vegas off strip classic. A locals spot before we had the term "locals spot". I've been here many times growing up in Las Vegas, and about the only thing in Las Vegas that has stayed the same is: Egg & I. 

It's just so consistent. You know what you're going to get and you know it's going to be good. Change is good, but in this case changing the already good thing they have going on would be a terrible idea. 

The ONLY downside is the sometimes insane wait times for a table. But hey, we can't punish a restaurant too much for its own success can we? 

I've had the eggs Benedict and the eggs here so much growing up I subconsciously judge every egg I have anywhere in the world based on the Egg & I's standard. 

Give it a go! Especially if you're from out of town: Experience a local Vegas staple.

Breakfast is my favorite meal of the day, so I'm glad I searched this place out on our last trip out to Vegas. I'm so over the pricey and mediocre food at the buffets on the strip for breakfast. So we came here based on the yelp reviews.

First, they have a huge menu, which makes it hard to decide what to get in the first place since I love all breakfast foods. So I went basic with buttermilk pancakes and eggs and bacon. Everyone's eggs were cooked perfectly. Bacon crispy as I had requested. Short stack of 2 pancakes was more than I could finish. My husband and a friend each got some sort of skillet concoction, and I probably didn't finish my pancakes because my fork kept was always in his skillet because it was so good! The four of us were all pleased with our meal.

The place is busy, but we were seated after about 20 minutes. Service was good, portions were large and a reasonable price. I would probably come back to this place next year on our annual trip!

I don't know why I waited so long to leave a review because this is one of my favorite breakfast places that always aims to please! Victoria will make sure that if your coffee is not strong enough, she'll get you a part that is! I love this place.... vanilla creamer and all :)

People talk about Hash House and others.   This places doesn't do all the crazy stuff; just quality breakfast food.   I had the skillet and it was awesome.  Lots of potatoes, "stuff" and bread on the side.   

I'd come here if you're looking for a really, really solid breakfast without the frills and upscaled food items.

Thank you Yelp for putting eggs and I near the top for reccomendations! To begin, Manuela was our server today and dealt with my non speaking English friends respectfully. She even gave us the wifi password! The free muffin is a must have. To die for. Amazing. Delicious. The banana nut muffin was different from what I expected, in a much better way. I ordered the country fried steak and the whole meal was crazy filling and satisfied my American breakfast cravings. It even comes with another muffin! She got the eggs Benedict and the one bite she allowed me to have made my mouth explode with heart felt desire for more. I'll deffinately be back to this spot during my next visit to Vegas.

Are you tired of waiting in lines that look like you're at Disney just to eat buffet food?  Then do I have an off the strip place that you'll will like.  My cousin told me about the Egg & I.  Boy am I glad that he did.  The food was really good.  There was a 10-15 minute wait but did not compare to those monstrous lines in the casino hotels.  

After glancing through their newspaper styled menu, I decided to have a four egg omelette.  Which was more than delicious when it arrived.  Accompanying this wonderful omelette was their famous ranch potatoes.  These bad boys were orgasmic good.  They were seasoned with some spices that gave it a lil bit of a kick.  But if you aren't into spicy then I advise you put some ketchup on them to dull the fire.  All in all the meal was delicious.

The service was pretty good as well.  They have a system where there is a napkin holder and on top are two pictures of eggs.  If you need some assistance then you just flip the egg to yellow.  Now I may be butchering the explanation of this process but long story short the wait staff is very attentive and helpful.

So give it a shot if you are tired of long buffet lines.  It also gives you a chance to see the other parts of Vegas.

I went here with a friend on Saturday AM. We arrived at 10 and it was packaged. Easy 30 minute wait which I find kinda baffling as the food and place is O-So- Average. However it seems like a popular stop for lots of locals. I ordered the Sicilian Skillet, and was not impressed. It was really bla and nothing to write home about for sure. The food was okay but not really anything you cant get at a Denny's IHOP, or countless other places like, that.

AMAZING, amazing experience here. The food and service was top notch here. They were able to accommodate our party of 10. Regardless of our party size, they provided amazing service. We gave them a big fat tip. Their banana nut muffins were to die for and possibly the best one I've ever had. I got the spinach benny and it was delicious. The other foods looked good and none of us had any complaints during our meal. I think I will need to visit this place every time I'm in Vegas. It's delicious with amazing service. Can't go wrong!
Our server Chance was awesome!  She was very attentive and catered to our needs. Highly recommend her and Egg and I!

i loved highly recommend. my favorite dish was the Chipotle benny my husband had it . the tradition benny was good but the ham was very blend. waited 30 mins but was worth the wait. or serve was amazing.  will most likely come back
Banana muffin was awesome. We split the corned beef hash, which was very tasty. Food was hot when it hit the table.

BEST PLACE EVER!!! I love eggs and I love breakfast foods and I love banana nut muffins. This place can do almost anything (and more) with eggs and their banana nut muffins are to die for. They warm it up for you and taste amazing with or without butter. Service is great! The staff is super friendly check in on you without hovering. There are so many delicious options on their menu and sadly I was only in LV for a few days but I would definitely go back just to eat here again! 

Side note: I fell so in love with their muffins that I went back the day before my flight back home to get 3 to eat on the way back - AND THEY THREW IN A FOURTH MUFFIN FOR FREE!!

From 2\/25\/15
Finally, got to try this place after seeing it on Google maps before I moved to Vegas. I know it's a corny reason to pick a place, but the name was what got my attention. We walked in, and the place was packed. 

Our server Carla was great. Even though it was busy, she was attentive, friendly, and our food came out promptly. My boyfriend got the three little piggies.I got the fruit parfait that came with the best banana nut muffin I've ever ate-ever!! I will definitely keep coming back here, to try out other things on the menu
Excellent service and even better food. Tamara our server was super helpful n very attentive. We will definitely be back again!
Food was excellent as always. Definitely a must to come here whenever we're at Vegas. Carole Ann's service was amazing! Let's get her to Disneyland!

Very good breakfast place on Sahara! I've ate here many many times and give them a solid 4 overall. 

Gets a little busy so don't go in a hurry but I like this place a lot. I want to give them a 5 star so maybe I could update later if some minor things change.

Checkout line gets pretty long almost every time so they need 2 cashiers or a faster system.

It takes awhile to get seated sometimes but they did update the seating list so you can get a text when your table is ready. It gives you an estimate on how long the wait will be.  Our quote said 15 minute wait to get seated but it was 21 min, it was a group of 6 during busy time so not bad and that was the longest I have waited.

Food is pretty good, chorizo burrito and mashed potato omelette are very edible. 

I really wish they wouldn't give you so many of those weird potatoes though. They are pretty good but not good enough to finish or take home, so almost every customer is sure to throw away a lot, my guess is they through away a few hundred pounds of potatoes every single day because no one finishes them. I would recommend they give you half the amount of potatoes and some fruit which would be so much easier on the stomach and make the meals a little less boring. 

I do recommend to stop by and give this place a try though. I will certainly be back soon. 

Thanks Egg & I!
Very attentive, friendly staff. The food was delicious and the portions were generous. We will definitely come back next time we're in town.

I have gone here for breakfast numerous times when I am in LV.  They have a large menu, service is quick and I have always had good food.  The only negative is that their coffee is low grade, just barely drinkable.  Its certainly worth the 10 minute drive for better food and lower prices than what you can find on the Strip.

Egg and I, WHY ARE YOU NOT IN CALIFORNIA?

Stopped by here when I was hungry and visiting Vegas. I ordered the stuffed french toast, and let me tell you, it did not dissappoint. Absolutely delicious. Was expecting hashbrowns as potatoes, nope. This place goes above and beyond and gives you some of the most delicious breakfast potatoes you will ever eat. Our server was extremely sweet. Wish I had gotten her name, she reccomended dishes to us and was super helpful. Will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas.

Wonderful breakfast! Great service!
 Our server, Karla, was super friendly and helpful! The entire experience while on vacation was great!
 Our grandson enjoyed his mouse pancake  and bacon, I had the western omelette, and my husband had gravy and scrambled eggs..everything was delicious! And my banana muffin was warm and moist and very tasty!

I had a great dining experience at Egg & I. The server was quite friendly and attentive. This is a great place to have breakfast at an affordable price. I had the vegetarian skillet and added some bacon (I know...crazy). The dish was quite tasty. And it's true what everyone says about the banana muffins. They are to die for!!
I love this place! I always get the vege Benny cuz it is soooooo delicious :) and our server Staci was the best!! I would give it 5 stars if it wasn't always so friggin cold in here.

So I'm from Cali and found this spot on yelp. . My experience was good, I enjoy the food very much. I had the skillet, the works.. with avocado on the side. I got to say that plate was very good. Well portioned, extra avocado was not a little but a lot;), service was ok. The only thing I dislike was I set outside on the patio and there are some ugly birds that come around to eat what you drop. Kind of a distraction from enjoying my breakfast.. Positive side was it is a lot quieter then inside. Also might not be a good idea if it hot out tho. My visit on the day was just right to sit out.

We came here based on the great Yelp reviews, and this place did not disappoint!
If you're looking for a big filling breakfast, this is the place.
The staff was friendly and our server was attentive and a total sweetheart.
The food is awesome! I ordered the egg-ceptional omelet which was huge and stuffed full of toppings and had the ranch potatoes as my side. It wasnt greasy or oily which was such a bonus, since you never know with a new breakfast place. The portions are big so I'd recomend coming hungry or sharing.

This place is amazing! It may not be on the strip but it is totally worth the trip here. I had the original breakfast burrito with the potatoes and it was soooooo good. Everyone at my table throughly enjoyed their food as well. If you're here on a trip to Vegas, you need to come here. You will NOT be disappointed! And Paula our server was great! We will definitely be coming back here again before our trip is over.

Definitely one of the better breakfast spots to try when you are in the area. I plan on making this place a regular stop on future visits. The location is off the strip and worth the drive. You know your at a good spot when people are lining up and waiting outside. The staff is very pleasant and they are quick to get you seated and fed.
Best Bfast in town, especially after a rough night in Vegas.  Very well worth the 4mile drive from the strip.
Staci was just great and the food is so worth it. Great prices, everybody working together to help get people in and out. It's a breakfast wonderful

5 stars for the BOMB homemade banana nut bread.... SOOOO good.  yes, sooooo good.  so good that I ended up buying a loaf and bringing it home as a gift to the guy who eats like cookie monster (doesn't eat only cookies like him, but devours food like him)!!!

All the other breakfast foods are good, eggs are cooked to perfection, clean restaurant, fast service - what more could you ask for?!?!

I got the chicken fried steak, it was good but I've had better. The coffee was awesome!  We also got the blueberry pancakes and they were great!  My husband tried the prime rib skillet. It was really good. The only real complaint we had were that the potatoes were awful. Boring an way too salty!!!!

Our first stop as soon as we land!!! Stuff French Toast is delish. You gotta try it!!! Today's server was Amanda, who was so happy, helpful and very personable... Actually everyone there are always happy and helpful!!!
I enjoy eating here they never disappoint although the service at this location is a bit slow at times

This quickly became my favorite go to breakfast\/brunch spot on my way out of las Vegas. The kays special, banana nut muffin, and the coffee are all fantastic. The waitress tells me the skillets are where its at as well.
Fantastic local breakfast spot. Locally-owned. Great food. Ample portions. Its sister restaurant, Egg Works is also a great breakfast spot.

Good food, great service. They were recommended by a local family member and will likely visit again when visiting LAS in the future. My husband thought omelette was good, but skimpy (not very full) with potatoes, which he and 6 ,y\/o thought were really good. I had pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon.
My favorite place to visit when on vacation in Vegas. The food is delicious and service is great! Tamara is a really great she's super nice and always on top of things!
Breakfast is my favorite. The drive here was kinda far but it was well worth it. The Banana nut muffin literally made me nut. That's how good it was.

Awesome food and great service. The food was a little slow to come out, but we were advised of that by our waitress... I loved my Chicken Fried Steak a lot, the gravy was very delicious. My partner's omelette was also delicious. The Diablo potatoes are crispy and flavorful. I will definitely eat here again and again...

I was seriously surprised by how tasty this place was. It's not that they have anything that's unique but they make normal\/ordinary stuff great. 

I had a bite of the corn beef hash and it was very tasty. I ordered the country fried steak which was very good. I for some reason had some very bad luck when it comes to the white gravy with country fried steak but this gravy was awesome and the fried steak was great. I ordered the fruits(yes I know) but it kinda went better for me as I thought everything was very heavy so the fruits at the end of the meal helped me. Also, I really loved their salsa. It was super good that I actually considering buying a bottle but I don't think I would add salsa to any chinese food at all so I didn't get it.

Regardless, I think Egg & I is great. They make simple\/homey food great and that's why it deserves a 4 star.
Liza was awesome , it's like she did the thinking for me  best customer service by far ! Food was amazing we will be back

Locals place with a variety of mild to spicy hot sauces for you.

Decent meal for a fair price. $10-15 per person will cover food and drinks.
I have dined here for over 10 years and the decor hasn't changed. The inside looks like a country barn. If you like that kind of thing, you'll like the Egg and I. Country music plays throughout.

Menu - The menu is extensive with about everything a breakfast diner could want. Dozens of egg combos prepared every which way. Waffles, crepes, burritos, pancakes. And choice of many sides too.

Coffee is average. I am an espresso snob so perhaps their coffee is A-OK for most.

Not fancy or touristy but honest, good food.

Stop on in.

Wait time was said to be 5-10 min and we were seated in 40 seconds, now we arrived at 10:45 local time but it was a full house. The menu was large but easy to read for me and my fiancÃ©e so we picked our choices and the wait for the food was a little longer than expected but nothing more than a few minutes (my fiancÃ©e gets impatient) the food was served as listed and it was delicious and filling and service was outstanding

Had a great experience here considering it was noon on a Sunday in a place that serves hangover food.  We were seated right away, service was attentive and friendly, and prices were decent. The menu is vast, with all the traditional breakfast options as well as some unique ones like the "crepelette" an omelet\/crepe hybrid. They offer dozens of lunch items too.

I had the "Flapper" breakfast platter ($8.95) which consists of 2 pancakes, 2 eggs, and 2 sausage (your choice of pork or turkey). The eggs were perfectly cooked (I like 'em over easy). Any place that offers a turkey sausage option is awesome for me as a non pork-eater. The real star of the plate was the pancakes. They were perfection! I am usually more of a french toast\/waffle person so this was a gamble for me. The pancakes were piping hot, spongy yet fluffy in texture, and really flavorful! Served with a side of hot maple syrup too.

I would highly recommend Egg & I to anyone looking to get away from the Strip for an inexpensive and tasty breakfast.
Really awesome service. Food is fresh and served warm. Portions are just right tho we had to take some home. Server is pleasant and has great customer relations ethics. We will be back again.

On our Vegas trip we wanted to check out Egg & I since I bookmarked it on our last trip with all the great reviews. Omg this place was delicious! We even came back the second morning  I had the works skillet, hubby had the heart stopper, and friends had the Benny's. Everyone agreed their plates were huge and everything was so good!

I go to Las Vegas a lot for vacation, and I frequently rent a car so I can get off the Strip a bit. Until recently, I didn't really know of anywhere to get a good breakfast off-Strip. Then I found the Egg & I and now I eat there. Every. Time.

The food has always been delicious. The banana nut muffin is to die for and if you tell them it's your first time at the restaurant, they'll give you one for free. I love free things.

The portions are huge and - how shall I put this delicately? - perfect for when you're hung over. My friends and I ate here the morning after the Rock & Roll Half-Marathon last December and it was like being in hangover heaven. 

If you live in LV, or you're visiting and have a car, go to the Egg & I. Heck, it's even worth the cab fare. Trust me.
This restaurant was the bomb. Amazing customer service on top of speedy and delicious food.
The portions are huge, the food is delicious! Alexa was a very helpful and friendly server. Great place to eat well and pay less off strip!

A great place to bring the family for breakfast. They gave great servings for my plate, I got the waffle works with extra banana and it has a big piece of ham, great amount of eggs and a enormous waffle topped with whipped cream and bananas.

Damn this banana nut muffin is delicious. And for the portions, sizes, and service, it's quick, and inexpensive. Whether you're coming in hung over, or looking to feed and fuel up... DO IT. I love this place for their courteousness and most importantly their delicious breakfast. Also, if the wait gets too long, go across the plaza and hit up Zia records and check out their vinyl, cds, DVDs, whatever you're into :)

This place is a gem, nice break from the hustle of the strip. Good cooking, the banana but muffins are awesome, and as for service, we had excellent service two days in a row from Carla. Moderate prices, generous portions, happy customer. Check it out.
The spinach Benny +avocado..Delish! And our waitress Chance was very cool and her  menu recommendation was spot on. Great breakfast place off the strip

Food was delicious. I ordered a strawberry waffle so it wasn't that hard to get it right. 

However, my biggest issue was with the wait staff. The host was mute and wouldn't say a word. My main server was rude and in a hurry to rush me out of there by throwing the check at me as I'm eating and before I even asked for it. 

Not quite sure why or how this is the best of Vegas...

So, so close to Five Stars, but given the fact that the coffee is weak and flavorless, I have to take it down to four.  Otherwise:

- STELLAR breakfast food
- Some of the best omelettes I've ever had in my entire life (the standouts for us were the chile relleno and the avocado\/bacon)
- Biscuits and gravy are LEGIT

Prices are low, service is great.
Awesome place for breakfast. Service was great and the good is amazing. Try the stuffed French toast. Aldo the muffin is good! Very moist! Best banana nut muffin I've ever had!

My BF found this place on Yelp after our first night in Vegas and I agreed to give it a shot based on all the great reviews. I had the mashed potato omelet and my BF had the country Benedict. Both were delish and a LOT of food. We also got a homemade banana muffin for free for checking in, and they gave us both one which was nice. They were delish too and so was the coffee! Our server was very attentive and friendly. Only con: we saw a few people who came in after us be seated before us but the hostess acknowledged the wait time and apologized.
I went for breakfast with my husband at this place during our last visit to Vegas.Their menu is full of delicious breakfast options. And the banana walnut muffins are the best I ve ever ate.

Our server Patrick was exceptional and the food delicious.  I had the chili rellano omelette and it was a flavor explosion!  The Diablo potatoes that come with it are amazing.  Couldn't stop eating them!Yummy! You get a free banana nut muffin for checking in on Yelp.  It was warm and tasty.

Tamara is such a sweet waitress! Very helpful and nice. I like how you get to put a sign when you need a waitress to help you. It made it very easy to get help. 

I loved the food here. I got the enchilada omlette which was good but I wish it tasted more like tomato sauce rather than chili. The banana muffins are soooo good! That is a must.

This is quite an experience for being off the strip. It's well worth the trip out side of the norm for Vegas. Stay focused and come here. You will never regret it. Check in on yelp and get an amazing muffin to go. We will be back for sure. Whatever you get you can't go wrong.

Went there twice while visiting here from NY. Not many places to eat just a simple breakfast that won't break the bank. I like the omelet and the egg skillets. What I wasn't crazy about were the potatoes, which did not seem fresh cut, but rather from a prepackaged bag. The service is excellent, efficient and attentive. When in Vegas this restaurant beats the overpriced buffets and hotel restaurants.

This was the best find in Vegas! Not only was the food delicious and very resonable, but the staff was remarkable. Our server and the manager went out of the way to make our dining experience most memorable. I highly recommend Egg and I to everyone!

Terrible Takeout! Do not go!
I called in my order, simple two omelet, with some fruit and tomatoes on the side. Nothing crazy. So I got thought the extended diatribe on the phone clarifying and identify I understand the extra charges for a side of tomatoes, the cashier says 10 minutes.
I get to the restaurant about 6 minutes later only to sit and wait another 20 or so, the price of which had never been disclosed to me. $11 per 4-egg omelet. I was a little shocked, but then my order was also wrong, they missed my extras and wanted to charge me even more for simple stuff like an ounce of tomatoes. I'm trying to grin and bare it, when the cashier dashes off without a word to get her manager, because she doesn't actually know the cost of said side of tomatoes. The manager comes out with a half -ass-ed apology and an offer to "take care of me" the NEXT time I choose to suffer through this establishment's shotty service.
So now that I've arrived at my office a whole 3 minute drive away, My fruit cup was leaking all over the bag of food. Each meal was luke warm, the ranch potatoes nearly broke a tong of my plastic fork, which we received one less than requested. My crazy chicken  omelet, which is described as "Loaded with julienned chicken breast, fresh mushrooms and guacamole. Topped with muenster cheese and sour cream." on the website, had flavorless dark meat chicken, and mushy old guacamole that was terrible.
Don't trouble yourself with this establishment, food should be a delight, not a stressful experience.
Had breakfast and everything was great.  Highly recommend the stuffed French toast.  Linnea was a great server !
Our server Alexa definitely deserves a trip to Disneyland! The food was amazing as always! It usually is a bit of a wait but that's because everything is so good!
Karla was our server, and totally fantastic. Incredibly attentive, fun to chat with, quick service. Also, really great food! Biscuits and gravy were amazing.
We had Ashley. We had an awesome experience. She made sure everything was taken care of in a timely manner.
A very nice surprise.  We went here because of a food network recommendation and we were not let down.  It is a basic breakfast, but very good.
The food was amazing!!!!! Raul is honestly the best server I have had. He was very funny and charming. He got our order right and had great recommendations for us. Awesome place to go

Apparently this is one of the best breakfast joints in Vegas.  I can't really agree with that but it's pretty darn good.  I ordered the corned beef hash and what came wasn't your standard canned mushed beef stuff. There were real pieces of corned beef in this mixed with potatoes, onions, red, green peepers and topped with 2 eggs of your choice, which should always be over easy eggs with super sloppy running yolks. The flavors were spot on and the side of potatoes were nice.  The banana muffin that is served is awesome too.  It's probably microwaved before getting to your table but it's still very decent.  Prices are a little bit high like $10.95 for the hash and the wait can be long.  The annoying thing about this place is paying at the cashier!  When it's busy, the wait can be 10 minutes to pay your bill... minus a star for that.

Best breakfast i ever has in my life. Lol. But for real its the best breakfast ever.. server Kat is very nice as well,she's the best. Thank you!!  And Great job. Make sure you look for her and you'll be in good hands.
I always love coming here after a weekend in Vegas. Great food to help the hangover. Our server Brady was excellent and the food came out very quickly. Will definitely be returning.

Great food, recommending the Benny! Only minus is the orange Juice "fresh" is not Tropicana... Will definitely come back!

Thanks Reina for great service!

I love places like this that specialize in breakfast, so I was especially happy that the lady found out about and suggested (The) Egg & I on our second morning in Vegas.
