Got there about 9:00 a.m. on a Tuesday, and although the place was busy, it wasn't packed, so there was no wait for a table.  Started with coffee which was surprisingly good - very mellow with a good flavor.  I even thought about asking what kind of coffee they use, but unfortunately forgot.

I ordered my favorite - corned beef hash and eggs, while the lady ordered country fried steak.  CBH was in a soft patty form.  The corned beef was of the finely-shredded variety probably from a can, so don't expect chunks from a brisket they brined and carved themselves.  I'm not complaining - the stuff was tasty.  The two eggs on top were done a nice over easy.  I wasn't a fan of their Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes, which tasted okay, but were a little too loose for me - like if you tried to scoop them with your fork instead of stabbing them, they would just fall off.  I like hash browns, home fries, etc. that stick together a bit so you can put them on the same bite as the CBH\/egg\/omelette\/etc.  I can't believe it's just me.  Right?

The lady's country fried steak was tender and tasty.  Not out of this world, but certainly better than you'd get at an IHOP.  While I had wheat toast, she chose the banana muffin, which was great - just filling, so with the good portions of the rest of out breakfasts, we couldn't finish it.

Service was friendly, and the prices were reasonable.  I'd definitely come back.
A really good breakfast place to eat while in Vegas. I had the chicken enchilada omelette, it was pretty good. The banana nut muffins were awesome with butter. So good we ordered a loaf to go.
Half order of Mashed Potatoes Omelet and an ice tea is how everyone should start their day!

Eats: Sundance Omelette, side of corned beef, classic benny (eggs Benedict), hot chocolate, and banana nut muffin 

Takes: The best friend and I literally planned our Vegas trip around our meals! She's the breakfast person of the two of us, and she ultimately chose Egg and I of the two places I suggested.

Two words: No regrets!

The corned beef was the homemade, pulled type of thing, and not your typical canned corned beef! The Sundance omelette is your veggie omelette complete with a side of potatoes and your choice between a banana nut muffin or toast. This omelette had mushrooms, tomatoes, spinach, and artichokes. The feta cheese is the one that brings this omelette home! The only downside is that protein is extra; I ordered a small side of corned beef. The potatoes were seasoned (they are on the salty side, but nothing ketchup couldn't counteract). The banana nut muffin came out warm and moist! It definitely was the highlight at first bite! 

Portion size: Large! Both of us took home leftovers! We went from stomach growling to food baby status after our meal.

Service: You flip the egg to the sad one when you need something. Our servers were very friendly and patient. They gave us recommendations on the menu, one even offered us free muffins for our first visit (before the Yelp check in).

Wait Time: immediately seated on a Monday morning

Parking: Shared Lot

Bottom line: Go here for your breakfast fix! It's egg-celent! 

Highly recommended.

If i could give more stars i would!

5 stars for sure , breakfast is the best!

I got the piggy skillet, so freakin good!!!!!! Trust me, go here, its a must go to for a breakfast on a vegas trip, you will be going everytime you visit vegas!

Potatoes are the best, skillet had bits of bacon, ham, sausage.  Topped with 4 eggs i had them overeasy.  U can get them scrambled.

They have coupons too, buy one entree get one free!? =) 

This made my day..trust me it will make yours too.

Best breakfast I have ever had from what i can remember

I went there today around 11:30am, this was my 2nd time here, had a great experience last time so I had to come back again for some more great food!!

It was pretty packed inside so u can tell this place does a good job satisfying the customers, one of the waitress was able to seat me right away since I was by myself.

I was gonna order the stuffed French toast AND their Ultimate Skillets but the friendly waitress said she could do half portion of each since she said their portions are pretty big, so I agreed and ordered half n half. 

The food came and they look amazing!! The skillet was delicious, their potatoes were very flavorful, the stuffed French toast with eggs and syrup was yummy. Maybe I was just hungry, I felt like I could handle the full portion of BOTH next time. My waitress was really friendly, always have the smile on her face. Would definitly be back next time when I m in town. 

Want to buy their groovy t shirt but they don't have size Large. Maybe next time.

I'm a little surprised I didn't write a review for my 1st visit! Oh well...service on this Valentine's day was exceptional! The wait was a short 10 minutes around 10 or so in the morning (good thing because it was 10 times more crowded when we were leaving!) Our waitress was Lilly & she was the sweetest! She was so nice and attentive, with a cheerful disposition even tho she was so busy. And she brought my husband his free muffin even tho he was having trouble with his yelp app to check in. He did eventually but was very happy that she did that, cause that muffin, oh that muffin....I think it's the best banana nut muffin I've had in my life, and I've had my share! Lol...my husband had 3 of the blueberry pancakes w\/a side of bacon. He enjoyed his meal but didn't even touch his bacon because the pancakes are a pretty decent size with fresh blueberries in the pancake and on the side was a blueberry jam sauce? It was sweet just as he likes it. I'm not a huge pancake fan so I don't make it much at home so he was happy. I ordered the chile rellenos omelette and I'm so glad I did!  I saw someone's picture of it and thought it looked good!  It was!  The sauce was tasty and everything just worked so well together with the pepper... Mmmmmm and my plate came with potatoes or toast and I chose the potatoes, I could leave that on the plate but my husband enjoyed it :)  and a muffin also came with the plate, BONUS!!  Will be back for more on our next visit!!

This place is great on a early morning on ur day off everything is soo good even their coffee i love the southern eggs with sausage gravy its so delicious!....But is it just me n the hubby but we think the diced potatoes are soo salty !! =|  .....portions are great!, food is awsome!. fast service A+ ....ooo ya but there seems to be these young girls as host all the time i go and their face always looks like they smelled a bad odor....my thing is your the first thing i see when i walk into your establishment ...because of faithful and new patrons you are able to thrive and grow....least u could do is fake a smile for the 8 hrs of ur shift....I work in the hotel business when a guest walks into my workplace i make sure to make the guest feel welcome.....customer service 101....im just sayin biggest pet peeve ever.....If your so miserable call in and stay home.Only negative thing i have to say...but after u get by the yuck faces its all amazing from there....

PS: bin here 4 times cant say u were having a bad day.

Great food, large servings and if your lucky, Dariesia will serve you.... If your lucky.

:)

A return trip is required.

For me I just cant eat here again. Wholly cow, the omelettes are way overloaded with cheese and their home fries are salted more than Doritos chips. I didn't feel right for the entire day after having breakfast there. They did give us a free loaf of banana bread and that was nice of them but I wish I had been more vocal in regards to not being charged for my meal. It just wasn't right. I was told that in the future I could request less cheese and less salt so that is good. If Egg & I management is reading this, May I please have a refund for my meal? Please? I can provide the date and time and amount. I charged it on my Chase Visa. I will update everyone later

The place was ok...we went on a Tuesday afternoon around 12pm. We waited about 30 mins. They sat other folks who arrived after us with the same # of party. I had to go back and question the hostess, they sat us right away. We wanted to sit outside because inside of the restaurant was a Lil small and not enough ventilation. I did not want to smell like food.

Now we waited an additional 20 mins just to place an order and then another 20 mins for our food. Omg I was so hungry, when my food came out, I only took 3 bites. 

But our server Karen (I think that's her name) she was very nice and friendly. She did bring us 3 banana nut muffins which were yummy! My friend's breakfasts were much better then mind. The server also took my order off since it was not that great.

Over all, I would not have any interest in going there again.

Thank you Yelp!  We were looking for a place to have a good breakfast before heading out on the road back to Phoenix.  We had been in Vegas for four nights and were looking for something other than the options around our hotel.  I found the Egg & I using my awesome Yelp iPhone app.  Everyone agreed to give it a shot and we were all singing praises to both Egg & I and to Yelp at the end of the meal.

The special of the day was the Prime Rib Skillet, Prime Rib over breakfast potatoes, cheese, and eggs any way you want em.  Two people at our table of six went for the special.  Other meals included a Brad's Scramble, two Chicken Fried Steak Skillets, and mine was the Kay's Omelette (Four egg spinach omelette stuffed with a blend of artichoke hearts, swiss cheese, parmesan, garlic and cream cheese. Topped with fresh tomatoes and feta cheese.)  Everyone was raving about their breakfast, except for one.

One friend does not like mushrooms and did not realize they were in her skillet.  She started to pick them out and when the waitress same to check on us, she noticed the pile of mushrooms and offered to have them remake the dish.  Very nice customer service.  My friend didn't want to wait, so she declined, but it was still very nice of the server to notice and offer a new dish.

The standout of the meal was the breakfast potatoes with their special seasoning.  These are the best breakfast potatoes that I have ever had, and I love breakfast potatoes!  The seasoning had a really good flavor and the potatoes were in the perfect bite-sized chunks.

There are plenty of great reviews for this place, so I don't need to go on and on.  Just one more final thought.  When I am coming home from a trip I always like to look back and think about what I learned during the trip.  On this trip, I learned a few things . . .

1 - Don't hold your new cell phone over a pint of Guinness, chances are it may fall in.
2 - Cash out at roulette once you have doubled your original bet.  Even if you just walk right back and put down the original bet again.
3 - Add the Egg & I to the "must-have" list anytime I'm in Vegas!

Breakfast menu is huge and is a little overwhelming with all the options. I had the western omelet and my husband had eggs benedict. The omelet was huge and the potatoes were a little overseasoned. My husband said the eggs benedict were just ok. Our waitress Paula was very nice, attentive  and just as sweet as can be!  If we could we would give 3 stars for food and 5 stars for service.

I haven't had breakfast in here in a while, not since we first move here around 8-9 years ago.  No one here this morning, our family finally left for home after a nice long visit, so we were up early going to the airport to drop off.  With plenty of time, we decided to stop in and give this place a try.

Good breakfast place. Size is generous, choices are plenty, and prices are average. Service was great.  I would recommend it.

Having read the reviews on Yelp, I just had to see for myself what all the fuss was about. Well, I'm a big breakfast guy, and this place more than lived up to its reputation. I went with the country fried steak, which had the perfect combination of crispy and tender. I'm more of a hash brown fan, but their cubed breakfast potatoes were very tasty. And I have to pay tribute to the banana nut muffin; I don't even like bananas, but this was fantastic. To top it all off, my server Staci was friendly, knowledgeable and attentive. Highly recommended.
Love this place and Karla is a gem, she's always on point! Consistently great food and their banana muffin is too die for. Great coffee too! Sometimes they're busy, but it's worth the wait.

Ashley was such a sweet server. The service is great & the place is well kept. They have so many choices here & cater to many different likes even though it is a breakfast joint. The potatoes are greatttttttt. Love it here!
Fast service and amazing food! Price was was very good.

Simply fantastic place to eat. The service was 5 stars and the place was packed. Our server checked on us constantly, when he found out it was our first time he dropped off two free muffins and never stopped making sure we were good with everything. 

The Chile relleno omelette was fantastic and it came out hot and delicious. Normally packed restaurants suffer in service but it was quick and ready and service was on point. No wonder 2000+ hits gave it more than 4 stars. 

Stop by and you won't regret it.
The bacon avacado omlete was delicious. The food came out quick and hot. Great service too.
Ok, This place is amazing. The muffins, no lie, the best. I couldn't put it down! (Actually ordered some to go) service was fast and friendly . Would definitely come back on my next visit to vegas!

First off, my expectations were pretty high for those banana nut muffins.  I prefer mine with more nuts in them so they were just okay to me - I've experienced better and probably will not get them again.

I ordered a scrambler and it was very good - the potatoes were okay - a little too much seasoning for me but they were crispy.  My grandma said the coffee was good and she enjoyed her corned beef hash.  The service was excellent, the prices reasonable, amount of food was a lot, and the atmosphere was good.  I would come back.

Oh, and free Wi-Fi which is great when your grandma you are visiting doesn't have internet.

I didn't want to waste my money on the crappy over priced breakfast at the hotel so I Googled good spots and found this one. It was a quick drive from the strip and definitely worth it! Service was great and the food was so yummy! I am definitely going here again before I leave.

Good service. Amazing food. Had the works breakfast skillet and it was scrumptious combination of breakfast meats, peppers, mushrooms and their spicy house potatoes. I would eat here again. P.S. Their banana muffins are awesome and it comes with your meal.

Service here is great. They have this little egg sign on the table that you flip to black if you need service and its really like magic the way they appear when you try to change the sign.  I had:
Iced water- I had to write that their water tastes like they got it from the restroom sink. Its so bad i had to order a coke. 
Banana nut muffin- didn't see what the hype was about. I thought it was OK. 
Eggs Florentine with seasoned potatoes- good with Cholula. the potatoes are really good!

I would say everything was good\/average.

Chance was an awesome server!  She had great vegetarian recommendations for me.  I ordered the 1\/2 Fresh Veggie Skillet and JM had the Pork Carnitas Ranchero.  The food was great and the service was even better.  Keep up the good work and we'll see you again soon!

We truly enjoyed this place. It gets really busy but our wait was less than 15 minutes. We were sat outside, this is the only reason they did not get a five, it was fresh but the pigeons were a little annoying. It did not help that someone thought giving the birds bread. 
The food was good inexpensive and plentiful. It was served within minutes. They also leave a carafe of coffee at the table. If you check in with YELP app you get a banana nut muffin for free. If you do not mind the wait you should stop by. They also offer a military discount.

When waking up at whatever time you wake up( given that it is before 3:00pm lol), you always gravitate toward the need of a good hearty meal. One that will jump start your day with the enjoyable taste you desire.

  Egg and I seems to always strive for that in my eyes. I've come here early morning, in their last hour of business, and even with a months in between visits. But one thing that has always stayed consistent.... Has been the A+ service and comfort the staff welcomes you with paired with that perfect execution of any hearty meal you crave for. 

 The food is highly recommended but the service is what will keep you coming back. 

Anything you try, you will be pleased with perfection.

Place is about 10-15 minute drive away from strip. There was a short line when we arrived Monday at 9am. The line went fast. The server we had was prompt and accommodated our special request. My friends bday that day, she made something special for him with the famous muffin. The serving is huge and can be shared by two people. Food arrived fast. They have a wide selection of omelette, Benedicts and breakfast menus. Check in at Yelp to receive free muffin which I took mine to go, ate it the following day and still tastes good.

A wonderful place for a great breakfast. We go there and Genesis is the best waitress by far and we plan on asking to be seated in her area every time. She remembers us by sight and has a delightful personality. This is becoming a regular breakfast place for us.

I love breakfast and am always looking for a unique spot for breakfast. I highly recommend The Egg and I. They have a bustling business. 
The place was packed when we were there, but we were seated quickly and the service was exceptional.
Their menu boasts 4 pages of egg related dishes (traditional and adventurous) as well as lunch offerings. 
My husband said the burger he had was excellent and the breakfast tostada I had was fabulous.

This is my new favorite spot in all of Las Vegas. The food could earn this restaurant a 5 start review on its own but the staff is so so so friendly, I wish I could give an extra star for service!! Yesterday,  Liza was our server,  then today Karla helped us out.  Both of them created an extremely memorable experience for us with their smiles and kind words throughout our meal. That's how amazing everything was,  we came back the next day, something I've never done in my life! Please please please come and visit this amazing establishment,  they truly want everyone to be happy and enjoy themselves to the fullest!!
Had the classic burrito and banana muffin. Muffin was delicious! Burrito came with a side of potatoes that was yummy. Didn't care much for the sauce that came with the burrito. The service was great!
Amazing breakfast and even more amazing was the service! Amanda was sweet, friendly, and most of all genuinely happy to help. The potatoes are out of this world and so are the banana muffins!

I LOVE LOVE LOVE Breakfast. Its my favorite meal of the day and i'm glad The Egg and I did not disappoint. Cute name btw. 

I ordered the Egg's Benedict Florentine.  As soon as I read fresh spinach, poached eggs and bacon, i was sold. I'm not usually a fan of ham (since i'm sensitive to salt. Anything too salty and i wont like the food) but this canadian bacon was perfect; not too salty. Eggs were nice and runny. Hollandaise sauce was flavorful. Fruit were far and few but I can't complain. 

I checked into Foursquare and was treated to their banana nut bread\/muffin. OMG it was sooo good. This is the one time i'd have to say Give me MORE muffin tops. Fresh Warm and Delicious!

You won't go wrong with Egg & I. The waitresses are practically giddy with happiness, the portions are humongous, the food is fresh and delicious, and the prices are very fair. 

The location is about 5 miles west of the Strip, so this is primarily for locals, which adds a more normal vibe compared to the touristy traps that dot this crazy little town.

The food here was eggcellent! (Get it? Egg-cellent). Anyway,  the service here was awesome as the servers were polite and made sure we had everything we needed. The atmosphere was upbeat and inviting. The menu was an adorable newspaper that was almost like reading the funny section of the Sunday news. Portion sizes were phenomenal and the kids menu offered variety and portions were like mini adult selections. My 9 year old loved it. My husband and I ordered the Cabo and Santa Cruz breakfast burritos with the works potatoes. We were reassured by the wait staff that it was pure deliciousness and it was! Our burritos were made up of four scrambled eggs,  sautÃ©ed bell peppers and onions, cheddar cheese,  chorizo, wrapped in a warm flour tortilla and topped with their signature Santa Cruz sauce & a dollop of sour cream. My 12 year-old decided to be adventurous and order the stuffed french toast, stuffed with scrambled eggs, sausage and sprinkled with powered sugar with warm maple syrup on the side. Definitely, a taste bud explosion. Thank you Egg & I...we will NOT forget you!

Yummers!!!

I loved this restaurant.  We only had to wait 15 minutes on a Sunday morning and were kindly seated.  The restaurant is a good size and was cutely decorated.  It's a really good family and brunch place.  

I ordered an omelette and enjoyed it a lot.  The portions are generous here.  The best part of this place is the service.  Our server (older Hispanic lady) was very funny and recommended different things for us.  I was being picky and she let me.  Thanks, ma'am!  The roasted potatoes here are really good.  I like hashed browns a lot and never really like home potatoes, but for once the potatoes trumped the hashed browns.  They were crispy and lightly seasoned.

I tried the chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes and the tasted absolutely AMAZING!  I couldn't stop eating them even though I was full.  I also had a bite of someone's French toast sandwich, and oh my gosh, did that taste like heaven in my mouth!!!!!  If you're ok with a heart attack on a plate, this is it.  It was a huge portion of eggs, bacon, ham, and sausage goodness.  This was probably the tastiest thing on the menu, and I had only a bite.  Definitely something you can share if you're not too hungry.  Great service and good value for the dollar!

Egg & I, I will be back!

Defiantly a disappointment, you might as well go to Denny's. Everything is so generic, the potatoes are obviously frozen as they are pre seasoned with high sodium junk!! Don't waste your time!! Please, it's terrible!!!!

Pretty good.  Local popular eatery.
Lots of breakfast food items to choose from, lots of egg items from american style to mexican style huevos rancheros.
A lot of american breakfast places arent that good, but this one was, so yay!~! since its rare i find an american breakfast place that i like.
very nice and friendly staff.  eggs were cooked right, not bland, and just the right portion.

It was a Thursday morning and our second day in Las Vegas. I have not had any GOOD food yet! (Mad Greek and the Rio Buffet were pretty bad from Day 1).

My husband told me that he used to eat here with his grandparents when they lived in Vegas. It's located in an older plaza and from the outside did not look busy.  We arrived around 9:00AM and it was pretty packed inside, but we were seated at a table right away.  I ordered the Sundance Special (veggie omelette with spinach, mushrooms, artichoke hearts folded with Swiss cheese and a special Works artichoke cheese filling, topped with Feta cheese and fresh tomatoes). I also got potatoes and a banana nut muffin. 

Our server was really nice. The food was so good! Honestly, the best veggie omelet I've ever tried. The banana nut muffin was also a delicious treat and so moist.

My husband did good bringing me here to make up for the awful food we had the day before LOL. Thumbs up.  :)

I'd definitely come here again when we are in the area.

105\/100 Reviews for 2016

The BF and I were looking for a good place to get breakfast\/lunch in Vegas before the drive back home. This place is off strip, but was pretty awesome! Great food, and probably the best service in Vegas. Our waitress was very friendly. I love how they have a little stand with a happy egg on one side and a sad egg on the other. Flip to the sad egg if you need anything from the wait staff, and they'll be at your table in a jiffy!

This is first place I went to when I first moved here... AMAZING!!!!  you can have so many things here, no matter what your taste is... always have great service and love the cute "egg" motif on everything... It is reasonably priced and fills you up..
Excellent selection on the menu. It was so good we went back 2 days in a row. Reina was an excellent waitress very accommodating  and friendly! I would highly recommend The Egg & I.
Lil busy, a good amount of people. About 15-20 min wait. Crazy big selection if you love eggs. Very filling portions. Food was delicious!! Definitely a must try for brunch!

My favorite place for breakfast in Sin City. Our server Amanda is great! Very attentive to all our needs. According to the receipt, mentioning her name here increases her chances to win a trip and we hope this helps her out; she was that good. Will definitely be back as Egg and I will continue to be a Vegas tradition for us.

Found this gem right here in Yelp. Thank you fellow Yelpers!  This place was fantastic. We had a party of five and waited all of about two minutes to be seated. We must have hit the right time of morning because the place was jammed by the time we left. Well worth any wait. 

Food - The menu was expansive. So many items to choose from. I had the Three Pig Omelette with a side of their excellent hollandaise sauce. Superb. My son was pleased with his waffle. My wife, who is not a huge breakfast fan, was thrilled to see she could get an egg white omelette. She commented that you never really know how egg white dishes will turn out. She raved about her egg white veggie omelette. The two others in our party had the the biscuits and gravy and loco moco respectively. The biscuits and gravy were a hit while the loco moco was remarkably reminiscent to the Hawaiian Islands favorite dish. 

Service - The service was exceptional. In an industry where service can significantly impact the diner's experience, Oscar was fantastic. Oscar was well versed in his menu knowledge and was quick to offer recommendations and to gladly accept order substitutions. His pleasant, respectful, and appreciative demeanor really helped to set our dining experience apart from every other experience while in town. He was also aware and kind enough to notice the kitchen was getting backed up so he brought out a plateful of banana nut muffins to help stunt the growing hunger we all were suffering. 

Overall - Highly recommend this restaurant for the wonderful combination of great food and top-notch service.
Food was awesome as usual.   Had the cheese and sausage omelet,  son had the avocado cheese omelet.   Both excellent.   Breeannda took fantastic care of us with her huge smile.  Great meal.

Someone call 911, because I'm in a food coma over the Banana Bread French Toast. 

It should be illegal its so good. I'm guessing that batter frying slices of Banana Bread is only legal in Vegas. 

Lots of other goodies on the menu. My wife got a savory crepe that was delicious with a side of their seasoned potatoes that you don't want to stop eating. 

Escape from the strip and go here for breakfast if you are in town. It was so good, I went twice during our stay. 

Service was good. Everyone is attentive and mostly smiling (which is rare to find). They give you your own pot of coffee which is a huge plus in my book.

My husband and I LOVE this place. The server we had was amazing and the menu is sooooo vast. They have amazing muffins and great portion  sizes. My husband's favorite food is biscuits and gravy. He got the chicken fried steak grilled plate thing to branch out a little and he said it was the most amazing thing in the world. We will definitely go back.
Good breakfast... not a fan of the free Yelp "check in" banana nut muffin but other than that, a descent meal. Go early to avoid the weekend wait.

Pluses:
Fast & friendly service
Gigantic portions
Home-fried potatoes 
Banana muffin
Fruit came on the side of every order in big pieces, not some crap salad.
Not on the strip

Deltas:
Hollandaise was shockingly tasteless for the amount of fat it presumably contained.
Food was frankly notable only for portion size.

Eggcellent! We've been twice and enjoyed every bit of this great breakfast place! The place is packed and there is always a wait, but 15 minutes of my time is fine by me as long as I am going to enjoy the food. If you know my reviewing you will see that service, and location are not heavy factors in my rating. I am a total foody, so what is most important is the taste, the quality, and selection of foods offered. What I ordered this time was the Bandito omelette, I enjoyed it. The last time I ordered the Chile relleno omelette, it was delicious! I liked it more than the Bandito. it came with a banana but muffin, which I finished even I told myself to fight the temptation. my kids ordered the strawberry stuffed French toast, I forget the name of it but it was stuffed with cream cheese and strawberries. they wanted to lick the plate. When we go to Vegas we won't have to think twice about it, we will be there.

This was a very impressive breakfast restaurant!

I came here with 4 of my other friends while we were in Vegas and all of us had a positive experience.  Both the food and the service were "egg-cellent."  

Anyhow, I try to be a little bit pun-ny at times and this is one of them.

First off, the SERVICE was great.  We came in around noon time and the restaurant was mostly crowded but our group of 5 was seated as soon as we walked in the door.  We were greeted by the hostess with a big smile and much enthusiasm.  What's interesting is that their menu is in the form of a newspaper, which is very creative and something I've never seen before.  Our waitress, Amanda, was very energetic and did a wonderful job.  She was very helpful with her recommendations, very quick, and very genuinely friendly.  I love it when the people at a restaurant enjoy what they do.  

As for the FOOD, my friends and I ordered different dishes but everyone enjoyed their meal.  I ordered a hawaiian dish that came with rice, eggs, and spam.  You could also have your choice of sausage.  Now, I know it sounds plain from the description but it was probably the best breakfast of those items I"ve ever had.  Everything was prepared perfectly and also presented well.  I had two eggs that were made over-well, hot and juicy sausage that was perfectly seasoned and two mounds of perfectly scooped rice.  Also, before our dishes were served, we were given complimentary appetizers in the form of a banana nut muffin.  It was the best banana nut muffin I've ever tasted because it came out warm and seemed to be freshly made.

My other friends ordered the country fried chicken breast skillet as well as a turkey sandwich that they happily shared with me.  I got to try it and it was just as excellent tasting as my dish.  The portion sizes were generous and all of us were stuffed by the end of the meal.

What I found interesting was that they had a little sign in the shape of an egg that had two sides.  It was used to signal our waitress if we were in need of some help.  One side of the sign had a smiling egg and another had an egg with a sad face.  Apparently you are supposed to flip it to the sad facing egg side if you needed service.  Anyhow, the last part might not make sense until you actually go there...but it beats any breakfast place on the strip that I've been too!

Lastly, the PRICE is extremely affordable.  An entire meal for one person was about $9-$10 before tax and tip.  I sort of wish they had one in Orange County but I'll definitely come back here with friends the next time I visit vegas.

This place has always been amazing. The food quality is outstanding. Clean friendly staff. But today was wired. Our waitresses Liliana made us feel like we were being rushed. This would have been ok if they were busy but that so wasn't the case today. Got to the table and she was there asking "what can I start for your drinks today?" Girl let me sit and look what you have before you rush me. Then she comes back like 30 sec later with drinks. "Are you ready?" I just opened my menu. Dang can we have a few mins to go over it? Sure." Then food comes then like 2 mins after that. "I'm not rushing but I will leave the check on the table. Ok now we feel rushed. But the food and everything else is amazing.

I absolutely LOVED this place and would recommend it to anyone staying in Vegas! We had a group of 6 and the wait was fairly short. The food was amazing and our server Tamara was great! Our drinks stayed full and she made some great recommendations! We will definitely making this place a part of our Vegas tradition!

There is a reason this place is rated as one of top places to eat in Vegas. The service was really good with a very kids friendly environment. The prep on food was really good with great vege. Options. The potatoes had a special spice to them which tasted really good. We ordered the skillet and omelette and kids ordered pancakes. One suggestion for owner to consider are floors, very slippery for chairs.

Best breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas that nobody talks about.  It isn't a coincidence that their reviews are so solid.  Great food, great service and great prices.  All the waitresses are good but Carole Ann is the real deal.  Super friendly and easy going!  Do yourself a favor and give this place a try.  You won't be disappointed.

A favorite of skeptical locals who have seen their share of bargain and selection!

I'm not usually into American breakfasts - typically pricey (for the cheap ingredients and unskilled cookery) and consisting of bland big portions. 

The Egg & I made me eat my words, plus some kickass Huevos Rancheros and coffee. My co-eater had the Country Benny - Buttermilk biscuits grilled and topped with sausage, two eggs any style, doused with "homemade sausage gravy" boasts to be a "heart stopper". 

Not close to the Strip, but then, no good cheap eats is.

My friends who frequent Las Vegas highly recommended this place to me! Thank you Maria M. and Dave O.!!

This breakfast joint is cute, welcoming and homey. It gets pretty packed during the weekends, especially with big parties, so be prepared to wait! But if anything, the food is worth the wait.

The selection of different types of dishes included dozens of omelettes done all kinds of ways, eggs benedict, eggs florentine, egg crepes, skillets, and i could go on and on because they also have sandwiches, french toast, and seriously I can go on.. 

I got the ham and mushrooms skillet with blue berry muffin. The muffin was moist and fresh! The skillet was their infamous ranch potatoes topped with ham and mushrooms with a layer of melted cheeses and two eggs done however you liked. Honestly, it looked super huge and I thought I would not finish it, but it was so good I annihilated that sucker!  My friend tried the ultimate skillet which had ham, bacon,  sausage and other goodies, but he said that it was waaaay too many things going on in one dish. So unless you like something super hearty and packed, try the ultimate skillet, if not, choose one or two ingredients to put into it.

Service was super friendly and kind. On the table there are these flip cards with a happy and sad face. Put up your happy face is your party is doing fine, but if you need anything put up the sad face and a server will attend to you quickly.

When I come back to vegas, this is a definite visit, especially after a big hangover!

The food here is amazing. It was hard to pick what we wanted because everything here tastes so good! Jessica was an excellent server very friendly quick and efficient. She was awesome ask for Jessica as your server.
Awesome Banana Bread, great Eggs (obviously).  Really friendly staff!

Ate here with hubby while visiting Las Vegas. They had a newspaper-like menu, which I thought was different and cute. If they ask if you want toast or banana nut muffin, choose the muffin!!! The muffin doesn't look appetizing, but boy was it delicious! I had the traditional benny. Decent portion and very satisfying. We had a really nice server, Roman, who was attentive and checked on us often to see if we were doing okay.

This place is PACKED and for good reason - everything on the menu is delish! Crisp bacon, Rueben sandwiches on homemade rye bread, banana nut bread muffins dripping with butter, and oh by the way - the staff is exceptional! I would take a cab from The Strip for breakfast again at this place!

It was Easter Brunch with a car full of 4 girls starving and ready to eat....after visiting Hash House A Go-Go down the street and being told the wait was about 45 min- 1 hour we used yelp to find another breakfast spot was we drove on over to Egg & I. 

The wait wasn't as long as Hash House...it was only about 15 minute for an outside table. The menu is huge and appealing that none of us could make up our minds on what to order. Eventually we did, 2 friends got the eggs Benedict and pancakes, another got the steak and eggs with rice and I got the spinach and avocado omelet with fruits and I shared the strawberry creme french toast with a friend. The ambiance is like any ordinary breakfast joint with that "home" and "granny's house" feeling. 

Everyone loved their foods, but it was so much that they couldn't finish it except for my friend who got the steak and eggs. I for one cold not even eat half of my food, regardless of how delicious it is....and I can eat a whole lot. I loved that my omelet was full of fresh huge slices of avocado and spinach inside my omelet. The fruits were fairly fresh and sweet. My whole plate cost me about $118 with tip so not bad considering I had a yummy Easter omelet, fruits and a huge delicious stack of french toast. Sadly, none of us took our food to go because we were on the road doing errands that day. 

Next time I hit up Vegas, I'll be sure to come here for breakfast!

Always love coming here. This place rocks! Great service and even better food! Even went on a double date for Valentines here! 
I can honestly say that the steggs(steak and egg) is better here compared to babystax. They don't have red velvet pancakes though, don't come here for that and be disappointed. Egg works bennys are farrrrr more tastier and better than babystax. It has much better flavoring. The potatoes on the side is seasoned really well. Can even preach that their potatoes fries taste better than babystax potatoes fries. The price here is cheaper than babystax. The only downside is the pancakes. Their pancakes and banana nut muffin was not good at all.
Two straight days for brunch. Food was awesome, a nice and clean place to go. Please be ready for the wait time on weekends....But worth it.
My experience here was perfect, Karla was an amazing waitress and I look forward to coming back. LA all day !

Holy amazing eggs! I loved this place so much! It's a mom and pop kinda place, and you know it's good because the wait list is a bit crazy and it's mostly locals since it's off the strip. We tried 2 different eggs Benedicts and they were both AMAZING! Staff was super sweet and service was pretty quick. I will come back for sure!!!

Solid, solid food!  Omelets are nice and fluffy, the muffins are all top, and the coffee pot is brought directly to the table in a big pot.  If you have a car in Vegas make your way out here instead of the touristy strip food to get in with the locals and save some dough for your budget.

Anytime I am in Vegas, I ALWAYS stop by the egg and i.

I don't like eating breakfast, esp. for breakfast... but I'll make an exception for the Egg and I.... My fav dishes are any from the 'mexican section'... but you can't go wrong w\/ any dish here.  They have the 'most bestest' home fries ever!!!! Most of their plates come with a side of home fries.

There's always a line anytime I come, but it usually goes fast.

So I saw this place on Man VS. Food and I just had to come here when I was in Vegas. This place closed a little early (around 3pm) so make sure you get there before it closes. Eggg-citing! The decor inside is absolutely adorable. There's little dancing eggs everywhere, which was egg-cellent. (excuse the puns please) The people here are really nice and its nice being somewhere in Las Vegas where not everyone there is a tourist.

 So I had the eggs florentine which was really good. My motto is the more fattening the better. The hollandaise sauce was creamy, buttery and probably loaded with saturated fat, which is completely fine with me. The eggs were poached just right, where it's firm on the outside but soft inside. The side of potatoes are really good too. This place is a must when visiting Las Vegas!

What a great breakfast place! We had about a 20 minute wait on a Saturday at 915am which was expected.  It was our first time there and our fabulous waitress Alexa brought us all these delicious, warm and fresh banana nut muffins for free since it was our first time! The Bloody Mary and coffee were both good! On our table we had huevos rancheros, the biscuits and gravy and the avocado bacon omelette--all were great. Portions were more than fair and the food was fresh and tasted delicious! We will definitely head back here on our next Vegas trip!

In Vegas for vacation and this place came up as a great restaurant.   I can say it didn't disappoint.  One of the best selections of food.  It came to the table fast and it was hot!   The quality and taste was fantastic!!  It is a MUST for anyone looking for a great breakfast on or off the the strip.  The green chile hash was amazing.  And the country fried steak skillet was tender and the gravy was phenomenal.   Don't miss out!!

We're almost there at St. George Utah! But before heading to our final destination, we did a breakfast pit stop at the Egg & I in Las Vegas. I like how they 'egg'orated their restaurant; characters of the egg adorn the whole restaurant. I also liked how they did on a spin on the breakfast menu names. I had an Egg Works Country Fried Steak.

My breakfast meal was good; country steak was delicious, gravy was good, and the eggs (over medium) were cooked spot on. The Diablo Seasoned potatoes were a little on the salty side though. What I and the rest of my friends agree is that their Banana Nut Muffin was very delicious.

Yet another delicious breakfast spot in Las Vegas. This place offers a warm banana nut muffin that is out of this world. They serve large portions I had the bacon avocado omelette with the crispy seasoned potatoes very yummy. I will be returning when in Vegas.

Delicious food, the reviews are no lie! Came here for brunch while passing through Vegas on a cross-country road trip. Tried the:

1) Crazy Chicken Omelette: very good! The chicken was tender, there was a good ratio of guacamole and mushrooms, and the omelette was smothered in cheese and sour cream. Ranch potatoes on the side were fantastic, as expected.
2) Sausage gravy + sausage patty: a little on the salty side, but I thought it had a good balance of chunkiness and creaminess. I'm a bit of a sausage gravy aficionado (haha) though, so it may be that my standards are oddly high.
3) Banana Nut Muffin: needs it's own category, even if it's a side! Delicious delicious. Moist and warm, not too sweet.

I would come back! The service was great too. Even though we came right at brunch time and the place was packed, there was only a 5 min wait for two.

Mother's Day, 10:00 AM, people all over outside... They tell us our wait will only be 20-25 minutes, and for once, a busy place didn't lie. We were seated within 20 minutes, got our asked for drink orders immediately upon being seated, and waitress took our orders as soon as we were ready.

We went to breakfast because my dad loves breakfast (and so do I, but not as much as him). He got the biscuits and gravy meal (as he does at most places). I got stuffed french toast, which means eggs, meat, and cheese inside.

I ate past the point of being full, while still leaving a little on the plate, and my dad finished his pretty quickly because it was so good. He said as we were walking to the car, "That's about as good of a breakfast as I've ever eaten." That's a top-level compliment that he doesn't use lightly.

It's about $8-10 for most meals, service is great, food is even better.
Nice restaurant, off the strip. Service was quick. Lillian our server was helpful.  Reasonable price. Large portions.  Definitely coming here again.

At a little before 7am on a Sunday morning, the place was almost deserted.  This was a little worrisome, but we soon realized that this said far more about the Vegas population than it did about the quality of the breakfast.  Here's the best recommendation I can give about the food: I came back for breakfast the next day!  And we would have come back the third morning except that we had to be on the road before they opened at 6am!

We got off to a good start.  When the waitress found out this was our first visit, she brought us a warm banana nut muffin to try.  It's a house special and well worth getting.

When you open up the newspaper-like menu, the first thing you'll notice is the words Habla Diablo in blazing red appearing in the descriptions of at least half the dishes.  My wife wanted the Spinach Benny, but was concerned about the Habla Diablo potatoes because the name sounded spicy and she's a self-proclaimed spice wimp.  The waitress explained that it wasn't spicy at all, that Habla Diablo is the owner's side company and he had just redone the menu to emphasize his products.  My wife went ahead with her spinach benny and I got the loco moco, with an extra side of the Habla Diablo potatoes.  (It turns out that the Habla Diablo seasoning is a lot like Lawry's Seasoned Salt.)

My wife really liked her spinach benny, but didn't care for the potatoes.  (But she's not a big fan of breakfast potatoes to begin with.)  I liked the potatoes and finished most of hers in addition to mine.  Plus the loco moco was the best I've had on the mainland!

The next day, I came back on my own, but with orders to bring back something good to my wife in the hotel.  This time I had the Biscuits & Gravy, which were great.  But, fair warning, they were pretty salty -- well within my tolerance, but if you are sensitive to salt, you might want to steer clear.   Then I picked out the California Crepe for my wife, which the waitress was happy to pack up for me to take back.  I asked to substitute some fruit for the Habla Diablo potatoes, and she packed up a huge container of fresh fruit.  My wife loved the California Crepe, except for one thing -- it was way too big for her to finish!

Great little local breakfast\/brunch or lunch place with awesome food and fast, attentive servers. This is one of my favorite places in Vegas to have breakfast and they're typically open until about 3 pm, 7 days a week. You have to try their potatoes and banana nut muffins, they so good and addictive! I usually go for the omelets when I come here, and no matter which one you order, they're all delicious. If you have ever been to Egg Works, this place is owned by the same people, but is just a little smaller in size and menu.

Went there this past weekend with the GF and my NY friends.  We had:

Blackened Prime Rib Benny - Blackened Prime Rib with onions and peppers and 2 poached eggs on a croissant with hollandaise sauce - Pretty good, but the prime rib was a little dry.

Eggs Benedict Florentine - Pretty good

Eggs Taliano - Very good, tasted like a pizza with a soft egg crust.

French Toast - This was ok.

All the egg dishes came with ranch flavored home fries which were geat.  This was a good breakfast place.  Very quaint and clean inside.  I would definitely go back there again.

The environment is awesome as well as the service. I ordered a chicken, mushroom, and spinach skillet but my mushrooms were not cooked as much as I thought. It was pretty much raw. The chicken was warm so I felt like it sat there for a while before serving it to me. The banana nut muffin is amazing though! Add some butter and bam you got yourself something even better. Overall experience is good. I would come back.

Great tasting food and large portions were a nice part of this moderately priced place. We went there at noon, and it was busy, but they were getting people seated as quickly as they could. Wait staff was nice, professional and knowledgeable. We got the Mexican omelet and the bacon omelet. It had the right amount of cheese and the food came out hot. Potatoes were great- tasted fresh and hot, not chewy or old. We had our food to go. I'll definitely be eating here again next time I'm in Vegas.
We ate breakfast here twice during our stay.  Delicious both times.  French toast, pancakes, waffles, eggs, bacon all awesome.  Service also awesome.  Would highly recommend this place.

Came here at 11am to see a lot of people waiting outside, however the wait wasn't that bad as it was only like 25 minutes. The chicken enchilada omelet was good. Our server Karla was very attentive and super friendly. She needs to win the Disneyland contest that the restaurant is having for their employees because Karla is amazing.
Great place to get breakfast. Very friendly staff. Been here twice out of the five days stay at LV. Will be back the next time we visit.

We went on a Saturday around 10 am after feeling discouraged over the wait at Hash House a Go Go at the LINQ hotel. The wait was only 15 mins which was not bad at all. The service was attentive and polite. We ordered the works skillet which is potatoes mixed with green bell peppers, onions, ham, sausage over 2 eggs cooked any way you like. We also got half an order of carrot cake French toast- which we thought was too sweet. The banana nut muffin was terrific- very moist, fresh out of the oven, and not too sweet. Yelpers can check in for a free banana nut muffin if it doesn't already come with your meal. Overall a good place for brunch\/ breakfast.

Brady was a great server!
The omelets here are really good.
But i was most amazed by how great the service was. I could see that all the servers were working hard trying to please the customers.

There was a bit of a wait time, but tis worth it.
Came here due to their great review but the food was just too salty. Staffs are great but food is ehhhhh
Outstanding breakfast with eggcellent service! Liza is a terrific waitress who will take great care of you!

I was looking for a great place to have breakfast in Vegas and this place was one that came up. I am so glad I went here, the food was great with much larger portions than what I am used to for breakfast and the service was pretty good as well. I definitely will be back on my next trip.

Absolutely delicious! Vanilla cappuccino is amazing, iced or hot! The banana nut muffin is so tasty. I had the veggie skillet and my boyfriend had the blueberry pancakes. Both were extremely good! Our server, Maggie, was so sweet and attentive! Overall a very friendly place!

Absolutely must visit if you're in Vegas! I love breakfast food and was super excited to visit. Bottomless coffee, superb customer service, and delicious food! Don't forget to check in to get a free muffin.

We love this place! We've been a few times and have had a great experience each time. Jessica was our waitress this time and was a great server! Definitely asking for her again next time we eat here. I recommend the biscuits and gravy and ALWAYS get the muffins!
The service was good and friendly and the eggs were fine, but they did not have espresso which means no breakfast latte and the pork burrito i had was excessively salty and dry.

Our server Tamara was excellent and kind! She made the overall experience here really awesome, and is probably one of the kindest persons i have met in Vegas! She has made the overall experience in Eggs & I wonderful and fulfilling, even as far as creating a cosy and comforting experience while i devour my breakfast in the most unglamorous way I love you Tamara you are the best

Found this place searching for a good brunch stop before leaving from Vegas.  Don't let the simple looking breakfasts fool you, these are down to earth home style cooked breakfasts.  There's a lot to choose from, making for more stops in the future.

My Gf got the standard and I the works skillet.  Definitely well done for the both.  I used the yelp check in to redeem a free banana nut muffin.  Omg, this was so good.  We went thru two, the one that came with the skillet and the free one with checkin.  

Our server Linnea was very attentive, and even with a packed house it was just a short wait when we needed some service.  

Very good place, will definitely have to make another visit when back in Vegas

Oscar was the bomb: He recommended the 3 Little Pigs Omelette and the Green Chile Relleno omelette. Both were served hot and were absolutely awesome. Relleno sauce was super flavorful and not too spicy. I selected the warm fresh-out-of-the-oven banana muffin (YUM). We ordered fruit on the side which was in large chunks and consisted of pineapple, 3 types of melon and an orange slice. Very fresh and tasty.  I would love to come back to try other menu items.  It looks like this place can be pretty busy, so allow for time to be seated.

Oscar was very sweet and attentive, letting us know our order was working and did frequent check backs. Plates were cleared and check promptly dropped. Thank you!

My experience was 5 star but admittedly that's not hard to earn from me for a breakfast place. It does mean I thought the food quality of my meal was well above average, aside from that it just means the atmosphere and service was plenty satisfactory or better. Would eat breakfast here quite often if I'm awake and not in the mood to make it myself.
Delicious food, excellent atmosphere but a bit crowded. Our server Reina "The Queen", was awesome and very helpful.

Cents here for breakfast due to a coupon we got for buy 1 get 1. My wife and daughter shared a waffle and egg meal. I had the chile relleno omelet. 

We left feeling full and the meals kept us going all day long. We never needed or wanted lunch.

The food was very good. The potatoes were a little salty, but not overly so. The hot sauces they provide added just the right flavor to the omelet. 

The waffle looked huge and was crisp despite being topped with strawberries and cream. 

Very good value for the money. Well be back next time we're in town.
The food was very good and our waitress, Jessica, was absolutely amazing and kept up with our orders!

Made a Togo order. Breakfast Burrito. Waited 23 minutes for the burrito and my order was wrong. Waited another 12 minutes for a simple correction to order and finally cancelled. Do not recommend take out.

I went to The Egg & I after a night of debauchery in Las Vegas (recovery breakfast) and I have zero regrets. I was excited to pull up and see roughly 40 ppl waiting outside as that generally means deliciousness awairs. After a 20 minute wait,  my friend and I were sat in Amanda's section. Amanda was a very knowledgeable, amiable and capable waitress. She got our orders correct and our food came out promptly. 

Speaking of food, I ordered the mashed potato omelette and my friend got the chicken fried steak skillet. Whoever though about putting garlic mash inside of a bacon omelette is a genius. Either that or they have grandmothers chained up in the back putting elbows and feet in the food. Absolutely amazing!! Will definitely come back when in the LV area.

Yelp 100 Challenge 14' * 6\/100

Be sure to arrive early (before 9am) if you want to be seated within 10 minutes because those banana nut muffins are pretty amazing!

Servers are always busy and it can be hard to get their attention with a never-ending inflow of people so what you can do is turn your eye to your table stand. Flip from a black to a yellow egg as an indicator that you're ready and a server would be at your table in no time. I found it unique and utterly adorable. 

After taking a while to eye the vast newspaper style menu, I got a huge portion of tender country fried chicken served with over easy eggs, home fries and their iconic banana nut muffin while mommy got the chicken, broccolli and mushroom skillet. It was the best thing that happened that morning. 

A point to take note of; the skillet is blanketed with a layer of cheddar cheese (wink to the lactose intolerant). To my fellow mint-lovers, do not miss the caramel peppermint candies available at the cashier. Slip a couple more of em' in your pockets if you can.

Yelp pulled thru again! Delicious on all counts. Great service, fast food delivery & everything spot on.  Banana muffin was as promised. Went Fri around 10:30. Only had to wait a few min. Weekend will probably be too busy but we may try to go back.

The food here is really good. The skillets have a ton of food with all great flavors. Biscuits and gravy are a generous portion that come with sausage and the great seasoned potatoes. Only tree stars here because of our terrible seating situation. Wait wasn't too bad but we elected to sit on the patio on a nice morning but wrong choice. He flies on the patio are terrible. Constantly all over us and our food the whole meal. Nasty pigeons roaming around going under the table too. Other than that...the service and food was great.

What an EGGcellent breakfast we had this morning!!!    We had never been here before but tried it based off all the positive reviews.    We were not disappointed!!  

It was a crowded Sunday morning but we only waited about 10 mins.   

We had the chicken enchilada omelette and the stuffed French toast.    Both were OMG!!  

The omelette had grilled chicken, green chilies, enchilada sauce, cheese  and sour cream.    Came with crunchy potatoes.  

Stuffed French toast was filled with sausage, eggs, cheese and topped with powdered sugar.     Unique combination and it all worked.  

Waitress was very fast and super friendly!   Thanks for a great meal.

This was another great Yelp find. Very friendly and quick service keeps this local breakfast restaurant moving smoothly. The food was great, no bad surprises. The banana but muffins have a great flavor, but the texture could be improved upon.

Great eggs, good chorizo, fresh fruit was sweet and hash was good too. Great place for a simple but tasty breakfast!
Great spot for an amazing breakfast. Bring your appetite! I always stop in here when I visit Las Vegas!!

So, what isn't GREAT about the food here? I came with 2 friends and we shared Huevos Rancheros, The Blackened Benny, and the Avocado Omelet. All of them excellent! I forgot to mention the blueberry pancakes? Our server Liliana was AMAZING and attentive and gave great recommendations. The place is a couple miles off of the strip but completely worth it.
Great Breakfast place. Omelette a are wonderful. Patrick our server was the best!  Try it you won't be sorry.
Gut filling satisfaction.  Diverse menu and old standards.
My husband had the country benny and I had waffles. Both were delicious!! Wish you had one of these in So CA!! We will be back very soon!

Whenever I am in vegas I always make sure that this is the last place that I hit up before I hit the road. The breakfast menu is really good and there is so much to choose from that it makes it hard to decide what you really want to eat because everything sounds so good. It is reasonable priced and the portions are large. So be sure to go on an empty stomach, cause you will walk out of there stuffed.

The service is great. Very mom and pops style. Only thing that sucks is that the cashier takes a while to ring up your stuff. She is pretty slow.

When you go make sure to have soem of their breakfast potatoes and their waffles are deliciuosly huge.

We came in on a crowded Sunday morning, but the wait for 2 was only 20 minutes. Service by Karla was phenomenal. She refilled my iced tea 3x without me needing to ask. Had the waffles with whipped cream and blueberries but the best part was the link sausage. Perfect amount to flavoring. Definitely will return to Egg & I on our next Vegas trip!

As we were leaving our hotel one morning I asked the Valet where the best breakfast spot is OFF the strip.  He immediately said the Egg and I.  He gave us directions and this place did not disappoint.  Its about a 10 minute drive from the strip but well worth it.  The portions are large, the service is outstanding and the food is great!  

Prior to arriving, I yelped it and saw all the great reviews.  We ordered the Banana nut muffin which was really good.  It was served warm with whipped butter.  Excellent start.

We ordered the ultimate skillet and a chile relleno omelet with a side of biscuit and gravy.  When the food came out I was amazed by the sheer size of the skillet.  It was was mound of food all served fresh and hot.  My chili relleno omelet was SOOO DELICIOUS.  It was topped off with melted cheese and a enchilada sauce with minced cilantro.  The omelet was one the best I've ever had.  The ranch potato's were crispy and seasoned well.  My biscuit and gravy was good but I was not really wowed by it.  

Our service was great.  The kept our beverage cups full and checked on us without being annoying.  The decor is a little cheesy but it works.  There are TVs on every wall so you can watch the news or ESPN.  

Definitely will be back the next time in Vegas.  Its a nice break from all hustle and bustle of the strip.
Solid amount, delicious type. newspaper like menu.

Delicious food! We're from Orange County, Cali and every time we come to Vegas we stop by the Egg & I. The food is great and it's always busy definitely worth the wait. Our waitress Carole Ann was so sweet and very attentive. She made us feel welcomed and comfortable right away. I would definitely recommend asking for Carole, she'll make your dining experience great. Thank you for the wonderful service and kindness Carole! We ordered the original breakfast burrito and pancakes both were soooo good! I added spinach to the breakfast burrito and it seriously looked like work of art when it came out, you could see the layers of bacon, cheese, eggs, spinach and potatoes. The salsa that came with the burrito was the best salsa I've had in a while and of course the Diablo potatoes are addicting. The pancakes were moist and fluffy. So much yummmm!

Hubby had the Bacon and Sliced Avocado omelette and now he does not want to eat breakfast anywhere else in Las Vegas. The four eggs were fluffy and cooked to PERFECTION! It was generously filled with bacon and avocado and smothered in freshly grated cheddar cheese. The potatoes were diced and crispy with a great blend of seasoning. Wheat toast was done just right. Paula was our waitress and she was attentive and friendly. This is a not-to-miss breakfast stop. And the coffee was wonderful.

This is my number one favorite breakfast food spot. I eat here, what seems like, once a week. I bring my family and friends any chance I get. The service is amazing and quick. Everything on the menu is delicious you can't go wrong. 

My favorite is the Huevos Rancheros with added avocado. You MUST get the Works Potatoes, so delicious. Also, the banana nut muffin is to die for. Their in house hot sauce is also amazing, if you like hotter, you'll have to request the Caliente from your waiter\/waitress.

Breakfast served by Karla. Crazy Chicken Omelette and  Huevos Rancheros with carnitas. Very good! The carnitas could stand on their own in taste, but nicely accompanied by an egg and, of course, their signature seasoned potatoes. Mmm, mmm! The Crazy Chicken is good for protein lovers, with a devilish addition of guacamole and cheese. Very good in a less spicy way. Exactly what I was in the mood for! Karla, our server always came with a smile and warm attitude. This is our go-to place and the food and service once again didn't disappoint.

The food is what won this place over this time. The eggs benny were fantastic but our visit was not that great because of the service. I know this place can get pretty busy but please train your servers better! I will try this place again because the food was great and hopefully next time the service will be on par with the food.

Super awesome brunch spot. Wasn't too crowded for a weekend. We got great service by Caroline, she was very sweet and on top of our needs. 

I had the Sundance omelette and I have no complaints. Wow it was tasty! I will be back.

So today after a long days of work, my coworker and I stopped by the Egg and I. We were seated promptly and our waitress Reina greeted us and took our drink orders. In less than 30 seconds our server brought us our drinks. She talked to us as if we were friends and made us feel at home!!! Will be back specifically to this location just because of her service! Thank you Reina. If they don't send you Disney I will!!!!!
My first time...enjoyed the stuffed strawberry cream cheese french toast! Coffee was piping hot like I love it. Atmosphere was good. LIKED OUR WAITRESS, CHANCE!!! Good service!

A couple of weeks ago, I made my way back to our semi annual trade show. I got the little free booklet you get from taking shuttle from airport. I flipped through and saw this place called Egg & I and their other location Egg Works. It looked interesting and the reviews sounded good plus had coupon for one meal free with purchase of another meal. Cool..I will take my co-workers there. Big mistake! They know best known for banana nut muffin served warm with butter but it had this weird taste as if they used artificial sweetener or perhaps the blend wasn't right because it tasted like metal or whatever it just tasted awful. It was nice to give all 6 of us free banana nut muffin but my guys wouldn't touch it!

 I ordered classic eggs Benedict, my fav breakfast choice. I was excited plus the potatoes versus hash browns. The potatoes had too much of that lawry seasoning...ugh. Then worse, my hollandaise sauce was the worst thing I have ever had! They didn't properly make the sauce and then to make it worse, the whole dish was slathered in it! I literally used a spoon to scoop out the sauce just so I could eat everything else which wasn't much better but I needed to eat. Would never come back even if I was paid to do so plus I read other reviews where this place was actually busy and needed to go early, well we were there Saturday morning around 8am and it was not busy at all!

This place was so good. They have a wide variety of options, but went for breakfast based off the name alone. I got the Eggs Benedict Florentine. It comes with the crispest seasoned potatoes.  FYI. The portions are really big. I wish I knew that before I went here. I left so full but happy !

I love breakfast. It is my favorite... so Mama might be a little picky when it comes to it.

Obsessed with this place. Amazing service, kind staff, & delicious food! A ton of healthy options! YES! 

Not too far from the strip to check out... skip the buffets & overpriced crap and indulge in the homefries & the amazing banana nut muffins. The scrambles are ridiculous and i added the "sassy apples" to my cottage cheese. 

Just GO! It won't disappoint.  Only thing I would want is a larger selection of coffee type beverages like latte's, etc...

Excellent service and food this afternoon.  Ate on the patio with my neighbor and my little dog.    I love this restaurant.  The staff always goes the extra distance to be sure you are having a great experience.

Super friendly staff, busy but not too busy, great food. 

We ordered the waffle with fruit and one of the skillet dishes. Both were extremely satisfying. 

One complaint is that the skillet dish was at the salty end of the spectrum, despite special request to hold the salt. 

Get the banana nut muffin.

love this place! first ate here a few years ago before Yelp.
Got to go last week and it was so good my mom wanted to eat there 2 days in a row! and my mom NEVER eats anywhere 2 days in a row.

highlights: giant portions, strong coffee, FAST SERVICE.

First day I ordered biscuits and gravy with potatoes and eggs. Was a little weirded out by the orange potatoes but when mixed with the gravy they were very good. The biscuits are freshly made and are amazing! Coffee was really good and strong here too.

I was very curious for the Cincy chili and got a side of that but I had to taste it and take it to go. It was AWESOME. Brought it home and ate it on a hot dog! AWESOME.

the service here was VERY fast and it was great but definitely hard for everywhere else we ate in Vegas to live up to.

lets see my other families food choices were all GIANT and everyone was really happy which is very unusual for us.

Second day I ordered the spam, rice and eggs. I think they called it Hawaiian special. Of course it was great. My niece tried the apple cinnamon pancakes but they were seriously big enough for 4 people to split. I think she finished 1 whole pancake. VERY fluffy and good.

Had the western omelette and pancakes. Pretty crowded for a Tuesday. This place is off the strip. My main dish was 4 star but t honesty the pancakes were not that great. I liked the papitas. 

Wife's review: 

The potato fries were salty and the service was mediocre.

Had breakfast there. Food was good.  Just a little pricey for  eggs and corned beef. Then again I am behind the times on prices. The waitress was doing her best keeping up on a holiday weekend. I would eat there again when it's not so crowded.

We came to Vegas for Spring Break and for a Basketball Tournament.  Looking to escape the casino for breakfast I Googled "the best breakfast in Vegas". The Egg and I came up a winner!  

Place was busy for a Tuesday morning.  Service was prompt with only a short wait to be seated.

I had a two egg chile relleno omelette. It was delish!  I chose to get fruit instead of potatoes.  My husband got potatoes with his chicken fried steak and eggs.  The potatoes were yummy and perfectly spiced.  The fruit I had was all fresh sliced pineapple, grapefruit, honeydew and cantaloupe. The fruit combination was a perfect complement.  

Kids ate mouse pancakes, one with chocolate chips the other without.  Both kids said they were better than my homemade!  

Coffee comes in a carafe to the table.  Took what was left in a to go cup.  :-)

Service was very good.  Our server was "Karen." She was super friendly, patient\/understanding with kids ordering, and very attentive.
The food was decent, it wasn't anything special. It took awhile for them to bring out the food and even longer to pay, their payment area was 7-8 people long, kind of annoying.

This place is good as long as you come at the right time. Too late, and you're doomed to wait a long time for a table on a Saturday or Sunday morning. Timing is key. The food is good and so is the service. We never walk in the door without a coupon. You can find them pretty much in any newspaper, city guide or Entertainment book, so be prepared.

Originally I didn't plan on eating here I had requested IHOP to my husband, but he quickly shot me down and stated we would go to egg and I. I was a tad bit apprehensive about their food but agreed. Once arriving at egg and I the service was top notch. Our waiters name was Amanda and she seemed so happy to be working and really looked to be enjoying her job, She was a breath of fresh air from the waiters we usually experience. Down to the food, I ordered the Waffle works but instead waffles I got strawberry cream cheese french toast and my husband ordered an omelette. Ohh my was it good my French toast were simply put amazing and my husbands food was just as good. I give egg and I 5 stars and they have gained a new customer

Wandering over to this side of Las Vegas,  I finally found a place in town that serves Cincinnati chili. Weird that it is a place known for a great breakfast!  Liza really made us feel welcome, and she was cheerful and efficient,  a rare combination in Vegas. We also ordered the chili relleÃ±o omelet, which was fantastic. Definitely worth a visit.

First off, I had the cordon bleu skillet, and it was great! Their house potatoes are pretty good, a little salty, but not too much to make me not want to eat them. I would say borderline on the seasoning. The service was great for a Saturday morning, and they were very busy. I recommend sitting outside in the morning, it is quite pleasant with the misters on. The food was very tasty, and the portions are excellent for the price. I will definitely be going back here again.

Honestly the BEST breakfast spot in Vegas! Every time we go to Vegas we make it a point to go here! The potatoes are on point here, WAY better than any potatoes you can get at chain breakfast joints. I highly recommend the blackened prime rib Benny
There's a reason this place has great reviews! This place is awesome!! Our server Amanda was so friendly and pleasant!! This now one of our must haves when we come to Vegas.

I never expected these kind of breakfast to be any more special than other breakfast shop, but their food is just extraordinarily tasty. I like their egg work newspaper. Very creative and cute, Remember to order their omelet, super awesome!

The Carnivore is in lovely Las Vegas again, to celebrate the anniversary of his nuptials to Mrs. Carnivore.  Breakfast number one was to be hosted by The Egg and I.  The carnivore loves this place for breakfast!!!

The Carnivore had eggs, bacon, hash browns, and pancakes.  This is his preferred restaurant breakfast.  There were no weak points.  The eggs were cooked perfectly, the maple cured bacon was bacony delicious, of course.  Hash browns were in patty form, but tasted lovely, and the pancakes were of the sort that I just plain love.  

This is honest food, cooked presumably with grease and butter, and is just plain good.  

The menus look like they are styled a bit after a newspaper, which is new and lovely.  This establishment has something The carnivore has never seen before.  Each table has a device on it that shows an egg with a happy face, or an egg with a sad face.  One is yellow, the other is black, and this means that your server can tell at a glance whether you need her for anything.  Every restaurant should employ a similar device.  

Amanda was our waitress.  Yes, the Carnivore still uses the words waitress and waiter.  He also will not apologize for this, or stop doing it.  In any case, Any case, Amanda was on point for our whole visit.  All questions were answered promptly, food came out superfast, drinks were topped off without any wait, and she had an infectious smile.  She either loves her job, or should move to Hollywood.  Mrs. Carnivore and I would be delighted to have her wait on is at any establishment.  This level of service is truly rare in today's world.

Great! Have came to this place several times and it's never disappointing! 
There food is amazing!!! And the muffin is to die for! 
The service is great too. Everyone is so nice and the food come out at a decent time. 
A must have when visiting Vegas!
Good food but left hungry. Cin. Raisin French toast, scrambled eggs, and bacon. Banana nut muffin was more like a banana bran muffin.

This place was a great spot to grab breakfast while visiting Vegas with friends. They had plenty of options to choose from (which all sounded good) and the food tasted great. Our waiter was attentive and gave great service. If I lived in the area, I'd make this a regular breakfast spot.
What is there to say....the food was delicious and the cost very reasonable.service was great and although it was very busy they quickly moved us to our seats. I would bucky recommend the experience.
Come in hungry, you'll starve by the time you get your table but once you do...you'll wish your momma made the eggs as good!

I called to place a to go order. I took 5 phone calls to finally get someone to take my order. I was transferred to another phone that would ring for over 5 minutes without anyone picking it up. I was transferred over and over even when I would ask not to be put on hold. Very frustrating experience

This is currently my favorite place for breakfast in town and I have a feeling it will stay that way! They have a huge menu and I want to come back many times to try all of the tasty-looking options.

I had a gigantic omelet full of avocado and bacon. It doesn't get any richer or more fattening than that but it's okay because there's no way I could have finished that thing (despite its yumminess). My husband got this ridiculous stuffed French toast monstrosity- stuffed not with marscapone cheese, or some fruity filling, or whatever else you'd expect French toast to be stuffed with, but with eggs and sausage! It was hugely filling but delicious.

They have good coffee, too, and the prices are right, and the heavily seasoned potatoes are probably loaded with sodium but who cares because they're delicious.

Had breakfast yesterday, 20 minute wait, this place is always busy on Saturday mornings and it was no different on this visit. 
Prompt beverage order and delivery. Had the Cincy chili omelet, was good again. The Banana Nut muffin is the best-hands down. We had one issue with an omelet and this was quickly resolved by our server.
The best thing in this place was Raul our waiter. Nice, adaptive and always checking.
Wide variety of dishes sure to please all tastes. Biscuits and gravy were very good. It was very busy but Linnea and the rest of the staff did a great job of meeting our needs. I will eat here again.

Whenever I come visit my brother, we always eventually grab breakfast at Egg & I. It's kind of a mix between Cracker Barrel and a Dennys. They have an amazing banana nut muffin that I always try and make sure to order. It's a solid place, usually with a 20 minute wait, but nothing extraordinary.
The food here is amazing! Best breakfast spot of our trip. Great service thanks to our server Raul. I will recommend this place to everyone.

Great selection of traditional and creative new dishes for breakfast. Service was fast and friendly. We sat down ordered and had our food within 5 minutes. I ordered the Kay special it was super cheesy and tasty along with their seasoned fries.. My friend had the stuffed French toast which according To her was amazing!!

Biggest portions ever!!! Very reasonable pricing and husband loves this place. Lines can be very long sometimes but it's worth the wait. The banana nut muffin is really good and the potatoes are really sprinkled with crack. No lie. Haha.

I know this place can do without another 5 star review, but I think I want to move to Vegas just for Egg & I. We came in a group of 10, but service blew our minds away. At 1 pm on a Saturday, we barely waited 10 minutes. Our server took our orders quickly, and gave everyone a banana nut muffin on the house!

A couple of my friends and I split the blackened prime rib benedict (a must must MUST!), the strawberry cream-stuffed french toast (tasted like fair food), and an Italian omelette. Enormous portions priced right--felt so bad leaving so much of it uneaten, especially since it was so delish. Even the coffee was the absolute perfect diner coffee.
