I don't think I can ever do a Vegas trip without the Egg & I. It's so worth the drive off the strip! And believe the hype--just stick to the blackened prime rib benny and you won't be disappointed.

Great breakfast for lunchtime. Breeannda us a great waitress.  It was worth coming out of the strip for some normal restaurant time.  Turn around is quick. No waiting despite all the people at lunch rush.
The food was delicious, service was great, and price was reasonable. You must try the banana nut muffin so good !!!

I only got to try the banana nut muffin and the traditional eggs Benedict but both were delicious and I think that says a lot about this place. The muffin was very moist and sweet with few nuts, just the way I like it.

The eggs Benedict, though traditional and simple, was perfect and filling. It made its way to the top of my list of favorite eggs Benedicts. The hollandaise sauce was one of the best I've had. This dish alone will have me coming back if I ever make a trip back to Vegas.

Our server was also very accommodating to our party of 9 and super friendly.

Now, I understand why the ratings for this place are so high; people who eat here must be stoner's. That is the only explanation for the "high" rating for the food.
The wait staff are pretty nice.

absolutely delicious and worth the wait. i came here a while back and i remember getting the eggs benedict. i seriously remember it and it was like two years ago. i'm definitely going back here on my next vegas trip.

Me and my dad have gotten the chili relleno omelet numerous times ! It is amazing ! I like to add avocado to mine! 

They have several many locations in the Las Vegas valley - those are valued Egg Works. Egg and I appears to be the original in my eyes, being born and raised here as well .

Another omelet I like is the mashed potato omelet ! 

The other thing , they have red bull - sugar free ! That is awesome !

I've been here several times over the years and finally getting the thoughts down on Yelp. On my last visit I was a little peeved when the hostess passed me over when taking names for the waiting list. I know I'm not invisible. Once seated things calmed down and breakfast was on. I had a skillet which are always good but I was looking for a spinach & ground beef omelet with cheese but they don't have that on the menu but I'll ask next time. Not always my first choice for breakfast but its a good place to be.
OMG,lots of food!  Banana muffin was so yummy.  And they have reasonably price alcoholic beverages!  You won't leave hungry

This is one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to. The variety of the menu is mind boggling with some great twists on classic American breakfast items. Everything we ordered was incredible- especially the banana nut muffin!

Our server (Manuela) was really hospitable, checking up on us often and making sure everything was ok. If you're in vegas GO TO THIS PLACE.

The food at Egg and I is good if you order the right thing. I had the scramble and it was just ok. However, the turkey sausage, French toast Diablo potatoes are great. The homemade banana nut muffins are to die for. I was most impressed with the muffins and our server Roman left nothing unattended.  He's one of the best I've had in any restaurant.  Great customer service all the way around.  If I'm back in Vegas I'll come back.

i absolutely *heart* this place!  i think its the cute egg mascots ;-)

been here serveral times.  one of my best friends moved to vegas years ago, and ever since she's been my vegas local guide to food.  its good to be in the know ;-)  we go here for breakfast almost every time i visit!  here's why....

service is always friendly.  the food is creative, homey, filling, and just a great homemade american breakfast\/brunch menu.  there are heavy soul filling and hangover killing dishes like meaty hashes, great benedicts, all sorts of omelettes, and then there are lighter versions like the egg crepes and even the fresh berry parfait.  

its PACKED for weekend brunch, mostly with locals, but the wait isn't tooo bad, usually not over 20 min or so.  if u happen to be here on a weekday, or get up earlier than the rest of ur friends and wanna get off the strip, this is perfect place to sit by urself with the paper, coffee, and  a good breakfast.  not what u would think of when u think of vegas, in a very good way =D

p.s. must get the muffins!

First of all, I have to say 'THANK YOU' to all the Yelpers out there that recommended this place.

Now the review...

The family and I were in Vegas to cash in on a Giants World Series bet.  I really didn't want the usual buffet, so we did a quick search on Yelp and off to the Egg and I we went.  

We stepped in and were quickly seated.  The televisions on the wall was great.  I could see who was playing and not playing for that Sunday's Fantasy Football Lineups.  We ordered coffee and looked over the menu.  (Note- Coffee was ok.  Better than IHOP, but not my favorite blend.) 

We looked over the menu and what a selection!  It took us awhile to figure out what we wanted.  I ordered the Egg-Ceptional Omelet, my wife ordered the Two-egger, and my son had the Chocolate Waffles.    

The food quickly came out and as far as portions...  they were HUGE!  My wife's Two-egger was like 4 eggs.  My kid's waffles were shaped like Mickey Mouse, which was a nice touch.  My omelet was one of the biggest I've ever seen.  Our only problem was that the chocolate waffle was without chocolate.  We had them bring out some chocolate chips and all was well again.  

The omelet and ranch spiced potatoes were yummy.  You could taste freshness of the ingredients.  The omelet had sausage, diced ham, bacon, onions, tomatoes, portabella mushrooms and melted cheese all topped with sour cream and green onions.     

We finished all we could and off to gambling we went.

As expected five stars. I'd heard of the Egg & I prior to this trip to Vegas and was anxiously awaiting a delicious breakfast. The food was superlative and the service...well what can I say? Packed house and we were offered immediate seating outdoors or wait. I chose to wait and my group was seated within 5 minutes. Totally unexpected. Karla was our server and she was friendly and attentive. She really made us feel at home! Karla didn't even blink when I asked for my free banana nut muffin with my Yelp check in. That banana nut muffin! You have to try it. Best I've had. As a side note, even the man who brought out our food (he had a family first tattoo on his arm) was really cheerful and made us feel welcome. The price ia unbelievable. Very affordable. I'm coming back tomorrow! Vegas!!!

The hype doesn't lie. We were in town for a couple of days and wanted to find a great brunch place. We debated between this place and Hash House A Go Go. I am so glad we came here. Our server, Liza, was top notch and gave us great recommendations and service. We ordered The Classic and Texas French Toast works. The Classic blew me away. The Classic is just potatoes, eggs and your choice of meat. I got the links with it and they were amazing. So simple but bursting with flavor! The free banana nut muffin at check in is probably the most moist, gooey and orgasmic muffin I ever had. Please don't forget to order that to try. Overall, a wonderful and unbeatable brunch experience away from the strip.
Food was so good. I ordered the Country Fried Steak,very filling and tasted great. Lindsey are server was great as well.

This is one of my favorite breakfast spots when you are in Vegas. They offer regular menu and they also offer vegetarian options. Plus when you order coffee they bring you a whole pot for yourself what's not to love .

Here I have had the veggie scramble and I've also hide the carrot cake French toast which are amazing I highly recommend. Good coffee!

The service is great and when you check and you get a free banana muffin which is delicious.

Also if you have a group on check out their breakfast deals that they have saved a ton of money .

I came here today with a good friend from out of town who wanted some breakfast while he waited for some car servicing to be done.  He let me choose the place and this was it.  I've driven by a lot of times and never stopped.  That was changed today.

We were seated promptly and were served coffee and water promptly while we looked through their extensive menu done in the form of a tabloid newspaper.

I got the Benedict's Garden, a vegetarian Eggs Benedict.  It came with English muffin halves on the bottom, then sliced grilled tomatoes, some avocado, and topped (the menu says smothered which is close) with Hollandaise.  There were potatoes and a side of some fresh fruit.  My friend got the Mexican omelette which was the special of the day.

Everything was really good.  My eggs and the mixture of avocado and tomato with the Hollandaise was quite good.  The breakfast potatoes were really flavorful and the small slice of canteloupe and fresh pineapple was like having a dessert at breakfast.  My friend thought his omelette was one of the best he has had.  Be prepared for a large breakfast.  The omelettes are listed as four eggs.

We chatted and passed a considerable amount of time.  Service was fast and cheerful.  It was a good way to start the day.

Egg and I, how I love your warm, moist banana muffins. I drool just thinking of the muffin split in half with butter melting into the tender crumb. Yum! I am also a big fan of your corned beef hash, tasty. I know you're a part of the Egg Works chain, I can't get myself to try the other locations. I'm hopelessly devoted to you.

So, I've come to the Egg & I on about 7 of my last 8 trips to Vegas after initially discovering it, but this was by far the best service I've had, even though service has been wonderful each and every time. Today, I just wanted to give a couple of shot outs to Brady, the Assistant Manager, and to Jesus, whom I discovered is a 20-yr  employee of the Egg & I. 

Jesus is a busboy. On my last two visits prior to the one I'm writing about (this past Monday, Memorial Day), Jesus has asked me if I needed anything to let him know, which he did again on this visit. Jesus is ALWAYS willing to help, and has gotten me coffee, filled my coffee and even scored me an extra banana nut muffin or two before. Not really his job, as his is to clean tables and make sure their customers have somewhere nice to be seated, but Jesus ALWAYS goes above and beyond what is expected of him to do, and I appreciate his hard work.

Which brings me to Brady, the young Assistant Manager. Brady is definitely young enough to be my little brother. Brady is a genuine, bonafide talker. He shoots the shit with you, but real talk. Not fake talk like I'm only here to make it look like I care about you talk, but good ol' fashioned back and forth banter. He has a tattoo on one of his forearms that says "Family First", and Brady made me feel like family! While shooting it with him, I told him that we had just come from Laughlin but had to detour cause one of my wife's uncles fell ill and ended up in the hospital and guess what Brady did? He sent me home with a loaf of their bomb ass banana nut bread to take to my uncle at the hospital since I told him that's where we were heading after breakfast! THANK YOU AGAIN BRADY! I'LL NEVER FORGET YOUR KINDNESS!

I'll end this review with a little bit about the food.........my Italiano skillet was on point, AS USUAL. Onion, bell pepper and sausages were all cooked to damn near perfection, it had just the right amount of marinara and cheese that didn't drown or overwhelm, and to be quite honest, have they every messed up a batch of their famous potatoes?
they have awesome breakfast this pancakes are pretty good they got great olives and the prices are pretty good not a bad place to go with the family I was satisfied for sure

Arrived worrying about too much salt and MSG (via previous Yelp reviews). But right away I knew I'd be disappointed when I learned that they didn't have real maple syrup for their pancakes. Its regular customer must be some one who likes the artificial sugar syrup they serve at cheap restaurants. It wasn't even an option for an additional charge.

To be fair, my kids didn't care their Mickey Mouse pancakes came with sugar syrup. And the prices for everything were reasonable. While I didn't find their eggs Benedict too salty (I am not salt sensitive), the MSG in the Hollindaise was palpable and the famous Diablo potatoes were "meh" (and I like spicy!). On the plus side, their banana nut muffins were delicious, as advertised.

Got here on a Saturday (5\/16) around noon for a late breakfast. The wait was about 30 minutes but went by fast. The food was great and loved the banana muffin. It comes out very warm and moist... delicious. 

What was best was the service. All staff were all very helpful and attentive and seemed truly happy to work there which made it a good experience for us.
Must stop here for breakfast if you're in Vegas! Awesome food and great service, Thank u Carole Ann!! Try the corn beef hash.. Homemade and delicious!

First time here and it was delicious.  Reina was super friendly and our food was amazing. Our order came out quick and just the way we wanted. As a server myself I was very pleased with the service we received. We usually go to Babystacks but we drove past this place and we wanted to try it out. Glad we did. Super busy but we didn't wait too long for a table.

Delicious food in large portions! I got the Mexican omelet and my husband got the stuffed french toast. Both were very filling. Prices are extremely reasonable for the portion you get. Friendly staff also!
Good food, large portions, great service. Awesome place for breakfast!
Best brunch ever! Love the banana nut muffins, yumm!

We enjoyed a lovely brunch here! The choices were varied, portions huge and the foid very flavourful. The best thing, it was almost half the cost of eating on the strip! If you have a car go where the locals are, treat yourself to an awesome brunch and enjoy discovering new addictions!

This was a nice, solid spot for breakfast\/brunch food.

The place is fairly big and when we went on a Monday morning at 9:30am, the place was packed.  I had the biscuits with gravy with eggs and it was a decadent and savory dish...perfect to start the day.  I had a banana nut muffin, which was also good.

The menu is HUGE, so take your time in figuring out what appeals most...there's definitely something for everyone.

Good diner and very close to the strip. Went with my friend after a long night and they offer good portions at a good price. Checking in alone gives you a free banana nut muffin that was delicious. I had the country fried steak and eggs as well as the corn beef hash and eggs for brunch. The corn beef hash was very good and better than the country fried steak and eggs. Although the reviews rave about this place, it fell just short of my expectations but it was still delicious. Would probably think about coming here again when I am back in Vegas, but it wouldn't be my first choice

As classically delicious as breakfast gets! 
I definitely suggest to be ready to wait, but it's bearable aside from there being a very small area inside to wait. The muffins are great :)

Absolutely an amazing place to get breakfast in Vegas. It was so delicious. The place was busy when we walked in and we were told to wait 10 minutes but got seated in less then that. Our waitress was super sweet and the food was great and inexpensive. The portions are massive so come on an empty stomach. I would suggest this place to all my friends. It's a cheap uber from the strip!

This place is great and I hope this review helps Linnea win a trip to Disney California!

Oh any of the egg dishes are awesome too.

Review - Egg & I


If I were looking for a reason to move to Las Vegas the Egg & I would be the reason.  Funny thing to say when speaking about a location that has something to offer for everyone and a few of the best dining experiences that money can buy. 

The Egg & I is simply a great place to enjoy breakfast and that's because it is simple.  Everyone who knows me knows that I love breakfast and can almost always be found at my favorite breakfast place in Corona, CA every Saturday morning without fail.

The Egg & I is a place that locals visit and has a lot of regulars.  It's located in a small strip mall that is way off the strip.    The interior is what you would expect in a diner that intended for locals.  It's a large open space with lots of tables and country-ish decorations on the walls

The menu is consists of many different egg dishes, pancakes, waffles and some incredible looking skillets.  On my first visit I tried the Works Omelet, which as you would expect has a list of ingredients including bacon, sausage, ham, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers, mushrooms, cheese and sour cream.  It is served with Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes and a choice of toast or a house made banana nut muffin.    

The omelet was cooked to perfection.  It was served hot, light and fluffy. The cacophony of ingredients came together to form the perfect symphony of deliciousness.   My preference for breakfast potatoes is hash browns.  I love them!  The Habla Diablo potatoes were a treat and a nice departure from the hash brown rut I'd been in.  The high point of the meal was however was the banana nut muffin(s).   They serve one almost like an appetizer when sit down before you order.  You get a free one with a Yelp check in.   It told our waitress, Chance (awesome Las Vegas name) how much I liked them and she sent me home with a couple of extra.  Bless her!  I'm not a huge fan of bananas.  In fact I hate everything about them but the banana nut muffins here changed my mind.  It's worth a trip to Egg & I just for muffins.

To summarize, great food, fun local ambience, extremely friendly staff.  I'd repeat and repeat and repeat and repeat...

I'm not sure why I haven't written a review before today, I've been here like hundreds of times.

I will say that there are a few things this visit that I wasn't too pleased with though. I ordered a classic 2 egg breakfast with a side of salsa and unfortunately they changed the salsa.

It's not the same they use to make and I'm not sure why they did that. This new salsa they use is just down right yucky tasting.

Also when I've ordered eggs here before they usually scramble them soft and this time they were kinda dry. 

Maybe this visit was just a slip up so I'm looking forward to coming here again and giving them another try.
Seated pretty quickly service was excellent very creative with the egg sign. Ordered the eggs Benedict with veggie, very good! and the country potatoes are fantastic!

Came here for the first time today. Our server Carole Ann was in a word awesome.  My wife got the Cabo burrito and it was huge and quite delicious. The ranch potatoes were heavenly, and superbly seasoned.  I got the plain buttermilk pancakes, and they brought out not one but 3 pancakes the size of a dinner plate.  I'm a big guy, and was no match for the giant fluffy elliptical yummyness.  All in all a great place to eat.

After waiting for 35 minutes waitress comes and tells us she forgot to put in our order. Used to love this place but the past two times I've eaten here you can tell that they don't care about customer service anymore. Go to egg works or jamms because The Egg & I has went downhill. What give no stars. but that is not an option. Really miss the good ol Days when people actually cared about getting the customers served. And she started off by saying she was going to take a couple of dollars off the bill for making us wait for 35 minutes. I have no problem waiting for good food. I have no problem waiting in a long line. But when your customer has placed an order and you just completely checked out from putting in the order there is something wrong and you really need to look at what you're doing.

Amazing breakfast place close to the strip. I found this place on Yelp and we decided to make the trip as it was close by. I knew we were at the right place when they were super busy. We didn't have to wait to get seated which was very nice. The food was very good and priced normally. Portions were regular sized. Would recommend to anyone who is looking for a breakfast and brunch spot in Vegas.

Came here for the first time while staying in Vegas because of the great reviews. Our waiter Karen was very friendly and attentive. The food was delicious, but the only reason why I took a star off was because the table we sat in was a bit too small. Other than that it was great!
the muffins are really good . fun down to earth laid back enviroment with excellent food .
My breakfast was disappointing. I disliked their potatoes. The bacon was hard, and old. The whole thing was a little over priced.
One of my favorite breakfast places to eat. Food was good and service was even better. Thanks Karla.
Delicious I loved it big portions great prices we all got skillets and you get a free muffin which is also delicious

Items selected:

Coffee
Cinnamon Roll
Banana Nut Muffin
Chocolate Chip Pumpkin Pancakes
Carrot Cake French Toast with Sassy Apples

With a house full of boxes waiting to be unpacked and a long run already in the morning's rearview it was with carbohydrates on my mind that we descended on venerable The Egg & I just after 6:30am and finding only a few regulars inhabiting the space as a half dozen holiday-clad servers stood in waiting I can only assume that both food and services rendered were as good as the restaurant gets...and both were pretty darn good.  A whimsical concept with a plethora of breakfast staples "eggceptionally" categorized plus a number of seasonal specials it was without hesitation that eyes turned to things autumnal and with a full pot of coffee in hand each dish that followed was exactly as expected - fresh, comfortable, and delicious; the sort of thing you 'could' make at home but never do...though if you make banana bread this light and moist or carrot cake pudding moldable to crispy French Toast I'll gladly come over, bring the coffee, and do dishes.

Very cost effective, lighting fast service but never once felt rushed. There was a wide variety for the selection of food and everything that came to our table was cooked perfectly. The Egg and I manages to feel like a neighborhood diner and your family's house all at the same time. No better place in town for breakfast for both taste and value.

If your looking for breakfast look no further. This place is amazing. I had the breakfast burrito and my girlfriend had biscuits and gravy, eggs, and potatoes. I would recommend this place to anyone. Always come with an empty stomach and leave full!! Check the 24\/7 magazine for b1g1 coupons.

Off the strip but soooooooooooooooooo good. Love this place --- and it's in Las Vegas only!

Just a few words that you need to heed:

Fresh. Banana. Nut. Bread.

OH YES.

The other items are great --- everything we had was so good. Skillets, omelettes, home fries (oh mmmmmmm yum), and eggs done to perfection. Wonderful service, friendly smiles, and great directions on the phone when we were trying to find the restaurant!

And their little egg logo is just SOOOO CUTE. What can I say? I'm such a sucker for branding!

Went here for breakfast with some friends after working all night. Nice family restaurant, and the service was quick and friendly. It is off the strip but it's worth the trip. 

Everyone's food looked great and I was happy to find out that the taste and quality were there. Some portions seemed big but most of them were good. 

I got the waffle combo plate and the highly recommend banana nut muffin which was awesome! Already planning on going back.

My wife and I came in on Sunday, 11\/11\/12, at 10:00 a.m. This was our first time here. There was a wait, but considering all of the Zagat listings on the wall, we didn't mind. When we were seated, the server was prompt and attentive. From there it was all down hill.

It too 30-40 minutes to get our food. Really? For egg dishes? Our food was cold. I had asked for my eggs basted medium. They came fried, sunny side up. The salsa that came with my wife's huevos rancheros was bland. That was better than my tasteless food. The cream cheese for my bagel was in a small metallic packet. It was so cold I could barely get it out.

Neither of us finished our food. I don't know how anyone could want to. I was still tasting my greasy "cordon bleu skillet" breakfast hours later.

Maybe I was just unfortunate, but bland, cold food and an unreasonable length of time to have the food delivered to the table means this is the 2nd time we will go there: first and last.

Great potatoes an great omelette , they actually use four eggs for their omelettes that's a lot of eggs!! I don't know if it is by luck or chance but we actually saw a bodybuilder named Dexter Jackson and also Jim manion. Must b the portions ! Would come back again . Sitting in the patio when it's great weather is so nice. I would recommend waiting for a patio seat.

Best potatoes EVER. I wasn't a fan of the wait to be seated, which took a half hour. But it was still the morning, so I assume it was just the normal breakfast rush. No real biggie. The food was great. My only real complaint was that I was supposed to get a muffin, which never came. Sad face. But everything else was awesome. Thanks!!
Their waffles are the best! Great spot for breakfast and brunch!

This place was recommended from a friend for cheap eats (seeing how Vegas likes to charge you an arm and leg at buffets). We came here for brunch after getting our asses drunk AF the previous morning. #HangoverFTW. It was 100+ degrees come 10:30am and we were waiting outside to be seated, luckily we didn't wait that long and managed to snag a seat at their patio (thank goodness their misters were on). The staff was amazing in accommodating our large party outside and they rocked taking all our orders and getting them out in a timely manner.

I ordered their fresh vegetable (vegetarian) omelette with egg whites sans cheese with a side of potatoes. The omelette was pretty good, although nothing terribly mind-blowing and it came with spinach and mushrooms. The house potatoes were not my favorite, but still eatable. It had way too much seasoning making it very salty.

The food was decent overall, would like to come and try their scrambles the next time I'm in Vegas. :) Can't go wrong with affordable mom and pop restaurants off the Strip.

My original eggs bene was pretty yummy. The Canadian bacon was a little too smokey for my taste, but the English muffin was tender and easy to cut and the egg was poached perfectly. And there was plenty of hollandaise. My boys enjoyed the kids meals and we had plenty of food to go around. The best part was our server always had a smile on her face and was very friendly. (Even when faced with a family with five young boys.)

Towards the end someone started smoking on the patio so next time I would definitely wait for a table inside.

This place was pretty good.  I know others have given it 5 stars but I only tried it once and had the corn beef and hash it was good, different then I'm use to.  I wouldn't reorder it however.  Its not like its from a can or anything, its shredded ham and the flavor is different then what I believe Hash should taste like  The Banana Nut muffin was pretty good, but again I have had better.  The servers are nice and the place is adorable.  

However if you want your Socks knocked of for breakfast go to the Hash House A Go Go, its a little further West up Sahara and on the right.  That place has the best breakfast I have ever had.
Overall I must say Egg & I is a good place.  A  decent breakfast, however for egg critiques take a look at the pictures, unless you order an eggs Benny they over cook most of there eggs.

The Veggie Skillet! A meal for 3! Everything made to perfection! Meal hot, cooked to your liking, eggs over easy!  Expect a wait, but we walked up the street to Starbucks, walked back & were called to sit down. Lots of parking!

Came here with friends while on vacation. I appreciate the choices in coffee creamers and the carafe being left of the table, which saves the hassle of tracking down a server for a refill when you've got a small cup o' joe. Good coffee, but I come here for the eggs. 

I ordered the hash, but our table also ordered a pancake plate and a waffle works. The waffles look light and crisp, the pancakes are fluffy and have a variety of fillings (but I think we got charged a different-than-base-price for these, so ask or watch out? Our server suggested something after we handed over the menus), and the crispy little home fried potatoes are so tasty! (I got a half serving of these, half serving of fruit--which is plenty of both!) My hash was homemade and nothing like that cubed canned corned beef hash, but it was pretty salty for my tastes. My eggs came out EGGsactly right and were mouthwateringly delicious for something so simple--eggs. My fiance asked for tomatoes in his scrambled eggs, and those were extra too, and we weren't informed of that\/how much until we saw it on the check (the pancake chocolate chips and the tomatoes somehow managed to be about $5, so I don't know how that stacks up, but it peeved me a bit).

If they ask you if you want toast or the banana muffin, DO NOT GET TOAST. GET THE DANG MUFFIN. It is sooooo good. It doesn't look like anything special, mostly because it's flat on top and served upside down, but it's soft and moist and tasty and warm and goodness gracious, so amazing. If you're counting calories, #1 you're in the wrong place, #2 put butter on it anyway.

The little eggy signs are so helpful for when you need to track down your server--a great idea instead of trying to get someone's attention in the (can be) noisy atmosphere. 

This place is fantastic, but I pulled a star because the server forgot a side order for half the meal and didn't notify us of the upcharges on the items at time of order and after suggesting (i.e. we order regular pancakes, he suggests blueberry or chocolate chip, but doesn't mention they cost extra) after taking the menus so we couldn't see ourselves. I know some things are extra, but how much sometimes influences people's decisions--knowing if it was $0.50 versus $2.00 would have made that difference, for example. Overall, will DEFINITELY come again.
Good food and generous portions.  The wait was about 20 minutes.  Our waitress  Liza was awesome.  Check it out if your looking for a good breakfast in Vegas.
Awesome and well worth the wait.  Egg's Benedict was wonderful and so were the home fries!

We had breakfast here because my friend wanted one of their Hawaiian dishes. The Haole Moco was the chosen dish which is white sticky rice topped with a hamburger patty, gravy, and two eggs any style. It was good and very filling. I ordered the carrot cake French toast with a side of bacon, but didn't like it. It was dense and had a strange flavor. I sent it back, and had the Works omelette which is loaded with bacon, ham, sausage, onions, tomatoes, green bell peppers, mushrooms, and cheddar and jack cheeses. This omelette is huge and has the nerve to come with Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes and choice of toast or banana nut muffin. I chose the toast because we got the free muffin for checking in on Yelp. That muffin is also delicious. The meal was rounded out with a tasty cup of vanilla cappuccino.

1st time here and it was really good.  Although it looked like there was a lot of people waiting to be seated, the time we waited for a party of 4 was about 10 minutes. The staff was very friendly and very attentive.  The food was good and big portions.  The banana nut muffin was so good.  Got a free one just for checking in with yelp! I would really recommend this place.

This place is great!!! 

The Staff is friendly
The food portions are perfect
The prices are spot on


Must try!!!
This place has become one of our favorite breakfast stops in town. Food is on point and service is always good.

We were very impressed. A friend recommended it and the reviews were great. We weren't crazy about banana nut muffins but once we tried them, we understood: omg. So rich and moist. Our waiter was Perry and he was fantastic and accommodating to us and it being our first time. I had the Sundance omelette with artichoke and cheese. The potatoes were also amazing. We were all very pleased.
Best breakfast ever. Service is phenomenal. Thanks Liza! Regarding portions: they are huge. Waffle and pancakes take up almost full plate. Relaxed environment, come early because it gets packed.
Excellent breakfast, excellent service. Veronica was amazing! We come here all the time and are never disappointed.

My sister worked for this chain in TX- but the NV locations are completely different, with a country twist and a more innovative menu that includes Cincinnati chili, of all things?! I rolled my eyes at all the four- and five-star reviews and then I went for myself. 

CHILE RELLENO OMELET: Huge and delicious. Wish there was a bit more red chili sauce on top but it's oozing with cheese and packed with green pepper strips and flavor. Side of RANCH POTATOES is addictive,  banana but muffin was a nice sweet treat.
BF had the daily special, a BRISKET BENEDICT, which was also solid- tender meat, perfectly oozy eggs, and more of those crack-style potatoes.

I get it now, guys. They execute massive portions of tasty food with a side of genuinely friendly country-style service. This place makes me miss home.

Searched for a good breakfast place and found this spot. Read the menu and decided to try their Island Favorite - Spam, two eggs, rice & banana nut muffin, it was delicious! This is my usual plate to get when we travel to Hawaii and it did not disappoint. Service was great, our server Oscar was very helpful and friendly. This is our new breakfast spot when we come to Vegas.

It was our first time here today we lucked in big time because Andrea was our server she's amazing! The atmosphere is amazing & the food is hands down best in town! If you're in or around the Las Vegas area you must stop by this place & eat your heart out! 5 STARS!!

This place is awesome! Anyone who had bad reviews obviously didn't get the right food or listen to the recommendations from the server. The skillets are amazing! I got the works skillet with everything minus peppers add spinach. it was delicious! If you mention you are a first timmer you get a complementary banana nut muffin. Let me tell you that is one good muffin! This place is great for the price. One breakfast was 11. The food is enough to where you can share without having to get any additional items. Although the hash house is equally delicious, the price of this food compared to the hash house I would come back to egg and I before hash house. My only complaint I have is the size of the orange juice for the price. Your better off going to 711 and drinking an orange juice before you go to breakfast.
Terrible.  Stick to the excellent egg kitchens on the strip rather than venture out to this strip mall outpost.

Alyssa! OMG! You are awesome. Wish we could be regulars so you could be our regular server! Service was great. I got biscuits and gravy, awesome first bite but then a bit salty. Service made up for seasoning.

I love the Egg and I and so does everyone else I know. It is simply the best locals oriented breakfast place in Las Vegas. Please don't let the name fool you this is not the chain "The Egg and I" it is independent and shows it. The quality is top notch. The portions are huge and the service is great. My personal favorite menu item is the Cincinnati chili. The have it as a omelet, a burrito ad as the traditional 3, 4, or 5 way. The best I have found outside of Cincy. As to the breakfasts the potatoes they include with almost every item are outstanding but if you ask for fruit they give you a huge plate of fruit that most places would call a fruit salad and charge 6-7 bucks for. This place is simply the best in Vegas

Love coming here it is a must! Carole Ann was great and attentive. When something happened to our order she brought us the amazing muffins!!!! Food was great as usual. Love coming here! Potatoes are the best! I got the prime rib Benny and it was great!

I'll make this quick and simple.

Me and my girl came here for breakfast during our visit to Vegas and being the type of people that check yelp for everything, we had to come try this place for ourselves. My opinion ? Amazing! We both had the skillet and it was perfectly balanced with seasoning mixed with all the meats, eggs, and potatoes.

It's probably other places that are good out in Vegas as well but this was awesome! Thank you to our waiter Reyna for making our visit enjoyable.

Our meal at Egg & I was the saving grace of our Vegas trip. Although when we pulled up I was doubtful, I held faith in my Yelp brethren--and I'm so glad I did. We were seated immediately for a group of 5 at 1pm on a Sunday, but that was just luck as it was a full house. 

The menu is huge and a little overwhelming because there are so many options, but I finally settled on the Huevos Rancheros with carnitas, both sauces, and breakfast potatoes. I also used the Yelp check-in for a free banana nut muffin, and she kindly brought one for each of us at the table! The muffin is so moist--we're talking stick to your fingers moist. Our meal came relatively quickly and there was silence among the table as we all dug in. The huevos rancheros were probably among the best I've ever had. It came with so much carnitas and melted cheese--it was exactly what we needed after two days of Vegas, if you catch my drift. I was wary of the breakfast potatoes initally; I'm a hash browns girl precisely because breakfast potatoes are often underseasoned. Not the case here in the slightest. Each nugget was a little crispy, but soft on the inside and packed tons of flavor. The portions are huge though, so keep in mind when you're ordering! I split the huevos rancheros and it was more than enough for two!

My friend got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were also very delicious, but super thick and rich so not what my dehydrated body was in the mood for. Gimme dat salt!

Right before we left we were commenting on how good the muffins were, and she brought us two to go in a box because they were about to close up for the day and they make them fresh every morning. I will definitely keep this place in mind next time I'm looking for brunch in Vegas!

It was a 20 minute wait to be seated inside. The hostess and waitress was friendly. I asked for a low carb option and told her about my daughter's nut allergy and she was great about substituting and pointing out other options.  You    get a free banana nut muffin if you check in with Yelp. The blueberry muffin was good even though it's not freshly baked. The Pancho's scram, chicken enchilada omelet, Cincinnati Coney dog, and kid's chicken fingers were good. My husband enjoyed the side of potatoes and the fresh fruit was good too.  We enjoyed dining here and it's nice that the prices were good as well.

This place was absolutely adorable : )

The service was very quick & friendly, food was reasonably priced and delicious!

I had to bring home an Egg & I mug
Good place to have breakfast. Good staff . Food was okay. Didn't like the seasoned potatoes. Homemade corn beef hash was okay.

The service is very friendly, the menu is huge, and the food is massive, but that's kind of it. We ordered a variety of food (mashed potato stuffed omelette, chili over hash, and french toast), and it was all huge and heavy. The banana muffin that comes with everything was delicious but very sweet and oily. It's a lot like Cheesecake Factory meets Vegas breakfast dinner. I would recommend "eat." far more for a place with stunningly delicious food.

This used to be our go-to place for breakfast when we hit Las Vegas.  For some reason, we started eating more on the strip.  But this morning we happen to be passing and decided to renew acquaintances.  Why did we ever stop going there for breakfast?  All menu items are well prepared.  The omelettes are huge.  My wife orders the toast and I the muffin, then we share.  Good coffee and plenty of it.  

You always leave with the warm glow of a great breakfast and the entire bill is less than a normal tip  for a Strip breakfast.

I only gave it three stars because we came in with a large party and they did not accommodate us well. A fourth of us got our meal then the other fourth and so on until we all got out meals. They came about 15 minutes apart. Our kids were with us and they were not happy to wait so long and get the food. They need to work on their timing better but the food was good.
Great place to have breakfast.  Fast and friendly service.  Arlene was very courteous and attentive. Hefty servings at a reasonable price.

They have everything you could possibly want for breakfast.  4 of came here, each of us ordered something different and all enjoyed it.  Pancakes, skillets, steaks and chicken fried steak where all winners with us. Those ranch potatoes are perfect with eggs.  This place definitely has breakfast right with something for everyone.  Definitely worth leaving your hotel and driving a short distance from the strip.

I come to this place every time I come to Vegas, no matter whom I'm with. They definitely have the traditional breakfast diner feel and the newspaper menus add to that feel. The waiters and waitresses are always friendly and conversationalists. The food is flavorful and you get a lot of it. I normally get the classic eggs (with cheddar jack cheese), bacon (it's crispy!), their country potatoes, and 9 grain toast. If I don't order that then I order their parfait. I know, parfait sounds lame but their parfait comes in a big old school milkshake glass with yogurt, granola, and a mix of fresh fruits. I actually couldn't even finish it last time. 

This place is packed on the weekends and they do not take reservations. 

They always have a deal a Groupon, it's worth it!

we decided to have a fantastic breakfast\/brunch while on vacay in Vegas and we thought we give egg and I a shot.  Oh man, I knew I was in for a special treat because clearly this is popular breakfast spot in vegas with all the wonderful reviews here on yelp and zagat reviews.

we both went with the egg white western omelette's, ham, green peppers, onions and mushrooms. we both were given a complimentary banana nut muffin since it was our first visit..and the husband loved it and i thought it was OK.  the breakfast arrived and everything tasted wonderful and was prepared the way we requested (we asked our omelette's to be cooked with pam spray vs butter-and they were happy to oblige). service was great and fast.  I would definitely return to try some other breakfast items.

Love the skillets and the Loco Moco.  The muffins are freakin' amazing!!  The breakfast potatoes are good too.  Long wait on a Saturday morning, about an hour.  This place is worth it to drive off the strip for brunch.  Friendly service.  Overall, i definitely recommend this place.

Love the banana muffin and the potatoes dusted with their signature salt.  Had the eggs Benedict  good hollandaise sauces. Great place with huge portions and amazing happy wait staff. Look forward to coming here each time we are in Vegas.

4 stars for the food and 5 stars for Karla our server.  She is awesome, she hustles and makes sure we have everything we need. We had the Mexican Omelet and French toast with a side of bacon. When you check in on yelp you also get a free Banana Nut Muffin.  Food had a lot of flavor and came hot and fast.  Definitely a place to come back to.

We came here for breakfast and for some reason the tuna melt looked good to me for breakfast,  anyway the tuna melt on rye with lettuce and tomato was awesome, the tuna had no pickle relish in it , a plus for me  . The thing that put it over the top was the bread , it looked and tasted like they grilled the cheese on the outside of the bread, it was crispy, like when u make a grilled cheese sandwich  and some of the cheese melts and gets cooked  in the pan and u peel that cheesy goodness and pop it in your mouth , yum.
         I have to go back and find out for sure, the waitress was busy, so I did not get the chance to ask about the bread.
         The fries were very good , shoe strings sprinkled with the the same seasoning they put on there breakfast potato's , it tastes like BBQ seasoning to me. I would not hesitate to have this meal again for breakfast and...... call me crazy for lunch? ;)

Food was delicious.  Service was great.  The best waitress- Liza...  
one of the best places for breakfast.  They open till 3pm .  Definitely will be back ...
This place only gets 4 stars because it's a little too small for being so good! They need to expand. However, we had fast service, great food, & @ a great price! Will definitely return!

BEST BREAKFAST EVER.

So good the wife and I went two days in a row during a recent visit to Vegas. 

4 Star Breakdown from two days:

WAIT TIME: 4*
Day 1 : Long ( We were told 15min , and it ended up being over 30min wait.) 
Day 2 : Quick ( seated in about 5- 10 min. )


Food: AMAZING!!!! 5*


Service: 4* ( They have clever yellow \/ black eggs as signs that you need help)

Day 1 : Had a server by the name of Amanda, who ROCKED!!! She was the perfect      host, and made the experience great. (she gets 5 *+ )

Day 2: Never got the servers name( skinny preggo chick), she never came buy often, and when she did, she would completely forget about stuff we asked for. The guy next to us sat there for a good 20min before she took his drink order, and even longer to get him his meal. I had asked for a refill of water, and she seemed to bring water to everyone around us, except for me. The she abruptly brought us our bill that we had not asked for , while we were still eating, and didn't even ask if we wanted anything else. Oh yeah I still hadn't gotten my water, so I asked her again and finally as we were getting up to leave, she brought water. 



Overall, This is a MUST when I'm in Vegas.

Super tasty breakfast spot just off the strip. Their menu is like a newspaper and is a couple pages long so there is something for everyone! Our server, Karla was very friendly and the service is fast!

Everything we ordered was delicious - bacon & avocado omelet and carrot cake toast for breakfast,  chicken skillet meal and gumbalaya for a take out. And the banana nut muffin was delicious! Our server Karla was so helpful and pleasant. She hooked us up with an extra muffin for our hikes that we were doing later. And so thoughtful about packing our to go meals. We'll definitely come back for their delicious food and excellent service by Karla!

I saw this place on Yelp and while it is a fair distance from the strip in a Lyft, we figured that the good reviews might make it worth it (also likely less pricy than brunch on the strip)

The wait was only about 10 mins. They do pride themselves on service and our waitress was a doll. 

You get a free banana muffin with Yelp Check in. But the portions are so huge we didn't really need it - INSIDER TIP - after we were all done, the waitress told us you could get Half orders of almost anything. (wish we had known)

I had the corned beef hash, which was okay. My man had the chili relleno omelet (he loved it) and my friend had the huevos with carnitas, (and green sauce) - IT WAS OUTSTANDING)

This place is a winner on all accounts.  The food at the Egg & I tastes great.  The service is spectacular, the people working there really make you feel at home.  Both the hostess and waitress were very friendly and fun to talk to.  

As the name would imply there is a pretty good variety of egg dishes.  You get to choose from a good omelet selection, to huevos rancheros.  If you aren't in the mood for eggs they also have the usual sandwiches and burgers.

Get a side of the banana nut muffin its really good.

Vegetarian Rating: 4\/5 lots of good veggie options, they even had a vegetarian version of Eggs Benedict.

I ordered the Turkey Cheese, Avocado, Crepe with a banana muffin and a coffee. The service was quick, loud and friendly. A home town feel for breakfast to get away from the hustle and bustle of the Strip. The menu was on a newspaper style paper which was neat. 

First the Banana Muffin came out and was moist and great!. I would want that muffin at the casino buffets. Then the food came out and it was huge. The potatoes were seasoned with some sort of lawry's seasoning flavor, pretty good, didn't need much ketchup, i didn't use any. The crepe was huge, it too up half teh dish, but was more like an omlet than a crepe. Still tasty and filling. 

I like breakfast and I usually get a chicken fried steak for breakfast, but that crepe was definitely a head turner walking in to our seats... I'm sold on Eggs and I.

This my go to spot when I want a good breakfast when I'm in LV. Not too pricey and always hits the spot exactly (never too full after leaving). Wish more places used the markers on the table to call attention, it's much better than hunting down your wait staffer.

Food is phenomenal. Had the California Crepe and the Chile Relleno omelette. Both were great. More importantly, our waiter Oscar was one of the greatest waiters I've ever encountered. Made my breakfast 10x better chatting with him. Highly recommend.
Nice place to eat. HUGE brunch menu to choose from. Eggs all different ways and great pancake\/waffle\/crepe options as well. Service was good and food was good.

This place reminds me of Hash house a go go, but a smaller size. The place is really pack when we went, and it seems to be pack most of the time. I got the Flapper and my friend got one of the omelet with spinach, chicken, feta cheese, tomato, and bacon. Both were alright, except I think the omelet was a bit salty probably from the feta cheese. It's a good breakfast place I think. Their banana nut miffin is pretty good. I think it's the best banana nut muffin I ever had because it's sweet - maybe honey and brown sugar and soft and moist and warm when we got it, but also a bit oily. Taste like cake.
Had the stuffed French Toast. A new twist to French toast. Absolutely delicious . Loved the seasoned country potatoes. I would definitely come back and recommend this place.
We ate here on Tues. morning 3\/28\/17. Our server was Tamara and she was awesome only to be complemented with the amazing food.

Nummy Nummy i like some eggies in my tummy.  Great food and definite stop off anytime you are in Vegas.  Place gets packed with locals, but when you walk in you become a local.  Honestly.  We were sitting there and some people walked up and asked what they should get.  I said eggs.

Try the crepes, they are stuffed with eggs and whole bunch of other stuff if you like.  I think they should rename the place hangover hamlet though :)

PHENOMENAL BREAKFAST. And we got the gumbolaya which was pretty spot on and even had two people ask what it was because it looked so good. Make sure to check in for their free muffin, it's so tasty and moist I get one to go too. Don't go if you need to eat immediately as there is always at least a 1\/2 hour wait. It is worth it though!

Good food, but what really made this experience great was the service. I recommend grabbing a skillet or the bacon avocado omelette. Strawberries and cream french toast was good too! The winner, however, was the free banana nut muffin you get when you check in.

Really great eggs! Such variety. Muffins galore. Tabatha excellent server! Great Vegas trip experience. Come here for good breakfast and unlimited coffee refills! Bandido muy delicioso. Would eat again after long drive to Nevada!
So far, STILL my favorite breakfast place! I usually got a pesto scramble, but I no longer see it on the menu!? Boohoo.
Oscar was amazing, food was amazing, nothing but good things to say about this place...will come back Everytime we visit and share with everyone we can!!!

Amazing breakfast off the strip! Such nice waitresses, best breakfast potatoes I've had. I had the french toast sandwhich and it was to DIE for! but I recommend sharing since they are HUGE. 

Must go
Food was great. Best place for breakfast I've been to in Vegas. Large selection. Probably not a good place on the weekends as we waited 20 minutes on a Monday morning for a table for two.
Not bad. Crepes were more like an omelet than a crepe. I enjoyed the banana nut muffin.

Fast service and good food. Their country  potatoes are a little too salty but are tasty with some ketchup. I had the California crepe and it was so good. My son had the chicken strips and fries. He said the fries were too salty to eat so he didn't eat them. I'm giving them a 4 due to the salty items.

This place is AMAZING!!!!!! Our server, Liza, was so sweet and took such great care of our table of 5!!!! Everyone ordered something different and were in absolute love with what they got. I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet which was heaven in my mouth, and so filling I could only eat half! Their banana nut muffins surely live up to the hype!! I want to eat here every morning we're in Vegas. Check it out, you won't be disappointed!
Yum! Great place to get some great food! Big portions to fill your belly, good prices, and fast service! Carole Ann was a sweet and efficient waitress.. Thanks!

Great breakfast as long as you stick with eggs. Tried the chicken burrito which was served cold and tasteless. While paying at the register, the cashier asked "how was everything ?" My husband replied " the burrito was not good, but I guess it was my fault ordering a burrito". The cashier replied "yes - that was your bad". Glad to know that the customer is always right !  Customer service FAIL.
Great breakfast and a good sized portion. Quick and friendly service. Food was great. The banana nut muffin is a must. It's also free when you check in through yelp!!

Great food great service! Our server Alyssa went out of her way to make our visit awesome! Great place to eat off the hustle n bustle of the strip with good prices for quantity. Will definitely be back to visit Alyssa!

Not my first time to this Las Vegas staple.  Service was amazing, and Tabatha was great!  She was super attentive and was wonderful at helping us navigate their large menu.  The food was excellent, I had their traditional Benedict. Poached eggs we're done wonderfully and the sauce is great.  The portions are huge and their French toast is no exception. I think it's probably a service size for at least two people.  Bottom line, check this place out. It's off the strip and two peoples breakfast with a pitcher of orange juice was under $30. How can you lose?! One of the best bets to make in Vegas by far!

Great! Cream cheese French toast is delicious (maybe even too sweet!!!) the bandito scramble was spicy with a great salsa. Probably can't go wrong here.

Our server Karla was fantastic!
Best breakfast in Las Vegas.  Alexa was a very friendly server.  Great coffee and delicious potatoes. You sure you try the banana nut muffin it's warmed up perfectly

My family loves The Egg and I!  We visit Vegas several times a year and have breakfast there at least once per trip.  The service is friendly, efficient, and fast.  The food is delicious.  We highly recommend the Fiesta Skillet (add chorizo) and the warm Banana Nut Muffin with some butter on it is to die for.  It's a small place, expect a wait, especially on weekends.

First off our server Paula was great. Very friendly and brought us extra banana nut muffins because it was our first time here.  The three breakfast items we loved were the Sunrise mountain, stuffed french toast, and Cabo breakfast burrito. All hits.

We are visiting the area and came across this place on Yelp. This is a great breakfast place. I had the Jose's Breakfast Burrito. It was good, great chorizo. My hubby had bacon & eggs. They have great customer service. Everyone was very helpful. Our waitress gave us a banana nut muffin to try, that was sooo delicious! OMG to die for. It was hot, not too sweet and went perfect with my coffee. We are hoping to make a stop tomorrow before we drive back home!
Went to breakfast twice here and it was tasty! Service was super friendly and awesome.
Loved the food and the service! Our server Reina was better then exceptional, checked on us every time she passed by. We will be back soon.
The Diablo potatoes are great, especially crispy. Toast is nice and chewy. Good choices
I like this place. It's got a cute atmosphere and friendly service but it also gets busy and crowded.

This was our first time eating here. We found this gem using Yelp and were not disappointed. Our server Carole Ann was awesome. She was very friendly and professional. The food was delicious and the banana nut muffin was even better! 

We will be back.

Don't even debate just go! Great breakfast the skillets are one better than the next and their fresh banana muffins are so soft and fluffy! It is a great place just to get slightly away from the strip and see what else Las Vegas has to offer. Sure you can go to a buffet their is dozens but the Egg and I is a sweet little shop with great food. We go every time we visit Vegas!

Very friendly and attentive wait staff! Got the chile relleno omelette which was ok. Generous portions.  I wasn't crazy about their potato rub\/spice.... Too salty.  Definitely get the banana muffin. It doesn't look great, but it's awesome!

great breakfast joint off sahara btwn arville and Decatur

think this was the original, they have a number of them in vegas now

buddy had the chicken enchilada omelette, which he said was pretty good
for some reason though, their hash browns are now patties, like you get at mcdonalds....no biggie, still looked good

I had the loco moco, which was good, not anything to write home about though
it was basic hamburger patty over rice with brown gravy and 2 sunny side up eggs on top....funny the waiter asked how I would like the eggs prepared, didn't know there was a choice with loco moco!  in retrospect, probably should have gone with standard breakfast fare or my go to key largo crepe
sometimes you shouldn't try new things
it wasn't bad, I just think their normal breakfast items are a lot better

noticed they have added quite a few southern\/Spanish dishes, maybe to cater to changing tastes? I will have to try next time...I know, stick with what you like, but have to let you guys know right?

Food is excellent! We were looking for a good place to eat and less expensive than the hotels. Eggs & I was perfect. Our server was Amanda and she was super nice and friendly. Great experience. We'll be back on our next trip to Vegas.

This was probably the best spot we hit on a recent trip to vegas.  It's always a good sign when a place is packed midweek. 
We were sat immediately and there was no wait to receive drinks and menus. 
Our waitress was Chance and quite honestly one of the best servers I've had in a long time. She knew her menu and was open to giving suggestions. She was also VERY attentive and upbeat in general. during a pretty good breakfast rush, mind you!
Firstly, as I said before, it's busy. But you never have to flag down a waitress or ask when your order is coming. There's a little sign on the table which lets you flip between a happy egg and a frowny egg. If the frowny egg is showing, the waitress\/waiter is supposed to help you right away. I never had to use this sign because the service was so prompt. 
First thing I loved was the bottomless cup of coffee. You're given a full thermos pitcher of coffee all for your table and there's plenty of sugar (or substitutes) and cream at hand. 
I usually ask for a recommendation on what to order when traveling and Chance was eager to help. She told me about the Chile Relleno Benedict and said that it's not normally on the menu (special days only) but that it really was a must try. Honestly, I'm not huge on chile relleno but hey she seemed enthusiastic and I went ahead and ordered it. 
It was amazing. And it SHOULD be an everyday menu item. I'll go into both dishes and what was so awesome about them below. 
Chile Relleno Benedict:
Wow. The dish was amazing. Benedicts make just about anything better but this was no joke. REALLY well thought out and balanced. First thing I noticed was that the eggs were PERFECTLY poached. The whites were soft but not slimey or runny. There was zero cooked yoke. It was warm and ran smooth just the way god intended. 
I don't know what was breaded in the dish but it was either the Chile itself or the thinly sliced (and tender as all hell) chicken breast. The breading was really what made the dish I think. It added just enough saltiness that I didn't need to add salt or pepper to my breakfast. I always add salt and pepper (unless I get chicken fried steak) and that was a pleasant surprise. The chile and the chicken were topped off with the poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. There were home fries on the side which also needed no seasoning beside what was already there but honestly I would have been ok just eating the chile relleno benedict. It was really that good. 
My GF ordered the veggie pesto sandwich with Cajun fries. I didn't try the sandwich itself but she said the bread was very tender and the pesto was really tasty. I DID sneak a few fries however and loved them. Thinly cut shoestring style potatoes covered in seasoning. Another instance where salt was not necessary. Really they would have been fine without ketchup. 
I fully intend on visiting this place every time I head to Las Vegas and can't say enough good things about it. Thank you Chance for the awesome recommendation and thank you Egg & I for turning out exceptional food and service at a great price!
Great breakfast in Vegas, tons of egg choices. We have made this a regular spot each time we visit

always a good breakfast place and good service. always with a smile from the hostesses to the server. 

I recommend this to all locals and tourist.

Emily, our server was excellent from start to finish. Offering drinks as soon as we walked in. Took our order promptly once we were ready and checked on us a fair amount of time to make sure everything was good. On top of that, her personality and kindness was a plus. Thanks Emily for the service and thank you Eggs & I for the good breakfast.
The Eggs Benedict were amazing!!!!  In fact all the  food was incredible. Our server Amanda was awesome.  Can't wait to come back!!!!

Amazing!!!!! Great service, delicious food. If you are in the area you must try this place out. Skillets, omelette are very good. Fresh baked muffins are delish. We found this place last year and heading out to Vegas this weekend, for sure we will be stoping by.
Skillet potatoes are amazing.  Always quick and good service. French toast and pancakes were much better than the waffle

This place was great! It is not located in a hotel so I didn't have to walk through a maze to get there.  A little bit off the strip but that's what I liked about it.  There was a ten minute wait but that's how I knew it was going to be good, and it was completely worth it.  I had a skilled and banana nut muffin.  My girlfriend had their eggs "benny".  All was exceptional.  Wait staff was great.

Delicious  food. Excellent service. Affordable price. U must try the banana muffins. They are very moist and hot bake from the oven. Talking about it makes me want more. I'll definitely come back when I'm in Vegas.

This place could get really crowded!

Why only 3 Stars?
1st star - originality of the place: the seating arrangement is really unique. the center dinning area is high up and the side dinning area is ground level. 
2st star - menu has a ton of choices! a lot of different ways to serve egg for breakfast and more: burgers, salad, sandwiches, and steaks. 
3rd star - service is good even though they could get so busy each server was alert and ready to serve customers who need help. Also, they have this EGG SIGN on each table where you put the WEIRD EGG FACE if you need service lol 

Food was okay, but I totally blamed my self for ordering my egg wrong. Apparently, I could order my egg "scrambled easy" so it won't be so dry. Oh well, there is always next time. Definitely will come back to try more of their stuff and of course! update my review for my fellow yelpers.

While on vacation in August 2015, we visited the Egg and I based on Yelp reviews.  So glad we came here!  The menu was extensive with so many choices, all sounding so delish. I had a skillet type breakfast with hash brown type potatoes and pancakes.  Pancakes were big and fluffy, skillet was huge and delicious.  Come here with a big appetite!  You'll be glad you did!

First time visiting the Egg and I, and I have no complaints or regrets!  The entire staff is polite and very inviting.  Special shout out to our server Brady,  he was fabulous!  And the food was delicious!  Definitely recommend visiting this establishment if you are visiting the area!
The food is delicious and the customer service is great. I feel like I'm down south.

Eggzzzzzz lawd have mercy. I've been wanting to try this place for the longest and finally found myself stopping by for some takeout after a late night. 

Tried the strawberry cream cheese French toast and it was too bomb. To be honest the strawberry cream cheese tasted like it came out of the Philadelphia container but no big. I also could have done without the strawberry jam (or preserves?) smothered on top. Came with a generous portion of potatoes which were also soo so good!

Another breakfast staple I usually order anywhere is the corned beef hash meal. Egg & I didn't disappoint! Corned beef was super num and came with a side of eggs and potatoes. 

Literally drooling........... Coming back forever and ever. Long wait always so order to go and eat in the room. ;)

PPS: check in via Yelp and get a free banana nut muffin SO GOOEY AND GOOD.
This place is delicious! Finally decided to stop by after passing by it. I tried the stuffed French toast!!!! The Diablo potatoes with syrup on top are awesome as well!

Stopped here on our way out of Vegas. We were looking for a tasty breakfast spot and we definitely found it. The portions were generous, the coffee was just right, and the flavors were spot on (with the exception of the potatoes- they were great at first but as the meal went on the saltiness took over. I will say our server was exceptional, she was attentive without being pushy and was genuinely pleasant. I would recommend this place for a good homey meal away from the strip.

Such a hot spot. This little dive lives up to its reputation. Best omelette I have ever had. The texture of my omelette was perfection. Being on a low carb diet, I opted out of the banana muffin and potatoes, but they both looked delicious. The wait for brunch was about 20 minutes for peak Saturday time, but so worth it. Our server, Liza was very personable and prompt with service. We got our meals hot, fresh and quick with the epitomy of service with a smile. Well off the strip so our meal for four of us was $55, which was what my husband I spent yesterday,  splitting a breakfast omelette yesterday at a breakfast spot on the strip.
This place is ALWAYS busy so be prepared for a wait, but it's incredibly worth it. Huge portions and great prices!

I just had to add in a 5 star review for this place.  AMAZING food here!  Waaay to much on the plate to eat at once, but wow, your going to get some fresh well made yummy food here.
A+

There is a reason why this place has so many good ratings.  The Pork Carnitas Crepe is like nothing you have ever had!!!  Make sure you drown it in the Habla Diablo Verde Salsa, enough said!!! You have to try this taste of heaven.  Atmosphere is old school cafe, so don't expect ambiance, that is not why you go here. But really come for the Carnitas Crepe and you won't be disappointed. If you are lucky enough to have Karla as your server say hello, sweet lady!!

This was the best breakfast food I've ever had before. I ordered the biscuits and gravy and the taste was phenomenal.  They gave me more potatoes than I needed (which is good). THEY TASTED SO GOOD. My whole family had clear plates. Also the service was excellent! Happy egg\/Sad egg was a brilliant idea. Great restaurant.

My boyfriend was right, this place was egg-cellent! I really enjoyed my breakfast at the Egg & I. Perhaps because all over the restaurant, there were little cute drawings of eggs being all happy and that the menu was made of newspaper material with happy eggs all over it  :D.

I ordered two pancakes, scrambled eggs and bacon. The pancakes were really nice and fluffy, the eggs were light and fluffy too and the bacon...I gave to my boyfriend haha!

Good price, good food, fast service and friendly staff.

Great food but best of all is Server Tabatha!
Fantastic happy friendly service and spit on recommendations!

Whether you go to Egg Works or come to Egg & I you'll probably have to wait a bit if it's a prime breakfast hour. 

There are so many great sounding items on the menu deciding what to get can be difficult, but the good news is, you really can't go wrong with anything you choose. The wait staff is always really nice and accomodating. I almost always order the same thing the bacon, cheddar and avocado omlette with egg whites and sour cream.

I was introduced to these breakfast spots my aunt who lived in Vegas for over 20 years and for the most part the customers are all locals so if you're in town and wanna get away from the tourists, check out these breakfast spots.

I love the Sad Egg and Happy Egg face dÃ©cor at the tables for service needs. When you turned the Happy Egg over to the Sad Egg a waitress comes over to the table in seconds. They work as a team at Eggs & I which I appreciate being in the service industry.

The food is wonderful. Whenever I visit Vegas we always stop here for breakfast on the way in or on the way out. I have never ordered anything I didn't like. The Eggs Benedict is my favorite followed by the chili omelet. Don't forget about the breakfast potato's, the best I have ever had.

I love how their menus are printed like a newspaper and I love that the service is always excellent. We will be back next month when we visit Vegas in April!

Got here at about 11:30am on a Sunday. There was a lot of people waiting but the wait was probably less than 10 mins. Love the fact that they use an app system and you get a text of your wait time and your table is ready.

Service was GREAT!! 

This time around my food was a bit on the salty side but still great!  As always, The banana nut muffin is a must have. OJ had a bit too much pulp as my straw had a tough time sucking it up. Plus it was not cold. Also I wish they served a single stack pancake that was not $5 but then again it was in the shape of a micky mouse and I'm pretty sure it was off the children's menu

Quick tip! Save $5 when you buy 2 entrees if you go get the VEGAS coupon book at miracle mile. I'm not sure if it's at the  other shops but it's free and will save you some $$$

I love the Egg and I. This is my families favorite breakfast spot. I love the Chile Rellenos Omelette and  my husband always orders the Loco Moco. The ranch potatos are so delicious. We've had the skillets with eggs and meat. Pretty much anything you order from here is going to taste good. 

Our server Breeanndra was very nice. She was fast and friendly. Anytime we needed something she was right there ready to help. I love this place it gets PACKED on the weekends in the morning rush so make sure to bring a book or magazine while you wait. Its worth it!
A great place to get a hearty recovery breakfast.  Friendly staff. Flipping the egg at the end of the table for service is great, no  need to flag down your server.

Classic Benny was great. our server Paula was fantastic! This was our first time there. But we did come back for breakfast two days later. Great food, great service. Loved the patio. Recommend for breakfast anytime. Thanks for making our time in Vegas a great one

I really love breakfast\/ brunch places! I like the seasoning on the potatoes and fries!
Sometimes it is nice to eat at a place that is off the strip

Wow their banna bread is perfectly made. 1st time visitors get it for free. This is a great place to have breakfast or a brunch. Get their early or you will wait. Get off the strip and get real home cooking 10 minutes away.
Hot chocolate was wayy to sweet. Free muffin on check in and it was delicious! Had the waffles and eggs, kinda plain style though. Price wasnt all that bad. The muffin was nice and hot too.
Huge variety and options. No complaints from our table - everything was delicious and our server Karla was super helpful and friendly. The banana nut muffins are indeed to die for.
Friendly staff. Great service. Super delicious banana nut french toast. Yummy seasoned potatoes. Great value for the portion. I will definitely eat here again when I come back to Vegas.
Best breakfast place in Las Vegas. I ordered the works skillet which was really good & the banana muffin is a must.

Egg & I, Good food and great service!  I can't ask for more.  I'm not sure if this is a mom & pop store, but it definitely felt like one.  When my party and I got there at 1pm on a Saturday, we didn't have much of a wait.  The portions were big enough to share.  Ambiance is diner style, but neater.  I love the fact that they have a yellow & black egg attention sign on each table so you won't need to wave down a waitress.  I left very satisfied and I intend on going back whenever I am in town again.
Awesome food. Great potatoes and banana muffins. They are owned by egg works. Different name but same quality of food.

Off the strip breakfast diner. We waited forever!!! for a group of 10..so I guess I should give them some grace...but still... 
Some of the food was good, some of it was OK. I had a french toast something that was drenched in sauce and I was not happy b\/c it was too sweet. I've had better breakfast at other places. They did get listed for top burger tho interesting enough. I would not go back for the mere wait, drive, and quality of food. Servers were nice tho. :)
Fast, friendly, and fresh... All 3 qualities I like in my food establishments. There's a lot of items in the menu for breakfast, lunch, & dinner.

Summary: Every time, and I do mean EVERY TIME I'm in Vegas, I HAVE to stop by Egg & I for breakfast. I mean, I was offered free breakfast at Wicked on my last day there and yet I decline because I MUST go here. The wait at time is long especially on the weekend but if you are willing to be seated in the patio, the wait time is cut in half. I couldn't have ask for a better service from all their staff.

Food: Waffle, Scramble Eggs, Omelets, Work Potato, etc etc etc
You just can't go wrong with whatever you pick. Well, you might but I haven't. No matter what you order, make sure you try their work potato, it's like country potato but crunchier with more flavor. 

Overall: Hate their parking lot, at times we have to park at the end of the plaza and walk over but it is so worth it.

I'm guessing a little wait time is typical here, because the food here is really good.  Its worth the short wait.  Moderately priced and off the strip a few miles.  I had the Rellanos omelet and it was really good.  Great Service.

Very good breakfast food. Waitress was very friendly and the food came out quick and hot. I had the bacon and avocado omelette which was great but the best part was that banana nut muffin to go which I ate later in the day and was still melt in your mouth good!

First time eating here.  4 of us had 4 different items based off of our server, Patrick's,  recommendation.  Every item was unbelievable!  Patrick was very helpful ,courteous, and attentive to our needs.  Great experience and wonderful service!  We will be back.

Service is always awesome!! Generous portions and down home feel.  Bomb greasy hangover food thats cheap.  They are not skimpy with the CHEESE or the AVOCADO which I love... And i like their cheesy nicknames.  I always try to go when I'm in da big LV.  Be careful if you are staying on the strip and catching a cab there.  They will take some EXTRA long roads.  Its actually easy to take the bus there if you are riding the deuce its free to get on bus.

I love the Egg & I, we are from Denver and have been to numerous Egg & I's. Of all the ones we have been to, this one had the best customer service by far! Unfortunately my meal got messed up (no big deal, it happens) but without question they remade my meal, brought the manager over and took my meal off of the bill. Our waitress was named Tamara, and without me asking or complaining she gave me the best customer service I could ask for. The staff and food were awesome but Tamara made my visit extra worthwhile. Highly recommended place, they really take care of their guests here!

Ive had this place several times, take out and dine in!! My best experiences are truly dine in! Mashed potato & cinni chilli omlette to die for!!! I love this location best servers have to be alyssa and bree!! Dont mind waiting as the food and service always wows me!

Every trip to Vegas, it is a MUST for us to stop here and eat! This place is AMAZING, everything on the menu is worth trying.... 
Now, the service.... if I could offer Carol Anne 20 stars, I WOULD! She is super sweet, always with a smile. We are a large family....11 of us!!! Some waiters\/waitresses don't like or fear a large crowd...but she took us all with the biggest smile ever!!!!

it's service like that, that makes this delicious experience....PERFECT!!!

Such a well crafted chicken country steak, amazeballz. Ashley was key to the deliciousness, loved everything she served, including splitting my bread order in 2. Got the sour dough and rye. Non nom nom

I went here one morning with a girlfriend while I was visiting. The place was crowded. But we were seated in less than 30 minutes, potatoes are amazing. Everything else that I had was good also but those potatoes really stood out lol

Get the heck out of the strip and take the 7 miles drive to this EGG & I all American breakfast joint. Open for breakfast and lunch only 6 AM to 3 PM. They located on Sahara and Arville. Plenty of parking spaces. 

When we arrived on Friday around 11 AM there was no wait and were seated immediately. 

SERVICE:

It was prompt, friendly and out waitress was great. Coffee was brought to us right away after we asked for it. One pot of coffee.

THE FOOD:

We tried the the ham and cheese Omelet. Bacon, mushroom, sausage Omelet, Eggs Benedict and side order of corned beef hash. Omelet's come with your choice of bread or muffin. All orders came with their delicious cut potatoes. Food was tasty and flavorful. Omelet's were moist and the Benedict was wonderful with enough tangy  hollandise sauce. The corned beef hash was delicious as well. 


This is really a nice spot for breakfast or lunch and it seems like the locals favorite spot.  Give yourself a break away form the casinos and gambling joints and try this place.

Holy cow I love this place. Amazing food, everything was so fresh and delicious and flavorful. The service is also very friendly and prompt.
