It's really hard to find a place with great food, great service and great prices. We were on vacation in Las Vegas and ate here 2 days in a row. I have never eaten at the same restaurant two days in a row. I only wish this restaurant we're closer to my house as I would be eating here every week. 
I am on a low-carb low-sugar diet. But I broke my diet to have their maple bacon French toast, twice!! It is so delicious it is better than a desert. We also ordered the chicken fried steak and chorizo scramble. Everything was delicious. We ordered their potatoes one morning and their fresh fruit the other. Their fresh fruit is wonderfully cut up slices of watermelon and pineapple and other melons. Not the yucky, cheap, cut up fruit that's been sitting there for days.
Their breakfast potatoes are all so delicious. The best way we can describe them is they are  very seasoned bite-size french fries. sooooo goood!
I guess it's a blessing in disguise The Egg & I is located in Las Vegas and we live in San Diego. I would definitely be gaining weight if this place were closer. Can't wait to go back to eat here. It's a couple miles from the strip that you will definitely enjoy your meal and save money.

This is a nice place to take the family to eat the food is nothing special there price range is alright but they seem to always have so many people there and there staff cant handle it they might forget some stuff.

Was in Vegas for a little vaca and we wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle on the strip and I wasn't down for another buffet or spending $16 on breakfast at the hotel we were staying at.  

So I trusted fellow yelpers and hopped over here.  It was approaching noon, but I still had my heart set on breakfast.  

We were seated quickly.  The service was ok. I don't know in what order the food went in or what, but this is what I noticed. 

There were 2 tables in front of my view.  One table got seated 5 minutes after us and the other table seemed like they were wating forever for their food.  I'm assuming the manager, went up to the table and apologized for their food not getting there yet.  I then noticed the table who sat down 5 mintues AFTER us got served their food first.  I looked at the hubby and said, "how did that happen?" AND they were served way BEFORE the table that was waiting.  So something happened to communication from the servers and the kitchen.   

I got the chicken fried steak.  When we got our food I was lovin' the potatoes!!  My scramble eggs were over cooked and hard - really no flavor.  My chicken fried steak was good, but the put sooo much gravy, I had to take half of it off.   

Overall, the place is a good spot for breakfast in Vegas.  I wish I could get more of those damyn potatoes!! :)

I came across this place when the bf wanted to find a "local place" for a recent Vegas trip, and I must say it is definitely worth the trip away from the strip!

From the outside, the place looks very unassuming. Not even busy. But right when we opened the door, crowds poured out, and we had to wait nearly 20 minutes for a table for two. The wall decor by the waiting place was cute. There were cartoons as well as sayings about eggs. Finally, we were led to our table by a super friendly and bubbly waitress.

The menu is printed like a newspaper - cool!! I've never seen that before!! (Yes I took a picture with it.) The selection is pretty extensive considering that every single item on the menu are made with eggs (like skillet items, omelettes, etc), so it took us a while to decide. I forget what we ended up getting - it was a while ago, pardon me - but I remember it being soooo good! They also customize your order so that you can have whole eggs vs egg substitutes vs egg whites, etc... Definitely get the fresh banana nut bread!! We almost got a loaf to take home back to LA even though we weren't leaving for LA yet.

The service was superb. Our waitress kept coming by to check up on us. When the busboy accidentally tossed our leftovers, the waitress felt so bad that she went back to the kitchen and got us some other foods to take with us. This was one place where I seriously went in not expecting much and left completely satisfied with the full intention of coming back next time I am in Vegas.

Banana Nut Muffin. Nomnom-erific

My husband likes to eat off of the Strip bc he thinks we can find better eats for the price.  He found this on Yelp (of course) and it's a hearty classic American breakfast diner.  They found seating for us right away and with a baby in a stroller even the Manager was involved in making sure our seating was to our liking.  The Waitress was kind and knowledgable.  I asked for Chocolate Milk w\/ 1\/2 regular Milk and she brought my drink made exactly as I ordered and wanted.  

We went with both sets of parents and everyone was pretty satisfied.  Don't know what we ordered.  Either way the food was good and we left fully and happy.  :)  Would probably go here again.

This place is great.  Yep, line out the door on Sunday morning but well worth the fairly short wait.  

Service was fantastic.  The employees all seem to be very happy, very busy, and very willing to help.

Prices are very reasonable. 

Most importantly, the food is very good with very generous portions.

Oh, and I almost forgot!  Banana Nut Muffins!!!
Egg & I is officially my favorite breakfast restaurant.  Great food, huge menu and excellent service.  Worth the drive from the Strip.

Stopped in and had breakfast today, I ordered an all meat omelette,  it was good the potatoes were salty didn't really care for them, when looking around the room other people where not eating the potatoes, I wish they had hashbrowns. Service was excellent the food was just OK

My family and I love this place and the waffles are really good but one day I had the burger there and it was gross the bread was soggy and I will never eat the burgers ever. The service was great and the people there are nice.
The banana nut muffin was so good:) Our server Chance was so awesome..great, positive vibe and super sweet:)

Egg and I, is one of our favorite places for breakfast. My wife had The California scramble *****(Good portion size) I had Grandmas biscuit and gravy ****. Which is basically the Country Benny ***** with the eggs on the side and potatoes. Service ****

Me and my Woman were by the neighborhood wanted to try it , best breakfast ever omelettes here are amazing! The server she was really amazing her name was Donna, she's just amazing best experience ever
Good food for a good price! This would be 4 stars if we hadn't waited 10 min before even getting our drink order in.

This is a great breakfast and brunch place. Always busy and packed especially during weekends. 

I tried their Eggs Benedict Florentine and it was delicious and a hefty portion. It came with potatoes and side of fruits. My friend had steak and eggs and she liked it. The steak was flavorful. 

Will be back!

Egg & I is a super-cute local breakfast joint away from the strip. It gets SO crowded and busy on the strip for breakfast\/brunch whenever I've visited, and it makes people even hungrier and grumpier while waiting. My advice? Take a cab or drive over to this place for a REALLY tasty meal.

My group and I of five people waited about 10 minutes for a table. Once seated, we were serviced immediately. Food only took about 10 minutes to be ready, and the staff were very attentive and worked together to address our table's needs. They have a little egg sign that you can flip to the sad-face yellow side, which indicates that you're in need of something. We did this a couple times to test it out, and it worked! Lightning fast.

Great food, great service. I recommend the Biscuits and Gravy! The Ranch Potatoes (their regular side of potatoes) are very flavorful and filling. A must have. Oh, and their Banana Nut Muffin was soooo sweet and moist!

I just may be back when I'm in town. If I can get outta bed next time after a long night, that is. Tehe.

Whenever we come to Vegas, we make sure to stop here for breakfast. Everything tastes phenomenal and the amazing breakfast potatoes top it all off. All of the staff has been great! Reina even went out of her way to change an order at the last second. Definitely go here. You won't be disappointed.

What a delicious treat! We waited about 15 minutes at 11am on a Saturday. Our server Karla was pleasant and attentive. We ordered the works scramble and the carrot cake French toast. Oh my goodness! The French toast tsa a decadent treat, but not overwhelmingly sweet. So moist syrup isn't necessary. The omelette was cooked to perfection as were the potatoes. My mimosa was a great compliment to my delicious meal. We'll definitely be back!

Geez, the portions here are ridiculously large, but then again, maybe it was because I had a Fat Tuesday Octane 190 large mug with 3 extra shots of everclear the night before. FAIL .  

I ordered the corned beef hash and it was ok.  I wish they wouldn't put so many potatoes in there, I already have enough with the Ranch potatoes.  The ranch potatoes were pretty good, basically just "cubed" fries with seasoning.  

My gf ordered some kinda skillet with massive amounts of cheese on it.  It was good, but way over the top in terms of a dense fatty artery clogging food.  She kept trying to feed it to me but I wasn't having it.  I warned her she'll be the one to suffer the consequences on the trip home to Los Angeles.  'nough of that.

The banana nut bread was nice and moist.  Good bread, but a little too sweet for me.

Solid breakfast spot off the strip.  3 stars.
Really really good savory stuffed french toast. Very good service too! My mum loved her omelette, and she's a fussy critic. I will definitely stop here again the next time I'm in Vegas.

Great breakfast spot! Consistent service and the food is delicious. Brad's omelette is my go-to, but if you're feeling courageous, the loco moco or the haole moco are both amazing! The potatoes are always good.
Great breakfast, reasonably priced, wait staff was super nice. Definitely would recommend

We arrived @ 8:30 AM and did not have to wait.  KAREN, our server, was promptly at our table making sure we had the menus, water, etc.  She stopped by again shortly to get our orders.  The food, skillet breakfast and Island favorite, was excellent.  I asked KAREN what the brand was for the portugese sausage.  She didn't know but went to the kitchen to ask.  That's service!
I highly recommend this place for the food, pricing and service.
Amazing breakfast\/brunch spot! they have great drinks as well and a huge menu.

What can I say..umm many Americans or travelers said it was good so do I. Love the busyness and ton of foods selection. Pancakes are amazing. 6 stars on the foods, 4.5 stars on the service because of there busyness I understand. Been here couples time and love every single time, just hate to gain couples ounces after the meal. Hihihi. Try it people!!!
Got there early before heading to Death Valley. Easy to park. Cheap. Good service. Nice Eggs Benedict and tasty crispy bacon.

Huge portions, quick service, pretty good food, grumpy waitress!

The muffin we took to go and ate it on our way back to California, and it was delicious, warm or cold, quality is quality!

Good place for breakfast. Its always good and the service is great. Evrtytime we come here there is always a wait. But the good thing about it is thst they will text you once your table is ready. Is worth the wait on a Sunday morning can get pretty busy. We will come back here again

I came to this establishment with a craving for some biscuits and gravy.

The hostess and waitress were both really pleasent. The waitress did a excellent job explaining the menu to me and letting me know how I could customize my order. Everything I asked for was promptly brought out.

While not the best sausage gravy I have had in Vegas, it was still decent on it's own and still better than most of the sausage gravy I have had in Vegas. Nice amount of sausage throughout with a nice homemade flavor. I do believe it was made in house. But it still had the consistency of being out of a packet. The biscuits weren't as soft and tender as I would have liked, but still passable.

The bacon I got was on point. They were straight and crispy. I asked for the eggs to be extra soft. They were okay, but it was weird, the top half of the pile was cooked how I wanted, but the bottom half was cooked hard. I'm  guessing they were left on too long and not continually scrambled. 

All together, I enjoyed my meal, but I am still looking for well made biscuits and gravy in Las Vegas. I will come back to try other items on the menu.

Great off strip breakfast spot. I had the chicken omelette smothered in Havarti cheese. Cooked to perfection. The potatoes here are outstanding. It's got a half fried\/half baked feel to them. I prefer these potatoes over hash browns. Pancakes are good sized and fluffy. The portions here are very filling. 2nd best to hash house a go go in my humble opinion.

Kept hearing about this place so my wife and I came in for omelettes. They have so much more! Everything was great especially Liza our server. Friendly and attentive, never had an empty glass. New breakfast spot when visiting Vegas.

I premise this review that I'm not a big fan of American breakfast. For me, I can't differentiate the best of the best for this staple American cuisine. In any event, came to this popular locals' spot in LV. I tried the strawberry filled French toast with bacon and scrambled eggs. I also tried a free banana nut muffin (it's free with Yelp check-in). The French toast was overbearingly sweet. The French toast on it's own without the strawberry madness was moist and fluffy; however, the strawberry filling along with the strawberry topping and the whip cream really overdid it. It was hard for me to finish.

The eggs and bacon were standard fare. Nothing to note. I tried some of my buddy's chicken fried steak. Again, decent seasoning, but tasted a bit too heavy for my liking. 

What stood out for me was the banana nut muffin. It was moist and the muffin top was crispy. Even better that it was free. I liked how it didn't have too many walnuts in it. Nice balance between breading and nuts.

Service was fast and courteous. I would say if you're looking for a popular American breakfast spot, check out Egg & I.

If you go at the right time, and you ca beat the rush it is completely worth it.  The Egg & I was very filling, and priced well.  If you are caught in the breakfast rush time, it can be slower, but it is still very good.  

The Eggs Works I think is owned by the same company, as both logos are on the shirts of employees, but that place is a little lighter for breakfast.
Great food and service. Pancakes were very good and so was the ham and cheese Omelette. Just be aware. If you're are coming from a hotel on the strip it's a 25 dollar cab each way.

Good size portions at a fair price make this a good go to spot when in the area. If you haven't been here and you are in the area or even close, looking for a good breakfast you can't go wrong with these guys. The home fries have a nice well balanced seasoning, some places try to get fancy and end up overdoing it but these guys found a good blend and stick with it. As far as eggs, I'm pretty particular about them but I have never had a problem here when I ask for my eggs a certain way that is how they come. All in all if you are wondering about this place, stop wondering and give it a try you will be glad you did.
We are fans.  I like that they have a few locations throughout the valley to choose from.  And they are dog-friendly.  So you can have brunch with your kiddos & furkiddos.
It was just ok,  the banana nut muffin was the only thing that really good. The potatoes that came with my corned beef hash was too salty for me.
We ate here 3 mornings out of our 6 day stay. Excellent service, fast seating and you can't beat the food!!!
Every time we come to Vegas we make it a point to come here.  Food is great. Service is great.
This place makes some of the best omelets I have ever eaten!  They are huge too, a 4 egg omelet stuffed with everything imaginable. The staff is very cheerful and attentive.

tip: 15 minute wait on a packed morning is super efficient.

breakfast crepes were out of the ordinary.  it's basically an omelet wrapped in a crepe; a must try.  too much home style potatoes.  good coffee.  flip the happy face egg to a sad face egg for prompt service.

I went to this place with my boyfriend right after we arrived at the airport. What I loved about this place was the service. Our waitress Tabatha was attentive and friendly. Her service was top-notch but not overbearing. Their muffin was okay in my opinion. I didn't think it wow me. I like their potatoes cubes which were fresh and well seasoned. I also like their sourdough bread and coffee. The crazy chicken was okay. Nothing spectacular on the main dish. I'd return next time when I was in town again.

Friends finally came into town this memorial weekend and I've been reading good reviews about this place and finally got a chance to check it out today.

It was packed.. But hats off to Egg & I because we were able to be seated quickly ( when at other restaurants it would take about 40 mins to be seated) 

Make sure that if you decide to come here that you use yelp and check in to get yourself a banana nut muffin.. The muffin was super light and moist and delicious.

There are so many different things to pick from on the menu.. The menu is super creative.. I got the breakfast burrito and it was the perfect size for my appetite.. The salsa for it was delicious too (I asked for extra).. I left full and ready for the day.

So I would definitely recommend  this place if you are hungry, because of the price, the amount of food, and the service. Is it mind blowing you ask? No, but it is definitely better then average. Hence the 4 star. I'm going to definitely come back.

Great food and great service. We picked this place because of the dog-friendly patio and I'll tell you what it did not disappoint!! The ambience is super cute and quaint and there is ample parking. Our server, Patrick, was attentive and hilarious.

We had the veggie Benny and breakfast burrito with the bacon subbed for beans as well as a crepe with home fries - so good!! The seasoning was perfect. If we are in Vegas, we will be back here for sure!

Food was great while the service was so-so. I had the French toast with blue berries and bananas while my friend had the strawberry filled French toast. Both were extremely delicious and we cleaned our plates without hesitation. By checking in on Yelp we were also provides a banana flavored muffin which was a great appetizer to our meals. Definitely recommended to those looking for a good breakfast after a long night in Vegas!

If you love a good breakfast, this is the place to try. 

I have to say first of all Brady our server was awesome! Personable and very professional, I haven't had this kind of service like this in a long time.It was Brekkie Time and I decided to check out the Sahara location,this place is smoking busy even on a weekday.

First of all if you're the kind of person like me that can't decide on what to eat,you'll be in trouble, huge breakfast menu! The banana nut muffin is must when eating here, it's that good. I ordered the Cordon Bleu Skillet, which has their tasty seasoned potatoes lining the bottom of dish. It was a deceivingly filling and I was very Happy with my dish.

I can see why Egg & I is such a super popular place to eat no matter what time of the day. Excellent attentive friendly service with lots of parking makes this place a great choice.

Super great service. The second we walked in we were seated Imeadiatly outside, there was full house but the wait wast not long at all. 
Chance was our server and she greeted us so warmly.
Chance is the reason I will be coming back!!

Great place to have some breakfast!

Banana nut muffins are delicious and service is prompt, courteous and friendly.

We had Oscar as our waiter and he was great to provide recommendations and was super friendly!

A must stop on our next trip back!

Jaime P. and I come here at least once during our stay in Vegas for breakfast (obviously).  Since it's a locals place, it gets pretty crowded, so don't come thinking you're not going to have to wait a bit before getting a seat.  It's totally worth it.  Located right off the strip, it's a great place to grab a bite to eat without hassling with the nearby hotels.  The prices are reasonable and they have a huge menu to choose from.  Even the pickiest of eaters have something to pick, no matter how difficult they might be.

It's a country style restaurant with a variety of egg dishes.  My favorite is the Eggs Benedict.  The hollandaise sauce is creamy and perfect and it's paired with some seasoned potatoes.  I like them, but they aren't my favorite.

Their biscuits and gravy are pretty awesome as well. A great dish to serve with the table, but if you're starving, you might want to try to conquer them by yourself.

Love coming here for breakfast as the portions are generous & the food is delish!  The banana muffins come out hot & fluffy.  Omelettes are huge & filled with yummy things.  The service is quick & friendly but be prepared for a wait if you come at peak hours.  The entrance is small so you will likely be outside enjoying the fine Vegas weather.
You must come an ask for Emily best in the West love my good got n ready to eat perfick I got the chili relleno Solvang

Vegas. Two girls. Hungover. We had a long drive ahead but needed time to collect ourselves. In our dysfunctional state of mind, we decided we wanted brunch.

Off to Egg & I we went. The place turned out to be a local favorite. It was fairly packed, but we got seated right away. Extensive breakfast menu. Options! And loved how it was printed on newspaper! 

Chicken Omelet (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/3kdSl5mo9dWC4clrQjEDGg?select=5jiBgyVg3dAhbE4X129pOw): I can't remember its name, but I do remember that it was absolutely tasty! Chicken, cheese, avocado with sour cream on top. Moist chicken. Fluffy omelet. Yum! 

Ranch Potatoes: Came with omelet. Addicting! Even though they were overly seasoned for my taste buds, I couldn't stop eating them.

Banana Nut Muffin (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/3kdSl5mo9dWC4clrQjEDGg?select=6JXT3ryRPelUwv5grDI67A): Came with omelet. Gigantic homemade muffin. Chewy top. Soft inside with bits of banana and nuts. So good!

Eggs Florentine (http:\/\/www.yelp.com\/biz_photos\/3kdSl5mo9dWC4clrQjEDGg?select=YvTvI5skrvIBBFC4W7TUVg): I didn't try it. But judging by its looks, I would imagine it to be delicious!

Coffee: Great quality coffee. It was unlimited refill and I had the whole carafe to myself. They have their own line of coffee. 

Huge portions!  We both packed half of our food to go. Great service! Friendly and attentive. And best of all, great prices! 2 breakfast entrees, 1 orange juice, 1 coffee, plus tax and tips all for $30! =D

We went to have brunch at egg and I this past Sunday. Fast service really good filling food. A great option to the buffets while visiting in Vegas. This will definitely be a place to go whenever we are in town. Our waitress was also really nice. Can't wait to go back to have the biscuits mmmm!

Yes there will always be a line, but you know that usually means where the good foods are. And the wait is so worth it for this place!!! The line moves very fast, and you will be sitting down with a yummy warm banana muffin. Portions are big, and you will be stuffed. I tried the cincy chili for the first time. It's an all meat chili with a sweeter taste. Then I had the best loco moco ever! Instead of the usual brown gravy, they use country gravy. And their homemade hamburger patty has so much flavor, and cooked to perfection.

Was on vacation and decided to eat here for breakfast. I was expecting something more..I ordered the chicken fried steak skillet..it had potatoes, chopped up steak, gravy and eggs throwed on top..it was ok..nothing to brag about. It was just ok.

My friends and I had breakfast at Egg & I on our recent trip to Vegas. We wanted to end our trip right by getting a delicious breakfast before heading back home to LA. Egg & I was quite good.

Parking: The parking is easy as it is located in a shopping center with plenty of spaces. Spots near Egg & I were full, but plenty spaces in the lot if you dont mind walking.

Service: The service was excellent! Our server was attentive and very nice. Although all our entrees did not come with the banana muffin, our server brought one for everybody! They even let us bring our Starbucks drinks in! 

Food: The food was delicious. The banana muffin was light and fluffy. Super yummy! I also ordered the Chicken, Broccoli and Mushroom skillet (served with eggs, ranch potatoes, and cheese). It was also very good.

Overall good meal. I wouldn't mind coming back again when I'm in Vegas.

We found this hidden gem before leaving Vegas. Saw it had a lot of stars so we thought we'd check it out. Our waitress Amanda was super nice. Be sure to check it out when ur Vegas. Definitely better than the generic places inside the hotels.

This place is overrated. We got bennidits, which were all right, nothing special. Potatoes were too salty. 

Their ice tea was terrible, you can taste they used tap water to make it, which was disgusting!!!

We will not come back for sure

Arrived on Wednesday at about 10 am and was seated immediately. Eggs and bacon were cooked just right  (I like my bacon really crispy.) Cinnamon French toast was delicious. Our server, Oscar, was "eggceptional". They offer so many choices and Oscar made some useful recommendations.  He was very pleasant. You can count on great service along with great egg dishes here.  BTW
we got 2 free banana nut muffins just for checking in on Yelp!  Thanks!!
I really enjoyed this place! Great food and service! I ordered the fiesta skillet with chorizo, amazing!

Best breakfast place i have ever been to! We experienced great service , and good food.Ou waitress was super nice. I love chille rellenos, so i had to try their chille relleno omelet. OMG BOMB lol it was so good. i had to try their banana bread  muffin it was good! i live in cali ,but travel to vegas a lot. Every time we are out in vegas this will be our go to place for breakfast!

Outstanding service, California Omelette yummy.
Fresh coffee and they keep it coming.
Perfect hash browns.

I will be back!!

Coming from Ohio, we had no idea where to go for brunch until my brother suggested The Egg & I. The food was awesome! Oscar, our waiter gave us the best service possible! The other staff members were so nice as well. We waited, but not long considering it was Sunday morning! The banana nut muffin is delicious and the portions we received were huge! Great place to go if you're looking for a breakfast\/lunch idea!

I love this place. I stumbled across this place years ago when I first moved out here. There's really not much to say that's not already stated in the reviews. I love the stuffed French toast. It's not overly greasy like a few other place that I have tried. You won't be disappointed. I don't remember our server name but he was wonderful.  This is my go to spot for all of my friends and family who come in town to visit.

One of the best breakfast spots I've ever had. I ordered the "Stuffed French Toast" It had sausage and eggs stuffed between two pieces of french toast. The potatoes were slightly mild in seasoning and full of flavor. The coffee is great; the price was great for las vegas; and Maggie my server was incredibly approachable. 

Oh, also free banana muffin when you check in via YELP!

5\/5
Such a filling breakfast,wish I had room for more in my stomach and bottomless cup of coffee,can I ask for more?
Loved this place! The french toast favorite stuffed with egg scramble was BOMB. Good portion and worth my dollar. I would definitely go again!
First time here with friends from out of town... our server Curtis was amazingly wonderful... we all ordered something different.. everything was perfect.. the only downside was it was very salty...
Best breakfast anywhere.  I lived the skillet.   And make sure you get the muffin.
Great food with incredibly reasonable prices. Carole Ann was the best with a special order. Off the beaten path but worth it.

My family and I came here after finding out the Peppermill was closed for maintenance. The Egg & I was a great find and did not disappoint. 

It's your standard greasy-spoon dinner fair, with a ton of egg options and great service. 

If you're in the area, give it a try. Being off the strip makes it a nice choice outside of the chaos that is Vegas.

Man... people freak out over this place, but I'm not really sure why.  It wasn't bad. Just not much different from dozens of other places.  Think Denny's.  There you go.  I will say this, though... great service.  I had the corned beef hash.  They top it off with an egg.  I LOVE CBH, but I wouldn't order this again.  I was with three friends.  They had scrambled eggs, eggs benedict, and a chili cheese omelette.  Scrambled eggs are the same everywhere.  The eggs benedict had WAY too much hollandaise sauce.  The omelette, though, was killer.  In fact, we stopped eating our dishes and ate from her plate.  What?  Now... the banana nut muffin.  I didn't think it was all that.  Good flavor, but mine was kind of hard.  The girls, though... I swear they had an orgasm.
The food is always fresh and the service is great. Huge portions of quality food for a low price. Karla was our server this time and she did great.

We had so much high expectations for this place after reading all the reviews on yelp. Wow...we were somewhat disappointed. Here's my review:

Food: 3 stars - I'm not saying their food was bad but they were not exceptionally great either. There wasn't anything special. It tasted to us like your typical breakfast at a restaurant. We had the pancakes, eggs, hash browns, eggs benedict, potatoes, etc.

Service: 5 stars - the server was great and took really good care of us.

Ambiance: 3 stars - average

Will I ever return? Most likely not.

Well well well California. It was surely a great visit. This place is eggcelent! You must must must get the banana nut muffins here ! When I went there was a check in option on Yelp and I got a free one to try! I ended up buying 4 more! Oh so yummy

The anticipation of eating at Egg & I was wonderfully fulfilled on this my first visit to this location.
Everything as expected at an Egg & I as I have eaten there in several states.
I ordered the Blackened Rib Benny and every bite along with the seasoned potatoes was simply delish.
All was cooked perfectly especially the eggs and the hollandaise is just right.
Be sure to check in with the Help app and get one of the best banana but muffins you'll ever taste. 
The service was quick even though they were pretty busy.
To sum it up this place is not to be missed for a hearty filling and scrumptious breakfast when your in the neighborhood.

First impression: very loud and raucous. I'm not really sure what all the fuss is about. The food was pretty standard diner fare. Nothing remarkable at all.   Had a BLT with their home fries. It was average. 

To read some of the review here you'd think this place was heaven on earth. I'm here to say that the food was just okay. When you calculate in the above average prices then this isn't a very good value in my opinion. 

The service, on the other hand, was very good. Staff was great.

Great service!!!

Waitress showed patience even when we couldn't make up our minds as to what to order.  
The food was great tasting.  I go back here to eat breakfast no questions asked.

We got tired of paying a premium for breakfast on the strip and checked Yelp for some local suggestions in town.  The Egg & I seemed to have decent reviews, so we checked it out.  On the day we went, New Year's Eve morning, it was busy.  We had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated, which was fine.  

Looking at the menu, I quickly locked onto the biscuits & gravy meal (with eggs and potatoes).  I'm a complete sucker for this meal and decided to give it a try.  

When I ate my meal, I discovered the biscuits weren't homemade (and were crumbly) and the gravy was unremarkable.  You can't really screw up scrambled eggs.  The potatoes were wildly over seasoned and virtually unbearable to eat. 

I rate the Egg & I biscuits & gravy as a "5" (on a scale of 1-10 with 10 being the best I've ever had, which is at Arthur's Family Restaurant located in Orange, CA). 

The service was fine and the food came out fast.  If I'm in the area again, I'll give Egg & I a chance to redeem itself (by choosing something else off of the breakfast menu).

A group of us are visiting here from New Jersey and we heard about this restaurant. The food was fantastic and our server, Chance was phenomenal!  Liza was a sweetheart as well. Highly recommend the mash potato omelette, but don't tell anyone about it. Lol
Short wait at 9 on a Wed.  Great fresh fruit plate.  Chicken enchilada omelet was a hit.  Kids got chocolate chip pancakes and it was a big portion.  A great stop 10 miles off the strip.

This is our second time here and I must say it's delicious! Allan has ordered the Loco Moco from day one and says it's the best he has had. Their food has a lot of flavor. The staff is awesome! Sunshine thank you for always welcoming us with a smile! She's the best manager ever! See you again in a few weeks.

Man everything here is pretty bomb.
They had my turkey bacon too. The good Godshalls brand. Oh my.
Best breakfast joint in Vegas, hands down.  I will never visit vegas without going here at least once (more likely twice).  I even bought one of their mugs as a souvenir, and I rarely do that.

Love this place--it's like Cheers, everybody knows my name!
Been eating here since I was in Elementary school....did you know this place opened up in 1983? Just a little food for thought! :)

Anyway, about the food...I love and highly suggest the:
-Italian skillet
-Corn beef hash
And my new favorite...
-Pork Carnitas!!!!!! (Drool)

Do yourself a favor and give this place a shot, it's an oldie but a goodie! :)
The Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast was SUPER delicious! Also, their breakfast potatoes are really good because of the seasoning. I recommend those two items.

Great breakfast food for your typical breakfast joint. Awesome service and a lot of options. You can even get the potatoes gluten free, which was nice when with somebody who has gluten allergies. Very accommodating and nice. Highly recommend!!! We had Tamara as our waitress. It was her first day at this location and we were blown away with how great she was.

So I found this great little restaurant on Yelp during one of our many Vegas trips and I have to say that I am in love with the french toast sandwich!!!! I'm a huge fan of savory and sweet and this place nailed it to the wall!! Great place to have breakfast after dancing the night away on the Las Vegas strip! I just wish I lived closer because the food here is amaziiiiing and totally crave-worthy!

This is the perfect breakfast and brunch place! The service is great. They have this happy egg and sad egg system. If you turn the egg at you table sad in a second a waiter or waitress will come and make your egg happy. The omelettes are too die for and the coffee is great. The servings are huge and the potatoes are very tasty. I wish they had one of these back home. It was a great expierence.
Kat was absolutely awesome! She made the experience so enjoyable. Stuffed French Toast and banana nut muffin is a must!

The chile relleno omelette was alright, not spectacular but decent. I expected an omelette stuffed with a fire roasted pepper stuffed with cheese. Instead it was a fire roasted Anaheim chile inside an omelette topped with cheese. It was good 4 stars. My partner ordered the stuffed French toast. It was delicious! If you like sweet and savory it's a must have. Banana muffins chewy and moist with no crumb. Our waitress was lovely, I forgot her name but she was very sweet, welcoming, attentive and genuine :-) 

Overall fair price, decent food, solid service.
Wow service with a smile! No long waiting the biscuits and gravy are incredible worth the drive for really good coffee too!

This restaurant offers a large and delicious breakfast with great customer service. We had breakfast there twice over a recent trip to Vegas and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. My first meal was the Ultimate Skillet. Bring a large appetite! My over easy eggs were cooked perfectly and all the ingredients were so tasty and fresh. I also enjoyed their sourdough toast. It was thick, flavorful, and buttery! The dish was so yummy and substantial.  It kept me going until late in the afternoon. My wife had the Bacon, Avocado, & Cheese omelette. She loved it. It was cooked to perfection; a uniform yellow color and cooked evenly through.  It was loaded with lots of avocado.  She said that it was maybe the best she's ever had. Wow!

I had to cut back on my next visit. I ate too much on the first one, although I really enjoyed it (trying to be good in Vegas???). I ordered the Eggs-Plus with ham. The scrambled eggs were cooked just right.  The ham was good. It was not dry, chewy or too salty. The potatoes were also good. The server helped my wife make substitutions to the Flapper which made her her happy. Who says you can't have your cake and eat it too? She rated the pancakes 5 stars!   Another great breakfast.

I must commend the staff here. They are welcoming, friendly, and they are willing to accommodate you so that you are satisfied with your meal. I am looking forward to my next Vegas trip so that I can eat there again.

This food is absolutely amazing!!!! We had eaten multiple Benny's and they were all great. Ate a coney dog with their spin on it, it was okay. They had given us a 25-30 min wait for a party of 4 and we were called with in 10 minutes. The service here is top notch I will always visit eggs & I while I am in Vegas

Karla was our server today, she was right on time w\/ her greeting us and was very nice! She was of course wearing green on st. Pattys day and suggested something new which most servers do not.. I tried eggs Benny! Loved it. Thank you Karla, see ya soon

Potato omelette. ..delish! Eggs, garlic mashed potatoes and bacon...topped with cheese and sour cream! Oh yeah...get the banana muffin instead of toast! The service was SPOT on awesome! Our server Elizabeth was the greatest ever!  Definitely coming back next time we're in town!

Came here for brunch on a Saturday. Waited 15-20 min for a table for two, and ended up with a nice spot in their shady outdoor patio with water misters. Out server, Amanda, was really sweet and we enjoyed the service. However, the table next to us had some interesting service...they asked a server for silverware and were told there was none left!!!! What?!?! They also waited a long time for cups to pour their beers into and were eventually told the restaurant was out of cups? WHAT?!

Food was great though! Got the classic with two eggs, toast, and delicious potatoes!

The paying process was annoying. You pay afterwards at the register, but it took us ten minutes to wait through the line just to pay!

First time here. Visiting Vegas. Hungry. 
stop in becauseI liked the sign. The food is awesome. The service was great. Thanks OSCAR. I will be back I had the "spinach Benny" it was marvelous...
Delicious!  5 miles from the Vegas strip.  Best service ever.  We ate banana muffins, chocolate chip pancakes, strawberry Belgian waffle and avocado bacon omelette.  Try it!

Sat outside, but the misters and shade made it all work.  I had the Country Benny, which was really biscuits, sausage patty, eggs and gravy in a boat, with their Diablo potatoes.  In our group, loco moco, chile relleno omelette and country fried steak were popular.  Service was nice and efficient.
We ordered Works Skillet, Traditional Benny, and the strawberry stuffed toast. All orders come with a large portion, and the most important is: they are very very yummy! Best Breakfast in Vegas!

Despite their glaring lack of proper grammar (Although Egg & Me doesn't really have that ring) I usually try to make it a point to stop by Egg & I...  usually on Sunday mornings nursing the hangover from Saturday's celebrations.

In the four or five times that I've frequented this establishment, I've noticed several things:

1.  Many of the female servers are quite attractive and helpful.

2.  The male servers that I've had have all been invariably incompetent, rude and sometimes a combination of both.

3.  For the price, (Bouchon's $18 version is slightly better) the corned beef hash is the best I've had in any restaurant.  The first time I came here, I tried it, and I don't think I've ever ordered anything else.

Beyond that, the owner\/manager lady provides a stalwart presence at the cash register with that unique mix of friendly\/surly grandmotherliness that only American women in their 60's can truly evince.
This place is great. Food was fantastic and service was second to none. Will definitely go again.

I was going to give this restaurant four stars but it deserves 5, because not only is the food delicious, the customer service is outstanding.

There was a small group of us and we all had something different abd we all loved our choices. We all had the banana nut bread muffin; which was nice and warm and moist. I then moved on to my Blackened Prime Rib Benny. I was in heaven and did I mention the seasoned potatoes? They were a perfect accompaniment to the dish.

Portions are generous, so come hungry.

Exceptional!! From the minute we walked in until the minute we left. Amanda was our server and I would have to put her in out top 5 best experiences with a server. She was very sweet but very quick, efficient, and attentive. Definitely a great asset to the company. I don't normally post reviews but it is people like her that deserve recognition so I promised the general manager that I would do this. Great job Amanda!

Huge portion sizes, great friendly staff and only minutes from the strip you can't go wrong. Some thing to remember if you check in on Yelp you get a free banana nut muffin and they are super delicious. The second thing we learned that there is a happy face on the table and if you turn it over there is a :-( if they see that :-( they will come rushing to your table immediately help in assisting you. I opted for the open-faced croissant sandwich it was loaded with cheese bacon and four large eggs even came with a side of Diablo season home fries that were really good and crispy you could even buy that seasoning to take home with you so if you're in the area and you want a breakfast to fill you up for the whole day I highly highly recommend that you drive to this location you won't be disappointed

If you want some pretty awesome breakfast food with great portions and a friendly staff, then this spot is just for you.  I ordered the Prime Rib Benny and was more than satisfied at how generous the portion was along with how delicious it tasted!  Now I know a Prime Rib Benny isn't something that sounds all too familiar to anyone who hasn't been to this restaurant, so picture this:  juicy and flavorful pieces of blackened prime rib chopped up with poached eggs crowning an open faced buttery croissant, which is then drizzled with a rich and creamy hollandaise sauce.  It's like what traditional egg benedicts dream to be some day basically.  Regular eggs benedict is Carlton Banks, Prime Rib Benny is Will Smith.  You get the picture.

Besides the entrÃ©e itself, my order of OJ was fresh squeezed and just right.  Their lemonade was great too, which is a definite plus in my book.  I also had a taste of their French fries and Portuguese sausage, which my cousins ordered and both were very tasty, too!  The fries were thin, crispy and flavorful.  While the Portuguese sausage was not overly oily and fatty and was cooked just right.

Service was verygood, as our waiter was attentive, friendly and always available.  They have this nifty little feature on your table where there's a sign of a sad face and on the other side of it, a sign of a happy face.  When you want your server's attention, you just flip the sign to show the sad face and you'll be helped right away.  I found this to be a very memorable and smart way of the restaurant going the extra mile to offer as much quality service to its patrons.

I love Egg and I and Egg Works. Great food, plenty of choices, nice presentation, moderately priced. Very friendly servers and nice ambience. Great tasting Traditional Benny! Would be a 5 star if not for a long wait.
Ordered omelettes and pancakes for our brunch. Mmmm was too good. We finished with a vanilla latte. It came with whipped cream cinnamon sprinkled on top of it. Nice brunch :)

Love this place and there other location on West Flamingo! The customer services is fair and the prices are very fair specially towards Law Enforcement. The food is unbeatable specially when you don't wanna cook yourself!

Came to Vegas to celebrate my boyfriends 21st birthday.. And today we go back home :( but before we leave we decided to track down an awesome place for breakfast to keep us going for the ride back! My boyfriend chose this place because of all the great reviews he saw on Yelp. And we weren't disappointed! The omelette was so cheesy and delicious and my tuna melt was perfect! The seasoned fries and breakfast potatoes were awesome too! Lily was our server and she was super sweet and brought us whatever we needed right away. We will be making it a tradition whenever we come out here to eat at the Egg & I! Thank you!! Now for the drive home..... :( lol

Went to Egg & I for brunch and it really exceeded my expectations.  I heard good things about this place and the reviews are are spot on.  It is located off the strip.  Located in a plaza with other businesses and there is plenty of parking.  

I ordered the new york steak and eggs.  Steak was tender and juicy.  Eggs were cooked perfectly.  Served with country ranch potatoes.  The country potatoes are basically small fried potatoes squares with ranch seasoning.  My GF had the cajun shrimp eggs benedict special.  The fresh fruit plate contains blueberries, madarin oranges, pineapple, cantaloupe, and honeydew slices.  Fruits were fresh and it was a great way to start off the morning.  Expect to wait a few minutes if you have a party larger than 2.  Luckily it was just me and my GF and we were seated right when we arrived.  The staff were fast, friendly, courteous, and they were as accommodating as much as possible.

Egg & I, you guys are now one of my favorite breakfast \/ lunch places to visit when I am around the Las Vegas Area.  Thank you for the great meal.

Bon Apettit

Food is amazing! A list of everything we ordered.
Biscuits and gravy with potatoes. DELICIOUS!!! The gravy was tasty and the biscuits were so soft. 

Steak and eggs: decent piece of meat but enough food to fill up my dad

Chile relleno omelette: how creative to put an entire chile relleno inside of an omelette! 

Wild chicken: ok, I think that's the name of it lol it's an omelette with chicken, guacamole, mushrooms and covered with Munster cheese. Who thought of this and why did it take me so long to try it?!?!? It was INCREDIBLE!!!! 

Oscar was beyond amazing!! He was patient (family was a bit slow at deciding) and constantly checked on us. Five stars just for his service.

I came here for the first time with my girlfriend. I ordered the traditional Benny (eggs Benedict) and wow. This place is great! Besides the long wait time ( which was worth it) our servers name was Reina and she was great. If u need anything u just flip the little egg guy on your table and they're there to help you! Great food, great staff. Definitely coming back!

Went to Vegas and a cousin Yelped this place, which pulled it up first on her phone. The wait was not long, food was delicious and portions are big. The seasoned potatoes that accomodate the breakfast plates have a nce seasoning to it, and tasty. The banana nut muffin bread was so moist and warm, and we shared it w\/everyone at the table just to get a bite; don't be fooled because it might look flat and plain in color!! The Egg Benedict was worth it, because it was the first time I've ever tried it at any restaurant. The waitress are attentive, and helpful. A very packed house, even on a Thursday morning for brunch.

Have came here several times with the family, service is always friendly and they are as fast as they can considering they are PACKED! But thats not a bad thing , food is good and portions are huge, we love coming here when we are in Vegas after a hard night of Partying the Egg and I delivers the goods!!

First time coming to Eggs and I. The food was delicious and the service was great. Thank you Tamara for the great service.

Would recommend this place to anyone visiting the area.

One of my favorite breakfast places in Vegas .... My last visit there wasn't so great ... The waitress messed up the order 3 times and well the rest of the staff more than made up for it ... The assistant manager was great taking care of us and the bussers were the friendliest and most attentive... Will return but will refuse to sit with in that waitress' section

Back to LV after 20 years and breakfast still great. Service from Oscar was more than top notch and the Country Bennie was to die for - in fact if my cardiologist finds out I'm in here and hears my arteries slamming shut he may sue.

I haven't been to an Egg & I\/Egg Works since I was in Arizona back in '07.  I love this place!!   It's one of those bfast places where there are mugs on the table and the server brings you a giant pot of coffee and leaves it with you at your disposal.  There were different types of pre-packaged cream and sugars, including hot sauces, ketchup, and a little egg sign which you can flip over if you need servicing.  Not as ingenious as the button at Korean bbq places, but it works!

Most entrees come with a side of toast or homemade banana nut muffin.  I'm not a big fan of banana nut but my god, theirs is just divine. Spongey, soft, moist, slightly sweet and with just the perfect flavor of fresh banana flavor and a little hint of crunch from the nuts.  The nuts aren't bitter either, as some walnuts can be and it was just pure perfection.

BH and I went a little buckwild (as we always do) and we ordered three dishes: eggs benedict florentine, a half order of corned beef hash, and the stuffed french toast with eggs and bacon.  The benedict was awesome and was smothered in creamy hollandaise sauce.  The eggs were soft and runny but the English muffin was still crispy and chewy.  The stuffed french toast was pretty good.  BH gobbled up the entire plate whereas I had just a bite or two.  I thought there was too much egg and not enough bacon, but BH told me it was great with maple syrup.  I like sweet meats and breads, but I haven't gotten accustomed to sweet scrambled eggs yet, so I never tried it dipped in sticky sweet maple. Finally, the corned beef hash was very fresh and I could definitely tell it was homemade and not from a can.  The chunks of potato were creamy and starchy while the chunks of meat were flavorful, salty, and a little reminiscent of dog food (but in a good way).  The over easy egg on top made it even more delectable.

Finally, one of the best parts of the meal, besides the banana nut muffin, were their ranch potatoes.  They are roasted to a perfect crunch and seasoned with some sort of red powder - possibly paprika for a bit of smokiness?  They were so damn good, that even past my stuffing point, I kept stabbing at the potatoes so I could get every last bit in my mouth.  Needless to say, BH  and I were nearly bursting by the time we left Egg & I.  I call that a sign of good breakfast and a good start to a day.

As good as it gets!

Came here in April to meet up with an old friend.  This place was very cute and spacious. We got seated right away.  The menu is like a newspaper, but not. I thought that was really neat and fun, quite creative if you ask me.  The corn beed hash is very up to par with what I consider a good corn beef hash. Trust me, I'm very nit picky about my hash & how I like them.  I really enjoyed the potatoes as well. Brownie points for endless coffee.  It's all you can drink so that's nice.

DON'T forget the MUFFIN!!! Melt in your mouth good. GET THE MUFFIN!

Great place for breakfast. The Works Veggie Bennie is absolutely fantastic. Checked in on Yelp and got a Banana Nut Muffin which was excellent as well. I will definitely come back for more when I am in Vegas.
Amanda was fantastic!  Cheerful, pleasant, smiling! Could not ask for better service.

For the hungry, this place serves up the nice sized portion.  For the picky, the food tastes great.  For those who like flexibility, these guys entertain reasonable substitutions!  

I just happened by this place on a Saturday morning.  There was a 15-20 minute wait for a table, which can be an annoyance, or it can be an excellent endorsement for patience.  My wife had a four-egg multi-cheese omelette, and tiny as she is, she ate every bit, washing it down with coffee (that was attentively refilled!).  It came with choice of potatoes and a super-delicious muffin.  I had a specialty omelette that was filled with spicy veggies and cheese.  When it came time to kick the spuds to the side, the waitress offered fruit, tomatoes, or fruit and tomatoes!  The fruit was chosen, fresh, sliced, and nicely arranged.  I had the coffee too, and the waitress was never stingy when more creamers were requested.  Such good service.  I can see why this place has people waiting for a seat.

This place has the best egg-dish menu I've ever seen.  The price of most dishes is in the $10.00 or less range.  They have plasma TV's strategically placed on walls, so you can watch sports if the conversation crashes.  It's all good. This is the best non-buffet breakfast I've had in Las Vegas.

Went here for the first time this morning. Not only was the food AMAZING, but our waitress Manuela was awesome! She was so attentive as to the point that we did not have to ask for anything! We love everything about this place. Will definitely be going back! #manuelarocks

The food is good and they have a good variety. but the only problem is that the service is a little slow. and I got a pastrami Reuben  which also came with fries and a deli pickle and they have a good selection of coffee creamers.

Hands down, they are my favorite breakfast establishment.  I have been here three times and loved all the dishes I have ordered (eggs benedict florentines, taco rancheros, & omelette). Too bad, there is no Egg & I around where I live!

By far the best breakfast in Vegas! My wife and I recently got married in Vegas and this is the only place I could go to for our pre wedding breakfast! The food, the staff and the banana nut muffin are all amazing!

It's a cab ride off the Strip, but worth it!

I'm in Vegas two of three times a year, and Egg and I has become one of my regular stops. The Kay's Special omelet will change your life.

And the banana nut muffin will have you believing in a higher power, no matter how you've done at the tables.
I always enjoy the food here.  A little busy inside kind of cramped but overall it is a good experience consistently
Had a great breakfast. I always come for the prime rib Benny. Tabatha was our server. She was super friendly and gave egg-cellent (get it) service.

Wow! So we came to Vegas for a quick getaway. As we were leaving our hotel, our valet attendant told us to try this place for some great breakfast! Soooooo glad we did!

Thee is ample parking and our wait time was like, 25 seconds. We were taken care of right away. We go super delicious coffee, beyond superb customer service, and a great atmosphere to spend a morning or afternoon to indulge in tasty breakfast food. 

Would definitely recommend this place to anyone!

Looking for breakfast outside the strip! Look no more. This place has it all. Most importantly than the food, COFFEE is really good too. Don't get overwhelm by the the line of people waiting, it go by fast and in the meantime you can read their newspaper menu. It has variety of assortments! We loved their banana nut muffin. Enjoy!

Great breakfast spot when you're in Vegas! Off strip so you avoid strip traffic. Eggs everything!!! Plus lunch if you're not into eggs (weirdo). Their omelettes are perfectly done with great flavors, fresh veggies and tons of cheese. Eggs Benedicts were perfectly done. Portion sizes were spot on for an Merican. Works potatoes are freaking delicious! They taste like seasoned French fries. I love all things potatoes- If this place was called potatoes and I, I would probably give it 10 stars based on potential alone. Service is great- quick, efficient, and friendly. 

Must try's: works potatoes, banana nut muffin, eggs of all kinds.

Yummilicious factor- A
Just delicious,  worth the wait and uber trip from the strip! Not over priced but busy with justification...

This the most favorite place for breakfast in all around the las vegas. Home made style, with a variety choices. You can customize every thing. They have juices and hot tea and hot coffee. Every things are really generously lot like every portion is good for 2people. Flask of coffee or hot tea and so on. 
Also, during the weekend the waiting time was almost 20 mins, but this time during the weekdays and 7 am there was not at all.

it's good to check-in to see if they are offering any deals.  I got a free banana nut muffin which was very delicious!

corn beef skillet was okay. salty even with the eggs on top. it needed a better balance.

veggie works Benedict was very good. something I will probably order again instead of trying something new only because it's fulfilling for me. 

service was good. nothing to complain about but nothing really to rave about either.

Love this place!  Old school all day breakfast spot and more.   Emily was a delightful server.  Had my usual Hawaiian breakfast and my hubby his gravy covered yumminess...  Their banana  muffins are soooooooo good.  They'd be 5  were it that the butter not frozen & all the outside seats were covered. Don't go if your in a rush... But,  if you've the time try them  yum yum yum it up!

Once in a while, someone makes you appreciate those who serve with a smile, good conversation, and superb attention.....Alexa did just that!!!  Greeted us, got the whole order correct!!!  CHECKED ON US, AND MADE OUR DAY!!!!!  With 6 of us, it is not always eazy.  Alexa made it seem easy, with courtesy, smiles, great attitude and so welcoming.  Food was outstanding!! Alexa made it all the more enjoyable!!!!  Appreciated her so much!!!!!

OMG. Friendly service, in fact, one of our party ordered something that didn't come with the banana nut muffin so she brought extra so everyone had one. These muffins  are super moist (and im picky about that) and are the best restaurant banana bread that I've ever had. Portion sizes are huge. Everything we ordered was great tasting. Their salsa is great.
Really good!! Muffins are awesome. Great menu with a lot of interesting items. Can order half orders!!!!

it was an so-so place. Greasy food and ok service. i wasn't expecting much. Diner food. The potatoes were seasoned far too much with seasoning salt. And my skillet was ok. I can't say it would be worth the trip here. Unless u are tired of the buffets. pancakes were nothing special. It was...meh...so i don't know how it got such high ratings.

Looking for a simple and amazing breakfast to brighten up your day? 

This place is it. 

Great food, huge breakfast selections, great service, and reasonable price.

The staff told us the wait to sit inside was approximately 30 min to 45 min, but our group could get a table now if we decided to sit outside. So we decided to sit outside on the patio and the weather wasn't too bad for a nice weekend breakfast.

Skillet breakfast - works (ham, bacon, sausage, mushrooms, onions, peppers, and tomatoes - $10.75 w\/ banana nut muffin): One of the best banana nut muffin that you will find and very flavorful potatoes. The portion was enough to fill my tummy up!

It's egg-ceptionally good! And don't forget about the banana nut muffin! 

P.S. - Once you are finished with the meal, you will have to pay at the register.

My wife and I were in Vegas recently. We're dying for some breakfast food. We googled and yelp and we keep coming across Egg & I. We checked trip adviser and finally we decided to go ahead a try it. Boy oh boy, it was worth is everything was amazing! The service, the atmosphere and the food. We are planning a big family trip and Egg and I will definitely be a major stop on the trip. See you 2018!!!
Great service and the food is always done as ordered. This is our second time here. Had the 3 pigs, four egg omelette.

I love brunch and there are wonderful savory and sweet options!

This place gets packed and for very good reason! The line is always out the door. But, the line moves quickly and is worth the wait.

Tip: Not conveniently on the strip, but I would head there on the way to Vegas or when you are heading back home.

Everything we tried was really good, so I don't feel like you can go wrong! Perhaps share entrees so you can try more of all the goods.
really good salsa. portions are enormous. Food came out clean (little grease) and was delicious.  Prices are a tad high, but goes along with giant portions.

Service was amazing we had a waitress named Rachel who just was always there for us , the food was also amazing really great place everybody was having a good time and enjoyed themselves  we highly recommend this Resturant

At the behest of a good friend (who has great taste in food), our group headed out here for breakfast.

Upon entering, I was completely taken to a different place, away from all the lights, sounds of Las Vegas.  I felt like I was almost at home. From the greeters, to the servers, service was awesome.  Served with a smile and genuine people, I was more than happy here.

And the food...oh...so tasty.  I had a prime rib skillet, which was freaking huge. I absolutely enjoyed my meal (the potatoes....SO GOOD), although I have to admit I think my friend's country steak stole the show, and I will be ordering that next time.

And there will be a next time :D

We started out our breakfast here with banana nut muffins.  We originally ordered one, but our waitress in her infinite wisdom recommended that we get 2.  Sooo glad we did, because 1, they weren't as big as we thought they'd be, and 2, those suckers are really tasty.

The stuffed french toast is to die for.  Seriously, I think it'll kill you with all the meat, cheese and butter they manage to stick in there, but it's definitely worth the extra trips to the gym to work it off.  It's a pretty huge portion when you add in the home fries. The previous reviewer that said that it looks like somebody dumped a bottle of Lawry's seasoning on them wasn't kidding. They were orange.

SO got the Mexican Omelette and she couldn't finish it because of the generous portion size, but she enjoyed what she was able to put away. We both enjoyed the fresh squeezed orange juice.  There's nothing like seeing some honest elbow greased pulp in your juice to let you know it's the real deal.

Great service, friendly atmosphere, plenty of parking.  We'll definitely drop by when we're in the area again.

Service was outstanding from the beginning to the end of our visit. We were seated immediately after we walked in the full restaurant. The person who seated us also took our drink orders so we didn't have to wait for our waitress to get freed up. 

I ordered the waffle works with strawberries and cream on top, came with turkey  sausage,  and eggs. The waffle  tasted a little  like heaven it was cooked perfectly the strawberries were fresh and sweet.  The sausage were tasty, and the scrabble eggs which I ordered egg whites were nice and fluffy.  I even redeemed my free banana  nut muffin.  Apparently, everyone loves the muffin but honestly I'm not in to banana  nut and this one did not change my mind. They give you so much food that you don't have room to eat another bite if you can finish the meal at all.

Egg and I had the best food, value and service that I found in Vegas for breakfast.

Absolutely amazing! The place was busy but we were still seated right away. We didn't have to wait at all for our food. Our banana nut muffins were so fresh they were still warm. We all got different things off of the menu and liked everything we had. Lisa was our waitress- she was very friendly, and very efficient.  We will definitely stop here again when we visit vegas!

Nice atmosphere. I loved the wall murals. Friendly staff. I enjoyed the food. I had the classic platter with bacon. Eggs, bacon, bread. 

If you want to depart from the chain restaurant and have more of a country restaurant atmosphere this is a nice spot. Sometimes I like to just sit and journal for a bit and they were ok with people "camping out" in the restaurant. 

Be mindful of the hours when you come. I believe they do their last seating at 3pm so give yourself enough time to relax and enjoy. 

I would definitely come back. Can you find better food elsewhere? Yes. But the atmosphere is really enjoyable and sometimes that's more than enough.

Was a Fan of this place until recently. Stopped in real quick to pick up one of their delicious "homemade" blueberry muffins. Was quite disappointed when I was handed a Sara lee muffin still in the wrapper and sent on my way. They charged me $2.50 for this muffin I could have gotten at any gas station for 50 cents. Extremely underwhelmed today.

I'm from Los Angeles and there is no breakfast place like this. I highly recommend it. The breakfast dishes are very creative and mighty tasty. There is a huge variety of food to choose from. 

If you are able, ask to be served by Brady. He was a great server with a good sense of humor. He will make you feel like a welcomed guest.
So very delicious it's off the strip but worth the trip! You get so much food, you will definitely be stuffed when leaving this place .

Best breakfast AND service in town.  Standard breakfast items are very good, but the variations are even better.  The Benny, the Hawaiian dishes like loco moco, and the banana-in-anything you want are awesome.  

Lots of free and easy parking.  Restaurant is super clean and nice.  Special shout out to Cheryl for the excellent service and great suggestions!

Food... Eggs'cellant !  (sorry) had to do that.  Agree with the other reviews here, the homemade banana-nut muffin was worth the drive.  Served warm...and I'm not a banana 'anything' lover,  but I'd order it again anytime.  This review is more about our Waitress, her name is Linnea.  We were seated promptly, and quickly thereafter a smiling young woman appeared at our table, offering water and taking drink orders.  Each time she returned to our table she had such a  genuinely  engaging smile.  "Now there is a young woman who is one of God's Happy Creatures" I said.  She truly was delightful!
Must come here. Brady is one of the best waiter here. Attentive and friendly. Makes you feel at home. Food is GREAT here. Had the Western omelette and the muffin was delicious.

After indulging us too much the day before at the Bellagio Buffet, we looked for a nice and decent original coffee shop - or such. The day before my lady had found a voucher in a tourist magazine together with the notion of a review that this place (i.e. both) we're very liked with the community and the reviewers, in fact best liked.

Being a no brainer it turned up trumps in reality: The place was VERY busy (which we took as a good sign to start with) yet being seated only took a moment and the service was very fast and attentive. Food variety on the menue is almost too big ;-) so I quite took my time to decide. Got an italian influenced omelette which turned out to be very tasty. 
One more thing about the service: Our little boy didn't like his fries because they came spiced (paprika or the likes)... they were replaced with plain ones in no time - comped !

A little before the food arrived a nice and cheerful lady of the staff came over and chatted us up a bit. Her expert eye didn't fail to note that we were out-of-towners. Later, I found out that she was actually the manager (owner?) and had the same first name as my darling ! When she heard that I failed to order the banana nut muffin (house specialty) she had one sent to our table immediately - again, complementary !

I guess I don't need to say more. Prices very reasonable, yummy food with a lot of variety...wish we had breakfast places like that in Berlin lol.

Since I guess we will return to Las Vegas at some point in our lives I can clearly see us going there again !

Used to be my favorite place, now i'll never return :(. The service was fine but there was a hair in my skillet and I got food poisining as well. So disappointed as I used to love this spot but I have no tolerance for a dirty restaurant.

A great place for a hearty American breakfast close to the strip, not walking distance, but worth the visit. There's always a wait, so be prepared. Don't dare walk away. 

On my last visit I got the corned beef hash with wheat toast and their breakfast potatoes. It was delicious! I also ordered their mimosa... which serves about 2-3 regular mimosa servings. 

The prices are really reasonable for what you get. Don't forget to check-in on Yelp for your free banana muffin! It's to die for!

Been coming to Egg & I for over 10 years and the food and service is always excellent. 

Today, there was an issue with the bill where the server accidentally gave our check to another table. We had to wait a while to get it handled with the manager but it was no big deal - we were in no hurry. The manager ended up comping our meal and all we paid was tip. Wow, thanks so much Egg & I. We will always be back!!

So this morning, I had a sleep study and w decide to do breakfast early and came to one of favorite joints around. 

Karla was excellent, she we barely awake and had issue ordering and she was patient and wonderful. 

I even got muffins to go for the couple of days 

Trust me when I say there nothing on this menu and isn't less than perfect.  I am in love w the piggy skillet, the strawberry French toast is great too !  Chicken enchilada for breakfast is out of this world. 

The hardest thing about egg and is deciding what to order. ! But always get a banana nut muffin is a must have staple !! 

Thanks for a great morning Karla !!

Ok. Love this chain. Not sure about this location. They seem to always be busy. Saying that.... 

Hire more help. Train your staff to help each others customers not ignore them.

Once our server Ashley came over things improved. Food came out quick. Tasted great. Score went from a * to a *** only because the ball started rolling.

While on a family vaca, we decided to hit a spot off the strip for breakfast, and man this was a jackpot. Great for the kids.  They greeted us with balloons, and where extremely friendly.  I had the Chorizo skillet and it was the bomb!!  Super crispy potatoes.  Grubby mixture of everything else.  Also comes with a very good banana nut muffin on the side.  They leave the carafe of coffee at the table.  

Hit the spot and wish they had one near me in So Cal.

The Egg & I was a very nice breakfast spot for locals and visitors.  Our server was BREE.  She was wonderful and provided us with outstanding customer service while recommending several breakfast dishes.  We were pleasantly surprised to see that they had Portuguese Sausage.  For anyone that has been to Hawaii, it was a great treat to find.  If you go, ask to be in the section of Bree, she is wonderful.

I stopped by here when I was at a conference in Vegas. A friend of mine was also in Vegas and had his car and said he could take me off the strip to eat if I wanted to work of course I took him up on the offer. Browsed through yelp and found this cute joint. The good portions are HUGE and yummy. I also liked that they have the happy egg or sad egg card that you put on a stand to let wait staff know you need something instead of them constantly checking on you. I say if you're in the area or in Vegas with a car this would be a great breakfast stop. Also, if you check in you get free banana bread -- mhmmm.

Coming here is a MUST every time I go to Vegas. The food is amazing and the banana bread is to die for! The portions are good. I usually share the omelet and potatoes with a side of pancakes and leave super full. Also, love that they leave a carafe of coffee on the table so you can do your own refills! I love the Egg and I and we need one in LA! 

This last time we were there we had a waitress named Tam and she was the best! Tam was super funny and a great waitress. The place was packed per usual and she still managed to be attentive and never miss a beat.

This place gets crowded come early for breakfast or later like lunchtime. Their freshly baked banana muffin is fantastic! My sister doesn't like bananas but she ate it up. Everything I've ordered has been tasty.

Our amazing server Jessica was super helpful at providing us with recommendations (loved the waffle with strawberries and whipped cream), super attentive at providing us with water refills, and super caring by checking in on us periodically during our meal. As always awesome potatoes- good job Egg&I and Jessica!
Great staff and customer service Food was fresh and Great First time Being here Definitely coming back thanks for the great Service Alexa
Great breakfast and service. Very friendly staff, especially our waitress, Liza. We'll be back!

More like 3.5 stars for me but I'm going to round it up to 4 because of their yummy banana nut muffin and breakfast potatoes which are the stars of the show here!  I ordered Brad's Very Special Omelette with spinach, mushrooms, tomato, and cheese which was about 3 stars to me - good but not the best I've had.  I chose to have it with their famous muffin and potatoes which are delicious!  

Got here around 1 p.m. on a Thursday afternoon and there were plenty of available tables.  Service was good and prompt and prices pretty low so for those reasons I can also round up from 3.5 to 4 stars.  I definitely enjoyed my food and overall experience here more than at Hash House A Go Go, so save on waiting time and come on over to Egg & I!

E&I was definitely one of my favorite meals here in Vegas. Originally my friends and I wanted to eat at Peppermill for brunch before leaving Vegas but the wait for 6 people was over 40 minutes. Called in to check for the wait here and was happy enough to find that we would only have to wait for 20 minutes despite it being packed.

There isn't much space inside for customers to sit while waiting for their table; you'll most likely have to wait outside and that kind of sucks especially in the hot summer weather. When we got seated, we were promptly given the menu and starter drinks. Service here is on point. Karla, our server, went out of her way to make everything as easy as possible for us. Instead of having us go to the front ourselves to split our check, she went ahead and split it six ways for us. I LOVE YOU KARLA.

Food portion here is very generous. You definitely will get the bang for your buck because most of the food items costs $8-$12 and only one person in my group was able to finish his order. Whatever you order, make sure the potatoes are included or order it on the side! There's Cajun seasoning on it, I think, and it's amaaaazing. You won't regret coming here!

P.S. there's this cute egg centerpiece on your table. Instead of flagging a waitress\/waiter down, just flip it from its black side to the yellow side and someone will come to your table. How cool is that??

Beyond the incredible breakfast I had (prime rib, spinach Benny) the service surpasses excellence! I'm happily greeted by every staff member I make eye contact with and blown away by the speed and response of any and all of my request. 

They pay attention to you! 

That says it all for any good restaurant. Of course, the restaurant was very clean as were the entire visible staff. Keep up the great work guys, I'll be returning here until the end of time. That damn good!

Excellent quality of food for a very good price with a substantial menu. This is it. You don't need to go to any other breakfast place or diner. Why do Denny's and IHOP even exist with places like this around? Apparently many others share the same sentiment because the place was packed.
Good food, friendly and super-efficient staff really ensure you are well taken care of.  Cute place, seems to be popular with the locals.

Amazing brunch stop before your trip home from Vegas! If you check in you get a free banana nut muffin. Not just one for the table, one for each person checking in! Service was speedy and friendly. Food portions are generous so you can order a couple things and share to taste more of the menu.

For years, the Egg & I was our "go-to" spot to take visiting guests for breakfast. But it had been a while since we stopped in. Good to know that when we took two friends to eat there on their recent visit, nothing has changed. Same huge menu; same great service; and same fantastic seasoned potatoes!

I had the bacon and avocado omelet, and my husband had the Cincy chili omelet, both with sides of potatoes (of course!). One of our friends ordered the Country Benny, and the other had an order of potatoes with a side of brown gravy. We all left pleased and sated, and my husband and I had leftovers as well!

Everything on the menu looks fantastic, but I suggest getting an egg dish (seeing how the name of the place is "The Egg & I"!) The "Three Pigs" and the mashed potato omelets are good bets, along with all the other items mentioned above. And definitely get the seasoned potatoes. Although my husband thinks they're overseasoned, I humbly disagree. To me, they're the best in town!

Awesome place! Came here in October w family. There is a little bit of a wait (20mins for a table), but completely worth it! About 15mins from the Las Vegas strip, this is the best breakfast spot we found during our vacay! Awesome food, BIG portions! Best banana-but muffin we have ever tried! Decent prices. 
*Try this place out! You will not be disappointed!*
I tried their Chile Rellenos Omelette it sounded good so I thought I give it a try and I wasn't disappointed. Very busy but service was fast and everyone was so pleasantly friendly

Very popular, off-strip, local friendly, fast, friendly service, great food and atmosphere.  What more could you want in a breakfast place?  I had the banana pancakes and my husband had the pork Benedict and we were both very happy and full afterwards.
Our waitress Tabatha was very lovely and helpful. the food is great. We enjoyed it a lot.

My husband & I found it on YELP and we were not disappointed.  Loved it!  We had to wait a few minutes but it was worth the wait!  I ordered an omelette with bacon, cheese and avocado & my husband had something else (ha...I was so into my breakfast I didn't notice) and he loved it.
