The  seasoning on the potatoes was wonderful and I tried the "Pepperdoux" sauce.  Loved it so much I asked if I could buy some and they said YES!  Thanks for giving us a reason to leave the strip!

Absolutely amazing!!!!  Everything about this place was absolute perfection!  From getting seated to the food and most importantly the service. Our waitress' name was Karen. She went above and beyond. We was quick and super sweet!  She was great with everything including our children. People aren't recognized often enough for their good deeds. Karen was exceptional and I hope she is recognized beyond this review!  We will definitely be back!!!

Good food, good service!  We had the banana bread French toast, fruit plate, corned beef hash and steak and eggs.  We were all stuffed and satisfied with our yummy meals!  Oscar provided great service, too!

Decided to give this place a try during our Vegas stay and its actually really good! The banana nut french toast was amazing!!!! Great presentation and delicious!! Our server Alexa was very friendly and attentive! Would come back if I wasn't leaving tonight!

Must go to for brunch if you're in Vegas. Waited 15 mins to be seated but it was well worth it. Food is great and price is reasonable. And portions are HUGE. I couldn't finish half my The Works Omelette. Comes with banana nut muffin which is amazing.
The banana nut muffin was delish, a must have! Service was wonderful thanks to Karla for making our experience wonderful!
Our waitress DONNA was amazing. Genuine restaurant and server. All the food was fantastic and the only thing better than the food was the marketing for a cafe style restaurant. Very impressed

The wait to get a table at 9:35am was THIRTY FREAKING MINUTES.  Plan ahead.  The menu is huge, and a little confusing, as the staples are towards the back (eggs, pancakes and waffles) while they seem to push several styles of eggs Benedict and four-egg omelettes (not a fan, blech.)  Service was what I expect from a half-decent diner - fast and punctual.  My waffle was not served with real maple syrup, which was a major bummer.  The potatoes that are included with the standard egg breakfast were small squares but were cooked perfectly and tasted a lot like French fries from Fuddruckers (heavy on the Thyme, which gives them a reddish, golden-brown color.) There's a little stand at the table with two metal egg badges. The first, in black, is a happy egg face which states to the wait staff that all is well.  The second is an egg-face in bright yellow with a somewhat consternated egg-face which signifies to the wait staff that you're either unhappy with the meal, but mostly tells them you need something.  I was in a particularly crappy mood, so I kept flipping the egg-face to the bright yellow unhappy egg-face, and the waitress was getting perturbed with me.  The turkey sausage was pretty tasty, so I'd recommend people order it if they decide to eat here.  In general, take it or leave it.

Another breakfast place serving up obscenely huge, greasy portions of artery-clogging nonsense. However, they do some good healthy choice options on the menu that are fan-fuckin'-tastic! 

The food quality is excellent and they have a patio for al fresco dining...although the patio faces out onto West Sahara Ave, an insanely busy thoroughfare clogged with carcinogen-belching traffic. So maybe not the BEST place to sit outdoors.

When considering breakfast spots on the West side, it's between this, the Coffee Pub (better alfresco dining atmo) and the Omelet House kitschier, retro vibe). All three are great, though.
best breakfast in vegas, screw the fat ho bag buffets, this place was delicious, the tri-tip benedict, got handled! fresh, friendly, and tasty!

We absolutely ADORED this place! Everything was delicious. There was no wait & our server was on top of her game. We had a party of 5 & enjoyed corned beef hash, tostada bowl, omelettes, French toast & a few carafes of coffee. Their muffins are hot, moist and delicious & their salsa is amazing! I'm not sure what they do their potatoes, but best we ever had! Such a gem! We will be back as soon as we touch down in Vegas again.
Great service n food! Thanks Ulises!! I will definitely come back when in town thank you

Excellent food and service !!!

Had the beef burito and veggie skillet with eggs on top !!! 

And got chicken ceaser egg - 

Highly recommended - highly generous portion !!

Egggggsellant breakfast! Come early....long lines if u out don't come by 9ish. I had the Benny, husband had the biscuits and gravy. He's southern and picky about his gravy. He gave it two thumbs up. Highly recommended this place.

The food was good and the service was great!

Amanda was our server and was flawless! It's rare to get perfect service, being friendly, attentive, and timely all at the same time, but she did it. She was genuine and deserves a vacation for working so hard ;) Thank you for a great eggsperience!

Food was good. We came off the strip to eat here. They got us seated quickly even though it was busy. 

Jessica our server was cool and nice. Send her to meet the mouse.

Only con, was that they didn't bring all the food out at once. I had to wait to eat until my girlfriend got her food. NBD.
Manuela was my server and she was very sweet and down to earth. That's the thing about this place, the food isn't the only awesome thing, the people are too.

Food looked really good.. I was happy with my Spinach Benny.. Hollendaise Sauce was a bit salty.. the potatoes were interesting .. one piece salty and the next plain.. next piece spicy.. the rest of the party was hit or miss.. I liked the eggs.. 

A bit salty for everyone's taste..

My sister and I had been pretty excited about coming here after reading all about it on Yelp.  It seemed to be really busy with lots of people waiting outside (on a Sunday afternoon), but we luckily only had to wait about 10 minutes before we were seated.  

Our server was super nice.  She really helped elevate the entire experience.  When we asked for banana nut muffins to go with our entrees, she asked if it was our first time there.  We told her yes and she said the muffins were free for first timers!  Hope that's true and I'm not getting anyone in trouble by posting that info here.  

I ordered the Eggs Benedict Florentine & it came with those little (obviously frozen) and highly seasoned potatoes.  Overall I enjoyed the dish, but there was so much Hollandaise sauce that the English muffin got pretty soggy and the ham was really quite bad.  It was cut in thick slices and was very rubbery.  It almost tasted canned or something.  I took the ham off and it was much better that way.  However, the whole thing was a runny, saucy mess.  The poached eggs were cooked perfectly though.  My sister unfortunately didn't enjoy her blueberry pancakes too much.  This might sound strange, but they were way too fluffy for both of us & just didn't taste that great.  We both loved the muffins though.  That very well may have been the best part of the whole meal.  

Despite the rubbery ham, I'd definitely come back.  The service was excellent and I feel confident that we'll both be able to find other dishes on the menu that suit us better.  Plus.... those banana nut muffins!  You'd be a fool not to try one.

First time here and best breakfast I've had in Vegas! Period. Yes, the food was delicious - I had the green chile hash - but on top of this, the service was second to none. Thanks Karla for everything. I would highly recommend eating here. Worth the drive from the strip....

Good, but not the best.  Had the Ultimate Skillet and a waffle, and was satified, but did not leave raving about the food.  Was seated within 15 minutes even though the restaurant was busy.  Waitress was great -- friendly and on top of it.  I would recommend BabyStacks over Egg & I if you're looking for a truly amazing breakfast.

I was soooo excited to try this place but it ust did not have anything special for me, I do love breakfast dishes but maybe getting a table in the outside patio in a windy day at 55 degrees without heaters, was not a good idea to enjoy my experience. 

We waited for around 40 minutes to get our table and were surprised they did not have heaters. 
If they know winters are on the cold side in Las Vegas, not sure why they don't invest some money  get a few of them.

I ordered the Crazy chicken omelette ($11) and it added up to my non enjoyable experience. It was flavorless, and the chicken and mushrooms were inexistent. 
Overload of flavorless cheese on top of my omelette. 
The habla Diablo fries were pretty good.

The banana muffin was the best part of my . It was warm when it came out and got a second one as I checked in in yelp! 

My boyfriend got the Corned beef hash and it was good but again not the best breakfast\/brunch I had in my life!

I might come back just to try something else and figure out if it was my meal that wasn't good. However, I don't feel like recommending it to anyone. 

Cheers!
When I was skipped over in line for a table someone immediately took care of the over sight. The food and service was excellent. Definitely will be back next time in Nevada

Tamara has made a day. She had gone above and beyond for us. She has this great skill of making the best recommendations and so friendly. Brought everything we asked for and kept checking on us. Thank you Tamara because of you I'll keep coming back to the Egg and I.
Great breakfast spot. I would recommend the Kay's Special omelet and the banana muffin definitely my go to at this place.
Beast breakfast place I have ever eaten at. I'm from out of town and we ended up doing here twice because the food is so good!!!!

Great place for breakfast and the price is just right.  Plenty of parking since it is away from the strip.  Dining area is immaculate and bright.  Servers are always hanging smile on their face.  They are friendly and attentive, always give you suggestion if you have a hard time to choose your breakfast.  Food serve hot and they are very home-made.  Portion is good and they are not too greasy for my taste.

Their menu is printed on a newspaper, very creative and interesting.

I love breakfast. There's just something good about starting your morning off right. Where else can I get a banana nut muffin that's just fresh and oozing with flavor and goodness. This is the place that will help you get that fresh start right. Nice sit down cafe that makes the best breakfast out in Vegas. 

I had my first date with my gf here so this place always has a special place in my heart....
Best breakfast that I have had in a long time. The country Benny plate is really good. Karla was an excellent server. Good experience. I would go back.

Very pupolar place for breakfast lovers. Exceptional must-have-to-die-for banana nut muffin & habla diablo potatoes, friendly service & generous portion. Highly recommended blacken prime rib benny & stuff french toast.

First of all if you like service that alone will make you want to like this place.  After being served by Karla you will love this place.  She was very attentive And was there in a jiffy. I do love me some good service. I had the Santa a Cruz scramble which did not disappoint. For the big eaters it's big enough to split you can have your choice of Toast or their famous Banana Nut Muffin. By the way Yelp check in gets you a free Muffin. Love me some rewards. My Skillet was delicious. Very fresh with all the fixings. This place will definitely be in my Vegas rotation. Parking can be an issue it seems, but the area seems busy. Not to mention several out of town license plates which equates to people trying to get their directions straight. At any rate don't be denied. This place is worth the off the strip adventure.

Eggsellent service! Get it? Get it?!!? This place is very popular, and there was a 20 minute wait when we arrived. It's in a small strip mall off Sahara Ave, and it is definitely worth going. They have a choice of various toasts or their famous banana nut muffins to start. They keep the bottomless coffee cup tradition going. To top it off, their eggs are all perfectly cooked! I got the hashbrown skillet, and it was fantastic. The potatoes were a little dry, but they had a nice seasoning. The prices are very reasonable, and the portion sizes are a bit on the large size.
Love, Love, Love this place!!! Every time I go its so delicious. Especially the steak and eggs. And the service is fantastic. Thanks Liliana!

That giant jug of freshly squeezed orange juice is totally the way to go! The spam personally was too thick for me it needed to be cut in half and cooked a little crispier however I was still happy because NO WHERE has spam for breakfast! The food was really good! Deff worth going to!!! I love hole in the walls and I loved it more that it wasn't on the strip and the customer service was amazing. Our server killed it!

Honestly the place was busy, clean, and expedient. Our server Alexa checked in frequently but not so much that I would be irritated. She always showed up with a smile and I love that in a waitress... the only reason I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 is I wasn't the biggest fan of the food seemed a lil over seasoned.

Another great breakfast from the Egg & I. Karla took great care of us and her southern hospitality shined. We live in Southern California and crave the Egg & I so much we make trips to Vegas just for the breakfast. My wife and I shared the biscuits and gravy and meat skillet. The gravy was the best gravy we have ever had and the biscuit was perfect. However the best part of the meal was the banana muffin. This muffin will keep you coming back. And when you check in on Yelp, you get a free muffin. This place is a must when in Vegas!

Generous portions, great service, and the food tasted amazing.
A special shout out to Karla who I hope goes to Disney Land soon. She deserves it :)

Also, the banana nut bread is a MUST try.

Found this place on Yelp...thanks!

Whenever we are in Vegas we try to eat off the strip. We were heading out of town and this place hit the spot.

Just a little diner type place (nothing fancy) but the servie was friendly and the food YUMMY!

The menu is HUGE.

We sampled the pancakes, waffle, eggs and home fries.
 
The home fries were SOOOOOOO good!

Also since my son requested no meat (his came with bacon) they offered fruit.....a whole plate of berries, citrus, and melons....It was great!

We will definatly be going back next time we are in town!
Great breakfast..not a big long wait...probally were the locals go.....I'd go next time in town for sure

This place is awesome! We had Erin as our server, she was great! She was very sweet and attentive to our table.

My boyfriend and I got two dishes to share because we couldn't decide! We started off with banana nut muffins (this is a must, they are home made!) I got the Texas toast French toast and my boyfriend got, 'The Crazy Chicken' Omelette both were very tasty and cooked to perfection! 

I would definitely go back here!

Come HUNGRY.  Seriously, you will get more food than you can handle.  The place is packed so plan on waiting.  The skillet breakfasts are delish.  I had the chicken, mushroom & broccoli skillet but also tried the country fried steak.  The banana nut muffin that comes with most dishes is also quite very moist and tasty.  No alcohol so one ding for that, but otherwise, a very good place to get your grub on.

I came here for breakfast with a few people the other day. The restaurant was packed and we had to wait about 10-15 minutes. I ordered the corned beef hash which was homemade. Good flavor and lots of it! My niece really liked it and ended up eating about half of it. My niece actually ordered the waffle with bananas on top (strawberries were out of season). This girl can eat but is skinny as a stick. Kids! One of the other ladies had Portuguese sausage, rice and eggs. They give you a whole sausage and it's pretty big. Whoa now, I'm talking about food! The other lady had spam & eggs which she really liked. We all got the banana muffin with our meals. YUM! We had a good breakfast and may be back again when we're in Vegas.

Overall the best place you can go for a breakfast in Vegas. Their muffins and potatoes are to die for! That's actually the reason I keep going back lol. Oh and of course they're superb customer service. 

I think to run a restaurant business you need three things:
1. Great customer service 
2. Amazing food
3. Great atmosphere to enjoy that food

This well run food joint has it all covered and makes me keep going back and others as well. There is always a wait to be seated but not a long one. 

Enjoy!
Kat was a doll and the food was incredible. Must try! I recommend trying the stuff French toast with strawberry and cream. Delicious!!!!
Paula is a great server- very considerate and helpful. Banana nut muffin is good. Skillet of bacon ham and sausage is filling and satisfying. Good place for brunch!

I just love social media! Well after my review the manager Katy contacted me and told me she had my cousin's purse holder. She claim she didn't have my contact info I had left with the employee I spoke with. Since then that employee has been delt with. I'm happy that she reached out to me. I passed on the info to my cousin and she apologized for the whole incident......I'm grateful to say she sent my cousin her purse holder. She said she could tell it was valuable and put it in a safe. She was a woman of her word and I thank her. I glad of the turn out, because the food was good and I would love to dine there again.  Now I will dine there and spread the word. Next time I'm there I would like to meet her and thank her personally. There are some good people in the world.

I wanted some American breakfast other than the breakfast I had in my hotel. So I came across this restaurant on Yelp. 

The restaurant is located in a plaza so there was plenty of parking. 

Luckily for me there was no wait time so I was quickly seated with the menu. I ordered the omelette with the home fries which was absolutely delicious. I also ordered the French toast which was also tasty. What I would recommend you getting is the banana nut bread. It is out of this world! 

The food came quick and the prices were very reasonable. 

My server was very attentive and helped me big time with my order because it was very complicated. I don't remember his name but he was a young Hispanic man. 

I'd definitely recommend this restaurant if you are in Vegas.
I made the wrong choice and got the tacos, which were so salty I could not finish them. I also prefer authentic Mexican tacos, so no go for me.
Best breakfast place in Vegas for the price. Our waiter, Oscar, killed it. This guys should own the place. We come here everything were in town. Bobillinanate
Needed a nice meal before my mini plays a volleyball tournament today. This place reminded me of a place in temecula we go to. The service was great and food was yummy.

Best Breakfast in town.
Had their Chicken Fried Steak Skillet, was to die for! Their awesome potatoes on the bottom, next cut up chicken fried steak, then smothered in the most flavorful country gravy I have ever eaten, then topped off with your choice of eggs and a side of toast or banana muffin. I went with the Banana muffin, which was absolutely delicious.

I ended up revisiting for the country fried steak skillet before I left Vegas to go home.  

I give 2 thumbs up all the way and would recommend this to any and everybody.

Delicious food! Great service! 
No better way to start off your day. I tried the Mexican Omelette and it was amazing! The banana nut muffins are out of this world.  I will definitely be going back soon !!

LOVE THIS PLACE! I think I have found my new favorite breakfast place. Move over, Hash House!

I've been wanting to go here for a long time and was so happy that my friend's house is only a few blocks away! I got our food to go since we had to start driving back home to LA and it only took 10 minutes. 

I ordered the bacon avocado and cheese omelette. Yum! The ranch potatoes on the side were effing awesome. The seasoning had just the right amount of kick to it. I gobbled everything up. You get to choose between toast and the banana nut muffin so of course I got the muffin. Holy moly! Delicious! It was so soft and moist I could have eaten 5 more. I wish I got some to go. I don't even like bananas!

Joe got Kay's special which has spinach, swiss, artichoke. It was pretty good but I liked my ABC better. :)

Get the orange juice. So good! Just the right amount of pulp, sweetness, and tartness.
Love the four egg omelet and the marbled rye toast. They leave the pot of coffee with you so you never run out. More food than I could eat. Service is fast and friendly. Love this place.
Carol Ann was great!!  Food is always good here. It's always super busy. I don't know how they get to everyone so quickly,  but they do. Just another great experience here.

Found this place a couple of visits ago, and we now have it on our must-hit list when we visit LV.  It is off-strip, but still gets somewhat busy at times, so be prepared to wait.  Highly recommend this place for breakfast - Very reasonable prices for quality & portions.  ($23-24 total for Eggs Benedict & Biscuits & Gravy)

The eggs benedict are our favorite here (totally smothered with Hollandaise).  FYI - They serve their "Diablo Potatoes", but change to Hash Browns or unseasoned potatoes if ordering for kids or watching sodium (The Diablo version appears to be just a ton of seasoned salt added.)

Excellent & friendly service!

NOTE:  Not a fan of giving up a cell number so they can text you when your table's ready.  We didn't - We're kinda paranoid about giving out any info as it can become part of a unsolicited marketing email spam.  (Not saying that's what they do, but we just don't do it.)

Venturing off the strip in Vegas this morning was the best decision we made all weekend. In a funky Sahara strip mall lies the Egg and I. Without our love and faith in Yelp, we never would have found this place.

Nearly every table was filled on a Monday morning. Our servers name was Debra and she was prompt, friendly and very knowledgable  about the menu items. 

The menu is pretty extensive. They do just about anything you can imagine with an egg. I ordered the bacon and avo omelette and my husband had the chile relleno omelette. We ordered a side of Diabla sauce, which came warm and was the perfect compliment. Our omelettes were moist, perfectly cooked, and stuffed with fresh ingredients. The potatoes at Egg and I were nothing short of addictive. It took what little will power I had on our last morning in Vegas to push away from my plate.

We will come here for breakfast every time we are in Vegas now.

Came back again hoping for 4 stars on a Saturday morning but the service ..  how do i put this nicely - it sucked. Our waitress wasn't very attentive. We were seated right away since our party of 5 decided we would sit outside to avoid the wait (TIP!!!!) It was nice for a while until it started getting humid and nasty but we stuck it through.

We had the Eggceptional Omelette (3 stars), Bacon Avocado & Egg (4 stars) - these flavors ALWAYS mesh well together!, The chicken fried steak skillet (5 stars) and the cinnamon raisin french toast (2 stars).

A tip: stay away from the cinnamon raisin french toast. Couldn't taste the cinnamon in it at all and it was kind of soggy. Not the heavenly experience in your mouth you get when you think of french toast ... mmmm. BUT get the chicken fried steak skillet!!! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT. Scrambled eggs on top. So yummy.

And of course, the banana nut muffin is still my favorite of all time here!

The Egg and I has been a staple breakfast restaurant in Las Vegas for almost 30 years, and for good reason. The breakfast is always consistent and good. Although I've never had lunch here I can tell you I have been having breakfast here for a very long time. My favorite thing to order for breakfast is Chorizo & Eggs. From time to time I also like to order the Patriot Belgian Waffle which is very good. I also like the Viva La France French Toast two pieces of brioche bread dipped in homemade batter and griddled golden brown. If you like omelettes I would recommend two, first the Egg-Ceptional Omelette (Sausage, Smoked Ham, Crisp Bacon, House-Roasted Onions, Tomatoes and Crimini Mushrooms with melted Jack and Cheddar) topped with sour cream and fresh herbs. Served with dressed greens and an English muffin. It's very good and possibly their most popular Omelette. My personal favorite is the Mexican Omelette (Chorizo, Chiles, House-Roasted Onions, Jack and Cheddar) topped with salsa or pork green chili, sour cream and fresh herbs. Served with seasoned ranch potatoes and a flour tortilla. It's delicious. If you happen to be a breakfast person this place is a must try.

What a find. Came here yesterday for our first time. Saw the line and thought there would be a long wait. To my surprise, it was only 15 minutes. Had the center cut pork chops. Cooked to perfection. Our waitress was Tamara and she was very friendly and attentive. Came back today for another visit and still packed, but seated quickly. Oscar was our waiter this time. Suggested the Bloody Mary's. Very tasty. Nice suggestion. Oscar was very attentive as well. Staff is great. Having the Country Fried Chicken Steak today. Kudos to the ownership. Man, what a goldmine. Great food and great service equals great success, but they already figured that out !!

Alexa was fantastic. Breakfast was delicious. Definitely worth the wait. Omelettes are huge, corned beef hash amazing, and biscuits and gravy delish. Somewhere off the Vegas strip where the locals eat. Not a bad place to be!

Definitely a local hangout which I  like because I will try to avoid the Strip for food when I visit.  The Egg Crepe was good, but I like their potatoes.  I  didn't try the banana nut muffin,  but am kicking myself for not doing it.   There's always a next time!

Maple Bacon Stuffed French Toast and the banana nut muffins were delicious! We were afraid it would be too sweet and overwhelming, but since you can just dip the French toast in the maple spread (it's not actually stuffed) and syrup it's just enough! Highly recommend splitting this with someone! We split that and the bacon, avocado omelet with potatoes which was also great. Portions are healthy and prices are very reasonable. Erin, our waitress, was an absolute pleasure!

The food and service here are amazing! Even though it looks like it may be a long wait--it isn't! The place is large and worth the wait anyway! Their muffins are fresh baked and their food is delicious! Also, I love their happy egg\/sad egg to get the server's attention--genius! And did I mention wonderful service? Highly recommended!

So excited we got to eat here! We traveled to Las Vegas with our two young children and NEEDED a family breakfast spot.  I read tons of Yelp reviews and decided to come here.  So glad I did!

They were pretty crowded when we arrived but they somehow had a table available and sat us down right away.  My 1.5 year old was super cranky and everyone who worked there smiled and tried to get him to lighten up- no eye rolling or snippy comments.  

The kids got super cute menus that looked like little books\/newspapers and crayons.  It kept my daughter well entertained.  Our server was friendly and super quick.  I got the eggs benedict and I'm not sure why.  I had never had it before.  There must've been a picture of it in the menu or something.  But let me tell you, it was SO good!  I've since ordered it back home in Chicago a couple different times and NOTHING compares to the one I had from Egg & I.  

Each table has a little egg figure on it.  One side is a happy egg and the other side is a sad egg.  If you need ANYTHING you just turn your egg to sad and someone IMMEDIATELY tends to you- even in the chaos of a super busy day.  We needed more napkins and had more than we knew what to do with within seconds.  

The food was great.  The price was average.  The service was amazing.  The place seemed very clean and had fun whimsical decor.  They handled being very busy and I was not uncomfortable as a customer at all.  If we ever head back to Vegas, I'd come here in a heartbeat- and possibly more than once.

Lobby was full upon arrival, but still only waited less than 5 minutes. Very attentive with service, even though they were crazy busy. Food was great!! Hot, delicious and filling!! HIGHLY recommend the banana nut muffin....AMAZING!!

I had to wait about 20 minutes to get seated. 
Food was excellent. I had a great waitress that was very attentive I ordered the everything omelet.
The breakfast was great Lianna our server was polite and prompt. the menu is vast and a bit overwhelming but those potatoes are so scrumptious

This is my absolute favorite breakfast spot! I came over my birthday (July 5) and had an excellent dining experience and enjoyed the food I ordered. Every time I have dined at this location, I have received amazing service. They always have the best servers who are very knowledgeable about the menu and ways to order dishes for optimum value. Although everything I have ordered here has been very good, I love their breakfast potatoes and egg whites! The food is great and they deliver excellent service. What more can you ask for?

While the food is good this place has the worst service.  We walked in to the 2 hostesses who seemed annoyed we came and then waited until after they finally finished their conversation to seat us.  Needless to say they had no other customers besides us.  The server came over and when I asked if I could get the Works Scramble as a Works Skillet he rolled his eyes and said they already had one and it was the same.  However, it is not the same.  It has 2-3 of the same ingredients and all the rest were completely different.  After we got our check and went to the front there were 3 ladies up there, who again, completely ignored us until their conversations were over.  THE WORST SERVICE.

Overall our experience here was probably the best on our trip. The customer service was great...almost to the point where it was annoying. 

The banana nut muffins are the best I've ever tasted and I don't even like banana nut muffins!

We got the greek style omelet and eggs benedict florentine. The EB were some of the best I've had. My omelet was good, but I should have ordered the everything omelet as our server suggested. The home potatoes were very good also.

You can tell this is one of the places that Las Vegas locals go too. I'm realizing sometimes the further off the strip you go, the better.

This is now on my top 3 breakfast places...

Great food and service. Our server Karla was awesome, my ten year old said it was picky eater approved! Free muffins were "eggcellant". Visiting from LA and wanted something off the strip. The portions were large and prices were reasonable. Would definitely come back. Even the wait time was fairly short considering they were very busy.

Awesome breakfast and awesome server! Manuela was so attentive and probably the best server I have encountered in a very long time. I highly recommend the Crazy Chicken omelette! If your appetite is big get the whole thing (half portions also available). Best banana nut muffins too! You can't go wrong here!
Cute little restaurant!  The food was wonderful!! I highly recommend the cinnamon raisin French toast or the harvest pancakes!!

Good, clean place. Food came as ordered and in good timing. Jessica, our server,  was nice and attentive. Food portion was reasonsble, and priced as expected. Four stars only because the food was "ok." Nothing I couldn't get elsewhere. Overall though, I would come back!
Awesome food! You get note than enough for the price. Also Kyle was our server and not only was he great and attentive, but easy on the eyes too.  we will be back!

Works Veggie Benny was really good, Chile Relleno omelette was incredible. Our server John was a sweetheart and gave us free banana nut muffins and said our drinks (Diet Coke and coffee) were on the house.

I'm always happy to find a local place in LV to have meals.  Sometimes being on the strip is just too congested and I crave some sense of normalcy... and buffets are just too much food and too expensive.

Hence I visited the Egg & I.  And it was closed.  Computers Down. :(

When I was finally able to return I looked through my newspaper style menu and was torn between the biscuits and gravy or a omelet.

I tried the artichoke omelet and sub'd for some mushrooms.  I love the fetta cheese on top and the fresh tomatoes.  One thing that lacked... I couldn't taste the artichoke... and it could probably use more mushrooms.  It was a great idea however probably would taste better with bacon and mushrooms or ham or something to that effect... Something you can actually taste.  The potatoes were really good, home fries... and more of a fries taste since they had a TON of seasoning on it.  I would prefer less seasoning, and have a bottle to the side if you want more.

Servers were very nice, there was a line of people waiting to be seated.  It was a good experience, I think I like Blueberry Hill more, but I wouldn't be opposed to returning here again.

Great food 
Breakfast delicious
We were visiting from Los Angeles. Six of us and everybody loves the food 
Customer service is the best 
They have little faces for service if you do turn the sad face around service come to your table in second
The best breakfast

Whut! This place is simply a friendly local's breakfast dive that is incredibly delicious! And the service is superb! Were were served by Thayrana who is getting married soon and was delightful. She gave us great and honest recos along with some complimentary banana nut muffins with her apologies when our food took a little bit longer than expected. Our most favorite dish was the pumpkin pancakes with chocolate chips! Highly recommend this place to all and apparently they have several locales as well!
Food & service were excellent.  Only thing needing improvement was coffee.  Way too weak - like flavored water.  Otherwise I would have given a 5.

While on vacation in Vegas, my friends had been going to the casino breakfasts, pricey and not all that. So we decided to give this place a whirl. 
Clean, friendly, great service.
WOW! What a great idea! Now it's not on "the strip", it's about 10 mins away by car, but oh so worth it!
Got the Santa Cruz Burrito- NICE! Filling was scrambled eggs, chicken, and other 'yummy-ness', tasty, great home-fries. Only $10 with lots of coffee.
Great portions, excellent flavor. Good comfort food. Everything that my friends ordered looked great. They loved theirs as well. 
Do yourself a favor, skip the breakfast buffets and casinos for breakfast. Go here!!!!!

Love the food here. Great service. Our waiter was Karla. She was sweet, friendly and helpful. Every time I'm in Vegas this is the best place to stop for breakfast. Hangover or not u need to try this place out! U will have an awesome time!

I came here with a couple friends during New Year's weekend and boy was this place packed. We ended up waiting about 30 minutes for a table for 3, but I'd say it was worth the wait. If you do the Yelp check-in you get a free banana nut muffin. Let me just say this is like 2 muffins in one and it is seriously laced with crack because everyone at the table devoured it in silence. It was pretty damn good. I ordered the stuffed french toast and the other two got skillets (Santa Cruz and Cordon Bleu). Honestly, I was not prepared for what was set down in front of me. The sandwich was MASSIVE, I could barely get through half of it. The skillets were also massive in their size and no one at our table was able to finish their food despite how HANGRY we were when we got there. Everything was super good. Although the french toast sandwich was good, I liked the Cordon Bleu skillet was amazing! The prices were super cheap for the quality and quantity you get, it's totally worth coming here, especially considering how overpriced everything on the Strip is..

Pleasant place to grab breakfast.  It's not on the strip.  It was nice to get away from the strip and have breakfast in a place that could be in almost any town I suppose in most of the states.  Service was fine, food was alright.  Not sure the food was that great to make a special trip out to this place, but if you are looking to get some good reasonable breakfast this place was fine.  

Had the avocado and bacon omelet, which was good.  Potatoes were a bit dryer than I would have preferred.  

Kids had the mouse pancakes, which they liked.

The food was good down-home cooking and we enjoyed every bite.  Beware, the portions are HUGE when you order a breakfast skillet ... big enough for two to share.  Our server Alexa was super friendly and she made us feel right at home!
Tamara was really awesome, great service and attitude. Really helpful and meticulous!
There were 4 of us.  We each ordered something different.  They adapted for smaller appetites--2 egg omelets and fruit instead of potatoes.   Highly recommend.
I had the breakfast burrito it was wonderful. .. super big I can never finish all my food here very large portions!  Great service every time I come in.. my kids and hubby love this place as well !

Egg-cellent food & service. I ordered the Loco Moco, a Hawaiian stapled & gravy is the secret. Great job guys. Karla was super friendly & patient w\/ our massive group during prime time brunch on sunday. She was soo kind as to anticipate our needs, service was efficient & everything came out hot & correct! Good work guys. Will stop by on our next visit soon!

I am just gonna rant.  Why does it take so long to cook an "unseasoned" chicken breast.  There is also an up charge for a plain chicken breast.  I thought I was saving them money when I asked for no seasoning..... Also some other food item could have been offered to eat in the meantime as a person waits patiently for 30 minutes after ordering.  It's kind of hard when your hungry and you see other people after you sit down around you get their food first.  Also I was not told at the time of ordering that I had to wait 15 min for an unseasoned chicken breast.
Incredible skillet, eggs made just right.  The potatoes were delicious and cheese melted just right. Highly recommended!

I didn't think that this restaurant deserved the four star rating it has for several reasons. The potatoes were basically over seasoned fried potatoes squares. My breakfast was good but overpriced for basic breakfast food. The muffin and service were the only highlights.

Very confused about the high reviews of this place. Yelp steered me wrong! Is steered a word?

We had a half an hour wait for an outside table on Saturday morning. The place was packed. I wouldn't say that the food was worth the wait. The food is similar to a greasy spoon diner but add a little spice. I feel like you could get the same quality basically anywhere? I got the omelet and it was only memorable because it was very greasy. The service wasn't particularly noteworthy, although I have no complaints. I won't be back here. This wasn't worth the trip.

Came here to try some new breakfast\/ brunch place. This place has a lot of variety an is pretty decent pricing compared to hash house a go go. 
Had the plain waffle in my meal and is was light and airy. The syrup is the exact amount of sweet, you not to sweet where it feels like you are drinking straight from the bottle but not so light you think it's a diabetic sugar supplement. The service was great! The only knock on this place is its a little cramped considered how popular it is and how many people are there.

Good breakfast and service.  Our waitress was helpful and you can turn the egg card around when you need service as opposed to waving some waitress down.  Smart.  Meals were large and they immediate provide you with coffee and banana bread before your meal.  Don't get full on that though since their meals are very large and if you are tourist, you don't take leftovers.  It can get very crowded so go during off times.
Don't assume because we're Hispanic we won't tip good! Got bad service... Won't be going back

We were here the first week of January, two thing were very disappointed.... First, I can't believe they charged us $3.00 freaking dollars for a jag of hot water which I only ask for a cup so I can set up baby formula for my baby.  On top of that, no one tell us that we have to pay for hot water!  If I knew, I would've order hot tea instead of ice water... at least I got tea at the end!  Second, we tried their chili.....it was horrible!  We only had couple bites, I was kinda tired and busy taking care of the baby...otherwise I'll ask them to cancel the or exchange to something else, in the same time ask them to give me a tea bag for that $3.00 hot water cost!  

We have been here few times before but this time probably will be the last!
This place was as good as the Yelp reviews say! Really really good breakfast place. Service was great, food even better. Will try one of the Eggworks places next time.

Some Words of Advice for Egg & I 

1. We came in around 10:45-11 and waited for about 15 minutes so I would say any later and you'll probably be waiting 30+ minutes..It started getting pretty busy right after we put our name down. 

2. If you are waiting in line, check out their menu cause they have a LOT of choices. 

3. Wear a sweater\/sweatshirt - I know were in Vegas but the place was blasting the AC. Even our waitress had a sweatshirt on. 

4. Order a banana bread muffin, its moist and fresh and a great snack. I ordered one after our meal because I was stuffed from my plate 

5. If you know you can't eat a whole plate of food, get the HALF order. Of course our waitress told us AFTER we finished. 

6. The pancakes were the best part of my meal - order them! Only complaint was that they served it with that fake syrup. (I'm from the East coast, I'm a little spoiled)

7. My sister didn't really care for the cinnamon toast french toast - they didn't look that great either

It was a solid breakfast for a lazy morning, I think next time I would try one of their egg-dishes since they are called Egg & I 

YELP 365: 163\/365

We did not want to have breakfast at the hotel and we decided to give this place a try. It is a great place . Service is very nice and friendly.we had Darlesia as our server , I give her 5 stars. I highly recommend The eggs & I.

I've seen it packed in early hours at almost every location and don't understand why? Breakfast is pretty regular and nothing special. Price's are decent but i'd rather go to dennys or the Omelette house.

Pretty decent (not spectacular) omelets and other egg-based dishes.

Somewhat cramped seating area.

No cloth napkins.

Many of the hotels in Las Vegas has better all-day breakfast offerings, with a much nicer  seating area and cloth napkins, at comparable prices.

If you want the best American breakfast in Vegas, don't eat where the tourists eat...yeah, don't eat at the local Casinos, long-wait Buffets or the Strip. 

You eat here. 

Probably the best, highest quality "comfort style" breakfast offerings I've seen without being overly ostentatious in the presentation, overpriced or over hyped. 

Being good at what they do, there is a slight wait for a table but since efficiency is the norm, local families get in and out without a hitch (with full tummies and smiles on their faces). 

The service and offerings here are top shelf, you're met with kindness and courtesy that accompanies a moist, warm banana muffin. 

I gotta say, because our banana nut muffins were so good.... we ordered a banana nut loaf to go. It didn't last long after we arrived back in SoCal. :)

Definitely one of our highlight meals while in Vegas.

The locals have it good here and this is one of the big reasons why.

Outstanding.

Love getting the half size (because the portions are so big) avocado bacon omelet!!!! It's sooooo delicious , I highly recommend. Food is always fast , we usually spend no longer than an hour here because they are so quick to get our food to us. They even have a little patio outside where you can eat and bring your dog!

I've been living and traveling the US in the past 5 years. This is the best and most amazing breakfastI've had. Theres always a line, so male time... but it is worth every minute!:)

Props to rachel for serving us well.:)

By far the best best banana nut muffins I have ever had in my life. They're addicting. Get a lot of them! The servers were extremely helpful and tended to us often. Everyone seemed to be in a really good mood & happy to help serve us. I really like the sad egg\/ happy egg sign at the table, that was my first time seeing that type of system but I really liked it. I ordered the CFS skillet and it was good but it was just a little too salty for me. That would be my only "complaint," but other than that, it was an absolutely enjoyable experience!
Yum Yum! Great breakfast, great service, homey and friendly. This will be our choice from now on when in Las Vegas.
By far my favorite breakfast spot in Vegas off the strip. The food and service is always great and friendly. The banana bread is a must, and if you ask for it, they usually bring for free!

Tip: They let you call ahead for reservations as long as you have 6 or more in your party!

I ALWAYS end up eating here at least once every Vegas trip. The prices are reasonable and the portions are huge! The wait to get seated or to receive food is not long and all the waiters are pretty nice. Parking is never an issue since it's a big lot shared with other shops. 

Note that for any entree that lists sides .. they let you swap out the sides! As in, you can change out what's listed there on the menu [took me a while to realize I could get fruit\/salad\/etc.]. I personally am a huge fan of their seasoned potatoes and omelettes.

Don't forget to check in in for a delicious banana nut muffin!
Banana Nut muffin was the best. Had Traditional Bennett as really good. Our server Maggie was great. When in Vegas will be in again.

I think it's really funny that I had no idea this place is the same as Egg Works. I probably wouldn't have came here had I known because I didn't much like Egg Works off of Rainbow. 

Surprisingly I thought the food and the service here at Egg & I were much more acceptable then Egg works. Boy was it busy though, I hate waiting outside...it's too damn hot in Vegas. Besides sitting in the heat waiting to be seated, I enjoyed the rest of my experience here. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the food was good (not amazing).

Most amazing breakfast restaurant. My boyfriend and I are in Vegas for a much needed vacation and this restaurant was awesome. We love going to local hole-in-the-wall breakfast places when traveling and this was the best we have ever had. This was due in no small part to the service. Roman is an excellent waiter who can anticipate guests needs. Awesome food did not hurt either! The potatoes are incredible! Looking forward to trying the banana nut muffins.
Very good food, excellent attentive staff. Our waiter was very nice.  I am happy I left the hotel to come to this great place with my family. I recommend if in Vegas stop by.

My expectations were high after seeing and reading the reviews on Yelp. 

The inside was clean and cozy looking and they had several flat screens. 

My order the corn beef with scrambled eggs and the banana nut muffin. 

The food didn't WOW me. The corn beef was average although it was home made, muffin was cold and the potatoes tasted deep fried with a to much seasoned salt. The pineapple slice and honeydue were juicy and a nice extra to the plate.

Service was good and attentive here but I probably would not return here.

We arrived early on a Monday morning and was seated right away.  Our waitress was very friendly and checked on us throughout our meal even though it had gotten pretty busy.  Our meals were enormous but so delicious.  Even though we were traveling, I brought my leftovers back to the hotel because I couldnt leave them - it was so good.  Best breakfast I've had in Vegas.
Came here a lot for breakfast and it's always been a good one. Also tried their burger steak and gravy and it's really yummy so came back the next day and ordered another one

Can't say enough great things about this place! I come here at least once a month for breakfast and every time I come the service and food is amazing!  They prepare everything so fast too. The eggs are always cooked exactly how i want them and the pancakes are so fluffy.  The prices are a little bit higher than some lithe places i won't name but everything is always good here.  It get packed on the weekends.

This is the type of breakfast i love. Delicious simple foods. I got the egg scramble and it was huge for the price. The taste was great as well. I did make one small mistake and i guess i should have ordered the banana bread but grabbed fruit instead. 

Overall this hot everything i love about diners, great food, good price, and good dark coffee. Also our waiter was extremely friendly and helpful. Will visit again in the future.

DEFINITELY WORTH THE DRIVE
We found our way here by accident last year and made a point of going back this year. Everything is delicious that we have ordered. Pork carnitas skillet was perfection. Apple cinnamon pancakes were delicious as was the often-mentioned banana nut muffin. Come hungry or share...they are generous with their portions.

Last day in Vegas and decided to eat here for brunch. Wait was 15-20 minites to get seated for a group of 5.
Food took a while to come too but it's understandable since they were busy. 
Our server Oscar, was awesome though. He was very attentive and seemed like a chill dude. When they forgot to bring out my friends muffin that was included in his meal, Oscar apologized and brought out a plate full of muffins so that we could all try :) really appreciated it ! 
Food was also pretty good and satisfyingly filling. 
I got the rib eye Benedict and it was pretty good. Also came with a side of potatoes that were seasoned real well. Great brunch place to eat in Vegas !

This was eggactly what was needed after a long night on the strip, time to realize there's more to Vegas beyond the main drag. Reasonably priced for decent portions and awesome flavors. I was blown away by the succulent carnitas dish served with country potatoes. Egg & I needs to franchise out so I can have this every weekend.
The Best Breakfast in Las Vegas, I love coming to eat at this place every time I come into town

Good place for breakfast! Love their banana nut muffin! Staff is very friendly and always there! No problems at all! I always go for the Loco Moco plus I like to add mushrooms and spinach to it! Tried the stuffed French toast that was really good! My girl had the carrot cake French toast which looked bland but she said it was good!

This is a great place for a late breakfast. Their egg dishes are incredibly good. Their pancake and waffles are on the list too. My favorite is the Kay's special with the banana nut muffin. If you have a sweet tooth, you should definitely go for the muffin instead of the toast. It's fresh and moist.  This place is not on the cheap side (you know it's LV) but the food quality and service sure deserve it.

Erin, our server, was great! We had the mashed potato omelette and the Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast. 

The omelette was very tasty and the French Toast itself was very good - we'll have to try something later that isn't quite as sweet as the Strawberry Cream Cheese. That was a bit too much sweetness for us, but it was very flavorful. 

When you're in town, or if you're local, it's well worth the visit.

That banana nut muffin tho! It came out nice and warm AND free! Aye! We checked in, showed our server, Oscar, he came swiftly came back with the goods! Though we were quoted a wait time of 15 min, we were seated in less than 10min. Food was REALLY good. Generous portions, I had the Prime Rib Benny and my husband had the Crazy Chicken omelet. I'd definitely come back on my next trip to Vegas.

We love having breakfast here every time we're in Vegas. I love the Asian breakfast selection that they have on a separate sheet. I always get the spam and eggs. It comes with white sticky rice. Yum! Reminds me of home. I have had the Brad's Very Special but it's not my favorite. My hubby and brother in law always get either the Mexican Omelette or the Francisco's Scramble. We love this place. It gets very busy during peak hours  so get there before 9am. But, it's a pretty big place and it has a huge patio. So, we never have a long wait. If you want a great breakfast head over here. This is also our favorite location. They have really good service here. The Egg Works is not as good as this location.

My wife and I have been coming here for over 10 years from California.  It's the BOMB!  Try Corned Beef Hash and Eggs.  Made with real Corn Beef!  Country Fried Steak and Eggs also a favorite.  Service is good, always a line to get in but it moves quickly.  Enjoy.
This place is a must for breakfast! Every time we come to Las Vegas, it's a tradition to come here! Our server Koko was awesome! If we could give her 7 stars, we would!

Prime rib Benny! beeeeeennnnnyy... benny and the jets... ha...

ok, for reals tho - 

the GRUB:
- check out my pics, my wife got the stuffed french toast with eggs and bacon, french toast, powdered sugar, and maple syrup - like the kitchen sink of breakfasts all in one bite... pretty good.
- also pictured, i got the Prime Rib Benny - ala the meaty blackened spice prime rib, poached eggs, holandaise sauce, on top of an open faced buttered croissant like a traditional eggs benedict - but kicked upped... super filling and super delicious
- fresh squeezed OJ and hot cups of Joe

the JOINT:
- typical vegas locals crowd, a little bit of everyone
- old school decor on the inside (like a country kitchen)
- outside patio seating if not a scorcher of a desert day
- they had an LCD with local sports and AC too

the SQUEEZE:
- breakfasts are always too expensive to me, so im a little jaded... but anyways, those 2 dishes and fresh squeezed OJ = approx $50 after tax and tip
- friendly wait staff and hostess
- plenty of parking in the strip mall
- vegas blvd (the strip) close

FINAL SAY:
pretty good change up for breakfast, if youre starting to get tired of those casino buffet champagne brunches\/breakfasts...

THE BEST BREAKFAST!!! I love trying new places to eat! This is a winner!!! My husband and i were lost and he was mad because we couldn't find it. He wanted to just go to Denny's. I insisted to keep driving till we found it. (Wasn't hard to find) we made a wrong turn.  My husband left soooo full and soooo glad we went there. Atmosphere was great, food wonderful! I had Avocado Omelet with Portuguese sausage, and the muffin. Delicious!!! If you're in Vegas this is a must!!!
Look for KARLA, she made my day she's awesome server.. made me feel I'm in hawaii very friendly staffs and i love to come back see her again... I highly recommend to see this place check out karla.

Went there today for breakfast. I had the chile relleno omelette and James had the eggs Benedict. We were greeted in a timely manner by the busser who took our beverage orders. Waitress came by a few minutes later and took our order. Food came out pretty quick and you could tell it was picked up and delivered to our table right away. It was an awesome breakfast! The chocolate banana muffin was great with my coffee.

The chocolate chip pumpkin pancakes are to die for!!! This has to hands down be one of my fave places to eat in Vegas. I also loooove to get chocolate chip blueberry pancakes...I make up this combo every time I go (when then pumpkin pancakes aren't on the menu!) Best Breakfast in town and great service.

We arrived for breakfast on a weekday morning. We were greeted by the hostess and sat near the back, near where the kitchen is. Our waitress was Carol Anne. She was as good as it gets. I asked her what was the best dishes and she suggested the chile relleno omelette. I was glad to hear that as I love green chile and don't get very good ones in Florida. My spouse has the collision which was a cross between a crepe and an omelette. We both ordered potatoes with our entre and a banana muffin. I had seen the muffin delivered to another table. The omelette was awesome the green chile had so much flavor. The collision my spouse had was very good. The banana muffin was the best banana bread or muffin I have ever had. I would go back just for the muffin. Carol Anne was a great server and kept checking with us and took care of us through the whole meal. I noticed on her name tag she had worked there for 4 years and it showed. She knew everything about the restaurant. I would highly recommend this place for breakfast or lunch. I will go back anytime I am in Vegas and of course I will look to sit in Carol Anne's section.

Great service and large menu for breakfast.  The "special potatoes" are chunks of potatoes with season salt.  That's it.  The corned beef hash was just ok.  The banana muffin was pretty tasty and warm.

This is as good as it gets! I ordered the steak and eggs with a banana nut muffin. The muffin was excellent, made in the restaurant. The steak was properly prepared as were the eggs. The potatoes were well prepared and not greasy. 

The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and clearly happy to be employed by this establishment. The waitress was patient and friendly outgoing and concerned about the service she provided us. The other patrons in the restaurant were professionals and a delight to be around. 

The restaurant was clean. The service was great!

If you come to Las Vegas you should check this place out. I am going to return before I leave.
Food is very good and portions very big. Totally recommended for a hearty meal. It's true that their banana nut muffins are excellent:)

The food was very nice,  nothing out of the ordinary but huge portions and good. However, the lines were long. We only waited 10 minutes though.  

What I did not get was why they did not seat more People outside as there were hardly anyone sitting there..
Awesome! Huge selections! Food was delicious. Banana muffins are the best. Stacy was are server and she went above and beyond in service. 5 stars service

Food was so good! It's owned by the same people that run Egg Works around town. Food came out pretty quick. Had an omelet with potatoes and a banana nut muffin. All were really tasty. They have a dog friendly patio and it was a nice atmosphere out there.

I'm from San Diego and I was visiting and we decided to look through yelp to help us decide what we wanted to eat. We ended up here and I'm excited have never received such amazing customer service from someone like I did today from Oscar. The attention and time he spent helping me decide what to eat and giving me all the options and taking time to listen to what I want was beyond amazing! Very satisfied with my food & service I received here. It was busy and the food and service was still amazing. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS PLACE

My wife and I found this place via Yelp and with the help of the turn by turn navigation, discovered the BEST breakfast we ever had!!  The banana nut muffin comes before the meal and it is SUPERB!!  Everything we ordered was FANTASTIC!!  The eggs (over-easy), the bacon, the link sausages, the pancakes, and of course the waffle (loaded with strawberries and whipped cream) could not get any better.  We visit Las Vegas at least 3 times a year and this time we were celebrating our 7th year anniversary.  We've done the hotel dining thing at most of the 4 & 5 star rated places and they don't even come close to being as good as the Egg & I.  We do have to thank Denny's for being so awful the morning before and that is what led us to the BEST BREAKFAST in fabulous Las Vegas.  Being from Hawaii, it was a pleasant surprise to see a "hawaiian" section in the menu.  A lot of Hawaii people visit the 9th island and we will definitely be telling our friends about this wonderful eatery on West Sahara.

The place has a "cute" charm to it right down to the animated and creatively named food menu. Choices that could easily satisfy the appetites of any family. Service was excellent from the hostess to our waitress Chance! She helped us make the perfect selections and checked in with us frequently.  My 13 year old said we need to come back tomorrow to try all the yummy sounding dishes.

We Ubered from our hotel because we wanted a good breakfast place outside the standard Vegas strip and our hotel.  It was good drive there, BUT WORTH IT!

Great portions!  I had loco moco, not your standard breakfast but oh so yummy!  Also ordered a bloody Mary and it was awesome!  

Service was friendly and fast!  Waiter had lots of recommendations, so you couldn't go wrong.  We had a table of 7 and everyone LOVED their choices for breakfast.  

Good value, good portions, great service!  It's a definite return when we come back!

We like to go off the strip for breakfast and eat where the locals eat.  The omelets were good, but not spectacular.  Kevin who is a carnivore went for their skillet with prime rib chopped in it and I got Kay's special.  The reason we'll come back though, is their banana nut muffin.  OMG it is soooo good we bought a loaf to take home.  I think we just picked the wrong menu items and next time will go for what everyone else gets.

I was so excited to try this, and I have to give it 3 stars. Maybe I need to try again next time I am in town, however it was just ok. I had the eggs Benedict (good flavor), but it was served in a dish so the muffin was soaked with sauce and there was no texture, but a big deal but definitely something I noticed. Home fries were good, if a bit salty. However with a Groupon it was very affordable.

Had the Chicken Cordon Bleu skillet. Was a great breakfast. Jessica the server was awesome. She was her attentive and was always there when we need something. If your in the area stop by for an eggredible breakfast.

So - my bestie who's a local told me and my other bestie to go to this place on our way out of Vegas.  I'm SO happpy she told us about this...

I got the shredded corned beef hash with eggs.  WOW is all I can say. So good, exactly what I wanted. 

For the price, the portions are large.  Total deal.

Hazelnut coffee was fabulous.  

The menu is huge, so if eggs aren't your thing there is plenty of other things on the menu to pick.  That was probably the hardest thing for us - was to actually pick something off the huge menu.  

Clearly this a locals place, it's off the strip in a strip mall.  We missed it when we were driving there.
This place was awesome. Food was good. We got there early and there was no wait. We checked in with foursquare and got a free banana nut muffin. It to was awesome. Try the stuffed french toast.
Good breakfast spot! Our waitress was Stacie and she was awesome!! Definitely try the banana nut french toast and the egg-cellent omelet... sooooooooo worth it and it'll feed 2 people no problem!

Great food. Great service. Dog friendly patio. Huge portions.  Will
Be back for sure.

Totally worth the journey off the Strip.  If I lived in LV I would come here whenever I wanted a good breakfast out.  Big varied menu, friendly service, great food, kid-welcoming, clean, and clearly very highly rated year after year as all the framed Zagat reviews on the front wall testify.  Great experience.

If you're in Vegas, you must go here for breakfast!! Everything is good; from the Hablo Diablo potatoes to the French Toast!  But especially the service!  Karla was EGGSallent!! She was friendly and fast and amazing!! We will definitely be back!!
Good food and good service. Erin was very attentive to us. Will be back the next time we are in town.

This place never disappoints. The only thing disappointing is the long wait, which only means one thing. Parking is also difficult. It's definitely worth the wait. The banana nut muffin is a must. I think the menu was made for hangovers. Anything you get on the menu would mend it. The only thing on my last visit I had an issue with was my potatoes. They were really salty. It wasn't just my potato it was also with my group. Everyone's potato was salty. Other than that everything was EGGcelent.
Great breakfast.  French Toast stuffed with egg bacon cheese omlette was over the top.  Breanna was a super server.  Banana nut muffin was scrumptious.

I am definitely a fan. Great, quick service, home - like warm ambience, and a hearty breakfast all make for a beautiful dining experience. 
We had the Fiesta Skillet, Vegetarian CrÃªpe, and Waffle Works with whip cream and strawberries. Traditional\/Deliciously cooked eggs and food made to order. It has a loyal following so try to get there early if you can. :)

Came here after checking out of our hotel one weekend in vegas with a group of 4 on Sunday at around 1pm and our wait was about 30 minutes. We were all starving and all a little out of if @_@ (as you should be when devouring food in Vegas). 

I ordered the basic eggs, potatoes, and sausage breakfast. I opted for the banana muffin and was so glad I did. They make it in house and was warm and delicious. My main dish was really greasy and hit the spot good! They were generous with the sausage portions. I wasn't feeling that adventurous that day, but others in my group ordered the chicken enchilada omelette, Tacos Rancheros, and Huevos Rancheros and all loved their dishes. Service was fast and friendly. I would definitely be back on my next Vegas visit!

This was a great place to eat away from the Strip.  Had the Veggie omelette.  Very good.   You get your own coffee carafe in this place.  Always a good way to start your mornings.  Wife and I enjoyed the seasoned home potatoes.  The hot sauce they carry is also good.  As long as you like some garlic flavor in your hot sauce.  Service was also very friendly.  We got a kick out of the smiley and sad egg faces they have on the table.  Good way to flag down your waitress.

The Egg & I is a Las Vegas staple for breakfast... Their maybe a five minute wait for a table but it's worth it and that alone be should tell you what you're in for. 

I'd like to add that Amanda our server was tremendous!   Her friendliness and professionalism did not go unnoticed.

We went searching for a Village Inn after checking out of our hotel. We never found it, but on the way back to the highway, we passed this place and decided to U-turn it back here. 

The service (except for the older woman at the register completely not seeing us and helping 2 people after us as we were trying to pay), was good and fast. The food was a little salty, but it was good. 

They were pretty busy for a Thursday morning and I'm guessing that's for a reason. Give them a chance if you're nearby! :)

Super great experience. Seriously. 
It's Monday morning, 11am, and there was a brief 15 minute wait.  Place is packed!! 
My carafe of coffee was a perfect start and I admit...I really enjoy just good diner coffee.    (You can ask for flavored creamers if you want them, just FYI.)

We were quickly greeted by Kat and trainee, Mariah, and it was just ideal from start to finish. Kat was personable and accommodating, something that could be easily missed in a place as busy as this.  

Our yelp check-in brought the tasty banana muffins and I'm glad they did.

Everything. We. Ordered. Was. Great!

I had the breakfast burrito, hubby had pancakes\/bacon\/sausage\/eggs.
Just good ol' fashioned FABULOUS food.

This was our first visit here. I wanted to try something new for breakfast this morning so after a quick Google search I found The egg and I. It was amazing! Service was amazing! We were seated immediately and after ordering out food it was out waiting a matter of minutes. If you like hot sauce be sure to try their hot sauce that they make! Yum!!! 

Thank you Liza for being an amazing server!!!
Food was excellent and large portion. Tabitha was excellent. Attentive, genuinely friendly. Highly recommend.
Erin was an exceptional waitress.  Her suggestions on the food were very helpful.  Only downfall is that they don't accept American Express
It was my first time having breakfast at the Eggs & I. I ordered a Brad's scramble which was super tasty! Curtis had been very nice and helpful to me. He was patient and helped a lot, thank you!

Very good food. Well worth the drive off the strip. Very big portions. Our server Karla was absolutely wonderful. I wanted everything on the menu. Come early or plan to wait for a table.  The banana muffin that comes with a lot of the meals was amazing!  If it doesn't come with it you should order one. It's warm and moist and perfect.  I got the Santa Cruz bfast burrito. So delicious. The sauce on to was perfect. My wife got the veggie works eggs Benedict. It too was good. There are just so many good options on the menu that it's hard to choose. I would definitely get the burrito again.
The Egg and I is one of our favorite places to come to every time we come to Vegas. The banana bread is the best.  Erin was very helpful and attentive.

The place is very homey and cozy. There was a slight wait but not too bad. The menu is almost endless. Settled on the stuffed French toast and butterscotch pancakes which where the best pancakes I've ever had. Our server Amanda was awesome and very helpful. Definitely would recommend this place if you happen to be in Vegas.

I don't get it.... I thought the food sucked. The people weren't very nice and the food was mediocre at best. Yeah the banana nut muffin was ok but not like wow! The seasoned potatoes were kinda nasty. I like season salt on my fries but theirs was GROSS!  Maybe I just didn't want breakfast that day... I do try to have a rule to try a place out 2x before I say no completely. I just don't think I will be trying it soon.

This is the quintessential breakfast spot. I got the corned beef & hash with eggs. & of course the banana nut muffin. Simply perfect. The place is clean & inviting. Perfect for a couple. I was alone. Maybe next time.

The best breakfast i ever had.
U need to wait to get in there. Worth wait.

Any Omelet here is awesome wit
Sides Cajun fries or french fries.
Fruits on the side.

We ordered 7 different omelets. Each and every person have their own specifications. All our orders are perfect. The waiter's here are pretty cool. If i stayed back in vegas and longer i would eat my Breakfast only here.

They offered us the Banana Muffins after our meal. Thats really awesome. We couldn't eat them so they gave us ToGo.
I'm a big fan of this place. They have wonderful service and amazing breakfast food. Try the Carnitas with the Salsa Verde and egg. Coffee was HOT and Abundant.
Karla was the best server at this establishment. I had the 5-way with spaghetti and chilli. It was amazing.

Best breakfast I ever ate!  Seriously!

I will say - my coworker and I were in Las Vegas for work.  It was a Friday, around noon and we had finished with our client earlier than expected. We did a Google search to see what was available close by for food as neither of us had a chance to have a real breakfast that morning.  After scrolling past several chains I landed on a name that wasn't familiar and highly rated - Egg & I.  I was later a little bummed to discover that Egg & I is in fact a chain, as I had hoped it was local to the area (I was unfamiliar with it being from the Northeast\/Mid-Atlantic region and never encountering one before).  I will tell you though - I did not regret choosing this place for a late breakfast\/early lunch.

When we pulled up the place was hopping.  A good sign that we picked a good place.  Inside there appeared to be a mix of both tourists and locals.  Although they were busy, we were seated very quickly.  Every plate I passed on the way to the table had breakfast food on it, and it all looked and smelled amazing.

The menu was quite extensive... what you would typically find in a diner.  The omelettes and breakfast skillets sounded especially appealing, and come to find out are their most popular choices.

Our waitress was attentive and very helpful in providing menu suggestions.  When she found out it was our first time there, she insisted on bringing us fresh banana nut muffins - which was a great touch!

The muffins were divine - served warm, they were thick and rich.  Like a really good banana bread in muffin form.

I chose to get an egg white omelette with mushrooms, spinach, artichokes and cheese.  It came cooked perfectly and I liked that the cheese was smothered on top and not actually in the omelette.  It was a nice twist.  The breakfast potatoes served on the side were also cooked perfectly - crisp (and not greasy!) on the outside, soft on the inside and seasoned with a signature mix of spices.  Based on what I've seen online, most other locations do seasoned ranch potatoes.  I liked the Vegas location's spicier take!  It had a kick, but wasn't too spicy.  I liked the blend of seasoning so much, I purchased a bottle to take home with me.

My coworker ordered a skillet and raved about how delicious it was!  

Even though the place is a chain, they must be locally franchised and I really liked how the Vegas location had the feeling of a locally owned place.  

Great food, great people and it was less than 15 minutes from the Strip and airport.  I'd definitely take the trek out for a meal or two on my next Vegas trip.

As long as you like eggs, this is great! They have few non egg choices, but a plethora of egg creations!

I had their breakfast burrito (scraped out of its tortilla -no gluten for me ). It was very good. In retrospect I would just get a skillet but I was starving and not thinking clearly with all the choices! 

I went on a Saturday morning and even though it was crowded, it felt like the wait was fine. The staff is friendly and was obviously working very hard to be quick yet still friendly. I enjoyed this place.

This place is away from the strip which made it appealing to us. Got there about 9:30 on a Monday and we were seated immediately. The place was very busy but service was prompt. We had the chile relleno omelette and the kitchen sink omelette, one with a banana muffin and one with sourdough toast. We ordered a side order of the bacon maple cream cheese for the muffin, it was so good! The omelettes were cooked perfectly, the potatoes on the side are delicious. Highly recommend making the drive to come here!

My number one breakfast place.

I usually get omelets and have never been disappointed.  Plus, the coffee there is a smooth coffee, not bitter or acidic.  The home fries are consistently cooked to perfections with a crispy brown and warm soft center.

Several large screen TV's so you can watch the news or sports.

Great friendly staff and our party of 8 was actually seated within 5-10 minutes.  

Banana nut muffins. Get one free if you check in! They are amazing!!! Soft, not too sweet, super moist. 

Chicken fried steak skillet. Crisp breading. Gravy flavorful. 

Corned beef hash. Comes out on a skillet and was really good. Large pieces of shredded beef was in every bite. Very tasty. 

Habla Diablo sauce was really good. I put that stuff on everything and it kicked it up a notch.

Everything was good. We'll be back!

Sometimes it's just about knowing what to order! 
The service was fantastic. I snuck in Egg & I just before lunch to get Breakfast right before the rush. 
They have a pretty big selection for breakfast and Lunch. I ordered a *Half Order chili omelet and they also allowed me to substitute half of my potatoes for tomatoes.

Love this place!! Every time I come to Vegas I make sure to make a stop here and enjoy the banana nut muffin that tastes like heaven! The staff is always friendly and they place a newspaper style menu for you to look at. If you say it's your first time, most waitresses will bring you complimentary banana muffins for your table. But don't worry if they don't because most breakfast plates either come with toast or muffin..... Please go for the banana nut muffin!!! It's that good! For food I recommend the works skillet or any of their omelettes. They also have Hawaiian style food, which I haven't had the chance to try. The wait can go fast although it might take longer for larger groups. Parking can be a hassle during weekends. This restaurant will beat any overprice buffets on the strip, it's well worth it to go out of the strip for the food. And if you enjoy the muffin as much as I did, they sell banana nut loafs!

Service was egg-cellent. Sorry, couldn't resist. I ordered the house specialty: corned beef hash. Got wheat toast instead of their special banana nut muffin because I got a free muffin for checking in! That muffin was warmed and was moist & delicious. Corned beef hash came in a ceramic skillet with 2 fried eggs on top. Tasty meal, but a little in the pricey side; around $11 for the dish. However, I would definitely come back because their food quality was good and the service was egg-cellent. Shit, did it again.

Wir, meine Frau, meine Tochter und ich, haben hier gefrÃ¼hstÃ¼ckt. 

Essen: Toll. Es dreht sich alles um das Ei. Unsere Omelettes waren sehr gut. Die Kartoffeln ok. Der Bananenmuffin sehr gut.

Service: Gut, schnell und nett.

Location: Ok, typisches amerikanisches Diner mit viel Deko in Form von Eiern.

Preis: Gut, unser FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck hat 28$

ResÃ¼mee: Wir wÃ¼rden wiederkommen

Man do the locals know about this spot and for good reason too. Thankfully they have a lot of seating inside and out. We ended up outside with the misters which was ok but still hot. The wait wasn't horrible despite it looking terrible. Our server was amazing. We mentioned it was our first time and she gave us a round of muffins, thank you!!! They were so moist and delicious! I also ordered a breakfast burrito which was gigantic and tasty. The potatoes it came with were ok and seasoned well. Definitely you get the most bang for your buck here.
The food and service were very good. Paula was very helpful and cheerful. It was a nice way to end our trip in Vegas

Great breakfast big portions... coffee was good and the service was very kind and quick!
Only problem was that you have to pay the bill on the way out and there was a very long line, we were in a hurry and if we wouldve known we could plan our time differantly...

Came here on a Saturday. It was busy. Has a lot of seatings including outdoor. It was packed when we got there. We were told the wait would be around 15-20 mins. But we were seated within 10. 

Our waiter was nice and helpful. There were other servers that were helpful too even though it wasn't their table to serve which is a plus. The hostess could greet their customers better. Just a hi and how's your day, also Didn't smile much. I noticed it wasn't just us. I greeted them more. 

Food... Was great. I ordered the spinach Benny. Eggs Benedict with potatoes on the side. I'm picky with my poached eggs and they made it perfect. Not too wet or to cooked like some other places I've been to. My BF ordered original house burrito and he said that was good. I tried it and it was good too. Lastly we ordered chocolate chip pancakes. I've never had choc chip pan cakes before but for having it the first time. I loved it.
