Prices were good not too expensive. Would definitely come here again.

My husband and I have been wanting to stop by here for quite awhile but it always seemed so busy. The service and the food were great! I ordered the veggie omelette and he ordered The Works scramble. The portions are giant so we had a lot to take home :-) We also tried their awesome banana nut muffins!

As we were preparing to leave Vegas, we googled best breakfast places and wound up here. We were seated promptly by the hostess podium, strike 1, tell me who wants to sit where you can hear the conversations between the girls as they seat people.

The server was pleasant and why I give this a 2 Star rating but the food was mediocre. My waffle was cold and not crunchy, the butter couldn't melt on a cold waffle so I had to use syrup. The ham and eggs were cold too, overall, not impressed, strike 2.

My friend had the bacon, egg & potato skillet and was also disappointed bc it was too salty and warm, not hot, strike 3.

I'm out, not on our list when we return to Vegas, sad really because I had high hopes after reading the reviews.
We wanted good breakfast and we found it here. Really good food. Big portions . Friendly service. When in Vegas .......go ......you will enjoy it :)

If you are interested in big, hearty, country breakfasts, this is your place.  If you are looking for delicate flavors or subtlety, no way jose. 

He ordered EGGS BENEDICT.  It was served in a baking dish so I guess the restaurant feel compelled to fill it with sauce.  It was completely drenched in "Hollandaise" if you could even call it that.  It was creamy and yellow, yes.  But there was no butter taste, or lemon.  Moreover, the slice of ham on the benedict was so thick and strong flavored that it was the predominant flavor.  

I ordered the HAM AND MUSHROOM SKILLET with TWO EGGS OVER EASY.  It's a baby skillet, with the bottom lined with the restaurant's ubiquitous Ranch Potatoes, mixed with diced ham, sliced mushrooms, topped with a handful of shredded cheese and topped with 2 eggs, any style.  It's all very salty, cheese, filling and pretty good actually. 

FYI: the Ranch Potatoes are diced taters completely drenched in Lawry's seasoned salt and they use it anywhere potatoes might be needed.  The result is ..seasoned salt EVERYWHERE!

Stick with basics like pancakes and eggs and these skillet-y things.  Don't get anything where skill might be needed to cook it.
good food, loved the breakfast selection

I'll keep this review short and simple.  If you want a delicious breakfast, go here.  This spot is on point and we couldn't complain about the food at all.  I got the their special corn beef and hash, with two over easy eggs on top and a side of potatoes.  Their corn beef is pulled, not the typical chopped up kind you find most places.  The flavor of this was awesome and the texture was amazing too.  I can still taste it.  On top of that, bust the yolk and it's on!  Wifey had their special banana french toast.  This thing was like a cake, literally.  It didn't have a "bread" texture, but it was rather good, something I've never had before and I have to say I really enjoyed it.  It came with syrup, which was a waste because the taste in the french toast was just right.

Prices are cheap for what they serve, service is good, can't complain as the server stopped by a couple of times to check on us.  The place is BUSY though, so expect a wait, especially on a weekend morning.  Highly recommended and they NEED to open more of these breakfast type spots in this area (booo IHOP and OHOP).

I am very please with this place. I ordered the chile relleno omelette & I could not believe how delicious it was. A lot of places take a wack at Mexican which usually ends up tasting like nothing more than Pace picante tossed on top; not this plate! I can't call it authentic but it's pretty close! We also tried the chicken fried steak & eggs, yummy!! It was nice to sit Outside on their patio and enjoy the Day I'll be back!
Really enjoyed the food! Service was great and fast!

Have not eaten at this one in over a year, but all their locations make a great breakfast, its a chain with a family run atmosphere. 
bacon egg and cheese stuffed into french toast, with seasoned  potatoes on the side OMG!
I always get the Milk Thai Tea Boba it super good and refreshing . They also have punch card when you get buy 10 drinks you get your 10th one for free .
A must stop at egg and I when I'm in Vegas! Best banana nut muffin, pumpkin pancakes and any skillet you get. Also the burgers here are amazing. Great service .

Amazing for breakfast\/brunch. Staff were very friendly and portions are huge! I did not run out of food. The banana nut muffin was the best I've ever had. Shame I live in the U.K and this will be the last time I visit it

The strip has expensive food, and a lot of it is shit. So before leaving we decided to drive out to this gem. The sausage is the best sausage I have ever had. The croissant under the sunrise mountain eggs was buttery and the potatoes were incredible. The French toast was a bit of a miss, but the service was great and the wait was non existent. Our server Lilly was attentive to our needs at all times, and very sweet.
Here on vacation great breakfast spot the employees are WONDERFUL so attentive to your needs. If you are in Vegas come to this place. Food was great got the Mexican omelette so spicy and yummy
Eggcellent! Food is delicious and service from Chance made for a great experience.  Great Vegas spot just off the strip.

Egg-cellent!  We came here because of the reviews and glad we did.  The food was great. They serve huge portions. (but you can order half orders) 

I could go on and on about how good the food is, but instead you should just stop reading this review and head to Egg and I for ur next Vegas breakfast meal.

Oh. My. God.

I want to marry this place. I want to have its babies.

Stuffed French toast -- more like a French toast sandwich with eggs, bacon, and cheese -- total party in my mouth. The combination of sweet and savory was enough to make me die happy right there. The bacon and the scrambled eggs were perfectly blended (no limp strips of bacon criss-crossed on top of your eggs in THIS joint!) and the whole concoction dipped in syrup was like a MIRACLE.

Jess got a skillet and I have never SEEN more beautiful over-easy eggs. OHMIGOD! I wish this place were local, I would be here every weekend. The iced tea was good too, and the staff is friendly and helpful. This is probably where we'll come for a farewell brunch the morning after our destination wedding. Mission accomplished!
GREAT breakfast in Vegas.... eggs, muffins, skillets... you cant go wrong!  Worth leaving the strip for this gem.  Be sure to try their verde sauce.

I don't usually eat breakfast in Vegas since I don't wake up in time but my friend has a list of foods he wanted to eat. One of them was eggs Benedict. So we went to egg and I and got the egg florentine Benedict. It's was decent and the home potatoes were good and well seasoned. 

I didnt like the eggs Benedict as much as my friend but the potatoes and the free banana muffin was good. Warm and put some butter on it. 

Shout out to Oscar for the good service and win the trip!!!'

This place is about 7 minutes from the Grand Hilton Vacation Resort (the one on Vegas Blvd).  I visited here on Tuesday.

Upon arriving, there was a wait of about 15 minutes.  When i was finally seated, I was giving this big menu of items.  I ordered the southwest omelet & cup of coffee.  Once I received it, coffee was okay & the omelet was great.  Service was okay, but not great.  I guess because they were busy, it took longer for her to check on me especially to bring my check once I was done.

Overall the place has good food, but needs to work on service.

Had the biscuit and gravy.  It's served in an oval baking dish.  Biscuits are fluffy soft and the gravy is perfect.   I like the way they serve it in a bowl type dish (as opposed to flat plate) because it keeps the heat better.  Good attention to detail.
Great place to get a hot fresh breakfast! You get a lot of food for your money! I will be coming back here, every time that I visit Las Vegas! "MUST TRY
Egg-cellent food and great service! Can be busy at times on Sunday, but it's worth the wait!
Stacie did a great job serving us. Delicious potatoes!!! We'll be back on our next trip to LV

Our last place we visited before coming home from Vegas. Thank you YELP for letting me find you. This place was the Bomb.com. I loveddd it!!  This place was super packed however we only had to wait 5 minutes before getting seated. Simple menu on paper but tons of options. I ordered the Chicken Skillet, my husband ordered the chocolate chip pancakes.  Both items were reallyyyy good however the chocolate chip pancakes were total overload, the pancakes were drenched in chocoalte chips and i love chocolate but it was a little too much actually not a little just TOO MUCH for my liking even my teeth starting to hurt because of the sweetness.
The prices were really reasonable and food was good and the service was awesome especially for how busy it was all.  

You must visit this place! yummmmy!

Omg! Best breakfast I had since I moved to USA! I had the Santa Cruz skillet and my boyfriend the steak Benedict ! Simply deliciousssss. Our server Sy gave us an amazing service and she was very nice !
Oh my god breakfast for four. This turned out to be enough for lunch too. I would recommend this place anytime.

Good quality comfort breakfast food that comes in huge portions! Each entree is about $10-$12 and most  come with fruit or potatoes, and toast or a banana muffin- definitely big enough to share. (I would recommend choosing the banana muffin, it's freshly baked and absolutely delicious. Note that you get a free muffin with Yelp check in!) 

While I don't consider most of the menu items to be healthy, as is typical of many American breakfast diners, you are given the option to make your order healthier, whether it be by using egg whites only, no cooking oil, etc. There are also SO MANY menu items to choose from. 

Stop by here to have a great start to your day!

Eggceptional! If you're visiting Vegas, get off the strip and try this one. I wasn't a huge fan of the prime rib Benny but not because of how it was prepared. Just isn't my taste. The country Benny was great, as was the service.

This is my favorite breakfast place i've been coming here since the day they opened the food is always good and the service is just as good, my waitress today Tamara remembered my order just the way I like it and everybtime  friendly no better breakfast place in town.

Everything about this place is perfect! Mashed potatoe omelet is lit! Seriously if you come to Vegas you have to try it. The muffin is also essential to life. Please do yourself a favor and come here! egg&i for president!
We always come here and recommend all of our friends even when we are not in town. Our server BREEANDA was very attentive and helpful. Thanks for your great service!

Monday at 11:30am waited 10 minutes for a table.  Can only imagine what it's like on the weekend.  The banana nut muffin is as good as they claim. Light and moist and very tasty.  Servings are generous.  Had the Veggie Works bennie, enchilada omelet, hash and feta veggie omelet. Everything was excellent.  Very fast service.  I and out in less than 30 minutes.  Definitely recommend this place!
Simply amazing! I stop in every Vegas visit. You have to experience it.....onelets are amazing, their potatoes work wonders, and the banana but muffin is a must have!

egg-cellent place for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed the eggs and complimentary banana muffins at the beginning of the meal. the blueberry panacakes were a bit dry however the omlette made up for it. i must also say the service was top notch and ended up tipping more than usual

We were looking for a breakfast off the Vegas strip & a friend told us about this place. Well, we weren't disappointed. I had the Santa Cruz skillet and it was great. Good size servings for a good price. Our server Oscar, was very good and kept checking on us. Great breakfast restaurant with great service! 
Cheers

We had Chase as our waitress. She was very on point with everything, very friendly & always checked on us to make sure everything was okay. Definitely coming back here again & my nephew loved her!!! Thank you so much Chase!!!! =)

Went for breakfast with my two young daughters, were sat immediately but the service was slow and sloppy. Liliana our server, was busy, in her defense. But the staff (hostess & other servers) who werent busy didn't bother to offer help and we sat asking and missing a few items...too often for my liking.

The location is about 2 miles away from the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites, which is where we stay always, great location right off of Sahara Ave. The decor is super cute, a bit country, yet not overwhelming and suffocating. There is an outdoor dining patio, it does face the busy street, but it was quiet. Surprisingly.

The food is great, fresh, came out hot and the coffee is good. A great variety of breakfast and lunch items, and I am looking forward to going back because as i said, slow service but great food. Good tasting. Fair prices. Liked this joint

Gave the 3 stars for the poor service and time we spent there despite non busy employees piddling around.

Has a large tv in the dining area, up high enough that you are not distracted if you choose not to watch. We were able to watch a bit of the World cup Soccer match, great in my opinion.

Great breakfast and extremely friendly staff. I would definitely recommend this place. 

P.S There french toast is awesome!!!

Ate here unfortunately I chew into a plastic material on my eggs, brought it to my server Alexis attention and also involve the manager. They offered another entree but I declined as I kind of kost my appetite. They gave me a whole banana cake too for the incident. Very nice and generous.

Great food and delicious banana nut muffins! However the customer service was a little off. We tried to claim the free banana nut muffin when we checked in on yelp, but they did not honor the offer.  The cashier lady made up excuses and said since we ordered our food with muffin (which it should come with toast or muffin) we don't get an extra one with the check-in and that we should save the yelp check in for next time.  Checking in on yelp is one thing and ordering our food that come with an option of toast and muffin is another thing since that is part of the meal that I pay for.  The principle just make no sense. Minus 1 star for not honoring  the yelp Check-in. That could have completed our experience.

We've been to LV many times and we usually eat breakfast buffet near the strip. But this place is good. Lizete reserved our seats because we called in. Once seated Debra just made us feel special with her service. The muffin is sooooo fresh and tasty. She even accommodated our request to replace the ordered toast with the muffin. I highly recommend for visitors to have your breakfast at Egg and I.

The service was fast and friendly and the food was amazing! We had the home made corned beef hash, chicken and chorizo hash and the Mashed potato omelet. Everything was phenomenal but those breakfast potatoes were the best thing on every plate! The portions were huge and the coffee was fresh. Breakfast heaven!

Service was great, lots of people waiting but the food comes out fast and the wait was short. Food wasn't greasy but the potatoes were extremely salty and the banana nut muffins were amazing definitely get the muffin.

This unassuming place is rated so high for a reason! Everyone is so sweet and cheerful and Lisa our server was an absolute doll. Don't forget to mention its your first time there, you get a free banana muffin.. warm and delicious! 
I got the Sunrise Mountain.. Four scrambled eggs on an buttery croissant with sausage and cheese... SO GOOD. Definitely stop by if you're going to Vegas.

Great food!  Western omelette was huge and tasty. Sour dough toast was good. Banana bread French toast...really good. Came with both maple syrup and a tasty apple compote. Food came out super hot (temperature). Patio is pet friendly. Casual but nice decor inside. Bree was a great server.
Large portions! Excellent breakfast & Karla is awesome! Great service. Will definitely come back next time in Vegas!

I really enjoy breakfast food but going to breakfast eateries, they just give so much food.  

Anyway gotta eat breakfast so we came here.  Typical breakfast shop.  I ordered the Fiesta Skillet which was a layer of their ranch potatoes topped with a mixture of green chilies, onions, and salsa.  On top of that was a layer of melted cheese and two eggs over-easy.  The skillet was accompanied by two slices of wheat toast and two slices of fruit.  It was pretty tasty.  I really like the ranch potatoes, eggs were cooked correctly, no brown spots and yolks were runny.

There were three different types of Habla Diablo sauce on the table Original, Chipotle, and Verde.  So if you need a little spice in your breakfast you can choose your pain.  Well not really since none of them are that spicy.  

Overall  I enjoyed breakfast.  I have tried other items at their other locations they all taste good.  Would definitely be up there on the list of breakfast places to go.

This place has to be related to Egg Works because they are literally exactly the same. From the decor to the menu!

It's a Sunday morning so we came into it assuming we would be waiting at least 30+ minutes. Although it was packed we probably only waited between 15-20 minutes. For breakfast on a Sunday morning that's really not bad.

We got seated on the patio which is what we wanted at the time but honestly we froze to death. If you're eating breakfast before 11AM sit inside or wear like ten sweaters.

We both ordered omelettes. I had the mashed potato Omelette and my friend had the bacon and avocado omelette.

Huge, huge portions! And very tasty! I had half of my omelette left over to take home!

It's a pricier place to eat breakfast you're probably looking at between 11-15 dollars for breakfast and OJ but it is very much worth it!

Had a great breakfast there yesterday morning. Service was great; Samantha did a great job. Food order was taken promptly and food brought to our table in a timely manner.  My wife had the breakfast burrito; which she loved and I had the Portuguese sausage and eggs with the banana nut muffin (a must). Overall very please with the food, service and will return again.

Quaint and homey looking restaurant.  I kind of felt like I was getting a weird look at time, but it was probably in my head.  The food was delicious though as well as great portions.  The price was also affordable.  The breakfast burrito was quite tasty along with the turkey salad my girlfriend had.  The bran muffin was nice and hot.  The service was good.  I felt kind of pushed to get out though since they were closing soon.  However, it was still a nice and clean place with friendly service and good food.  Not much to complain about here.

Came in for breakfast while in Vegas based off of Yelp reviews, trying to stay off the strip for some "real" food and I am glad we stopped in.  SUPER friendly and hard working staff.  Lots of food.  Great banana muffin.  LOTS of potatoes on your plate with their Habla Diablo seasoning (really good seasoning, I even ordered a bottle to go).  I ordered the chile relleno omelet and it should have just been called a green chile omelet as the paper was not stuffed with cheese or anything as the menu claims.  Still good, but not a relleno.  My wife's scramble was also good.  They are really good in their offerings goo, if you don't want potatoes or toast they have all kinds of things you can substitute for; cottage cheese, fruit, tomatoes, etc.  
Nice job guys.
Great variety, good food and friendly staff. I had the country fried steak skillet and it was 2 meals worth of food!

Good food, lots of it. Our family of five walked in under the wire at like 2:58 pm and were treated to fast, friendly service and good food. My son, who is a big potato fan enjoyed the potatoes thoroughly. My daughter, the vegetarian, said of her omelette, 'that's a bomb-diggity-omelette'. Husband said the everything skillet was very tasty and shared the last bits with my son who ate it along with the pancakes and bacon he ordered...bottomless pit that he is.
AMAZING!!! We got the chicken enchilada omelette and the carnitas breakfast tostada and of course their banana nut muffins, holy heaven so good!! DO NOT SKIP THIS PLACE!! and KARLA was the BEST!!

After an interesting night of debauchery, my stomach was hungering for a good, full breakfast.  Apart from having the cutest name ever, Egg & I has THE best banana nut muffin I've ever had in my life.  So moist, so warm.  So delicious.  Their bacon, avocado and cheese omelet had just the right balance of cheese and fillings, although a little more bacon could never hurt anybody... Orange juice was freshly squeezed and a bit pulpy, which a nice surprise :)

A nice, comfortable, and homey place to recover with generous portions and awesome staff.  Definitely recommended.

I got the original Loco moco and wife got prime rib benedict, they use a croissant for their benedict which is unusual, usually benedict is made with muffins ? Wife said that they put a little too much hollandaise sauce on the benedict, so if you don't like them drenched, ask for lighter sauce.
My Loco moco is perfect, portion is definitely large, I only eat a little more than half of my plate.
They don't take American Express, which is not a big deal but the fact that they put Amex logo and crosses it out with a red "X" kinda too much in my opinion, it's almost like they have a big problem with Amex.

When we first walked in it was a bit overwhelmingly with the noise and it's a wide open space.  They seated us very quickly and got to omit drinks right away.  One server Erin came to our table slowly there after to take our order and answer any questions we had.  My wife doesn't eat regular sausage and we were very impressed with the vast ability to substitute. We were here for breakfast, but i peeked at the lunch menu and you can build your own burger with ground beef, chicken breast, turkey, or a vegetable patty.  I had the fiesta green chili skillet and it was amazing.  Perfectly spiced and filling.   My wife had a burrito and substituted turkey sausage and fruit.  We each got one of the banana bread muffins which I highly recommend. Erin was our server and she was very attentive and pleasant.  This was a nice way to start the day.  I highly recommend making this past of your Vegas stay.

Love this joint! We waited about 20 minutes on a Sunday which was shorter than I would expect for such a popular place. Our waitress (bummed I don't remember her name) was ridiculously sweet and friendly. She provided great service. The food was delicious. I'm really picky about eggs benedict and theirs did not disappoint. I had the prime rib benny and highly recommend it, came on a croissant. We were planning on ordering a carrot cake to go and when they were out of it they gave us a loaf of carrot cake on the house - it's gestures like that that make all the difference. Great place and will definitely be returning. They're doing it right :)

The Egg & I is an outstanding local diner with great service and great food.   It's the perfect hangover cure and refreshing escape from the strip.   We usually visit this place when en-route to Utah for road trips.  Definitely check it out.

My fiance and I came to this place twice on our last trip to vegas.  I can't tell you how much we liked the place.  The interior was unique and so wat the menu.  The portions were big the coffee was hot and the atmosphere was great.  Good service both times as well.  If you're looking for a great breakfast or lunch joint that blows dennys or ihop out of the water here's your place!!!

Tried this place with a friend and had probably one of the friendliest waitresses I've every encountered. The selection of food is pretty amazing and fills you up. The waitress gave me and my friend two free slices of their famous coffee cakes and it was heaven. The breakfast food was ridiculously delicious. I highly recommend this mom & pops place if you want something different than what is on the strip.

The service started out really nice. Our server took great care of us initially. She was prompt and polite. It was wonderful. Then I placed an order to go. Good grief. It took longer for the 1 to go order than it took for the 3 of us to eat initially. 

The food was pretty good. The muffins, as everyone says, were delicious.  I had a bandito scramble. It had a lot of cheese and just didn't look like what I expected for the items that were supposed to be in it. It was delicious though. In addition, the potatoes that came with it were wonderful!  My daughter has the Mexican omelet. She was in seventh heaven....eyes rolling, lips smacking, spoon licking heaven. Who could blame her? The food was really good!

The wait for our take out, and the aggressiveness of the manager cost them a star. I thoroughly recommend coming here, just be prepared to wait a minute or two.

Tabatha was our server, such a friendly person! The banana nut muffin is so good!!!! So is the chicken, spinach, mushroom skillet! My favorite breakfast\/ lunch place to eat. I always bring people here!!!

Saw this place on yelp and saw the review and decided to try this place. And guess what, this place is GOOD!! I tried the egg-ception scramble and with fruits and with banana nut muffin! And WOW! the banana nut muffin is so good!! I would definitely come here again! 

If you ever gonna come here, you gotta try the banana nut muffin!!

Great service, fast food, great taste and atmosphere is great....(the restaurant is a pokestop which i love) Liza, our server, definitely made my vacation start off beyond great.  I would definitely recommend

Excellent stop. You Yelpers steered us right again!! Very clean, country appointed, quick friendly service....what else do you need??

Had the hash with eggs with shredded cheese and onions. Wife had the egg sandwich on ciabatta brad....both excellent. Banana nut muffin also good.

Not a fan of the diablo potatoes. For as fresh as this place is... Taking a short cut and using food service potatoes....would have thought better..but not enough to drip a star!!  

Thanks Jessica...great job!!

Huge portions, plates are enough for two. Definitely get the banana muffin as a side (comes with most entrees). Great coffee, very friendly staff. And yes, the ranch potatoes are awesome, don't substitute it with fries no matter what your kids say.

Wait time was about 20 minutes. (Not bad)
Service was excellent!
Food came out within 10 minutes.
Blueberry pancakes but asked for Bananas in it. (Scrumptious!)
Pork Chops were was seasoned well.
Potatoes that comes with the meal was absolutely mouth watering.
Sunny Side Up egg were prefect.
Coffee was delicious.

Highly recommended this place!

This place was "ok" the service was friendly enough. I had the French toast sandwich and a side of their special potatoes. The sandwich was very good. Good portion size. The potatoes were bad. Instead of like "country potatoes" which go better with bfast, these were more like French fries. They were super dry and just too crunchy for bfast. I guess it's a matter of preference but I didn't care for them at all. Had I been eating a burger tho, I probably would have liked them more.

I don't think I'll go out of my way to go back though.
Cute spot. Has their own touch. Nothing special, but still good. They used very nice fruit, too. I'd eat here again for sure.
This place has great breakfast if u like eggs. And their banana nuts muffins are super good too. The best of all are their customer service, especially the waitress Carolyn. She's awesome.

Off the strip. 
Nice staff, all wearing bunny ears for Easter. 
Server: Amanda. She was super sweet and attentive. :) 
Cozy and busy. 
Got the sunrise mountain & banana nut muffin. Had a bite of the Italian and plain cakes. 
HUGE portions! (Share with a homie.) 
Fast service. 
Everything was DELICIOUS!!! 

Will return!

Delicious hot food in a reasonable amount of time... I order eggs Benedict everywhere I go since they're my fave.. They never dissappoint... Service could be better with the waitress in the glasses but maybe she was having a bad day. Prices are around $10 to $13...good breakfast restaurant.
Always the best, hands down the best breakfast in Vegas!

Egg and I is truly delicious! The banana muffin is a must try and you really can't got wrong with anything you order. When you come ask to be seated with Tamara, she is exceptional, sweet and very attentive!

Great breakfast in Vegas for a resonable price."

Great service, food and price. It's not easy to find really good and affordable dining choices in Las Vegas... but, this is one of them. The menu is diverse and you have some good people watching too. My favorite in Vegas.

This is the best breakfast spot I've ever been to in Vegas!

They are very accommodating with small changes, fast and generous with their portions.  The restaurant is clean and there is ample parking.  

If you're staying in Vegas and have access to a car - then for sure - get off the strip because you won't find anything that beats Egg & I.
Wonderful place ti have breakfast.. Love the skillet menu and the attention that the server, Amanda, gave us today make it better!

Is it just me or does the person working the register always have an attitude. went there today (12\/31\/15)  and the lady was treating the people in front of me rudely. Tried to do the same with me, ridiculous!



Food is very good, waitress was awesome ! But please, for the registers girl ... When someone's check is $26 even and you get money and a "thank you goodbye," for my breakfast .. please don't say "really" as I'm half way out the door! The tip is on the table for my waitress! Not you.

Thee place was pack but we waited the most maybe 15 minutes.  There was so much options on the menu it was a bit overwhelming.  But our breakfast was good and their banana nut muffin was warm and delicious.

The food is excellent, the service is iffy but then again they are super busy so I guess it's hard to get it right & knock it out of the park all the time. Pancakes are awesome, eggs of course are great. Bacon tastes good (pork chops are goooood, Pulp Fiction reference). 5 for the food, 3 for the service (4 overall). If you're visiting Vegas, come here as you will leave with your stomach more than satisfied and your wallet won't take a pounding like it would on the strip!

Great locals spot. You can tell by all the Nevada license plates outside. The food is hearty. They specialize in guess what? Eggs! I had the corned beef and hash, expecting the can-type, which I hoped for, but it's good, high quality corned beef with hash. The eggs are cooked well. The scramble was pretty good too. Oh yea, and with the check-in you get to try their infamous banana nut muffin. It's pretty good, the muffin top rivals that of Souplantation. Yum!

Great breakfast place... Banana nut muffin was great, no too sweet, just right...
Had the Spam, egg and rice which hit the spot. Spam was cut thickly which I liked...  Prices are so reasonable too. Definitely will come back....

I come here every time I visit vegas, which is about 8 to 10 times a year.

I love this place,  their food is amazing!

Don't be fooled by the big crowd outside waiting, they are so quick with serving that people are constantly getting seated.

Servers like Dariesia make the restaurant experience fun and enjoyable! Servers should learn from her and Crack a joke once in a while. Haha.

Highly recommended! Just don't come at the same time as me, might have to fight for the banana nut muffins... :)

To start off, this place has been on my list of stuff to try for a couple of months solely based on the name.. and after reading through the rave yelp reviews my expectations for the quality of food slowly started to grow. 

I planned to head back to socal early this morning and wanted to be the first one in the restaurant. I arrived at around 5:45 am and fidgeted in my rental car while checking the "closed sign." Suddenly another car pulled up next to me, the driver walked out and headed straight into the restaurant - the sign was magically on Open. Wtf... 

The hostess\/waitress was so friendly (and at the buttcrack of dawn thats pretty impressive) that I think this partly made me enjoy not only the food but much of the rest of my day.

The front lobby is decorated with articles and reviews AND pictures of eggs in action shots which I found pretty amusing (sometimes it doesnt take much) but the main eating area is pretty diner-y so I kind of zoned out till the food arrived. Ordered the fender bender egg crepe with avocado and sprouts and something else in it and it came out surrounded by a mountain of delicious seasoned potatoes and the softest, freshest muffin i've ever had. The egg crepe is in a league of its own compared with any kind of omelet you can get at IHOP or denny's or some drive by diner. 

I sat there for a good half hour savoring the meal. At the end it was all gone - the muffin, potatoes, egg crepe and the bucket of coffee. For the amount of food I had, it was very very light and felt quite healthy. I didn't get hit by the food coma train on the way home which is a big plus.

As a heavy consumer of all things chicken, I recommend this place to everyone. Unless you don't have taste buds...then go to your local diner where your $4.99 omelet brings you to orgasm every sunday morning. If you have taste buds - go eat here. Pay a little extra. Its worth it. I would guess that this is the best "cheap" breakfast i've ever had.

Went for breakfast with my family of 5 after reading some great reviews online!  The reviews were spot on! This place was great- we were seated right away and ordered right away..  The breakfasts were huge, I got the chicken omelette it was really tasty, a bit too many of the mini potatoes, would have been better to have more omelette but still plenty of food.  One of my kids got the chocolate chip pancakes and they were great!.  Also they had something for everyone, our youngest only wanted chicken fingers and French fries at 8:30am and they had it available.. My wife had the rancho scramble and it was amazing!  This place lived up to its billing on the Internet, best breakfast we had in 3 days in Vegas!

Service was good, however the breakfast itself was ok...the diablo potatoes were just TOO salty... even our waitress gave us a heads up and advised us to order them with less salt.  I believe in seasoning your food right but overdoing the salt just takes away from your experience of a good dish.  On a positive note, the banana nut muffin was AMAZING!  We checked in and got our free one and ordered another!  Definitely recommend that!
Karla is the greatest!!!!!!!!!!!!! Everyone at the table enjoyed their food. Huge portions and for a good price!

A pretty standard, diner-like place. Their menu has southwest flare. The service was excellent. Paula? I hope you're one step closer to Disney! 

We ordered a skillet and that was enough for two of us. Came loaded with veggies, bacon and cheese. It was standard. Paula offered us their banana muffin on the house since it was our first time in. A really nice touch. It was served warm and was delicious. Would come back just for them!

The condiment holder on the tables acts as a service signaling device when you flip to sad face egg -- very clever! If you're looking for a friendly, diner with stellar service, come here. I think you'll be pleased.

After a few more visits the service, food, and portion sizes have all remained consistently good.

Love the veggie benedict and all the vegetarian friendly options here! :) seasoned potatos that come with most of the breakfast entrees are so flavorful! 


Banana nut muffins are soo good and you get 1 free with Yelp check in.
Good customer service and great food. The chili relleno omelette was amazing. Inexpensive and a great way to start your day.

The food was really good! My wife's tortilla shell was stale but other than that I have nothing but good to say. I have to say that Genesis our server was really sweet and was an absolute wonderful as our waitress.

rise and shine 702!

Thanks for all the wonderful yelp reviews~ I finally had my first experience at Egg & I this past Thursday.

My gf & I had breakfast around 11am. It was really crowded but there was only a 10 minute wait.

We ordered the croissant sandwich, I had mines with turkey sausage and fruits and she had hers with bacon and potatoes. 

Service was great, food came out fast. Casual dining, indoor\/outdoor seating, private lot. meal for 2 cost around $26. 

I'll be back for more.

Egg & I makes my breakfast in 702 list! If you're looking to get your morning fix, stop by Egg & I! 

-Miss Yelp 2011

Holy crap where do I start??? Tldr: if you're reading this, just go there as soon as you can. 

We went on a Sunday morning, for a lazy brunch and that's exactly what it was. 

The menu options are EXTENSIVE. Lots of sweet and savory options. We ordered the Brad's Scramble and Waffle with a banana nut muffin on the side. I'd read tons of reviews about the muffin so I wanted to know what the hype was all about. 

And I was BLOWN AWAY. This is one of the yummiest, tastiest muffins I've had in my life. And this set the bar really, really high for me. 

Then the waffle - with a nice layer of whipped cream and blueberries was perfect. 

Scrambled eggs were great as well. The potatoes were really excellent! Cooked perfectly and coated with the Hablo Diabla spice, not too spicy - just right. 

When we went to settle the check, there was a mixup and they charged us with someone else's bill. But they handled the situation well, and fixed the goof up very humbly. 

The staff was always nice and sweet. 

This is in stark comparison to the fancier places we dined over the weekend, where the staff was very curt and hostile at best. 

Will definitely come back, just for those muffins awww man.

Wish this place was in California! Gotta get the banana nut muffin. I've only had the country fried steak here, but refuse to get anything else. The potatoes are so bomb here, Airways finish it! Service is great and is always crowded. The 4.5 stars on Yelp are definitely deserved!
The works omelette was delicious. Very fresh food and Lindsey was helpful and prompt. Good dining experience, would come back again.

My favorite brunch place in Vegas!
The atmosphere is positive, prices are acceptable and the food presentation is creative.

The food was delicious! I had the original breakfast burrito! It came with a delicious side of home style potatoes which were seasoned perfectly and had a side of salsa, which also tasted amazing! 
The other entree ordered at the table was the chicken enchilada omelette which was also delicious! So the food is a big part of dining out, but then there's service which we all know can make or break an experience ...

Amanda was incredible! She was polite, friendly, and fast without being pushy! She encouraged us to take our time and when we were not quite sure what to order she offered recommendations which we definitely took and did not regret! The cinnamon roll and banana muffin were also DELICIOUS! 

An elderly impatient man sat himself behind us and after only a minute of being sat was incredibly rude and calling out for a waitress and coffee (despite not waiting to be sat by the hostesses). Amanda was calm and very polite when she greeted him which I can tell you, takes a lot when you aren't being treated with respect! 

So with food and service being on point, I'd have to say this place is a hit and worth traveling off the strip for while in the area! I'll definitely be back and recommend it to friends! Thanks again staff and especially Amanda!

Came here on my trip to Vegas because I was craving some eggs Benedict. This place was a little trip away from our hotel but defiantly worth it! Me and my boyfriend both got the eggs benny with home fries. Service was fast and food was delicious and cheap! Would defiantly come back on my next trip to Vegas!

We've been waiting for almost 20 minutes and still no one came to our table to take our order. They just walk by and continue to go as if we are not waiting. We flipped to where they said if u need service n still nothing. If you are wanting to eat I suggest going somewhere else. Never again. We ended up leaving not ordering anything

Usually go with breakfast selections, but wanted to try something new so I ordered a beef burger. I typically pick at bread since it's so filling, but ate everything this burger came with. Includes the seasoned potatoes :) 
Typically you'll have to wait to be seated, but they also have the patio option so tons of seats. Great service, just don't expect too much if you are seated outside. It's a pretty noisy atmosphere, but has a homey feel to the place. Check in on yelp to try their homemade banana nut muffin!!

Very good menu, good food, excellent ambience.
Would definitely go there again  when i visit next time.
First time there. We had great eggs and stuffed French toast!
Amazing restaurant! I definitely recommend it! The food was very good and our waitress Bree was very helpful and kind. I ordered the Country Benny and had the banana muffin. Delicious!
Eggcellent breakfast. Incredible service by Amanda!  We'll definitely be back.  Ordered the Carrot Cake french toast. Yummy.

love this place ,, food it's great !!!.. great customer service from "koko"..CHILE RELLENO OMMLETT it's a must try !!!. Love them potatoes !!!.. ohh and the prices are awesome .. it's a great restaurant for all the family , kids meals plates are huge at great prices.. wish I had taken a picture ,.. but we couldn't wait to eat .. lol..

Bacon Avocado Omelet hearty and delicious. Habla diablo potatoes are yummy. Portions are large, prepare to eat! Karla, our waitress, was attentive and very pleasant. Definite go to breakfast place off the strip. Bonus is the free banana nut muffin with the Yelp check in. Super yummy!!
Tried this place this morning after reading glowing reviews.  I found the food nothing to rave about.  It falls far short of the food at any of the Cracked Egg locations.
I'm not from the area but this is my favorite breakfast place ever amazing food good atmosphere great service and clean!

On our last morning in Vegas, we decided to have an American breakfast and found Egg and I on Yelp (of course!).

I had the pancakes, bacon, and eggs combination (around $7.00) and my friend had the eggs, muffin, and potatoes combination (@ $6.75).  Both were excellent and the vibe here really brightens your day.  The people working are cheery, friendly, and serve your quick and come back when you're not happy.  How do they know when you're not happy?  Well, you turn the egg over to the unhappy face!!! haha.  great customer service!

I enjoyed my breakfast here and all the way into the parking lot until Jeff Rose (of Boston, MA) backed into our car and left a dent.  sad face!  We got the car fixed, but so far Jeff has not responded and looks like Jeff's going to bail on paying for an accident that was his fault.

Xie Xie!!
Great service and great food! I ordered the corn beef hash with over easy eggs. Reina is a very attentive, nice and quick server. Kudos to Reina!!!
Amazing!!!  Best service and best food.  Omelets were incredible.  All food came out hot, which never happens at most places.  Erin our server rocked it.

Loved the food here! We came for the first time today and all of the food was delicious. Good price for the amount of food they give. The banana nut muffin was amazing. I will definitely be coming back when in Vegas agains
Brady was great! Very courteous and prompt with service. I can't wait to come back tomorrow!

This place is simply delicious! Nice size portions for a decent price. There can be a bit of a wait , but its well worth the wait. Just thinking about it makes me all tingly on the inside. LOL. 

a nice hidden jewel away from the strip, but for us locals who drive by on our way to work or church...we know what kind of gemstone it really is@ 

Most importantly, it is kid friendly. For people who have two young ones and who also has friends who has two young ones...its a good fit for us. 

yummmie...

2Nd time eating here today.1st time was great but now i dont think so. My husband ordered chicken fried steak. The gravey tasted very strange. He scraped most of it off & continued 2eat. I ate1\/2half of 1 of his hashbrown paties which had some gravey on it . W\/in 30 mins i threw up ,w\/in 1hr he also did the same & has not stoped all day vomiting.  I finally called & spoke 2a manager, the lady was nice &suggested  i call the operarions manager. I said no . but u need thow that gravey shit away!!
Wow super impressed best breakfast in the Vegas metro area everything was above and beyond from hostess to wait staff to cashier. I can't say enough the food portions were huge and delicious!!
We enjoyed the food and service was good! Skillet plate called Fiesta was good but a bit salty. This is a good one lace to go to be away from the Strip. We sat outside but the misters were excellent!

So my brother and my best friend and I decided to have breakfast here. Was a bit disappointed that this location doesn't serve alcohol but oh well. So we walk in and request an outside table and were seated in a timely manner. The hostess seated us that had the tip still on the table and I thought that maybe she didn't see so I let her know oh the tip is still on the table and she had a bit of an attitude while telling me the server would grab it. The server, Amanda, came over to us and greeted us and we told her what happened. I wasn't that upset but I just thought it was kind of ridiculous. Anyways our server was really great! Bubbly and cute and super friendly. She even sent the manager over after we had told her about the tip thing and they gave us a free round of muffins! I love that! I guess it's company policy they leave the tip on the table due to bussers stealing tips. 

So on to the food. I got what I always do, it's just a platter with potatoes sausage toast and eggs and it's always delicious. My brother got banana but French toast and Biola got regular French toast and it was fricking fantastic.  

Once again I'd just like to say how amazing our server was! Thanks Amanda! Also I hope you win that trip to Disneyland!

Ate here while in LV on business and was blown away. Had time in the morning, so decided to get off the strip, and found this gem. Got the Mexican Eggs Benedict, and it couldn't have been any better. And their potatoes are the best I have ever had.  I wish this place was in Indy!!

My family & I came from Cali, which is like a 4 hr drive to this place & overall it is soo worth the drive! Their banana nut muffins are delicious! I recommend trying it. The place is kinda cramped but all that matters is that the food is yummy. Also our server, Tabatha, was really kind. Definitely love servers like her!

If you want your monies worth, this is the place to go. Almost always a long wait but worth the wait. The eggs are just amazing, menu has a great selection and service is warm and friendly. Great place for a weekend breakfast with friends and family.

Thank you Earl for fantastic service! Food was delicious and plentiful . Our group also appreciated the affordability since we are budget conscious travelers highly recommend to anyone looking for "a locals best breakfast

Nothing beats starting your day in Vegas indulging an eggcelent hearty breakfast. 

Egg & I is a casual breakfast joint, offering warm hospitality, home-like atmosphere and American faves food, making it a great place for enjoying a laid back meals. We decided to pay a visit to this happening place on weekend at around 11 a.m., and it was packed! The wait was tediously long, but it was so worth it; as they really live up to the hype by offering an extensive menu of breakfast goods at an affordable prices. 

For breakfast, it's egg benedict all the way for me! Ordered their Blackened Prime Rib Benny:  buttery slabs of croissants underneath tender, juicy prime ribs, topped with sautÃ©ed vegetables and hollandaise sauce. Nothing on this plate disappoints me! Nothing! All of them were superb, I personally love their habla diablo potatoes, it was crunchy and seasoned perfectly. The price for my breakfast is about $14; which is more than reasonable, especially if you witness the portion...

And if huge pan of egg benedict and half a plate of yummy potato goodness is not enough... wait for it.. They give you even more. As an offer for Yelp check-in, they generously gave us four of their famous banana muffins.  IT IS TO DIE FOR!!

Overall, if simple ambiance and BIG (tasty) breakfast experience is your cup of tea, Egg & I definitely will not disappoint. What a delicious find and happy to recommend this spot to you :)
Menu promised exciting food but once it arrived it was just boring.  The staff was great and Ashley is a must ask for if you chose to dine here.
Everything is great here. Food is great. Server is really nice. I ordered bacon and onion skillet. My friend order omelette and classic. We really enjoyed our brunch here.

Found this place thanks to yelp! Super friendly staff and the patio is dog friendly! Amanda our server was great! She was really attentive nice and always smiling! The food and coffee was awesome too! I definitely recommended it! You will love this place from the moment you walk in!

This is the best place for breakfast around Vegas.
Nice size potions, yummy food and great service.

I go there all the way from Los Angeles!

Keep up the good work! :)

I've been here since Monday and today is Wednesday FINNALLY some real good food! Chicken fried steak cooked to perfection gravy was on point and the potatoes works were seasoned and cooked just right! My husband got the egg sausage bacon and toast SOO GOOD!! Oh and the banana nut muffin!! YUM!!! 

I definitely recommend this place for the perfect breakfast!
OMG - Thank you Erin for making us taste the warm banana nut muffin. DIVINE!!!!!!!  I love this place!!!!

Had time for breakfast before leaving Vegas and decided to give this place a try!

The food alone I would rate a 4 but the overall experience was easily a 5.

We had the beef hash, eggs Benedict florentine, New York steak, and veggie omelette.
Nothing really to note on each item, all were satisfying and enough to fill us up.

We were seated immediately upon arrival.
Our waitress took our drink orders and came back quickly to take the rest.

Food was prompt and I was asked right before the food was brought out if I would like Tabasco or any other sauces with my food. I did.

Oh. And they gave us an extra banana nut muffin because only 3 of our meals came with one. (Party of 4)

Great experience! Will return

Definitely recommend this place for breakfast...the wait is probably better than Hash A Go-Go but the con are that 1) when you call in to out your name on the list, they tell everyone that it's at least 30 minutes wait but actually it could be 45 min to an hour and 2) their waiting area is very tight & a bit fire hazard. The pro is that is food portion is pretty large, and the staff are super friendly unlike Hash A Go-Go where the hostesses are super snobby because they think they have power toco trial when you could be seated. The hostesses at Eggs & I are super friendly & do their best to find tables for large party. They even gave us extra banana muffins for free for the long wait & the muffins are yummy.

Enjoyed an incredible breakfast. They were very busy, but extremely efficient. Our server Oscar was outstanding. He was hustling with a lot of tables, but was very attentive, helpful & friendly. Habla Diabla potatoes were off the charts. Had the Carnitas Huevos Rancheros and wasn't disappointed. Great family owned restaurant. Will absolutely be back. Highly recommended
This is my second time eating here. Both experiences where exceptionally pleasant. Shout out to our server Lindsey. You were great.
Aloha! Spam and eggs in Las Vegas! Very nice restaurant. Good food and service. Located very near to the strip.

Omg. We visited this restaurant on our first trip to vegas along with 2 of our friends. 
We did spend at least 15 mns. to get seated but it was very busy. Our server was very attentive and explained the menu very well. Everyone working there knows the true definition of customer service. The food was excellent and so delicious. The home made potatoes are everything. Everyone loved they're food. Can't wait to re-visit this place on our next trip to vegas!

A classic breakfast and brunch place. Pretty much a local spot. I enjoyed this place very much. This was my first time here and because of that I got a very fresh banana walnut muffin. It is their very famous and tasty treat. If you check in w\/ Yelp you can also get the muffin. 

FOOD:

1. *Waffle Works
Waffle w\/ side of two eggs any style and any meat (i.e. ham, bacon, sausage)

2. Fiesta Skillet
Eggs any style with cheddar and jack cheese and a side home-fries

3. Veggie Skillet
Eggs any style with cheddar and jack cheese with spinach and green peppers

4. Pancakes
Choose a type of batter (i.e. buttermilk, whole wheat, homemade) and amount of pancakes (2-3) and flavor (i.e. plain, blueberry, chocolate chip)

Overall all the food was great. Except the home-fries were a little salty with a little heat. Also, the portions can be pretty large, so you can definitely share. But either way good brunch place to come with family. Definitely give it a go.

I guess I came here with too high of an expectation.  All the food was mediocre, nothing special that stood out.  

I got the vegetable omelette, good amount of 4 eggs, had spinach, mushroom, bell pepper and probably onion.  Nothing fragrant that stood out, but it did the trick.  The meal came with plateful of mini squared potatoes.  At first glance, you can see all the seasoning and it taste over seasoned. My only gripe, was they had MSG sprinkled all over it.  I didn't realize it until my thirst level started to slowly creep up.  I took another close look and felt sick to my stomach.  Why, do you need MSG in fried potatoes? Why?

To end on a good note, I really enjoyed my slice of grapefruit and honeydew and opted not to order the muffin or toast. 

I should have stuck with good old Blueberry Hills Family.
Great food and great service from Chance!  Definitely worth the shirt drive from strip
Love this place.....! Love my Egg Sandwich......yummmmmmm! I can't wait to come back to Vegas and eat there......

Great start to my vacation! The food here is excellent. This is definitely the best eggs benedict I've ever had.

Fantastic service from our waitress Tabatha! I hope the other places I visit have wonderful staff members like her.

I don't think you'll be able to top this place in regards to price and portions.  The food is plentiful and the price is even better.  Best breakfast for under $10.  I got a half portion which was more than enough and it slashed that price by a third.  Their banana muffins are to die for and their wait staff is so friendly and sincere.  It's off the strip but well worth the trip.

Went back...nothing changed but the service!! TOP NOTCH! The servers were super friendly and our food came out withing minutes....yummy as it gets for cheap...fast and big portions. Please try the french toast sandwhich with eggs and bacon!!

Yummy breakfast.  Wait is as expected.  I ordered the portugese sausage hawaiian breakfast because other than in Hawaii this is the only place I have been able to find it.  It is a whole sausage they don't skimp.  Good food!

I love the egg and i but whats makes it even better is the service. Liza was our server and made sure we were well welcomed. She was attentive and prompt with our orders. She took care of us in every way to make sure we enjoyed our breakfast!  Thanks liza and thanks egg and I!

This little gem has off-the-strip prices with locals and tourist mingling.

We had such a great server, Kat or Katty. She was very kind and inviting and even suggested we get half portions, because the desert heat was killing my appetite. We got free warm, yummy and full-sized, banana nut muffins just because it was our first time there. 

I got some veggie egg skillet. It was fresh and well-prepared.

My husband got a Mexican omelette and was very happy.

We'd go back. The bill was under $15 (we did half portions) and it was such a nice homey-diner. Full portions for an omelette equals 4 eggs! Crazy.
Alyssa was a great server today. Cheerful and attentive.  I enjoyed the banana bread French toast, but probably would have preferred something else.  We will be back!
Big portions and tasty too. The works skillet was awesome. Would highly recommend for breakfast.

We have been to many of the egg restaurants in Nevada - all have great food. The service has always been good as well. This waiter was awesome. He made breakfast all about the grandkids  - awesome is all I can say

The food was delicious!! Portions were really large. Our server Jessica was super friendly and very attentive. I will definitely be coming here again on my many Vegas adventures! Off the strip, not a long wait, dog-friendly patio.

Yummy. I loved everything i got the flapper  with French toast.... YUMMY 

My boyfriend got the flapper with pancakes. He liked everything except  the pancakes were gummy. 

The fresh squeezed oj was delicious 

REASONABLE PRICES!!!!!!

Best breakfast diner experience! Karla was very sweet and polite. She helped me order my eggs perfectly to perfection. We had the banana nut muffin...AMAZING! Added some butter, even more yummy! I'm cheating on my Mom's homemade banana nut bread..shhhh don't tell her! What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas! Anyways my husband had the bacon avacado omelet and he added sausage.Very yummy!  I had country fried steak with eggs (medium over medium) pefect when I cut into the egg the yellow runneth gold over. It was amazing. I had the country fried steak it was good and gravy was definitely homemade, yummy. My only compliant is the gravy was a tad bit too salty for my tastebuds, and I love salty. ...other than that it was perfect. It was already buttered to perfection!  Attention to detail. At home I love my toast buttered immediately so it has time to melt. And they did that. This place is a must go!

Our usual bfast joint in Vegas is the place to be! Every meal is a hearty one so you won't leave disappointed. Try their banana nut muffins and their Hablo Diablo Verde salsa with your meal. Yummy-zone. Our waitress, Erin rules!! Thank you!!

Stopped in for breakfast. We heard great things about this place and they lived up to the reputation without a doubt. 

The staff is very friendly, polite and very efficient. They were always very conscious to our needs. 

The food was fantastic! We highly recommend this place.

I'm just sorry that we don't live here to come back soon.

There's a reason this place was totally packed when we arrived. Even though it was packed, we were seated in a couple of minutes. The waitress was fantastic, fast and attentive. AlThe food is amazing.  Best potatoes I've ever had.  I can't wait to go back!
Huge portions of amazing food! Try the Banana Nut Muffin for sure! Our group had an assortment. Crepes, Sausage n Biscuits and Pancakes- all of us had the same expression "this is the best...

Food, okay. Service, good. 

With the long wait\/line, I had high expectations. 

The server, Darla, was on it, as was the rest of the staff. However, that is where the "WOW" factor ended for me. 

Being from Hawaii, an order of the Loco Moco was placed, along with the Ranch Club.

The ground beef on the Loco Moco was hard and a bit bland. The Club was okay and unfortunately, the onion rings were average, at best, as I am used to panko onion rings which make it flaky crispy.

I can't say it was bad, but not what I had expected based on the reviews and the long line outside.
Stopped in on a Sunday morning after reading the other reviews on Yelp. I was not disappointed! As a vegetarian, I had Kay's special which was delicious, and our waitress Karla was delightful!

This place has the best breakfast in Vegas. Portions are proper and not over the top (you're not throwing half of it away but still paying for it). Oscar and the other servers are great and on top of serving you. My favorites are the cabo or santa cruz buritto. The bananna nut muffins are awesome too. They sure know how to make the 6 hour drive worth it.

Taste: 3
Creativity\/Authenticity: 3
Atmosphere: 3
Service: 5
Bang for your buck: 3.5

Lets start with when your standing in line (with no one in it) and 2 girls walk up they will ignore you and seat them first so off to a bad start. The waitress is what made me change my mind very friendly and attentive (perfect service). Now to the food, not sure why this place got such high ratings but i wasn't that impressed. They seem to be all about the omelets so the other stuff might not be so good; to start i got a side of biscuits and gravy... more like stale dry biscuits with not enough gravy so again not off to a good start. So the main dish yeah i should have got an omelet but with so many choices i couldn't decide so i got the cabo breakfast burrito... bad choice the burrito was soggy smothered in sauce it was just very un appetizing and the side of house potatoes covered in that texas seasoning was one cold and dry so i don't know if i just got the last of that batch but my experience here was nothing short of just meh nothing that dennys couldn't have filled. Overall the service here at least from my waitress was what gave this a 3 star but the food was not what i expected; especially from the high reviews this place got. NEXT

This was my 1st time here with my bf. I loved the Eggs Benedict Florentine with regular bacon not Canadian bacon. The potatoes were good. The little fruit on the side was bitter and I don't think they cared about the fruit. They just wanted to display it so it looked nice. My boyfriend got a crepe, it was good but my dish was better. The waiter Stacy, forgot my boyfriends English muffin so she gave us 3 free banana nut muffins to go. They were warm and moist and a little crunchy on the side. Even after 2 days the muffins were still very moist! This is a great place to eat breakfast and you must try their banana nut muffin! YUM-my!
Great restaurant. Consistently good food.  Especially wonderful service by Rachael. ;^)

Love loved my breakfast!!  The loco moco was Amazing ! And my husbands country fried steak was one of the best i've ever tasted
My server was very nice and my cup was never empty, I would definitely go back
Best banana but muffin, best chile relleno omelette , best potatoes, best everything in the world.

I like coming here for the breakfast, and the service is always good:: 
Food is usually average, I just don't like Luke warm stuff but it's breakfast so I can't complain:: I'm usually to tired too  ( one eye open) .. 
I drink my 50 cups of coffee cause they give me a pot! It's usually so so:: but drinkable--
I guess I really just have to complain about the most simplest thing which is :: H2O:: 
Man does it taste like metal or is it just me?? It's horrifying water man:: beware:: 
If anyone is awake enough and feels the same would probably give you props if you say something:: 
Over all a good in the hood place for some morning grub::

Great breakfast!!!! Rented a car in Las Vegas and decided to getaway from the strip for breakfast. Found this place on yelp and had great reviews. So glad we did!!! John was an awesome server and loved the table egg flip card if you need anything :) great idea!!!!! Best pancakes and he even gave us a bowl of blueberries and whip cream if we wanted it. Yum!!!! Great food, prices, service and worth the trip!!!! Can't wait to go back.

This place was so good, I came for breakfast twice in a 3 day Vegas stay. Huge portions of food and cheap prices. Diablo potatoes were so good (not spicy at all) and the skilled breakfast kept me full almost all day. Highly recommend. We didn't have to wait for a table either day either, first day we got there before noon, second day it was around 1 pm.
I love it here. A lot of food for friendly prices with amazing customer service. Our server Amanda was the best!

We were in the area early in the AM and decided to get some breakfast and decided to try the EGG ASND I. We had never been.
Breakfast is my fav meal of the day and I really like to get or make a seriously good one. 
Wow, this one turned out to be great.. 
First, we had this great server... Thaynara... She was sweet, understanding, and smart! She has patience while we figured out what we wanted to eat, so many choices!  YOU HAVE TO SEND HER TO SEE MICKEY!!!!!!!
Since we were 3, two of us decided to split the Works Veggie Benny... and Pumpkin Pancakes.. and the third party got the Chili Rellenos. 
Everything was really good.. I always hesitate to get poached eggs since so many restaurants make them in advance and have them sitting in a water bath, so in the end either you get a medium to hard yolk or a watery mess.. these were perfect, the minute you cut into them the yolk spread everywhere, the spinach and avocado were raw not cooked to death and I just can't believe the potatoes.. They were spiced and hot and really good, and we had a  choice of potatoes or fruit and since we couldn't decided Thay suggested 1\/2 and 1\/2.. Perfect. 
The pumpkin pancakes were moist (which I didn't expect, usually they are dry dry dry) but they were really good, like a good pumpkin cake (not pie).. 
And the Rellenos were really good, not too much cheese (which I don't like) and he really enjoyed them.
All in all a really good meal! 
It's 3PM and I'm still not hungry..
Oh, and we tried the Banana Muffins.. we gobbled them up! 
Even the coffee was OK.. 
Definitely, will be heading back for more!

I've been coming to Egg & I for 3-4 years now. We come here for breakfast every year each time we come to Vegas. Now I can tell more about the dishes I've tried at this place. I even got a sweat shirt from here that I wear regularly to the gym in NY LOL. Cute shirt just like the logo. Hubby said that you need your ID to pay at the cashier (if you use your card). The service is one of the best in Vegas. They're fast without rushing you, courteous without over do it, polite and happy naturally. Never had one bad experience. Everything on the menu comes with eggs, what do you expect at "Egg & I"? They come with eggs but not with "U" of course, we don't eat people. The potato is amazing! I don't like potato but I like this type. It's diced-potato with tasty spice or could be just salt but very tasty. I don't eat much salt but I don't feel that it's salty, just tasty. I've tried different types of omelettes here and thought they're pretty big. Of all the omelette that I ordered so far, I liked Works Vege Omelette and Traditional Omelette. Not a big fan of Chili omelette. Last visit I had just the classic 2 Sunnyside up with toasted English muffin. Had something like this with multigrain before and fruit plate but this time I had it with cottage cheese. Hubby had eggs with potato but usually he would order it with bacon or ham too but I begged hubby to get something without meat for breakfast this time. Whatever you order here is great. I've tried many and highly recommended! Coffee is ok not so much on the "wow" side but they give you a pot for a table, so drink up your caffeine and then go play and win a jackpot!
Eggs Benedict, biscuits and gravy and banana nut muffins...amazing! Always friendly service and accommodating staff. It's the place to go whenever we are in Vegas.

Great service, free banana nut muffin, and pretty good food.  What makes this place shine though has to be the service. Super friendly staff that focuses on the small things like offering coffee to go, asking if we need a cup holder, and being consistently friendly.  Something about the rye bread with butter made it better than bread at other places.  Maybe it was the swirls in the middle.  

While the food isn't they best in the wolrd, the whole package of atmosphere, service, and speed the food came out made this place a winner.  Plus they know how to utilize Reciprocity Principle by giving away free muffins: smart folks! Most likely coming back next time I'm in Vegas.

excellent customer service. very fast and friendly. staff here knows how to make customers happy: get them seated quickly, take orders right away, bring their checks early, and let them pay at the front when they're ready to go. no extraneous wait time so you can just sit, eat, and leave. food wasn't overly spectacular though. simple tasty meals with eggs utilized in creative ways, but nothing that really wow'd me

GroÃe Auswahl an Eierspeisen aller Art. FÃ¼r unseren Geschmack hÃ¤tten die Portionen etwas Ã¼bersichtlicher ausfallen kÃ¶nnen. Freundlicher und zÃ¼giger Service. Achtung: Schal einpacken, die Klimaanlage tut's!

Love this restaurant! They are usually quick about seating folks. They are attentive and I love the egg on the table that you can switch to yellow if you need something! It's great not trying to have to chase your waiter\/waitress down when you need something! My favorite dish is the huevos rancheros and eggs Benedict. My husband usually goes healthier and gets the yogurt parfait and Brad's very special omelette. My husband never orders coffee there. He says it's too weak.

Really great service! Large menu selection! Dog friendly patio! The free banana nut muffin with check in is delicious! Coffee is hot and fresh. I had eggs, bacon and toast. Very good and I love that I can take my dog with me instead of leaving her at home. I will definitely come back and recommend this place:)

What a find! After having humongous buffets at various places in Vegas, this was a welcome change! Definitely give it a try on your way back. My husband had the eggs Benedict and I got the veggie omlette. Very cute little place.

Wonderful food and wonderful service. 

Thank you so much Reina!!! 

We will definitely come back :)

Almost without exception when I'm traveling I will use yelp to guide me to the best restaurants. You would think this restaurant with over 2300 reviews would be a slamdunk, but unfortunately it wasn't. My girlfriend and I drove off the strip several miles to a very unimpressive strip mall, waited in line for 20 minutes only to be thoroughly disappointed. I had the spinach eggs Benedict which was very bland (hollandaise sauce was mediocre), and my girlfriend had the works omelette. Both came with Diablo potatoes which are nothing more than fried, cubed potatoes with some seasoning salt on them. The coffee was good and the banana nut muffin was excellent. Everything else I give two stars for in setting my expectations so high and delivering so little.

For someone that is out of town I recommend this place... u get your money's worth.. I'm writing a review while eating that's how good this place is, I couldn't wait to write the review... I'm coming back for more, next time

We came here for the first time and will definitely be back. Great portions, good prices, and exceptional service. Tabitha was great, making recommendations for us and meeting all of ours needs. Thanks Tabitha!

I'm a biggggg fan of breakfast! This place is so so so so good! Went to Vegas for the weekend and we wanted to stop by for breakfast and we are so glad we found this place! Their signature muffin is out of this world good!! And this is coming from a person that doesn't like bread, cake, or most things that have some type of bread. I'll be going in May again to Vegas and we will defitnelty come here again!

Food is pretty average. Service is spotty at best. 

There are 2 girls working the front counter. One blond who was really stand-offish and borderline rude when I approached the front...I was standing there for nearly 1 minute wondering how to get on the list, when the other one, the brunette came by and asked the blond to put my name on the list. All this time, the blond was just standing around, twirling her hair. The brunette was friendly and made sure my name was on the list. The rude blond really did not care...wonder how many potential customers she has driven away already.

 So, I wont visit again, just due to the rude way in which I was treated at the beginning
We walked right in on a monday morning for breakfast and the food came quickly!  The potato's were amazing!  Highly recommend hitting them for a very satisfying breakfast!

My wife and I came here and our server was Karla she was really nice and she didn't rush us to order food like some waitress. I ordered the mash potatoe omelette it was just like a bake potatoe except in an omelette. My wife ordered the chicken tortilla soup and a breakfast tostada . The breakfast tostada had refried beans , scrambled eggs , cheese , potatoes , salsa , olives and sour cream . She enjoyed it !! I recommend this place because the staff is friendly , the food isn't expensive and you get a large portion

Not sure what all the high reviews on this place is about. This is your standard ordinary breakfast place. The service is excellent, very friendly and nice waitresses. The menu is great, lots of variety to choose from. But the food was just average. I was really disappointed in my bacon and avocado omelette. I thought they seriously forgot to add the bacon. I dug through the omelette for it and finally saw tiny small crumbles of it in there. The egg was thick and dry and the only good thing about it was the avocado chunks inside. Big pieces of avocado. That's IT.  The potatoes it came with were not good. Just deep fried potatoes. The side of fruit was much better. The corned beef hash was mushy and had a lot of potatoes. Was disappointed in that too. Why the heck all the stars, yelpers?? 
Ok ok, the muffin was probably the best part. They give you choice of toast or muffin. Get the muffin!

Me and my husband were visiting Las Vegas and I found this place on Yelp. We have it a try and the food was amazing, the service also was great.
We visited again for our last day of vacation and everything was great.
Great food and great service
I highly recommend here.
Sooooo delicious 
Thank you egg and I, you guys rock

So glad we made the drive over. Simple diner with great food, fast service, and reasonable prices. Does get busy but worth the wait. All 4 at our table loved their choices and as others have noted the Banana Nut muffins are a cant miss.
Stacie is the best.  Great service, amazing muffins!  Tons of muffins, great for the trip home.  The pricing is beyond fair especially for the portions.  Killer eggs Benedict!

HATE Nothing.

DISLIKE The location (not a great view). My waitress barely checked on me. Too much butter on each piece of toast (and I didn't even ask for butter).

LIKE The location (aimed at locals) and diner vibe. The fruit selection with your plate. Decent prices.

LOVE The Crazy Chicken omelet. Diverse breakfast menu items such as spam with sticky rice and cincy chili (chili over spaghetti).

Mr. Egg. Mrs. Egg. And Egg Kiddies are all here.
Yeah theres usually always a Wait  Line. Foodies who Really Really Really LOVES Breakfast needs to Eat Elsewheres. To ever relieve Egg and I constant Lines.

Look around if you Eat here. Everyone is always A Smiling. Is it the Huge Delish to Max Bannnnnnana Muffins??????? Ans before you buy a Dozen, do Yelp checkin for one free. Hope all family members have Yelp App.

Egg and I have won like 20 awards.


Myself.... prefer Hash browns rather than seasoned potatoes! Too salty for my taste. Other with us liked the Biscuit Gravey... I had much better. More Flavorful. Less Salty. My bacon was soft and oily.

This my second time over the years. 3 stars total both times. OJ, Muffin 5 stars. My selections choice could have been better.


Place here always packed AM. 30 minutes wait
The food here was really good. We got a free banana muffin for checking in. sooo good

Our party of 6 only waited about 5-10 minutes before being seated at around 11am.  Service is quick and friendly.  Between Hash House and Egg & I, I'm leaning more towards Egg & I now because the service was more friendly and accommodating while the wait was significantly shorter.  Of course in Vegas you'd think there'd be something special about the eggs... like a dinosaur-size egg over easy... but in the end the eggs are pretty standard eggs... nuttin' too special.  If you mess up eggs, you've got no business serving food.  My 5 stars are for the hash!  Something about that homemade beef hash makes it stand out over all others.

Our server, Linnea, was great. Dined with my husband and another couple. Everyone loved their food. They were out of prime rib so we had to substitute steak for the prime rib Benny. Hubby and I split it and it was plenty for us to eat. I also got a free banana nut muffin which was AMAZING! Menu is diverse enough that everyone can find something to eat. Will definitely be back!!

Great place for that comforting desire of the south west. Service staff is friendly and accommodating. There are regulars left and right due to the variety of food served. One can order the American eggs and toast with a side of fruit as well as the Belgium waffle that is crisp on the outside and moist on the inside.
Their house banana muffin is awesome! Their potato fries and squares have an seasoning that has just enough flavor in it to mix perfect with your eggs. 
We had an excellent experience and will most definitely go back.

This place is delicious. I'm sure everyone who knows this place knows this already.  The banana but muffins are awesome.  But I'm mostly writing about our server Amanda.  A young and friendly face that made our experience above expectation.  Her kind and always helpful manner left us in a good mood and ready to enjoy our day after breakfast.  Never in my life have I ever had such a positive server.  She really made our day.  For that I wanted to leave this review.  So if you're ever in town and want a great breakfast, come to the Egg and I and definitely ask for Amanda.

We came as a group of 7 on Friday around 1:30pm and only had to wait for about 15minutes. Thank goodness the wait wasn't too long because by now we've been on the road for 5+ hours and we're starving!!! 

I have a feeling that this place is super busy all the time--the restaurant is packed with people and the service is also super duper speedy, like the servers here are always on their toes to get people in and out as quickly as possible. But they're still super friendly, so I'm not complaining because I love the efficiency of this place. 

F O O D:
Honestly the food here was a pretty big disappointment. For some reason the food here was very very salty--the ham, the sauce, everything. Eating this makes me feel super gross and pretty terrible about myself. Especially because the portion sizes here are HUGE!
