My friend and I shared the Stuffed French Toast and we couldn't finish it (sorry potatoes :( ). So I recommend sharing just one thing between you and a friend or you can always take it to-go. I thought the Stuffed French Toast was really delicious because it wasn't salty at all, but our friends that got the Eggs Benedict dishes weren't so lucky :( 

P A R K I N G:
There is a parking lot right out front so no worries about parking! 

Don't forget to check in for the free banana nut muffin! It's warm, it's wonderful, it's amazingly good!

Came here for brunch with a friend who's a local. The wait was about 25 minutes, but it was definitely worth it. I ordered the biscuits and gravy. Best I've ever had. The biscuits were melt in your mouth, and the gravy was so flavorful. I also had the orange juice, which tasted hella fresh.

This was my second time here and my girlfriend's first. Amanda was our server and she was prompt as well as very helpful. I ordered the chile rellenos omelette and my girlfriend got the country fried steak. The food was absolutely delicious and my girlfriend is excited to come back on our next vegas trip.

If you're looking for a decent & in-eggspensive (well, at least by Vegas terms) place for breakfast, let me suggest the Egg & I. The service is very friendly and attentive. If you're looking for a nice break from The Strip, this is a good choice.

The food is decent. Not gourmet, but certainly not bad neither. There is a wide array to choose from. I particularly am fond of the omelets, which are quite tasty. The skillets are quite good also.



Oh yeah... don't pass up the Banana Nut Muffins... it's eggscellent.

This place was just ok. It's not worth the trip off the strip. I do like that they give you your own carafe of coffee. Much appreciated after a night imbibing in vegas. 
Unfortunately the food was nothing special. I got the egg, ham and cheese croissant they brought it late because they had accidently made it with bacon instead of ham but it was still disappointing. it just wasn't very flavorful. They have better ham and cheese croissants at Dunkin Donuts.

My husband was also disappointed with his eggs benedict. The hollandaise sauce was good but the benedict was drenched in it. Moderation people!!

Wow that's a lot of reviews . I guess I came on an off day because the only thing that was good was the muffin . Service is very fast so fast that they forgot part of our order . We asked the waitress for our toast she said your order doesn't come with toast we said we ordered toast she then looked all around our table and looked at us like we were hiding the toast in order to get free toast. She said I will go look for it . When it arrived it was at the end of our meal . The house potatoes are heavily seasoned with what I guess is season salt way to salty to enjoy . The carnitas were cold . It wasn't very good over all.

Second time here. They is always a full house. The service was cheerful but not consistent, we had to flag down people for water. 

The potatoes are always on point. The Monty cristo sandwich was just MEH. I ate 70% of it because I need the energy for driving back home. I tried some of my friends omelette and it was way better than mine. 

The hot sauce was bomb also so I bought a small bottle for the trip home.

I would give the food 5 stars; my wife would give it a 3.  We had to wait 20 minutes for a server and Crystal came to our rescue.  It was not her station and she was a star once she knew we hadn't been served.  

I went there for Loco Moco but ordered the Island Favorite; Portuguese sausage, eggs and sticky rice with a slice of fresh pineapple.  It was a real treat!   I have used Kikkoman soy sauce all my life and was pleasantly surprised by "Aloha Soy Sauce" that Crystal brought to the table.  It is slightly sweet and was a nice change.  

My wife said the biscuits and gravy were good but did not enjoy the "works potatoes: which looked like diced potatoes, deep friend and seasoned with Lawry's seasoning salt.  She had a side of bacon which was really good.

The Egg and I is our favorite place for breakfast when we visit Las Vegas. The food and service is always good. But this time our waitress Ashley H. made it even more enjoyable. She was extremely personable and helpful .My  husband and I always share because the portions are very generous. But we always have to compromise because we each want something different. Ashley informed us about the dishes that we can get half portions of. So now there is no need to share. We can each get what we want. Everything on the menu is great. So be adventurous and  try something different.

Packed (understandably), but we got the last empty table. Waitress, Genesis, was there instantly for drinks order, then food order--she made recommendations that we wisely accepted. Food came quickly and was great (skillet scramble & omelet). Next time, breakfast burrito (looked like 1.5x normal size).

Just about everything comes with Habla Diablo potatoes, which the waitress accurately explained as having seasoning salt, but they've not really spicy or hot.

Restaurant is very clean, has a huge menu (almost entirely breakfast fare), and is very well staffed. Table-to-waitress ratio was very low, and tables are bussed immediately. Tables also have a little placard on a ring that's normally black smiley face, for all is well, or yellow frowny face for service please. There are managers or expediters wandering around, and they pounce immediately if you turn the placard to yellow (service).

Excellent overall.

Had a coupon so we broke from our usual habit of hitting our neighborhood Omelet House and tried this place.  It's a winner!  Comfortable restaurant, friendly staff and great service.  And, oh, the food is really really good.  Prices a bit high but quality and portions are excellent.  My wife had the cheddar cheese omelet....it looked so pretty you almost didn't want to eat it.   Light, cheesy and oh so good.  Banana nut muffin equally good.  I had the piggy skillet....layered with potatos, ham, sausage, bacon and cheese, with a couple eggs on top.  Delicious.

This is place gets two sunny side thumbs up from me!  It's in a crappy shopping center on the wrong side of the tracks.  No worries just walk in get yourself a great breakfast, you forget you're in North Las Vegas.

The food is great, omelettes are full of flavor, home potatoes are decent (3 stars), French toast yummy goodness, large portions, great service.

I got the crazy chicken omelette, it's one of the tastiest omelettes I've ever had, a definite must!
Their home made banana nut muffin, delicious!!!

Btw, Kelsey our waitress was awesome!  

Just keepin' it real eggy
The Real Foodie

Very great "homey" environment, servers were very sweet, and the food was delicious! Glad that my family chose to eat here on our quick trip to Vegas. I was also pleased that they had their sauces for sale!

If you can get off the strip, you need to try the breakfast here. Staci was our server and she helped to make this a great dining experience.  She was friendly, helpful and professional. I ordered the pulled pork taquito, served with eggs on the top. Oh my, this was delicious and humongous. It served with a green salsa which I don't normally like but this was good. If you like a little Mexican with your brunch this is a dish worth trying. My partner had the homemade corned beef hash.  Also delicious, big chunks of meat. The meal started with their muffins. So Good, I wish we saved one for later.

I haven't been here since 2011. Service and food is still excellent.
My server REINA took great care of us. Thank you!

Great food and portions! Above all, phenomenal customer service. My wife has a gluten intolerance and our server, Patrick, was extremely knowledgeable in what items were safe for her to order. It was a breathe of fresh air to be in a great down-to-earth atmosphere, away from the strip. Highly recommend this place.
The staff was so friendly and welcoming! Very attentive and the food is just amazing! Don't forget to try their muffin is so delicious and is served warm!

This place is amazing!  I've been dying to try it ever since driving by once and seeing the line out the door.

We dined on a Friday morning around 11 and there was a wait of about 15 minutes.  The menu is cute and read likes a newspaper. 

The portions are huge and we split 3 dishes between the 4 of us. 

Catherine's Scramble: chicken, mushrooms, spinach, feta and artichokes.  I was sold on all the ingredients and the dish was amazing and flavorful.

Bacon, avocado and cheese omelette: full of bacon flavor and packed with avocados.  Usually when I get avocado with my omelette it is served sparingly with just a few pieces on top.  They were not stingy with it and filled it completely.

Corned beef hash: the good stuff, not canned corn beef.  Eggs and toast were included.

All the dishes were served with a side of ranch potatoes, which is amazing in itself.  I would eat the potatoes alone!

 Priced well with large portions.  I will definitely be back to try other dishes.    
.

Gets packed around 10. You can call ahead to get your name on the list, but they will only  honor it for 30 minutes in advance. The banana nut muffin is delicious with coffee. The potatoes were also delicious because of the seasoning they used. Service was friendly and fast. I recommend their original breakfast burrito.

..these guys are very good... pricing, food, service (Oscar's great)..
..every seat gets taken for very good reason.. 
...and don't be afraid to share..or be prepared to take-home..
..we live 20 min away in Henderson.. in the area for something else.
..next time, might just come back for them

This place was slammed but the seating was fast, the service excellent and the food great as always. Just crowded and noisy at times but that is to be expected. I've been to a lot of Egg & I locations and the menu on this one was huge. If you cant find something you like there is something wrong with you

It's a very busy place always crowded but it's well worth the wait. The last time I came I only waited 10 minutes which was shocking I usually wait 20-30 because how crowded it is. The customer service Is pleasing for a busy place! They always make you feel welcome. Their potatoes has to be one of the best things there. What ever I order I make sure the item comes with potatoes or I get them in the side. If you are a fan of banana but muffins then you will honestly love theirs. Always moist and fresh out the oven. I've been to Egg works which is the same business but for some reason I prefer the Egg and I more.

LOVE this place! My friend turned me on to this "off-strip" gem on my bday.

Great menu, fast service and fairly cheap prices. LARGE portions so maybe split your breakfasts!

My ritual before heading home. I head to Egg and I and have a breakfast feast. I enjoyed everything that I have tasted there. From fried eggs to the pancakes to the seasoned potatoes. It has a very homey feeling. 

It is nice to get away from the strip and get used to life outside of Vegas before heading back home. I love the staff here. Super nice!

The omelet was delicious and portion was generous, potatoes was really really yummy I couldn't stop eating although I was really full!! While many people recommended their banana nut muffin and we decided to give ourselves a try, turning out it was really good!!! Couldn't believe we can find such a cutely decorated, good and affordable brunch place in Vegas and just 5 minutes drive from the strip!!

Heard about this place thru a friend and then saw reviews on Yelp. Our visit started a lil rocky as we were sat outside, it got really cold but their heaters were not functioning. Won't go into the details, but we were accommodated inside quickly, took a bit longer to place our order.....but the food was definitely worth the wait. 

Our party order the following: Country Biscuits N Gravy, Country Benny, and an assortment of Skillets. I also ordered the Strawberry Cream Cheese French Toast. Ahhhhhh-mazing!! 

We all devoured our food. Everything was delicious. Great portion sizes too. 

Service was quick and friendly. Our server Lily was great. General Manager Marc even gave us a bread loaf as a parting gift. We are definitely coming back the next time we are in Vegas!

Egg-celent food! :)  it's definitely an old fashion restaurant and setting. We had 4 diners in our party and everyone was very happy with their meal and the service. We will definitely go back again the next time we visit vegas!

This is our favorite breakfast spot because the most amazing waitress is here Karla, we love Karla she makes us feel like family every time we come!! She knows our order and can anticipate our every need.  The foods delicious of course, but the real reason we drive, wait and happily spend our money here is due to the incredible service we always get from our favorite waitress Karla. Ask for her and trust me she is worth the wait!!

It was okay nothing special...pancakes were dry didn't eat it. Got that with bacon eggs and potatoes and toast! The staff was good friendly, it took a while for the food to come out but it was expected for a Sunday. Food wasn't terrible but I wouldn't come back.
Erin was an amazing server we went with a group of 15 and she did great! Everyone's food was hot and delish!

Classic greasy spoon spot and I mean that in the best way possible. Biscuts and gravy were great, pancakes were massive (butter milk were so good) and the classic breakfast burrito was everything I hoped it would be. 

Expect a wait if you are going at breakfast or brunch time. Pricing is maybe just a touch higher than you would expect. Great spot off the strip.

I really loved how friendly the staff was! The wait was not too long and they were very organized and getting your order ready quickly. We checked in and got free banana bread. We were surprised to get two, one for each adult.. In all honesty as far as the food quality goes it was well prepared and it looked very good. But I am really picky and I felt as though it was cheap ingredients.

My husband really loved his chicken fried steak. I was surprised that everything has seasoned salt on it. The waitress brought two cups and a picture of coffee when only my husband ordered coffee and then I did drink some of it was pretty good and she didn't charge me. I did appreciate that!

We're from Los Angeles - on vacation. The wait wasn't as long as we had expected - but a much longer wait would've been worth it! Liza was super attentive, friendly, & warm. We highly recommend this place to anyone in Las Vegas area. We had Mimosas, stuffed French Toast, & the Works Chili Skillet; simply the best!!!

Stopped by for breakfast before our trip back to LA.. We got there at about 10:00 A.M.  The wait was about 10 minutes, our server was Linae (spell check) she was really nice and attentive, 5 stars to her! The food was good. I ordered the huevos rancheros and the BF had an omelette.. I can't remember the name... The potatoes were yummy.  Good price.. It got a bit crowded and it was very difficult to stand in line to pay at the register when all the parties waiting to be seated were standing right there.. Some old man even cut in front of us.. I guess he thought we were waiting to be seated.  By the time we left it was packed! Did I mention it was a Monday!?!  Will Definitely be back when in Vegas, I enjoyed the food and everyone was super friendly..  I'll try it a bit earlier with less of a crowd next time

This place is by far my favorite breakfast place in all of Las Vegas. Their omelettes are excellent and their Banana muffins are the best I've ever had ANYWHERE. I come to Vegas 8-10 a year and even if I don't have time to make it in for breakfast I'll call in a to go order of the muffins. 5 of 5 stars for sure!

Great time, excellent food.  Paula our server was fun and attentive and threw in a Banana Loaf for our friend who was celebrating his birthday.  Highly recommend your trip to Las Vegas include a visit here

I had ordered the eggs benedict which was recommended. Overall, it was alright, it was just smothered in hollandaise sauce and I got kinda grossed out after a while. Their potatoes were good and nicely seasoned. But the main reason why I gave them 4 stars was for their banana nut muffin. Sooo good, slightly chewy and a nice sweet thin glaze on top. It was the best banana nut muffin I ever had.

Large Servings for Reasonable Prices. It is no wonder it is nominated the number one spot for breakfast in Las Vegas. I ordered a fruit plate and got a platter of pineapple, cantaloupe, honeydew melon, clementines, blueberries, watermelon, grapefruit, & strawberries, it also included cottage cheese (or yogurt) a side of toast, unlimited coffee, & a small orange juice. This will be a must stop among many when out in Vegas!
Amazing and contains a really creative menu.
So completely awesome. Love the table service interactives. Makes things so easy. The food was delicious with great portion sizes.

There was a 2 hour wait for our first choice restaurant, so we went down the street to Egg and I, and I'm so glad we did. They were able to sit our huge party (16 people) in only 20 minutes on a busy Sunday morning. The service was excellent, they were there to refill waters, coffees, and juices before we even realized they were empty. They have a helpful little sign where you can flip it to yellow if you need assistance at your table - we never had to use it once. 

The food was also amaaazing. I am a huge breakfast fan and have been to tons of breakfast places. They had the best chicken fried steak I've ever had, and there was so much of it I had the leftovers for lunch and was full all over again. Definitely worth the price. They give you so, so much food! And it tastes great. Everyone at the table loved their food. Whenever I visit Vegas in the future, I will be SURE to stop by again, because I was blown away!

We went here earlier this month not realizing that we'd been to their other Southeastern location in April 2010.  We were thrillled because we loved the food!  The coffee is so good and strong and love anywhere like this that leaves the urn on the table so you don't have wait for refills (I hate that!).
I had the Taco Rancheros which was a flour torilla covered with scrambled eggs, seasoned ground beef, refried beans, cheese, sour cream and salsa. I put the fried potatoes on top of it and it was awesome! 
My boyfriend had the Reuben Sandwich and he loved it.
This is one of those places where you get so much food that you don't need to eat again until dinner!

Great food! I recommend the traditional eggs Benedict.  The home fries are spectacular.  We had great food and excellent service, thank you Linnea for providing us with great suggestions and great service!
My new favorite breakfast in vegas!  Country fried steak was awesome!  The potatoes and muffin were very good!!
Great service. Busy restaurant. The food was pretty good. If they had more variety of hot sauce it would have been perfect!

Staci, our waitress, was the bomb!  The service here is great. Everyone is so friendly. The food was great. I brought my husband and brother-in-law and they loved it!  Egg and i never fails to impress!
Great Chicken fried steak & potato fries. Such good gravy, and seasoned potatoes! Thanks, Chris - a great server in Las Vegas on 4533 West Sahara!  We are leaving satisfied, and full.

Having breakfast in Las Vegas was not my thing for the 3 days.  This time I met a business contact at Egg & I.  Service was very good and place was packed for a Thursday at 8am.  I ordered the following:

Corned Beef Hash ($11): It came with two eggs, toast and potatoes.  The potatoes, eggs and toast was good but the Corned beef was mushy, wet and very salty.  Everything else was good. 

I noticed that they have a Hawaiian menu so when I go back, I'm going to try the Loco Moco.
I had the Sundance Omelette! This is what i always get every time i visit this place. For me, it's so delicious!

Husband and I came here for a quick bite the day we left Las Vegas heading to the airport. The parking lot was packed to the brim, but we only waited maybe 15 minutes at most. Service was fast, waitresses were kind and quick. Husband ordered the hash skillet it was amazing, like, mouthgasm amazing. When it came to the table it didn't look like it was going to be that good, but wow. I ordered a chicken fried steak breakfast with over easy eggs, gravy was portioned well, not overly done, steak fried perfectly, not greasy, but crispy even with the layer of gravy. Their potatoes are pretty interesting diced\/cubed with like a season salt, have a nice crunch to them. The portion sizes here are absurdly large, I think we could've easily shared one of these breakfasts plates and been satisfied. We both weren't able to finish either plate. They also come with a side of toast or a muffin. Only downside I'd say is the coffee price is a bit on the steep side, but they do leave you a jug, at your table so you don't need to flag someone down and you're supplied with all your needs at your table.

FYI: While this offer lasts, check-in for a free Banana Nut Muffin, you will not regret it! 

What a gem to have in Las Vegas, definitely one of the best breakfast spots I've ever had. After looking up a few places, ie. Denny's, Hash House a Go Go, we decided to come here even though it's off the strip. We took a Lyft from Venetian and the ride was only $11. 

With a party of 10, we thought that the wait would be around an hour, hour and a half, but amazingly, it was only thirty minutes. If you are coming here though, expect a long wait, so be patient, but it's worth the wait! Once we got seated, they handed us menus which looks like a daily newspaper. Deciding what to eat here was probably one of the hardest decisions I've had to make since there are 8 pages of food to read. Took a while but I finally decided on the Santa Cruz Skillet. 

Santa Cruz Skillet: The order came with toast and butter (since I got the muffin with the check-in) and sunny-side up eggs. The potatoes, chorizo, Santa Cruz sauce and the runny yolk was probably the best breakfast you could ask for after a night of drinking. Portion-wise, you could easily share this with another person but I was able to finish it on my own. 

Service was amazing throughout the meal, they have a system where you flip the happy egg to a sad egg whenever you need something, genius! I would have subtracted a star for them bringing out the 2 Bloody Mary's and Michelada after we almost finished the food, but they didn't charge us for the drinks in the end. On top of that, 7 of us checked-in for the free Banana Nut Muffin. I can't stress this enough, don't forget to check in! Will be back here for sure to try the other items on the menu. 

Beware: You will get a food coma after eating here, we all ended up taking a nap in the room afterwards, but once again, soo worth it!
The food was AMAZING - and Liza had the best customer service - we will be back...!!!

Great service, great food, great price; this place is THE place for breakfast... 

Only comment is that the potatoes were a bit salty for my taste, but substitutions were readily available.

We went three of the five days in Vegas, will definitely go again.

I have been there several times and every time I have a great experience. We have ordered different things bisquit and gravy, omelets, pancakes, all the regular breakfast foods and everything have tasted great. You cannot leave this place without trying the banana nut muffin, breakfast potatoes and the coffee. All the dishes we have tried for breakfast have been delicious. This place is a must and is on our list for every Vegas trip. We have even purchased their coffee bag to make their coffee back at home.

The family and I tried this place for the first time and it was all worth coming here for the first time. The service  (hostess) was friendly. The waitress (Tammy) was super friendly and professional, our food arrived in a timely manner and was correct. The food servings were phenomenal and delicious. Tammy was very attentive and provided great service from the beginning to the end. We highly recommend the restaurant and the waitress.

We wanted to head off the strip and get a taste for the rest of Vegas. We got here early, just after 9 AM, and it was already busy but a quick 10 minute wait.

I opted for the bacon and onion skillet, figured that's not something I make at home. YUM! I thought the ranch potatoes were slightly salty but could be because I've been lowering my salt intake lately.

The husband opted for the bandito omelette with the banana nut muffin (which was delicious!). He did not leave hungry.

Large servings, fast service, delicious food and nice atmosphere. We left satisfied and glad we found this place on Yelp.

Great FOOD!  I recommend the chicken fried steak. Hell I would've ate just about anything there. Great service, the servers were attentive and the food was great.  If you're in the area and want a good breakfast, go to this place!
Super yummy food.  I'm not an adventurous eater here but I love the omelets and the skillets!  So yum!  The service is usually great, though there is always a bad seed.

This family oriented restaurant is a great place for brunch.  The menu selection is vast (6 pages!) and offers dishes for both vegetarian and non-vegetarians alike.  I ordered the veggie good omelette.  The yummy omelette (I requested mushroom, spinach, and cheddar on mine) came with well-seasoned potatoes and their infamous banana nut muffin.  You must try their banana nut muffin!  It was probably the best banana nut muffin I've ever had and I'm not exaggerating.  It tasted like there was a slight hint of buttermilk in the muffins but whatever this restaurant did to them made them amazzzingggg.  

All the portions sizes are huge and I liked how I could easily substitute items that were orginally in the veggie good omelette to make my order just the way I like it.  Great prices for what you are getting as well.  The atmosphere is also fun and filled with egg puns!  Egg-static!

Just moved to Vegas and heard great things about this place. Went for the first time and they offered a delicious banana nut muffin, complimentary, since it was our first time! It was great. 
Our food, however, was not. The server said our potatoes were fresh, but they didn't taste nor look fresh. They put wayyyy too much cheese on everything and it completely covered up the taste of everything else. So we decided to give it another try.
Came back on a Saturday morning, had the banana nut muffin that tasted stale, again, way too much cheese and our food took forever! I don't know why I thought this place would use fresher ingredients... Definitely disappointing.
Awesome place! Have to try the Banana nut muffin. It is quite a gem.
Great place for Sunday brunch.  Good food, fast service. The banana nut bread is delicious. It's busy but they move quickly so the wait isn't that long.

I came here three years ago and loved it.

I came again and fell in love again.  I had the Key Largo crepe and it was flavorful, delicious, filling and succulent.  That along with the muffins.  I wish heaven had an Egg and I.
Delicious!!  The banana nut muffin is to die for.  The breakfast is delicious here.  The potatoes are flavorful very seasoned. Portions are pretty big - very filling.  Food comes out pretty fast.

Local Las Vegas breakfast place.  Waited 1\/2 hour for family of 6 of which three were toddlers  Provided color crayons and child drinking cups.  Ordered corn beef hash with two over easy eggs.  Corn beef was not crispy but soft cooked.  I had the Hawaiian french toast with pure maple syrup which was good.  Also ordered the chocolate chip pancakes which were pretty good.  Orange juice and coffee to drown it all down.  The only thing I would say is the lack of service hospitality.  Waitress did not provide utensils and did not serve us the right amount of cups of water as ordered.  The hostess blurted out the WIFI password when I had asked but did not give me the proper spelling, therefore, I could not ascertain the service.  Food is good but service could be a bit better.

The best thing was the Banana Nut Muffin which you can get if you check into YELP.

Had a great time - our server Bree was excellent too. However, she never brought out our disco ball, and thus I was unable to OFFICIALLY beat her in the dance-off I challenged her to. 

As a Cincinnati resident, their Cincy Style Chili was great. Their muffins are amazing. The egg dishes were wonderful and full of flavor. This was hands down the best breakfast I've ever had in Vegas!

Banana nut muffin is moist with a great crust. They dont skimp on the canadian bacon when it comes to the eggs florentine benedict.  Hollandaise was on point; not too much salt and is not too creamy, complementing the egg yolk. Potatoes were seasoned perfectly, although they could have been crispier. Had a bite of the chili relleno, overriding flavor was the chili, which is a plus. Coffee left me wanting, but we were there for the eggs!

Great service, no wait to get in, overall great place to have breakfast off the strip.

Thanks to the online reservations on yelp, we was able to book a table before we got there. The wait wasn't too bad and the hostess who got us the seats was very friendly and nice. (She remembered my name, not very common). We ordered the veggie omelette and chicken omelette with spinach and feta cheese. The portions were very large and we were very FULL. The staff was very friendly and the ambience was great for breakfast. Will visit again when next in Vegas. 
Banana bread was MUST try. Reminded me of a dessert from back home!

We were in vegas for the weekend heading to Mt Charleston looking for breakfast. This had great reviews and was crowded so we proceeded. They have great service but i am not a fan of tex-mex or southwestern food so i could not rate it higher.

Yummy. 

Classic diner with friendly staff. The portions are pretty good so be ready to have left overs if you aren't sharing! 

The food came out quickly and was pretty yummy. I'm definitely coming back to try out some more stuff on the menu
Great breakfast at a reasonable price. The staff is excellent and very courteous.  Will definitely cone again.

On our way out of Vegas I decided to try this place. I love eggs for breakfast and found this place on yelp. Thx fellow yelpers. You didn't disappoint. It's not too fat from the freeway and easy to find

The banana muffin was awesome. I inhaled mine so fast. I had the Brad's special with the yummy ranch potatoes. The price was great too. I'm definitely coming back here when I'm in Vegas.

Spent a few days in Vegas and wasn't feeling like a "buffet" style breakfast or our normal Hash House a Go Go meal. Found Egg and I in a coupon book given to us at our Hotel. 

Located in a strip mall with a lot of parking, there was no wait on a weekday morning, but the place was full of patrons. Took a while for our server to take our order and asked us twice what we wanted to drink (amnesia maybe ?..no she was just busy, trying to tend to everyone), so after about 10 minutes, my husband flipped the sign with the un-happy egg, to show we needed attention. The sweet lady at the register quickly came to us and asked what we needed. Our server quickly came to us and apologized for the wait and also brought each of us the BEST BANANA  NUT MUFFIN ever !!! 

I had the Blackend Prime Rib Benny, A Grilled croissant with  prime rib, sauteed spinach and roasted red bell peppers, two poached eggs, then covered with hollandaise sauce. Also came with home fries and 2 slices of fruit. This dish was AMAZING ! All the flavors tied together so well and that Banana Nut Muffin will make me a return customer ! The hubby had Crepes filled w\/ Mushrooms, that I take was also delicious, since  I didn't get to taste it ! 

The coupon for a "buy one meal get the other for half off" made the whole experience even better.

 We'll be back in 2 mos..EGG AND I but this time we won't be alone.

By far, the best breakfast in town! Our server today, Karla, was super attentive, quick, and very nice! I have been a loyal egg & I customer since moving to vegas in October and I have no plans to go anywhere else. Their hot sauce is amazing as well. Egg substitute omelette for the win!

Okay. Food and service used to be better.
Ordered buckwheat pancakes this morning.  When the cakes arrived they looked much lighter than normal.  Sent the cakes back thinking they were wheat instead of buckwheat.
Waitress returned with order of cakes saying the restaurant had changed the batter.  Now the cakes are cold.  Taste was not bad, but not as good as the original buckwheat pancakes.  Disappointing. The waitress did not ask how we liked the "new and improved" version.

Love this restaurant! Excellent service, and the food was amazing! We recommend the avocado and bacon omelet. Their muffins are fabulous! Our server's name was Claudia, she was lovely! We highly recommend this restaurant!
GET THE BANANA MUFFIN! You cannot leave without trying it, it was awesome! Everything here is really good, hands down one of the best breakfast joints i've ever been to.

This has become my common stop right before leaving from Vegas back home. I have been there only 3 times and have had chili skillet every time. Food is great. Even my veggie friends have loved this place. Service is really friendly and attentive. First time I went there I had 3 different servers coming to take my order. I am not complaining. Idea of changing the egg logo to show that you need something is really cool. They might have taken it too far with "EggCeptional" kinda stuff on their T-shirts. 
They have LCD TVs so you can watch football games while having breakfast (if you are sober enough). One star less for not having this in San Diego.

We visited this location for breakfast during our vacation and totally enjoyed the experience.  The food was delicious and our server, Maria, was polite, friendly and definitely made the stop worth it!!  Customer service is a definite plus!!!
Love egg & I! The banana muffins are the best. Our server Carole Ann was a sweetheart. She was very attentive and made great suggestions :)

Find a 2 for 1 coupon before coming here!  They are in coupon books handed to you the minute you cross the Nevada state line.  For some reason, food tastes better when it's free.

First time guests get a free banana nut muffin.  IT WAS AWESOME!!  I even bought an $8 loaf after my breakfast. I had a chicken sandwich and it was just ok.  My girl had a spinach omelet w\/ feta cheese (the Kay special) and thought it was just ok.

I guess after eating the muffin it was just a slight let-down from there.  At least I enjoyed my loaf for the next couple of days after.  I would come here again and order the pancake stack.  It looked really good.

Service is excellent and prices are pretty decent.

My favorite Sunday Brunch location. This location is always busy, so make sure you are willing to wait 10-15 mins to get your seats. 

Banana nut muffin is one thing you shouldn't miss, it blowed my mind the first time I tried it. It's not over-sweet and the aroma of banana smell so damn good.

So when I am out traveling, one of my most favorite meals in the history of the world is breakfast. And I usually like my breakfasts to be big, home style, and comfortable. So on my last trip to Vegas, rather than brave the elements of the casino buffet, I decided to get in my car and venture around the city and hit up some of the local spots.

Of course, I hit up Yelp to find out what the breakfast scene was in Las Vegas, and it led me to The Egg & I. This place is located in a strip mall, and has really really good parking. But that's just the small stuff, let's get into the real treasure within.

Right off the bat, you feel totally at home in this place. It's got all the elements of one of those quaint little hometown diners that you know and love and probably grew up with. The staff there is super attentive, and honestly made me feel so welcome as soon as I walked into the door.

 I didn't have to wait long at all for someone to come up to my table and asked me what I want to drink. As I slipped on my coffee and looked at the menu, they had a wide variety of stuff to choose from. I settled on the combo plate which had two pancakes scrambled eggs and my choice of sausage, bacon, or sausage patties. I went for the link sausage, because they said that was absolutely the hot ticket. And of course, long-time readers of my Yelp reviews will know that I always order a glass of milk with breakfast as a test for the server's attention to detail.

My breakfast was delivered by a different server and was sat down in front of me and for a brief second I thought I was going to have to make a mental note to give them one star off for forgetting my milk. When lo and behold two seconds later comes my waitress with a glass of milk. Great save on their part!

The food itself was really good the pancakes were light and fluffy, the eggs were cooked to perfection, and they were absolutely right on those link sausages ... they were the bomb diggity. The staff was really good about cruising by every once in a while and refilling my coffee and asking how things were without being overbearing. Honestly, it  felt like I was at a friend's house rather than a restaurant.

The bottom line? If you are ever out in Vegas and don't want to have to navigate through a horde of drunk people, obnoxious teenagers, or Keno players to get to your breakfast, you really have to go to The Egg & I. You won't regret it!

this place is great. i would give it five stars if they had a tofu scramble or some veggie options but i know vegas isn't big on their vegan.

the portions are enormous. no one in my group finished their food, and we all love to eat. the ranch potatoes are good but a touch salty after a while. the egg salad was very good, the seasonal pancakes were amazing... i had a chicken sandwich with onions and peppers and it was delicious.

the place itself is adorable; there are some really great pig-themed drawings in the lobby that i wish i had in my house! my favorite was "swine on harvest moon" closely seconded by "tammy faye bacon." 

the service was great- they have a happy egg\/sad egg table alert system so you can put up your egg to signal you need something. brilliant! and the menus were little newspapers, which is really fun.

totally going to remember this place and come back!!

Really great place for breakfast. They have really cute newspaper Menus and give you free banana nut muffins for your first visit! These were the best muffins I've ever had, I'm usually not a fan of banana nut but these blew me away. I also really liked their potatoes, they were crispy and seasoned really well. The bacon and avocado omelette was also to die for! It was our first time there and the waiter was really nice and helpful.

First time eating there I ate the prime rib poached eggs ssndwich.  Very different style of presentation.   Food was cold when receiving it.  Potatoes were nothing special.  But what was the kicker for me was their salsa.  Thank goodness I didn't dump it on food without tasting it first.  Tasted like vinegar.  They had table tent advertising to vote for best breakfast of Las Vegas.  No I couldn't do that at all.  Service was excellent.   That's only reason I'm giving 3 stars.

I know "what happens in Vegas stays in Vegas" but this place is too damn good not to mention !

So, what so "EGGsellent" about this place?? 
- Friendly Service
- Large portions 
- Big Menu
- Free parking
- Quick service

The list can go on and on cuz this place is so "Egg-mazing!!!" However, let me tell you one thing you must order is the "Banana Nut Muffin". Order one or a dozen to go, TRUST ME!

Though the place is a bit off the strip but it is totally worth the drive, TOTALLY!

This place is definitely amazing this is one of our favorite breakfast spot so we always come here if you come here I would definitely suggest getting the banana nut muffins because they're delicious also the key Largo crÃªpe is really good as well
Food tasty and generous and also a bit on the pricey side.

Enjoyed the good breakfast, really enjoyed how you can substitute just about everything to make it healthier. I got the western and subbed egg whites, no cheese, turkey bacon and no butter, with fruit instead of potatoes. Forgot my coffee but that wasn't anything to bad, also our waiter mixed up our ticket with another table. Service was good minus those couple things, very prompt on getting food out, they have a quick turn around so if you see people outside waiting don't be to afraid to stop in. Facility was little aged, and not the cleanest but that comes with the age of the place.
I love it here! The food is always amazing and the banana nut muffins are bomb! I also had such great service this time from Chance, a waitress there.

All hype? We waited a good 15-20 minutes for a table of 4 on a Saturday, and were all less than blown away by each of our meals. Darn.

The traditional eggs benedict was simply drowning in a very creamy and underwhelming hollandaise sauce and tasted like a somewhat soggy mess. Unappetizing.

The sunrise mountain, which was a croissant underneath scrambled eggs with bacon and cheese, didn't taste too spectacular either and can probably be easily duplicated at home. It looked better than it tasted.

The potatoes, on the other hand, were seasoned well and tasty. Probably the highlight of our dishes.

Service was very friendly and attentive, and once you get your check, you can go up to the front register to pay and split checks as you please.

This place is a gem. After a very disappointing buffet at a casino with a price tag of 32.99 per person. We decided to use yelp for our breakfast in the morning. Needless to say the reviews of this place are true. 


Let's address cons. 

It's off the strip 
It has a decent wait time to be served. Place was packed and it's worth noting but they clean tables and have people seated as fast as possible. 

Pros. 

Food is great. I have paid triple for similar food. And I had the cabo breakfast burrito which is and easy item to mess up. Sause was dryer and baked on so it did not cause the burrito to become soggy. Was crisp without too much grease. 

Great customer service. 

I will be eating here again before I leave is how much I truly enjoyed my self. 

Wife would want me to give it a 4.5 because they used too much cheese on her omelet however it said cheesy so I blame her.
Excellent biscuits & gravy (just ask for an extra side if you like it real saucy).  Fast & friendly service.  Definitely get the free muffin offer....very good as well.

I'm from out of state and this was my first time at this restaurant and id have to say i was not disappointed. My sisters and I found this restaurant online and decided to check it out for the breakfast. I had the country fried steak and it was one of the best country fried steaks I've had. The banana nut muffin was actually the best I've ever had. Our server Tamara was very sweet, she took very good care of us. We will definitely be coming back upon our next visit to Vegas. If you haven't already been sold on this place you need to just go. Great food and amazing service.
Great service and the food was amazing!!! Portion sizes big enough to share between two people.
My husband and I had a delicious brunch! Our waitress Stacy was kind, helpful, and made sure we had everything we needed. We will be back!

When you're in Sin City and breakfast comes to mind, many people might think the breakfast buffets on the Strip hit the spot. Don't get me wrong, those are good. However, if you are looking for something a little off the beaten path for the BEST spot for breakfast in Las Vegas, look no further because the "Egg and I" will have you covered. With an astounding 2,500 reviews (as of October), its no wonder why this place has near-perfect Yelp reviews. 

I've actually had this place bookmarked forever as I finally got the opportunity to dine here with my lady on the morning of Saturday 9\/30\/17. Located directly on West Sahara Ave. (and adjacent to Arville St.), Egg and I is located in the Westside neighborhood of Las Vegas and only about a 10 minute drive from the Strip. Parking especially during breakfast hours can be very challenging as there are other business here. But the majority of people the park in this lot dine here.

Since we had arrived around 10:45am, we park quite a distance from the main entrance. The exterior is very rustic and looks like your mom & pop place. The interior has a very cozy and charming feel to it. Since the weather was a perfect 76Â°, we decided on dining at their generous outdoor patio. Since I was still tired (after not crashing until 3:30am and waking up at 7:30am), I ordered coffee. What is nice is that they give me the entire carafe of coffee! And lots of liquid creamers to go with it. Score! And our server was very sweet, attentive, and took care of us in a timely manner.

Their menu is very extensive; they have a huge variety of Eggs Benedicts, omelettes, corned beef hash, French toast, pancakes, waffles, and crepes. I finally decide on ordering their "Bacon & Onion Skillet" (for $9.99). My lady opted for "The Classic" which are two-eggs (she chose over easy) w\/toast and Godshall's turkey bacon. Both of us receive their signature Habla Diablo seasoned potatoes. Even though business was at full capacity, both our breakfast platters arrive in just 10 minutes.

I've got to say, I was very impressed with what I received. There is something magical about these potatoes because the seasoning in them was addictive! And the bed of eggs over the ooey-gooey cheese made every savory bite a heavenly experience. I had the opportunity of trying some of her turkey bacon and damn, this was flavorful and on point! For the price you pay, you will get enough food to carry you through the rest of the day. In fact, my next meal wasn't until around 8 hours later at 7:30pm.

A little added bonus, if you check-in on the Yelp app, they will give you their signature Banana Nut Muffin. However, we got so much food that even more carbohydrates with that muffin would equal a massive food coma. Overall, the "Egg and I" is definitely a place worth checking out. A great family-owned experience, quality food, excellent prices, and stellar service makes this one of the easiest five-star ratings I've given in quite some time!

My wife and I visit Vegas at least once a year.  Until I found this place (and others) on Yelp, we used to just have breakfast\/brunch in the hotel's anonymous coffee shop.  Meh.

 Now that Yelp has opened my eyes, we've tried different places.  The Egg & I is one of our favorites for breakfast (actually brunch since we don't leave the hotel until 10 a.m. or so).  We eat here most often because there is a plethora of different items on their menu to choose from and they are ALL GOOD!  Breakfast is my favorite meal to eat when I'm away from home, so this is important to me.

To be honest it is pretty difficult to screw up a basic breakfast centered on eggs and breakfast meat.  However, the Egg & I is head and shoulders above the others with various delicious potato and egg treatments, their muffins, and friendly service staff.  Needless to say, we don't eat in hotel coffee shops anymore.  Not only do you get huge quantities of food at the Egg & I, it all tastes great, and what a variety!  If you're not into eggs, they also have waffles, pancakes and french toast, as well as salads and sandwiches.  Also free wifi so you can catch up on news from home & messages while eating.

If you are like my wife and insist on staying in a big-name Strip resort hotel, do yourself a favor and drive a short distance off the strip to have breakfast and some really tasty food.  Catch a glimpse of what the rest of the City of Las Vegas looks like, and taste real food, not the bland stuff the corporate chains dish out.  You might realize, like I did, that The Strip is not the final destination of your trip to Vegas.

There are fine dinner restaurants off the Strip as well!  Yelp is here for you.
Great service, decent biscuits and gravy. But I wasn't quite as impressed by the experience as I was led by friends to think I would be. I think I prefer Cracker Barrel.

I woke up with a massive hangover and needed breakfast food STAT! Buffet wasn't going to cut it... I needed comfort food. We came here on a whim and now it's on my list of must go to spots in Vegas. It's your typical breakfast joint... no more than a 20 min wait even when the  masses are outside the front entrance. There's a plethora of breakfast dishes... american style, mexican style and even islander style! Oh yes... LOCO MOCO. I know Aloha Kitchen is just right there... but when hubs wants Hawaiian and I want Mexican... well then, you gotta find some way to compromise. Egg & I did not fall short with their Loco Moco... it definitely hit the spot... and so did that side of spam!

We were sat quickly, and served promptly by Tabatha. She was quick without rushing. The banana nut muffin really is as good as the hype. We enjoyed our prime rib benny and classic. 
We would come back during our next visit and hope for Tabatha to be our server again!

This restaurant really does not live up to all of its fabulous reviews. The service was very slow and the waitress with colorful hair  ignored us when we told her we were not satisfied with our food. Our orders did not come with all of their sides and they ignored our complaints about that. Also, the toast was burnt and they tried to hide that by placing the burnt sides on top of each other. I will never come back here. Rude staff and terrible service!!!!!!!!

Egg works on flamingo and Durango is way better. Same owners from what I know but this location was wayyyy too greasy, taste not the same at all from the muffin, to the eggs to the potatoes. I'll stick to the flamingo location.
We had a bit of a wait to be seated, but the food was worth it. And I love that they leave a whole pot of coffee at your table, very good!

Our first breakfast in Las Vegas! It was good. The eggs with cheddar were delicious and the waffle was very well done. My bf had an eggs benny and he really liked it. Overall, it was the best breakfast we had in Vegas and I would recommend it. Kept us full for the majority of the day.

I have a few things to say about the dishes I've tried:

- Egg's benedict: flavor explosion in my mouth!  I was recently introduced to the benny and can't believe what I've been missing out on. There are so many sensational flavors in this dish that you just have to try it for yourself!  And those potatoes - I'm not much of a potato breakfast person but could not help stealing these off my friend's plate!

- Strawberry stuffed french toast: I am more of a 'sweets' type of breakfast girl so I typically order french toast. You get 2 slices of toast stuffed with strawberry cream cheese goodness.  Unfortunately, this dish starts to become a little TOO sweet at the end so it's a struggle to finish the last few bites.  (I've had to confirm this by ordering this dish twice.)  If you can share this dish with someone, that'd work out well.

- banana bread muffins: you pretty much have to try this when you go there. I'm so confused because sometimes, I've been given the muffin for free and other times I've had to order it...but whatevs, you gotta do what you gotta do!  The muffin is soft and when served warm = bomb-dot-com.

** ALSO, must note on the service. All the workers are very polite and friendly. If you ever need something, they have this egg face you can turn over at your table. When the egg is black, you're fine.  Need something? Then turn the egg over so it's yellow. I have to say, this system totally works. Because the few times we've need a coffee refill or something..flip over the egg face and *BAM* someone helps you out right away!

This is one of my breakfast spots of choice (another is Baby Stacks) for good, consistent, yummy breakfast food.  Prices are decent too!

Einfacher aber guter FrÃ¼hstÃ¼cksort
Das Restaurant ist simple gehalten, im klassischen amerikanischen Style. 
Es gibt auch Platz auf der Terasse, leider direkt neben der Strasse.

Der Services war manchmal gut und freundlich, manchmal gestresst und wortkarg. 
Das essen ist sehr gut, natÃ¼rlich alles rund um das Ei, wie z.B. Egg Benedict. 
Aber auch die Muffins sind lecker.

Im Vergleich zu den Restaurant am Strip kostet es nur die HÃ¤lfte

Perfektes FrÃ¼hstÃ¼ck!! Unglaublich gut!!! Ich hatte "Three Pigs" und war begeistert. Kann ich nur empfehlen!!! Personal total nett, Portionen riesig. Gibt dann auch (wie in den USA) Ã¼blich eine Box fÃ¼r das Essen. Und dann noch ein Kaffee To-Go dazu.

My in-laws came to visit for Father's Day weekend (2016) and on Saturday June the 18th my father-in-law wanted a worthy hefty breakfast badly. We all got halfway through our meals and almost needed to go boxes already so hefty indeed especially with the seasoned potatoes they serve with most of the meals. We decided to give Egg & I a try and we are in awe! MY father-in-law had the Blackened prime rib benny and he automatically fell in love. My husband had the Cordon bleu skillet as he is a huge cordon bleu fan and he now knows exactly where to go to have such a delicious breakfast. I had the Cabo breakfast burrito, the sauce that covered it went extremely well with the burrito. I am a HUGE fan of Banana muffins so of course I got one before our meals came, we all shared it and it came warm and SO soft. When we arrived it was full house WITH a couple families waiting in front of us. Not even 10 minutes and we were seated. Not even an hour and we were on our way out the door fed, bill paid and happy while it was STILL packed, fast service. Only one thing, you guys should get bigger Orange juice cups, it's about half the size of the water cups and it's good juice so it was gone in 2 mins.

Let's review. Two days in a row. Two different items off the menu. Two reasons to smile. Janeen was great and attentive BOTH days as well! Can't wait to come back for some more banana nut muffins either! Everything is so fresh and delectable. I could seriously try anything on the menu and go home happy.  Hopefully I'll be back in a couple of weeks!

We were just passing through on a road trip. My hotel recommended Egg & I and we are so glad they did! The whole staff was incredibly friendly and upbeat. Really seemed to enjoy what they do. Our server was awesome, I wish I could remember his name! I brought a collapsible bowl for my dog Mojo and our server brought me a big cup of water to give him. They have a big patio and are certainly dog friendly! Great customer service. If I'm ever in Vegas, with or without my dog, I will definitely go back! Wonderful experience, glad they were recommended to me!! :) go there!
The Strawberry Stuffed French Toast is amazing! We got seated right away even during the lunch rush. And the service from Alexa was great.

When the Hash House was packed on Saturday we decided to give this place a try and woo-wee it was worth it! No wait, breakfast until 3pm, and huge portions of delicious foods!!! The service was great and they have cute menus that look like newspapers. Their burritos are kick- ass waffles topped with fresh fruits are amazing and I highly recommend the corned beef hash. One of the best I've had. They also have fresh OJ and the best tasting homefries Ive ever had! I cant wait to go back to this  place next time Im in town.

Didn't even eat there. Waited for 20 minutes when a person parked there car in the front as we waited and and left 2 dogs with the windows up in the hot sun. I went in to talk to the hostess and asked her to make a brief announcement to the restaurant and she responded to me "that's not my problem. You call someone if you want." Our party of 6 immediately left, I will never return.

Delicious! 

Veggie skillet had seasoned potatoes on bottom, then veggies, topped with cheese and egg. I would've used red onions instead of white but still delicious. 

The banana nut muffin was great too.

We had a late breakfast this morning here and although there was a long wait,  the food was delicious and the service was excellent.  We were seated outside but it was a pleasant temperature due to a misting system. I had a Mexican omelet that made my day.  The space is a bit cramped inside, but I'm happy to recommend this place to anybody.

This place is eggcellent and I will definitely return! 

Ulises was my waiter and he was courteous, helpful and quick.

I got the corned beef hash meal and the homemade corned beef hash was awesome and the eggs were well prepared. The banana nut muffin was good, I liked the fact that it wasnt as oily as many muffins. The toast and coffee were just ok, but I'm not complaining, this is a fantastic restaurant and anyone would be lucky to be nearby.

Egg & I has become a recent tradition with the future in-laws.

It's a nice change-of-pace versus the Strip and a mere ten minute drive but not worth the added expense if you plan on cabbing.

Parking is plentiful and there is a delicious bakery with some of the stickiest baklavas in the same strip mall to warmup while you wait (ranging from 10 to 30 min).

Prices are reasonable, service is shoddy, and luckily one cannot mess up eggs.  Food wasn't greasy for whatever's thats worth.

As you may have guessed menu is egg-centric but fear not.  I decided to change things up during my latest visit and ordered hawaiian food.  Yep, you read that right and my internal organs as of a week later remain intact.  They offer: loco moco, spam and eggs and portuguese sausage and eggs.  Ordered both the spam and portuguese sausage and had no regrets.  Forgot the name of the breakfast burrito with the chorizo but it was dense AF and subsequently awesome.

Their homefries are also a must.

If only all brunch spots were as good as this one. First of all, their service is amazing. We called ahead to see our wait time and they offered to put our name down, so by the time we arrived half an hour later, our tables was all ready for a group of 15 --perfect! Our server was also super sweet and constantly checked on us while even offering everyone in the table a free banana nut muffin. I did claim the Yelp check-in for the free muffin, but she was kind enough to just give everyone in our table one. What was even more wonderful was that one of our party members is allergic to nuts, so they gave her a blueberry muffin in replacement.

For food, I ordered the Chicken, Mushroom, and Spinach Skillet with sourdough toast ($10.25). I also shared with the boyfriend as he got the Stuffed French Toast ($9.75). When you're ordering here, I know your eyes are going to speak louder than your stomach, but I can guarantee that you'll be stuffed by the end of the meal. I highly recommend the Stuffed French Toast. It was the perfect blend of savory and sweet with a sausage, cheese and egg mixture folded between french toast. The syrup it comes with is lightly sweet and simply tastes amazing altogether. Of course, you'll end up a little sticky but it's worth the battle. Their potatoes are no ordinary potatoes either. They give you a plate full of potatoes covered with cajun seasoning --so delicious! Not to forget the skillet I ordered, because that was very tasty as well. They melted so much cheese over my potatoes, which was my favorite part. I only had 1\/4 of the skillet and was too full to continue.

When paying, we always struggle with a huge group. They have you pay up front and were very patient to help us easily sort each order and pay efficiently. The service and food is seriously on par here, love it.

Short wait but worth it.  Lelani was great and attentive.  The chicken fried steak was amazing with biscuits and gravy as good if not better than hash house.  There are a lot of things to try so we will be back for sure.  Fifty bucks out the door with a great bloody mary,  screwdriver and free banana muffin which was awesome.  If you wanna venture off strip give it a go and you will not be disappointed.

Came in and the line was out the door, still only took about 10 minutes to get us seated. This place operates like a well oiled machine turning tables over quickly with good service and getting the food out piping hot and fresh.  

Had the blackened prime rib benny and it was so good. It's a very huge portion and it tastes super good by itself but throw on some of that chipotle hot sauce and it's a winner. The side of potatoes it comes with are phenomenal super crispy and seasoned to perfection. 

GF ordered a sundance special omelette and loved it too. Came with the same potatoes. 

Checked in and got the free muffin, server actually gave us an extra one at no charge because of the wait. 

Clean, friendly, fast and cheap and good food. Hot sauce is for sale up at the register too.

The Egg and I was just what we needed before heading to Red Rock to hike.  We were seated quickly by friendly staff and greeted with a carafe of good coffee.  We were there for breakfast expecting your basic bacon, eggs, pancakes etc but the menu was much more inviting.  I had an inlet with spinach, mushrooms, cheese and an order of hash browns with great seasoning.  My friend had pancakes with a choice of a great apple topping or syrup.  The service was fast and the prices were very reasonable.  The Egg and I is off the beaten path but well worth the 10 minute drive from the Strip.

This place was packed when we walked in but didn't have to wait too long (for a party of 2). They sat us outside. The tables were big and they had misters, so that was cool. I checked in on yelp and got a free banana nut muffin, which was delicious! I ordered the country fried steak and my husband ordered the fiesta skillet, added chorizo to it. Both meals were served in big portions, on a hot plate, and they were delicious! Our waitress was attentive, which we really appreciated. The OJ was a little pricey ($3.25) but other than that, the prices were decent. The only reason I'm knocking off a star, is because we asked for a cup of ice to-go, (we're from CA, and planned on driving home after our meal. Wanted the ice for water on the road) and when the ice melted there was some sort of dirt in the bottom of the cup. I'm not sure if she gave us a dirty cup or if they have dirty ice. Either way, it was gross.

First time eating here and I must say I was very impressed with the service and our server Patrick was very nice and attentive.Knowing that it was our first time there he recommended some breakfast items which is alway a plus in my book.Oh and did I mention the portions are huge perfect for a couple to split.

Been l to egg and i many times just not to this location . We brought the dog because they have a dog friendly patio and it was very nice outside . The portions are on the big side and the service was top notch . I got the bacon and onion skillet which was very cheesy and hard to mess up . We also got the stuffed French toast which was good but we will probably skip next time for better options . We had a couple bloody Mary's which were very good as well . Overall a good experience and we will definitely be back for the patio experience .

You will get what you see on these multiple pictures  posted here on Yelp. No more and not definitely less. Portions are huge. You will not leave hungry. My pancakes were good. I could not finish them all because they were VERY LARGE. 
Service was very friendly. We did not wait at all but of course we came in the middle of the week. They had a lot of people dining but there was no line and no wait. 
If you like this type of food i think you will not be disappointed. My husband told me that this restaurant was for vegans but i think he was joking.

Egg and I is currently the best spot for breakfast so far. It's usually very crowded but there is an obvious reason why: it's good. Everything from the service to the food, is outstanding. Our server was extremely humorous and friendly and provided a few laughs here and there. The coffee was good, nothing to be complained about. The atmosphere had a medium to loud ambiance level but it is tolerable, in a sense. The food was great! I had the French Toast sandwich, which is exactly as it sounds. French Toast with egg, sausage, bacon and  cheese inside with a side of syrup. Amazing flavor and everything is well done. Their potato's are fantastic as well.

First, no cream for my coffee. They didn't ask or bring. Checked menu on line before we went, but this location did not have the crabcake benny. My daughter ordered a coke, they brought diet. Yuck! Food came but no forks to eat it with. I got the veggie Benny. Too much lemon in the hollandaise. Probably would have been great with the crabcakes. My daughter got the buttermilk pancakes. Chewy?  And they said that can happen when you add syrup. Really? Doesn't happen at I HOP. The manager was very concerned we didn't like our meal and took off the pancakes since they weren't eaten. The only reason I gave 2 stars. We did have 2 servers, and the 2nd was better,  but I won't be back.

This is one of my regular stops for breakfast. Normally a great breakfast joint but not today. The greeter wasn't friendly and the food was average. This place has been around for a long time with a good reputation. The kitchen needs to try harder and they need a friendly, happy greeter. It will be a while before I go back.

Place -- Family friendly, smiles all around! 

Food -- The banana nut muffin. I saw the clouds parting and sunshine came through.

Service --   All of them were so nice. So, so nice. 

Go back? -- Hell yes. Yes.

Ordered porkchop center cut and it was tender and tasty. Banana nut french toast is the bomb and so is the banana nut muffin. Kudos to Troyce for an excellent service. She even helped cut the food of an elderly customer seated close to us and assured him she would cut his food anytime he comes in. 2 thumbs up to Troyce!
Muffin was good, omelet and potatoes were amazing! French toast was not impressive at all. Over all good experience. Kind of expensive but it was big plates.
Great food. Fast and friendly service!!! The biscuits and gravy are great, and the banana bread muffins are amazing.

AWESOME AWESOME AWESOME food!

A normal trip to Vegas for me and my girlfriend tends to be limited to the strip, but having driven out from San Diego, we decided to venture away from the concrete jungle for breakfast.  I looked on yelp, found this place and we started driving.

Here's all you need to know:

1. There were a lot of people waiting outside, and we almost just left.  For a two-top, we waited 20 minutes (which seemed more than reasonable for a Saturday morning).
2. The food came WICKED-FAST.  Like, 5 minutes MAX.  2 orders of eggs bene and a plate of pancakes.  CRAZY FAST.
3. I am an eggs benedict officianado, and theirs was MAGNIFICENT.  The eggs benedict was probably the best I've ever had, and the "ranch-style" potatoes that accompanied it were fantastic as well.
4. The prices were very reasonable.

100% Guaranteed that I will come back to this place next time I'm in Vegas.

RANDOM NOTE:  After picking up our pup from a doggy hotel near the airport, we considered driving way back to this place for breakfast one more time.  By PURE LUCK, we saw a sign for "Egg Works", stumbled in and discovered that it was the SAME COMPANY.  1 in a million chance and a very happy ending for our trip.  The food was equally as good as The Egg and I.

We were in Vegas over Thanksgiving (2012) and found the Egg & I on line. Ended up eating breakfast there 3 out of 4 days. Both my wife and I had some of the best breakfasts ever! The chicken enchilada omelette was awesome! Service by Janeen was the best! Ask for her and you will start your day right.

I'm all about yelping places to eat. Came across this place so I took my family and brother here. I went in to place my name on the list and went for first available meaning we might be seated outside. It looked okay since they had mists going on and it was pretty shaded. My brother didn't think it was a good idea so I went back and they had no problem noting we wanted to sit inside. It's busy but people go in and out quick. We waited for about 5-10mins. 
As usual we got seated, got menus and they asked for what drinks we wanted. So far so good with service with Amanda. She took our orders and talked a little to my 1 1\/2 year old niece. Drinks came out quick. The banana nut muffin that came with our meal came out as well and it was so delish!!! My daughter and I got one each and we saved one for later. We didn't want to get full so we shared one. 
Our food came out. I had the corn beef hash with the side of potatoes. Potatoes were good. I don't know why I got the corn beef. I'm not really a fan of it but it got a lot of reviews. My daughter ate half of her omelette and saw a hair in it. We bothered one of the servers about it and she took it back and made my daughter a half order of the same omelette. Almost done with our meal, they forgot to t bring out the banana pancakes my bro ordered. We reminded them about it too. 
The lady that took back the omelette came out with a complimentary plate of these banana bread with custard filling goodness. She probably gave it to us because of my daughters omelette and forgetting the pancakes on time. Omg! It melts in your mouth!! 
I love this place and they have the best customer service. Especially when it's crazy busy in there. When they brought out the pancakes, they told us they did not charge us for the omelette and pancakes. How awesome is that?? 
They're super nice! Thank you Amanda! I'll definitely go back but not order the corn hash for me.

Amazing breakfast with a break away from all the Vegas pricing at other restaurants. Our server was Lisa who was outstanding, always making sure we were well taken care of. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an awesome breakfast for a decent price.

Killer breakfast at this place, and I'm not big on breakfast. I definitely enjoyed the giant selection on the menu.  You might not eat the rest of the day though--generous portions!

It's also away from the insanity of the strip--which I found favorable.

What a great place for anytime meal, but we came for breakfast...and make sure you yelp and check in you'll get a complimentary banana nut muffin....great start! 
I chose the Ensenada Burrito which was a great meal in itself but wonderful mix of mild Mexican flavors!! Our service was fantastic!! When you're looking for a great dining experience, stop in the Egg and I!!!

The young waiter with the arm tattoo who looked like a young Art Garfunkel was awesome. 

Good food. Exceptional service. We'll be back.
Erin was an awesome server. She helped my husband pick his new favorite meal. We love eating here. My daughter had a waffle

Decor nothing fancy... the food rocks. Well worth the 30 min wait 
I ordered the potato omelette without cheese ontop. With every bite I took, I went Mmmmmmmm while chewing. Eggs with bacon, scallions ontop and filled with garlic mashed potatoes. I am not a fan of potatoes with eggs. However, Mmmmmmmm their Diablo potatoes were wonderfull!
I would go back today if I did not have other plans.
Service par excellente!

Highlights: Their banana nut muffins and kay's special omelette were excellent!  full of flavor and large portions. The prices were reasonable, expect $8-$13 for most dishers.

Coffee was bleh, but my friends enjoyed their O.J. with pulp.

While the service crew were very friendly and helpful, I did see some flaws:
When coffee was served, we weren't given creamer or teaspoons. 
We had to wait about 30 minutes for our food after ordering. 
Plus, I witnessed one of the waiters spill ice cold water on a customer. Yikes!

Food: 4
Service: 3

Went to the Egg and I .When I had arrived the line was  long. The wait was about 20min but when I got inside the service was fast our waiter was really nice I had the chili rellano omelette came with potatoes and a choice of toast or a banana muffin I choose  the banana muffin which was really good I would come again
One of my favorite breakfast spots in Vegas off the strip. Must go here every time I'm in town!

This was my first time eating here and let me just say it was amazing. The service from Amanda was above 100%, and no sooner then sitting down did she have our drinks ready for us. After our drinks she was highly intensive even though the restaurant was busy it seemed that all of her tables were taking the best care of. Honestly the food as well was amazing, so would I recommend this place... Yes 100%

When in another city eat like the locals. Don't stay on the strip in Vegas, sometimes the best food is worth driving for! And this place right here is no exception.

Even on a busy morning we were seated quickly. Our waitress was super friendly and quick to come by and see if we needed anything before she took our order.

The food came out and I was pleasantly surprised at the amount and the quality. The scramble I got was basically overflowing from the dish it was served in and the pancake, I shit you not, was spilling over the plate! haha.

Definitely going to be a stop in spot each time in LV.
Great breakfast. Seated fast, great server her name was Paula and she was amazing at her job . very friendly. Very fast and very helpful.

Huge portions and good food, but long wait line for breakfast. We were seated rather quickly (about 20 min) considering how many parties were ahead of us (about 8)
Be prepared to be put in a food coma...
I had the sunrise omelet with chicken and could only finish half of it. The thing I liked about the omelet was that it wasn't too oily like in other omelettes I've had. Cheese was a little too much for me as well.
My friend and I split the strawberry cream cheese French toast. If you don't mind having gobs of strawberry jelly and whip cream on your French toast, this is definitely for you! The taste was spot on, but can be overwhelmingly goopy for some.
Overall, good food, good service. You definitely could feed a small family with just a couple of entrees!

OMG!!!!!! This place is the by far the best breakfast I've ever had!!!! Tourists don't waste your time going to expensive breakfast buffets or high end restaurants when visiting Vegas. This place will fill your stomach and pleasure your taste buds. It's INSANE!!!!! We had the chile relleno omelette and holy ****, I felt like I was having a party in my mouth! I've never had anything like it! And the potatoes and homemade banana muffin seriously! Our server Alexa gave us the best service. She was very nice and attentive. Even the bus boy Jesus was on it. He came by at least 3 times to make sure that we were ok. I noticed he went around to a lot of the tables since the restaurant was so busy. Alexa and Jesus should tag team most of the tables. This place would be even busier! Loved this this place! Please open up in Southern California! God knows we could use some good breakfast! PS You can send Alexa and Jesus to open it up

I actually came here with my youngest son to use a Groupon that I'd gotten a pretty good deal on! We arrived at about 11 for a late breakfast and the place was packed. Which is typically a good sign, but it looked borderline at capacity. Moving on, we opted to sit on the patio and it was a great choice! They had misters that added a great touch and I enjoyed people watching! Only tip would be if you don't like pets don't come out here. It's a pet friendly area and in addition to a few dogs Mother Nature's pets attended... there was a fair amount of pigeons. Almost unsanitary because they'd get really close and flap off leaving all sorts of pigeon germs in the air. The restaurant can consider enclosing the area with that garden wood or something that would keep it a bit more sanitary. 

Moving on to the food. I felt first off there's way too much going on with the menu. Pictures, eggs , burritos, omelettes, chili, pancakes, and everything is served a thousand ways! I was overwhelmed. Thankfully my baby just learned to read and knew he wanted waffles! I on the other hand ordered half a bacon and avocado omelette and a side of corned beef hash! 

At best, the food was ok. The omelette was well cooked but the amount of avocado was overwhelming, a shock because usually you don't receive enough. The bacon was non existent because of the overwhelming avocado. The hash was mushy. I'd read it in another review and thought impossible, but the flavor was good, but the texture was similar to that of fried stringy mashed potatoes.  I will brag my baby's waffle was delicious, fluffy, and crispy! I'd come back for the waffles and the bacon!

I got a skillet meal trying to get a taste for something different, I liked it but it wasn't really amazing as it looked in front of me. the flavors were mildly okay and the bread wasn't really toasted. I'll come back to try something else and hopefully give  a better review.

The staff are friendly, food are good. I just wish they can change the way of cooking hashbrown. Not all in that chili powder style. Also, if the cashier can speed up during the check out would be nice.

The first time i came here was with a car club I am associated with. I was surprised they accommodated 15-20 people on a sunday morning on their patio. I thought that was pretty cool of them. The waitresses were very friendly. Nice girls. The food was really good. I had no complaints for them. Everything was on point. I definitely recommend this place.

A groupon and good reviews lead me to try this place in Vegas. Normally, I do not go off the strip to eat. I don't think this place is as good as the reviews lead it to be... the place was packed when I went though, around 11am. It took about 30 minutes or so for a table. Looking at the menu, LOTS of stuff looked good and I had trouble deciding what to eat. The menu is a newpaper, which is actually really cute and different; also, there is a lot of word-play on the menu which I thought was cleaver. I ended up getting the chicken fried steak skillet and my brother got the carnitas skillet. Both did taste good, but I did not think it was spectacular. Portions were a good size, a bit larger than average. My chicken steak was tender and crispy and the gravy was good... but the house potatoes it came with was way too salty. I mixed everything together to try to lessen the salt taste, but in the end, I couldn't finish all the potatoes because, well, it was just too much salt. I think they need to put less of the seasoned salt on it. I'm a total potato lover and I couldn't finish my potatoes. My skillet also came with 2 eggs, anyway you want and a muffin or toast. I chose the muffin. It was good-average. I tried a bit of the carnitas skillet... but I'm not a big Mexican food fan... so it wasn't to my liking really, but my brother liked it. His did not come with a muffin or toast though. I also ordered coffee, thinking it was going to come in the interesting cup I see posted... it came in the ugly typical diner coffee cup...

Personally, I think Hash House A Go-Go has much better food and better prices... and way bigger portions!! My brother agrees with me too.
